description:
It is my first time ever being at this particular Bubba Gump's location.  What I noticed right away: is the consistency Bubba Gump's has with their other locations elsewhere.  Example:  I went to Bubba Gump's in Hawaii a few times and this particular place is has almost the identical look and feel.  I also went to another Gumps place somewhere in Cali, and I'm sure it looked and felt the same.  Like on the top of a two-story place, over looking the ocean or some kind of water, with a inside/outdoor seating capacity.  There is also a operate gift shop with Forrest Gump playing continuously on some of their TV's.  The interior design along with their drinks and foods are pretty much all the same.

We had a big party (about 20+ people for a wedding), and they were well prepared for our arrival.  (Yes, the Bride and Groom organized a dinner event here way in advanced).  The wait staff was up spirited and great, our foods campout pretty fast and so did our drink orders.  

I had the cheeseburger, and though it was good, had a little too much bun for me, but I just ate it with the top bun off, no big deal.  Other than that, drinks were good and food was tasty as well.  I expected how things will taste on what ever I ordered and tried, thus there was no glaring surprises nor too great of expectations.
author: Troy T.

description:
Bubba Gumps at Pier 39 San Francisco - We we're seated and walked out within 20 minutes. At our table we're 2 Highway Patrol Officers and 1 Director of Transportation and all 3 of us were totally "SHOCKED" at the number of employees who were under the influence. Our server Dave was very nice but very scatter brained and appeared to be trying very hard but, unable to stay focused. While at least HALF of the employees appeared to be HIGH on meth, cocaine and marijuana. We swore we were on a hidden camera show because it was so obvious. Staff were dropping dishes, cups and even food and leaving much of the debris on the floor. The other employees would come through and walk through it,kick it and even slip in it. 
We asked our server Dave for some straws and he he brought back 5 unwrapped straws with his bare hands...so unsanitary...who does this? In fact when he brought them to us he said, "we're not to do this" thinking what caring unprotected straw with you bare hands?" No, give straws unless asked for? Wait a minute...we did ask for them??? 
My son was seated at the end of the table and several servers were constantly bumping into the back of his chair. Not one person stopped to offer an apology...good thing he wasn't drinking hot coffee! It became more obvious, frustrating and extremely sad having to sit there and observed this conduct. Their physical functioning  was consistent with being high while some were experiencing facial disorders consistent with tweaking. A few others had glossy dilated eyes.  The bussing staff were just as bad.
We eat at this restaurant 2-3 times a year with visiting family but, the last few experiences were dreadful!... yesterday was simply out of control.
I cannot imagine that management didn't notice any of this going on? 
For health and safety concerns for ourselves and our children we had to leave! 
On our way out my son expressed to a female manager (long brown hair) our reasoning for why it is we need to leave...he expressed staff were constantly bumping his chair...the final straw (no pun) was when Dave delivered our unprotected straws with his bare hands to the table top (yuck)!!!

Disappointed Landry card holder!
R. Hill
author: Ronald H.

description:
Visited today with a party of 7 and was beyond disappointed with the service, cleanliness, employees, and atmosphere of the restaurant. After waiting to for what seemed like an hour to have our order taken, we left. First, and most importantly, we observed several staff members acting as if they were under the influence of drugs. Not only marijuana, but more like meth. You may want to drug test your employees at this location stat!!!  We observed several staff members excessively dropping things, spilling on people, and unable to physically function. It was very obvious to us that more than a few of the employees there were high while working. I thought we were being punked and Aston Kutcher was going to come out any minute and tell us it was a joke. Unfortunately, it wasn't. 

Also, when we asked for straws, our waiter handed them to us with his bare hands, touching all of our straws before setting them down on a dirty table. After taking our drink order, he advised he would be right back to take our order, he then disappeared for thirty minutes. The unfortunate part of this is that it provided my party a lot of time to notice how the employees were acting and all the stuff they were doing. 

You had servers dropping things because they were so high, servers running into the back of chairs, your busser was unable to keep anything on his tray, and servers dropping sodas only to leave them spilled on on the floor for the next server to walk by and kick it into a seated party. Also, no one came by to clean anything up. After placing our order an hour after being seated, being bumped, spilled on by servers, we left. Your manager canceled our order, apologized, and seemed embarrassed but we won't be back again. This is unfortunate since it had been a staple in our family every time  we visit Pier 39. Thanks for breaking that tradition! We will spend our money elsewhere.
author: Angela H.

description:
Horrible this place is a mess I would not go here again. Dirty restaurant dirty bathroom.
Wait time is horrible and then when they sit u now u must wait another half hour for them to take ur order. I almost slip because the floor was so dirty and slippery. Food is 2/5 service was good when it finally came 5/5 view is really nice but all the other factors ruined it for me.
author: Juliette H.

description:
I have always loved this theme restaurant that's why we frequent the ones in LA. This location has the best views, I think that's why it's one of the tourist favorites at pier 39. We got on yelp waitlist for a late lunch but still had to wait about 20 minutes when we got here. Good thing was we just walked around pier 39 and this pier was just too much fun to hang around! 

We were able to get a window table with the views of ocean and Alcatraz island. Funny thing was parents had actually dined here many years ago at the same table! I had a San Pellegrino sparkling water, no alcohol cause I was already dehydrated. For food we had our favorites like shrimper's net catch half and half, Jenny's catch and shrimp scampi. Food was delicious but I don't think it was as good as LA locations, since I eat at Bubba Gump a lot so I could taste that little bit of difference instantly! 

Our waitress was very friendly but she really just looked at the "run forest run" sign to see if we needed service at the moment. At LA locations, servers always stop by often no matter which side of the sign is on! 

It was still a very pleasant family lunch, we enjoyed the views and food nonetheless!
author: Mimi L.

description:
I have not come here in a while as it is always so busy.  We were able to get arrive early and get a table facing the ocean and Alcatraz!!!  It was so beautiful.  As usual, the place was crowded and busy.  Our server was good and we didn't have to wait too long.  I know this is a chain but I figure I ate here, might as well write a review.  The good thing is, the food was tasty and actually better than what I remember.  Here is what we had:

Pear and berry salad: Fresh Greens with Charbroiled Chicken, Strawberries, Pears, 
and Glazed Pecans. Tossed with a raspberry vinegarette and feta cheese -  If you are just coming for a light lunch, do not get this.  It is so big, it fed 4 of us.  It was so yummy, the fruits in the salad had the perfect tartness and sweetness to them.  We had ours with chicken which was nice and tender.

Net Catch Entree: Beer steamed Shrimp, along with Carrots, Celery, Corn, Potatoes and Andouille Sausage all steamed and 
tossed with Garlic Spice - this was yummy as long as you put a little lemon on it.  The shrimp was so tender, the skin just fell right off and it melted in your mouth.

Grilled Seafood Trio: Shrimp & Veggie Skewer, Shrimp New Orleans and Bourbon Street 
Mahi Mahi on a blanket of rice - i love the grilled taste with the skewers and the sauce for the mahi mahi was absolutely delish.

Forrest's Seafood Feast: Mama Blue's Fried Shrimp, hand battered Fish & Chips and made from scratch Seafood Hush Pups. Served with Fries and our dippin' Sauces, Tartar, 
Cocktail and Remoulade - fried heaven, if I could just eat a surmountable amount of fried stuff, this would be gone.  Big thumbs up for the taste of the the hush puppies and sauces.  Shrimp, perfect...fried fish - almost perfect.  Overall delish!!!

I would definitely recommend this place, and remember, go early if you have a big party.
author: Cecilia D.

description:
Celebrated a company wide event here and working on with one of their sale reps made it all sooooo easy!! 

We had a pretty tight budget to work with but also wanted the moon and stars on a silver platter (typical). Our sales rep did not just help us stay within budget but she went above and beyond by doing so! She was able to accommodate most of our option and able to squeeze in a couple drink tickets! 

She also customized our menu to add that extra special touch!

It was definitely an experience to remember, and we will definitely consider using them again next year!!
author: Be H.

description:
If you are not enthralled by the cinematic masterpiece of Forrest Gump, you might as well run, Forrest run. 
I'm not a smart man (rich woman) but I know what love is. Even if this place isn't the most affordable, it's delicious and fun. 
It's a tourist trap, but so is every notable scene in the film. You didn't hear Forrest complaining at the Lincoln Memorial. 

My favorite menu item is the bucket of trash because mama used to say life is like a bucket of trash, you never know what you're gonna get but I betcha it will be dusted in a Cajon salt. 

The service is usually pretty slow and the wait is terribly long, but Forrest ran really far for you to eat this food. 
I get the service critiques but if you hate the food... you know what mama used to say about stupid. 

I'm pretty tired... I think I'll go home now.
author: Chrissy C.

description:
I have gone to other bubba Gump shrimp locations and however this one was very disappointing. It was really busy but I think people come hear because they think it's cheaper than the restaurants near by. 

Location is great and has great views unfortunately the place itself was really dirty. Bathroom was overall awful and I noticed that the floor looked like it hadn't been swept in a while . I also noticed that the manager and the waiter just kept walking over food and trash that was on the floor as if it was meant to be their . By this point I was already worried about how the quality of the food will be. 

Food wise it was very disappointing calamari was overpriced for the portion and batter was not fully cooked. Chicken cesare salad was lacking flavor in the chicken and the food just did not meet the price standards. I just want to say that I have gone to other locations and have got the same thing and I enjoyed the food and the taste and considering it is very busy hear you can still maintain a clean restaurant but the manager seemed to busy walking around instead. Overall bubba Gump is a great place to dine if you have the right management and staff to keep the place maintained. I suggest bring staff from other restaurants to get this one up to standards like the rest and making cleanliness and customers a priority overall they have a great location it's just lacking in many ways .
author: Mirna P.

description: Been a long time since I've been here things have changed , the service is really good I ordered a burger and a bucket of garlic shrimp the shrimp was as good as always the burger was not my favorite , out of Allot of beer after three attempts we finally were in business also certain flavors of smoothies were out also an odd coincidence I guess ? We had the Pyramid white beer with the shrimp bucket made everything better along with a great window view.
author: Aaron B.

description:
I get that this is a famous place, but the waiting is really really long. I'm talking about 1hr wait maybe longer. Now I'd you dont want to wait they have a membership that you can join for $25
 They don't update their waiting time on Yelp. I had been waiting for 45mins and only 2 parties in front of me and once in went up the line when it was our turn. There was another line that I has to wait another 1hr. Not to mention the person helping was rude! If you want to go to this place go when it's not busy
author: Damaris G.

description:
This place... They have such prime location and I honestly think if it weren't such a popular chain people would seriously boycott. The staff is AWFUL and beyond unprofessional. 

My horrid experience started at the door and really I should have just walked out at that point because it only got worse. The hostess was super unprofessional with the group in front of me who didn't speak English, but you could totally understand what they were saying. She told them it was a 45 minute wait and rolled her eyes when they decided not to wait (good choice on their part!!). My turn came up and I told her I was just a party of 1 and she LAUGHED and said " oh just 1". Yes, I sometimes really enjoy traveling alone. I can't seriously be the first person that has ever come alone to Bubba's. Whatever, shrugged it off and went to the bar. 

The first gal that greeted me was friendly and informed me it was HH. I knew what I wanted right away and despite there being 4 people behind the bar, the next guy didn't take my order for about 15 minutes. The drink arrived quickly and was good (Lava flows from here are super yum!). 

During my time waiting for them to acknowledge me so I could pay (45 minutes!!! Granted I intentionally just sat here waiting for them to make eye contact with an empty glass) I had the opportunity to be horrified by the conversations they openly have with one another. I also witnessed a waitress yell at a child for running ( I agree they shouldn't run but let the parents scold!). 

The staff is so incredibly unprofessional for a touristy and family oriented place. Not to mention NOT ONCE did they ask if I was doing ok, despite having my drink empty for over 30 minutes. I personally will never come back to this location, but have not given up hope on Bubba since I do love the other ones I've gone to. Oh and they also never gave me napkins. I have never been to a place where they serve you food without napkins!
author: Steph G.

description:
I was scared to death to eat here after just glancing at the reviews, without reading them. My son and his wife really wanted to eat here while in SF. While we were at the Golden gate I called them to see if they would take a reservation, she said no, they were too swamped and the wait time was about 2 hours. She would not put us on a list. 

We figured we would go to the pier, get our name on the list and mess around there for few hours waiting. It was a beautiful saturday in February so it was beyond packed down there. Luckily, when I hung up from her, I focused on my Yelp app and saw a button that said put your name on the waiting list. I was HIGHLY SKEPTICAL. I had to cap that so you understand the serious level of my skeptical-ness  of really being able to do that. It was even giving me a countdown to where I was in line. I was 72nd in line. I was expected to get a table at 2:14. 

We mosey across town, well, really we got stuck in massive traffic, but none of us took this list thing serious, even though I was moving up in line. We get down there, park and start to take it more seriously just in case they are being honest with this list thing.  

I fight the crowd, as my yelp app says expires in 5 mins, get to the door of Bubba's they are jammed. I get up there literally at 2:14 show her my phone thinking she is going to laugh me out of there, sees my phone, looks down and says, yeah here you are, it will 15 mins or so. It was literally 3 mins. Yelp you rock for this alone! Six people with low blood sugar didn't make the front page news on this day. 

Got in there, not expecting much, got a great seat by the window and the grandbabies could see the sea lions on the dock. Waiter was great and on top of us with refills and Bubba trivia. We all got the pot meals and again, didn't expect much, but holy kittens of fire, they were really good. Full of shrimp, sausage, corn on the cob and red potatoes. The grandbabies got little meals served in paper boats they loved. 

I was really impressed. I then went back and read reviews and noticed alot of "touristy, dude drinking spot," reviews. I mean nothing on the food as much, so really, a bad review because it is in a massive tourist spot and you ate there? I don't know what to even say about that, if you are going to complain about that aspect of Bubba's, SF has some great eateries not even near that tourist trap wharf we all know and love uber yourself right on over to one of those. But I am really impressed with the experience and the food. Don't be afraid to go in and give them a try.
author: Holly K.

description: This was my first time here with my 21mo old daughter. We came Sunday night 10/21. Very, very good service we had. If they are busy there is wait time usually 40 minute wait to be seated unless if your VIP. Luckily my mother in-law was VIP we got seated more quickly. I had the Salmon very delicious. I tired my mother in-laws fried shrimp that was delicious. Also their hush puppies were delicious. Their fries are very good and fresh. Everything was wonderful during our time. I would go back any day.
author: Victoria W.

description:
Hubby and I have been here since they opened at Fisherman's Wharf.  Since the birth of our son, we've also been to the one in Monterey.  When we decide where to eat at the Wharf, I always lose to the boys.  They like Bubba Gump - what can I say!  The only time I refused to go was when we visited New Orleans.  

Yelp is on point with its 3-star rating "A-OK" couldn't agree more.  The food is mediocre, it' a chain, and a tourist trap in SF.  Service is not stellar, just alright.  As long as the two men in my life are happy, I'm ecstatic to be with them, even if it's a cheesy dinner at Bubba Gump Shrimp.  

No reservations btw - first come, first serve.  The nowait "waitlist" doesn't help, the host/hostess can add to your wait time if the place is packed.  To be on the safe side, get the fish & chips, can't mess that up.  It's hard to give a place like this 5 stars.  I'm just happy Rainforest Cafe finally went away!  Let's stuff our faces with some hush puppies shall we. =)

'Til we next again ~ cheers & see you on Yelp!
author: Christine R.

description:
Lots of things made me excited to be here. They ultimately disappointed in an insubstantial, $$$$ meal. 

1. They sat us right next to where the line ends. Servers slammed down trays and baskets of flatware behind me continuously. The place was loud. Like, really loud. Terrible atmosphere. 

2. The portions are puny. My spouse ordered a shrimp meal that came with three shrimp. THREE. SHRIMP. in a SHRIMP RESTAURANT. These are not jumbo prawns.  An anemic handful of fries and two small hushpuppies completed this "feast". I had  a decent enough meal, the Jenny special, which is fish, mashed potatoes, and spinach. I ordered five small grilled shrimp. Smallish portions. Fish and shrimp, nothing too exotic and special. 

4. We had three drinks between us. 

5. Total bill: about $95. Absolutely the biggest waste of money for $50 worth of food, tops.  

This was not a complex meal of rare items. It was shrimp and fish in a noisy chain restaurant. I have spent less in Papadeux and gotten much better food. 

Go ahead and skip this place.
author: Misty P.

description:
I have mixed emotions about giving our traditional spot for celebrations just 3 stars, but I just can't let my feelings stop me from keep'n it real so that other visitors in the future can keep this experience in mind and then decide for themselves when it comes to being told that there is a long wait.   Here's how the convo went:

Host:  Welcome to Bubba Gumps, how many in your party?

Me:  We have 5 adults and two kids. How long is the wait?

Host:  O.k., hold on a minute [speaks into his mic], it's going to be 2 and a half hours.

Me:  [Gulp], um, o.k., put us down 

Host:  your name?  phone number?  you will get a text when your table is ready.

Me:  Thank you

So off we went to browse around since we are at Fisherman's Wharf so there is plenty to do for those 2 and a half hours.  The little one is excited to get on the Merry Go Round so that is our first stop.  Mind you, this is only 5-10 minutes since our party had been deciding our route for killing the 2 and a half hours, and then to our surprise, the buzzer goes off on our thing-a-ma-jigger.  Whoa!  We are a bit perplexed, but we all start scrambling to get back up there and also have to switch our mindset back to eating.  

When we got back up there I tell them, I thought there was a 2 and a half hour wait?  They really had no good excuse.  My opinion:  they were trying to discourage patrons from dining there because there were a lot of people in line.  

As for the food, and dining experience, I love Forrest Gump so that says it all, but again, this is only about the wait time issue that I believe if enough of us Yelpers review this subject, management may take note that reality is the best policy.
author: Yvette S.

description:
Terrible service. Terrible value. Great view.

Went here late last night because nothing else on the pier was open. There were empty seats all over the place so certainly not a busy night. Yet, it still took an hour just to get waters and our drinks. It was a good 30-45 minutes before we even took our drink/orders after being seated. Server said, "sorry we ran out of cups"......what?

When the food finally came it was just more disappointment. Shrimp Mac and Cheese looked great in the picture with a bunch of large Shrimps. Nope, the skillet was the size of a bread plate and the 3 or 4 shrimps were the size of dimes and the popcorn shrimp basket was half, fried  artichokes.....again, what?

Every meal was overpriced for the quality and a couple of us woke up feeling nauseous. Likely won't return.

But enjoy the view of the Bay if you do!
author: Stephen R.

description: ALWAYS have a LONG wait to get a table, BUT! the food, view, and ambience is so worth it. Great bartenders, so order a drink, sit along the wall and get off your feet. Can sit outside also. If you'd like, take in a couple of close shops. You'll be notified by a text when it's time for your table. Even though the waitress's and waiter's are super busy they are pleasant, courteous and efficient. Tall, wide windows are the "walls" facing the wharf area with a beautiful view of the Bay Bridge.
author: Diane V.

description:
I got that Bubba Gump yum! That bub bub bub!  That Bubba Gump yum, da dum dum dum! 

The restaurant not only reminds me of Forest Gump, the movie, but also the song above.  I don't know what artist created those lyrics, but the beat is catchy!

The view is amazing here and there's a long line to dine here!  It's near the ocean view in Pier 39 and the reputable name sells itself!

They have the signs, "Run Forest Run" or "Stop Forest Stop," to flag a server down or no need for the attention!  

I got my Cajun shrimps and hush puppies munch on as well the fish and chips!  Family and friendly atmosphere!

Bubba shrimp grubbin' here!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I have tried Bumba Gump once before and it did not leave a deep impression but this one it surely did!

The six of us ordered
1. Fried calamari: comes with fried pepper and hot pepper, be careful.
2. Pear and fruit salad: I have to say, this is the best of all the dishes we ordered. I did not expect the salad to taste so good. The pecan and the balsamic vinegar make my night! The pear is perfect. I wish there were more dark green than romaine lettuce though
3. Jambalaya: good, smaller portion than I expected
4. Net catch entree: many shrimps with potatoes, celery, carrots. We tried both butter garlic and Cajun. Both are good!
5. Butter lemon fish: I did not recall the exact name but it is the first one under Jenny's favorite. The mashed potatoes at the bottom tastes gray with sauteed spinach
6. Seafood feast: the last one on menu, the portion is smaller than I thought. Most of the plate is taken by fries
7. Shrimp scampi: not my personal favorite but my hubby likes it

We also tried the chocolate chip cookie sundae. The cookie is dry and the vanilla ice cream has ice chips inside. Our server was nice, friendly, and helpful.

I will give the food 3.5 stars and decor one points, adding up to 4.
author: Sunny X.

description: Visited with my daughter, brother and his son. As usual everything was great.  I had the shrimp Po Boy sandwich and it was delicious. My brother had the dish with 4 kinds of shrimp. My nephew had shrimp and fish. My daughter had the chicken sandwich. We had the shrimp Mac and cheese for an appetizer. Everything was excellent and of course we had a great view of the bay.
author: Bryan R.

description:
Got seated fairly quickly and waited 20 minutes now for server to even come back.  We watched another table be seated, drinks and order taken...then finally I pestered another server to check to see when they would come to take our order.  Mind you I have a toddler and few teenagers and this is 10pm at night, so this is a bit precarious with hungry kids.  Let's hope the food is decent.  So much for a quick bite.  Let's see how long they take to bring out our bowls of clam chowder.

For the pricing, you'd think you would get better service...
author: Mari S.

description: Let's starts off with the wait time will always be high 1) it's San Francisco and 2) it's Bubba Gump Shrimp from Forrest Gump so naturally everyone and their mom wants to eat here. Leaving a review based on the wait time here didn't seem fair but my boyfriend and I waited at the bar and had drinks and started our appetizer there, by the time we finished our appetizer our table was ready! Therefore the wait didn't seem that long, I ordered the Mac and Cheese with shrimp and oh my goooood this was the best damn Mac and Cheese I've ever had! It was so savory and made from the cheese gods. Words cannot describe how amazing their Mac and Cheese is I definitely recommend everyone to try it at least once! The server was funny and helped us forget about the long wait, she was very attentive and overall I'm happy with the experience I had here! (:
author: Nancy H.

description: Unfortunately I'm with the unpopular option that this place is overhyped. With such a prime location right on the pier, you'd think they would do better in terms of food and service and yet they always fall below the bar. The service is slow and the staff look like they'd rather be elsewhere. As for the food, the coconut shrimp were really good and everything else was subpar. Such a shame that this place turned out to be a flop.
author: Franchesca B.

description:
This is my second time coming here. The first time, I was sick. So I decided to give this place another try. 

First, is the service. My server was Melissa. She didn't even greet us with a smile. With a straight face she just taught us how to use the license plate on the table to signal them to stop and take our orders or if we have any questions. When we told her that we still needed a couple minutes she rolled her eyes and left.  She came back a minute later. We did not switch the license plate yet and asked us if we were ready. So what was the whole point of teaching us how to use it if she was just going to come back?  We felt rushed, so we ordered our food.   My niece ordered a shrimp poor boy sandwich with no pickles. Notice, how she said no pickles. 

Second, the food. We ordered the Popcorn Shrimp for the appetizer. I felt that it was not worth the $10 price tag. The taste was just about average. Nothing really special about it. I ordered a Grilled Texas Chicken Sandwich. It had a lot of flavor. But, there other ingredients over powered the taste of the chicken that I couldn't even tell that there was chicken in it at all. Texture wise I was eating chicken. But I could not taste it.  Remember how I said that my niece said that she did not want pickles. Well, she got pickles. 

The check. When I received the check, I wanted to see if Melissa added the detail no pickles onto the check/her order. Just as I suspected, she did not.

The Overall. Overall this place really dropped the ball. As a tourist, and a former food service worker, I will not come here again.  But, how famous this place is, I will not tell people not to come here. Everyone has their own taste. I just don't recommend coming here.
author: Ryan M.

description: They served me PINK chicken TWICE !!! Horrible establishment! Bad service overall. The manager seemed like she was on drugs too. The plates were dirty and disgusting!
author: Ana G.

description:
I use to come here all the time as a kid and loved it! So I was super excited when wandering around the pier& decided to eat here again after so many years. 

First off, I used yelp to get on the waitlist, and by doing so I was suppose to "cut the line." We arrived to check in at the specified time but the hostess told us to wait 20 more mins. So we did, then came back to be told to wait another 7 mins. What was the point of all that? It wasn't even busy.

Then we finally get sat& it takes a while for our waiter to approach us. We order everything at once, drinks, appetizer & entrees. We receive the appetizer & drinks before we get the waters.

So we receive the food actually pretty quick BUT both of our shrimp tasted like it was just taken out of the freezer. The food wasn't even hot, it was probably cold to room temp. The best part of our meals turned out to be the corn& fries. I am so disappointed!!
author: Ashley J.

description: My friends and I were at the pier at decided to check out bubba gump shrimp as we have never ate there before. I'll give this place 2 stars because I love the movie Forrest Gump so the theme of the restaurant was probably the only part of this whole experience that was decent. We started out by walking in and asking for a menu. Right off the bat the shrimp macaroni caught my eye as the picture looked delicious and "full" of Mac&shrimp. We were seated in about 10 mins and our waiter was nice. The place was packed as it was a Friday night. There was four people in my party including me, three of us ordered the Mac and shrimp, and one friend ordered a burger. The meals were a bit pricey so we expected the best. Our food took over 45 minutes to come, and when it did we were extremely disappointed. The portions were so small compared to the picture on the menu, the cheese was almost "watery" and the shrimp tasted rubbery and bland.actually the whole plate was bland. My friend who ordered a burger was pleased, but probably because we waited so long for our food. As we were waiting for our food we overheard an older couple seated to the left of us complain about the food being bad to a waitress! Definitely won't be coming back here.
author: Dalilah K.

description: I have been to other bubba gumps and this one is exactly the same as they all are.  From the decoration and food to the sign on the table letting your server know if you need anything is all the same.  Food is typical for a chain restaurant.  Good but nothing amazing.  Overall its your typical tourist restaurant done right.
author: Mary J.

description: Good food. I wish they service clam chowder in a bowl but they gave me a bread on the side at least. Wait was about 30 minutes but we were able to go to the bar area and sit right away.
author: Jen C.

description: Waited about an hour and half to get seated due to "lack of servers" & finally got the food which was super sub par compared to most shrimp places in the bay area. I completely understand at restaurants like this youre pretty much paying for the "gimmick" but if youre in the mood for quality (not prepackaged frozen Grocery store) shrimp boil there are far better quality places. Shrimp was clearly frozen and TINY, sausage was dry, potatos were hard, and corn quality also frozen. But the gump memorabilia was pretty cool. & our waitress was very nice.
author: LJ D.

description: The food had no flavor and the texture of the fish was awful. Added malt vinegar hoping it would help, but no luck. Left most of the food on the plate.
author: Estee C.

description: Get the Landry's card and avoid the wait. Always come here when I'm in the city. If you have Kids tell them to review trivia from the forest Gump movie they get excited every time!!
author: Eve A.

description: The service was terrible. When we checked in with the hostess they said it would be a half hour wait, when it was well over an hour. The host was visibly so high and intoxicated she slurred her speech and couldn't keep her eyes open. Who's managing this place, is that your standard? The bathrooms were really dirty, but much better than any truck stop in Timbuktu. I ordered the peel and eat shrimp, it was very misleading as normally you would have full size shrimp with the heads on, but it consisted of mini cocktail shrimp, what a rip off, I have never seen Cajun shrimp that way, normally they would at least be medium sized with the heads on. Our server was ok, she clearly had more tables than she could handle however which is not her fault that is management trying to save on labor. Overall it was a crappy experience and really not representative of Landrys brands, I won't be back. I will say that the have the most amazing view, that was the only positive
author: Matthew J.

description: Skip it, super long wait time, doesn't seem to have a manager here, employees look overwhelmed. Was told 5 minutes and waiting a half hour with several empty tables.
author: Lucero T.

description: You guys fucken suck!! Told us that the wait was gonna be 10 to 15 minutes then waited for 40 minutes with no text or call. Fuck you bubba gump. Yall suck
author: Mo H.

description: Came here two weeks ago but forgot to post my review. For a seafood place I would say they are alright. (If you have been to a red lobster or clam jumper it's around that price range and taste). This place is all about the nostalgia of the movie it's based off of (Forest Gump). There is a long wait time but you can call or reserve ahead on yelp which is a plus. The service does take awhile in the evenings due to high volume. I saw about 6 people who were serving tables and another person was working the bar. The restaurant fills up and has many large groups. Food took about 45 minutes to receive. If you order salad or an appetizer you should receive it in 15-20 minutes. Drinks took about 15 minutes after seating as well. The waiters looked a little stressed out and busy. Even though there are many waiters the restaurant itself is quite large and seating extend pretty far away from the bar and kitchen so they end up running around a lot. It is one of those restaurants where you may have to flag down a random server to help you refill a drink or add on any food or dessert since your server could end up having to help 5 other tables all at once. Great place to go if you love the movie. There is also a location in Southern California as well which is on a pier which you can play games on and shop around at during the day.
author: Aly R.

description:
Bubba Gump seems like a shrimp lover's dream but it's more focused on fried food than anything. Don't get me wrong, I love French fries and fried shrimp just as much as the next guy, but I still want to be wow'd by what I came for - the shrimp. Unfortunately, Bubba Gump's did not do that for me. 

We ordered the Shrimper's Heaven (coconut shrimp, grilled shrimp, crispy golden shrimp, and tempura shrimp) and the Grilled Seafood Trio. I found the shrimp to be overly chewy and it seemed like the huge amounts of batter was supposed to distract customers from the subpar quality of the meal. 

The overall experience was fine. The ambiance and view are probably the best thing about this place. We came just before noon on a Saturday and surprisingly only waited 10 minutes. When we left the restaurant around 1pm the line was crazy long, out the door. I'd give this place another try eventually but I'm not in a rush to hurry back anytime soon.
author: Meghan R.

description: Had to try this place  The food was very good and the place has really taken advantage of the Forrest Gump film in a funny way. Not the cheapest place but worth a visit.
author: Markku K.

description:
I was excited about coming here and trying Bubba Gump. Its definitely a tourist must go restaurant. So came here and ordered the Boat Trash with Maine Lobster. It came with only one lobster tail. The lobster tail was kind of small. I think there were like 6 pieces of shrimp and 4 skinny battered fish. And rest was basically fries. it was served with coleslaw. Overall I liked it but it was not wow. For $26.99, I wish there were more shrimps. 

I also ordered the clam chowder soup bowl. I think it would be wiser to order outside than here. This place is about shrimps. 

On top of all that I got the watermelon lemonade. Buy a drink and get to keep the cup. The drink came to $8.99 and its non-alcoholic. The cup is cool. It has lights and it project the bubba gump logo. 

The décor of this place is nice. It has an awesome view. Because its located at Pier 39 and its on the second floor, it overlooks the beautiful water view. Awesome. 

The place gets quite busy. Very popular!
author: Denise W.

description: If we were to replace the name with something other than Bubba Gump Shrimp it would not be this popular. The food was just horrible. I ordered an appetizer and it was cold then another server came by with another order for a different table and told us to keep it. Which was great because that was hot. Then our food came it was cold. For what I paid it was not worth it.
author: Accoya C.

description:
Great experience!!! Not our first time here but as busy as they were one of our best
Bin was amazing!!!!!!!! Best manager I've met in a long time!! Really fun ok extra time to make sure everyone including us was talking care of. I'll definitely be back to this location just because of him!!!!
Thank you Bin!!!!
author: Jesse L.

description:
Table server was great, food was ok, but the front desk waiter was bad. Multiple times drastically underestimating our wait. Quoted a half hour, and after an hour wait said we were third in line. Fifty more minutes and then we got the text inviting us to be seated. 

We weren't able to do everything we wanted at Pier 39 because we constantly were told we were close to being seated. Very disappointing.
author: Tim B.

description: No complaints except for the wait which wasn't as bad as they said it was going to be . Came for lunch in a Sunday and the wait was about 20 minutes.  Put your name in the list with Yelp and get a text when your table is ready. Food was good and filling. Mashed potatoes needed flavor and texture . Drinks are good but pricey.  Staff was friendly
author: Cristina D.

description: The food was ok but my review is for the outstanding service Claire gave us made our day. She was fun and her trivia of the film really made out experience one of a kind.
author: Gardenia H.

description:
I come to this place every single time I am in the city. Everybody calls it a touristy place, which, in all fairness, it is, but the food is so worth it. 

As a heads up, you do need reservations, depending on the time you are planning on coming, there is always a waiting period, it can vary from 20-30 min to 1 hour or even 3 hours. The best tip I could give is when you are at Pier 39 go straight to the restaurant and put yourself on the waiting list; or if you are reading this review on your phone, you can do it on the Yelp app. 

I think I've had everything in their menu, the fried calamari is a great starter, and Jenny's catch is absolutely delicious! The Caesar salad with grilled shrimps is as well very good and not as heavy. 

The alcoholic drinks are fairly strong, they also have non alcoholic long drinks and a favorite of mine is Fizzy Fun, note, that you can take the glass home as a souvenir.
author: Anamaria I.

description: Food was amazing, excellent customer service & great experience even though they were super busy! ESAM was an amazing server/waiter, keep up the great work and never change that bubbly personality (:
author: Laura M.

description: A one hour wait, ok np we can wait. Walk in to get a beer, bartenders don't even look up at me. There were 4 spots open at the bar. I walk past the bar and there are 20+ seats open. A 20oz beer is 15.00 What a rip off. We've been to many other B.G. but not this one. What a joke !
author: Jonathan I.

description: We don't normally go to the city unless we got visitors that we want to show around. This time we just went to city for a ride and since it was perfect day I wanted to eat here! I tried to get reservations @ Yelp and the waiting time it more than one hour and which I do believed was true esp it was weekend and lovely weather. We got there and people were waiting outside talked to the guy outside taking names. I told him I tried to get in Yelp but I don't think it went thru. Then he just said go in and they'll take you! Wow! Lucky! So we got in right way ordered food and it was all good! Our food! Yummy! It was indeed a good day @ Bubba
author: Xena R.

description: One of the worst in the chain. Normally you can almost guarantee a good time at these locations. Ok so the food isn't fabulous, but you go because it's fun and reminiscent of a great movie. But this place is the pits. Lousy service and terrible manager service. They place you in a cattle car of sorts and let the chips fall where they may attitude from the management down to the servers. You want to visit a good representation of Bubba Gump restaurants? Then go to one in Anaheim and ignore this location like the plague.
author: J G.

description: I went here with a friend for a pre birthday lunch celebration. Let me tell you...I was dreaming about this place for 2 weeks.  We get there and they gave us the perfect waterfront view.  It's best to make reservations or get there early. I think we were there as soon as it opened. Anyway, we ordered the stuffed shrimp. I recommend you get vegetables(prefer) or rice on the side because it will soak up the garlic butter sauce. When our food arrived.. I closed my eyes and I exhaled with each succulent bite. Yessss Gawd!  It was so damn good. Then I put some hot sauce on it.....Chile I was done...took me straight to heaven.  I was so full afterwards.  So please try the shrimp just once...you won't regret it.
author: Nikia B.

description: My family and I went to lunch here the other day. It hit me that this random trendy restaurant based on a popular movie has been in business for over 20 years now. Who would've thought? I guess that means it's pretty good, right? This was probably the 3rd or 4th time I've been to any bubba gumps in my life. It was very good food, better than expected. It was way too expensive, but that was pier 39's problem, not bubba gump's. The staff was happy and nice, and of course it sits right on the water and had a great view. Leaves little to be desired, except a better value.
author: Chris B.

description:
Had a very poor experience here. Going through group reservations, I got hassled to meet a specific minimum price and was jockeyed between different limited menus before finally being allowed to order off the full menu with my party. The service was exceptionally slow and after two hours, we left without some of our food ever being served. The manager was exceptionally unhelpful in letting us pay our bill, which took  over an hour to arrive.

Do not return here.
author: Michael G.

description: The location is nice, near the water, you can see the boats and Alcatraz. Long wait to get a table. Waitress was nice and took good care of use. Nice system with the turning sign to get their attention. Food was okay, but expensive. Cocktails were big and tasty (and strong). Long wait until we get our food. For every one who is a fan of Forrest gump should visit at least one time.
author: Julia W.

description: Awesome place just about a Hour wait but got to get a set at the bar which made it not so bad and the Restaurant itself had so much to look at.. Shrimp was Really good just didn't really like the Maui Maui fish, it was little bland no taste to it and steak was little dry also could of used better seasoning and marinate. But again it's called Bubba Shrimp.. Other then that this place was packed and Awesome...
author: Michael S.

description:
Despite having a long line of people waiting to be seated during lunchtime, we were seated immediately. Tony was our server and was very attentive. He made sure we were doing well without our plate being set to stop. He also had recommendations which my family loved! We asked for another order of the spinach dip, but when Tony noticed it wasn't given to us yet, he made it on the house.

Service is excellent. However, I gave the restaurant 4 stars because the tortillas for my fish tacos were hard. It was difficult to eat and I ended up eating only the fish. Other than that, the staff is accommodating and have amazing service.
author: Minmay L.

description: We beat the rush and got there about 11:30. They sat us by the window so we had a nice view of the bay. I think you'd have a great view anywhere though. All the decorations were fun and fitting not only for the movie but location as well. Our waitress was nice and always checked in. Our food came fast and was soooooo good. They also validated our parking, which saved us $12 in the parking garage. That is a big deal when paying for parking in SF. Highly recommend.
author: Melissa A.

description: Long waits and tourist magnet.  The taste is over rated, and price is on the high side.  Mostly for those who want to eat here for having done that.  Other than that, nothing specular.
author: Raymond W.

description:
Who makes up a policy that only allows happy hour for people that sit and physically eat at the bar? Came with a large party and not everyone drinks. My server told me I would have to go to the bar in order to get a drink at happier hour prices...

I go to the bar to order a drink and the bar tender tells me he can't serve me because I'm not eating at the bar. I was on the brink of leaving entirely but didn't want to ruin my night.

Whoever created this "policy" is one losing money for the company and two doing a huge disservice other customers. If you want to do a happy hour don't be cheap BUBBA!
author: DaVonte B.

description:
This trip solidified our thought that we don't want to dine here ever again. Gave a second chance with the in-law and the food was bland, the waitress was pretty cool, but I guess the other young woman was a manager and she appeared to take offense when we said the food wasn't good. The kicker, when I said "thank you" as appreciation for her time in conversation, her response was "uh huh" as she walked away. Wow...

$100 down the proverbial drain...
author: Jon V.

description:
If I could give a 0 star review I would. I was super excited to eat shrimp since living in a land locked state so I chose a place I THOUGHT come through for me, it's in the name, but NO not at this place.  The shrimp looked freezer burned and the fish looked like a kiddie serving of chicken tenders. I asked to speak with a manager. She came to the table and stood by my chair, didn't introduce herself, ask what was wrong just stared at me. I explained to her that for the price of the meal the food was unacceptable, actually the food was unacceptable no matter the price. She just stared and said I'll get you another one, I said no I don't want anything else from this restaurant. The manager snatched the plate off the table and left. Our server Angel and the bus guy Duane were just wonderful. They made the experience much better just being kind and friendly. The main manager came by the table and was very nice and genuinely cared about our experience. Then the GM Julie stopped by the table she was very nice and wanted to make the situation right. 
I was typing this as it happened so it ended well. I am not sure if I will try it again but I have to say in the end they made it right.
author: Lory P.

description: The location was great, we had a nice view of Alcatraz while we ate. However, the food looked better than it tasted.
author: Valerie G.

description:
Low quality, over saturated, over cooked seafood. 
To get the wait staff to serve, you have to flip a license plate to display stop, how about having a staff that is attentive? 
To check in, give them your number, they text and then you stand in a line to get seated.
The view here was very nice.
author: Brandon E.

description:
Well I liked the crab, but there wasn't plenty of options that's why I ordered it, Service is bad the style of the restaurant is consumed by better ones and the shrimp they have is awful in a real bad way like I couldn't eat it even.


 That's why I'll never go there again.
author: Ibrahim A.

description: There's a lot of hype over this place and I get it..forest gump is one of the best movie ever and this place does a good job in honoring the movie. The decor and forest trivia are great. The location is great also but the food...not so much. I decided to try the shrimp mac and cheese and the gumbo. Gumbo didnt have much taste I mean. I tasted the sausage? Not sure. The mac and cheese didn't look anything like the picture in the menu showed. The shrimp was a lot smaller and just...plain. My husband got a burger, it looked plain and the fries didnt have much crisp or anything to it really. Went for the experience, now that it is done. Not going back.
author: M. B.

description:
I ate lunch here while on vacation in San Francisco last week. The food was good, but it is pricey. Our service was ok. My issue with the restaurant came once I got home and checked my credit card statement. Lo and behold my server added an extra $10! I immediately called the restaurant and was placed on hold for 10 minutes before I was told they couldn't help me, but they took my information and assured me that someone would return my call on Monday. Monday came and went and still no phone call, so I gave them a couple of days and by Thursday called them again. I was put on hold for another 10 minutes but the only person that could help me wasn't in, but AGAIN took my information and promised me that this person would call me Friday. Well, it's Friday night and still no phone call, but I did check my credit card and I have been credited back my money finally. Customer service is seriously lacking here! I ended up having to 2 10 minute out of country phone calls I'm on the hook for now. This has been beyond frustrating! 

I see from other reviews that this isn't the first time this has happened, so beware if you pay by credit here!!
author: Nicole M.

description:
We love BG... took the boys in Honolulu and left the light up glass there so we had to visit this one in Pier 39/SanFran to get another glass! Arrived at 4:30 where you'll be texted to stand in line for a table. They don't take rsvns and are busy so be prepared to wait. It took us 15min to get our table. We sat by the window with an amazing view!!! We saw pelicans the ticket speed boat, a tanker and sail boats. Our waitress was friendly and helpful checking with the kitchen on dairy in the gumbo. I can have butter but not cheese or milk so total score on the gumbo cup! It was smoky from the sausage with a strong savoury sage and rosemary bite with cayenne. Get it! Next up, I had the market price pot of seafood, son had a shrimp Mac n cheese and hubby ordered the shrimp baskets. Check the pics!

This place is loud, crowded and not fine dining by any means. If you like Rock n roll, are open to trivia and a solid meal, you'll be fine. Our waitress ended her shift and introduced us to the new server.  They checked on us, topped up our drinks and even took my son's light up glass to wash it out after he finished drinking so we could carry it home in our backpack without stickiness! Way to go! Always a solid meal...you know it's good when you get a bib, crab bits in your hair and need to wash your hands twice after a meal, haha!!!
author: MJ L.

description:
Me and my girlfriend came here a few days after watching Forrest Gump for the first time and we were giddy with jokes and excitement about eating the food. With this place being in a location in SF that's so filled with tourism, this place is affected as well. Many people go here--avid fans of the movie, families for a meal, and tourists. That being said, the wait will be a while and you can use that time to explore the nearby shops such as their own gift shop filled with funny merchandise.

Now when it came to the food, things were SO overpriced for what they were. Portions were not really worth what they were marked as and the food really just felt like it was fast food marked at a diner price. So don't expect much out of the food.

What makes this place somewhat redeemable is the atmosphere made in dedication to the movie. Props are strewn everywhere from your table to the employees; it's really funny to just have a conversation about it all. The view is also really nice--it's an expansive view of the water and you can relax and watch all the boats pass by. You can tell a lot about a restaurant by it's decor, and you can tell this place is really just a place to  have some fun after watching Forrest Gump and probably no other occasion.
author: Renneth D.

description: We came to see the fireworks and afterwards we came and checked out this place. We had the shrimp and some drinks. The price was right and the food good. This bubba guy sure knew his stuff. Recommended!
author: David G.

description:
Really disappointed. Food was great, loved the ambience...I am a HUGE Forrest Gump fan and was so excited to eat here for our first time visiting San Fran for our babymoon. But the waitress totally ruined our experience. 

It was the most bizarre thing I've ever seen. Typically if service starts off good, it ends good and vice-versa. In this situation, the service started off okay, but once we had our meals, the waitress named Laura P. just became completely inattentive to us, for no reason at all. We were never once rude or anything. She just randomly stopped coming to our table. She was extremely attentive to her other two tables, I'm not sure if it's because they ordered alcohol and we didn't, or what (since I'm pregnant my husband has been practicing sobriety in solidarity with me, out of respect). 

She passed our table 7 times (we counted) while we were with empty plates and empty drinks. Never once asked how we were doing or if we wanted refills. She made eye contact with us several times and we tried to flag her down, but she would very blatantly ignore us and tend to her other tables. She must've touched the other tables at least 12 times, while ours was only touched 3 times. She eventually came to take our empty plates without asking us which plates we were done with (she just took the plates we were still eating off of without even pausing to give us a chance to stop her) and, once again, didn't ask if we wanted refills or the check, nothing. 

My husband is also a server and he was very upset with the service. He flagged down the manager and was very respectful, letting her know maybe the waitress was in need of a coaching session but made it clear he is also a server and had no intention of getting the girl in trouble. The manager apologized and told us she'd make sure our drinks were refilled. 

Come 20 minutes...no waitress, no refills. We finally flagged down the waitress for the check (this took three tries, each time we made eye contact with her and she still ignored us). The manager finally came back to touch bases, and we complained we never received our drinks. Turns out the manager had told her to bring us drinks, but the waitress never actually brought them.

We then witnessed the manager chewing out the server at the register, and the waitress proceeded to argue back, as if she was thoroughly convinced she'd done nothing wrong. Our check was brought back and the manager apologized and asked if we wanted a free dessert, but we declined as we had to leave. We still, after all that, never got our drinks. 

I hope that it was just a bad server and not the fault of the establishment, as I enjoyed the food and was super nostalgic about the Forrest Gump theme. But the service was literally the worst and most bizarre thing I've ever seen. Started off okay and took a nosedive out of nowhere. Disappointing.
author: Ashley S.

description: Undoubtedly the most visited restaurant in fisherman's wharf due to the large number of tourists visiting daily. They always have a crowd so be prepared to wait in line for a seat. Their service is average as they don't get too much time with the customer. Their food is also average. I'm not a very fried food fan so it's not my cup of tea. If you are interested in such food, Head on there!
author: Julia J.

description:
This was the worst experience ever. The customer service was the horrible. We waited 45 minutes before our drink orders were taken.  I complained to the manager who said she would send someone over to our table. Three different waiters come and said the put our order in and never did. The last person put the order in and of course it was wrong. To make matters worse the food was not that good. Never again!  

Update: I received a telephone call from the Manager, Julie apologizing for the service we received. I appreciate the apology because it shows they care about customer service.
author: Debra B.

description:
Came here recently with the fam and I must say we had a great time! I've always wanted to try Bubba Gump since watching Forrest Gump all those years ago but just never really crossed my mind to dine here, but we did and I will be back! Our server Mike did a fantastic job of running through their huge menu with us so we understood how it worked and also pointed out to us some favorites.

We ended up ordering:
*Gumbo - this was fantastic. We had their 'bowl' and it was a fairly decent portion which also came with rice. Flavors were on point, would order this again!

*Pear and Berry Salad - the dressing they had on this was solid with the flavors. The greens on this however seemed like they were from an old lettuce head since there were spots of redness on it

*Create Your Own - we had the fish with rice and chimichurri, and with their shrimp scampi. This dish was great, all the spices made it awesome

*Bucket of Boat Trash - this was their 'fun' menu choice. It had fried fish, shrimp, crab legs, and a bucket of fries. Honestly I don't think this was that worth it. The legs were good but the portion is mainly fries which were just meh

*Frozen Coronaritas - this is the drink which they pour a mini Corona on top so it looks super fancy and fun. It tastes like what it is. A margarita mixed with Corona. Was pretty decent!

Overall it was a fun experience and the food and alcohol was pretty good. There is a great vibe inside and the ambiance is splendid. For four of us it came out to be around $130 after tax and tip. We would come back!
author: Benjamin W.

description: Long wait on a Thursday night. Big tour groups. It took forever to get a beverage at the bar. I was sick during the night after eating here
author: Kathleen P.

description:
This location nice, it's at the end of pier 39. Beautiful view that we saw when we were seated next to the window. 

When I walked in, the host told me I would be seated in 15 minutes, but the restaurant looked very empty... This got me very confused, because the host was just chatting with the servers in the front.

The reason why I gave this location 2 stars is because the customer service and the quality of the food. The food tasted very bland and doesn't taste fresh at all. The Cajun Shrimps had no taste at all; felt like it was frozen shrimp thrown into a pot of sauce and warm up..: and also the Shrimp Scampi also.

I would say I wouldn't come here ever again.
author: Joey C.

description:
not great!
The service was1/2 a Star for us. Waiting for our waiter to show  up, then waiting just to get water. It was a hot sauna no air conditioning, then always asking and more waiting for some one to ask us if we needed anything, even with the sign that says stop no one would check on us. My order was wrong & our waiter try to convince me that it was the way I ordered it, when it was most definitely  not, the way I ordered. More waiting for the check and more waiting to finalize our Bill.
Won't be back to this Bubba Gumps again.
author: Gloria G.

description:
Stopped in for a quick happy hour on a cool and windy evening. I grabbed a Bloody Mary and it was yummy to the tummy! Slightly spicy, with a huge piece of celery, olives and a juicy pepper. It was very good and the bartender did a great job making my adult beverage.

For food I ordered Cajun shrimp and sausage. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great. It was just ok and had a decent amount of heat. It came with two pieces of grilled bread.

Happy hour prices are very reasonable and they have a decent selection. I spent $10 bucks so pretty good for a drink and appetizer. I would go back again! The bartender and waitress were friendly. The restaurant was clean. The food did come out slow for just an appetizer. Overall I had a pretty good experience.
author: Nisha R.

description:
First time here and was very impressed the wait time was 10 min and was seated next to a window table.
The server was very nice and friendly and explained the signs on the table run forest means you need your waiter. Stop forest means no service needed. i found that very interesting.

The appetizer plate was very good and full of flavor we ordered the shrimpers heaven which has all sorts of shrimp .
For the main dish i ordered the catch entree was very delicious full of flavor.

The ambiance is very nice, will definitely come back when I'm in San Francisco.

They also have what is called Forest Gump  trivia and if you win you get a prize...
author: Maria A.

description: Do your self a favor and avoid this place.  We should have read all comments prior to eating here.  First time and last time I will eat here.  Poor Service, managers were apologizing at every table for issues.  My wife's food never made it to the table until everyone else was done.   She ask for it to go and the manager brought it with a free dessert.  WTH get a free dessert like that's going to make it better.  Let me give you all a hint.  Serve the food your customers order and you won't have to say sorry.  Incredible how poor the service was.
author: Corey S.

description: I visited this restaurant for the first time on 9/8. I was super excited because its a popular seafood restaurant. I noticed its alot of families that come in however,i noticed the kid's menu had too much of a small selection. I ordered a frozen margarita and Boat Trash With Maine Lobster. It took about almost an hr for two adult meals & two kids meals of kids who didn't really order much of anything. The margarita was awesome, however, the Boat Trash With Maine Lobster was literally trash,the lobster was the only delicious food,the rest tasted like frozen breaded seafood cooked in a microwave. The waiter apparently had a bad day he claimed,and it showed in his customer service. The service seems very disorganized and careless. I will never eat there again.
author: Sharde R.

description: The food was amazinggggg but the staff was a little absent minded. But that's to be expected eith a very full restaurant. One tip, definitely call ahead and make a reservation. We did and we got a window seat away from most of the noise and hustle and bustle of the restaurant. Overall great dining experience!
author: Marina M.

description:
The wait was ridiculously long we were told 45 minutes to get seated. We waited an hour and a half.. I understand the wait because of it being Saturday and all of the tourists. Now for the service, it took 25 minutes to just get our drinks. I can't tell you how long it took to get our food. When we got our food we needed refills for our drinks, (water for 5 of us). We asked 3 times for water and finally got the Manager to bring it to us. We asked for a bag to put our bubba gump glasses in and was told they were out of bags we would have to go to the gift store., when the table next to us had  5 bags.
The food was good!
author: Vicki T.

description:
The service here is great, and the servers are very friendly and professional. Our family members really enjoy the food as well as the environment there. We went there during the weekend and there were very crowded. Though the waiting was kind of longer than expected, we were served just in minutes as we got the seat.
The only problem is about the app.function. It didn't work well enough as we used it to check in and book the waiting list. We need to call in to get on waiting list.
In general, we will be there again in the near future.
author: Mm T.

description:
Wait was loooooong, waiter was very cool and good at his j-o-b.
the food, well not so great, just ok. Hell Red Lobster has better food..
author: J W.

description: I only give this place one star for the service, service was good. Food is too overpriced for the portions that are given. Very disappointed as others are on here. Should've read the reviews before coming.
author: Alisia A.

description:
Our waitress was super cool, so there's the one star.  
The wait was absurd, and while it was stated at check in to be about 30 minutes, in reality it was almost an hour. 
The food is OK but really basic, absolutely nothing about it that would warrant the stupid high prices.   Drinks were like $15 each!  We tried to order 4 different drinks and were told that they were out of each one before we selected some that were available. 
The vastly overpriced bill came and I saw that there was a "fee" included at the bottom.  It was like $6 or something somewhat menial, so I asked the waitress what this nonsense was and she said, "It's a city tax."   I know that it is not a city tax and I told her this, so she said, "yeah, I don't really know, our manager tells us to tell people it's a city tax if they ever ask."   If she hadn't been a good waitress I would have taken this fee out of her tip, but that's lame so I didn't do that. 
I went to the hostess stand and asked them the same question, I asked them if I could see a manager and one of the hosts went to fetch the leader of this establishment.  She came back a short time later and said, "The manager's on a break, but he said to tell you it's a cost of doing business in San Francisco fee."  Utter nonsense obviously, but enough to verify that I needn't return to this place.
author: H K.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!  So much fun!!

I really wish we could get one up here in Seattle!  I would be there almost every day!!!
author: Jennifer O.

description: Not sure why I've never written a review before. Been here like a million times. This place is super touristy, duh! So you won't be too thrilled about the wait times. Staff is sometimes meh, but mostly friendly... depending on time of day, etc. I don't think I've ever had a bad experience here. We will keep coming back, I'm sure. I always get the bucket of shrimp, Cajun. And I like getting the fun drinks where you get to keep the glass/mug/shaker as a souvenir.
author: Sherryl Z.

description: Good location, okay food.  good education place for kids.
author: Geoffrey H.

description:
The food here is sooo good!  Their jambalaya is darned near perfect and the shrimp linguine was super, too.  This is really great for the company because if not for the food I wouldn't go here.  I give this location 3 stars because the hostess was surly and when I got to the table the silverware had old fishy flakes on them.  I let her know there was old food on the silverware and she just said "sorry" until I prodded her to maybe get me a new set.  She was quite irritated by this.

Still, the food is really good lol!
author: Beverly H.

description:
Went on a Saturday evening, just honey and I.

It's at the back of Pier 39. If this is your lunch/ dinner location I recommend checking in with Bubba Gumps First. They said our wait would be an hour. They have a texting system, and you can even check your status with the link they send you on Yelp. We only waited about 30 minutes before we  received our text saying our table was ready. We walked around the pier while we waited and even caught a street performance at the stage in the back of the pier. 

When we were called we were seated promptly. We even got a table over looking the bay during sunset. Our waitress was pretty cool. She went over specials and the membership club. Then took our order. She was helpful in making our food choices. 

The food was everything I imagined. Good, plentiful, and quick. 

For it being pretty busy and touristy we didn't feel rushed and the quality and level of service was good. 

For me being a local I have to give it 4 stars  because I've had better seafood in the bay that's not as commercial. For the price, the ambiance, and quality of food well worth it.
author: La'Ban W.

description:
Over priced like everything in the city and was bland and small portioned. The waiter was super friendly and we gave him a fat tip for his service but not for the quality of the food for sure.
Return to this little gimmick? Naw I don't think so.... thats all I have to say about that.
author: Garrett K.

description: THIS PLACE IS TRASH. In my popcorn shrimp I got 4 pieces of shrimp and the rest were bell peppers. The shrimp wasn't even good. Never again will I go there.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
There was a bit of a wait to be seated, but luckily part of our party went to put our name down first, while the rest of us went to play a 7D experience game just below the restaurant. Bubba Gump is themed on Forrest Gump, and the movie was playing on some of the TVs, along with "Run Forrest Run," and "Stop Forrest Stop" license plates on each table. We didn't know what they meant, so we flipped it to "Stop Forrest Stop", and a server came by and was like "Stop Forrest Stop! What do you need?" And we were like whoops, don't need anything, just didn't know what it meant XD Now we [you] know (cue Bill Nye hehe). 

- Shrimper's Net Catch: an appetizer of - you guessed it - shrimp. The shrimp had shells on them, which made it a bit more difficult to eat. It was heavily seasoned. We got a mix of half Garlic and half Cajun seasoning, and it was pretty funny because one of my friends is not very tolerant to spice, but it seemed like each shrimp she ate was the Cajun one haha.
- Forrest's Seafood Feast: came with a variety of fried goodness. 
    - Hush Pups: these were quite interesting! A fried oval with some corn and seafood goodies inside. These were probably the most unique/tasty thing of the night.
    - Fish was pretty decent. Fries were decent as well.
    - Fried shrimp: standard, not much to say.

The service was kind of funky, but I think it was just our server and the vibe I got. Not sure if he was new or something, but the most prominent example is when we were still in the middle of finishing two plates, and he came by to ask if we wanted the cheque, and we hadn't flagged him (or put the Stop Forrest Stop sign lol). The restaurant wasn't crowded at that time or closing soon either. Like in the middle of my bite I was like um nope not done yet (in my head I'm like look at our giant platter of food that still has more than a third left on it lol). 

Anyways, besides that, just speaking about the food alone, the seafood and platters weren't quite worth the price. I guess that's a restaurant in a super touristy location for ya. It's good to come once, just to see the Forrest Gump theme, but other than that, not worth a return visit.
author: Joanna C.

description: I've come here a few times for the fun, casual atmosphere and pretty good food and drinks on the pier. It gets really busy here in the summer time (well, all the time since it's Pier 39).
author: Michelle R.

description: Great Place to Come to for Lunch or Dinner. There was 4 of Us and Our food was Absolutely Delicious. I'm So glad that I didn't pay any attention to the Reviews that Rated this restaurant with one or two Stars. Our Table was right by the Water, so we had the Perfect view. I must Warn you though to Make Reservations on the Weekends. I had the Boat Trash with Lobster, other dishes on my Table were The New Orleans Shrimp, Seafood Pasta, and Stuffed Shrimp. This is a FUN restaurant & EVERYTHING reminds you of the Movie Forest Gump!
author: Tracy M.

description: OMG...the shrimp new Orleans was everything! Drinks were great and we had a wonderful view of the bay
author: T, P.

description: On 08/23/2018 I dined at this establishment and was over charged almost 40$ and I have not been able to speak to anybody regarding my money that the establishment owes me. Everytime I call the restaurant the last two managers I spoke two (david/cassie) stated I needed to speak to some accountant dept but every time I was transferred to her she was not there and had to leave a voicemail, have yet to receive a refund.  The first manager I spoke to(bin) stated he refunded me but now he no longer works there. I called corporate  but I was unable to speak anyone except the receptionist and she was also rude, she stated there is nobody I could speak to and If i leave a voicemail someone will get back to me. I have not received any call back and I have been waiting since 08/24/2018.
author: Rebecca G.

description: Unorganized. our reservations were "lost" even though we confirmed them yesterday. Plenty of people have came up to the counter complaining about the same issue and longer wait time than said. Would never come again. PERIOD.
author: Junior P.

description:
My opinion on this seemingly popular food chain may be due to my inexperience with American family restaurant culture, but I really did not enjoy my time at Bubba Gump Shrimp. 

Firstly, we were welcomed by the overwhelming NOISE of the place. Everywhere people we screaming at each other across the tables. There was even background music blaring to add to the headache. 

When our food arrived, we were not overwhelmed with the quality. The "Shrimpers Heaven" consisted of four types of shrimp with fries. The tempura and coconut shrimps were good, but the grilled and fried shrimp was below average, and very chewy. Alongside the mediocre food, the amount of plastic waste accompanying the meals was disgraceful. There were plastic cups for sauces and paper and plastic serving parts.

Apart from the awful food, the service was shocking. Instead of not being served, we were attended to way to much. Our servers asked us questions all the time, and almost harassed us about their game of Forrest Gump trivia. After realising we wanted to be  left alone, they left us for a while before trying to make us take their "free" draught glass. 

After this loud, oppressive and hectic atmosphere and about 25 birthday parties around us, I was glad to get out of there. I understand that some people find this type of restaurant fun and entertaining, but we definitely won't be returning.
author: Hailey S.

description:
My girlfriend and I were in a hurry on a busy day. 3 stars is probably not a fair rating, but it was a Sunday afternoon and the place was packed to the rafters, plus we required only very basic meals. We were lucky enough to get a little table almost immediately- it was in an awkward place, but we had a train to catch and were glad to just get seated and served. The servers were polite and did their jobs quite fast (under the circumstances) with zero drama.

I ordered only a 'big bucket' of French Fries and a beer. The paper lining inside the bucket occupied half the space of the bucket - I guess it improves profit margins if they only provide 50% of the alleged fries and scrunch up the paper to provide the illusion of a full bucket. A minor quibble on a day when we were in a hurry; yet an interesting discovery all the same.
author: Jack W.

description:
When eating there I was pleasantly surprised by the stellar location and view. The service was quick but a packed restaurant meant lots of bustling. The food didn't have a strong taste and felt rushed. Some aspects of the food were good such as the shrimp. The restaurant had a nice history with a themed ambiance. Overall the restaurant has some strengths and weaknesses but is a good place to eat 

*one side note is that they accidentally served chicken broth to a life long vegetarian.
author: Jason N.

description:
It was my birthday. So, my family decided to have a celebration dinner on the pier. 

We hadn't been to this restaurant for a long while, maybe 6-months, maybe longer, but they updated the place! They expanded the restaurant for more tables, which was great because when we arrived around dinner time (6:30pm), we were sat down within 15-minutes! Super quick in comparison to previous experiences. 

Though the food can be slightly expensive, you definitely get a decent amount for each entree. We had the shrimp mac and cheese which was decent. I got the fish and chips because it's always a good portion! If you want, you can always upgrade the portion, but you already get three big pieces with the normal size. Others with me got the shrimp heaven which is probably they're more popular dish for good reason. It's like a big sampler dish with lots of great sauces!

I think what made me experience good though was definitely the service. Very quick to respond to the STOP FORREST STOP signs. Plus! Even though the servers did not know it was my birthday (and there were also several tables with birthdays around us), our server (Michael) was extremely attentive - even took the time to play the famous Forrest Gump trivia games with us like they normally do, which definitely put a smile on my family's faces. Thanks for a good time.
author: Aaron G.

description: Literally I'm here rn sat at a table cocktail waitress is rude gives me attitude for no reason, she said we moved the stuff of the table when it was already off. Then said it was there for a reason because the table was dirty and she needed to clean it, then sprayed her cleaner all over myself and Friend
author: Michelle R.

description: Wow! This place has the best cajun seafood I honestly have tasted. Their garlic bread is so yummy! Beautiful area and view was nice from our table. I gave this 4 because the waiters don't seem to pay attention much on the food if it's done or not.  But food was worth it !!!!!
author: Priyanka K.
