description: Good food but one of the waitresses spilled bbq all over my lady and she didn't clean it up try to help us out or anything.. I had to flag down another server for help.. very rude and didn't offer any kind of discount
author: Hueston H.

description: Whenever I go here, I get the shrimp scampi. By far the best I have ever had. I get it with extra capers. Never cease to amaze me! Thank you guys.
author: Katie W.

description:
Had the worst and weakest margarita I have ever had in my life!  Also it was supposed to be a top shelf and it was for sure made with Cuervo....and it cost $14!

Our waitress was nice but her breath was rancid.
author: Angie D.

description: Our food was ok and the waitress was unfortunately terrible it took an hour to get our food and she never checked on us to see if we wanted refills on anything my son didn't get his apple juice until our food arrived and 45 to an hour later worst service ever
author: Jo T.

description: Not at all recommended if you are going to have lunch. I think this place is very touristy. The rates are high, wait time is super long without any reason, we saw a lot of empty tables when we entered but there were still people who were waiting outside for their turn. Two stars for food because that was tasty but all in all it wasn't worth the time we waited for. Will probably never visit again.
author: Qasim Z.

description:
Been here at least 5-10 times over the past five years. Summary: Rude arrogant and unprofessional young people are running the place. Waiting is always over 1hr and food and drinks are definitely not worth it. 

Latest incident we had was, they said waiting time is 1hr 30mins but that we could sit at the bar if we wanted. When we walked in, there were tons of big empty tables despite the crowd waiting outside, but not many seats at the bar. There were single seats in between group parties. I asked one of the waiters to help us get two seats next to each other at the bar, he said he won't help and that I should deal with it on my own if I can, and if we can't he can't do anything about it. He couldn't care less. Didn't even wait, he turned and kept walking as he finished his sentence. Obviously we left immediately. What a horrible treatment. Won't be coming again and don't recommend to anyone. Try another bubba Gump location this one is and was horrible at least in all times I've visited.
author: Selen A.

description: Our waitress could see our little guy was hungry and knew the wait was long so she brought him a snack while we waited. The food was excellent and I was so impressed with the service I had to let the manager know what a great girl she has working for her. Will definitely return
author: Jessica L.

description:
If I could give them  negative - 's I would. I'M livid... my meal came with 3 shrimp!! Who serves an adult 3 shrimp with dinner?? The waiter Trent was very nice and helpful. However it did not make it any better that my meal came with 3 shrimp. I'm not never spending another penny at this establishment OR any of their restaurants. 

Update:
So apparently while I was writing this review sitting in my seat my husband had an issue with his debit card and went to the ATM. I totally was obviously to the conversation him and " Trent from Texas" the waiter had regarding his card not working when it was processed as Credit. Trent gave my husband directions to the nearest ATM. Which was a 3 minute walk. I was unaware because I was in my own zone still steam mad about my 3  and I was writing my original review. 

So after my daughters packed up their to go boxes and I didn't see my husband we proceeded to go to the front. I assumed he went to the front to pay.  As we were walking to the front the Manger Mr. Le (kinda look like Squidworth from Spongebob) abruptly blocked my line of travel and asked if he can help me with my bill? I'm thinking he is taking about because I was upset about the 3 Shrimp that I received with my meal. Oh no Honeee he was talking about payment.. now I'm all confused. 

He had me and my daughters blocked from leaving our area and he was on his walkie talkie informing someone he had " A WALK OUT"........

Husband come back pay for the food with cash. I inform him of what transpired after he left. Trent was standing there with the manger. They both were aware that his card did not work and he went to the atm to get cash. The manger could have dealt with the situation differently. I was not aware of the situation he could have asked me I would like for you to stay seated until the payment is made. I could understand if my husband did not have a conversation with the server regarding the situation and then the server Trent also directed him to the atm, with his family waiting for him.  So it's a matter of principal I don't want to hear about your damn policy. Use your mouth and have a conversation before you assume that people are trying to run about with about paying. At least I would have enough sense to do something like that with my kids with me and don't you think I would eat at a 5 star restaurant and not go for a BUCKET OF TRASH??
author: Keisha J.

description: Over priced and food tastes ALRIGHT. The place is crowded and waiting time is excruciating long. I ordered the Shrimp scampi and it came with  garlic bread. The service is great tho, but I would never come here again.
author: Neloffer E.

description: Great service, great food. If your looking for shrimps cooked in many different ways this place is it.
author: M M.

description:
We came here on a spontaneous night out on the town on a midnight summer Sunday night. She had the clam chowder, a side, and two glasses of white wine. I partook in a glass of Merlot. For the main course I believe I had the tilapa with mixed vegetables which included spinach, broccoli, carrots, cucumbers, etc.* and mashed potatoes which was cooked to perfection. The service was prompt as well with our servers being attentive and polite. I found their "Run Forrest Run" call signs to signal the help quite amusing as it was effective. For this fine dining experience, I award 5 stars. It was definitely worth the twenty minute wait to be seated. I will definitely visit again when I'm in the area for the cuisine, the wine, and the amusing atmosphere of the company's staff. 

I do subtract one star for the noise level from the other customers. There could be better ambiance levels in the building by way of infrastructure to create a more private setting. Doing that would create a more upscale quiet environment. Should they do that, the next time I visit I'll give them the full compliment of 5 stars with zero subtractions.
author: Richard R.

description:
My lady and I spent the weekend in San Francisco for our anniversary, we had dinner at this Bubba Gump and let me tell you the wait was no joke. These things happen though so I wasn't too upset as I just walked around while I sat on a wait list. 
  We were greeted and seated by Charlotte, I believe her name was. Now let me say, the food was great.....I mean it's shrimp how can it not be amazing but if I can go off on a tangent and talk about the service. We did have a server and unfortunately I didn't get her name, however most of the evening we were helped by Charlotte and let me tell you to say this girl does her job and does it damn well. 
  She checked on us several times, helping us with refills and overall while coordinating the rest of her staff, she would stand in one spot and being a very tall lady just watch over the whole place making sure everyone was being helped. Im at a loss to think of when I've seen someone as efficient in her job as Charlotte. 
  Yes the food was good haha I had the shrimp lovers plate which was awesome. Very happy with our dining experience here.
author: Tony A.

description:
If you're reading this you probably already know it's overpriced and a tourist trap. Sometimes we just want to indulge in a tourist trap though. 

Food is tasty, of course overpriced and service here was a little ghetto overall of the staff but I am sure turnover changes this from time to time.
author: Joey H.

description: They're only getting a two star because the food is decent and the creativity of course BUTTTTT don't you dare walk in there at dinner time, even when they say the wait is only "10 minutes" & you check in on yelp  because you will wait aT least AN HOUR BEFORE YOU GET YOUR FOOD!! YOUR SERVER WILL NOT REFILL YOUR DRINKS and if your lucky you MIGHT (let me emphasize with caution) have your waiter come back at the end of your dinner just long enough to give you your tab after you've waived him down 13 or 14 times. At this point I was beginning to think this had to be strategy of some kind because I was almost ready for a second meal before I even left the place!
author: LaVonna V.

description: Horrible! Use to love this place the food was not great and the service was ok! Long wait times so disappointed this time
author: Amy A.

description:
I like this place, I go often.
Nice staff, they can work on organization, but the rest is fine. Most servers are lovely.
author: Ana M.

description: Food is not all that but service and management team is great! Love my 1st experience here (even with the mistakes& stuff in my food) I will definitely bring my family back
author: Aima D.

description: We're avid Bubba Gump fans and have been to about 6 in the US and the only one in our home country, London. Loved this, service was a bit staggered but the experience is always good.
author: Meg L.

description: If I could give 0 stars I would. Came here tonight at around 9:40 pm, the closing online says 10pm. Me, my husband and my 2 yr old stood outside the locked door and knocked because there was still a bunch of ppl inside eating and the closing time said 10. The guy standing next to the register waved his finger at us and didn't even come to the door. A nice girl from their store came and opened it for us and confirmed that they close at 10. We came to the bar area and sat in a booth. The girl working the bar came and started saying they closed at 9:30, we told her the time says 10, plus there are still bunch of ppl here and the other girl confirmed it was 10. She still tried to push that they closed at 9:30 and looked irritated and asked the girl who opened the door for us why she would do that right in front of us so I just asked for a manager. As she walked away, she turned back towards us and said to the other guy, "what the f@!* ".  We were shocked.  I explained to the manager what happened and he also confirmed that they close at 10. Were we lied to, disrespected and cussed at because we tried to get dinner. The manager was nice and apologized but I will be seeking further action against those other employees. Mostly the girl who thought it was ok to cuss at a pregnant woman, my husband and my 2 yr old. Awful experience.
author: Macee F.

description:
We ordered Dixie Fish Sandwhich , Cajun chicken sandwhich , kids grilled cheese and kids chicken fingers.  It was good, standard pub-style food.  I'd pass on the bread pudding, all 4 of us tried it it was meh.  Bummed they were out of Kendal Jackson Chardonnay. Had their local wine, Glass Mountain it was bad. Despite a crazy long wait (somehow they forgot about our table) our waitress was very charming, and had us do a Forrest Gump Trivia Quiz and that was fun.

Previous visit I had Baja Tacos, it was pretty good & husband had jambalaya he said it sucked. 
The food is hit or miss, typical chain restaurant fare.
Kids LOVE it here.  Adults seem to love the cocktails, every table had a lit-up drink on it.  We played it safe and just ordered glass of wine and a beer.  My husband didn't like having his beer served in a plastic cup.

Always good place to take out of town guests. We came here before with our U.K. guests they were ecstatic with our table, panoramic water views.  Be prepared for long waits for table if you arrive after 5pm fri-sun.  We do call a heads even with that you'll have to wait a bit too.
author: Jill S.

description: Not impressed at all. I expected this establishment to live up to the hype, however, there was much to be expected. The staff was somewhat pleasant. The restroom were hot like a sauna. One stall door was broken; I'm sure this restaurant makes enough money to fix it. Also, clean your restrooms because they are disgusting. Walking into a stall with blood on the floor was repulsive.
author: Tianna H.

description:
The food at this restaurant use to taste really good however there haa been a drastic change.
 My family and I went last week and I had the bucket of boat trashwhich was absolutely horrible.  My shrimp was previously frozen and a few pieces were still stuck together, my lobster tail taste like rubber and was tasteless and over-cooked and my fries were old and cold. For the prices they charge and for the food to have such poor quality I will not be returning
author: Iyabo A.

description: Its a great location, I am here on a Monday so the wait is not so bad, still took me 10-15 mins. The service is quick and professional. No time for Jokes. Its a busy tourist place and of course famous from the movie. The food was okay, nothing special. It lacks the quantity and quality for five stars. Beers are great though.
author: Love P.

description: You are paying for the experience. The food was ok, nothing to write home about. Service wasn't great but it was busy and apparently shift change. Wouldn't go back
author: Chris R.

description: I've been to another Bubba Gump restaurant and the portions sizes were much smaller in San Fran. The meals were great and quality of food is always good. I loved our waitress even though she forgot our appetizer she comped is so there's no complaints there. The only negative comment I have is that the next day my husband and I decided to stop in for a drink and as I walked to the bar an autistic boy and his mom were sitting waiting for a table. He attacked me! He grabbed my hair and coat and yanked me to the ground. His mother apologize repeatedly and pried his hands from me while my husband pulled me back. Nobody from the staff intervened at all. I would hope that if any customers are in this situation that at least the staff interject in some way, even to ask if I were ok afterward.
author: Elizabeth P.

description:
I am disappointed, we were really looking forward to trying this place out! It could be 5 stars but the wait is ridiculous! We called at 4pm to make a reservation for 7.... she said 50 min. We walked over around 40 min later and let them know we're there, the hostess said oh the wait is going to be an 1 hr 20 min ... so about another 40 min. At this point we have already waited and all the restaurants are going to be busy. Finally get to the "second" line inside the restaurant 2 hours later.... she then asks how many in your party... 7... oh that's going to be another 30 minutes! Are you kidding me? 

1. How did you not know how many in our party? 2. They had NO ONE sitting in the booths the entire time we were waiting. All the tables were full but booths were empty. They had to be under staffed. It was unorganized chaos. 

They get 2 stairs from me for their view and when we finally did get to sit down the waitress was very nice and helpful. If it wasn't for her our experience would have been miserable. Food was ok. I can now say I have ate here but most likely won't come back.
author: Amy D.

description: Food was delicious and our view was great. However, the service could have been WAY better. We were not helped until we switched our sign to 'Stop Forrest Stop' and our server, Julie, only checked in twice during our whole stay. Given that we're loyal Laundry members, we expected better service. After telling her we were ready for the check we waited an extra 15-20 min to actually receive the check & pay.
author: Erika F.

description: 1 hour into our 40 min wait because they kept closing tables. Then 30 minutes to order. Then 70 minutes to get food on the table. Two trips to the parking meter adding an hour each time to avoid a parking ticket. Claimed a large party, however that party came in after us. Worst dinner experience in over 10 years.
author: Bruce G.

description: When did this place start going for the Applebee's/Chili's vibe? I remember coming here years ago and even bringing friends and family because of the great theme and food. What happened? Did they get bought out by Comcast? Service was terrible and food tasted and looked like it came from a DMV cafeteria. Who ever bought this franchise ruined BubbaGumps and what it once was. If you want frozen dinner quality seafood priced high then you've come to the right place. They'll even try to sell you T-shirts and cheap plastic novelty cups while you eat, good times.
author: Andrian T.

description: I like these kind of kitsch/theme restaurants...even though the food might not always be the best I'm there for the environment and I love Tom  Hanks sooo...it's a win win
author: Nicole A.

description: Popular tourist attraction and also great place for locals too. Wait is a little too much both for a table and to get your food. They have a great environment and service is mediocre. If you order certain drinks you can also get a commemorative glass to bring home. I ordered a fish taco and they give you a little salsa, it wasn't enough and they charged me more for more salsa. We also ordered a shrimp bucket that was half cajun half butter however shrimp was very small. Boiling crab is better. Margarita was very light, not much alcohol in here. They do sing for you on your birthday. They validate parking at this location.
author: Amy Y.

description: I was super disappointed in my meal, my service and the bathrooms were awful. Over priced food. The shrimp was tiny and poor quality. The service was slow, it took 30 minutes to get my daughter's milk. We got 1 hour validated in our parking.  Totally not worth it.
author: Nichole B.

description:
We've been to bubba Gumps up and down the east coast from NYC to Maryland to Orlando and back and this one doesn't stand up to par. We flipped our "stop" sign and waited 13 minutes (6 servers passing our table up without stopping) before I got up, refilled my son's drink and sat back down. It was another 10 minutes before we would even lay eyes on our server again. The food was good as standard but the service just wasn't there. This makes me very sad for Bubba Gump and will most likely never return to this location. 

Edit: it got worse, our food was delivered room temperature and when I spoke with the manager he just continually told us they are understaffed and run the restaurant like this every night. He did say he hopes to fix that in the future.
author: April B.

description: i love this place. my boyfriend took me to SF on the piers for my birthday. i chose here to eat. it was busy as heck. we had to wait an hour to be seated, but it was worth the wait. id drive all the way to SF just to eat there again. and the staff are reallly friendly.
author: Amber M.

description:
Over priced food and not all that good. The view keeps you coming back. The bay view is amazing. 

We had the least interesting waiter ever this trip. Something was off the entire visit to this restaurant. It was a Wednesday around 5pm and not overly busy. 

I will probably go back but 80 dollars for three meals and lousy service makes me think about trying another restaurant this area.
author: Mark L.

description: When you live near the city, you try to avoid touristy locations, however, its always good to try them when your with people who have never been. This place did not disappoint. The food was good, but is a bit pricey for what it is. Think of a good Chili's or Applebees but overpriced. The service was sub par as well. They have signs that you flip to say you want service, and we had 5 employees walk by without even a bat of the eye at us. I give it 4 stars despite the price and lack of service because the food was good and view was awesome, also the wait time was shorter than they said, it was 2 hour wait but we only waited for an hour.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Me and friend decided to come here for lunch on a Tuesday it wasn't crowded but waiting to be seated took awhile like maybe 20 minutes , I think they were very short staff. When we got seated we had a nice server  then she went to lunch and we had another guy I was confused who was our server  anymore . Our first server she was basically running around taking orders for most of the tables and bringing food. The other servers they were slow or on break I was still confused and then we had the guy . It's like who is helping us? 

Finally we got our food and I got the trio shrimp sampler omg amazing and so much you can share that . The sauces went well with the shrimp it paired well. My favorite shrimp was the coconut shrimp so coconut and sweet. Also got the apple Berry vingerate salad with chicken absolutely good and we got the fried chicken which comes with mashed potatoes and corn , the chicken was so crispy and mashed potatoes and corn went well with it.
The server came up and asked us about question about Forest Gump too be honest I'm not a fan I just wanted to experience trying the food thank God my friend knew those answers. First time coming the food was awesome and I will probably come back if the servers not bug me about the movie and the servers , and hostess are more friendly and knew what they were doing. 

Definitely come try this place if you never had it  so you can say you tried and maybe your experiences is different from my views.
author: Hoa T.

description: Horrible service. Had to ask who our server was, once we got one assigned. She had a horrible attitude. Will never visit this location again
author: Kevin Y.

description: Get ready to wait. We put our names in and the staff said it'd be about 35 minutes, but it took an hour and a half. Frustrating since we stopped walking around the pier to wait in front of bubba gumps expecting to be seated soon. Service was great and food was good though.
author: Josh M.

description:
We visited the Bubba Gump Shrimp restaurant on Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf, CA on 4/10/18. It was our first visit and we were excited to try it out after having read so many good reviews on TripAdvisor. The location on Pier 39 is great, but a little hidden. The staff was very friendly and helpful, but the food was average. I would probably rate the dynamite shrimp at Cheesecake better than the 3-4 different shrimp dishes we ordered. Even for the price, I felt it was a bit high as the portions were very small. In the popcorn shrimp we ordered for the apps, there was hardly any shrimp but mostly fried batter chunks and peppers. Was a bit disappointing. Will not visit again.
If you order certain drinks, you get the shakers or glass as souvenirs.
author: Mil K.

description:
Completely overpriced. Charged us food that we never ordered. Food was so so. I was so disappointed with their shrimp appetizer. Just be aware that if you order their "jumbo" size shrimp appetizer, you'll not get jumbo size shrimp, instead, they double the quantity, which still very little for $28. Smh. If you want real cajun shrimp, just go to boiling crab or any other seafood shack. Calarami was served cold. Clam chowder was soo bland. I'd rather go to wipeout. I don't think I'm ever coming back. 

Staff was great though.
author: AE -.

description:
This was a horrible experience We were told we were going to have to wait an hour and 20 minutes OK fine understandable it's a popular place so we did wait the hour and 20 minutes past we were now at an hour and 40 minutes we continue to wait continue to wait we kept getting told no 10 minutes 10 minutes two hours came still nothing but young girl was not apologetic really didn't care that I was upset did not care that we waited over two hours trying to talk to a manager but apparently they were too busy this place is a disgrace I've never eaten at this establishment but if the service is this bad I can't imagine the food been any better signed so disgusted  
We ended up leaving hungry, lkooloôbut Black Angus thanks I'm
author: Toni D.

description: I have been to other Bubba Gump locations, but this one in San Francisco was the worst! Service was horrible. We walked right in and were seated immediately. After drinking half of my lemonade, I noticed the ice had black mold in it. GROSS!!! They took forever to bring the food and some of the food items were cold resulting in one person in my party getting food poisoning (ruined the rest of the trip for them). We ordered dessert but no silverware was provided. We had to get a busboy to bring us silverware after the ice cream was halfway melted. Then the server took forever to bring us the bill. Very bad service! Do NOT recommend!
author: Sandra C.

description: The food was good. The service was good except we couldn't get anybody to remove our dishes from the table when we were done. We ended up putting the dishes on the next table. Other than that and the high prices, it was good
author: Jae T.

description: This place is busy on Friday night. We got in in about 20 minutes and our food took a long time but our server was charming and gave us some Forrest Gump trivia questions to pass the time. Then she gave my daughter some spongebob trivia questions as she felt left out. That's the definition of great service. Antisipating the guests needs. We needed attention to be diverted from the long cook time of our food and she delivered. I wouldn't order the chicken sandwich again as it was overcooked and the crust was hard, probably because it sat in window for a while, but no big deal. The rest of my party had great food. That's what I get for ordering chicken at a seafood joint. I will return for the service alone. Service is dying in America but Bubba Gumps delivers the goods
author: Bryan J.

description: We chose this seafood restaurant out of so many seafood restaurants, just because my husband and I love this film so much. The atmosphere inside is super good but you have to wait for a while to get a seat. Seafood was fine, and during the meal we were asked several quizzes about Forrest Gump, my husband got all the answers right! So proud! It was a funny experience.
author: Abby W.

description: This place is always a place we eat at when we have the option to - not because the food is stellar but it's pretty consistent and not terrible by any means.  Our waitress was really friendly and went above and beyond after my husband accidentally spilled his beverage all over the table and even our neighbors - oops! She cleaned up our mess, offered to replace it for free and when we declined she deducted the beverage from our bill. Our table the night we visited was a corner table with a perfect view of the bay - full views of Alcatraz, and the bridges! If you're looking for an enjoyable dinner with a fun atmosphere you won't be disappointed.
author: Amanda M.

description: I would have to say that this place is amazing. It's located on Pier 39 on some sort of shopping center or food court there's a lot of places that sells food and there's a lot of places that sells all kinds of souvenirs. This place has always been busy I've never seen that it would be slow they always Have huge line in order to get to the restaurant you'll have to wait for at least 30 minutes it depends on the time of the day the food Service in small portions. Whenever you are ordering food it will come to you in about 30 minutes so you better order everything at once. The reason why the food preparation take so long is because they are very busy like a mention it before the parking spot is very hard to find. If you want to find a parking spot you'll have to park at the very end of the Pier 39. They also have parking lot Buy this big to build an apartment I hope this information will be useful if you like to wait that's the place for you if not find some where else to eat. They also charge tips without your Permission. That's the law San Francisco for some reason. In my opinion it's very stupid even though you got bad service or good service you'll have to pay 20% tip anyways.
author: Ivan A.

description: Absolute WORST RESTAURANT IN SAN FRAN!!!! We have been there and around all of the piers and hands down this is the worst! We waited for an hour and a half to be sat... even though half of the restaurant was empty....! They were terrible at turnning tables around! I have worked in Food and Beverage industry in Vegas and this is nothing like we expected!
author: Stella V.

description: Good food but horrible service. 4 out of 5 of us got our food by the time us 4 finish our food and the 5th person finally got there food 30 mins later for a salad. We also waited for 50 mins to get a table. They also did not give us silverware to our food " they were out" . The little sign doesn't work cause the workers will walk pass it and not help.
author: Kayden B.

description:
I went to San Francisco on a weekend trip and stopped at this Bubba Gump shrimp. 

I had the shrimper's net catch ( garlic ) and it was surprisingly filling and delicious. 

A pot with potatoes, two corns, and other veggies along with shrimp. 

I walked out satisfied and wanting to return. 

I didn't take a picture but the attached image is what it looks like.
author: Oscar D.

description: Food awesome been going their since I was a kid  now I'm 32 still going also my fav movie  always good great staff friendly service can't wait to go back
author: Bev A.

description: This is the worst managed restaurant I have been to. Serious logistical issues in basic tasks like managing and delivering orders. Not worth your time.
author: John M.

description:
Yojanes or Johaness/Giohaness? The host guy in the blue shirt was so kind! Our waiter had to go on his lunch but we were taken care of greatly! I totally forgot her name but she is from Chicago. She was fun! My first time here was awesome. My cousin got a surprise cupcake. The trivia game is a cute add on the experience of coming here. I will be back soon!

Please note, if you are on a low-sodium diet, this is not the place to come!!! Unless they can reduce salt or not at salt to the seafoods cause they are already from the sea... lol
author: Alessandra E.

description:
Delicious food, great staff and beautiful views of the bay, including Alcatraz. 
Bubba Gump is a popular spot in one of the busiest tourist spots at the end of Pier 39. Therefore calling in advance (specially on weekends) is a must to be put on the waiting list. Once on the list, they shoot you a text and you have 10 mins to get there. 
Once seated, you immediately see the beautiful ocean views and feel as if you're actually in the Bubba Gump movie. Little things such as signs saying "run forest, run" or "stop forest, stop" to get your waiter or waitresses attention are pretty cool. 
There is a selection of food options, the sampler and the fresh pot of shrimp catch are a must. 
Sometimes even the manager checks in to make sure everything is great. There are alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks as well that come with souvenir cups, they also validate an hour of parking for you. Highly recommend if you're in the area.
The reason I give it 4/5 is because the location is so busy that they don't really care for each individual customer individually. So they pass by and put things down quick and move on to the next customer.
author: Damien C.

description:
The real question is who hasn't seen Forrest Gump?!

It's one of my all time favorite movies! As this restaurant was inspired by the popular 1994 film Forrest Gump, it portrays bits from the movie as illustrated by the sitting bench outside, décor and food; all designed to remind you of that once beloved movie and character. 

Movie trivia from the waiters are especially fun! Although I 've seen the movie countless times, I usually get stumped by a couple questions. "Me and Jenny goes together like peas and carrots."

When at Bubba Gump, Forrest (waiters) would recommend the bubba shrimp or a daily special. Cajun shrimp and calamari are always tasty. I usually get the Seafood Feast and fish & Chips. To add, I usually go with a clam chowder also. By no means is it embarrassing to be hunched back, belly up, because one ate an excessive amount of fried foods and became bloated from so much beer. Don't even talk about exercise now! lol 

Their specials are also considerable items. To name, Coconut Shrimp and bucket of Boat Trash is also worth trying. Frankly, I just come here to get full off of shrimp! I know this may sound super unhealthy, but when I have a cheat day, it usually contains fried food. XD
Wow, I'm kind of getting hungry just talking about all this seafood, but I'm in the mood for crab with butter and crab cakes at the moment.
 
I especially like this location when I'm lucky enough to get a table with a view. Waiters are super friendly and have a lot of background knowledge of the movie. Service can be awfully slow but ambience and décor make up for it whilst you're waiting for your order. 

My mantra when I'm here is to just pig out! 

Run, Forrest, Run! 
---------------
---------------
Overall rating: 8.5/10 great for the experience 
Water quality: 8/10 not too shabby
author: Andy L.

description:
Let's start off by I used the Yelp app to reserve/expedite my place in line with my boyfriend. Everyone has been telling me to try this place out Bc it's supposed to be an experience 

Boy lemme tell you

We got to the restaurant 2 minutes early before our estimated wait time. I showed the host the app and confirmation text message that we should be seated in the next 2 min. There were maybe 3 other parties ahead of us in the waiting walk way but I did not think much of it because we were approaching the dinner rush. 

We waited an additional 20 minutes to be seated... 

Not only that once we were seated we were not asked if we wanted any drinks or WATER for another 20 minutes. 

When our waitress asked if we wanted any starters
We made our orders and emphasized we'd like to have waters 

She impatiently nodded and rushed away 
I already knew she wasnt listening Bc she didn't repeat our orders

My man didn't want to wave anyone down, but being that we had planned to watch a movie later that evening I was not going to be treated like ghosts. 

I waved down 2 different servers besides the one assigned to us. None of them got us our waters and even told us that they are not our server. Like, there is a specific reason why I  waving down every single server that passes our table Bc it's blatantly clear that our assigned Server doesn't know how to be one.  On top of that, the other waiters treated us like we were a nuisance for just askin. For water. 
I don't want talk to the side of your face when I'm asking for something nor do I wanna see you explicitly rolling yalls eyes 

At this point we've spent an HOUR WAITING. Not eating or sipping on any sort of beverage. 

Our appetizer  comes out lukewarm and at this point I'm over it. How are you going to serve your customers room temperature food? Especially seafood ?! Thank god we ordered a salad in case something went sideways

By this time we got our cocktails which weren't anything special ( a mojito and hard lemonade )

Our appetizer, the hush puppy things were really salty. 


. 
I promptly asked where our food was to our ASSIGNED server and she said she'd go
Check like.. you just dropped off our appetizer 



Then we waited around 15-20 min longer for our main course

When the shrimp came out I only tasted probably 3-4 baby shrimps and they tasted like pre-frozen shrimp that got tossed in a generic spice bag w no salt. 

Our salad was the only memorable dish we had

We finished everything within 35 minutes Bc we were rushing at this point.

By the time I wave down a server for our check, we get our waters. 

Like, come on 

You seriously are going to serve your customers water at the END of their meal especially when they've been asking for water for the entirety of their dinner?

I will
NEVER
Go back to this establishment 

There should be no reason to stay at a restaurant for almost 2 hours and spending most of it waiting to be served 

And I will throughly tell people who are considering this restaurant to go somewhere else( I can recommend a handful of options )  or make your own bucket of shrimp at home.
author: Sun K.

description:
Came here for the first time the other night, it was pretty good. Wanted to come here for quite some time, the wait time was only about 4 to 5 minutes. When we got seated one of the waitress' came by to explain how the signs worked here, the blue sign that says "Run Forest Run" your table is okay but the red sign that says "Stop Forest Stop" is where your table needs something. Thought it was a cool idea. We ended up getting popcorn shrimp, hush puppies and the garlic bread (very toasted which was very good - - not a fan of soggy bread). Didn't have any food leftover. 

After we ordered another waitress came up and did a trivia game with us about the movie which was very cool. Got almost everything right besides for the last question she asked (didn't know the second half of the trivia question).
author: Magz K.

description: I've been to other Bubba Gump restaurants before that were fantastic, but this one was absolutely terrible! The service was great but the food was hideous! I tried to order the shrimp Mac and cheese as an appetizer but they were out, as a substitute I ordered the popcorn shrimp which tasted soggy and disgusting. As the main dish I order the soup and salad, with claim chowder and a garden salad with honey mustard dressing. The clam chowder was really good but the salad was bland, no flavor, hardly any dressing, and the croutons were stale. How can you screw up a simple salad?
author: Landon B.

description: Service was good and the prices are reasonable!! Had the Forrest seafood feast and it was really good!
author: Robert R.

description:
We were excited to come to this one, having visited so many.  Reception was sweet and f5ill of info.  The gal that brought us to our table was beautiful and kind and wonderful.  Our waitress, Cely, was typical - pleasant, but not beyond that. 

After a while she explained the signs needed to signal her (We forgot) and made our order.  Hubby and I chatted and then wondered where our food was. So we signaled for our waitress And another waitress came.  We asked where our meal was.  They didn't know.  But they went to find it.  When it came, it wasn't warm nor hot. Bordering cold.  We were hungry and started eating ... the manager came and spoke with us. She was very kind, asked if we wanted it fresh - we declined as we were now running short on time.  She apologized and comp'ed our dessert. It was delicious! 

Although we would have preferred hot food, she made it much better just with her acknowledging the issue and promising it won't happen again. 

You're welcome.  When you go, you'll get hot food!!
author: Cindy C.

description: I would actually give 0 stars!!! First time at this restaurant and last. First off it was so hot and uncomfortable in this restaurant. It took forever to get our food. Then once we got it I thought it looked good but bit into my shrimp skewer and noticed it tasted funny so I spit it out and realized it was raw!!! I inspected all of the shrimp and it was all raw. We showed the manager and h agreed that it was not cooked and took down my information then had the "head cook" come and talk to us to apologize and said "next time you come in we will set you quickly etc. ridiculous!! There will be no next time. So they basically didn't charge for my plate but that was it we should have gotten our entire meal for free. Horrible experience. Do not eat here!!!!!
author: Monica R.

description: Best restaurant for Shrimp lovers. Appetizers sampler is good one to start and with a Caronarita Original is good here. If you are lucky you might get Beautiful view of Alcatraz Island and Golden Gate Bridge.
author: Aditya B.

description: Horrible service, 22 minutes before server came to our table!   Another 47 minutes before our meal came!  No sense of urgency!  Never again.....
author: Edward G.

description: I'm in-love with this restaurant ever since I started eating here. Their food is just exceptional and service is fast and good. At one point I also love how they throw you questions about bubba gump's long before stories and history. Tho its hard to get a seat right away but I don't care with the long wait tho sometimes when you're on the waiting list they've been a little forgetful on who to call next and and it'll be mixed up. But on a lighter note it's really delightful to eat here esp when you try to order all their "shrimp" dish! Man its  a bomb! Their mahi-mahi is just so good too!  Bubba Gump is just a place to be. Servers are fast and very accommodating!
author: Mel A.

description: While it gets kind of loud in this restaurant, the atmosphere is fun and the food is excellent. Staff are pleasant and attentive. Lots of cool pictures and memorabilia from the "Forrest Gump" film. It's gets crazy-busy so reservations are an absolute must, especially on weekends.
author: K K.

description: Came here for my birthday yesterday since shrimp was one of my favorite foods and it was great! Bubba humps is usually just average but the day I went was great I had the shrimp lover basket I spouted it with my brother And it was great I really enjoyed it! Defiantly coming back next year.
author: Alex P.

description: One of the many stops from our road trip from San Francisco to LA. We dropped in for a meal before we did the Alcatraz tour. This location is above the water looking out into the ocean. Where we sat, we could see Alcatraz. Our server was friendly and attentive. Our food was good but the portion was, massive. Unfortunately, we didn't finish our entrees and the server did not ask if we would like to take it to go. My problem was, as a tourist, I saw many homeless people on the streets. As for these restaurants with so many leftovers, I could have given someone a meal for the day. It is a problem I noticed with most restaurants I visited in Cali. We both took home souvenir cups which we got along with our drinks. Mine did light up once upon a time. It's a must visit if you like Forrest Gump but either then that, nothing special.
author: Thanh N.

description: Not impressed at all from this place. Was just here with my gf and I got the shrimp mac and cheese and it was depressing! $12 for the smallest portion and the shrimp was not fresh at all which is weird since this place is literally over water. Tasted like it came from a big frozen bag of shrimp and they just warmed it up a little. My gf just got a kids grilled cheese which is one of the most simplest things to make and some how they messed that up also. It was a little burnt and very little cheese. It was more like a burnt piece of bread with a touch of cheese. Not to mention this was at 11am on Tuesday and we were like the only ones in this place just about and the food was horrible. Surprised they served us this food when it was that bad. Our waitress was pretty good tho which is why I'm putting 2 stars. Probably won't come back to this location much rather try any other seafood place in the area and have better food.
author: Cameron L.

description:
Nice place to visit but not worth the wait.  1.5 hours wait for fried food. My plate looked like they just threw the food on there. A little bit of fried stuff thrown on a plate. 
But that's what you get for a tourist area.
author: Kat G.

description: We went here and the service was a joke. Food was mediocre and we won't be going back.
author: Kaitlin H.

description:
Too fried, and too expensive.

At some point I used to work kind of close to this establishment, and the only reason i ended up actually visiting is:

1. There was no line.
2. My coworker offered to pay.

This place is a case study in marketing, and branding - not food.
Skip it.
author: Oleg H.

description: We had a poor experience today. Drinks took 40 minutes, and food a little over an hour. When we finally got our food, 4 out of the 7 dishes ordered were wrong or missing something. We tried to flag down our waitress, but she didn't come back until it was time for the check. She handed the check to my 14 year old daughter and ran off. Another employee came over and took our payment. We paid $120 for half of what we ordered. What we did receive was good though.
author: Derek C.

description: I was unable to sit down.  Checked in at 6:28 wait time 1 hrs. AFTER an hour and forty minutes I just left.
author: Lizbeth G.

description: So I've been here an hour already and JUST not got our drinks.. people with bigger groups(there's only 3 of us) that were seated after us have already gotten their food..
author: Andrea M.

description:
Lucky to have a nice view seated at a booth beside the window. Before ordering, I liked looking out at all the boats sailing by and the shimmering ocean waters as the night darkened. Waiter was superb. His service and character is definitely a 5 star. He was quite amusing to keep in theme with trivia. Few of the questions he asked were from the movie Forrest Gump. I was amused and happy to still remember some answers. The Seafood here is just okay. I think I would like to try other variety of dishes if ever returning here, which would actually be more unlikely, even if I wanted. So, first & last type of dining experience.

During dinner, the fried items were okay, but lacked flavor. Sauces were good and necessary. Just too many fried items felt overwhelming to me. 

I liked my Strawberry Speckled drink. Usually I prefer some sort of virgin Strawberry Lemonade type of drink at restaurants so I was happy with the that choice.

The items had were:
- Calmari
- Shrimp and Veggie Skewers
- Shrimper's Heaven
- "I'm Stuffed" Shrimp

Calamari: This was the appetizer of deep fried calamari with roasted red bell peppers and pepperocini. It comes with sauces.

Shrimp and Veggie Skewers: These 2 skewers of shrimp, red bell peppers, red onion, yellow squash, and zucchini were chargrilled and served on jasmine rice with lemon garlic cream sauce.

Shrimper's Heaven: Lots of people in the restaurant ordered this one. It piqued my interest. This comes in four shrimp varieties, which are hand breaded coconut shrimp, grilled shrimp, crisp golden shrimp and tempura shrimp. All of those are with fries and yummy sauces called Tangy Asian, Cajun Marmalade, and Zesty Cocktail.

"I'm Stuffed" Shrimp: Originally when I read the description, I was interested upon reading shrimp and crab, but it wasn't that appetizing. So, pass on this in the future. This is shrimp with crab stuffing baked in garlic butter, topped with Monterey Jack Cheese, then served around jasmine rice which is in the middle. Plus a piece of bread.

Mostly food was average. I liked the sauces with Shrimper's Heaven and the shrimp covered in coconut was good. People all around seemed to be having fun and the restaurant was pretty packed. They serve non-alcoholic and alcoholic drinks here like beer, wine, specialty drinks and margaritas. Definitely expect a wait time if you come here. It's fine with Pier 39 to walk around the pass the time or benches are nearby to sit and wait. If you're curious, try it.
author: Andrea S.

description: The servers were attentive and friendly however they tended to hover and check up on us more than necessary - always seemed to be when our mouths were full! The food was average - calamari was ok but the fish in the fish & chips were fried and flavorless. Won't be going into one of these again
author: Lo M.

description:
Waited for 2 hours outside, then they said no one told us to walk into the dining area. so confused. Mis cue between the Host and Server, and we got caught in the middle of everything and starving.

Server did his job and served us the food we ordered.
author: Lee R.

description:
Worst happy hours ever. Absolutely no alcohol in my cocktails . When I asked our server about it I was told that the alcohol is "really smooth" hence I can't taste it . You really shouldn't be trying to fool your customers this way. We aren't dumb. 
I don't even know how their regular menu is and I don't want to find out. 
Really disappointed and never going back .
author: Natasha P.

description: I went to Bubba Gump Shrimp with a small of group of 5. We were seated in a reasonable amount of time; however, our ordered food had a mix up and ended up arriving an hour later. We were incredibly disappointed with the service, including our server who checked on us at most twice during our 2 hour visit. Our food was sent to another table (seated after us) and by then the rest of my table's food had already been delivered so I ended up watching them eat waiting for my food. The only reason they got a single star is because the clam chowder was ok, everything else is sorely underwhelming and tarnished Bubba Gump's legacy.
author: Erica R.

description: Ordered the Seafood Trio. The fish didn't taste right I got sick later.  A whole row of tables were about ten feet away but a had a better view.  I asked three times for one of those tables and was refused.  Less than ten minutes later she was seating people there.  Poor food and poor service.  Nowhere near the quality normally found at the other BubbaGump restaurants.
author: Robert H.

description:
We were seated in a corner table and it was a little congested for 10 of us on the couch so we needed extra chairs. Service was a bit slow, but the food was regular seafood restaurant taste, nice. We had appetizer sampler, popcorn shirmp, seafood hush pups, shrimp salsa (which was bomb), mahi mahi, new orleans, scampi. The portion sizes were huge.

The drinks came out in regular glasses when we were expecting the disco light ones, but the waiter was sweet and gave them to us anyway...
author: Aishwarya G.

description: Terrible place. The food regular to bad. The prices outrageous bearing in mind the quality of the food. I'm never going back.
author: Jimena M.

description:
Heard a lot of great things about this place and was finally excited I made it down to SF to try it out.
Couldn't find much on the menu that interests me (not a huge fish fan,but I love SHRIMP). I settled with the Traditional Shrimp Cocktail ($15). NOT quite what I expected, very small and not the type of cocktail I expected. It taste like regular ol shrimp. Nothing unique, something I could have whipped up at home. Our server was Taylor, she was very nice and attentive. We won't be coming back. Didn't get a draft beer for the souvenir after all.
author: Adrianna M.

description:
I usually can always trust Bubba Gump for a good fun meal when out in a touristy area... and this time was no different. While visiting the SF area we headed to Peir 39 for some eats. We had a big group with some kids so we picked Bubba Gump for its variety on the menu.

We expected a wait of about 30-40 being a Saturday at 3:00. They told us 45 but ended up getting sat in about 20 mins. Whooo hoo! Our host was great, he got us a big table for our group with an awesome view of the SF Bay. We could see boats coming and going, huge container ship passing by in addition to the views of the city and Alcatraz island. 

Our server was pretty good too. We had our bill split with no problems. Food came out in a reasonable time considering the place was packed. There was a Dodgers vs Giants game on so the it was pretty lively there. She did the normal Forest Gump movie trivia, and turned the difficulty level up a notch when we told her we had been to Bubba Gump's before. It was fun. 

I had the fried shrimp - always a reliable plate. Lots of golden shrimp and fries. Others had the New Orleans shrimp which always looks amazing - a hint of spice in there for those who like a little kick. Another great option if you arent looking for shrimp is the fried chicken. I have had this many times too - very good and filling. My favorite beverage to get is the Gerogia Peach Iced Tea. So refreshing.

They took good care of us and our large group. Great job by the management all around. I kept noticing them scurrying around to see if everything was being attended too and to fill in tables.

 Ill keep coming back for the good food and service.
author: John E.

description:
Bumba gump is pricey! But hey, what are you suppose to expect right?! Ocean view... San Fran. bay bridge in sight... 

Service was definitely great! We didn't have to wait for a table and our server was not pushy but timely. My tilapia was a little on the salty side, but the mashed potatoes complimented well.

My boyfriend says the food was "ok," drinks were good. 3/5 averages for both of us.
author: Desiree D.

description:
Long wait. Horrible service, food and management.
I went for my birthday and I was extremely disappointment.
Garlic bread should have fresh garlic and parsley, and not just using artificial spray. Regular margarita doesn't taste or look like normal margarita. Complaint about garlic bread to manager. Chef came to talk to me, and remade the bread which was no different than the first time.
Server had major attitude and unprofessional, and made too many mistake with the order. We had to ask 4-5 times for everything including plates, utensils, paper towel,  soda and more... When we sat down the table was dirty and sticky. We asked the waiter to clean it. Waiter opened one of the small wet tissue paper that is for hand instead of using the regular table towel to clean the table. I will Not recommend this place anymore. Poor customer service, low quality food, and bad management.  Spend your hard earned money somewhere else. Extremely upset because this experience ruined my birthday.
author: Sheila M.

description: We've been here before but I've never been so upset with them as I was this time. They missed our drinks, my two soups never came out, I had to fight to get them. The side salads didn't come out. I asked and I was given the biggest attitude. This was the first time a waitress rolled her eyes at me. Ok wrapping things up and I gave tHe waitress $220 for my check... she returns asking for my money! She left it somewhere and the manager found it. Now the manager was sweet and came to soothe us and comp some things but this was the worst meal I've had in a long time. I was too upset to actually enjoy the food. The manager was professional and i feel horrible for her that she has to deal with staff that'll roll their eyes.
author: Christie-Regina K.

description: this place is my new favorite spot in San Francisco ! I fell in love with the coconut shrimp and this mac and cheese which i cannot stop craving! I also love the movie Forest Gump! I cannot wait to go back and get some more of the coconut shrimp and mac and chesse! i also love how you can get seats right next to the window where you get a beautiful view of the ocean!
author: Ana C.

description: My family and I visited this place today for dinner after a walk on the Pier. They seated us promptly and handed us our drinks shortly. Our waiter was really kind and he made us feel comfortable. For the price, I expected to get a little more than what I was served, based on the photos on the menu. I got the mac and cheese with shrimp, which was delicious but again, it was such a small portion for the pretty hefty price. I got a taste of the fish and shrimp that my parents ordered, and it could have used a little more seasoning, so I mainly sticked to my mac and cheese. The view of the bay was gorgeous from where we sat. The bathrooms are decently clean and the place overall was as well.
author: Tara T.

description:
We waited 1 hour for our food after we ordered. We got our drinks and I ordered a Pepsi and it was out, just carbonated water and they still served it to me like that when obviously you can tell it's clear and not dark like Pepsi. They knew they kept messing up and taking long so they offered free garlic bread, we said yes. So at the end when we checked our receipt...guess what! They tried charging us for the garlic bread that they offered for free.
Please go eat someone else if you're just trying to spend good time at the pier do not waste your time here you will just be upset.
author: Chloe P.

description: This place is super overrated. However, let's start with the drinks. The strawberry mango chiller is a must try because there's Mountain Dew icee in it. It's more on the sweet side. The cups light up and you get to take it home! So we ordered the fish tacos (grilled and fried) and it wasn't all that. We ordered the net catch and it was not good at alll. The shrimp was the cheap tasting shrimp. The menu's picture definitely fooled us. The surf and turf was okay. The mac and cheese didn't really taste like mac n cheese. But let's start with why there's stars here. 1. for the drink! 2. For the service! And 3. Because the SEAFOOD FEAST was sooo worth it. The shrimp and fish with fries tasted so delicious! The little hush puppies were like corn bread. It was also so good. If you come here and don't want to be disappointed then get the seafood feast!!! I'll come back for that but that's about it.
author: Linda N.

description:
Been wanting Bubba's Shrimp co for years and I am VERY disappointed with our trip here. 

Apart from the hour long wait, the service was horrible. The staff put more effort into singing Happy birthday to people then actually doing there job. Our waitress did her very best to accommodate us but every other aspect was horrible. 

The shrimp came cold and our appatizer arrived as we were finishing our food. I took 20 minutes for a manager told finally speak with us. We were told that all week the kitchen has been having issues and they'd discount our meal. 

With that being said, 2 adults 3 kids and discount still tallied over $100.

This was so disappointing. Makes sense why the reviews are so bad.
author: RJ J.

description:
My food would've been great, cuz they were really workin' the entrees, but since they had grease smeared all along the outside of the containers (gross) and my food looked like it'd been thrown into the box (no love) I'm going to have to give this a "1"

Sorry guys
author: Kelly H.

description: Stopped in after hearing great things. Ordered the scrimp and macaroni cheese dish and was extremely salty where couldn't even finish the dish. There was barely any fish in theCaptain scrimp and fish dish. Fish was over battered to where most was a shell.
author: R B.

description: This restaurant served my pregnant wife literal crap. Her shrimp hadn't been cleaned properly and it wasn't even close. Took 10+ min to get this addressed, another 15 to get a new entree fired - by which time my plate had already been cleared. By time we were able to ask for the check it then took another 15 min to get that. Between the three meals, the best was chicken. How disappointing for a place known for shrimp. Went from being an item my wife was excited about to the lowlight of our trip.
author: Andrew J.

description: Our Girl Scout troop had the opportunity to participate in the San Francisco bridging event this past weekend and we ate here (a large group of 20). Our server was Caden, and he was amazing with all of our girls (adults too). Caden took time to recognize our girls requests and spoke to them as mini adults. I also observed other waiters and waitresses being so patient with everyone even though it was a bit chaotic with so many scouts and other guests dining. Thank you Caden for making our girls feel special!!!
author: Marie G.

description: My friends and I decided to try a different restaurant so we went here. I reserved a table on yelp. They called my table with in an hour. We came in sat down and order right away. The shrimps were small we thought it would be like boiling crab or something. Food wasn't there garlic shrimp was ok if they did it with actual minced garlic it would have been better. Hush puppies wasn't anything exciting. I don't think I'll go back for the food. Service was great though.
author: Cathy N.

description:
Came here for my birthday dinner with my boyfriend on a Friday night. Wait was about 45 mins which was not too bad for a Friday night. 
We started out with garlic bread which my boyfriend couldn't get enough of! He had a bacon cheeseburger since he doesn't really eat seafood and said it was really good. I had the net catch entree with garlic sauce which was absolutely DELICIOUS! and a Georgia peach iced tea which was perfect because I don't like the taste of too much alcohol. It was just the right amount. I love all the details in the restaurant about Forrest Gump, it is too cute. At the end of the meal we even got 2 souvenir cups to take home!
author: Lauren D.

description:
Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. is a restaurant chain that can be found on many touristy spots in the U.S. It's popular because of the Forest Gump movie theme and not because of the food. One dining experience here will prove to you why.

We received a free artichoke dip & chip appetizer from a Yelp Coupon by checking into Pier 39. The artichoke dip was disappointing because it arrived to our table at room temperature and had sections of it still cold, similar to the results of microwaving TV dinner brownies. The chips were also cold and some were stale. They gave us a second artichoke dip and the results were about the same.

As for my entrée, I ordered the veggie burger (to join in the spirit of eating veg with my vegetarian/vegan friends). The burger was large but the fries were less than expected. The burger was OK. It put something in my stomach.

The atmosphere is like eating at Chucky Cheese. It's very noisy and over-the-top festive. There were two birthdays that day so the staff was required to do their shouting routine. Overall, the atmosphere is more suitable for family with young kids.

Service is very slow. We waited 15-20 minutes only to process our bill. They also ran into technical issues when trying to use the appetizer coupon because of how we split the check.

The host was rude to us while my friend and I were waiting at a stand up table next to the restroom. She blatantly asked us to leave while another family was behind her waiting on us. It made us look like idiots.

Overall I would never come here again. It may be more suitable if you have kids and can't take them anywhere else.
author: Danny L.

description:
I wish I could leave no stars. I am only giving this place 1 star because I have to at least leave 1 star to leave a review. 

My boyfriend and I chose this as a lunch option while vacationing in the bay. We were looking for a restaurant that had a casual vibe, delicious seafood and was reasonably priced in the fisherman's warf area. Causal vibe- yes.... that's about the only thing good about this place besides being able to see the bay if seated near a window.  We asked our waitress for a drink suggestion and she mentioned the frozen margarita. We inquired about whether or not they would truly be a frozen margarita (she said yes) and took her up on her suggestion. The drinks arrived and they were far from frozen. They looked like "on the rocks" margaritas with chips of ice placed in them. We sent the drinks back and told her they were def not frozen. She then proceeded to tell us (after we had specifically had a convo about it) that the margarita machine had been broken for weeks and these were handmade with a blender. For $17 a drink- we expected to get what we asked for. ‍

Disappointed with the drinks, we decided to order soda instead and hoped that some delicious seafood would turn things around! WRONG! We asked for a recommendation on the food (same time as we asked about the drinks) and our server suggested "The Feast"- so we went with it. Apparently it's one of their most popular dishes. We placed our order... and waited...and waited.... annnnnddddd waiiiittteddd. Finally we saw our server coming with our "feast," which was everything that a feast is not. There was hardly any food. The food (shrimp, hush puppies) that was included was mostly fried batter and bland. The fries were terrible!

Please do not waste your time or your money here.  We were so bummed about the quality of your food and speed of service. We went straight to In and Out after we left- way better decision.
author: Lisa P.

description: If i could give this place 0 stars i would. To start out after we were seated in a less than half full restaurant we waited 10-15 min for a waitress that never came. I had to get up to ask someone for help. At that time we finally received help from someone that wasn't our waitress. Then my ribs were subpar. If you have never tried bubba gumps, don't start with this one. It is by far the worst and only one i haven't enjoyed in the 5 that i have been to with countless visits.
author: Cameron M.

description:
We ordered the Net Catch Entree - a bucket of shrimp with Cajun seasoning. It tasted so bland. The color of the food looked good but the taste was  like eating frozen shrimps. The look on my husband's face while eating it was just sad. I felt bad for him. 

So, this was our first visit and will also be our last. The staff were great but the food was just bad.

My daughter did like her cheese pizza, hence 1 star.
author: Mona C.

description: My son and I had a great time for dinner here. The atmosphere was awesome. Service a little slow. But, the I didn't care. The views was great. Food, my eyes were definitely were too big for my stomach! The key line cheesecake is a must have !
author: Tami F.

description: Very disappointed. I came here a few times in the past. They food quality went down. Staff were very friendly. I hope they get back to what they were doing.
author: waddah s.

description: This is one of my favorite places ever and I'm surprised that I haven't left a review yet. Even when this place is packed and busy, once you get seated, their service is still wonderful. It's helps that they have the sign you can flip to if you ever need help and someone will stop and help you. "Run Forest Run" if you don't need assistance and "Stop Forest Stop" if you do. Pretty simple lol. Even when the wait is long, I believe it's worth it. They take your number down and will text you when your name is close to being called and another text when it's your table's turn! So you can walk around the pier as you wait. I always order the lava flow. The taste of coconut is so delicious and it's so refreshing. Whoever I'm with always asks for a taste and they end up enjoying it more than the drink they order ;) I always always always order the bucket of boat trash. For over 10 years, that's what I've always gotten but they've changed it! I couldn't find it yesterday and they changed it for almost the same thing but instead of getting crab legs with it, you get deep fried lobster tail. So this one time, I went with the feast entree. Which my hubby has gotten so I knew I would enjoy it! I also love their run across America sampler. Perfect for sharing! Or if you're like me, you won't want to share. It's got wings, HUSH PUPPIES (favorite), shrimp cocktail, breaded shrimp, and spinach artichoke dip with chips. It's a little bit of everything, so there's something for everyone to enjoy. Sometimes, if they're not so busy. You're server will play a little game with you and another table and do a quiz on the movie! It's a pretty fun place. You just have to wait if you have a large party as they have to clear tables and move seats around. Again, worth it. And most of their drinks, you get take home souvenir cups! My hubby and I have a cabinet full lol.
author: Alexandra G.

description:
It's hard to get a seat overlooking the pier during the holidays on a busy day. However, we got lucky and got a seat by the pier. Our waiter was David and he was awesome. He's so friendly and nice. My grandma is from Taiwan so she thought it was weird that my sister was talking to him. She thought that the waiter was our friend or something haha 

The food wasn't all too great but my dad loves to eat at this place whenever he comes visit me. It was my grandma's first time in a long time so we took her to eat here. We got a variety of food so she could taste each one of them. She liked a specific dish that had mashed potatoes and soft fish. She thought the mashed potatoes was really yummy. Their speciality is shrimp so definitely try some kind of shrimp. The appetizer was alright, we got the mac and cheese shrimp and it was so tiny. We wanted to order more 'cause it was that good but we ordered a ton of food already. 

Shoutout to David, he's a great server and he was very attentive! When we were waiting to get our bill, my parents wanted to take a selfie of us three and David came back and said are we taking a selfie and he joined in on our selfie haha when we left, I remembered that we forgot to get my mum's souvenir cup so I came back and he came running towards me and said that we forgot our fish eye lense! I was so surprised he'd return it 'cause that's expensive and a lot of people would just take it since it was super small. I also told him that we forgot our souvenir cup and he went back and grabbed it for me.

Food was good but service was even better!
author: Sheila C.

description:
Will never visit this place again. Such a overhyped place for food. 

TASTELESS FOOD ....
SMALL PORTIONS ....
EXTREMELY HIGH PRICES ....

Service sucks. Kids menu came at the end of everyones else food. 
Jambalaya had rock hard pieces of shrimp. No flavor at all. 

This was my LAST VISIT EVER to this restaurant.
author: L M.

description:
Why were the customers sitting next to us so quite? That's because they were too busy enjoying their tasty meal! 
My meal+alcoholic drink was delicious (received souvenir glass), we had beautiful view of the Bay and great service from Chris, Erin, Patrick and Stephanie. I'll return and bring more ppl with me :) 
Oh! No waiting in line, reservations was easy to make. Bubba Gump Shrimp sends updated texts to inform you were you are at in line.
author: Regina D.

description: Worst service ever. Family and I took a trip to SF decided to eat at bubba Gump. We waited at least 15 min to order our food and drinks after being seated. I asked for a water 4 different times. A completely different waitress brought us our food I only got half my order and told them what was missing, they just walked away. Our waitress never came back to check on us. so I ended up canceling the whole thing. Take your money else where
author: Itzel S.

description:
Total waste of mines and my families time.  I took my sister here who is visiting from Houston, Tx.  The food here is basic nothing to write home about our server was named Gloria and she was inadequate.  Took forever to deliver my meal, forgot to bring missing items and was rude.  I'm not one to write a bunch of negative reviews but considering it wasn't very busy and for a 150.00 plus check for a party of 3 I expected better customer service.   
I definitely won't return~
author: Renaye B.

description: Worst service ever. Waited 30 minutes just to get water. Ask for help and the lady snapped  an attitude!
author: Natalie G.

description: The host made us wait for 15 min sitting on a side table, while a lot of new Customers were arriving and getting in front of us. I called the manager to complain and he said the host was wrong, yield and argue at him but did not gave us a table, so we had to start all over from the beginning of the waiting line. My wife did not want to wait as we felt we were very poorly treated so we left and went to a better place in the same pier 39 area. Very disappointing.
author: Lessandro A.

description: My all time favorite place to eat! Every time I am in the area I have to come here. My husband enjoys the fish and chips and I LOVE the shrimp New Orleans dish. It is perfect every time I go. I know the wait can be long sometimes but it is worth getting a Landry's card so you can get faster service.
author: June L.

description: Our visit was extremely disappointing! I'm not sure which was worse, the wait time, the food or the lack of service. We waited nearly two hours for a table. Luckily we did end up with a table that had a great view of the bridge. Our server Trent was nothing more than a bratty kd. He grumbled when I requested a kids menu for my ten year old, he was more interested in chatting with the other waitresses than processing our order. I watched him spill the ice from our cup and scoop it back up with his hands. I asked him for a new soda because I watched him use his hands to pick up dirty ice. He replied " uuh uuh I didn't so you don't need a new one". A few minutes later two of our food orders were brought out, then 15-20 minutes later the other 3 people in our party were served. The food was overpiced and not great. Overall, very dissatisfied.
author: Suzanne L.

description: I'll start off on a good note, our server was very sweet and funny.  Our frozen strawberry lemonades were amazing. My wife got the shrimp trio and loved it. I ordered the Cajun chicken sandwich, I think it was called something close to that, was gross! First off it was all bread, my chicken was no thinker than two pennies stuck together and all dark tendons inside.  There was no flavor! I was so disappointed. I ended up taking two bites and just eating my fries,  I had my server take away the plate, with a full sandwich.
author: Jon S.

description: Horrible service we checked in at 4:24 pm and are just now at 7:56 being notified that are table is ready.. we already went to another restaurant right around the corner ordered food and ate and are driving home the waiters were clueless and couldn't even tell me how long I was gonna wait but guessed it would be  20 minutes more.. I don't recommend eating there service is terrible!!!
author: Grace R.

description: I recently visited with family & upon arrival decided that a Bubba Gump Experience overseeing the San Fransisco Bay would be a great start. Unfortunately, I was wrong. To start off, their "strawberry lemonades" tasted more like water with a splash of flavored strawberry syrup. Secondly, it took 22 minutes for two beverages to arrive. Soon thereafter, we realized we did not have settings upon our food arriving. My younger sister ordered a kids pizza which was cold and did not taste the best. Oh, did I mention that the fries (her side) was non-existing when her food came in. Our waitress was not the most attentive as She was "covering" for another server and I am sure had other priority tables. It is safe to say that I will not be coming back. I had been here before with a large group of 50+ & we had a lackluster experience, but I figured I would give it another try. $70 later, it is safe to say that it was a huge MISTAKE! I asked to speak to the manager to thank her after the credit, but like the fries, she did not show up. It would have gotten one star, but since drinks were credited- it gets a second star. All in all, By now you can tell, this is not the place to go to in San Fransisco. Avoid it.
author: Jose Q.

description: If Forrest Gump and Bubba were real they would be a lil disappointed. Over 40mins to wait for our food and to even get a refill on drinks. I ordered a mixture of shrimp and some were not cooked/raw. First time here next time I hope it's not as bad
author: Fernando S.

description:
My wife and I chose BGS for fish and chips.  Food was great and the views of the bay were spectacular!

More importantly the service was top notch and every employee there that night had great attitudes!!  I really felt they appreciated me dining with them.  I commend the manager for putting together an "outstanding team".  

Thank you for making our experience on Pier 39 very positive!!

Steve
author: Steve S.

description: Came here with friends visiting from Canada! We made a reservation for 3:45 and were seated. It took 45 minutes to get drinks after we ordered food. It took 3 hours to get our food and they still forgot my child's food. French fries were cold and stale... corn was unseasoned and Unbuttered. Never received refills for drinks and the waiter disappeared. WORST EXPERIENCE EVER AND IT WAS AN OFF DAY ON THE PIER!! I'm appalled at the lack of service and general lack of care. Just all around a bad experience for a $180 almost $200 meal. Not worth it at all!!
author: Jessica K.

description: Stopped by on 7/23 in the afternoon.  When they messaged our phone that our table was ready, we still had to wait an additional 15 mins to be seated.  Once seated, no one greeted us.  We had to grab 3 different worker's attention before our actual Waiter came 15 mins after we sat.  She never apologized for the wait let alone greet us in a normal manner.  She proceeded to take our order. of appetizer & entrees.  While waiting w/ only water on our table, the tables next to us had finished & left w/ new customers being sat.  Somehow they all got their appetizers before us.  When we asked for the status of our order, she just said there's a delay. Shortly after, while still waiting on out appetizer, a Mgr happened to walk by.  We told him how our experience has been so far.  Soon after, our food comes out.  Looked nothing like the pictures in menu.  The portion was tiny for the price we paid.  This place sucks in every aspect.  Will never return!  Wasted 2 hours at this place when we could've enjoyed other experiences at the pier.
author: Minh S.

description: The server Veronica was awesome, very friendly and even challenged us with Forest Gump trivia.....Food was Deeelish and the cocktail was perfect.....We will be back
author: Roni J.

description: Wow!!!! So impressed. Nice place, nice view,, nice shrimps. I love this Bubba!!! I will be back to try more dishes. Shrimps Heaven was amazing.
author: Viktor K.

description: Best fried shrimp. Our plane was delayed so we shared a bucket of shrimp. Big meaty fresh shrimp. A must stop at puerta Vallarta airport
author: suzanne l.

description:
I came here when the restaurant first opened I think in 1998 I wasn't impressed never went back until my cousin who moved from Texas came here with his boyfriend when I saw the photos and I asked him since you been here 3 times obviously you must like the food he said yes. So my cousin and I and her son came here last Friday OMG it was bomb diggity the service was fantastic I love how they have the red and blue sign simple easy peasy red they help blue copacetic don't need no service we got Mama's Famous Chicken it was a little Bland but very good I actually took the other chicken home and ate it the next day.
My younger cousin said the shrimp was really good we ordered two chocolate cakes I'll end up taking a piece and a half and ate that for three days that was really good ordered I think it was a watermelon margarita with a shot beer whatever you want to call it, and got a souvenir glass the garlic bread wasn't impressed I've had better. Actually the dinner we ordered was $17.99 Each for Mama's famous chicken and $9.49 for each slice of cake which was really good $14.99 for the souvenir drink.
So if you looking for a really good yummy shrimp place besides the Red Lobster come check out this restaurant and if you're looking for a really good fried chicken it's really good but it is Bland. Thanks for Reading my Review of Bubba Gump restaurant!
~Lizzie~
author: Lizzie G.

description:
