There wasn't a crazy long wait to be seated. When we did finally sit, our waiter was extremely pleasant. He gave us pointers for where to go for brunch. He quizzed us with some Forrest Gump questions. The food was great and on time. He brought everything out quickly and it all looked amazing. I did think some of the food was a little pricey but it tasted great. 

The drinks were also delicious. Would try again.
author: Carmen C.

description: I had a really good experience here our server hesam was incredibly nice and charismatic.
author: Jessica D.

description: How should I begin. I have had very wonderful experiences with Bubba Gump. We have celebrated b-days and just regular get together with family and friends but all that changed today. I understand that on a busy day you must give the staff, specially the waiters all the credit in the world because they are working their butts off but I truly believe that taking your meal order-so that 50 other meal orders do not go before yours, must be a priority but apparently that is not the case. We had to wait to be seated 1:40 minutes and then we had to wait another 40 minutes on the ramp waiting to be seated and then our waiter lost our meal order. Unacceptable and I am at a loss for words. I can excuse certain mishaps but losing our meal order should never happen. Not sure who's fault it is but this is just wrong.
author: Brittny E.

description:
Fun place to eat. Nice views of the bay and Alcatraz island. It did not take long to get seated.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive. They do trivia about the Forest Gump movie at your table if you want.  We ordered the fish tacos, New Orleans shrimp with rice, kids Mac and cheese with salad, and a baked cookie with ice cream on top. We enjoyed our food and dining experience. I liked that the manager checked up on us. 
We enjoyed eating at this location.
author: Cheyenne P.

description: Rude and ignorant young workers. Me and my fiance got married and came to celebrate there...It was our first time there as well. Our waiter was annoying and kind of inappropriate towards us. The food was over priced and had small portion. The fried shrimp and hush puppies was good but everything else was gross.
author: Chiania V.

description: I am usually not a big fan of shrimp, but when I had it here it was really tasty. We got an appetizer and the dip for the chips was also amazing. It is at the end of "pier" and the actual restaurant is on the second floor (you have to take an outdoor escalator to get up). Their decor is cool too, because they have all these references to the Forrest Gump movie, and they even have the movie playing on replay on multiple screens around the restaurant. We also got dessert (which was "Chef's choice") and it was delicious, too. Customer service was very good, too. Very accommodating and friendly. I would recommend making a reservation ahead of time, though, just because it can get busy sometimes.
author: Justin L.

description: Must go for the shrimp lovers. Beautifully located at the pier 39. Loved the mango sparklers. But the place was very hot should have provisions for AC rooms.
author: Somnath K.

description: We came here for my daughter's birthday because she loves shrimp so we decided to visit Bubba Gump shrimp well in the SF area the wait time for a table was not bad at all and the service was very good however when the food came out it was a bit cold and even a little too salty that's why am only giving it three stars will it be a regular stop when we are in the city no but if you are celebrating a special occasion and of course if you do like seafood then I would definitely give Bubba Gump a try
author: Justine B.

description: I wish I could give this restaurant a zero star.  I recently arrived at this place after a wonderful night in San Francisco and on the pier.  Finally my girlfriend and I made it to the much anticipated Bubba Gump Shrimp.  We were rudely treated at the door.  We were told that it was a fifteen minute wait.  However the restaurant was 95% EMPTY!  I couldn't believe it.  I asked the man whether he was serious?  "The restaurant was nearly empty.  Why exactly am I waiting?  Your restaurant is empty," I said.  The man remained rude and had no logical explanation. So I walked away.  Under no circumstances would I allow this place to ridicule me by making me wait 15 minutes for no reason.  I can only assume the absence of patrons is a reflection of their horrible service.
author: Felix S.

description: This restaurant sits at the end of pier 39.  It is prime location with beautiful views.  But the kudos stop there.  We were there for a birthday lunch and had traveled from out of town.  We ordered wine.  Our lunch came out right away but they said there was a back up at the bar. It was not crowded!  We didn't even get our water which we desperately needed to eat the overly dry food!!!  The fries were actually chewy.  The service was poor.  It was not a good experience.  I would recommend eating at one of the other restaurants on the pier.
author: M M.

description: avoid. food poisioning and unable to leave my room in sanfrancisco for a day and a half.
author: Andrea S.

description: I love this place. The spicy net catch shrimp omg! I eat them until I feel sick. The drinks are great as well. It gets very crowded sometimes but it is a nice place with a good view. Servers are great, I only got a weird rude server once, I was shocked because they are all always so happy. Come try the shrimp!
author: Jenny D.

description: Really good drinks! Tried their Conoraita and Lava Flow! For food I had their Shrimp Shack Mac and Cheese, very delicious! Good customer service as well!
author: William H.

description: Still a great place to sit and eat. I do love the atmosphere and the view isn't bad. I dropped it one star because I was waiting for my birthday song and they never came buy =(
author: Dee R.

description: This used to be my go-to spot whenever I visit SF Pier 39. I took 10 students last month because they're never been. We waited an hour for cold food when the establishment didn't seem very busy. I returned yesterday with a colleague to give it one last chance and immediately regretted it. Where should I start... our table was filthy, we actually had to clean it ourselves. One waiter literally picked his nose then took plates out to serve. People around us who ordered the same simple happy hour menu food that arrived after we did we getting served before us. We would have never been served if we didn't complain. Then they brought our cold food out which had obviously been sitting somewhere. No apologies. From this point on, I'll take Jenny's advice and RUN...from this place.
author: Brett K.

description:
Ive been to Bubba Gumps in many cities, through the years.  This one was pretty much exactly what was expected, except for all the Irish!  Apparently the city of San Francisco is engaging in some kind of "Sister City" thing and almost all the employees were college students from Ireland, while the regular employees were working over there for the summer.  

Tons of fun, food was excellent, I passed the trivia (of course) and took home a lovely glass!
author: Kymberly G.

description: My family was starving and there was a wait of 45 min we were told BUT we waited maybe 30 which was really worth it. It was our first time at Buba Gumps the waiter were nice the food was GREAT and the view was AMAZING. When we flipped our sign for help we another waitress came over right away since our waiter was in the back. My whole family really enjoyed the food and service.. SHRIMP MAC AND CHEESE AMAZING...
author: MaynelnWeezy A.

description:
This is a one for service. We were told 45 min wait. At 45 minutes, we asked where we were in line. Come to find out they took two 100+ parties ahead from group sales. The hostess said that I could take the table in he bar that just opened up. Went in and sat down; another waiter came over and asked me to move with my two kids because a couple had been waiting longer at the bar. I can't sit "at" the bar with kids. But that couple could. So rude. 
What a disappointment for my kids
author: Keri W.

description: The wait time was ridiculous! Said 40 minutes and ended up being an hour and a half. The food is mediocre. Management needs to step up its efficiency game!
author: Hector R.

description: Growing up I came here a lot, and I remember my experiences being a lot different. I'm not sure if it's the new management or what... The person that greeted my boyfriend and I at the door was an older dude with a grey beard and he was very friendly and sweet. We got seats instantly at the bar (it was packed on a Sunday during playoffs) which we appreciated, however the bartenders ruined our experience. They were so stressed out and complained about everything. They had such an attitude about every little thing. They need training on how to keep their composure and professionalism... I bartend too and it does get very stressful but you need to know how to compose yourself. They were expressing all their feelings and drama in the restaurant in front of customers and yelling at the waitresses & bar backs, shoving each other, etc. it was very unprofessional. It was like an episode of jerry springer (I am not exaggerating) When we asked them to change the tv to the playoff game they gave such an attitude and put it on the tiniest screen at the bar. It wasn't the food that ruined my experience it was the bartenders
author: Korina B.

description: Awesome spot down in the middle of tourist country in the wharf. They have great views of the pacific from the restaurant and the wait staff did a good job of handling the rush that ensued after we had arrived. I couldn't figure out the seating at all in the beginning. We were greeted but then had to wait in this weirdly long line to be greeted by another host. I didn't mind but I just didn't understand the system. The food was good as well. I ended up just getting a burger which I know isn't what you go to this place for but it was still great and I thought a good bang for my buck.
author: Ben P.

description: Every time we're in SF, my fiance and I always come here. Used to drive down here with my good friend just to eat. On this visit, we were seated right away for dinner and had a wonderful server, Michael! He checked on us frequently and was super fun with the trivia questions. My fiance got the Run Across America sampler and I got my usual Shrimp New Orleans. The sampler comes with a variety of appetizers, great for sharing or as a meal. The Shrimp New Orleans has a kick but it's my go-to meal here. Can be pricey but that's the Pier for you. Only thing is - they have Pepsi instead of Coke and no Dr. Pepper either. Also just fyi, you can get an hour of parking for the garage validated in their gift shop after dining.
author: Traci Mae D.

description: Love the bubba humps in Monterey. So of course was excited  there was one on the wharf in S,F, horrible! Long wait with no one in the restaurant. Hostess was very rude. Will not go back.
author: Bernie K.

description:
I've been to a Bubba Gump's once before on the East Coast and had a good experience there, so I was hoping I would have a similar one at this location. Unfortunately, that wasn't the case... 

I ate lunch here with my boyfriend and his family while we were at Pier 39 and I ordered Bubba's After the Storm "Bucket of Boat Trash." I saw some reviews on Yelp recommending it, while others said it was a no-go. In the end, I still ordered it and boy did I regret it... I felt like it was nowhere worth the $22.99 that it was priced at. Do not be fooled by the appetizing picture I took! The shrimp and fish sticks tasted like they were like frozen food items that you could get at any grocery store. Their seasoned fries also tasted very dry and not appetizing at all. I enjoy fries from fast food places like Jack in the Box or Ruby's much more than the ones I received with my order at Bubba Gump's. The only thing I enjoyed was the crab legs which was hardly filling at all... I really did not enjoyedmy order at all and enjoyed my boyfriend's order of "...Of Course We Have Scampi!" much more. Perhaps if I ordered a different menu item my experience would have been much different. 

The service was also mediocre. Our server would constantly take dishes away from our table without even asking if we were finished with it, which was quite annoying. 

Overall, I don't think I would choose to eat here again since I find their food to be extremely overpriced for the quality and quantity they give you. There are much better things to eat at Pier 39 and I wish I chose to eat there instead.
author: Angela A.

description: Came here with my wife last night, the staff is very friendly and the view of the water on the pier is nice if you get sat next to the window. Food is way over priced and very small portions. We got the far out dip and added shrimp for an additional 1.50 and it came out with two shrimps chopped in half, really? I got the stuffed shrimps and my wife got a po boy sandwich, my plate was double the cost and half the size of her sandwich. The stuff po boy was very plain but a nice size. the stuffed shrimp tasted weird so I saved it for my dogs, it was 8 shrimp and a small scoop of rice. They only offer salt and pepper for seasoning and only their hot sauce which tasted like it was mostly vinegar. Definitely not worth going back
author: Miguel C.

description: Not what I expected. Didn't live up to the hype.... the food was mediocre and the service was below average, especially for the price!. Won't be returning.
author: A C.

description: I have been coming here for years and yesterday was the worst service I have ever received. It started with our drinks They forgot one of the babies drinks and name we had to ask for times where a Margarita was you said their machine broke they were makes me at my hands we received it 20 minutes later. We are to send back a Margarita twice because it just tasted like Margarita   Mix and ice. Where food came out  All of my party did not receive their food waiting 15 minutes after the rest of us got our food. When it came time to the  Bill we all had separate checks My bill being largest I gave the waitress to gift cards plus cash to cover the bill and the tip. She then comes back to me and says I'm $43 short because one of my gift cards didn't have that much . When I explained to her I check the gifts cards before handing them to her They had enough to cover the bill and I gave her cash to cover the rest she said I didn't have enough. We were in a rush to leave because we had to catch the ferry back Then she came up to me and said what she did was use one of my gift cards and paid for another party's meal at my table so she carried their remaining balance to what I have  left which made my balance now  $46. Because I didn't have time to deal with it there and we were late to our boat I Just pay the 46 and then left it'll be a long time before I go back to this place
author: Tiffany F.

description: I was hoping to have the same attention and atmosphere as in Monterey but I was completely wrong. The place is way too over crowded and the employees look  unhappy  and I received just that . No hello, no eye contact , just asked for my number to put me down in a wait list that failed . I waited over 35 min and happen to check my status and my  party had apparently been dropped with out my notice. I went up to the front desk and they couldn't explain what had happened but let my party go in to be seated. Service was OK. Except you had to wait a very  very  long time to get your food .  Oh and be aware of the seagulls outside in their waiting area they will shit on you.  I was a witness to it . It was crazy . Will not go back .
author: Olga M.

description: Went here once for dinner. This place is all about shrimp~ I tried their Fish & Chips. This place is right by the piers in the back. Nice view by the window.
author: Yennie L.

description: Bubba Gump SF its chain restaurant not much to say. Our server was extremely friendly and welcoming (Kin-G) ! Food was mediocre and medium warm but what we expected. $80 for 1 clam chowder , 2 entrees and 1 dessert.
author: Yvonne m.

description: It was an okay experience. Don't get me wrong, the view is AMAZIN' and food is delicious. I would say better service other than that it was good!
author: Jessica I.

description:
I enjoyed my "...Of Course We Have Scampi!" dish, and I can tell Bubba Gump's has the capacity of making really great dishes. However there is room for improvement.

The service was really good. Truthfully, I've been to a Bubba Gump's on the East Coast, and their service was so much better. However, that was mostly due to the fact that we went as a huge group of people, so it was probably treated like a special event. The service here was still good though. They ask you trivia from Forrest Gump (no prizes though). I also like how they're means of knowing when a table needs service is the flip sign. It the sign reads "Stop Forrest Stop", the waiters know to stop at the table to tend to your needs.

My dish was exceptional. Definitely on the expensive side but well-worth it. Eating seafood by the sea just seems so right. My girlfriend ordered the Bubba's After the Storm "Bucket of Boat Trash". Needless to say, she shared some with me, and I was shocked at the quality of the fish sticks. They were not on par with the rest of the dishes. They tasted like something from the cheap frozen section at your local 99 cents store. Other than that the dish was fine, but not worth the money. The bucket was also deceptive. It is NOT full, but rather, the components of the dish rest on top of a paper that sinks slightly into the bucket.

I believe that I would come back only because of the fact that it is a well known restaurant that provides good quality family fun. The food is great, but it itself is not the main attraction of this restaurant.
author: Jaime J.

description: Came here for my first Time, with my wife. Actually  the time we came was good not to busy. When we sat the host didn't even give us our menu. Then when the waitress came I don't remember her greeting us very friendly. Anyways we ordered the shrimp and fish platter, it was fulfilling. In the middle our meal the waitress went on her break and switch with another one. This second waitress was not that friendly also. My total first time experience would be a 3 out of 5. It's all good the view was gorgeous!!
author: Ben P.

description:
Loved the movie...but this restaurant, Eh...not so much.

We all get caught up in the nostalgia of Forrest Gump and good ole Lieutenant Dan but the movie is way better than the food.

Even if you bbq it, boil it, broil it, bake it, saute it...

Have it pan fried, deep fried, stir fried...

lol, its just not yummy.
author: Christopher K.

description: Long wait but was not crowded inside.  Ended up sitting at the bar and the drinks were not being filled to the top.  Added shrimp to our dip and it didn't have the shrimp. Un friendly staff. The fried shrimp appetizer was mainly fried peppers.  If you're going to get the far out dip you might as well get the sampler for the best bang for your buck.  Tourist trap for sure.
author: Amanda H.

description: Nice ambience and food is good too. Our server Rudy was cordial. Shrimp scampi, shaken shrimp with Mayan salsa, spinach artichoke dip and popcorn shrimp were yummy! Our drinks didn't come in the lighted glasses so when we asked our server he happily gave us the glasses. Will keep coming here when I'm at Pier 39 :-)
author: Sneha S.

description: Bad experience! My daughter and I waited for 45 minutes to get seated on a closed area... we waited like 20 minutes without any servers stopping to take our orders down or check in. I saw a manager walk by, made her aware of what was going on. She let us know we got sat in a closed area & she moved us to another table with a cool view. Waited another 10 minutes to have our drinks/orders taken of course the food was great. But I will not be coming back. You are better off buying seafood outside on the pier!!!
author: Alejandra A.

description:
Service was super slow when I went. We sat at the open bar area during happy hour. Took about 30 minutes to get our food which was only fish tacos, sliders, and onion rings...

Waiters did not come to check on us frequently even tho we had the sign to let them know we needed assistance or wanted to order.

Food was pretty good and priced cheap for the happy hour. The happy hour tequilla was a bit diluted though.
author: Elijah B.

description:
I love love love the movie Forrest Gump, I have probably seen the movie close to a hundred times. So somehow that obligates me to come to Bubba Gump Shrimp Co 1-2 times a year. I get nostalgic with all the Forrest Gump memorabilia and decorations on the wall. 

I always order the "I'm Stuffed" Shrimp, it consists of shrimp stuffed with crab baked in garlic butter. I have eaten it many many times and I have never been disappointed by it despite its high price point. The Caesar salad is dismal though because the lettuce is wilted and yellow. It's honestly seen better days...

If possible, try to get a table next to the window because it overlooks the water. I like that the servers here do the trivia game too but I just wish that they gave away small little prizes if you answer all the questions correctly. Bubba Gump Shrimp Co is probably a 4/5 in terms of tourist trap in the Fisherman's Wharf, but it's nice to be a tourist sometimes in your own city!
author: Philip M.

description:
The food was good and the server was great!

Note:  I used Yelp to get on the waitlist - it was not an ideal experience when we arrived.  I recommend checking in with the hostess often (if you have to wait).
author: Lesa W.

description: Loved the meals and the cocktails. The view was great at sunset and the wait staff are friendly and helpful.
author: Grace G.

description: You would Think that a restaurant that specializes in shrimp would have been using quality shrimp. The shrimp i got in my salad literally smelled like a portable toilet and were chewy and gross. This place also has a dirty vibe. Probably would never go back.
author: Madison K.

description: The atmosphere was nice except for the loud noise in the restaurant from people talking and the music. The service from them was very bad one person took our drink order and then came back with that and then took our food order and brought back our appetizer and then the wait time for our food took forever.  Also the person that took our order came to see how things were and to also introduce us to the person that was going to take over because she was getting ready to go home.  We waited a very long time for our food to come and when it did I did not get what I ordered so they took it back and had to wait another 30 minutes or so and I was so mad that I lost my appetite and the waitress said that she would have the manage come over and talk to us but he didn't.  By the time I got my food it was burnt and I wasn't going to eat it.  Then when the bill came they charged us for the item I did order and the item I didn't order but they took it off the bill and just charged for my brother dinner.  Will not go back there for a while
author: Roxanne S.

description: Always love this restaurant, food is always great . Server was wonderful .. got there a little late but still welcomed. Don't forget to tip your servers well,,. Remember they only get a portion as it is split between host/hostesses and bussers...
author: Queen A.

description: Best food - best service - we love our waiter (Jeff) and the manager Charlotte-thank you Charlotte for the Shrimp Shack MAC and Cheese!! And thank you Jeff for excellent service! I'll be going back to Salt Lake City with a happy belly and a happy family!
author: Tonya B.

description: TRASH!!! Horrible, not worth it at all. The shrimps are very small & taste very bland & unfresh. Ordered the shrimp mac & cheese as an appetizer & there were only three tiny pieces of shrimp & the mac & cheese was very dry & greasy, not creamy at all. For our entrees, we ordered the net catch & the stuffed shrimp. Both tasted store bought & were not worth the price. The bill came out to $83 & we ended up leaving over half of the food because of the poor quality. The hype is not what it seems, you are better off eating somewhere else at Pier 39 or eating at one of the other places on the Wharf. Bubba Gump is TERRIBLE! Was expecting yummy, fresh seafood but got overcooked, bad tasting, low quality shrimp instead.
author: Priscilla J.

description: Pretty awful experience.. was told the wait time would be 25 minutes and didn't get a text until about 2 hours later when we were already on our way home.
author: Brittany H.

description:
First time here and there was a crack in the beer glass so the manager kirk gave free appetizer which was only 1 kind. Was allergic to it so asked to credit bill instead and discounted only $10 after swallowing a piece of glass! Making sure i dont come back here ever again!!

After posting a review on our experience, Mara from corporate contacted us and made things right. Went back today and the manager Marsha took care of us. Thank you
author: Anita C.

description:
2 Sars.. 

We were told the wait would be an hour but waited for a little over 2. We decided to ask the host how long it would be since they kept calling names, turns out they totally skipped over our name so they just sent us in... to another line.   So we waited there for about another 20 minutes. 
Finally got a seat with an awesome view, which is one of the best things about this place. 
We could see the sun setting & Alcatraz island. 
Service was very quick considering they were pretty busy, which was another positive. 

About the food... Bacon potato bites were an amazing appetizer, and that's about it. 
Our food was NOT good at all. 
My girlfriend had the Bourbon Mahi Mahi which was extremely dry even with the dressing, and the portions were TINY!! Maybe 3-4 bites each. 
I had the #1 "Fan Favorite" which was the Forest Feast, it came with breaded shrimp, fish, hush puppies & fries. Again, the portions were very small but you get a lot of fries. The breading was way too much & also a little burnt. 
It just was not good food, I've had better Fish & Chips at Big Boys. 

So, If you're going out with a bunch of friends & just want to socialize with a great view & fast service, then it's a decent place. If you are looking for quality seafood, go anywhere else.
author: Jason D.

description: While I generally like Bubba Gump's, this one at Pier 39 was ok.  San Francisco has extra taxes passed on to consumers which drive up an already inflated menu price.  Food was ok but certainly not worth the prices we paid - $80 for 2 people for lunch and no liquor was involved.  I expect to get dinged a little but this was just a bit over the top for "pub grub" type food.  I had dinner for 3 people at the Ferry Building and it wasn't as expensive.  2 out of 5 stars.
author: Jerry V.

description: GREAT PLACE for shrimp, but be warned: this is not cheap food! This is a place for going with family and friends--not really a place for an intimate date for two, unless you're looking for a fun atmosphere. The seafood is absolutely fresh and soooooooo tasty. I got the Shrimper's Heaven, which had grilled shrimp, tempura shrimp, golden battered shrimp, and coconut shrimp, and I was not disappointed. Each one was unique tasting (not just a fried taste) and came with fries and was very filling. Even the fries were pretty good! But this place is NOT cheap, so I'd say save this for special occasions with friends and family or if you feel like having good quality shrimp. Also is really loud so might not be a best first date venue.
author: Erin-Ashley M.

description:
We were at Pier 33 today for another event. At lunch time we walked over to Pier 39 and the Bubba Gump location over there.

Not my first time at Bubba Gump. I have been to this location and to the one in Anaheim. Food is not bad, but clearly chain food.

I am not a fan of the hoopla and the prices are really too high for what it is. Bubba Gumps will do in a pinch as you know what to expect. However, I don't go out of my way to visit this place.
author: David M.

description: Life's like a box of chocolate.... you never know whatcha gunna get.......   in a way I can refer bubba Gumps  to that line.  The first time was  amazing! The second was ok! This latest visit was five stars. Will say one thing, fish lovers? Gets your self some bubba gumps shrimp!
author: Chris K.

description: Had a great time here. The wait was 20 minutes for party of 4. Which wasn't to bad considering the location. Our table was great! We had a great view of Alcatraz and the Pier. Our server Earl was Awesome! Very attentive and friendly, he made us laugh. Played Bubba Gump Trivia while waiting for our food. Food was great as well! Great experience! Be sure to bring your parking ticket so they can validate in the Bubba Gift shop!
author: Gia Z.

description: We love bubba gump in Santa Monica. Being a LSC VIP member, they treat us so great every single time we visit bubba in Santa Monica. Here at fishermans warf, we didn't get the VIP treatment. Drinks came our fairly fast. Food took 45 minutes! Just 2 dishes! Manager usually always checks on us when we visit Santa Monica. Here, it just wasn't all there. I absolutely love bubba gump. I will not let this experience ruin it for us! But I am a general store manager at a restaurant as well and there was absolutely no sense of urgency here today. And today is my birthday. Disappointed in today's service. Improvement is expected.
author: Khatherine P.

description: Wait time for us was said to be 50-60 minutes. We were informed that our table was ready for us to be seated, but when we got there had to wait another 30 minutes just to sit down at our table that they still had to put together. Food was good, but service was slow and unorganized.
author: David H.

description: I already knew food was not great here but decided to visit the location to enjoy the views of Pier 39.  Service was good but not great.  I would probably rate three stars  tops.  My rating has more to do with the 5% surcharge they add to your bill.  Don't get me wrong, I totally understand that this location is probably more expensive and they need to adjust pricing accordingly; however, the customer SHOUL NOT find out about this when they get their bill.  The restaurant should be upfront about it and not just add it at the end.  NOT COOL!
author: Jorge G.

description: Very good food . Recommend checking in to be seated :) although they were busy we got our food pretty fast. Everything was delicious , amazing view ! & great waitress & host .
author: Gabby L.

description: Really Mediocre food. Love the vibe and the atmosphere of the place as well as the cheesiness when coming to the movie Forest Gump. Food was just eh for a place super famous. More of a novelty eat and way more expensive than need be. The server we had was awesome though. Super nice, funny and engaging. Food was priced pretty high for just basic food.
author: Navdeep D.

description:
From start to finish this was a great experience. The staff above all was great and even when our original waitress had to change shift our new waiter took over and continued with great service. Our drinks were refilled and our food arrived in good time. 
We ordered the Shrimpers Net Catch and Mamma Gumps Garlic Bread for appetizers. It tasted delicious and went well together. I ordered the Net Catch Entree with the secret Cajun sauce. It was similar to the Shrimpers Net Catch appetizer except it had sausage, potatoes, carrots, and celery. I didn't care for the potatoes, celery, or carrots but the sausage and shrimp were good and that's what I really wanted to eat anyway. Everyone else enjoyed their food as well. 
Be prepared for some Forrest Gump trivia courtesy of your waiter or waitress.
author: Jenny A.

description:
My husband and I are seriously disappointed. We are traveling and decided to try out Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. cool looking place, lots of cool memorabilia and decor, nice view of pier, great service (not including one incident), and horrible food that made us both ill. 

First of all, the peel & eat shrimp appetizer is complete false advertisement. That alone is not acceptable. They show a huge pot of jumbo shrimp in reality it's a teeny-tiny pot of farm-raised tiny soft shelled (which makes them hard to peel) shrimp. The seasoning was good, but seriously disappointed. 

Secondly, my husband's fish sandwich & fries..boring, bland, looked like a chicken sandwich from
McDonald's except McDonald's fries actually have flavor and a crunch to them. Everything about this did was bland.

Thirdly, my Caesar salad was cruddy, worst restaurant salad I'd ever had. And the gumbo had way too much of ONE spice, overpowering and wasn't traditional at all.

Most importantly, my husband and I were totally ill afterwards. We both got sick. We shared the gumbo, so it had to be that. 

Got a 1 star for good service & cool decor, and because that's the lowest I could give. Sorry, but not happy.
author: Amber M.

description: They told us we were going to wait 30 to 45 minutes we only waited 10 minutes it was very delicious we had a great time. Even though they are busy they tend to you provide great customer service.
author: Main P.

description:
Went here for Mother's Day and it was pretty packed. We came here right at 5:15pm and our wait was 45 min according to the paper they give you. They were running a little behind so we waited another 15 min. After they called us, you still wait in another line to get seated! Wow! The restaurant is pretty huge so it seats a lot of folks. I wish we could have gotten the window seats to see the view as it was not foggy this time. =) We sat down and I saw a couple of tables empty but still with dirty dishes from previous customers. A little unorganized to me. =(   Staff was friendly though.

All the drinks we ordered were good. We got the drinks where you keep the glasses. We ordered:

Crab stuffed mushrooms was good.

Garlic bread - was buttered garlic flavored but not worth $5.50.

Seafood pasta - It was cooked pretty well with lots of sauce and it was tasty. I thought it was bigger with more seafood for $20?

Lt Dan's tilapia with lobster sauce - this was good. The fish was cooked just right with a little crispness on the edges. The mashed potatoes was freshly mashed real red potatoes but the only thing it was lacking more lobster sauce! I wouldn't price this dish at $20?

Bourbon mahi mahi - had no flavor...the prawns were shrimp! Lol Hella small! $20 though?

Salmon with veggies - was dry and no flavor. The veggies were aldante! Not worth it.

My son got a burger  with BBQ sauce but it was more bun then burger. The fries were good. 

I think the place is more touristy than anything and the dishes were overpriced as well as the drinks. My rating would have been a little less than three stars. This was my second time here and I will have to be in a good mood to wait for my meal or have a little extra cash to spend. =)
author: Edna G.

description: Long wait for table, mediocre service, clam chowder was disappointing. Great view of Alcatraz but that is kind of the only highlight of the restaurant.
author: Vanessa M.

description: Food was good but the wait was not acceptable.  We waited 2 hours and there were empty tables to be seen throughout.  They messed up our seating four times and let others go before us.  Not an issue for the adults as we ordered appetizers and drinks from the bar.  But the kids wanted certain meals we could not order them.  This was my 4th visit to this establishment and worse experience ever.  The kids ended up going next door for pizza instead.
author: Craig H.

description:
The wait was over 40 minutes and the place was completely EMPTY! Rude careless host service. We weren't even offered to wait at the bar, which was as well empty. 
This place isn't what it used to be. 
The food isn't worth the money and the service started to be disappointing.
author: Ramona S. E.

description:
Good food but not mind blowing. Sorta pricey for what it's worth. 
Good service. 
Wait time for dinner can be LONG (about 1 hr minimum)... Luckily, we put our names on the wait list and got seated quickly. 
Restrooms are ok. One door doesn't lock in women's restroom.
Great view if you're seated next to the window!
Interior design is nice.
author: Cici Y.

description: Not my first time here, probably not my last.  I was here on Sunday and this place was a zoo.  I had to sit at the bar.  The bar tender kept getting our order wrong, but once I got my food, all was well.  I probably will not be coming here on a holiday weekend again.
author: Beatriz R.

description: I gave them by 3.5 stars. I like this restaurant but a little expensive with their quantity. However those tastes should be good for visitors and families without much more salty taste. In addition this restaurant is located on very good place at pier 39 San Francisco so we can enjoy eating, drinking and buying stuff as well. Prices may be effected by location cost unfortunately.
author: Fumitaka N.

description: Eh the food was just eh... I wish I got up and left but I couldn't ... You see my date was really sensitive he might just get devasted and  maybe cry on the spot ... Jk but he had a rough day .. He wanted seafood we came because it was our last day in San Fransisco and I was stoked to go back to San Diego .. But the food was just right on the price the flavor was there on the appetizer but I wanted the Cajun one but in the big size without veggies idk they just made it seem like it's hard to have no veggies just wanted shrimp and I don't mind paying extra but I just felt like wow!! Even my food life is difficult .. The guy at the bar forgot our rice so I think he felt bad and not charged us. So we order more rice the girl came and said oh you already have your rice.? I said yea I we order a second one and that rice in your hand is ours she made a big deal and said they forgot to add it on ur check I was like okay well add it and give us our rice . This girl took the rice to ask the other server to make sure why he didn't add it .. I was like really it's 2$ rice get over yourself .. But guess servers job ... I think they just need more employees.. not really a fan of them I wanted to try their food I tried it and not consider coming back
author: Myrna R.

description: Food was delicious as expected from Bubba Gump Shrimp. I ordered the clam chowder. There was a 35 - 40 minute wait but it was well worth the view looking out into the bay directly in front of the Alcatraz prison.
author: Rosario R.

description:
Really great place for a sunset view with reservations we still had to wait in a "reservation line" 

Food was delicious but service was slow
author: Mikaela B.

description: THIS PLACE IS TRASH! I came here with a coupon I received from the California welcome center at Pier 39 stating I can have a free appetizer. When we ordered our waiter told us we had to buy two entrées for our coupon to be valid, so we got a chowder bowl(which he said would work) so when the check comes by they informed us that our $10 appetizer (that THEY chose for us because we couldn't pick our own) could not be used with our meal that we had chosen. Now we have to pay for this extra chowder bowl we didn't even want and extra for this supposedly free appetizer. We go and talk to the manager and tell him our issue. This person was so unprofessional I have any idea how he was placed manager, he treated us as if we didn't matter. Showed no concern over our issue and honestly didn't even want to deal with it. My boyfriend had said "I'm sorry I'm not trying to be a piece of shit" and this mother fucker had the nerve to say "Well that's kinda what it is". Lol we're never coming back here again ‍
author: Alexx S.

description:
Decided to check out Bubba Gump's because I felt it was important to educate myself on both the local and tourist experience the great city of San Francisco had to offer. Maybe I'd find a hidden gem? Haha, nah. 

Bubba Gump's is the kind of place that's probably never going to read this review because they don't care and don't need positive word of mouth to continue staying in business. With that said, the meal I had was very "meets expectations."

My friends and I went all out and ordered drinks and apps to start. I would actually highly recommend the strawberry mango frozen lemonade. Unfortunately, you can't opt out of the souvenir glass to save yourself a buck or two. I really liked it though! So if you actually WANT a souvenir glass, then it sounds like a no brainer. As for our appetizer, we were starving, so we ordered the Run Across America Sampler which included chips and dip, cocktail shrimp, chicken strips, hush puppies, and fried shrimp. Everything in there was good enough.

For my actual meal, I had the Bubba's After The Storm "Bucket Of Boat Trash" which included more fried shrimp, some fish strips. Again, everything was very standard.

While the food was all edible, nothing was particularly "delicious" and was of course overpriced due to it being a tourist chain.

Would I come back? Nah. Would I recommend going? Sure, but maybe just once to say you've done it.
author: Charles L.

description: Been here twice and it has never dissapointed me in service and the shrimp! If you like, you should consider giving a visit. PS: the pint glasses are cool, get one.
author: Benjamin B.

description: Went to Bubba Gump's Saturday June 9th. It started off awesome with the host Jose. His Hospitality was such a delight to be greeted with a warm and friendly smile and a positive attitude. We did not have to wait longer than stated. We ate our food which was delicious. They seem to be pretty busy. Luckily we had for our busser Larry. Our plates were clear cleared right away and our drinks were refilled even though I'm sure that's not his job. Without Jose and Larry I don't know what our experience would of been like. I'm so thankful for them two gentleman. They made our trip from Sacramento amazing. I will be coming back soon thanks guys for all your amazing service. Keep up the good work..
author: Tanya B.

description: I wish I knew our servers name. We went here at the last minute and were seated at a great table by the windows. I ordered two mango mojitos because they are SOOO GOOD. I had fish and chips, my friends had plain mojitos, rum n coke, chicken strips and boiled sauteed shrimp. Everything was really tasty and our server checked on us often even when didnt have our "stop forest stop" sign up! I like the atmosphere, the drinks and the food so I will definitely be back.
author: Wenn C.

description:
The sign says it's at the end of the pier but if you're not paying attention, you might not find it right away, like I didn't, haha.  Anyway you'll find it upstairs from the player sports bar and grill. 

See if you can get seated on the far side of the restaurant; it has a nice view of Alcatraz island. 

Typical bubba gump chain restaurant, but with a view.  Actual reason I ate here was to validate a bunch of parking tickets hehehehe. Had the chowder and house salad. 

Service was good - this place gets PACKED for lunch. Prob because of previously mentioned view...and maybe cuz everywhere gets packed at lunch here.  Prob harder to get a nice view table if you come late tho so if you want that view, heat the rush. 

Parking - park at the pier 39 structure and get an hour validated parking at this restaurant...you get two hours after 6pm.
author: Jay B.

description: Delicious food with cute entertainment ))) nice big portions , friendly stuff . The only downside very long waiting time but it's totally worth it !
author: Jessica J.

description: DO NOT BOOK YOUR EVENT HERE! First they promised a private room, then when the some of our party guests show up early by a half hour, they had no idea or record we had reserved anything, only after consulting with about four people they said the room wasn't ready yet. When we arrived with the person who's birthday it was same thing, except this time they said we didn't reserve a room, but even then we asked where we would have our event (we paid nearly two thousand dollars for two hours, A large portion in ADVANCE!!) they brought us to the regular seating area, how are we supposed to put 30+ people at a bunch of spread out tables mixed in next to other diners on two different levels ( not drastically different heights, but a few feet higher) The food was already supposed to be ready or at least set aside to be warmed or cooked as we went over the menu and picked in advance, but it took nearly an hour to get anything, it was all just frozen food recooked in the first place I could have made better food with a toaster oven and a $2.00 yellow box of gortons fish sticks WITH FREEZER BURN from foodsco. Or food4less. It was awful, all of it. From the tiny portions to the old stale bread buns for the hamburger that had cold fries with about one teaspoons worth of two sauces I couldn't eat more than 7 fries and I had to get some drinks..... I thought.... bar was full of untrained underpaid (Not the cooks or the servers faults it's the scummy dude who owns these chain of corporate chow shacks who was quoted as saying he doesn't need to pay more than min wage to his workers and definitely no benefits, that's why they get min wage so they can pay for their own health care!!) not enough employees and there are two event coordinators at this location(one that is rude unprofessional greedy and a liar. And one who's nice and respectful and seems like a decent person. Bottom line DO NOT BOOK EVENTS HERE. If you have to go here make sure that you DO tip the underpaid staff, I'm sure as bad as our party was for us, they had to come back there the next day, at least I'll never have to! P.s. they closed the rainforest cafe which we originally booked and were told one week before event they were sorry but will be closing FOREVER a few days before our event was to happen and we already gave a non refundable deposit!!! My son was absolutely heartbroken!! He had a look on his face like all the endangered fake animals and hundreds of real fish died in an instant (ELEPHANT INCLUDED) the way these "slum lords of the restaurant business" operate I'll bet they either left all the real fish to die or they ended up on our plates at BuBba chumps!!?!?? Omgarsh ZERO STARS!
author: Me W.

description: I loved it here! Prices are reasonable and the customer service was amazing. Also got to take home a souvenir cup that came with my drink!
author: Linda V.

description:
My fiancé and I took his brother here a week ago. And I have to say I was very very disappointed. I ordered my burger well done and it was really pink inside. My sons mac and cheese was served in the bag I am assuming they microwaved it in. And my younger son didn't eat his food so we usually take it with us. I asked our waiter for a box he came back to the table 5 minutes later grabbed our dishes and my sons food thru it away then brought us the box. 

It wasn't too busy we got a table right away, but it was very loud in there. 

The one bright side is that they did remove his food off our bill. Since the waiter thru it away.
author: Lisa L.

description:
My experience here was definitely the worst part of my trip.  The only good things I'll say is on a Friday night around 6:30 there was no wait for a table, the place was practically empty oddly enough, and my mango mojito was delicious.

Everything else was bad. The food was way over seasoned that the only thing I could taste was their cajun flavor, it didn't matter if I was eating shrimp or a potato because I couldn't tell the difference. The service was THE WORST. First, the waiter did not introduce himself so I don't even have his name for reference, but he acted like he was annoyed he was at work at all. He forgot my water all together (also he didn't understand my Philly accent of "wooder" and made me say "water" which I thought was beyond idiotic-this is a tourist spot, I'm sure my accent was easier to understand than others), and he forgot to put my salad in to come out before my entree, so after waiting and waiting I mentioned it to him and he said he'd fix it and then everything still came out together. When I asked for the manager she was less than helpful and looked like she was probably 20 years old and had zero experience in the industry. 

The ONLY reason I'm giving this place two stars instead of one is because the waiter tried to salvage the meal with some Forrest Gump trivia which my boyfriend appreciated.  Bottom line-there are so many restaurants in San Fran, save your money and taste buds and go somewhere else.
author: Brittany C.

description: Great location with awesome views of the Bay and Alcatraz! Staff was ok until the waiter! The waiter was awesome and very knowledgeable! Quizzed is on the Forest Gump movie! Very entertaining! Food was great, I had the fried chicken and my wife had fried shrimp! Again was food was excellent!
author: Kyle K.

description: Meal was okay but service was well, without reservation told wait was 3hrs but I could sit at the bar. Wait to actually be served was terrible.Waited forever for my ticket to pay too!!!
author: Steve T.

description: Well, I can say I'll never go there again! I'm sorry but when u say that the wait time is an hour to  an hour and a half, And your still waiting to be seated 2 hours later is pretty ridiculous. But ok,  We were seated now 2 hours and 5 mins later. Let's have a great time! Well After we were served our drinks and appetizers, Our waitress asked us if we were going to want desserts. We were confused, We haven't even had our dinner yet! well an hour after being seated I was about to go crazy! I asked the waitress, Where's our food??? and she looked confused. I've told her well we had our drinks and appetizers? Manager came over, And they apologized and took our drinks of the menu. But Where is the trivia questions??? I mean come on! really. Not happy!! We were celebrating my daughter birthday and this place made it bad! Never again!
author: Cec J.

description: I specifically checked in a d told the greater my son is in a wheelchair and I reminded him of that when we were paged to be seated he told us to walk up the ramp with the wheelchair. I asked him if he was sure? After waiting for 20 minutes we were told we'd need to walk back down the ramp(completely full of other guest waiting to be seated)to be accommodated in the proper seating. Not very considerate or helpful in  remedying the situation.
author: C E.

description: Nice looking spot, food wasn't good. Plain chicken sandwich. Jambalaya was risotto-style, over-saturated with spices.
author: Felipe S.

description:
Went there on a Friday night to kill time while waiting to pick up our daughter from prom..have never been to Bubba Gump's despite numerous opportunities at various locations. Greeter was friendly and said it would be a 30-45 minute wait, would received a text so no worries..haven't been to pier 39 in ages. Walked around bunch, of other food options available at the moment but really wanted to try Bubba Gump's. Got summoned back via text around 30 minutes, checked in with the greeter..was instructed to go up the ramp behind another party..fun concept. Stood at the top of the ramp while making eye contact with different staff members..no smiles or anything. Finally greeted with a "for two?"..grabbed two menus and led down to our table...were left in her dust,had to slow down because the floors were pretty SLICK...afraid to lose traction and SLIP. Was greeted by someone with a smile saying that he was going to clear a table real quick and be right back to take our orders..opened up the menu and was greeted by another server..had to ask her what she just said was rather soft spoken but realized later that she was either really tired or had something else on board..really sluggish. Gumbo was good, battered fish was crumbly..glad I did'nt ask for more tartar sauce..had cramps and the runs later. 
Felt reprimanded by an older server in a tied dye shirt because we flipped over the "stop forrest stop" license plate not knowing that it meant we needed attendance from any staff..was told to kindly flip it over after he told us what it was for..yikes. I think this is my first Yelp review ever..rather disappointed with overall experience..this is Pier 39 after all, realize it is a restaurant chain but come on now...might have been a long day for the staff but this is a Friday night..no one smiling except for the greeter and the young man who told us he would be back to take our orders. 
-Food...nothing spectacular, gumbo was good.
-Service...seemed disconnected.
-cleanliness...the floor was really slick...went to the restroom after being seated for a while.. took another route same thing, restroom..thank God for the hand drier...the floor would have been littered with paper towels bec the trash needed to be emptied.
-Disappointed
author: Roger S.

description: The staff is super friendly but they are overwhelmed and therefore the food and the service was pretty bad. I wouldn't go here again especially if you're with kids.
author: Rifftide S.

description:
Sunday was our 2nd visit to BG. First time they texted us when we would be ready to be seated. So we walked around outside. When the text came we were seated right away. Waiter came and told us about the signs at the table. I don't remember what I ordered but I know it had shrimp. This time it was quiet and we only had to wait in line for a few minutes. I ordered the Pear and Berry salad which was so good I ate it all before my friend finished his meal. The waiters were very attentive and I got some of my answers wrong though I thought I remember everything. 
I don't understand the negative posts. Maybe they are just really picky or had bad days. Though we love going to Hard Rock to eat, we will be back again here.
author: J E.

description: Horrible customer service, on a Wednesday afternoon  when it was not busy, I had to wait for 25 minutes for a side of butter, management was nothing but disappointment,  to make things worst they claim to validate my parking, the staff sent me to the gift shop to get my ticket validated and when I went to pay for parking they charged me full price , so basically they didn't validate nothing... negative -5 stars
author: Keeping It Real G.

description: Did not take my girlfriend's allergies seriously, we had a reaction.
author: Ryan A.

description:
Seriously, people.. this restaurant is famous only because of the movie. Food for tourists - bad and expensive. The food is awful, super expensive, small portions, not tasty at all. 1h wait for a table. 1/4 of a pound of Shrimp, 5 fried fish fillets, french fries and 2 glasses of cheap wine - $70
Never again.
author: Bruna D.

description: Would  not recommend this place to nobody it sucked food was cold waited for 1 hour even though restaurant was half empty they said that they didn't have enough servers but a lot of workers walking around
author: Eno H.

description: My husband and I are out here traveling for the first time in San Francisco for my birthday. This is also our first visit at a Bubba Gump restaurant ever. We waited about 40min to be seated which was fine that just made us think this place must be great! We were so wrong about that. The clam chowder was horrible and tasteless. We flipped our sign to share it w our server Imani but 15min went by and still nothing.We couldnt even enjoy the food we ordered, and I had to get up to tell one of the buser about our experience and that we needed a manager and she just said " just leave it there then" still no manager and I finally seen the no duty manager and shared with her our experience she said "Im sorry" and just walked away didn't even let us respond!!!!  Even after telling manager we still waited for server to come give us the check! We spend over 60$ and left so unsatisfied. We will never visit this place and will share this with our friends and family. I have never wrote a negative review or any at all. However this ruined my day and bday and Bubba Gump needs to know what horrible service they are provide here.
author: Monica A.

description:
My mom and I come to Bubba Gump's in San Fransisco once a year for my birthday, it's an annual thing for her and I. We have always loved this place!!! Everything we've had over the years has always been spot on delicious!! Love the view, the crew and the decor! 

This trip we were sitting at a table by the windows with a fantastic view! Our server did a good job, she did misunderstand what my mom ordered, but still what she ended up with was delicious. 
I give kuddos to the hostess, she had two customers be very rude to her then demand to be sat at a round table for 10 when they were a party of two, as she tried to explain the table was for a party that was going to be seated soon the lady told her she didn't care that she wants that table and she's there first! The hostess was so kind and patient. These two women were disgustingly rude and loud and Bubba Gump's handled it very well and professional
author: Tina D.

description:
This location is always busy. It is in a tourist spot so be prepared for a long wait.

We put our names down & then wandered the Pier since they told us about 45 minutes.

When they called our names, we were put on the ramp inside for someone to seat us. Our host & server were AWESOME! Super friendly & attentive!

They have these place cards on the table that you use to get your waiters attention. The blue card states "RUN Forest RUN" which means all is good but if you want to get your waiter's attention, you flip to the red place card that states "STOP Forest STOP." Love that idea! Although we didn't need to use it because our service was SUPERB!

I ordered a Mojito which came with a voucher that gave me a glass I could keep as a souvenir, SUPER COOL! You redeem the glass at their gift shop located right outside the restaurant.

I don't necessarily do burgers, since it's the consistency but I decided why not? & I was feeling adventurous. I should've just not. 

I ordered the Veggie Mushroom Burger which was a mushroom burger with pepper jack cheese, RAW red onions, avocado, spring mix and remoulade sauce. Served with fries.
The burger was good..... but again, it's a texture thing for me. I only ate half, if that. The red onion being raw was meh. I'm sure the burger was good but I'm just a picky person -_-

Other than that, it was good.
author: Camille C.

description: Service was sub par. The calamari had more pepperoncinis than actual calamari.  Then the main dishes came out before our other appetizer. Then had to ask 3 times for silverware to even eat our main dish. The grilled trio shrimp was cold and didn't taste fully cooked. There are other restaurants on the Pier that would provide better food.
author: Devin M.

description:
Not for me...came on a Friday night with a group of 5 in my party and got seated right away. Puts a thought into my head on a Friday night, why isn't anyone here? One of the waiters spilled a drink behind me and didn't even apologize or offer napkins? The drink got all over my feet.

Food was mediocre. Seriously...I could fry a box of frozen shrimp from Costco and it be impeccable fresh and HOT. 

Bubba Gumps, not my cup of tea.
author: Chris L.

description: Their drinks are so good. The servers are nice and also very friendly. Did I mention their food??? I am just so in love with the Grilled Trio. I would definitely come back again when I have chance to visit SF again.
author: Vanny P.

description:
I don't eat seafood but my lady said her trio plate was delicious. My cheeseburger was ok, nothing special but I wasn't expecting anything fancy anyway. 

Service was great and the view we had was awesome.
author: Realz T.

description:
Went there with a couple of friends when they were visiting. They loved shrimp and so I took them there. It was my first visit. 

Service was good. They have a way of making sure you don't have to chase after a waitress. They have a sign you can flip on the table that will get their attention.  Trouble was that even with the sign it took a while sometimes to get waitress attention. But. It too bad. 

Good food quality and lots of it. We all liked our food. I had a mixed shrimp meal that I liked a lot, although I was a bit disappointed in the grilled shrimp. I thought it was overlooked. 

The prices were a bit too high for the quality of the food but not too bad.
author: Barzin S.

description: While I realize the pier in SF is always busy, my family and I had made a reservation on yelp to hold our place in line. Once we got there, we waited at least an additional 20 minutes, only to then be escorted to yet another waiting area for a table. I know now that they were understaffed, but the severe lack of communication to the patrons made our entire party quite frustrated. Once we did get our seats, the service was mediocre, basically ignoring the sign "stop and go" policy which usually guarantees quick service, and witnessed at least a few meals drop to the floor while staff members simply laughed it off. I've been to Bubba Gump's multiple times in other states and like I said, I realize the wharf is a completely different world, but this service was inexcusable.
author: Allison F.

description: Never again will I never again patronize this establishment. It went from bad to horrible. We arrived 15 minutes before our reservation time & were told it would be a 3 hour wait. After discussing the issue of reservations & minimal wait we asked for the manager. Within 15 minutes we were seated & never saw the manager. Our food was delivered cold & skimpy. One child's meal was delivered after everyone was done eating. This was not my 1st visit but it is my last.
author: Monique S.

description: Food came quickly and the atmosphere was fun. Our server was very nice. Only downside was that the tables are placed so closely together it was hard to get in and out of my seat. The view of Alcatraz from out seat was super cool, though. Shrimp bucket appetizer was SO good. I had the clam chowder as my meal which was also gold...not spectacular, but good. Would definitely visit again.
author: Lindsay C.

description: Our server Luna was alright and so was the food. When we got sat it took almost 10 minutes to be greeted, my friends ordered their drinks and I ordered the premium bloody Mary. A different server came and dropped off the drinks a few minutes later and I automatically told that server my drink was wrong they gave me the regular bloody Mary. He said he will tell my server, as to which he did not. I didn't see my server again till our food came out 15 minutes later. When I finally got to tell her she then apologized and went to get the right drink. From where I was sitting I could see the bar and watched that bloody Mary sit till I was finished with my food the only thing the bartender did was put a shrimp on the drink and sent it back. I paid $14 for a watered down well drink and a half frozen shrimp, not acceptable! As for my meal I  ordered the shrimp scampi and had asked if I could get cajun seasoning in it, server said sure but it didn't come out Cajun. She didn't stay around long enough for me to even get her attention to say anything, she checked up on us at the end of the meal and asked if my meal had Cajun, I said  no but there's no point now cuz I'm full. As for the appetizer we we got after our meals we were told it is because that appetizer takes forever to make. Ok great ring in the appetizer first then wait a few minutes before ringing in the meal or put a hold on the meal itself. The server checked on us twice throughout the whole dinning experience the attentiveness was extremely poor! I get it, it's bubba gumps u shouldn't expect excellent customer service, but spending what we did I expected a bit more...
author: Kayla B.

description: Every since I was a kid whenever I think about Pier 39, this is the location that pops up to my head mainly because I've always really loved this restaurant because shrimp is my favorite seafood so an entire restaurant based off of a really good plot point of a movie which is completely based on shrimp is a complete selling point to me. The vibe you gain from this location in particularly special since it's directly on top of a pier which brings a special vibe to the restaurant while overlooking the bay from your seat. The food is great and it's always my go to sit down restaurant while I'm at the pier.
author: John S.

description: We visited Bubba Gump Shrimp San Francisco this week and I will never eat there again. The food was so greasy and had no flavor. on the ride home from the restaurant two of the three people got sick on the side of the road. This was an extremely overpriced meal that was like a cheap TV dinner. I would not recommend this place to anyone. BEYOND DISAPPOINTED.
author: Dave D.

description: Our server was nice and you can have an awesome bay view if you get seated in the right spot but that's all about I have to say about this place. We had the shrimp cocktail, seafood trio, and grilled shimp po boy, all of which were ok...small in portion. This place is just another hyped chain.
author: Mariah R.

description:
I want to give this place an extra star for nostalgia factor, but it really is a 3-star restaurant. It's a bro-filled touristy place you'll find in many major tourist cities, but damn it if I haven't had a great time every time I've been here. With friends, family, we all just put ourselves in the right mood, go with the flow, and we have fun, genuine fun. 

The food has never been great, however when I first started going almost 20 years ago it was definitely better than it is now. Not surprising, we're talking a chain that knows where to put its money. People aren't going there for gourmet meals. The prices are on the higher side for the quality, but again, you pay for tourist places. Don't go there looking for a good deal, go there looking to have fun and eat mediocre food.

The servers have always been friendly with us. Maybe it's forced, maybe they just hire friendly people, who knows. Either way, they do a great job serving us while entertaining us with Forrest Gump facts and other little games. 

I recently noticed that somewhere along the line they went from having several tvs all over showing Forrest Gump to only one tiny almost unnoticeable one in the waiting area. Less props and costumes from the movie are found hanging in glass cases. But that's what happens in these kind of places. The more they expand the cheaper they get. I still have a good time there. Also, if you're looking for souvenir crap to buy they definitely have you covered! Everything from the light up glass your drink came in to prawn magnets to a full scale selection of various types of clothing. Honestly, it's better than an I heart SF tshirt.
author: Shannon H.

description:
What a great place, Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. Based off of the cultural sensation Forrest Gump, the place offers great Cajun cuisine in a lively environment.

My group was greeted somewhat promptly but to find out - we had to wait 30 minutes to get a table! I had previously expected a wait with the popularity on this touristy pier but not this long! This definitely brought down a star from me.

We finally got our table in the timeframe requested and noticed the wide variety of decorations from Forrest Gump. It was pretty cool how we could flip license plates to indicate if we needed attention (Stop Forrest Stop, Run Forrest Run). Our waiter was extremely generous and welcoming, offering suggestions for our group and providing loads of information about each dish!

While patiently waiting for our glorious dishes, some waiters around us announced that a customer  was celebrating their birthday and asked us to cheer! This just added to the lively environment, everyone seemed excited and ecstatic. We also noticed that the view was spectacular, although dark the Bay Bridge shined so well with the night sky. 

Finally, the food. When it arrived we were completely stunned! The fries, shrimp, and fish I had were absolutely glorious in every way as they had their own spice and were perfectly cooked. They had the right amount of salt, fat, and flavor as a whole! The best Cajun food I've ever had!

This is a must-go place to chomp on if you ever visit San Francisco! This chain can only be found in mainly coastal cities and although it's on the expensive side the atmosphere (and view) makes up for it! This is truly an unforgettable experience one should never miss!

TL;DR:

Pros:
-Great atmosphere
-The view!!
-Utterly amazing food

Cons:
-Long time to wait
-On the pricey side

Final Rating:
-A regretful but reasonable/justifiable FOUR STARS
author: Edmund Z.

description:
So, apparently I wasn't the only one who complained about the clam chowder last time. Last time it was bland as hell & had no clams whatsoever in it. Waitress then replied that it was a "clam base" huh??!?! 
Anyway, my Fiance' decided to order it again ( 2 yrs later mind u ) and what a difference!! It was very tasty! Actually had clams in it & flavor!! Very good! So happy to see they improved on the chowdah!! :)
author: Jaime W.

description: Three star exactly. Average food plus a bit high price is totally understandable. The waitress gave me a 5 questions quest and I got A+
author: Xiaoou M.

description:
You can't compare this to the Bubba Gump's in Hawaii, but it's conveniently located on the Pier amongst all the shops. On a Sunday, around 11-12, no crowds and the food came out quickly. Spent about $80 on fried food (*cringe*), but it's the experience you're paying for. 

I wouldn't go here, just to go here. I would go here because you want to see the shops, because you want to eat the mini-doughnuts after, because there's an NFL shop a couple of stores down, because you have to pass a merri-go-round to get there.
author: Rochelle B.

description:
We went here as laundry select members for my birthday.  I called ahead of time to ask about parking validation.  The person told me that Bubba validated for 2 hours.  We decided to go to eat there.  When we arrived, we confirmed with the front of house person that they validated for 2 hours and he said yes.  

We stayed. Ate there. Food was decent. Server was okay. A little awkward, but nothing crazy.  We took our time and finished in about an hour. 

We paid using my birthday reward from laundry and paid the difference wish credit.  and then went to the retail store to validate. They told us they could only validate one hour!!

We asked to speak with a manager and she couldn't give us credit on our meal or any validation for the extra hour.  She said the policy changed, but they haven't trained all their staff on the new rules, which is why people gave us wrong info. We asked if there was anything they could do (ex. Comp for next meal). She asked another manager and they talked for a long time while we waited and she said no. She said cuz we paid already they couldn't give us anything back. We left really upset. Not going back here. Ruined my bday dinner night!!!
author: Okapi C.

description: Food was good for a hungry guy :) Line management was also fine. Cool "Gump" movie athmosphere.
author: Oleg A.

description: Great food, friendly service & fun system with the "run Forrest" or "stop Forrest" plates!
author: Kimberly K.

description:
We went in on a Friday night and expected this place to be busy of course.  It was supposed to be a 45-50 minutes wait, so we went and walked around the pier.  Since the recite said that we were supposed to be called in by 7:40, we decided to head back and sit nearby incase they called us.  

When 7:30 came around, one of the girls asked me what my name was again, because she saw me nearby.  When it came to 7:45, I asked her how much longer, and she said that I was the next to be called, and it shouldn't take more than 10 minutes.  I decided to use the restroom since it was near the entrance, and when I came back out, she basically knew my name by now and grabbed me for a quick second, telling me that it'll probably be another 10 minutes.  

When my name was finally called, I can tell that they wanted to take care of my group right away and sent me and my group to another route where we didn't have to wait in line on ramp with the other people whose names had already been called.  Once we were there, some of the workers nearby assured us that our table was in the process of being cleaned and that we were going to get a table by the window.  I can tell that they cared a lot about us, which was nice.  

Overall, the service was great and the food was delicious.  Everybody was happy with their meals.  Even though we had to wait an extra 20-30 minutes, I can tell that they wanted to keep me happy by always updating me.  We will definitely go back again!
author: Samantha L.

description:
First time
Experience here at the restaurant 
Awesome experience just wanted to check out the fuss so not so sure if every bubba is packed well this location I understand so many tourists our wait was only 15 minutes we sat down and our waitress was very friendly and gave us some first time tips .
Looked into the menu and had to try the shrimp lovers heaven (can't remember the name) well they have different shrimp which I'm so into very delicious meal had to check this place off my bucket list 

Excellent food
 can be pricey 

Had a good time I'm glad I experience the Forest Gump experience  "Life is like a box of chocolates
author: Nina S.

description: It's sadness me to write this review.  I live in the Bay Area and I go to Pier 39 often. Bubba Gump was one of my favorite places where I could just sit back relax and enjoy my food. I liked the fun and crazy atmosphere. Even though it was always so busy,  I didn't mind waiting in line for 30 plus minutes. The staff was always so welcoming and full of energy. They always seemed to care about their customers. But this time around I had the complete opposite experience. The staff as well as the food was not the greatest. Staff didn't bother to check in, even when we had the sign up that indicated we needed service. They almost seemed bothered that we had to call out for them. They talked amongst each other about personal issues and spoke extremely poorly when joking around. The food was different this time around. I order the bucket of seafood. The shrimp was dry and the clam chowder taste like if it was out of the can :( Our order was also incorrect the first time around so on top of the hour wait we had to wait longer for out food. I would like to visit other locations in hopes to have a different experience.
author: Cristina M.

description: Came in for dinner. Waited to be seated for 10 minuets. 2/3 of the restaurant was empty, but the hostess was standing near us, turned away and kept ignoring us, even after a few attempts to call for attention.  Not used for this kind of service. Shame.
author: Vofka S.

description: I'm gonna give it 2 stars for a great view and fairly good food but they lose 3 stars for ridiculous prices on average tasting food and highly disappointing service. Expected much for my buck that's for sure.
author: Service Seeker L.

description: Good food...Great service. Even though it was busy we only waited 15 minutes. The best view to eat seafood!!
author: Cesar P.

description:
Got the stuffed shrimp with crab and rice!!! Beyond amazing!
Portion looked small but it did fill me up or maybe it was the margaritas!

Came on a sat night and it was an hour before closing and service seemed a bit slow! 
Our server was nice but food took awhile to come out!
author: Brittany C.

description:
I hate myself for this because I LOVE Forest Gump.

I love the general idea of Bubba Gump. I really do. I've watched Forest Gump a million times and it's great to finally be able to go to a place just dedicated to this amazing film, but I was let down.
Everyone who worked there seemed like they hated their jobs maybe even their lives, but the whole tactics of "run forest run" and "stop forest stop" is so cute to catch a servers attention.
I wasn't so crazy about food either. My favorite part of the meal was the Net Catch in Garlic Butter squeezed with lemon. But the Trio plate is a no go. I couldn't have cared less for anything on the plate aside from the mahi mahi. And everything was able to be overpriced in the basis of the cinematic connection....
author: Abby L.

description:
Bubba gump is kinda that place you go to @ pier 39. Everything from shrimp, lobster but I opt for chicken sandwich. Boy was it good. 

Service was good. 

Don't forget you have a job "stop forest stop!" Run forest run run. No wait @ 11pm. Sat right away.
author: Rose B.

description: This place is so awesome! I love coming down here before a giants game and watching a little bit of Forrest Gump and having a little trivia with the waiters and waitresses. The all-American burger is very delicious! If you ask me or if you want to try agood burger order that and you will be so delighted you did! The menu is full of great food and great alcoholic beverages as well as appetizers and yes the waiters and waitresses quiz you on the movie just to kill time but hey that's a lot of fun then sitting there twiddling your thumbs waiting for your food...especially if you've seen the movie you can try to outsmart them!
author: Addison M.

description: We stopped in for lunch on a Sunday.  The restaurant was full but not packed and they didn't seem busy.  We were seated after an average wait and our server was polite and enthusiastic.  From there things didn't go as well. It was awhile before our orders were taken and it was almost another 1/2 hour before most of our food was delivered.  It was clear some of the food had been sitting awhile and one member of our party didn't get their food at all.  Once the food was received, it was good but not great.  We've had good experiences at Bubba Gumps before but not at this one.  We had to ask for our waters to be refilled otherwise the glasses sat  empty for half of our meal.  There was certainly room for improvement.
author: Field M.

description: Workers here are so lazy and play around with each other ass or something. They do not care about parties less than 5. There were many open tables and we waited around  1 hour and 30 mins
author: Jie L.

description: We went here on a whim. Not a bad choice. It was loud and crowded. Definitely a family oriented type of place. Our server was great-made a lot of jokes, kept our water glasses full. The food overall was pretty good. The presentation was impressive. Everyone in the group was able to find something to satisfy them. I would go back.
author: Anna I.

description:
Came here on a Monday around 8:00 and we were seated right away.

Ordered calamari appetizer, "I'm Stuffed" Shrimp & one of Forrest's dishes.
The appetizer came out the same time as the food it was good.
