The calamari was good and came with bell peppers and something else listed in the menu. As for the I'm Stuffed Shrimp, it was good, me and my boyfriend pretty much shared all of our food and got full quickly and had a little leftovers.
The service was good, the waiter played the Forrest Gump trivia game with us as we waited for our food.

Also, if you park in the Pier 39 parking lot, get your ticket validated at the souvenir shop. Before 6 one hour free and after 6, it's 2 hours free!
author: Jessamyn D.

description:
Maybe I was tired, maybe I was cranky....but the food truly was awful.   The manager was shockingly twice as awful.

I like it what a manager stops at our table to see how things are.  But I also have an expectation that the manager will then leave our table.  I've run into family and friends at restaurants who haven't chatted as long as this guy did.

The service was neutral - individually he was great - as a team they seemed to be quite clustered and confused (maybe management just couldn't well read where he was needed)

I DID adore the prawn magnet and would have bought it or three if there was an option to add it to the bill .... After waiting and waiting and more waiting with a stomach half full of less than mediocre food, I was not going to make a separate stop into an out of the way gift shop.

But it's worth going to decide for yourself
author: Brigid D.

description: I'm actually writing my review as I sit in the restaurant. After waiting over 40 minutes to be seated I was expecting the service to at least be average but it is honestly horrendous. Our waiter is very confused. It took forever to place our order and he gave our drinks to a different table. Then went back to the table and brought the drinks to us. This alone is crazy unsanitary. What if the other table had touched the drinks? We also asked for lemons and I kid you not he brought them with his bare hands. Needless to say I'm already disappointed and pretty disgusted by how unsanitary everything has been and we haven't even gotton to our entrees yet. This is going to be a hellish experience and I'm positive it will be my last time at any BG location.
author: Nava N.

description: Visited this location on 4/28/2018. Sat at the bar because the hostess said there would be an hr wait, when my date and I seen about 10 open tables. The waitress at the bar was not friendly and inviting at all. She barely checked on us. Her attitude was very poor. She wasn't rude per say. She just did not show us her BEST customer service face. My food tasted funny. Like 1. It was old and freezer burned and the shrimp was dry and rubbery. Or 2. Something had been sprayed on or around it. I got the stuffed shrimp. My date got the big Forrest platter. His food was under cooked the breading on the fish litteraly slipped right off when I picked it up to try it and was crumbling in my hand. Needless to say, we regrettably ate the food because we were starving. But both of us had severe upset tummies last night and today. I was so mad because while walking down the blvd we seen a hole in the wall Louisiana Kitchen that looked way better. Way better service and way better food. We will definitely try that place next time. I will never visit this location EVER again. Over rated. Bad service. Terrible food. Mild food poisoning.
author: Keysha B.

description:
Prob'ly one of the most annoying places I have eaten we asked for bread never came we asked for lime took  almost 10 minutes. My daughter had to wait to eat her food with us for all that long , swrvice is really  bad and  I think what's going on here is that yongesters who work here do not understand  customer service
 I know that I will never eat at any bubba Gump  agaain.
author: Kavita S.

description: The Sevice was good once we got a seat. Though I am cutting them a break for the 55 min wait as it's Sat Fleet Week. The food is good and though I am not a big shrimp fan they have plenty of other options. Great for kids and families.
author: Cinamin M.

description: I don't know what was worse... the watered-down clam chowder that maybe had two small pieces of potatoes and one small piece of clam in it... or the server Sarai, who had us wait for our fish and chips for 1 hour and 30 min before approaching us again to ask us what we had ordered because she forgot to put our order in! I will never come back to this restaurant.. it was a complete joke. For starters, we waited 1 hour to get seated. 45 minutes for our clam chowders (by the way they do not serve clam chowder in a bread bowl...they gave me a cup with little bags of crackers to put in it...) and then we waited 1 hour and 30 minutes for fish and chips, which we never got to eat because our serve, Sarai, lost our order somehow... I am overall extremely dissatisfied. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone!
author: Jsjeejjwwj W.

description: Restaurant has a great view of the bay, food is consistent and tasty. The tables along the window are close together and the restaurant was extremely hot and stuffy; we arrived when they opened at 10:30 AM. I don't think I'd want to visit late in the day as I could only imagine how hot it would get inside. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive.
author: C A.

description: I wish there's a No star option for this place...I was browsing my Junk Mail and i got a notification that my review way back in October was flagged down...I am the one who got insulted and I didn't get any calls from the Management for the Humiliation of their Shift Manager!!! Why would you hide the fact experience,,,every Single detail of my review was not fabricated.
author: Anne D.

description: Came for dinner on a rainy Monday, we were sat right away. Mariah greeted us immediately to get us drinks and told us to take our time looking through the large menu and that when we were ready to put the "stop forest" sign up, I thought this was nice because i didn't feel rushed to decide what I wanted. My boyfriend got a bucket of fried fish, shrimp, crab & fries it looked amazing. I had the 1/2 pound cheese burger with BBQ sauce bacon and onion straws, which was great.
author: Tailor B.

description:
Came here last Saturday after Dungeon, which was a bad move on our part!   

1.) The lines are LONG.  We had an hour and a half wait.
2.) Its super noisy and tables/chairs are really cramped together.
3.) Service is pretty bad, the waiter did a good job with my order, but several people in our party had their orders screwed up/something missing.
4.) They didn't offer any dessert, just handed us the bill, which I think our server was pissed that our party called out several of his mistakes.
5.) The fried calamari appetizer sucks, its contains a 50% of calamari and 50% various vegetables.  NOT WORTH it, I suggest avoiding it.

In conclusion, I'll NEVER go back to any Bubba Gump restaurants!
author: Mike M.

description: This is my first time being to San Francisco bubba Gump Shrimp and it's been over an hour and haven't got my appetizer??? Waiter told us that it should be coming out soon but no sign . Very upset how people that were sat down after us got their food first my recommendation would be to keep customers happy not waiting too long
author: Yesenia S.

description: I understand it's a holiday weekend night but I have to clean a table to be able to sit while waiting the 2 hour wait when I was quoted 1.25 hrs. Then I asked a server and she told me she didn't know where one was and to ask the host. The place is a mess!
author: Bobby J.

description:
Basically paid $24.00 for a plate full of frozen French fries, frozen shrimp and two small pieces of frozen fish. The staff were friendly and the two girls at the door checking people in were super nice. 

Overall you can go purchase these items at your local grocery store and it will be the equivalent of what you'd expect to receive if you dined in. I have to remember we are at the pier so food is a little more expensive.
author: Alexandria W.

description: Worst customer service ever the waitress that randomly came up to us and gave my friend hella attitude .... We sat for 35 minutes waiting for JUST our drinks then our drinks cane and sodas were flat I didnt even want to bother to ask about the drinks but the food came out finally and nasty ass shit cold .. And the waitress Sydney was the worst person!
author: Marshneil C.

description: I would never recommend this place to no one! Had to wait 2 hours to be seated ,when they were lots of tables empty. The host is this young boy who is very unprofessional. Food is average when we finally got it. But the waiter was a very pleasant guy.
author: Kelly A.

description: This was the worst experience I have had at this place. The first thing was it took a long time for a server to actually take our drink order. Luckily I had been to this place before so I knew about the sign on how to make them stop. The server did not explain any of their specials they had going on or ask us if we have been there. She was more like "Hey, let me know is when you guys are ready. " When our food finally came out it was a disappointment. We had ordered the "Forest seafood feast". Luckily we had ordered two to see what we were missing from one plate. We came around 6 in the evening and was not that busy. Just the worst experience I've had at this place and totally not worth it. Would not recommend. Try a different place on the wharf
author: Diyan S.

description: Somebody messaged me from the company and I provided my number but nobody ever reached out to me wow!
author: Patricia S.

description: Wait....where are the trivia questions! One of the fun things at your restaurant. Service was mediocre , food mediocre, long wait. Will rethink about another trip here. Have been many times in the past but you're declining all around :/
author: Julia A.

description: Terrible!!!! Terrible!!! Terrible!!!! Service was the worst! Rude and apathetic! Food was nasty and cold!!!! Go anywhere else on the pier for real seafood ... this is mildly defrosted garbage! The only star is for the view.
author: Marci M.

description: Horrible horrible horrible I will never eat here again. Food was nasty under cooked service was horrible.
author: K O.

description: Yesterday was my first time ever at Bubba Gump and I'd have to say, I really enjoyed it.  Their clam chowder has got to be one of my all favorites.  The calamari was good, but I did find it strange that there were battered and fried banana peppers and bell peppers amongst the calamari.  I didn't mind it, but it was quite the surprise when I bit into the pepper.  The shrimp mac n cheese was pretty good as well.  From my husbands dish, I loved the hush puppies because they were super flavorful.  My jambalaya was also very good, but I barely made a dent in it because we had so much food on the table.  To end our meal, we got the dessert sampler and I loved their version of the "pizookie" warm chocolate chip cookie topped with vanilla ice cream.  The service was great and we will be coming back.
author: Peggy L.

description: Appauling!  There was a dude hanging about during our 2 hour stay.  Yes. Hanging about.  He went into the men's room and took off his shirt to dry it and then just hung about.  Turns out he's one out the waitress' boyfriend.  He looked like a tweeter.  Huge turn off.
author: Bobbi L.

description:
I normally like Bubba Gumps but this was a mixed experience. The waitress was very friendly and efficient, but the food left some things to desire. We love going to this place because of the setting. There is a large covered deck overlooking the river. You can sit there have a few drinks, and watch the river flow by. You can watch the steady flow of people, boats, and ski dos. It was in the afternoon when we went and very hot. But they have fans with misters to help keep things a little cooler. 
My wife had the Cajun shrimp which she enjoyed. It was overall satisfactory. We would have liked to rave about it, but in reality it was just slightly "above average". I had the steamed shellfish bucket. Here is the odd part. Some of the items were good, some not. There was big crab claw which had the taste and consistency of sawdust. Horrible. The muscles were tough and chewy. However, the shrimp and clams were great. It should have been called the Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde bucket. It is also very expensive for what you get. My advice would be to go there, order a couple of drinks and take in the river view. If you eat, get the standard stuff such as fried or steamed shrimp. Goodluck.
author: Gerry B.

description: Came here with a large group. It was a really busy day so I expected the wait to be over an hour but it was around 40 minutes. I ordered the salmon dish with a side of grilled shrimp. The shrimp is small but tasted fine. The salmon dish was way too small for the price and the greens it came with wasn't so great. The salmon came with a bourbon sauce that did not go well with the salmon but the sauce itself was good. The food overall is okay nothing special.
author: M B.

description: I always enjoy this place! My kids love it, my spouse, my family. It's just so much fun and food is always on point. I have been taking my oldest son here for his birthday, 3 yrs. in a row. Today is his 14th Birthday, and here we are celebrating at Bubba Gump in the city, once agaib!
author: Imani O.

description: Wow what a disappointment!!!! although the service was excellent and the atmosphere was better than expected the was one of the worst that I meals I have had. Not only did we wait an hour and a 1/2 to get our food , but when it arrived the shrimp I ordered were cold and dry, my daughter and wife ordered the mahi-mahi and it was cold and dry.  Both of them did not even eat all of their meal. My daughters boyfriend ordered an entree salad that was much less than anticipated for the price and looked like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for awhile . All in all the only part of our meal that was good were the lemonade and sodas that we had gotten. I feel like I paid for an $97 fast food lunch plus the additional $15 I spent on a second lunch for the 4 of us. The only reason this Bubba Gumps was given 1 star is because of our server. Highly recommend that the San Francisco's pier 39 location be avoided
author: Mitch M.

description: The food was good, but the.service was slow. The portion was great.  I recommend having the Landry card to be seated faster.
author: Joel P.

description: I called ahead to see if they could accommodate my strict dietary such as 4 oz of shrimp without sauces or butter and steamed broccoli. When I arrived, my server Roy, ensured my order was cooked as specified as Chef Francisco had accidently added butter to the shrimp and Chef caught it before it left the kitchen. I enjoy the food here and was simply thrilled to have a wonderful filling meal that can meet the strict requirements of some guests, such as myself. Thank you Bubba Gump staff!!
author: R M.

description: First time customer...loved everything about this place--the decor is an adorable homage to one of my favorite films, the food wass yummy, the service was professional and fun (I especially enjoyed Forrest Gump trivia), and the amazing LOCATION at the end of Pier 39 offers a breathtaking view of the bay!
author: Angela S.

description: Never even had a chance to eat. The workers here just don't seem to know their shit. I was told my wait time would be 30 minutes; I waited a damn near hour and when I went to check our status, I could see a bunch more people complaining about the same situation as me. I decided not to even bother and just left. Completely ruined our time. Such bullshit.
author: Farhad A.

description:
I had been wanting to go to this place for a long time and my boyfriend and I went here for our anniversary. 

When we get there the hostess tells us for a party of 2 it will take 20-30 minutes for a table. She even asked for a number so they can text us when the table is ready. How convenient I thought. So we waited for 40 minutes and nothing. So we went back up to the lady and said sorry, that we basically had to wait in line by the bar. Because of her we waited over an hour for a table when we were told 20-30 minutes.

However, when the server came she was very friendly, made sure we got wonderful service. The food was great. She even played some Forest Gump trivia with us, which I thought was cute.

I don't think I will be going back again all because of the front hostess making us wait twice the time.
author: Megan M.

description: When you want to be a kid with an adult drinks i can't get enough of this place food is awesome staff is super fun one negative is it's so crowded but trust me worth the wait every time ;)
author: Melissa M.

description: I just found out that I was charged $10+ extra on the tip line. Make sure you keep your receipt and check the charge on your account when it pops up later.
author: Victor G.

description: We came here for a quick dinner, the service was ok, the team service approach got a little disorganized at times, but eventually we got everything we needed. It is a kitschy restaurant but we were all happy with our meals. We got a great table with a view of the bay harbour and my son said his pizza was the best ever.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Kinda pricey, but good food, great view and obviously centered around Forrest Gump. Most alcoholic drinks are take home cups.
author: Jr. M.

description: Decided to come here for dinner with family. WORST SERVICE EVER. the hostess told us the wait would be an hour. Checked back an hour later. She added 20 more minutes. Waited and didn't get to sit for after 2 hours of waiting .. the server brought out cold coffee with grinds in it. Asked the manager to change it. Waited 30 minutes for a cup of coffee. They forgot one our orders claiming "it was still being made". Our server didn't check on us at all. Had to flag down the manager more than once. Don't come here. Food isn't even good. Greasy and not worth the wait, and the service is HORRIBLE.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
NEVER RETURNING. CUSTOMER SERVICE NEEDS SERIOUS HELP.

The staff is rude & the managers are rude as well. Especially the women manager who was talking shit with the RUDE staff right in front of me and my families faces. My fiancé asked the girl who was sitting us if we were being seated at a booth & she said no. My fiancé then asks to seated at a booth & the girl looks him up and down and walks away. She then proceeds over to a group of her female coworkers & the female manager & BLATANTLY STARTS TALKING SHIT ABOUT US RIGHT IN FRONT OUR FACES. They couldn't even have respected us enough to walk away to talk shit. 

We watch them talk shit for about 4-5 min looking at us back and fourth, laughing and smiling. She then walks back over to us and sits us. My fiancé was not okay with how we were treated so he asked for the manager. The female manager comes over and my fiancé asks her "Were you over there talking shit with your staff" & she's lost for words. He then asks for a different manager and he comes over. Before he could get to us, he is ambushed by the female manager as she explains her self to him before we could get any of his time. He was nice and did nothing but defend his staff as we thought. After speaking with the male manager then female manager comes back over and offers us a free appetizer. We order it and the ENTIRE rest of the time we are there, all the women are walking around with smirks on there faces and treating everyone else with the MOST respect like they were basically laughing in our faces, again. 

What did we do as customers, to these women for them to act how the did. When ALL my fiancé did was simply asked to be seated at a booth & not a table. Very upset with how we were treated. YOUR STAFF NEEDS TO BE SPOKEN TO AND THIS SITUATION SHOULDN'T HAVE BEEN TREATED AS LIGHTLY AS IT DID. Very bad customer service.
author: Jasmyn B.

description:
Yesterday was our first experience with Bubba Gump Shrimp. It was a very special lunch for our family, made even more special by the beyond excellent service provided by our awesome server Jeremiah! He is simply the best! The food was great! The view was great! (Table 107/1) The drinks were great! Everything was just perfect! We will be back, for sure! 

Warning: If I ever open a restaurant, I'm going to come steal Jeremiah away! ;)
author: Christy B.

description: The service was absolutely terrible. We kept asking for stuff... we ordered popcorn shrimp and got 3/4 of a cup full of vegetables and maybe 5 shrimp. Ordered a shrimp scampi and half of my bowl was butter. Manager was careless.
author: Maria M.

description:
Having never tried Bubba Gump, I decided I might as well go all out tourist and head to the one on Pier 39. It's kind of hard to find at first - you really have to go to the very end of the pier to get there.

The restaurant is huge, and there's a nice bench on the front, complete with giant shoes and suitcase, for you to recreate the Forrest Gump movie cover.

The first thing you notice about the interior is that there are awesome, wall to wall windows with great views of the pier, the bridge, and Alcatraz. It was definitely worth plowing through the bad food to get to sit in the natural light and gawk at the bay.

Yep, as previously mentioned, the food was pretty horrible. The entire menu is seafood based, and most of it involves some kind of shrimp or breading - it just all kind of tasted like it had come out of the freezer via the microwave.

The service is interesting - there's a series of license plates on the front which you cycle through - the red one means you want service, and some other one means you don't need service. We tried using it and found that we were mostly ignored. 

Overall, I'm really glad dropped by - the views were definitely worth checking out. I definitely don't think I'll be heading to any other Bubba Gump again, though.
author: Pam C.

description:
I don't like giving one stars, but I was very patient until the very last moment and deducting star by star throughout entire dinner.

9:30 pm - arrived. Checked in at the FIRST host stand. Promised that will be sat in 10 minutes.

9:50 pm - host has sent people already that came after us. After I looked at him, he said "Oh, you can go as well".

Standing in the line to the SECOND host stand.

10:00 pm - after arriving to the second host stand, one person is asking how many people, so he can prepare menus and utensils. Another person right next to him asks again how many of us, so he can find a table. 
Finally, third person is taking us to the table.

10:15 pm - placed an order because the waiter did not change the sign from "Run Forrest Run" to "Stop Forrest Stop" before we were sat and we didn't pay attention to it either since it is our first time.

10:25 pm - drinks finally arrive. Ordered house special Margarita. Me and my other two friend agreed that it was waaay to sweet. Asked them to tweak the drink, so it will be less sweet. The answer was "we can pour one more shot there". Are you serious? Another shot to lower sugar concentrate? Anyhow...

10:30 pm - appetizer arrives. Run Across America appetizer was finished in 3 minutes by 3 people because it is small for this size party despite $20 price tag.

10:40 pm - entrees arrive. Single piece from entire experience that I do not have any complaints. Good, well balanced and tasty entrée. But no, wait. Manager showed up and asked if I indeed didn't like their Margarita. I confirmed. Manager left

10:50 pm - asked for dessert menu. Ordered Key Lime Pie. 2 minutes after server returns and says that they do not have it. Obviously, I did not want anything else, neither my friends.

Asked for check.

10:54 pm - check arrives and we giving 3 cards and ask to split it equally. One minute later she returns and says that they cannot split it equally in the system because we have only one appetizer and she needs exact number. I would probably use a calculator and divide our bill into three separate pieces, but no. Since there was two my cards, I took one out and said to charge $63 (pay attention to this number) on one card and everything else to the other.

10:57 pm - my card is charged $65.05, but I do not care at that moment, since I wanted to leave.

11:00 pm - giving a last chance to the host at the stand to say "Good bye" before exiting, but no, she looked at me and turned around without saying anything.

I especially liked their 5% surcharge for "cost of doing business in San Francisco" as if food price wasn't enough.
author: Taras M.

description: Horrible food and even worse service. The staff seems really overwhelmed with all the tourists. This was my first time eating at a Bubba Gumps and also my last! Anyone who thinks this is a good seafood restaurant has no sense of gastronomy!
author: Johncj32 ..

description: Restaurant based con the movie, that is all. The food is good, well served, well attended, but I don't see anything that makes me return, they always have long lines. The owners know to make money of the movie, and that's it! For sure is better Pappadeaux or Joe's Crab Shack.
author: Adrian B.

description:
Really enjoyed it! Server was nice & attentive, food wasn't fine cuisine or anything haha but the atmosphere and view was well with it. 

We shared the "Shrimper's Heaven" & Hush Puppies yum!
author: Marisol L.

description:
Location: SF is extremely pack but honestly Bubba Gump makes it total worth it ! I always park in the parking lot across the pier and enjoy a good walk with family and friends, Bubba gump beside the clam chowder is my all time to go restaurant when I'm in the pier .

Food: Delicious ! Everything ! From the shrimp to the burgers , I love it all !  

Staff: Nice and Friendly , unfortunately in one occasion our order took about an hour and it was just ridiculous but the manager was so kind and friendly he hooked us up ! 

Price: a little high but is worth it , if you got at night time you'll enjoy the view from the light boats and all ! 

Recommend: Yes ! for any occasion rather visiting , getting a quick grub on or even a date night !
author: Yadira S.

description: Me and my girlfriend were removed from the waitlist after waiting an hour for no apparent reason, then told to wait another 10 minutes before just sitting at the bar. Our food came out cold, and our waitress was nice, but forgot a few simple things we asked for. I would never come here again
author: Christian C.

description: Been here many times visiting Pier 39 and this is our first choice - have never had a bad meal or drink!  Great service too.
author: Suzanne L.

description: Horrible service!!!! Came in around 9:30 pm and the lady that sat us was so rude! Slammed down our menus and just kept walking.. then we waiting for 20 minutes for someone to even take our drinks!!
author: Madison V.

description: Alright today was our very first time here and we've lived in San Francisco for years. Our waiter was very nice, however he messed up our order about 3 times. The food is pretty pricy for the amount of food they serve you. We also waited a long time for our 3 plates and got the wrong plate served. I thought the trivia game was pretty cool though. Honestly I will not come back here, wasn't crazy about it at all, and overall was very unhappy. I thought this would be a good place to bring my mom for her birthday but I was wrong. If it helps the food was pretty good except for the fried fish it was nasty. Wish this place was better but it's not.
author: Adriana A.

description:
I used to love coming to this place. The O'stuffed Shrimp were amazing Never failed to disappoint until tonight. This was my first time back in about 3 years and I can honestly say I don't think I will be coming back. They did seat us very quickly tonite. But, There was so much disorganization it was crazy. 

1st issue: I had about 3 different waiters come and tell me they were my waiter. This happened right after the 1st waiter took my drink order. The 2nd one came and started going over the process of things, and asked what I would like to drink. I explained to her someone had already taken the drink order. The 3rd waitress came and let me know she would like to get the drinks started and again, I let this one know that someone had already taken the order. The1st waiter came back and looked rather annoyed with the 2nd waiter for stealing her table. Not sure what happened in the background but we ended up with waiter number 2 as our waitress for the rest of the night.

2nd issue: I ordered water for myself and an apple juice for my son. The apple juice came, but the water didn't. Had to ask if I could have a water on 3 occasions when the last time I asked it still hadn't come. They took our food order a short while later, still no water. Once they took my order I again, had several waiters come out to confirm the order...not sure if it was an off night, the food came pretty quickly once they told me the order was in.

3rd Issue: When I got my food it was cold :(. I had been looking forward to this since again, I hadn't been here in about 3 years. The plate usually comes out sizzling hot and the cheese has this amazing oooey gooey, yet cheesy crust and the crab stuffing is very tasty. Tonite it was very mushy, barely warm and unfortunately kind of grossed me out. I ordered a shrimp skewer and jasmine rise for my son. He choked on the shrimp from how over cooked it was. I took a taste of his and found that the cajun shrimp skewer had absolutely no cajun taste to it, it was like they just threw it on the stove and forgot about it for a bit and threw it on a plate when they remembered. 

I understand that they are very busy but the quality of the food tonight left a lot to be desired. I asked for my check as fast as I could and got the heck out of there. I felt bad for the person we ended up with as our waiter, it looked like it was her first night working and wasn't really being given direction and just looked lost. They ended up dropping some dirty plates in another booth that had guests sitting in it and she looked mortified. Maybe in another 3 years the place will hav improved its organization and food quality before sending it out, especially for plates being at $18 dollars and higher.
author: Sonia L.

description: One of my go to places when I want to be bad and eat fatty foods. I really love the Shrimp Mac & Cheese and the BBQ Burger. My guest loved the Shrimp Po'boy. Service is great, very friendly staff and I love the way the managers stop by our table and ask how are we doing! I pass on the Movie quiz though. The view is amazing.
author: Geoff F.

description: Shrimp platter and mashed potato are too good. We ordered 3 entries . All are yummy. Place is crowded, but lively.
author: Sahitya M.

description:
Love the restaurant.  They scam you on the "buy this drink and get a glass like the one it comes in". Unless you demand a glass glass, you get a cheap plastic one which does not confirm value in the cost.

Food is good!

Service is good for the most part.  It's busy and they seem to get frustrated easily.  I think lack of management support is the cause.

Fun trivia questions!

You pay to park off site.

Restrooms and restaurant are both clean.
author: Topher H.

description: Today I went with my family to Bubba Gump Shrimp! We picked this spot because of the great movie Forrest Gump ! The service and food was great ! In fact it would have received 5 stars if it wasn't for the lack of Dr. Pepper that they do not serve. I was pretty upset that they do not serve this drink when in the movie it makes a clear reference to the drink and the restaurant is popular because of the movie. Other then the lack of the Dr. pepper, it was a great experience and great service! Highly recommended
author: Brandi P.

description:
On my trip to San Fran, my friends and I came to this place to get the city's famous claim chowder, try some seafood, and get buzzed.  We accomplished all three of those things at Bubba Gump's.  We got a sweet table with an amazing view of the ocean.  Our server named David gave us an amazing dining experience. He conversed with us so well and gave us the popular Forrest Gump Trivia game with so much enthusiasm that we had a blast. 

The claim chowder was delicious though I felt something was missing from it. The Shrimp Heaven we shared was a bit mediocre to be honest.  The grilled shrimp was good but the fried shrimps were terrible.  I also ordered mashed potatoes which weren't spectacular at all.  I ordered a blue Hawaiian which was delicious and made me buzzed perfectly. All in all this place gave me an amazing fisherman's wharf experience.

Pros: 
- Service is incredible for us and I want to give a shout out to David (black guy with the amazing smile). However some people around for us had bad server experiences with their person.
- Clay chowder was good but did need some extra flare
- Drinks were great. I recommend the Blue Hawaiian
- BEAUTIFUL location and views

Cons: 
- it is very pricey but that's to be expected ( they do charge surcharge and gratuity so be prepared)
- other food ordered was medicocre
author: Thanh T.

description: The bartenders here are AMAZING! Jacob, sean, kenji, mark they do such an amazing job. i love coming here keep up the amazing werqqqq
author: Kaloana G.

description: Food is great! Wait was about 45 min, and you don't normally get 100% waiter help since the place gets so busy. Had to keep asking for something I needed, but I didn't mind since we enjoyed the food!
author: Jovan L.

description: I take my family here from time to time for special occasions like birthdays and the like. When you get there, you'll notice a line. The wait times usually aren't terrible, but there isn't a lot of place to sit while waiting. They have a gift shop right next door, do you can spend some time buying t shirts or pens or whatever while you wait for a seat. Now the wait is over and you're in! What to expect: it's loud, and crowded. There's music playing from speakers overhead and the noise from people yelling over the speakers, combined with the usual restaurant clatter all mix into a dull roar. This isn't the place you want to go for a romantic evening. But, if you're up for some noise and activity then this is where you want to be. The service during this last visit was particularly slow, probably due to the amount of people there and the limited staff. There was a manager walking around handling various duties to assist the staff. Once our orders were placed, the food arrived quickly. Our waiter tried his best to keep up with the demands of a party of 6. The food was very good. I would say just shy of great... The only reason it got 3 stars was the noise and the slow service. I would definitely recommend to anyone and I will return.
author: Michael S.

description: Long wait.  Sat at bar and were assured we'd have good service.  Not!  Ordered the smoothie.  They don't have it. Ordered blue raspberry slushee. Nope.  Machine is thawing.  Gee my water tastes great.  Owners:  how about you have menu items available?
author: D C.

description:
This restaurant let me down in a lot of ways. I was very excited to try out this spot, after seeing many locations, but after this experience I don't think I'll go back. 
We got seated and it took 25 minutes before anyone came over to ask for drinks. By that time we had all decided what we wanted for dinner, so we ordered. Then that took another 45 minutes before we got our food. Once we got our food, half of the items we ordered were wrong. And that took another 15 minutes to fix. 
My food tasted similar to something I could get out of a frozen package and through in the oven at home. It was not tasty and luke warm when I got it. AND for the prices it was very disappointing (22$). 
After all of this we were charged for the things they replaced when our orders were wrong. It was a very infuriating and frusterating experience. A bad place to eat.
author: Cade L.

description: I'll admit I prolly should known better. I've heard some things. I knew it would be pricey at Pier 39, but I didn't know it would be awful too, just dreadful. Overcooked shrimp, a few fries, a salad and a drink ... like $35 for one. I'm embarrassed to admit this, but I'll take one for the team. Try ANYWHERE else!
author: Don F.

description: Loved my experience here brought me and my family and had an excellent time! Great service although the place was extremely busy we were still treated like a priority and not just another number!
author: Mister S.

description: Waited a total of 3 hours for food I either disliked or didn't get to taste. The chowder was a joke...the server (Sarai) was a complete disaster...who forgets to place your order in?... we waited 1 hour and 30 minutes for our food just to have her come back to our table and ask us what we ordered because she lost our order... I will not be visiting Bubba Gump again.
author: Esteban S.

description:
Decided to try the place since it is a spin-of by that oh so popular movie by Tom Hanks. We waited outside for about 15 minutes and got to have our seats after another 5 since they were "cleaning our tables".  There was alot of unoccupied tables that are available but clearly our party of 6 had to wait till we're cramped in a table  comfortably good for 4 - hey were a "big" group. They seated us by the window so we can see the marina where the boats are. Hmmm nice view but am famished.

The server was nice, and took our orders with a smile. no problem with that...

These are what we got:

Shrimpers heaven - we gobbled it all up cause we're hungry...its actually really good but looking at other peoples yelp pictures I felt  we were ripped off cause our fries were actually on the other cone and not on the tray and we dont have any coleslaw with our dips.

Shrimp scampi "of course we got scampi" - my mom didnt finish it because....hmmm

Shrimp skewers with bourbon on it...dont remember the actual name but my dad liked it.

Steak and shrimp - the mashed potatoes was blah, the steak medium rare..."ehhh" and shrimp was good tho.

Jambalaya - really tasty but spicy for my taste, good amount of shrimp and pepper chicken was underneath that tomato spicy rice.

Drinks: mango sparkler and the speckled (strawberry)  lemonade, both were too sweet for our taste so we had to water it down (alarmingly sweet for diabetics). Run forest Run smoothie - the kid liked anything with strawberry on it.

Fried chicken and corn - cousin says it was soft and tasty...he finished it minus the corn which was dry...

Kids meal - cheese burger on jenny's tug boat...really cute presentation minus the newpaper lining the food...the burger according to the kid was ok  but the blue jello was awesome...something's wrong here...it should be the other way around.

Anyhoo with everything ordered and gobbled, we paid a pricey tab plus tip. Coming back? eeehhhh....prolly for the ambiance.
author: Joy U.

description: I had the best experience last night at Bubba's. This is by far the best time my daughter and I had in a restaurant. Our waiter was super nice. The manager was very involved with her staff and the customers. I have a fish allergy. Yes I know right. Your thinking why is she eating at a seafood restaurant. My 8 year old won't eat fish around me because she cant touch me. I am severely allergic to fish except shelled fish and squid. So here was the issue. All fish and shellfish is cooked in the same oil. Some items are mixed with fish like the hush puppies. The waiter checked with the chef before placing the order. I am glad he took that precaution. I had waiters in the past bring me food and treat me bad for not knowing. But no not this one. Then the manager came to the table and explained they cooked my shrimp separate to make sure I didn't get sick. Amazing!!!! Thank you so much for the first class treatment.
author: Sabrina C.

description: The only good thing about this place was the view. The drinks, even just a beer, are very overpriced. The spinach artichoke dip came out glazed over and crusty, like it had sat for way too long under the heat lamp. The fish and chips were mediocre, and again, very overpriced. This was the first and last time I will go there.
author: Stephanie C.

description: 3 pm with no wait but still had to wait for a long time for 5 people. Service was good, everyone was decently nice enough & did their jobs however the reason for the 2 stars is that their food is really really really overrated just for the fact that it's from Forrest Gump, if you just want to enjoy mediocre food and the views and have a fun night including "Forrest Gump" related things its the right place. They did a fun little game about questions about the movie but it was more interruptive than fun (no kids at the table). Food was barely decent & if you are expecting outstanding seafood, you might as well go to red lobster & get better service AND SEAFOOD.
author: Yena K.

description: Not everything on the menu has a price. Had to ask twice for a price on something because the waitress kept forgetting. Save your money and go to Joe's Crab Shack. They have a better menu, better prices, and larger portions. Also the parking garage at pier 39 is ungodly expensive. $10/hr. Talk about insult to injury.
author: Bobby H.

description:
Not sure why all the bad reviews, but I'm glad I tried this place! I think maybe because I went on a weekday evening it's different? However, we did show up towards the end of closing time (9:30pm) and left about 30 minutes after closing (10pm). 


I found the place charming and the service was the friendliest. I didn't even know this restaurant existed and was surprised it was based from the movie. There's even a gift shop next to the restaurant.

The host at the front (don't recall his name but he was a bigger guy with an even bigger smile) was so sweet and greeted us immediately upon entering. Our server Jeremiah was an absolute delight, and we were very appreciative of his patience with us (we were confused about the Run Forrest Run signs and kept flipping them around--he kindly explained what we were doing, oops). The staff were all so friendly and accommodating. 

The only thing I didn't like about the food was the their lengthy names. Lol. Felt like a tongue-twister while ordering. 

All in all, the meal was quite good, but I'm a sucker for anything adorned with shrimp. However, I ordered the Net Catch dish under the "Jenny" category in the menu with Cajun seasoning...towards the end of dinner I found myself eating mostly from my boyfriend's plate which was the Bubba's After the Storm Bucket of Boat Trash. I liked the texture better, although the Net Catch was quite flavorful. I recommend adding a few drops of the provided Tabasco in the bucket for an extra kick.

But I LOVE their drinks. They give you the cup for most of them, and I love mine! It lights up at the bottom and when you lift it up it projects Bubba Gino's 20th Anniversary. I thought it was so cute. Jeremiah offered to rinse it for us after dinner (it was so clean and spotless!). I ordered the Strawberry Mango non-alcoholic freeze thing. Boyfriend had the Coronita with the free shaker which you have to pick up at the gift shop after dinner because it's alcohol. 

But again, I really am grateful for the staff's friendly and kind service. You made our visit wonderful.
author: Alyssa N.

description: A friend of mines took me here. It was a late birthday dinner. It is an awesome place. Love it, Love it, Love it!!!
author: Rachelle J.

description: This is my fourth experience at this chain restaurant and most have been subpar. I have to say it has been the worst one of all the service was awful they kept switching waitress without notifying the table and service was slow. Ordered calamari as an appetizer and it was bad. Apparently the dish includes fried pepperccinies, which totally overpowered the dish at a 9:10 ratio. The table ordered simple dishes like soups and salads and it took forever for the food to be served. A few items ordered never made It to the table until the waitress was questioned about it. All the salads were warm, it was obvious they were just sitting in the kitchen. The waitress could not remember to bring items requested. This will definitely the last time I go to this restaurant. The food was horrible and completely over priced.
author: Cynthia F.

description: The worst customer service. So many empty tables but it's an hour and half wait lol especially during the holidays. Obviously there's going to be a lot of families out. Wouldn't you want to be more prepared. Under staff with empty table almost half the room have empty tables. Bad business.
author: Daisy S.

description:
You absolutely will NOT get your bang for the buck here. I came here years ago , was craving some Shrimp so decided to give it a go again & came for my cousins 21st birthday. We skipped appetizers because we thought we would be too full too eat our meals assuming our portion sizes on the entrees would be bigger..we were wrong. Having a snack when you get home means you got ripped off. However the food was DELICIOUS. Not coming here again, at this rate Red lobsters unlimited shrimp is a better deal.

Server was very friendly. Not his fault prices are jacked too high/small portion sizes.
author: Kam H.

description: I use to love this place it seams like the quality and flavor and been sacrificed for speeding along the customers. I would think twice before I go back. But the people and management seem to be very concerned and seem to care about my opinion but only time will tell. I'll repost again the next time we go
author: Mike D.

description:
The wait was sooooooooo long ! But the service and food was amazing ! It was a great time spending my birthday here  they also sang me a birthday song which was fun haha 
The views from there to the ocean were gorgeous, I love the water so it felt like I was eating food on water since I was sitting right by the window .
The other thing is they have a pretty cool system with cards that say stop  for a waiter so that if we need them we would have to flip the sign and they will be there !
author: Yulia K.

description: Don't believe the bad reviews for this place! I came here on Friday at 4pm and we waited about 5 min to get seated and there was a few people in front of us we were surprised we got seated so quick because we read the bad reviews. All the servers were so nice and would go to our table every time we needed one of them. Our appetizer was out so quick too! As soon as we ordered we maybe waited 20 min for our food which I thought was great! The service the whole time was really good and food was amazing. Thank you!
author: Yesenia E.

description: We went to Bubba Gump Shrimp Dec 10 with my family.  The next day, we all got sick. The food is pricy, and it is not worth it to take a chance to get a sick.
author: Jiseon K.

description: Go for the theme not for the food. The food is shite, but if your a Forrest Gump fan this resto is hard to resist.  But the food is shite be warned..
author: Wilbert Louis N.

description: It is a must, since it poses value do to Tom Hank's film and the significance that it portrays. It's good is good although not expectacular. It is rather more pintorescque than delicious
author: Adrián B.

description:
Get the clam chowder or get the jambalaya. They know how to get it prepared and served quickly. The wait to be served can be forever but once you are seated the service is fantastic. I order both dishes and I was pleased beyond words. I did not order any dessert but the food was just RIGHT!!!

There tends to be a lot of tourist in the area so expect to be asked a lot of questions if you are a native San Franciscan. 

I always recommend getting a table near the window so that you can enjoy the bay but if you cannot it may seem a bit congested. I don't think they take reservations so if you are in the area and want to eat here you are going to have to wait for awhile. 

Great spot to go to if in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
author: Robert F.

description: So my family and I decided last minute to drive the hour to Pier 39 to eat at Bubba Gumps. We parked in the garage across the street and even with the 1 hour validation from Bubbas it was $30!!  The wait was over an hour and as we're finally walking to our table a mother rushed past us with her daughter who was throwing up!!! Can you say lost our appetite??  The smell alone.... well you get the picture.  Out come the paper towel rolls and the disinfectant. We were diverted around the back to get to our table. We always have the fried chicken and mashed potatoes. The chicken was great but the potatoes were half the portion we usually get. Two of us ordered a side just to get the regular portion. I'm not blaming Bubbas for what happened. They were apologetic but it kind of put a damper on the meal.
author: Sarah G.

description:
Was expecting a lot better quality in the food since its right by the water.
Service was okay she didn't pay much attention to us after she took our order we will not be going back there.
author: Heather H.

description:
I'm never disappointed with the food at bubba gumps! Always delicious. We had the Run Across America Sampler and just about licked the plate clean. We also tried the Shrimp Tacos, good but the tortilla was kinda funky, and they used two which covered up the shrimp flavor :/

You're going to have a long wait time for sure, but it'll be worth it. View from dining area is to die for! Sail boats passing by and a nice breeze. Friendly staff that do a great job with keeping up with the theme.
author: Sarah D.

description: Worst service  ever they messed up our order and the waitress was rude and seemed in a hurry and not really wanting to take an order or didn't bother to ask if we needed any else.
author: Antonio V.

description: Fantastic service and good food. Good for the essential seafood fare, nothing to fancy but served with care. Bebhinn is a great waitress!
author: Charlie S.

description: There are many other places in the Pier to get better, cheaper food, with lower prices and shorter wait. The Bubba Gump gets away with their service, food and price only cause of the movie but would otherwise be out of business. We went but would not go back.
author: Ricardo G.

description:
They handled efficiently over 20 people with limited forewarning. Food is not exceptional as usual in this kind of place, but reasonable, as are drinks. Service was good and fast.

The final bill was reasonable.
author: Stefano Z.

description:
I went a few days ago and wanted to post my feedback.

Giving them a 3 because the Seafood from what I was told was very good. The service was just ok, and myself not a big Seafood eater had a hamburger.

I know it's a Seafood place, however, you would think that the burger would taste just as good if not better. Unfortunately, it was just OK. 

I would have probably given it a 4, but, when I got the clam chowder it was watery & it had no clams at all! I asked the server about this & her response was just that it was "clam based"??? What ever the heck that is!!! I asked shouldn't the clam chowder have clams in it, again she said it was clam based? 

Overall, just ok for the price we paid. I think right now there are much better places to eat in the same area. If you go on Yelp and take a look at the people's reviews, they seem to agree.
author: Mike M.

description:
My first time here and I really enjoyed it. We were a table of 7, 4 adults 3 kids. The wait wasn't too bad, for a super busy Saturday. 45 min wait. I loved the table that we were seated at! The table by the office is the best! I will definitely be coming back! 

Our waiter was Travis, his customer service was awesome! I loved his energy and his up beat personality!!! He made our first time there very pleasant. I couldn't have asked for a better server. Even though they were crazy busy he made time to constantly check on us to Make sure that we were okay! How awesome is he! He was very inviting and just made us feel so very welcomed! I loved the little trivia game that he played with us! 

So thank you Travis for being you! Thank you for your human kindness! Thank you for your hard work!
author: Cece N.

description: My wife and my son made a reservation here last Sunday expecting to eat some good seafood. We were wrong! The service was absolutely horrible. When we go there we told them we had a reservation which they quickly aknowledged. After that we were told to go have a seat at a table which we thought was weird because it seemed other people were actually being taken to a seat. Then we sat for about 15 minutes before anyone acknowledged us. The waiter said "has anyone helped you yet?" We told him no and he proceeded to take our drink order. He then forgot my wife's mango drink until we reminded him several times that we didn't have it yet. When we got our food we realized we had no silverware on the table to eat with. We told the waiter and he brought silverware about 10 minutes later , which also our food got cold by that point. The food was mediocre at best. I could've went to Costco and bought some frozen breaded shrimp and some cocktail sauce and it would've been better. When we tried to pay our card was decline by our bank due to suspicious activity which made us have to pay with a credit card while I was calling to get the card unblocked. When we have the waiter the credit card he went to the register and rolled his eyes to another employee implying that we had no money and were probably going to get declined again. We normally tip at least 20-25% but I left him $5 on $75 because the service was so bad. All in all I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.
author: Markus C.

description:
Great service, but it doesn't make up for the overpriced, bland food.

I came here with my little brother and the server for our table was Jenna. She was very attentive and friendly. 

My brother ordered the fishwich (fish sandwich) and I ordered the Cajun chicken. The buns for both our sandwiches were half of our sandwich. While my sandwich came with guacamole, spicy mayo and bacon, it still lacked flavor. 

Two sandwiches cost me $36. Definitely not worth it. Would not recommend to anyone. Might as well walk along embarcadero to In n Out LOL.
author: Patty C.

description: I love love the food we had a blast love the food again. Only thing that did not like was it was not internet/nor technology friendly I struggled to find somewhere to charge my phone it did not help that the waiter wasn't very friendly nor did he pay much attention are table.
author: Cisca L.

description: Great fish and chips, loved the seasoning. Garlic bread as the appetizer was better tasting then I accepted. Our server was full of energy. Overall a great experience.
author: Anup P.

description: I usually show a huge disdain towards tourist chain restaurants, but for some reason this one of the only franchises that I can see myself visiting on a regular basis. It may be the atmosphere that keeps bringing me back, I love how all the staff members get involved in singing, games, and trivia, and how every worker is willing to assist you with any issue, but it could also be the food that has me hooked. Everything is pretty palatable, but my go to item is always the coconut shrimp, it's kinda pricey, but you get a lot of food, I've never left this place without leftovers. Give it a shot, this may not be your regular spot to dine, but it's definitely a nice treat from time to time.
author: Joseph A.

description: I love Bubba Gamp's restaurants and I've been to several other cities in the US, but for the second time I've been to this location at Pier 39 in San Francisco and to my surprise the service remains lousy! Whenever I arrive the unpreparedness starts from the desk clerk to the waiter. Of this last time, I ordered 3 chopps for the employee of the bar that serves the drinks, until a table to sit was available; she told me that I had to see the other two people who were going to drink, otherwise it would not suit me! That is, I can not order more than 1 chopp per person! After that, I paid the bill to her and did not add the tip, because I did not like the way she met me and because the tip is optional. After a while, I came back and asked for 3 more chopps and the clerk told me that I did not pay tip the first time and she would not serve me any more! After that and for over an hour waiting, I went to complain to the general manager because they had several empty tables and we were waiting a long time hungry; she said that we should already be waiting in line on a small ramp that exists there, but no one had informed us before; so the manager provided us with a table and said that he would talk to the bar employee about the disrespect she made with me, demanding me tip! We made the request and after more than 30 minutes, arrived the food and the chopps! We ate with much displeasure at the lack of commitment we had from the employees and before we finished, the waitress already brought the bill, without having asked for it! We paid and went away indignantly, me, my wife and a friend! I will not be returning to this place, I do not recommend it and from the first time I went, I was mistreated! I make a point of formalizing this evaluation so that the Bubba Gamp restaurants can maintain the quality recognized in other cities and that unfortunately in San Francisco is bad!
author: Thiago L.

description: I expected more. The service was slow, the food was very average. The fish tasted like nothing, the seasoning heavy handed, and the drinks were not made correctly. Also the beer was warm. Will not return.
author: Bryce H.

description:
I love the place.. the food, the drinks, the view and everything about it.
BUT
the pricing of the souvenir glass and the drink with it is confusing as shit!
and when I asked for the manager to explain me and started to discuss about why is it if we get the glass it's expensive but if we don't get the glass, the drink remains the same price.. she started to talk very loudly and wasn't even slightly interested to explain me why the heck it is like that..

Very disappointed by their staff esp the manager and the pricing system as I'm not complaining about the prices but the unfair complications to it!
author: Karan M.

description:
My boyfriend took me on the first time I dined here. I like the concept and the decorations (Forest Gump is a great movie). The location also has a beautiful view of the pier/bay but it can get a little cramped because it's so popular. We put our names down around 3 pm and we waited about 2 hours before we were seated. 
The service was very good especially considering how busy they were. We didn't have to wait long for our food or for our server. 
The food was good but the portions were small for the price. I expected more for what we paid.
author: Catherine L.

description: I love the movie Forest Gump so pretty much really only wanted to come to this restaurant for the fun of it.  It was a great experience. The whole restuant has tons of funny quotes from the movie. Even the paper that our food was on. We were able to get a window seat so we had a great view. Ordered half Cajun and half garlic shrimp bucket from the appetizer menu and poboy shrimp sandwich with fries. The shrimp bucket was a little on the salty side but still pretty tasty and the sandwich was delicious!
author: Mel H.

description: When we arrived over half the restaurant was cleaned and ready for customers yet we had to wait for them to clean a table. Waited about 15 minutes as staff sat around having a conversation. Horrible staff who spent more time talking to each other then helping customers. Very rude and unprofessional. If I exhibited this type of behavior at my job I would be fired! It took forever to order and our waitress spent no time with us and then left for long periods of time without ever taking our order.  The manager was either on her phone or busy chit chatting with other staff who was near her not paying attention to customers or staff. Then the servers bring all the drity dishes next to my table where i am eatting. Only 1 server, Jeff, seemed to be actually trying to do his job. When our food final came it was not at said on the menu. Instead of chicken strips it was lumps of chicken in some nasty sauce. I watched as staff members pointed and talked about me as i ate. The whole experience was horrible! This place use to be fun to visit now its just a pain and waste of anyones time! I would not recommend this OVERPRICED hole to my worst enemy! I have eaten here many times over the years and the quality of service and food has rapidly declined in the last year. Some one needs to shut this place down or do a major rehaul. If you are visiting from out of town stay away. There are much better places to eat!
author: Karen M.

description:
Amazing time, having lunch right in front of  The Amcerica's Cup.

I didn't really want to try this place mostly because it's a restaurant chain. My boyfriend insisted so let's see what happen.

I have to say as a big fan of Forest Gump , I really enjoyed the atmosphere the restaurant. I know it's all about marketing but everything reminds you the movie and I found it very cool. 

Most of the plates offered are seafood and shrimps of course ! I wasn't really hungry so I chose a shrimp pot served as an appetizer. 

Oh My God. when this pot arrived I realized the big difference between France and USA. They call it appetizer, I call it main meal. 

Anyway, I was surprised. The food was rrreeaaallyyy good. So let's try !
author: Laetitia V.

description:
We were on a family trip to San Francisco, visiting Alcatraz. By the time we got back we were all starving and had a very picky 4 year old in tow. We were wondering around pier 39 trying to figure out what to eat. Bubba Gumps wasn't our first choice we live pretty close to the area and generally avoid the over touristy places, but after reviewing the menu and saw a short wait, we figured why Not? 
I'm glad we stopped the prices aren't much higher than Red Lobster. We were seated with a great view of the water, definitely a plus.  All of our food came out quickly and tasted great. My son's kids meals was so cute, came in a shrimp boat!.. 

Not sure why there is so many complaints on here over the prices, its seafood, on pier 39. All the food is over priced I think the view was worth the extra $$$.  We also had great service. I didn't think I'd like it but we'd come here again.
author: Valerie M.

description:
I have gone to this location twice, first with friends and the second with family.

My first visit was a while back around 2-3 months ago after going to Alcatraz. We decided to eat at Bubba Gump since we haven't been there before. In all, we thought the food was delicious. Honestly, I can't remember what we all ate but I do remember everyone saying they had enjoyed it.

My second visit was today. My mom, sister, and I came here spontaneously after looking at the sea lions. I think the theme of the restaurant is great since I love Forrest Gump.

Food: I can't speak for my family about their food. But for me, I ordered the Baja Fish Tacos and a cup of Clam chowder. (The food they had ordered are in the photos I had posted.) We also had calamari for appetizer.
The tacos were not as tasty as I hoped. Not sure how to explain it, but I felt that they were missing something, just not sure what. The clam chowder though, that stuff was the bomb. I loved it. I think the cup is the perfect size because it's not too little and not too much (you can see the difference in size between the cup and bowl size of chowder in the photos I posted.) The calamari was delicious and both sauces it came with were great. However, I just wish the portion was a little better since basically almost half of the serving was fried banana peppers and red peppers.

Service: I didn't catch the name of the guy who helped us but he was very kind. He was top notch!

Overall, I would go back to try more dishes. Maybe not the Baja Tacos again but definitely the chowder!
author: Shannon C.

description: One of my favorite places to go when I'm on pier 39.  Constantly get great service, great food. Good for adults, good for children.
author: Davor B.

description:
Went on a sunday night with two other friends, Waited for an hour, the hosts and bartenders were super nice which put us in a good mood plus it was our first time eating here so we were excited and anxious. Our server was cool and nice so we thought Until he made a racial comment to me and my friends. We asked why one of the dishes are called "boat Trash" he goes "its just something kind of ironic, you know like with you being black, if you called me darkskinned that would be ironic" that was the example he used for "ironic". Why he used an example in the first place as if we didnt understand what ironic meant anyway... im not sure but it was unnecessary af.. after he said it, i looked up confused and then he pat me on the shoulder and told me "dont think about it too much" sarcastically. I should have went off on him right then and there but I let it go and we continued to order. 

Then my friend asked our server if one of the dishes would fill her up. He said yes, then while we were eating she playfully told our server "you said this would fill me up but im not full" lol (my friend is really goofy). Our server then goes "Look, you guys had a whole hour to decide if you wanted to eat here and what you wanted to order. Im just trying to do my job here." And then he stormed off before we could even process the fact that he really had us messed up.. 

So he comes back like nothing ever happened. We are pretty easy going girls and dont take much seriously so when he came back and offered to refill my friends lemonade i ask him "oh are you trying to redeem yourself now?" With a smile on my face Lol i guess this simple question made him mad and he goes "look im just doing my job here, so do you want a refill or not" we said no and he says ok and walks away. we didnt even know what to say so we told the manager who didnt do anything to rectify the situation.. when our server came back to the table i asked him if he was ok bc i didnt understand what exchange had prompted him to start being so rude to us all of a sudden.. then he raised his hands again and rolled his eyes and said "its just a job im just doing my job and walked away" like WTF 

Moral of the story, my first and last time ever coming back here.
author: Zakiya B.

description:
Came here the other for my friend's birthday! The wait was about 1.5 hrs (for a group of 14) but it's not too bad since the pier has so much going on that killing time was easy. There's a nice arcade bar downstairs that you can grab a few drinks and play games as you wait. 

This was my first time at bubba! I've always heard about it, but I never took the time to drive up here to dine at this restaurant. It's pricey if you're not into paying a lot for a dish, BUT do keep in mind that it is a seafood place. So for that reason, the price is actually reasonable. They serve a variety of dishes: fish tacos,  burgers, surf and turf, and much more. They also have a nice bar with quick service! 

The atmosphere is great. All of the waiters and waitresses are friendly and do look like they're having a fun time at work. Our server Michael was super fun! Every table apparently is asked trivia questions about Forrest Gump! Our table did pretty damn well since we had two big Forrest Gump fans. Michael was helpful and he checked up on us often. Even other waiters/waitresses would check up on us every now and then. 

So the food! Everything looked and tasted amazing (no one complained about their food). I had the baja fish tacos, grilled. It was delicious. The fish was cooked perfectly and flour tortilla is my favorite so that was a plus. I love that they served the condiments for the tacos on the side. That way, I could measure how much I wanted on my taco, and it also prevents the tortilla from soaking up the liquid and tearing apart. 

I was able to try their fries and it was very tasty! Like everything else, cooked perfectly. There's this tangy sauce (orange/yellow color) they had served with a shrimp order and it was great to dip fries/chips in as well. I may ask for that sauce on the side the next time I visit. 

Visit bubba gump whenever you're in the city! Great food and great atmosphere :)
author: Gina N.

description: Decided to go to The City last Saturday with few friends because we just decided to go out. And decided where to eat and thought why not Bubba Gumps. I've been here before, and every the first time was alright.. ( except where we were seated, that table is in the most awkward places ever). This time around the waiter took a while to get to us. And only came by about two times to ask if we were good or needed anything. The food wasn't all that great, pretty bland. And their fries were soggy.. this time around I was disappointed, hopefully next time I decide to go it's a better experience .
author: Mehzabeen M.

description: I put my name down for a table for 3 and was told 15-20 min before I would be seated. After 30 I checked and was told at least another 20 min. I waited and waited and waited. I have now been waiting for 2 hours and 13 min and still no seat available. I understand that this place gets busy but really??!?!?! I will never try to come here again.
author: Ariel W.

description:
Pros:

Good food. Good service. Awesome view if you are seated by the window.

Cons:

Crowded. Loud.

But this is my 2nd time here, and I'd still come back. :)
author: Mel L.

description:
If I like to eat peel and eat shrimp I would go to Boiling Crab in San Jose. I came here for fun and entertainment. We ordered the following

Bucket shrimp with corn, and sausages. The shrimp is overcooked. No skin to peel, no shrimp head to savor. No bueno.
I had a bite of the ribs, must change the name of this resto to Bubba Ribs. 

Service is attentive, warm, fun and entertaining esp. Ryan. I recommend that his boss gives him a deserving raise for going above and beyond of being a server.. Because of him I would rate 4 instead of 3.

Key lime pie is homemade. Strawberry shortcake is THE best!
author: Carolina H.

description:
First off we came here since we got a coupon book from the Welcoming Center. The coupon was for a free Dip App. So we sat down in the bar area since it was open seating and didn't want to wait. We were hungry!  Haha. 

Service was terrible. Our free appetizer came out after our food. The manager came over and offered to remedy the situation by taking money off the bill but I was already upset so it didn't really help. 

When it was time to pay the waiter swiped my credit card for twice the amount of my bill... of course he fixed it. But that's not that point.  Careless mistake.

Really not a pleasant experience. They really need to get it together.
author: Michelle S.

description: So went here on Saturday and try there steamed crab legs and it wasn't that good. I was better off going to Joe's Crab Shack. I love the services and the garlic bread and drink but every thing else I didn't like. I was a busy day for Mother's Day weekend had to wait 30 minutes.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
I personally don't find the food here that great to warrant their crazy prices, however, the atmosphere they create is fun and mostly what you pay for. Be prepared for crazy waits, Forrest Gump trivia, and underwhelming food.

I came with two friends from college and naturally we got some drinks. According to our waiter, the drink with the best alcohol to cost ratio (aka the cheapest drink with the most alcohol) is Bubba's Blue Hawaiian...Definitely agree.

I personally recommend getting any of the sandwiches (Dixie fishwhich or shrimp po boy) as they're pretty solid, come with fries (woot!) and only around $13-15 compared to $20-30 entrees. You can get better seafood anywhere else on the pier honestly. My friend got the jambalaya and she definitely was not full at the end of her meal.

Overall, I think it's a fun experience for what you make out of it!
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
Believe it or not I have not seen the movie...Forrest Gump.  I am very familiar with it; in fact I did rather well with the quiz that our server, KALEY, had for us.  I have eaten at BUBBA GUMP'S SHRIMP in Osaka...very nice.
The BUBBA GUMP'S SHRIMP here in Pier 39 is quite nice. Nice view, if you are fortunate enough to get seating with a nice view, and while we are on the topic of seating....we did not have a reservation and there was a line when we arrived.  We were told that the line would move rather swiftly and that the wait would be 5-10 minutes.  True to word...that was the case.  We were seated and enjoyed delicious, fattening, unhealthy American cuisine at its finest.
The atmosphere and ambiance were nice; very good service and we left stuffed, full and happy.
There are many options for dining in the Pier 39 area of San Francisco...BUBBA GUMP'S SHRIMP should be at the top of your list.
author: Caliph A.

description:
Gorgeous views of Alcatraz and the Bay Bridge, but average food.

You know this place -- it's the result of that Forest Gump movie. They have one in every major city and the menu is always the same. High calorie, average American seafood fare. The servers are hit or miss, but luckily, we got a good one.

We ordered the calamari as a starter, but when our entrees came out before the calamari, we declined it. Our waiter let us keep it if we wanted because obviously, the kitchen couldn't do anything with it anymore. We kept it, and it was typical deep-fried goodness. For my entree, I ordered the Accidental Fish & Shrimp (halibut and shrimp served over jasmine rice). It was pretty good, but a bit salty for my taste. The sauce was the saving grace for this dish. My sister ordered the I'm Stuffed Shrimp and my parents ordered the Shrimp New Orleans. They seemed satisfied with their food.

Since it was my sister's birthday, the waiter had everyone sing Happy Birthday and they gave her a sundae in a cup!
author: Leana L.

description: Antony was amazing. He was personable and suggested some yummy items from the menu! We sat right at the window, with a beautiful view. The food was perfect but Antony made the whole experience even better!
author: Laura T.

description: Place was busy but had out my name down for a text back as here's always a lot to look around at on the fisherman wharf absolutely beautiful ... specially since it was my first time ..once we got our text back we were seated shortly after arriving back there .. took as a while to get our orders down as no one had came by but once our waiter came he had explained that if we ever need anything flip the sign that's on our table which say "stop forest stop " so we had ordered the 2 1-2 shrimp bucket .. me and my wife shared it .. the flavours where mild but not too bad we had the Cajun style shrimp .. tasted fairly decent only problem was we waited 40 minutes  for our shrimp and they were over cooked .. it was my first time and nothing about the occasion would bring me back but defiantly  worth a visit if you were a Forrest Gump fan .. our waiter was very polite tho
author: Ivraan K.

description: Came here with my family late on Friday night for dinner. Took us a while to figure out what exactly what we wanted to order, but majority of us ordered seafood. We started off with an order of calimari and two order of garlic bread. The garlic bread was okay, nothing too special and the calimari contained spicy pepper in it. I was not too fond of it. I ordered the dumb luck shrimp which was a handful of coconut battered fried shrimp with fries! It was delicious, but I was not able to finish it. My sister ordered a dish that was pretty salty, my cousin ordered the shrimp scampi pasta and liked it, and my cousin in law ordered the shrimp po boy. Our sever was super kind and helpful! Truly a patient server! This place is overall pretty touristy and expensive so keep that in mind when planning to eat here. My dish itself was $20.  I would recommend folks who are big shrimp lovers and love forrest gump to try this place out. This restaurant is obviously based off the movies. I would come back, but not any time soon.
author: Danika P.

description: If I could give this place zero stars I would. I was visiting San Francisco with a friend, and we were given free vouchers for this restaurant. We went during happy hour, but happy hour is only served at the Bar. Our server told us it was ok to go up to the bar and get happy hour drinks. My friend went up first, got a drink. Then I went up next. When I went up to the bar, the bartender (a man with long black hair) asked me if I came from a table. I said yes. Then he proceeds to tell me he can't serve me and I have to order drinks from my table (full price.) I say "excuse me?" He goes "Yeh someone got in trouble for it before, sorry." He tells me I can come back when I'm done eating. I tell him "happy hour will be over by then." He just looks at me like "yehhhhh." Did this man really just tell me how to spend my money? I tell my server this and she tells me she has been working there forever and has never heard of his none existent policy. Now I'm wondering if the guy was lying to me. Turns out there was another bartender my friend got the drink from. Rather than make a fuss with the manager, I just sat there as my friend enjoyed her discounted drink. Second gripe. As a restaurant that is promoted as a SEAFOOD restaurant, I would expect them to know how to fix seafood. I ordered the crab legs and they were terrible. They were crumbly and fell apart. Horrible! Oh well. I don't live there and had vouchers for the meal. But I would advise anyone who wants REAL seafood to go elsewhere.
author: Ashley T.

description: I've never been to Bubba Gump Shrimp before so when I saw it on the pier I decided this would be the day.  My waiter was very personable and even sat at each of the tables for a few minutes asking trivia about the movie.  That wasn't something I'd normally do either.  It was a nice touch.  The view can't be beat!  The menu seemed less than spectacular, to be honest.  I'm very health conscious and didn't find too much in that regard (my fault, not the restaurant's).  I settled on the shrimp stuffed with crabmeat and cheese and I added a side salad.  It was very good.  The blueberry lemonade was delicious.
author: Debbie H.

description: Horrible service. Takes almost an hour to get your food only to have half of your meal brought out. Imani the waitress rude . Save your money go somewhere else to eat at the Pier.
author: Gaby C.

description: This is my second time here at Bubble.  Omg the  first time honesty deserve a 5 start rate. But it was 3 years ago. Service was good today no complaints at all. It just was other ppl there complaining making it hard for me and my fiancé to enjoy our meal. My finance didn't care for the Fish and chips. At first I though he was complaining and I took a taste and yes no seasoning at all. Garlic fries were good and my popcorn shrimp was great. My Zombie drink was Strong like I like it. I recommend it! But over price for average Sea Food. $80 bucks on what!!?
author: Carletta L.
