description: I've been here a few times already and I have to say last night was the biggest disappointment! The only reason it is getting a second star is because the wait was half of what they said! First off- took a while to greet, then I ordered a strawberry lemonade- received it super watered down so I asked him to just get me a water instead. Then we ordered and my boyfriend only wanted a shrimp app but decided a few minutes later to order the ribs item. My food came out only maybe 15 minutes later and I decided to wait for him to get his food. 20 minutes... no food, I start eating. 40 minutes... still no food!! We tell our server and he looked confused as if he didn't even put the order in but then was like "oh yeah! I'll go check on it" then came to tell us it should be out in a few minutes. 10 minutes go by STILL NO FOOD! We told about 3 different workers where was his food. Server was totally avoiding contact with us because he knew he messed up. Finally 5-10 minutes and they bring his food. Seriously??? I waited to eat my food and then I am the slowest eater and I was already finished with my food by the time he got his. I'm shocked that they didn't even offer to take it off the bill after we waited almost an hour for it. I'm just so disappointed. Do better!
author: Giselle O.

description: So I called here around 1 to set up a reservation at 1:45 and the lady on the phone said "you don't have to make a reservation, it won't be busy" little did she know!! i got there!!! and it was busy!!!! hahaha if i call to make a reservation let me make my reservation :)
author: Citlalli Y.

description: Horrible experience on a Christmas night. I sat at the bar and ordered POPCORN SHRIMP. When the food came out and i asked for the fork from the bartender who is Don. I kind of looking at me with a weird look and telling me that most of the people eat that with their hand. What is wrong to eat with a fork when you customer asked for it. He should have just get it for me instead of telling me what to use to eat thay shrimp in front of me. Horrible service... If he doesnt like to work on the holiday day then dont come in to work but if he chooese to come in cuz of the holiday pay then better shows some good service to the customer.
author: Annette T.

description: It's been a while since I've been to Bubba Gump's. I love the movie and the food is tasty. My boyfriend and I split the bucket of boat trash and we also ordered the appetizer sampler. The restaurant was busy but the staff were professional and friendly. Try to get a seat by the windows and enjoy the amazing view of SF bay.
author: Nina M.

description: More about the experience,  left some things to be desired. I'm not a big seafood fan but my mom wanted shrimp so we went here because there menu was big and i could always order something besides seafood. I ended up ordering the Dixie Fishwich (southern fried) which was ginormous.... it was good,  but was better with more of the sauce,  and had too much breading where some needed to be scraped off. Mom had Forrest's Seafood Feast and she thought it was good,  but everything was fried again and all looked the same.   Her favorite was the hush puppies and I really liked the cajun fries. The service was good, the atmosphere was fun and our server asked us Forrest Gump movie trivia as we waited for our food. Like I said,  it was more about the experience,  the food was ok,  but not the best ever.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
I loved the Bubba Gump's in Monterey Bay, CA so I was super excited to try one located more locally. From the moment we walked in, we went up to the host stand, got ignored for a bit while she joked with a coworker and then finally were informed to move on to a different host stand. Okay? So we migrate to the other one. Were greeted immediately but then this host ignores us for a while which I would understand if she were waiting for a table to clear but no, because once again, this host is joking with coworkers until an entirely different person comes up and asks if we've even been helped yet and then we're immediately seated. So after finally being seated, I have to say I love the decor and layout of this Bubba Gump a lot more than the Monterey location. We weren't even seated by the window but we still had an amazing view of the bay. We had two servers (since our first server's shift was over mid-meal) and while we may have had shitty customer service from the hosts, our waiters were AMAZING. KENNY S. and I believe our original waiter's name was KEVIN, were both absolutely great. Truly top notch! 

Now on to the food, I always order the shrimper's heaven which I loooove. Comes with 4 different styles of shrimp and fries. I also ordered the coronitas (the regular margarita one and the special one). The drinks were bleh. I regret ordering them. They're overpriced at 14 dollars and not even good. The syrup was so thick and, no matter how much I stirred, was not dissolving well. The alcohol wasn't strong at all. I mean, for double-fisting two of these and not even getting a slight buzz was upsetting. The food was great but I have to say that I much prefer the Monterey location's food and especially the drinks. 

To sum it up, great service from waiters although the hosts kind of suck. The food was good, but mixed drinks were not. While I prefer the Monterey location, I have to say that the decor for the SF one is better!
author: Gabby U.

description:
YayyyY!! Great food, great service! The scenery is soooo beautiful! They had these little license plates on the table that read something like "run forest run" "stop forest stop" one blue and one red. Red- "Stop Forest Stop" meant that you needed a waiter to come to you. The cool thing about that was that ANY of them approached us. It didn't have to be our waiter. What a relief from other restaurants where you have to follow your waiter with your eyes and wait till you make eye contact. and when you do... be careful not to give them the stink eye! lol! Any who... I liked my coconut shrimp and fries! The hot sauce tasted like Crystal hot sauce but I love me some Crystal hot sauce! So all in all... great place! 
I didn't have any drinks that night but they looked awesome and no complaints at all from my table. They got that upside down coronita drink too... ;)
author: Barbara B.

description: If you plan to eat here than I would suggest planning out activities that can keep you busy for at least 1-2 hours depending on how busy the place is. We waited for an hour an 15 min before getting our table. One thing that's a plus is that they take your cell phone number to text you when the table is ready so till then you can walk around the pier. We only ordered the appetizers as we were just trying out the place. The shrimp was amazing, had the perfect amount of seasoning and sauce, and of course the fries were well seasoned. They offer many different types of entrée, which entail more shrimp since that's what they are known for. If your a shrimp lover than you are definitely going to enjoy this place. The atmosphere is hip and happening with music, and if your lucky to snag a sit by the window then you will get to enjoy an amazing view. The customer was alright it wasn't exceptional, we had many different waiters so it did get confusing when we had questions about our orders. Also, if you need to get a hold of a waiter or when your ready to order than they have a sign on the table that you flip to get attended. "Run Forrest run" sign is when you don't need their service and "Stop Forrest Stop" is when a waiter will come to your table; otherwise, if you get your food don't expect anyone to come and check on you or your food. Overall a three star place.
author: Natisha R.

description: Very good people and good service good sense of humor.... I will comeback here! Michael is serving us well
author: Edgardo John P.

description:
Okay, I know it's a chain. But we really wanted a place with a view for our last meal in San Fran and this was at the Pier, plus it offered shrimp mac & cheese, so we were sold!

My group of 5 came in, STARVING, and we were told it would be a 45 min to 50 min wait. Disheartened,  we gave the hostess a contact number,  thinking we could wait the wait. 

We left and got some of Trish's Mini Donuts, hoping to sustain a tiny bit of hunger,  and LUCKILY, they called us 20 minutes later with an open table! 

We sat right at the end of the Pier - an absolutely gorgeous view - and we spotted a sea lion, wanting to say hi to everyone! We were seated and immediately were told how this place works (the Run Forrest Run, and Stop Forrest Stop signs). We ordered a few drinks (Blue Hawaiian,  Sangria, Bloody Mary, and Lemon Twist - the Bloody Mary was OK. I've had much better) then ordered. 

Service was prompt, nice, and very enthusiastic (Forrest Gump trivia!). It took a while for out waters but they were swamped, so it was a bit understandable. 

The stuffed mushrooms & shrimp mac & cheese was AMAZING. CRISPY on top, perfect cooked and soft at the bottom and packed a ton of flavor in to every bite.

I ordered the Cajun Shrimp 2/3 lb catch and the shrimp was perfectly cooked - slightly raw but not really raw at all, if that makes any sense. For a Cajun dish, though, it was really lacking in the flavor department. I had to make my own side sauce of lime, salt, and pepper.

Fish tacos were ordinary fish tacos. The Shrimp Po Boy..  not so great. It was just the wrong kind of bread for a Po Boy - like a sub sandwich. Too doughy, no crispness and no flavor. It would've been better if they used a Baguette as the bread, instead.

All in all, it was a great experience. Overpriced, though. This turned out to be our most expensive meal the entire trip and we barely got as much food as we did at other places. The shrimp cocktail was ridiculously priced. 

The drinks were good. I don't think we'll come back here for a while though, but their service is spectacular!
author: Michelle M.

description: We did not have to wait long for a table.  The atmosphere is upbeat. The food is fair but definitely not great. My husband received a plate of food with a long piece of hair stuck in his  coleslaw- rather gross.  The drinks are overpriced.
author: Victoria C.

description: Overly priced for subpar food. This is one of those places you may just want to go for a souvenir cup just to say you've been to "Forrest's" restaurant.  Besides the beautiful views surrounding the dining room...nothing special about these shrimps.
author: Carlos F.

description:
3 star because The environment was awesome and the service was great. They would come up to you with questions about the movie, Forrest Gump, which was pretty cool if it was your first time there.

Only bad thing is that the food they served, they have a picture of real shrimps on their menu but what they serve are shrimps that you get from one of those bags in safeway. It was not worth $15. I was expecting the shrimp with the head still attached on it. Lol 

But other than that, their service was great. And if you parked by the parking lot near there, Bubba Gump actually pays half your ticket.
author: Jericho Andrei L.

description:
Today I went to bubba gump it was the worse
Service ever. It was very disappointing because I have been their so many times and had received great service. Today I went with 15 ppl you would think they would have taken good care of u...nope not at all. Service was bad n the food was horrible. When I say it was bad. When u asked the manager for some help all they say I am sorry. I would never come back again.....i would give them no stars but u have to put a star on their.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Visited yesterday (04-01-17). My 15 yr old son was threatened by another customer who was an adult male in the waiting area. I talked to the manager to inform him of the situation and he went above and beyond to make us feel comfortable and get us away from the bully asap. I will definitely bring more business to this establishment. Thank you to all who helped my family and I yesterday. Means alot to me that even in a high volume touristy place the manager was a down to earth human being.
author: Victoria C.

description:
Though the wait is always long, it's crowded, and the food is named after Forrest Gump references, it holds a dear place in my heart. I have visited this location many times throughout my life and recently, I ate here with the wife and kids.

Tip: the changing table is in the handicap stall in both restrooms.

I don't know why, but we mentioned high chairs and the hostess tried to offer us a booth. That don't work, I think she was hoping we would go for boosters, but the kids ain't there yet. We declined and scored a window table! I forgot exactly what I got, but it was a little smaller than I thought. It had snow crab, clams and mussels, I forget if there was lobster. The kids had a icon shrimp meal, I forget what the wife had. Food was ok (it's bubba gumps after all).

One thing that annoyed me was that I asked the waiter for a few extra bibs for the kids. He said it will be brought out with the food. Don't see the server for a long time. Food comes out and I don't see extra bibs so I ask for some from the guy who brought the food. Sure he says..never see that guy again. We flip the "stop Forrest stop" sign and another server got us extra bibs in a few minutes. Liked how hard would it have been for the other two dudes to do that? Our server drops in right after. I know it's petty to get hung up on stuff like this but I hate repeating myself. I don't like tiling less either because my kids make a mess sometimes and I'm
not going to screw the bussers for the other people. 

This satisfied my bubba gumps craving for some time, I think I'll work on training my kids to eat at a nice table so that we can bring them to Thang Long
author: Chris C.

description: I Come Over Here is Nice Place, But the Food is Ok.. So i really don't know what to say About this Place... The service is Ok.. Other than that three star should be fair...
author: A T.

description: The food was great. The service was not so much! My daughter order has a fruit cup that did not make it to the table. The drinks and food did not come together as we wished. Asked for a table by the window and we got one.
author: Nurah K.

description: Poor service , food was mediocre .. My first and last time because if the service was great and the food was okay, I'd return but when u have okay food and poor service , I won't return .. When I first sat at the bar I was asked if I was waiting on a table or was I going to order , One should never assume.. I understand this location is busy but that's no excuse for poor service
author: Trinoon H.

description: This BubbaGumps looks over the ocean and you can see the Bay bridge. We were there at sunset and it made for a nice view! The young men that waited on us were awesome but I can't remember their names. Unfortunately we weren't thrilled with the food. I love coconut shrimp so I  went with that. I received 7 small shrimp and some fries for $20. It wasn't great, Red Lobsters is much better. They had a sign mentioning to sign up for their email club and receive an email for a discount for that visit. Never received he email and the waiter said he didn't know what I was talking about! Oh well, not to thrilled.
author: Lori L.

description:
I absolutely love Bubba Gumps!! 

Food is always delicious!! My favorite item is the fish and chips- it is a lot of food you can definitely share!! I've tried the shrimp pasta and that was delicious too!!

Alcoholic Drinks are strong!!! 

Getting a seat is a long long wait- they have a very small waiting area and that sucks when it's cold outside.  Service when inside is normally pretty fast- I had one terrible server out of ten good ones. That's about normal.
author: Sabra F.

description: I come here everytime I go go SF, sure the food is a bit overpriced since it attracts a lot of tourists and brings in a lot of money, however the food is great the atmosphere is great and the view is just beautiful! Most times when I come here I try to snag a table by the windows to get a great you (which works most of the time) the con about this place is, since they're in a hurry to serve a lot of customers some of the food is undercooked or overcooked but other than that I would come here over and over again!
author: Alona K.

description: I love coming to Bubba Gump! I just took a trip here again last Saturday to celebrate my sister's birthday. My family and I come here for birthday parties or just for a fun time for the weekend. It does get packed especially on weekends so it's best to put your name down first and if the wait time is long then I suggest walking around the pier and checking out Fishermans Wharf. There's also an arcade you can go to, to kill time around that area! Service is always great here, the workers almost always seem enthusiastic and full of energy. Food is great, it's kind of pricy but overall I enjoy spending my time here with my family.
author: Mae-Elisa S.

description: What can I say?  It was the perfect end to a perfect "tourist" day in SF. Thank you for finally satisfying my sons craving for all things shrimp. Unfortunately my youngsters have never seen the movie so the decor and menu didn't make a lot of sense to them--but I loved it. GREAT VIEW!!!
author: Carmen L.

description: If you are craving shrimp or seafood this is definitely the best place to go to. There shrimp is packed with flavor and I recommend going here . But even though  the food was great and all the wait to be seated wasn't , I think my family and I waited for about 1 hour and 45 minutes and another 20 just to be seated . (Mind you there was only 3 of us ) So if you want great food go here but don't expect to be seated immediately .
author: Avianna J.

description:
Yummy! 

Shrimp scampi is by far my favorite. We had a very nice view of the pier and our server was very friendly and attentive and even played bubba gump trivia with us! 

We ate lunch here on a weekday after visiting the aquarium. It was pretty busy but service was reasonable and the food came out in a reasonable fashion. I was not a fan of the macaroni appetizer however, it was too watery but no big deal I wanted to try something new and sometimes you have to gamble. 

I would return next time I'm in SF :-)
author: Nikisha S.

description: This is our usual go to place EVERY SINGLE TIME we visit San Francisco, which is pretty often since we live about 1 1/2 hours away. The last couple times we have gone haven't been too great, so we were on the fence about going last week, but decided to go anyways. BAD DECISION! The wait wasn't too bad, about 20 min since we went a little after they opened. The food was good as usual, but the rest of our experience was awful. The staff was just rude, the vibe was just totally off. Our waitress took our drink & food order quick because we knew what we wanted. I ordered my daughter a slurpee, which she never got but was charged for it on my receipt. We also ordered a appetizer & told the girl we had a coupon for it. Our appetizer came out AFTER our food. Really?! We were there for maybe an hour & our waitress came to check on us 1 time. My husband asked for a refill on his sprite. The waitress filled his cup up with water even after telling her it was sprite. I never got a refill when I was there. We got our bill back with the charge for the slurpee we never got & for the appetizer that we said we had a free coupon for. So we asked to speak to a manager. Even he was rude. Not to mention it was HOT in the restaurant. My 4 year old was red, sweaty & whiny because how hot it was. It was 85 that day, which is super hot for SF, but still. The restaurant shouldn't be that hot. I honestly don't think we will ever return to this location again, which makes me sad because that was one of the reasons we went to SF. I hope they get their stuff together. Maybe some new staff. The staff didn't seem to give a crap about anything.
author: michelle p.

description: Most excellent food! Definitely recommend captain's fish and chips! Appetizer of the day, spinach and artichoke dip with chips also fantabulous!
author: Who D.

description:
Bubba Gump is located upstairs at the end of the pier. It's a fun tourist attraction that offers a nice view of the water. You can see Alcatraz and the bay bridge from the window.

However, I wouldn't recommend coming here for the food. The wait was long, and service was nice but really slow. I got the shrimp tacos, and they were mediocre. There are much better options in the area.
author: Aimee Z.

description: Wait wait wait wait wait outside for one and half hour and finally seated and then waited another 30 minutes to have water and another 40 minutes to have food...food is good that's why I'm giving an additional star...I hope this place could seriously think about how they could serve the food faster...(but considering it's Saturday night, it MAY be better during weekdays)
author: Yuan H.

description: The food was ok. I have been many times but I guess last night the cook didn't have any love. Our waiter was super cool. We never had to flag him down. The bartenders were really cool too.
author: Donyell A.

description:
Yummy food - but expensive!
Spent almost $100 on lunch.
Beautiful views and super cute theme decorations.
author: Carrie W.

description:
Yes. It was expensive. Yes, there was a wait. Yes, the service was not as fast as we would have liked. But I mean...it's a tourist attraction.
However, the food was delicious, our server was hilarious and the view was to die for. My group was lucky enough to get a window seat, where we were able to watch the boats on the water. And even just waiting to be seated had a view that was incredible.
Our server asked us trivia, as it seems they are trained to do, however she did not seem bored by it and responded with a lot of enthusiasm. They also have cute little signs that work to get the waiter's attention, instead of making you flag them down every time you need something.
I would definitely recommend this restaurant who liked the movie, or just wants a good place to eat while they're on the Pier!
author: Katelyn R.

description: Great service staff and shrimp! Waiters were friendly and prompt, and the food was great (even for me, who doesn't like shrimp all that much). Our view of Alcatraz out the window was a great backdrop to dinner.
author: Eric L.

description: Worst service ever!!! never coming again the people working where being very rude what the hell is bubba gump know about treating customers
author: Jorge V.

description:
We ventured into this popular tourist destination, on Pier 39, one Saturday and decided to explore this "Forrest Gump" spin-off franchise for lunch.  Since I enjoyed the movie and l love seafood, I had high expectations for Bubba Gump Shrimp.  My first experience at this location left me saying...eh, the food isn't too shabby, but most things on the menu were overpriced, which was to be expected.

Our picks:
1. Shrimp scampi - shrimp tossed over linguine pasta; it was creamy and lemony but tasted bland.  Portion size was small for the price.

2. Caesar salad: nice salad with tender grilled chicken and fresh romaine lettuce.

3. Dixie Fishwich: quite tasty and portion was huge.  The fries that came along with the dish were seriously good!  

4. Forest seafood feast: included fried shrimp, fish and chips, and hush puppies.  All were delicious!  

The magnificent view of Pier 39 and the finer details of the movie decorations across the restaurant really made this place memorable.  The service was friendly, but perhaps too friendly - they quizzed us on Movie Trivia while we were busy stuffing our faces, haha!  I did get 2 out of 3 right, though, as I was devouring those shrimps ;)

Overall, it was not the best seafood place on Pier 39.  However, food was decent and I would come again for the atmosphere and the great service.
author: Veronica C.

description:
I'm very disappointment of this place!!  the food is good, but the portions are really small, the prices are really expensive and they don't have anything like forks and silverware for the to go orders don't even ketchup. 
I don't recommend this place at all!!
author: Lina A.

description:
I think this place is too hyped. I went there and it was extremely  busy and had to wait almost an hour before our turn. Servers are friendly, atmosphere is nice but Food is alright. 
I wouldn't go there again but it wasn't too bad visiting once.
author: Ahmed Ali B.

description:
My friends and I stopped in after our Alcatraz tour.  The place is super adorable and it was super packed!  After the initial wait and we were seated, service was super speedy --- border-lining rushed.  Our server, Jenny, was really sweet and really sold us all sorts of food.  The four of us started off with the garlic bread basket [complimentary because she used some secret coupon or something], Bubba's Far Out Dip, and a pound of cajun spiced shrimp.  For entrees we shared shrimp tacos, two steamed shellfish, and the "Of Course We Have Scampi."

My favorite bite of the night had to be the cajun spiced shrimp appetizer.  It was flavorful and packed a punch!  I'd skip the garlic bread and the spinach & artichoke dip since it was nothing really special.  The shrimp tacos were okay, the steamed shellfish was decent, and the scampi was delicious but a bit on the saltier side with the overload of capers.

Overall it was a fun gimmicky place to try and it's cool how they let you  keep the light-up cup from ordering a Strawberry Freeze.  I'd come back only the cajun shrimp.
author: Joyce W.

description:
When visiting San Francisco, my husband and I have a favorite way to end our night. On the Pier until sunset, then dinner at Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. Now don't get my wrong, Pier 39 has many wonderful places to eat, who doesn't like clam chowder in sourdough bread bowls? I can't help myself, I LOVE shrimp, and I love Forrest Gump, and this restaurant is a wonderful homage to this classic movie. This time on our trip to the city, we brought our two best friends along for the ride. I wanted to show my friend Sara San Francisco because she had never been, and seeing as how her hunny loves shrimp we all decided on Bubba Gump's!

The wait time was a bit long, about 45 minutes. However they offer a text message when your table is ready, therefore we continued browsing the shops until our text came. Once we were sat, the fun began! Our waitress came instantly and took our drink orders, along with explaining how the Stop and Run Forrest Run sign works. When it's on Run Forrest Run, wait staff knows to keep going, but once flipped to stop, any wait staff to see it will stop and ask what you need! I love this system because getting service is much quicker.

The menu has SO many different shrimp options, it really is hard to decide what to get! It used to be the wait staff would ask you trivia questions from the movie too...I don't know if they've stopped doing it, or only do it when its not so busy...but when they do, it really adds to the experience and I enjoy it...plus it buys me some more time to look at the menu because I can never decide!!

We started with Mama Gump's Garlic Bread Basket because who doesn't love garlic bread? The bread is very yummy in my opinion; a good amount of butter and garlic makes it perfect. Sara Ordered the, "Of course we have Scampi" Shrimp Scampi. Her hunny ordered the, "I'm Stuffed!" Shrimp, I ordered the Shrimper's Heaven and my hubby ordered the All American BBQ Burger. We all tried each other's for optimum sampling! Sara's scampi was amazing! Full of capers, tomatoes and lemon garlic butter, this pasta is really tasty! The stuffed Shrimp was one of my favorite things tried that night! They were loaded with crabmeat stuffing and Monterey jack cheese with garlic butter...I may just be in love with Garlic Butter TBH!! My Shrimper's heaven was great and I instantly fell madly in love with the coconut shrimp with the best Cajun marmalade ever. I found myself finishing everyone's dinners when they all offered me the rest! A 4 hour long drive home doesn't make for good leftovers after all. There was simply no room for dessert, but we all left San Francisco with happy hearts and happy stomachs! I can't wait for the next time we can go!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Service is garbage. Manager sat us down as a party of 8 for my Dad's bday. 10 minutes later, they came back only to tell us to get up due to the table being reserved for another party. I don't think I can find another restaurant that will seat you, let you order drinks and begin reviewing the menu, only to be told to get up.

In the end, we stood our ground after a small argument with the management. So we kept our table but not without them ruining the night. 

Don't do it! McDonald's will serve you better!
author: Ian L.

description: Whitney was our waitress- she was so sweet with 5 star service, not our first visit to this location, but this gal made us feel like she cared about what we wanted and not rushed even though it was really really busy- Tuesday after Christmas was chaos at pier 39... Our food was awesome as usual but out of all the time we have eaten at Bubba Gumps, this was the best service!  Whitney, you rock!
author: Donnette T.

description:
I've heard so much about this place, especially since my husband's favorite movie is "Forrest Gump". we've been wanting to come eat here for a while, finally, yesterday may 31st 2016 my 25th birthday, my husband decided to surprise me by bringing me there, oh shall i say we weren't expecting much, but oh boy everything was so good &filling... expect to pay 60+ for 2... 
we had an appetizer, 2 drinks &2 entrees paid over 90+ dollars, but then again it was so tasty
author: Sandy H.

description: Absolutely terrible service! Waiting time is about 30 min, then they send you text message and you think that you will be seated. But in fact in is only the beginning because you will wait additional 20-30 min in a line inside. Very strange practice!!!! Will never back on pier 39 restaurant.
author: Lana P.

description: Great location, but service wasn't great. We waited in a line for 5 minutes to be seated an a semi empty restaurant. We did a lot of waiting and never got water refills. Ordered the shrimpers heaven and in my basket of coconut shrimp there was 2 and a ball of batter.  What's up with that?  It felt like a giant corporate business that didn't care about customers.  I wouldn't go back.  Such a waste
author: Kristy R.

description:
It's ok. My brother ordered a steak and that thing came out tiny! For the price we were expecting something at least filling. We also ordered the shrimp to share between two people which was plenty with a side order of the shrimp mac n cheese. It seemed like the food got cold super quick which was one of the downsides and I had hoped the shrimp would have more flavor. The garlic bread was good! The kid's order was cool for them because it came in a little paper boat tray. 

All the hanging memorabilia of the Forrest Gump movie is cool to look at & my niece enjoyed being in charge of the little flip sign they have (one side says run forrest and the other I think says stop or something like that) where any waiter can stop to help you. Which is convenient you don't have to wait forever for your own waiter to come back to you. Our waiter was awesome though- great customer service but just wished the food was what it was hyped up to be. They also quiz you on the Forrest Gump movie too!
author: Vanessa G.

description: Ordered the fish tacos ... they were waaay over cooked did not look appealing and taste was very bland ... the popcorn shrimp appetizer was a better choice tasted a lot better . Service was great tho
author: Mayra S.

description:
Bourbon mahi mahi. Never disappoints.
Hush puppies can be better but they are good, ask for extra sauce
author: Carlos A.

description:
Used to be an annual trip for my daughter and I. Loved coming to the city and eating at Bubba Gump's. But we were so disappointed at our trip this year. Our waiter was very lackluster. No smile, no trivia, no nothing. My 9 year old was not offered a kids menu, not even after we asked for one. Our appetizer came out with the entrees. Another waiter had to assist us when ours couldn't be bothered with us. I was given and paid for a souvenir cup I specifically said I didn't want. Uber disappointed and will spend my money elsewhere next trip.
On the other hand, in December we visited the one in Anaheim and had a superb time and the staff there were excellent.
author: Kris S.

description: Was excited at first to grab happy hour but after our long pointless visit, would definitely not recommend for parties with 5 or more. Went in and was greeted by obviously new employees and asked to sit at happy hour. But they basically said first come first serve followed by some attitude  when asked how long it would be to get seated. But it's impossible when there isn't enough seats for 5 people to sit together. Asked to speak to manger, never came. After deciding to leave, found the manager but didn't really seem to care what had happened
author: Bernice H.

description:
For what it is, it's great. A fun atmosphere nothing fancy or fine dining. Good for first dates.

Def don't come here if you're gonna go on a diet.

Ordered the fish and chips ($20)and shrimp heaven($23) The fish was so fresh and they hire you large portions! Tasted so good! And the coconut shrimp is the best! Shrimp was fresh and coconut shavings were nicely fried. I wish I could keep eating but the portions were so big we had leftovers. 

Come, drink and have a fun time

Also got a coronarita which is margarita and a corona and it was delish! Could be stronger....
author: Josie L.

description:
Food= Average, but location and environment is beautiful! Can't beat the view

Being located on the Fisherman's Wharf, this place is highly popular. Bubba Gump is nothing special to me since it's a large corporate chain that's overpriced. The place is always busy and it seems like you have to dodge through a lot of people to get to your seat. It's a very family-friendly environment full of color and noise. 

I usually order one of the shrimp entrees or the big Seafood Bucket full of clams, mussels, and shrimp. I think the food here is overpriced and not too different from the quality of Red Lobster and Olive Garden. 

What I really loved was THE VIEW. There's large windows that pier over the Fisherman's wharf. It's beautiful. If you can get a spot close to the window, that's great.
author: Thao P.

description: My wife and I had the combo plate which included shrimp, fish, fries, and hush puppies.  We also ordered clam chowder.  Servers were excellent....friendly, prompt, and helpful. Food was average except the clam chowder  which I would rate as "fair" at best. The chowder was more like soup than chowder...good flavor though...just too thin. Place was packed and yet they got us in, seated, and served promptly.
author: Jim C.

description: Our party had been waiting for over an hour and a half for us to be forgotten and our spots to be given to several families. The food was tasteless, flavorless, given in small portions, and overpriced. This Bubba Gump had a beautiful view but terrible food. We felt as we paid for the brand name and not  for the quality food. I would not come back here and I would not recommend.
author: Bam B.

description:
The food wasn't that great, the service was mediocre, and the prices were ridiculously high. The only thing I liked about the place was it was Forrest Gump-themed. 

As a frequent SF visitor, I've had my fair share of Pier 39 restaurants. Clam Chowder is also my favorite food, therefore I am extremely picky with how restaurants or cafés execute this classic. 

My friend and I each only ordered a bowl of clam chowder, because everything else on the menu was far too expensive.
We hoped it would be a BREAD bowl. But they did not make bread bowls. It just a bowl, a very small bowl for the price you pay. It's $5.95 for a cup and $7.95 for a bowl, and the bowl had half of what I can get at the Pier Market or at Fog Harbor's. And it wasn't that special either. It had a somewhat of a tangy, tomato flavor that was actually pretty good. 


My other friend ordered some plate of coconut fried shrimp. There were 7 pieces and it was $21.95. Really? 

The Forrest Gump trivia the server gave us was annoying too. I love Forrest Gump, and so does one of my friends (he memorized every single line of the movie no joke), but we weren't in the mood with interacting with our server. We were there to talk about our own things, and it seemed as though they just forced us into it. 

gotta say the view here is pretty night though, but i'm never coming here again.
author: Sharon C.

description: REALLY GOOD VIEW FROM THE WINDOW TABLES.   BUT REALLY EXPENSIVE. This is my friends favorite restaurant he always gets the coconut shrimp (almost 20$ for shrimp and fries).  I got the Shrimp Po' Boy sandwich it filled me up for sure the bread was good the fries are alright and the shrimp was alright. The batter they cook it in doesn't have any seasoning and the tomatoes that they put on it are the same as an in and out burger so not what I'd pare with shrimp. It's cool tho they quiz you on the forest Gump movie
author: Oliver B.

description:
The food was really good.   I had Forest ' s seafood feast which had shrimp,  breaded fish,  hush puppies and fries.  The shrimp was juicy and tender and the fish was flaky and soft on the inside and crunchy on the out.

Sam was an excellent waiter and suggested my dish which was exactly what I wanted. 

Dessert was good.   I had the cookie sundae. It was delicious.   My boys got a good portion of that.

Food took a little while,  but the house was packed.   Besides,  it was worth the wait and you don't go to a place like this if you are in a hurry.
author: Rachel J.

description:
The views here is excellent so choose the windows seats if possible. We had lunch here and ordered 1.5 lbs of Shrimp and chowder. Both were good. The service is attentive and the atmosphere is cheery.

Now if I did not see the Forrest Gump movie and it had no window seats, would I still eat here? LOL
author: Caspere L.

description:
Beautiful view while enjoying a meal. The inside looks very fun. License plates and memorabilia all around.

I always get the mushroom burger with fries. It's amazing. 

Our waiter didn't give us any trivia questions which was pretty upsetting because that's what I always look forward to when I eat here. 

Also, they should have a challenge where if you answer 15 questions in a row correct, your plate is free!
author: Kalani M.

description: We wished we went somewhere else. I got a steamer bucket. It was so heavily seasoned that my corn was orange. My husband had New Orleans shrimp which was boring at best. The service was barely adequate. My suggestion is to skip the tourist trap and try one of the Italian seafood restaurants down the street.
author: Lisa H.

description: Been to Bubba Gump's several times and this time by far was the worst! The wait was long which is expected for coming on a Saturday night to the Pier. That was no problem so we sat ourselves at the bar counter for drinks. When ordering drinks we asked for a Bahama Mama and were told they can make it then 5 mins later told they couldn't because they were missing Banana Liqueur but that they can try to still make it. We just ordered something else and sat at the bar for about half hour never asked if we wanted anything else. Finally got their attention and ordered appetizers chips and spinach dip and Shrimpers Net Catch (half n half) we got seated before appetizers came out. While being seated i asked for a glass if water and we ordered and waited about another 15-20 mins for my water and our appetizers which when we got them were cold and not good!! Our main meal we ordered Po Boy sandwiches, fish tacos and a Dixie Fishwich. The Po Boy i was looking forward too but when we got then they were not good!! Just seemed bland and no flavor and the fries seemed old. Our other guest liked the fish tacos and the Dixie Fishwich was ify!
author: Catherine V.

description:
Fabo yummy!
Our server Samantha was cute as a button and attentive.
So very welcoming!!
Great meal!
author: Becky M.

description:
This Bubba Gump location is the worst one I've been to! My family chose to have lunch here because my little niece likes this place... The location is nice if you're able to sit at the tables and stare at the view of the bay while you wait for your food. Yes you'll need a nice view to distract you from the reallllyyyyy long wait for their overpriced dishes.

While our servers seemed friendly, they were extremely clumsy and somewhat forgetful. The kitchen was sooooo slow that day that we waited almost an hour for our food. My niece's food (something off the kids' menu) also came out later than the rest so she was getting really hungry and frustrated.

Anyway, the main dishes were not good. My shrimp scampi was bland and the only thing I liked was the bread. My mom's crab legs were overcooked and not fresh.... My sister's pork chops were also overcooked! Her fiance's dish was okay, and my dad's food was probably the only thing that was good and well seasoned on our table.

Worst meal on our 4th of July weekend for sure!
author: Glenn L.

description: Yesterday we went to have lunch because it's my favorite place. But, when we got there we tried to our our name so it's easy for them to call us. This girl in front said we don't have to, because right now there's no seat available. And she said she will just call us and let us know. As soon as there's chairs available she forgot about us and keep letting people go in and she never took our name. I told her that we've been waiting for so long and those people who waited the same time with us already been seated! This girl didn't even apologized and didn't even acknowledge us. We're regular customer. Finally the customer behind us was nice enough to say that we can go first! Thank you to those group of people who allow us to go first. Good food but their service need to improve.
author: Charen N.

description:
I love the restaurant decor and the vibe! Forrest Gump is one of my favorite movies, so I thought the "run forrest run" signs, maps of his running routes, ping pong paddles, pictures, posters, and so much more were super cool. Outside, there's a souvenir shop and benches next to a bubba gump sign with Forrest's shoes that you can put your feet in for pics. There was only like a 10 minute wait because I went for lunch on a weekday.

The food was on the good side, except I probably should've listened to other yelp reviewers to not get pasta because it wasn't amazing even though it was still pretty good to me. Pretty expensive and small ish portions, though I get why -- the ocean view on the side of the restaurant is so pretty!

Only problem I had was the rude waiter.... She kept acting super annoyed at us because we weren't ordering our food right away and she just kinda rolled her eyes at us and gave attitude. I could tell that she was trying to act fakely courteous but she was clearly annoyed lol. And when we were paying, she said "okay so do you need change or not????" and similar stuff when we were ordering. rude -_-
author: Iris F.

description:
Decent but nothing to brag about - server was great - the crab in my combo was so salty was like eating a salt lick. Peel and eat shrimp
Appetizer over cooked almost impossible to get shells off. 

Was a one time experience just to say we tried it ... To many other choices in the city. 

Place was extremely loud from large 18 year old birthday party a couple tables away in corner yelling.
author: Misty L.

description: Woah wtf man. That was horrible experience! I normally save Bubba Gump for my Monterey trips. This was huge regret. My fish tacos tasted like dollar store tortilla and some Gordon's left over fish refried. The shrimp stew was pathetically over spiced. We got some brown guacamole on burger. Calamari was drenched in greasy. The habanero and pineapple hot sauce oh and also the mint was good. :-/
author: Shimmy S.

description: This was our first time at a bubba gump restaurant and I have to say that I was a bit disappointed with the portion size. I thought this would be a southern style restaurants with generous portions but that wasn't the case. The food was pretty good but nothing over average, however we ordered dessert and it was AMAZING! We had the chocolate chip cookie with icecream and a keylimepie to share. Both where a gift from above but if we have to go with one we highly recommend the cookie with icecream!
author: Ali S.

description: Okay, to me & my hubby,  this ones actually  going to be our second visit to Bubba Gump. But this visit was extra special.  Our entire family was here.  We came to San Francisco to attend a Memorial and decided to make it a mini vacay and show the kids around since it will be their first time to see the State! Secondly, it was Father's Day! So, first my husband called to see if he could make a reservation of which they said they don't take any for the day due to the occasion and it is extremely busy. But nonetheless,  he was told its going to be a 30 minute wait for a group our size which is 6. That's fine.  we understand that.  so we left for Pier 39. When we got there, sure enough there was still a line of people trying to get in.  But we got our names on the list.  This time they told us it will be about 45-50 mins wait. Fine. We still wanted our kids to experience it, i.e. See the view,  taste the great food that we remembered etc... we walked around until we were called.  Finally, we got the text and off we went.  We waited for another 10mins before they seated us.  When they did,  we got a great corner view of the Bay and the Alcatraz. So that was a plus. We started choosing our food and drinks coz mind you it's been over an hour of wait already and we were starving. Our waiter David was extremely nice and funny.  He took our orders promptly. But, you can't blame him if the kitchen takes another hour to prepare it.  yes, that was how long it took for them to prep our order! we got our drinks first though.  my 2 kids got this Strawberry Mango Icee drink and they said it was extremely sugared down. It would kill a diabetic right there and then.  They had to ask for an Extra glass of water to water it down. at least i was happy with my drink and it was a virgin pina colada. David kept on coming back to update us on our order which was extremely nice of him.  When the orders finally arrived,  this was the first thing that i noticed.  #1- the food DID NOT look the same as the photos on their menu. it was like night and day. lol. seriously i had to snicker. But embarrassed because we bragged to our kids how amazing this restaurant was.  my dish for example,  i got the Accidental Fish & Shrimp dish. You will find a photo of the fish that i took from my dish that i couldn't even eat because they forgot to literally season it! Yes! As a foodie,  that's like a big No!No! i took a bite off that fish and was like,  what the heck! nothing! bland.. plain, no sparks.. tasted like literally nothing! i even tried to season it with salt, yet nothing.  you know,  sometimes, even fresh fish has a little sweet taste even if you forget to season it, but this one had nothing! i truly wonder how commercial and cheap are their choice of ingredients like their seafood that they use that i literally got nothing,  ZILCH! David at this point had to go already,  he was off his shift and Travis took over.  So we told him about it so he can relay it to the kitchen.  My son,  ordered the Jambalaya and this kid loves food.  We call him the food disposal. Everything that we dont finish,  he gobbles it up.  But he sat there and his eyes were watery and i asked him if something was wrong.  He said his dish was extremely hot and spicey. He asked if he could get some sour cream to tone it down.  so we did while relaying the problem to Travis. I mean,  obviously there's a big problem but this restaurant was not offering anything to rectify it.  It took Travis another 10 mins to get that sour cream.  seriously! He had to deal with it.  my daughter wanted to try his dish and took a bite and she literally said she didn't like it! liver and over! We finally asked for our bill, they didn't take out any of the dishes to fix the complaints, nothing. they didn't apologize for it. what can i do? but I'll tell you this,  even if it's a special occasion and it is busy,  they still need to maintain their quality or they'll start losing customers. because I'll tell you this,  after this experience,  i don't think I'd want to come back nor would i recommend this restaurant to anyone. I didn't make a fuss there because we've overstayed already.  didn't want to waste our time at Bubba Gump when there's so much to show the kids at the wharf. After 2 hours of waiting, literally another hour dining,  you'd expect something awesome.  instead we get something below average.  That's disappointing. don't you think?  they get 1 star for the view another star for David's service.  if it weren't for those 2, they wouldn't get any! literally!
author: Cynthia G.

description:
The boyfriend and I were on vacation in San Francisco. It was his first time there and my sixth. After a 4 hour plane delay we desperately needed a place to eat at Fisherman's Wharf. Bubba Gump seemed like a good option, even though it is a chain restaurant. He ordered the fish tacos and I had Forest's Seafood Feast. The food was actually very good. Service was nice and the atmosphere was pleasant. For a chain restaurant, it was surprisingly nice.
We would certainly return.
author: Rennie M.

description: Always thought bubba Gump to be more gimmicky restaurant than a true eatery.  The first time I went I thought it was ok.  After many years were treated by a local friend to eat there. I think the food is better. The portion still were on smaller side given the price. I had the tilapia which was well prepared however too salty to my taste. I was still hungry afterwards. Which they gave us table bread. My friend had the shrimp feast. Looked really good, with lots of fries.  Wife had the seafood pasta which I thought the flavor was too mild. Over all it is still an ok eatery.  Service was nice and friendly.
author: david c.

description: Good food bad service though . So busy the wait was about an hour ! Parking sucks . The view was nice tho but next time if I'm craving sea food I'll just go to the one in Monterey worth the travel & gas compared to looking for parking in Frisco then paying $30 bucks for the garage .
author: M P.

description: I have been to several Bubba Gump's over the years and by far this was the worst! The waitress seemed annoyed at having to help us and was quite rude. The food seemed to take extra long and when our appetizer sampler arrived it was cold. We were interrupted twice with a long drawn out speech of how they were changing shifts so our waitress was changing and then they came back saying it was changing again. In my opinion this place is significantly over priced for what it is and the quality of food.
author: Pauline H.

description: Was here yesterday with a group of friends for a day in the Bay Area! The wait was not too long for how busy it was! Professional and friendly staff, got seated and our waitress was very attentive and sweet. She played "Forrest Gump" trivia with us. Shrimp was very good along with the crab and fried fish! The drinks were yummy and some even include a souvenir cup! My friend wanted the mason jar souvenir glass and they were accommodating! Good time and beautiful view of the bay from our table. Will probably visit again if I happen to be by pier 39!
author: Erica L.

description: Bloody dam good sea food at Fisherman's Wharf!! I love the Forrest Gump theme of this restaurant. They have amazing cocktails and top notch shrimp, crab and fish. Don't go there if you haven't watched Forrest Gump though!
author: Dheeraj M.

description: Bubba didn't take a bullet to the gut against the Vietcong for this type of service. Forest didn't bust his ass on the shrimpin boat for this either. asked for Vinegar and the manager said she had it but it never came. But luckily, Simon and Patrick (Batman and Robin) delivered some of the best service i've seen in my 18 years of life. Bring these boys up in the ranks of management. Patrick if you ever read this we hope you realize how much we appreciate you and what you do to keep this restaurant going. For the lady with the headset and green shirt, figure it out.
author: Max H.

description: Fun atmosphere!! The food is good, but I come here because I love the movie, Forrest Gump! The tropical drinks were excellent, and came in a cup you can take home. This place is great for kids too, they will love the environment. It can be noisy, but that's how they want it to be. Overall I enjoy coming here. Would have been 5 stars, but the service was slow, even at 9:30 at night.
author: Andrew Z.

description:
Do yourself the favor of finding somewhere else to eat. I downloaded yelp just to do others the favor. After being told to sit at a booth, we were told by another employee we can't sit there and instructed to get up.
Several employees were mocking customers as I waited to place my drink order. They were out of many things. We ordered an appetizer and had to ask for silverware. Long story short we asked for our check and left.
author: Aaron S.

description: I have been to Bubba Gump Shrimp Co while in Florida years ago. My husband and I stopped at this location because we wanted another souvenir glass to take home. The line to eat was crazy long but we managed to snag two seats at the bar. At the bar the bartender made us feel comfortable and explained what drinks could get us a free souvenir mug. My husband ordered the Tennessee Ice Tea and I ordered the Starboard Sunrise. My husband's drink automatically came with the mug which was a mason jar that sits on a stem. The drinks themselves were overpriced and weak. I do love the atmosphere of this place and it had a great view of the ocean.
author: Amanda K.

description:
Lunch was like a box of chocolate.   I never new what I would get.  Ok now that I have that out of my system I can begin.  

We came here on a crazy and cold Saturday afternoon and I was shocked at how unorganized the staff was.  We were going to be a 7 top with a small child.  My brother was trying to find an elevator to bring up the stroller and we were kicked out of line until our entire party was ready.  Three other groups were behind us and sat immediately.   

We finally got to our table and I must say that the view was beautiful.   We had a great view of the bay.  And we were brought waters very quickly.

Our waiter was a bit odd and a little slow to take our app and drink orders. The shrimp apps were good when they arrived.   And the mixed drinks were darn good.

My main course was the gumbo and it was just average.  It was what you would expect from a chain.  The waiter tries to have fun and quizzes the  tables on movie trivia.  In the end it is decent food and less than par service.  I may pass next time unless I am not paying.
author: Scott S.

description: Worst experience ever. Customer service was horrible. It took over an hour and a half for the server to give me the cheeseburger I ordered. The weird part is that it wasn't even busy in the restaurant. And the manager was unapologetic I wouldn't recommend coming back here ever again.
author: Dyrell W.

description: As busy as they were on a Saturday in San Francisco, the service and food was great! The view of the bay was beautiful
author: Victoria C.

description: So this review isn't for the food. The food was actually pretty damn good. This review is for the server we had. Okay so we go in on a Monday and luckily it was so busy we sat at the bar area and our server, I think her name was Olivia according to the receipt had a serious attitude problem. So for those of you who don't know at bubba Gump they have signs saying "stop forest stop" in red when it's on there it means the table needs helps and "run forest run" in blue meaning the customer doesn't need help. So anyways, After we sit. It's been almost 15 mins and no one has came to our table and I flip the sign to the red and 5 mins later our server comes throws our menus on the table with so much attitude, And flips the sign back without saying anything. Okay so that was strike one. Really pissed me off. So after that she comes back 10 mins later and takes our order. Okay so fast forward we get our food. Not once did this server ask us if we needed anything during the time of our eating. So again I flipped the sign to the red. And the comes by and " you guys really like to use this sign "  we told her we wanted some sauce and water. And she flipped the sign back with a hard hand and kind of threw it to the corner to the other side of the table. So it may not seem like much but her persona and attitude toward us was really rude and if she can't be nice she shouldn't be working there. She was very unprofessional.
author: Sanju C.

description: Told me it would be a 20-25 minute wait and that I would receive a text when they had a table. Thirty minutes later and it turned out they completely removed me from the waitlist ? When I approached them about it the employees were rude. Overall they were disorganized and seemed like they did not know what they were doing.//:
author: Sarah M.

description:
Following an all-afternoon outing at Alcatraz Island, my friends and I decided to stay in the area and check out Pier 39. I suggested that we rest our weary legs and eat at Bubba Gump's because I had heard of this place for ages and had always wanted to try it. Even though I don't normally follow the "touristy" path, I thought it would only be appropriate considering today's earlier event. 

My impression was that it looked and felt a mixture between TGI Friday's and Joe's Crab Shack... but with a nice view of the Bay. We were there on a Monday at about 5:45, and it wasn't crowded at all. We left at almost 7:00 and it was still relatively empty. 

Our cute female server was very exuberant (to the point of being quite infectious) and spoke loudly and clearly. I don't think I've ever been served by someone so personable and energetic and with a voice that simply boomed.  I'm sure anyone would agree that these are desirable qualities for a place like this, where there are regularly a lot of tourists and where it can get loud and crowded. And they are even more desirable when you consider that they make an announcement and sing to you if you mention that it's your birthday. 

Instead of flagging down a worker when you needed something, you flipped your sign located on your table: the blue "Run Forest Run" license plate meant that you were good, while the red "Run Forest Run" license plate meant that you needed something. I had flipped the sign at some point, and a worker came by quickly. I was wondering why and how he read my mind, and he said that the sign was red. I had completely forgotten all about the sign.

The food portions aren't large like, say, at BJ's or Claim Jumpers. The garlic bread was more like a long stick of bread rather than the usual oval shape and was soft and very buttery/oily. I had the Bourbon Street Mahi Mahi (charbroiled Cajun-spiced Mahi Mahi with Bourbon sauce, grilled shrimp, thin fries, served over mashed potatoes) and the Shrimp Shack Mac & Cheese (macaroni with sauteed shrimp, cheddar, Monterey Jack, and Parmesan cheese, topped with bread crumbs). Food was served quickly and presentation was very nice. I especially enjoyed the creamy sauce that came with the mahi mahi and the smooth mixture of cheeses in the mac & cheese. I just wish they included more shrimp or even bigger pieces of shrimp (I know, I know... Not a realistic expectation).

Being a restaurant chain located in a touristy part of San Francisco, you can expect the food and beverages to cost a pretty penny. In the end, it's worth it if you're in it for the atmosphere and the view and if you're a tourist in the area.
author: Jenman F.

description:
If you love seafood, a casual atmosphere, and a bit of movie trivia, then this is a great place to go eat in the city. The establishment is themed after the movie Forest Gump with a very "out at sea" feel inside (netting, fishing supplies, wood walls, etc...) mixed with a bar-like atmosphere.

 I went here with a group of friends, to celebrate with some drinks and I have to say our waitress was so awesome! There was a party of over 20 sitting near us and she made sure we taken care of before they ordered. She was very nice and outgoing, shooting trivia questions (Forest Gump) at us every now and then,  and just all around fun to be around. The food/drinks were pretty good as well, although one of my friends did have a complaint that the drinks were kind of expensive here, but that doesn't surprise me (drinks are expensive in SF). 

Great place overall, if you enjoy seafood check it out!
author: Betty K.

description:
I came here with a friend for a really late lunch, so luckily there was no wait. And we had such a nice table! We were able to sit in a booth that overlooked the Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, and the Bay Bridge. The setting was awesome! The decor in the restaurant was also wonderful - very true to Forrest Gump.

I tried the Bubba's After the Storm "Bucket of Boat Trash." Such a super long name, which came with snow crab legs, flash fried shrimp, fried fish, and French fries with a Cajun seasoning. The serving was certainly generous, and the food was cooked perfectly! So delicious! 

For dessert, we tried the sampler trio - bread pudding, strawberry shortcake, and chocolate chip cookie. My least favorite was the cookie because it was pretty typical. But the bread pudding and strawberry shortcake were very good.

The service was really great, too! All of the workers were so friendly and extremely attentive! Their system of calling a waiter over is so efficient.
author: Rachel H.

description: The last time we where there, we had a great waiter. I think his name as Aaron? Big guy with a beard. He zipped around for us, brought mass quantities of fried foods and asked us a ton of trivia questions until he finally stumped us. Actually, I was amazed how many things I remember from the movie. We had a great time.
author: Dave S.

description: Fast and fun service. Our server Phil was a ball of energy. So contagious. Everything I order here is good. I recommend the Cajun shrimp appetizer and calimari. Price is fair and the view is perfect.
author: Michelle L.

description: Great location! The food is okay, not as good as expected. The fried shrimp is tasty, but overall very expensive. Waited 40 for a two people table lol
author: Wandi C.

description:
Still not the best service. I'm trying to decide when is a good time to come here to have a good meal. I've been here when it's been busy (and a Landry's membership definitely helps that!) and I've been here when it's been very, very quiet. 

After having a good time at a local comedy club up the street, we decided to grab a quick bite to eat here (primarily for the shortcake--more about that later). I get here a few minutes before 10:00 PM and was not greeted by anyone. Someone at the bar, someone over by the water fountain, and a customer (presumably) sitting by the door waiting for take-out perhaps? Although, the location of this makes that suspect because where would he park for just take-out? But, doesn't matter. 

I walk up the walkway and stood at the top for a moment. Made eye contact with the bartender and a few of the wait-staff. Nothing. Then, finally, a manager walks out of the office (next to the restrooms) with another employee, seemingly just wrapping up a meeting of sorts and I'm greeted. He doesn't show me to a table, just acknowledges my presence, and that someone will "be by shortly to seat you" (in the nearly nearly empty restaurant). 

The meal was as I've grown to expect from Bubba Gump (another reason why I can't stop coming here!) The strawberry shortcake is a MUST-TRY if you're eating here. If you're deciding between an appetizer, or the shortcake: skip the former and go for the dessert!

Nearing the end of the meal, I'm offered the Landry's membership which I told the wait-staff that I was already a member. The tune changed a bit and more attention was given to our table (although the place had already closed at 11:00 PM). 

On our way out (into the rain & cold), the hostess at the host-stand said "good night" without looking up from her clipboard. I know it's closed and I'm sure she wanted to get out of there as soon as possible, but service could definitely use a boost here. 

To be completely fair, my interactions with the staff were generally positive. They were friendly and courteous, and perhaps I shouldn't be so picky? I did not feel like I was "mistreated" in any way, but I just didn't feel welcomed in any way. 

I guess (maybe) I'll wait a few months and give them another try? There are other Landry's places down at Fisherman's wharf too...
author: Charles K.

description:
Crowded, noisy; lots of fun.
Did not know what to expect, since lunch was on a whim while visiting Fisherman's Wharf.
Tried the shrimp bucket-four different treatments. Really pleasantly surprised. Can now say that we ate at Bubba's.
Was going to buy a hat, but $25 is too much.
author: John H.

description: I have never had an issue with this place until last night. I was seated with my boyfriend and asked what we wanted. So we placed our drink order and as we did I explained that we would like separate tabs. (we split all our bills and vacations in half.) I had explained a second time to the waitress that we would like them in separate tabs and she acted as if she understood. She then continued to ignore us and walked past a few times (even though I had the sign flipped) without asking if we needed anything. The other servers were more helpful for us than she was. I get that everyone has off days but when you're blatantly ignoring your customers and just standing around talking, there is an issue. It got to the point where one of the other waitresses had to tell her and her friend to stop standing around talking. I had half a mind to just ask for a different server! It then took about 20 mins to get the check and again it was a different waitress who brought it.... And it was all in the same tab. So I asked our waitress to separate it and she said yes and then continued to come back twice and ask what was separated . all I wanted was my food and my boyfriend's food separated and it turned into a big ordeal because of the fact that she didn't even know what orders we placed (because she ignored us so another waitress helped us) and she didn't ever check back. It was frustrating to say the least that if she would have just done her job it would have been more pleasurable and not such a long wait just to get a check. Every other experience here has been great. It really all depends on who you get.
author: Rachel P.

description:
When my friends and I went on a vaacation to San Francisco, we decided to have lunch at bubba gump :) 

This visit was most impressionable.. the wait was minimal, our waiter was freaken awesome and the food was great!!!!!! 

I remember I shared an order with my friend and it was more than enough to feed us :) 

This Bubba Gump was definitely superior to the ones I've been to locally...
author: Van D.

description: Enjoyed a good lunch with a great view of San Francisco Bay.  The staff was very friendly and the food was good but not great compared to the one at Universal City walk.
author: Veronica F.

description: Very bad place to eat. It took us over an hour to get seated. They took our order and didn't submit it to the chef so then we had to wait another 30 minutes. The food wasn't that great and it was over priced. Would not recommend hell naw.
author: Teresita R.

description:
We were there opening night!  

They had a Tom Hanks look-a-like sitting out on a bench just outside the main entrance! We sat with him and took pictures!  Neat!! 

The food was amazing!  The service was Awesome! 

We had a great time!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I've always been a fan of BGS and their food is ok. What makes BGS unique (when I first visited) was the Forrest Gump theme but over time, they are catering to the sports fan more then the movie fans. The service has improved since my last visit, from being completely ignored ON MY BIRTHDAY. Last year I put my name on the waiting list. They told us it would take 30min wait. After waiting an hour, I checked back and found out someone had scratched out my name off of the list. I had a rotten night. All I wanted to do was go home but hubbgy insisted that we drove 1hr away just to eat here to just make the best of it. Also, this location seem to cater the tourists more than the locals though I understand their main income is from the tourist. 
Service: Good

Quality food: good
Quality service: above average
Price: $$
Will I (we) return? Of course. I love Forrest Gump and always will though depending on the direction of the restaurant is going (following the movie or just following the sports fans), I cannot for sure if we will come back.
author: Apit L.

description:
Went here in June 2016. 

The food was good, just probably not worth the price, which is very high since this is kind of half tourist thing, half restaurant. I think my drink (with their shiny light-up cup) was around $5-$15. One thing that did kind of bother me that might not bother others (hence why I didn't count it against them) was how constant the service would check up on us. We were clearly in the middle of a very tense conversation, but I'm not sure if the waitresses could tell because they kept checking on us every 2 minutes. That was a bit of a bother at least for us, but I'm sure most people would probably appreciate it. 

Anywho, I'd still recommend it. If anyone going into SF plans to hit up the Alcatraz night tour, I'd definitely recommend hitting up this place after your ferry gets back to port. It's a nice finnisher for a day on the town.
author: Ken S.

description: Had to wait a while for our food but it was worth the wait, and the staff were friendly. Just took a star off for being hangry at the time.
author: Jenny M.

description: Horrible place to come! We sat at the table for 1.5 hours and only half of us got our food. Order was wrong and one person never got their food even after waiting longer. Server was rude when confronted about it and manager was brought in. They did end up comping our whole meal. At least one thing was handled. Don't recommend this Bubba Gump's. Have been to others and those were great. This one needs a lot of work!
author: Jaime R.

description: The employees are rude!!! First of all we were set down pretty quickly we have three toddlers with us we ordered our drinks and asked the waitress if she could bring us some crayons for the toddlers so they could color on the paper that they gave them. with an attitude she stomped off to get the crayons when they brought us our drinks she brought everyone's drinks except two of the toddlers apple juices they were tired they were hungry and we said could you go get their apple juice? The waitress said yes they're coming.  the waitress comes back with no apple juice I said can you go get their apple juice they're having a meltdown they see us with our drinks and they want their drinks.  finally our drinks, mom and the kids are happy the kids are happy. next they bring us our food everything is fine. The youngest Toddler Who is a-year-old a-year-old dropped her at Apple juice. the Chinese waitress with the bleach blonde hair came over to help clean it up like I said very rude.  our waitress was going to lunch so we had another waitress wait on us she really didn't come by very much that was OK we were fine. When it was time to leave no one paid any attention to our stop forrest stop sign kept passing us by. Finally when it was time to leave I carried my two-year-old granddaughter and I walked my three-year-old grandson out of the restaurant.  on my way out I was walking by some tables and employee who was seating  some other customers come charging straight at me and I had to practically fall on the table to get out of his way he never smile he never said excuse me he could awaited 3 second and I would've been out of his way. The employees there don't even smile they make you feel like they hate their job. Maybe they were all just having a bad day.
author: Wendy D.

description:
Meh.

I used to like this place.  I think we both have changed and this relationship can no longer move forward.

The food has changed.  They changed the tartar sauce and the new sauce is terrible.  

I'm sensitive to a few preservatives and this place uses them liberally.  I could have tthe fresh fish, that's about it.  I have to say this is one of the only places that can actually cook perfect fish and chips. 

I could not have any of their sauces, mixed drinks, even the shrimp had preservatives.  

I received a call from the manager after leaving the original update and so I'm updating now.  He said they are trying to go away from mass producing things like the sauces and such and trying to go more natural.

Even if you freeze your shrimp because it comes from so far away you don't have to pre-bread it in something with preservatives.  If they fix this type of stuff we may go back eventually.
author: T J.

description: I love this place.  We used to live up near here and always come when we visit.  The views are awesome and the food is amazing.  They let us call ahead and put our name in.  Even though its a holiday weekend the service was so fast.
author: jerry m.

description: 1st time at Bubba Gump's, great fun, drinks & good value for money food. Go here when you are hungry as the portions are good ol american sizing ;) I had the tasty "I'm Stuffed" Shrimp, was good minus the rice (just too much). Husband was happy with his steak.
author: Rachel P.

description:
I liked the food and view, but didn't like the $9 drinks, which they do NOT show you the price of the drinks before you order. Really expensive for non alcoholic drinks!!  These drinks I gave to the kids and when we asked for a refill they mentioned a charge, but I didn't think another $9!!!  All in $38's for two kids drinks. 

Either bad service or bad management.  

Be careful!!!
author: Ajay S.

description: This is your typical chain restaraunt. Very bubbly atmosphere, very friendly servers, and the place is really big. Didn't have to wait too long for a table- just about 5 mins. For the appetizer I had the chips with the spinach artichoke dip which was very good, and for my main meal I had the Texas Cajun chicken sandwich whcih fries which was just alright. Nothing special. I had to rip half of the bread off though cuz the bun was so thick- my stomach was filling up faster than I could enjoy the chicken. I know this place is famous for its seafood- (which I couldn't have today) and the people I came with who got seafood said it was very good so I advise getting seafood when you come here. Stick to the dishes they are most famous for. For dessert I ordered the dessert sampler which wasn't bad. I enjoyed the cookie brownie portion of it the most. It's also huge - the picture makes it look small. It was also cute that the waitress did a little Forrest Gump trivia with us before we got the check. Overall- I liked the place.
author: Danielle M.

description: Can't buy your father an anniversary dinner with a credit card over the phone? WHAT?!?!  My Dad love's chain restaurants and decided to go to Bubba Gump Shrimp for his anniversary.  I had him connect me with her server so I could buy his dinner... but the manager refused to accept credit cards over the phone.... I'm sorry are we in the stone ages?  Do we not live in the food delivery capital?  (maybe second to NYC)  I've never had anyone tell me they couldn't take a credit card over the phone.  This is ridiculous and I would have expected the manager, Kristoph, to have better customer service than this.
author: Casey C.

description: This place sucks the life out of our San Fran getaway. This was probably our third and last time coming here. We have a large group and its always a hassle everywhere we go. Usually the waiter steps up his/hers gameplan. Why don't they have beverage serving rounds? There is always something in my drink because they struggle holding so many in their arms and hands. The food I can't even talk about. I love seafood but not from this Bubba Gumps.
author: Charlie L.

description: I haven't been here in awhile but this review is for the excellent service from David!! Best service I've gotten in a long time :) he was so helpful and informative, friendly and so happy!
author: Stacy H.

description:
The food was just ok, i expected fresh shrimp but they didn't taste like it :( 
The service was excellent, but it is definitely overpriced for the quality you get, over all i had a great night with a really awesome view but I'd look for better options in the future
author: Mariela M.

description:
Was here with a group of about 60 to celebrate our end of the summer.  We had a fixed menu with soft drinks, 5 main dishes, plus chocolate cake for desert.  

Plus:  Nice view of the bay and Alcatraz.  Loud and fun place to socialize.  Lots of sweet sugary adult drinks.  Oh and someone else paid. 

Minus:   Its loud so its hard to hear what people next to you are saying, sad wine and beer selection - just sayin, dinners are meh (had chicken linguini and tried the fish and chips and fries shrimp while others were not looking, desert was also not great (chocolate cake was hard like a rock).  

They played movie trivia with our group but it was so loud that many could not hear the questions much less the answers.  Someone got prizes though so they must have heard something. 

Bottom line:  fun place with a view, cheap fast food quality.  Not where the locals go.
author: Marcus K.

description: It's a hit and miss. I've come here several times now; sometimes the food is amazing, other times It's just okay. I think they could be amazing. If they just had some consistency with the quality of food then I would rate it higher.
author: Todd D.

description: Good food. Only thing I thought was strange that being on pier39 they dont sell u the clamchowder in a sourdough bowl. Good fast service even to be seated.
author: Ivette A.

description: Wait was too long  and food actually didn't worth the long wait!  The resturant was too crowds and noisy to eat.  I was there just because I love the movie!
author: Jenny C.

description:
Lol, my family and i read the menu on the outside of the place before deciding that we wanted to eat here.
Definitely not as good as i expected
Food was way salty, rubbery, and tasted almost old.
Very disappointing when I saw the bill and realized we were paying so much...
author: Elizabeth F.

description:
