I rarely give restaurants five stars, but this place definitely deserves it! I have been here on two different occasions and both were great. 

Both times I had the Texas Cajun Chicken Sandwich($14), which was fantastic the guacamole is so delicious. It's a must try! My boyfriend ordered the stuffed shrimp, which were pretty good. For $20 the plate was kind of small but it ended up being filling for him. 
We also ordered the shrimp Mac n cheese as an appetizer. It was absolutely fantastic and just perfectly cooked. I would happily pay the $12 for it any day!

At the end of our meal when we paid, their systems broke down and they handled the situation beautifully. My bf and I were in no hurry and kept telling them it was okay if we had to wait a little for them to get their problem fixed. Both our waitress and a manager apologized for the inconvenience. The manager also took off our appetizer from our bill because of our wait. Great service through out that restaurant. Definitely did not expect them to be so great seeing as how crazy busy they are all the time, but they have a great team that knows how to treat customers. That's just a bonus on top of the awesome food!
author: Liz T.

description: Love this place!!! Andi rocks!! Hands down, best waitress ever!!! Food is great drinks are incredible! Amazing service, awesome job guys keep it up!!! And when we walked in we asked for a window seat and they didn't hesitate! You guys are awesome!
author: Helena F.

description: I still don't understand the check in and waiting process to get a table. We got our table, we didn't get a server at our table for about 15 minutes. And, after the drinks were brought, I still had to personally wait for 30 minutes to get my water.  And, it was really weird, they brought the kids meals out and they were done eating before the adult meals were bought out. And they only brought the adult meals out one at a time so my sister was eating when everyone else was done. Horrible service. Definitely not worth the money
author: Stacy S.

description: One of many restaurants on Pier 39, but one of the few with a view!  Shrimp & gumbo were very good, skip the shrimp mac n cheese.  This is casual seafood so don't expect steamed crab or the like.
author: Jeff R.

description:
Came here with my mother and daughters.  We really loved it. We were seated right away and did not have to wait.  The food was so good.  We sat outside and they had heaters which helped. The night was a bit cool.  

We truly had a great time and will be back :-)
author: Kimberly O.

description: Bubba Gump's is one of my favorite restaurants. I love to order the Fisher's Net Catch of Cajun shrimp. It's an appetizer however it's the perfect amount of food for me to eat by myself and I love the Cajun sauce. It can get a little messy because you have to peel the skin off the shrimp but there's always plenty of napkins at the table for me! I came in with a party of 7 and the waitress happily split the bill for us. I will continue to come to this restaurant whenever I am in the SF area.
author: Mackenzie L.

description: I was feeling like having some Nawlins in SF. Had the cup of gumbo and the jambalaya entree. Both were delicious. Tevin, or waiter was great and provided exceptional service. I'm not sure if and when I'll return to SF but if i do I'll make every effort to come here again.
author: Juan M.

description:
Worth a trip and good for out of town friends. It's an experience, though "touristy" it's not a "tourist trap".

Food is good, though prices are a bit high. There isn't anywhere on Pier 39 you can get dinner cheaper elsewhere along the Embarcadero if you're looking for cheap eats.
author: David S.

description: Unremarkable over-fried fish and shrimp. Bad service, but great view of the bay. Insanely overpriced. Soggy fries. They don't have Mountain Dew even though they served Pepsi products. You'd be better off going to Long John Silvers, save a bunch of money as well.
author: John H.

description: Terrible service. When someone yells "excuse me" then you look at them and keep walking...rude!
author: Do. T.

description:
I've always heard about this place and wanted it to try it out with my friend as we were down here on a road trip. I came in expecting much but was slightly disappointed. It had been set up on a pedestal for me and I came out thinking that this place is more of a tourist trap. 

Some good points is that the service was good and the restaurant was pretty lively (lots of tourists!). The decor is nice and the view is beautiful as well, which adds to the experience.

My friends and I ordered a variety of dished. For me, I got the Shrimer's Heaven which is a  platter of shrimp prepared in various ways. The shrimp tastes fresh and nothing was bad about the dish. The coconut shrimp, especially the Tangy Asian dipping sauce, was probably my favorite part of the platter. 

A friend got the "I'm Stuffed!" Shrimp, which was probably the best dish on the table. The crab stuffing tasted wonderful and was the centerpiece of the dish. Another friend got the Accidental Fish and Shrimp, which was okay. The lemon was a little strong so you got a strong taste of acid and salt with the dish, which put me off a little bit. The other two shared a jambalaya and traditional shrimp cocktail. The jambalaya wasn't the best I've tasted, but it wasn't terrible either. The shrimp cocktail was a normal cocktail. Although, I must say that the cocktail sauce was pretty top notch. 

Overall, the food was okay. Nothing really had a big wow-factor except maybe the crab stuffing. The price was pretty high, but I would expect that for a seafood restaurant; however, I wouldn't be surprised if it was a little higher due to its ability to draw in tourists. 

Would I recommend? I mean, it is a place to try once in your lifetime. It's nice going to a well-known touristy restaurant. Just don't expect too much and you'll still have a good time!
author: Joon K.

description:
I wasn't very pleased with the Jambalaya. The meat/seafood was fine but the rest was too mushy. The place was packed. The hostess said the wait time was over an hour so we chose to sit near the bar.

The restrooms are horrible and disgusting, not to mention awkward.

The overall menu is diverse with options, so I may return just to sit somewhere better and try their other dishes. As for now, the rating remains at a 2.5
author: Stuart B.

description:
I took my family to this restaurant for the 1st time on 12/06/2014. We enjoyed the food, drinks and the staff there. I paid my bill using my credit card and left a CASH tip on the table. 
A few days later, I viewed my bank statement and noticed that the waiter added a $20 tip to my credit card!! I was pissed and dissappointed! It was hard contacting the manager to report this. I finally was able to speak with someone regarding the waiters actions. 
After all was said & done ... it took this restaurant about 1 1/2 months to refund my $20! I never spoke to the GM, he called once but never returned my call :(

I had planned on returning for my birthday in late December, but I chose otherwise.

Always, always double check your credit card statements after eating at a restaurant!!
author: TRINA W.

description: Super nice view of the bay if you get to sit near the window. However, mainly tourist attraction so extremely pricey. Food was just normal...
author: Henry L.

description: I got the Mahi Mahi on mashed potato. They gave me 3 pieces of shrimp and 2 pieces of fish which was dry. The whole dish(with the plate) was smaller than the palm of my hand and I paid $21 for it. Also got the Strawberry Rum drink, more than half of it was ice and had at most one shot of rum in it. Paid $12 for the drink. The servers were nice, but this place is not worth the money and the hour that you have to wait in line to get in.
author: Farzin S.

description:
The wait was about an hour and 15 minutes but we expected that, plus they have a system that texts you when your table is ready so you don't necessarily have to sit there bored and wait we were able to go shop around.
Our server was great I don't remember his name but he had an awesome Irish accent or something, he did the Bubba gumps quiz with us and had a great sense of humor.
We got the skillet shrimp Mac and cheese for an appetizer it was absolutely amazing I wish that was an entree choice!
I got the scampi I was not impressed at all. The noodles were undercooked and the bread came completely soaked already, it was literally falling apart. My boyfriend got the ravioli he enjoyed his food.
It was pretty annoying being next to a party that thought they were the only ones there, being extremely loud and their kids running around the table like crazies but I knew that was no one's fault and they had to deal with it too.
Other than my disappointing entree and having to pay  $90 for two people I was satisfied overall and my man was very happy so that's what matters.
author: Cortney H.

description:
"It's a chain! Why would we stop there?" When my traveling buddy said this, I had to point out that although Bubba Gump Shrimp Co is a chain restaurant, they don't have any near where we live. So we went. We went during happy hour. You might want to know that because Bubba Gump is a huge chain and a bit of a tourist trap, they don't actually have happy hour specials. That's ok though because it's still charming and fun. 

The servers are peppy and nice. They're good salesmen and they know how to get you to look at a dessert menu. 

The food was great; the cocktails were amazing. Would I go back? Sure I would. And next time, I'm going to watch Forrest Gump before I head in. I don't want to miss any questions on the quiz next time.
author: Sharece B.

description:
Life may be like a box of chocolates, but when it comes to restaurants, you wanna know what your gonna get. At Bubba Gump's, what I got was not what I wanted. 

I will start with the good chocolates. Our service was excellent.  The hostess was very friendly and she was very interested to learn about where we lived and how we were enjoying our day in San Fran. Our waiter continued the trend as he went above and beyond to make our time here a pleasant one. I admit to playing the role of bitter lieutenant Dan after having spent the day walking San Fran. That didn't seem to bother our waiter at all. He got a 30% tip. 

Now for the bitter, nasty dark espresso chocolates. The food bordered on nyeh to bleh. My fries were cold and stale, our tempura shrimp was soggy from too much oil and the shrimp were poorly cleaned. I will say that my fish and chips were actually pretty good. All in all, the food was not worth the cost. 

Would I eat here again?  Nope.  While I enjoyed the atmosphere, and our service was great, I just can't look past the food. There are too many restaurants on the Pier to give Bubba a second shot. Sorry Bubba, I don't think your gonna make it.
author: Craig W.

description: I I give two stars for the food the service was bad Stephanie was our server first off we have no silverware second off I asked him to sing Happy Birthday to my girlfriend which I hear them singing to other tables which never happened then after that I have to chase her down for my check when she act like she doesn't hear me so I woke up to a different server to get my check and to go boxes but she was very attentive when it came to pay for my check hoping that I left her a tip which I didn't because that's service sucks I work in the restaurant industry and I know how it is and they were nowhere near busy she may be had two tables tops she needs to go back to being a busser if she can handle a table
author: Peanut B.

description: Miles from Bubba Gump is amazing. Our reservation wasn't confirmed and we had arranged to take my Grandma with a handicap for a day out. We were stressed about maneuvering her in the crazy busy pier and then worried that our reservation wasn't ready. Miles greeted me at the door and arranged a special table for my Grandma right by the view with a beautiful view. Excellent customer service!!! Thank you Miles!!!!
author: Lena K.

description:
Waited 1 hour to be seated.  Did not get drink I ordered. They charged us for 2 drinks when we only ordered one.  Waited 30 minutes and food never came. Waitress came back to take our order a 2nd time after she forgot it. They only validated 1 hour parking when we were at the restaurant 2.5 hours.  Worst experience ever.  Waitress tried playing Forest gump  trivia while we trying to eat food.

When I arrived I put my name in for me and my gf.  They said it would be 30 min wait and they would text me when my table is ready. They gave me a receipt showing my arrival time at 841 pm and that I would get a text by 921pm. I was caught off guard as the 30 min estimate now was 40 min on my receipt.  Well 921pm came and no text. I waited until 924pm to show the hostess I didnt get my text.  She said it would be another 15 min. While we waited the hostess then began seating parties who arrived much later than us...including other parties of 2. My gf was upset and asked how much longer we have to wait ...finally they let us get in another line to be seated.
author: Chris S.

description:
I have been here a few times and the food is good, so is the location, waiters are good too.  My last visit, we were told the wait would bee 45 minutes and we ended up leaving an hour later to the pizza place next door because my wife started getting a hunger headache.  1.5 hours later, we received a text that our turn finally arrived.
To top it off, I tried to look for contact info to complain to, whether local or headquarters, and could not locate anything but local number.  not acceptable.
author: caleb d.

description: After all of these years since seeing the movie I finally decided to try the restaurant, well actually I was forced to because it and Hard Rock Cafe were the only two restaurants open. We arrived an hour before closing and I truly have respect when arriving to an established close to closing and I hurry along so the staff can get outta there. However, this time we were highly encouraged to hurry up by our waitress she even suggested dishes that was quickest to cook as she continued to inform us that they were closing in 45 minutes. When she first approached the table she stated " do you know what you want we close in 45 minutes" we hadn't even opened the menu since we had just sat down. She tapped the table when we didn't respond quickly and said I'll be back and yes she was back within two minutes. I asked about two dishes and this is when I was informed of the dish that cooks the quickest. I ordered the shrimpers net, I think that's the correct name and a side of fries. The shrimp was ok I got mild and the seasoning was fine, the fries were good and it is enough to share. Food was mediocre so I won't be hurrying back!
author: Frankie H.

description: Clam chowder had hair in it. When notified the manager, he delivered a new cup, which appeared to have the same hair at the bottom of the cup.
author: Tom M.

description: I've come to this place many times over the past year, it's usually a place I take my family when we are doing an SF tour as the restaurant is an attraction on itself; Nice staff, clean and overall good atmosphere. Wait times suck but what did you expect of a very famous restaurant, it's understandable. Only problem I have is lack of consistency of the food; Sometimes you might get a great experience in taste and quality and sometimes you might get a really bad, cold, undercooked in the same dish. In my last visit we ordered pretty much the same dish and some of the shrimps on it were undercooked and the BBQ ribs were a little bit on the cold side; I hope they solve this issues on the kitchen as this is my fav restaurant on the pier.
author: David C.

description:
Eating Bubba Gumps made me rewatch Forest Gump and remembered how much I love that movie. Overall, I had a good experience at the restaurant but expect to wait for an hour+ if you there at peak hours on the weekends.

What we ordered...
-Traditional shrimp cocktail
-Patron margarita
-New England clam chowder & salad combo
-Forrest's Seafood Feast

They were all soooooo delicious! Our serve was very nice and help with suggestions and made sure we were having a good meal. I'm not sure when Bubba Gumps started doing trivia, but that was definitely interesting. Losing at the trivia prompted me to by the movie on the way home and watch it. I forgot how long it was...

Even though it was a pricey meal, it was good and had a great time with my boyfriend. I rather have fresh seafood and pay a bit than cheap seafood. The BART ride home would have been very unpleasant...

Run Forest Run!
author: Grace C.

description: First time eating here and not impressed. Waited for an hour on my food so by the time I got my food it was cold. Told my waiter, Travis B, which he spoke with manager and made a discount. Not once did Travis ask me if I needed a refill on my drinks, I had to ask him twice. Never did Travis check up and ask how everything was. I was expecting to get asked if I wanted dessert, since I was celebrating a special day, to have the crew celebrate. By far probably the worst experience at a restaurant. The only reason they get a 2 star rating was because I got the discount and they said have a goodnight but if it wasn't for that they deserve a 1 star rating.
author: Jose F.

description:
We came for mother's day and the only plus was the wait was only 45 mins.
First off, the hostess by the name of Roxy was a complete b****! Extremely rude and took her forever to actually look me in the eye to say "I'll be right with you." Ugh!
Once we were being seated I slipped on some water on their dirty floor and caught my fall by banging up my shoulder on the rail by the stairs. 
They didn't really show any concern and when I told the girl who seated us that they needed to clean that area where I slipped...she just giggled!

The food was good but this place is ran by a bunch of kids with no proper customer service!

I enjoyed the one in Monterey much better but SF Is so much closer to where I live.
author: N B.

description: After a long day at the pier we were excited to go to Bubba Gumps. We knew there'd be a wait...a hour and 20 minutes seemed extreme but we waited...and waited. Finally I go ask what the hold up is. I go to the front and the 2 hosts are too busy talking to each other. Well someone behind me finally got their attention. When they finally got to me, they told me to go stand in line. We did. Well they really weren't ready for us yet. By now we're irriated and hungry. They end up seating us anyways. The service was slow. Took about 15 minutes to even get our drinks. After our dinner came it took so long for them to get condiments that we sucked it up without using them. The quality of the food was decent. We definitely won't go back.
author: Taylor M.

description: Only come here for the crab stuffed mushrooms but since they no longer serve that I will NEVER come her again service was horrible food not worth my money maybe the stuffed shrimp but everything else Is blah
author: Michelle R.

description:
Group dinner here - weeknight, 7pm reservations - still waited another 30 or so.  Theme was cute and food was good/reasonably priced (even for Pier 39).

However, we sat for over an hour after the last bite trying to pay and get out of there.  After about 45 minutes of waiting, the "Hey guys, let's do a Forrest Gump Trivia Quiz" didn't work anymore, and we hit the point of "Look, we just want to get out of here," which sucked all of the fun/pleasure out of the visit.  

This place has potential, but a hard look at processes by the management is required!  It will always be packed with tourists, and they have a busy gift shop, so I'm not so sure this will receive attention (?).

I would love to give this place a second chance.
author: Steve H.

description: My bf and I came in tonight on labor day, the pier was just crazy and the restraunt was packed. After a semi long wait and dropping $21 on two drinks at the bar, my bf and I were starting to get irritated. Thankfully, our wonderful server Joel turned the whole experience around. Knowledgeable, fun to talk to and really put us in a great place. Food was amazing as well. Cheers Joel!!
author: Katrina K.

description:
So I was here earlier around 11:30am to have a lunch with my Mom and this branch of Bubba Gump failed to do at least a fair customer service. No one assist us after we get our table from the asian girl on front ( She did a great job on welcoming customers though ) . We're waiting for about 15-20mins and I saw the guys that I guess he's the one who supposed to do the ordering but you know what he was doing that time? Laughing and Chit chatting to his co worker. I don't want anyone to get fired but hey, these guys should remember that it's their job, and that's what they apply for. We just walked out and after that no more bubba pier 39.

Bubba Gump Universal Studio - Busy place but maintains Excellent customer Service = 5 star
author: Justin L.

description: It was so busy but then again I did go on a Saturday. It took about 45 min for a table and about 30 for the food but the food was so worth the wait and the waiter was so nice. The view of the water is beautiful I wish I would have gotten lucky enough to sit next to the window. The place was extremely clean for being so busy and overall I will be back for more seafood. It was my first time here and I see why everyone likes it so much.
author: Jessica K.

description:
I have always wanted to go to a Bubba Gump's, just because I love the movie Forrest Gump so much. When I got there, the decor was great.  Everything was movie related and the menu had some excellent choices on it, but I was extremely disappointed when I got my food.

I got a Forrest's feast, I believe is what it's called, it had fish, clam strips, hush puppies, fries & shrimp. It was horrible; the shrimp was soggy and the fish and the clam strips were overcooked. I couldn't even get the breading off. The French fries weren't even edible.

The hush puppies were so bad I almost had spit it out in my napkin.

My friend just got a smoothie and it was delicious so I suggest going here for the atmosphere, but I would stick with just beverages.
author: Kimber B.

description:
You pay for the experience at places like this, the ambience and decor fit the seafood Forrest Gump theme. Which is fun, and fits well as it's right on the water at the Warf.

The quality of the food however is average, or slightly above average. For $40-50 a head I expect a high quality dining experience, and it just didn't live up to that expectation for me. But, the location is good and the theme is fun, so if you are willing to pay for that and aren't expecting 5 star food, this place might be for you. Although I do believe there is better quality seafood at the warf.
author: Phil M.

description:
Nice place. Spinach salad with asparagus and goat cheese was interesting 
Fish and chips was really good, fresh...
I also enjoyed my Americano coffee
author: Tendü Y.

description: I love Bubba Gumps, but this branch was a disappointment. It was super busy, but a quality restaurant provides the same quality no matter what.
author: Tallal S.

description:
My husband and I had a great experience. We sat at the bar and had great conversation with the bartenders and had a blast watching them work! They made sure we were okay and went out of their way to get us anything we needed. 

The food was delicious and the drinks were amazing! Price was fair for what we got! Tons of food! We spent a good amount of time just enjoying the environment! The workers all seemed to enjoy what they were doing and were having fun. 

It is located on pier 39! So expect crowds and noise. But not too extreme it was a great place to have fun, let go, as enjoy a wonderful meal. 

We would totally come back again, if and when we visit here!
author: Kristina D.

description: We ate there on 6/19/16, for Father's Day lunch. OMG It was soooooooooo hot in that place I kept telling my husband let's leave. When they took our name we asked for a window seat because I had my 7 year old that had never been to SF. Well forget that, we ended up literally as far as you could get from the window. We even told them we had NO problem waiting as long as possible for a window seat. Not to mention we paid easily $100 in food to sit and sweat while we ate. If it wasn't for my husband wanting to eat there we would've gone elsewhere. Now we know next time, go somewhere else.
author: Ashli B.

description:
Tourist  Trap... although we are from the Bay my kids LOVE coming here.  

The food is ok but the service is great.  Long wait... but there is a gift shop and other little stores you can check out in the meantime.

Like Ive said in some other reviews... these type of places are for the memories with your family and not a 5 star meal.  If you want a 5 star meal, there are PLENTY of other places in SF to try.
author: Julia J.

description: Disappointing. Food was ok but quite expensive for what It was (expect to pay over 20$ for a basket of basic fish-shrimp & chips). Plus we asked twice and they refused to close the door (doors stay fully open, even when it's cold and wind is blowing inside...). It was freezing cold during the whole dinner. We were happy to leave!
author: Romain N.

description:
This place is pretty cool.
The food had fantastic flavor and the service was fun.
My only dislike of this place which was enough for me to knock off one star was that when you order the 24oz beer they bring it too you in this light-up plastic cup. They also charge you extra for that useless cup. Personally I'd rather have my beer in a real glass that doesn't light up.
author: Cescilia A.

description:
I was so excited to go here I couldn't wait (I even had to pay $18 for 2 hour parking in the parking garage across the street) 

I love the atmosphere I love how laid back the waiters are and I really love how it's by the water. I also got a non alcoholic smoothie that came with a light up cup that I got to keep. It was cool. Service I give 5/5 STARS 

BUT the food was so freakin disappointing like I'm
not exaggerating:( everything was really really fishy even the snow crab legs, the fishy taste was so overwhelming I could not bare to take another bite after a while. I got the crab stuffed jump shrimp it sounded so great but it wasn't. I would go back if somebody invited me but I'd get a burger or something not seafood. Food gets 1/5 STARS
author: danielle p.

description:
Honestly, the meal was below average.
You're better off buying you're own shrimp and steaming it yourself. Everything was BLAND. Not only that, but the food took FOREVER to get to us, 1 hour. (This isn't even an estimation).

Girlfriends rice with Cajun shrimp: came out cold.
Girlfriends grandparents' food: cold.
My food: bland, under seasoned or not seasoned at all.

Despite the anger that I've gained over time from waiting, the food was below average and everyone I was with was completely dissatisfied. 

Honestly, I don't recommend this to anyone who is touring San Fran, but to also to locals who want to try something new.
author: Alyanna M. I.

description:
This restaurant had Forrest Gump written all over it. 

With quirky little trivia only to 'win' a beautiful view of San Francisco's bay waters, the Forrest Gump movie playing on nearly every corner, and a sea-like atmosphere is a few of the things you can look forward to experiencing when you walk into this joint.

The reason my score was for that fact that our food took, and I kid you not, one whole hour to get to our table. Only to find out that everyone's food was cold, hard, and frankly, mediocre.

The view was the only thing keeping me going, but even that wasn't enough for me to go back.
author: Jenn W.

description: Made my experience in SF amazing . Such a fun place to eat and relax . Excellent views!
author: Sarah B.

description:
I've been to this place twice in my life.
The first time, I had the variety shrimp and I really enjoyed it.

This time, I tried the shrimp scampi.  It wasn't the best.
The shrimp in my pasta were very good.  The pasta was very good, but there was one thing that over powered the entire dish, that I couldn't even eat it....
CAPERS!
I guess it's an acquired taste.  Still, I felt like it was drenched in it's pickled juice.  I think the bread and shrimp were the best thing from the dish.

I did try the cajun shrimp appetizer, which I really enjoyed.  It's extremely oily and spicy.  Be prepared!

I'd come back and stick to my fried shrimp.
author: Stephanie B.

description: I came in there, they messed up my order. I told the waitress that there was tomatoes on my plate when I specifically said "no tomato please". She didn't offer to change it or anything. Payed for something I didn't want. Left the table, and my boyfriend came back to the table and asked her if I left, she said "yeah hopefully" very disrespectful girl. Her name is Kayle. Don't fire her, just tell her to do her job right next time.
author: Jamie R.

description: I experienced the most amazing plate of seafood in my entire life. And that is odd because I usually stay away from seafood but damn it was delicious. Great staff and overall prismatic environment.
author: Gerardo C.

description: Very slow service.  All the staff appeared confused.  I had a mixed drink and there was no detectable alcohol in it.  The food was just okay.  They skimped on anything expensive.  Lobster salad had a couple of pieces of lobster.  Calamari was almost all peppers.  We sat at table 101 and there was 5-10 staff members always waiting to get to a terminal.  It was very rude.  We spent $185 for 2 adults and 3 kids.  I expect more for that amount.  We will not be back and will not ever try this chain again.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Love the movie, like the place, but of course there are a few 'catches'.

Anyways, I've been a few times and while the food is always great, it's always ridiculously crowded with long wait times and on occasion you have to wait even longer for service and to receive your food.

While the food is good I think the prices are a little out of touch. I once ordered a plate of jambalaya for $18 and the portion was ridiculously small. All other things my friends and I have ordered seem to be in the same boat; overpriced for the amount received.

The walls are covered in movie memorabilia and quotes, there's even a bench with Forrest's shoes outside. It's cute. Inside is incredibly cramped space, while walking, sitting, and even in the bathroom.

The staff is either scary friendly or really dull. Sometimes they'll play trivia games with you or give you some facts/information about the area, but that's only if they aren't swamped with customers. 

To sum it up, good food but bad prices, alright people with sometimes alright service, but at least there's 24/7 viewing of Forrest Gump!
author: Rachel N.

description: Love love love shrimp so this place is a great place for me. Plus all the Forest Gump references make the place entertaining. Overall a good place to take family and friends.
author: Mary G.

description: Came here with the family.i really didn't want to come here but my gf. I order fish and chips.fish was cooked to long took one bit and didn't touch it again. My girls jambalaya was ok. I took few bites of that. It's not worth the wait of hour and half for food that is only ok.
author: Dennis T.

description:
This bubba gump location had some of the best service ive had in years. my server gg was very nice and extremely attentive. it was like everytime i needed something she popped up ready to assist. I am a big fan of Forrest Gump and this restaurant really makes me feel joyful and happy. i love it when they do trivia, im the best! Anyways i give it four stars because i think the food is a little pricey considering its cajun seafood. Great service, fun ambiance, high prices. Take ur family here if you want them to have a good time and a decent meal. Thanks GG and the rest of the bubba gump staff for a great experience. 

Edit : the earlier review about GG written by Keli L. must be absolutely untrue. i think its vulgar and very rude. It seems like Keli only writes bad reviews. obviously there is some bad luck or haunted ghost following her around because every where she goes she seems to have a bad time. Just read her other reviews.
author: Arash T.

description:
Pros
Great tasting Shrimp entrees
nice views if you wait for an bay view table.

Cons 
We had to wait for 1 hour for a table!


Shrimper's Net Catch in garlic spice and Cajun Shrimp was great.
Typically they make it dry, but when you request them to make it extra saucy it was great.

We also got the caesar salad [ just OK ] + the clam chowder soup combo.
The soup was not so great, and if you really want to have clam chowder to to "Chowders" which is right at Pier39

The only plus i found recently was their reward program which seems to be good if u are a frequent visitor [ 25$ initial fee, $25 refund on your birthday month.. 1 time,  and no long lines.... and if u spend $250, u get $25 off again.. ]
author: Navin R.

description: Been here three times and I have never had a problem here . Place is nice and employees are wonderful here . Our server for the third visit was great , we actually held a great conversation. Only thing I had ordered here was the jambalaya which is great but I decided to try something different and got the fried chicken . My boy friend ordered the fish and chips and he got the bigger portion for 3.50 more which is a must !!! His plate was huge and he absolutely enjoyed . Both the fried chicken and jambalaya are good here . This place has bad reviews for the price. It's San Francisco , were in a main attraction which is the pier . Your not going to be getting 2 for 20 from apple bees here . It's a little over priced but what do you expect . Haven't had a problem here yet and we'll keep coming back.
author: Natalie M.

description: Service was great and so was the food... Minus the kids meal. Pasta was undercooked and had barely any sauce, like not even enough to cover the pasta. Stephanie was our server and she was awesome!!
author: Jamie M.

description:
The first time to visit and probably the last. The food is ok, to be frank and the sea view is a plus, but the price is not reasonable considering the food (we had a very small sample and a shrimp basket, with a milkshake and charged $70 altogether)
And what make it worse is the service we received. In the very beginning, it's ok, but the waitress Nancy seems have a big problem with our tips. ( we gave $7 as tips, just 10%, we we consider fair enough considering the amount of food we have). And in the rest of the time, the waitress refused to say a single word to us, except a  "whatever"; (I'm pretty sure I didn't overhear). 
To summary, be ready to please the waitress for whatever you get, or just pick up any of the other fancy restaurants in the pier.
author: fangyue w.

description:
I came here for the first time and it was an amazing experience along with great food. It was very crowded, but as expected for its location.

The wait wasn't too bad, it was about 30 minutes... Flew by quickly. 

Claire was the one helping us out. She's honestly the reason why I'm writing this review. The food alone was a reason, but she was the icing on the cake. Her attitude was amazing and positive even though it was hectic inside (operation wise). She took the time to take out order and calmly explained how to used the signs when needed assistance. I was able to switch an appetizer we didn't like and she took it back with a smile on her face and n hesitation. I've been to places before that I would get frowned upon if asking to switch out a plate 

While waiting for the new appetizer, she let us know the status of it and played a fun little trivia as a pass time. 

With out great service, my experience would have been mediocre but thanks to Claire, it made it that much better. Keep it up!
author: Y M.

description:
The only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is for the service AFTER the host stand. Was told the wait would be 20 minutes by the VERY rude hostess Roxy and the other hostess whose name I dont remember. After waiting 45 minutes they finally call my table for 2 and so I walked up to the stand and they proceed to ignore me and my boyfriend. Roxy looks up at me and says "name?" And I told her we were just called to the stand and she gave me a look that was like she was saying I was the dumbest person on the planet and said "then you go to the ramp.." And so we walked over there and finally the employees were very nice and helpful with anything we needed. Unfortunately I had the mahi mahi and I was not good at all. The fish tasted very rubbery and then rice and shrimp just didn't go together at all. Too overpriced for not really
enjoyable food. Waitress was great though.
author: Montana M.

description: This is our favorite-must-eat place when we go to the wharf.  The servers are always great.   Get a Window seat if your there during the day.  Join the club too and skip the line.  If not, well at least the sights are great.
author: Michael G.

description: Drove up here from Santa Cruz because I had an event in San Francisco that ended late. Me needing a late night dinner called to make a to go order hoping they wouldn't close on me and the girl told me that you have to make to go orders in person as I check to see what saw that Bubba Gumps was "open" as I get there the girl tells me their closed -_- you guys need to change the closing date I was really excited to get some shrimp.
author: Jackiee M.

description: Horrible service. At first the dude told me they didnt have steak sauce but he didn't even check then I asked him to check and he brought back a brand new bottle. One of our burgers were ordered well cooked and it was brought raw. They charged us for another burger even thought it was there fault. I ordered mashed potatoes with my steak and I asked for gravy but didn't get my gravy until my food was done. Food was mediocre and over priced.
author: Basilio D.

description: I've always been a fan of bubba gumps and frequently go there when I'm in other touristy cities. I've never been to this location until today and the people who work on the floor are a little unprofessional. They didn't give us the bubba gump quiz like they normally do at other places but despite that, the food and location along the Pier is great. Our server was very nice and the food was delicious. It is on the pricey side so be prepared to spend when you're here. I ordered a talapia shrimp with chipotle and crab butter over rice. It was awesome. I also had a sip of my friends blue Hawaiian drink which was also yummy. I wish I can come here often but won't be back for a while Because I don't have money like that.
author: Shan M.

description: What is the point of the Stop Forrest Stop signs if no one acknowledges?? We got seated. Table on one side of us gets drink order taken. Waitress walks by, gets other table that got seated a couple minutes after us. 15 mins go by, no greeting, no drinks ordered. We flip the sign. 10 minutes and 2 waitresses pass by, nothing.  Did I mention I've got 4 kids with me, and they are patiently waiting just for water? Its busy, I get it. But not even a hey, we'll be with you, sorry for the wait. Now i get up and ask for a manager at the hostess desk. They call for 5 minutes before someone shows up just for me to let them know we have been waiting a total of 30 min and we'd like water at least. We got seated an hr and 20 minutes ago and still havent gotten food. Yup, we wanted to leave but we are from out of town, here for the day, and didnt know where else we could go, without driving around for another hr and waiting somewhere else.
author: Chris H.

description: What can I say.  This is a fun place with good food.  Family had shrimp salad and I had side of shrimp.  Friends had Mai Mai jackdaniels. It is alway good. Manager came to say hi to me.  Other friends had Forrest sea food feast. Dish was good the dips could have been better.
author: Mike C.

description:
After a long drive to San Fran the weekend before, I needed something fulfilling and new. Ended up walking down the pier to the wharf all the way. Long walk but I was new here so no worries.

The wait was one hour and 15 minutes. Now some people will give low reviews based on that. I see it as a positive for a restaurant that people are willing to wait outside for a spot rather than go to the hundreds of other places to eat.

After getting in, I had Mama's Southern Fried Chicken and it was delicious. The only reason I didn't rate a 5 was because I have had the Cajun fried chicken from Razzoo's which tops pretty much any chicken friend chicken breast meal based on the seasoning of the chicken. TRY IT

Other than that, the Irish waiter was friendly. He was only there for the summer so it was nice to chat about what there is to do in the city.

Overall a great experience with a view of Alcatraz and the bay. Highly recommend.
author: Brian J.

description:
I've been here before on my 21st birthday for drinks and food with my friends and I had a great time but I was just here for lunch and the experience wasn't as pleasant. 

I ordered the cordon blue chicken sandwich because it sounded so delicious but when it came out, I kid you not, the piece of chicken on each half of the sandwich was about the size of a very small thin chicken nugget. Very disappointing. & to top it off the chicken was cold! I ordered a different sandwich being the Cajun guacamole chicken sandwich and i wouldn't say it was the best but it definitely was better except the bun was cold. Hmm arn't buns suppose to be warm? The manager came by and asked how everything was and I said "eh could be better" he offered to make me something else but I definitely was not going to wait for a THIRD entree after we've been waiting forever. I ended up just eating the sandwich. Nothing was taken off of the bill and not even a dessert was offered. 

Oh and the small bowl of gumbo soup I ordered took about 15 minutes to get to me. We also didn't get greeted for about 12 minutes after we sat. 

I'd give it another shot though hoping is a one time thing.
author: Ashley S.

description: I wanted so desperately to like it. The only thing saving this review is the incredible view. Alcatraz and the entire bay. Just stunning. The service was sub-par and the food was less than spectacular. If you don't like sea food, this is definitely not the place for you. It is incredibly over priced. Just absolutely absurd. You'll have much better luck at another restaurant on the boardwalk.
author: Kaylin M.

description:
The service and waitress here are the reason I was highly disappointed. 
I am a great fan of the movie "Forest Gump". Even though this place reminds you of the movie, it is nothing like it. We waited 30 min for a place to sit. This was fine, but the waitress serving us was very rude and was constantly bugging us, invariably wanting us to eat and go away I guess. Food in these places are always average but you want to have a good time. Me and my wife were stressed after spending 30 min inside and were treated very badly. The shrimp dish we ordered mostly contained fries. I can only hope that at least someone doesn't go here after reading my review. Please avoid.
author: Bimal S.

description: Second time eating at Bubba Gump. Food is good and atmosphere fun. Our waitress went AWOL though hence the four stars. Manager finished the table service. Still a good time. Would go again.
author: Keith B.

description:
I have never had bubba, and I had to go all the way to beautiful SF to try it. 
I'm not complainging...

So I am a sea food lover and shrimp happens to be one of my favorites. 
Well bubba specializes in SHRIMP. 
They do SHRIMP everything, you name it

The wait at this location is rather long, i wasn't surprised being that its at one of the most touristy locations in SF! 
So be prepaired for a long wait. My boyfriend and I waited well over an  hour!
 But we did get the best seats in the house! 
A table right next to the window overlooking the bay. 
What you can do to alleviate the wait is hit up their bar, they have Bubba Gump beer! It's actually pretty tasty, I recomend having it being that you are at BUBBA GUMP SHRIMP!

I dont remember what we got exactly but everything was delicious. Especially the shrimp macaroni! mmmmm yummy.

The waitresses go around and give a bubba gump pop quiz, so make sure to brush up on your trivia skills.
author: Jackie R.

description:
Over due review. Love the food. Been here several times. Love the views. Very friendly. Compared to what you would get at another seafood restaurant on the pier, pick this one for better flavor and quantity. 
Ive read reviews that its crowded. Well let me tell ya alot more space to get up and go to bathroom compared to other restaurants on the pier. 

Can't wait to go again! Mouth watery yum yum
author: Sarai C.

description:
So, I admit it. I like this chain restaurant. Sue me!

It's crowded but guess what. It's at Pier 39-one of the biggest tourist spots in SF. Do you really expect it to be empty? Come on now. I had to wait for awhile to eat here and at this point I can't even remember why we picked it but we did.

Upside:: Now for the positivity. I liked the food here! I got the fish and chips and I enjoyed it. It was super filling and kinda fatty but I didn't order fried fish and fries to be healthy. It's kind of fun inside and the view of the bay is a major bonus. Also, I love Forrest Gump just like everyone else.

Downside: I would honestly say just that it's loud but this goes back to the tourist location.
author: Salma R.

description:
The place was packed, but that's not really the issue - I expected as much being a tourist destination.

The real issue is that my pregnant wife ordered a bottle of water, they brought out one that they tried to pass off as new, but there was ice in it, and the cap-seal was already broken!

When we asked for another bottle of water, they said they ran out.

I think they filled it up with tap water from a cup of water they had lying around, and tried to pass it off as a bottle of water new....

...this was hugely disappointing and made me lose trust in this whole place.
author: Cal C.

description:
I am generally not a big fan of seafood but decided to check this place out during my sfo trip. I had the coronarita  and the dumb luck coconut shrimp. Shrimp was crispy, soft, flavorful. The marmalade dip was sweet and tangy, perfect pairing. The fries felt a little salty. The husband had a locally brewed beer which he loved and he had another shrimp dish which was really  good. But the star was the garlic bread appetizer...the best I've eaten all my life...buttery, garlicy and soft bread. Sure the appetizer came after the main course due to a kitchen mishap but who cares...the flavor was amazing in every dish we ordered.

Coronarita glass souvenir and a nice picture outside in Forrest Gump shoes :)

Perfect first lunch in sfo and a brilliant start to a memorial day vacation.
author: S V.

description: Waited 40 minutes for our food and had a bread plastic clip in the food, they screwed up our order, and it took 35 minutes to get our last meal. Won't go back here.  2 stars because they took the mistakes off the check.
author: David S.

description: We had the coconut shrimp appetizer. Friendly bartender and Forrest Gump plays in the background on a screen the whole time. Nice memorabilia in the restaurant.
author: Kim L.

description: This place is a joke, my family and I went here for my birthday today and we literally waited to be seated for 3-4 hours!! Then when we did get seated it took them over an hour and a half to get our food out to us! The service, staff and food was all horrible! I will never go to this one again, or recommend it to anyone! And there was hair in some of our food! And the manager is a joke also, so unprofessional!
author: Nichole G.

description: Great service and great food. Our waiter, Payton was excellent! He was always there when we needed him. He even asked us trivia questions based on the movie!!! If you love the movie Forrest Gump you have to check this place out!! Best place in town off Pier 39!!!!
author: Monica B.

description:
After the rude treatment I recently received, I will never eat here again nor recommend them. After being seated, we sat there for well over 10 minutes with no one taking an order or giving us so much as a glass of water. I could understand this if it was extremely busy. It wasn't. It was the deadest I've ever seen it.

We got up to leave. The person at the front door was barely coherent. I asked to speak to a manager. He looked annoyed that he had to get up from sitting there doing nothing and do something. When manager arrived, I told him I didn't appreciate literally being ignored. He was like, oh, sorry we ignored you. No, come back in and let's take your order right away. No, how about a free drink for your inconvenience. Nothing. Just, uh, oh well. When I mentioned that this would be put in a review on Yelp, he just laughed and walked away.

This kind of attitude and poor service is unacceptable in the first place, but considering this restaurant is in a high tourist area where people from all corners of the world visit, you'd think they'd have a little more care on how they treat their customers.
author: Doll O.

description: Manager called me personally about the pricing issue and even sent me a gift card! Great customer service!
author: Valerie K.

description:
Food is ok at most, not flavourful 
nor warm !! overpriced and mediocre. 
Our server was on time and friendly no complaints.  
A TRUE TURIST TRAP. Wont come back.....
author: Maximus Decimus Meridius ..

description: I love Bubba Gump's because the location is superb, the menu offers a variety of options & the ambience is so much fun. If you're a fan of Forest Gump I'd highly recommend coming here. The entire place is decorated with movie memorabilia & references. On the walls you can see different license plates, shrimp posters and snapshots of different scenes from the movie. The view in this restaurant is also unbeatable. You overlook the ocean & can see the port of sailboats. I tried Shrimper's Heaven for $22 & thought that it was super tasty. It came with tempura shrimp, grilled shrimp, coconut shrimp & regular battered shrimp on a bed of fries. It came with 3 dipping sauces that included an orange marmalade type dip, cocktail sauce & a sweet dijon style dip. We had a super bubbly & fun waitress who was attentive when we turned over our "run forest run" sign to "stop forest." I like how the drink menu is on a ping pong paddle & how there are movie quotes on the table. I also tried the chocolate root beer float with vanilla vodka. It wasn't as large as I expected it to be nor was it as boozy as I expected it to be but it was very tasty nevertheless. It was made with IBC root beer which is 1 of my favorites. The wait here can be long sometimes but they take down your phone number & text you when your table is ready. Meanwhile, you can go across from the restaurant & browse the Bubba Gump's souvenir shop where you can buy really cute souvenirs like a shrimp stuffed animal or a box of chocolates.
author: Brenda L.

description: My family and I enjoy coming here. Most of the time it's great with a couple of bad experiences but they rectified themselves and what restaurant do you know is perfect all the time. If you haven't tried this place you should give it a try. They have a variety of food, it's fun and on the pier overlooking the beautiful ocean.
author: Luis L.

description: Don't see why the 3 star average had a great meal . with a good atmosphere. Our server was awesome would totally come back
author: Mike C.

description:
My overall experience at Bubba Gump is Amazing I would give it 10/10!
 
 As we enter the place the guy in the front desk was welcoming us and asked us to wait for an empty table to become available because it was a bit crowded,so we had to wait for about 20 mints.
 
The table was clean and the view on the ocean was magnificent,The menu has a good variety.
 We were four people so we tried to cover all the menu and share everything so we ordered both fried and grill shrimp, fish and ships,ping pong pesto pasta,steamed crab legs and the seafood feast.
 
The food was delicious well prepare and cooked well, it had so much flavor on it, if you were there never miss the shrimp whether fried or grill.
 
The atmosphere was good the place had so much life in it so if you are the quiet person who like's to eat and listen to the relaxing music,the place is not for you.
 
 Prices ? ummm I think it's a bit high but definitely worth every penny!
 
The staff was charming and very nice even thought it was busy
 
 I would definitely recommend the place and I will visit again as soon as possible.
author: Khalid J.

description: The crab stuffed mushrooms are a must for any mushroom lover. Overall, Daphne and I  loved the quality of food. We found the use of the license plates to let servers know you needed something was a great concept. The service was a different story. While our server was great, the additional service was not so much. Daphne finished her drink, and when the food came, she asked for a refill. A refill that never came. So we used the license plates again, and another server stopped. Daphne again requested a refill. By now, our dinner was half eaten and Daphne still didn't receive her refill. It wasn't until our actual server returned to discuss our dessert options that we finally got that refill. Lastly, we chose the "$$" price rating, we soon found out that after you have an appetizer, an entrée, and dessert for two, the bill can easily become $100.
author: David N Daphne R.

description: Service was amazing but the price for the quality of food wasn't too amazing. The food tasted excellent for my dish of Jenny's catch, but the friend shrimp and fried onion appetizers were underwhelming and over priced for the amount.
author: Kayla F.

description:
Read the reviews, came with low expectations even though we're not newbies to Bubba Gump. However, it has been a good 5 or 6 years since we've dined here.

That being said, if you haven't seen the movie...or worse yet, don't even LIKE the movie....then don't waste your time here.  1/2 the fun of this place is the Forrest Gump-y-ness.  

We came mid week for lunch. Perfect timing. Seated right away by the window looking out over the bay toward Alcatraz. It was beattiful. Service was attentive & friendly from the get go. Not pushy or overbearing in the least.

They've got a great thing going with the blue "run Forrest run" or "stop Forrest stop" signs at each table. We never had to use ours for "stop" but have no doubt any one of the abundant and helpful servers would have checked on us immediately upon seeing the red "stop Forrest stop". 

Ordered their freckled strawberry lemonade (in honor of my daughter who ALWAYS used to get that when we ate here and couldn't be with us this day). My wife had iced tea. It's a Pepsi place. 

For starters, we had the cheesy artichoke spinach dip with a mountain of chips. It was very tasty. Nothing very unique to this place but delicious just the same.

We were delighted to see they brought back my wife's favorite dish...the shrimp shack pasta...which had been discontinued on our last visit but they were still happy to make for her.  It's a rather yummy shrimp & pasta dish with a light lemon & feta cheese flavor.  I admit to liking it very much too but always get my favorite: shrimp'in dip'in sauce....which has now been dropped from the menu.  No worries, I went for the New Orleans shrimp with jasmine rice. It's very similar to what I used to get and was still very good. I wasn't overly disappointed.  Next time I want to try the Cajun one with shrimp and andouille sausage.  

No dessert for us this time. Too full.  

In conclusion, it's probably not the best seafood there is, but what they do...they do right. Pricing is on par with any of the touristy SF restaurants in this area. No sticker shock here. Didn't feel like we got a screaming deal, but we certainly didn't feel raped. Since we went for lunch on a weekday, it wasn't crowded and we certainly didn't feel rushed.

We are glad we went. Glad it didn't disappoint and would certainly go again. 

Mamma says, life is like a box of chocolates--you never know what your gonna get!
author: Keith A.

description: The first time I came in for dinner we had terrible service. And the food was cold. But I gave it another try, and our server Steven made my experience amazing. My boyfriend and I only come in now when he works. Steven remember our orders and works Monday's. We now come in every Monday. Shrimp net catch and the steamed crab legs are the best.
author: Rebekah P.

description: Really big fan of shrimp, so I thought I might as well try it for the first time. Let's just say I'm never going back. My server seemed to not care about having any manners whatsoever, our food took about 45 minutes for it to be in the middle of the day on a Wednesday and the food honestly wasn't that good that I accidentally left my to-go box there and as I was walking out I didn't even want to turn back to get it because even though I spent a lot of money the food was unsatisfactory, that should speak for itself
author: Nekay O.

description:
The first time I ever saw a Bubba Gump restaurant was August 2011, when I was down in L.A. on vacation with friends. I didn't dine in during that time, but almost a year later with the suggestion from a co-worker, I gave the place a shot. My party of two decided on a whim to head to the city to try the place out on a Friday night. The restaurant was pretty packed, given that it was a Friday night. The wait had to be no more than 30 minutes though. Since we had time to kill, my boyfriend and I decided to wait at the bar and have a few drinks while doing so (well, I didn't drink, but my boyfriend did). We probably sat at the bar for 15-20 minutes until our name was called and we stood in line to be seated for another 10 minutes. Our hostess played a silly game with us, which I thought was fun. 

We were seated at a table that overlooked the bay. Unfortunately it was foggy. 
The service was excellent!! I cannot stress how much I enjoy GREAT customer service. 

What more can you ask for? Good food and excellent customer service!

Review from July 2012
author: Ardella O.

description: I visited here this past Saturday with family and friends. My sister and I have a ton of food allergies, and a lot of restaurants have pre-prepared food making it difficult for me especially to eat out. I was really happy that the staff was able to accommodate my difficult food restrictions. Bihn, the manager, made sure the chef came to talk to us so that  he could come up with some dishes that were safe for us to eat. I settled on grilled fish tacos and veggies while my sister had Salmon, rice, fries, and spinach. The manager also made sure to check up on our table periodically to make sure everything was okay. He also made sure the waiting staff was aware of our food allergies. Overall,  the food was fresh and delicious. Everyone at our table loved the food, and we were all greatful for the amazing service. This is a great spot for families and kids. Thank you so much Bihn! He's the best manager I've ever come across at any food establishment.
author: Veronica S.

description: If you're here for a loud atmosphere this is the place to be. The food isn't the best quality but if you like fried items this place will do. I ordered the salmon and veggie plate. Salmon was a little over done, but I made it thru most of it. I didn't care for my carrots and red onions but I liked the asparagus that were part of the veggies. We ordered calamari first and I've definitely had better. There's vegetables mixed in with the calamari so beware of those. Our margaritas didn't taste like there was any alcohol. Our waiter was OK, never offered us dessert or asked how things are so that could have been better. But this is part of pier 39, so you're not here for a quiet night out.
author: Renee P.

description: Amazing te here very family oriented! A lot of choices from seafood little pricey but it is seafood. The bucket of shrimp Cajun is really food! The Texas Cajun burger also a classic! Different types of alcohol drinks. The servers amazing people with wonderful personality and also  the gift shop very nice merchandise.
author: Yvette L.

description: The best part about this location is the view. We were lucky enough to get a window seat and that really made the experience better than if we didn't have that to keep us occupied. While we waited we watched what was going on in the water with boats leaving and arriving, Alcatraz in the background, and people enjoying water sports. As far as the food and drinks, they were okay, but nothing to rave about. We ordered and appatizer and drinks right away when we sat and it took quite a while to get those out to the table. I get frustrated with this since these are supposed to be the quickest and easiest things to get to you. So while we waited a little excessively for some drinks and an appetizer, we were at least entertained with the view.
author: Nathan G.

description: Been here a handful of times. The wait is usually extremely long, especially weekends. Go and reserve your party there, and then walk around shops to kill time. The sampler with all the different kinds of shrimps is sooooo good! You will spend a good penny but if you've never been here the seafood is great!! Great service too!
author: Jordan B.

description: I had the coconut shrimp and hush puppies for lunch. Delicious! The view of the Pier was wonderful. My server was very nice and attentive. Based on the movie Forrest Gump. I love that movie as well.  You must check this place out when you come to the Pier in San Francisco.
author: Evan C.

description:
I'm pretty sure the only reason we came here is because we had someone with us from out of town and thought we'd take her to a fun popular place! Well that wasn't the best idea, I've been here plenty of times and I'm never too pleased.

The food is "okay" at it's best. I got the fish tacos and they were SO plain, I mean come on were on the ocean, can you put a little love into them? Everything is soo over priced, it's mostly about the experience which I'm sure is why they get a lot of business.... The atmosphere is a little too loud and crazy for an everyday place to eat at. Probably won't be returning.
author: Allayna F.

description: Food wasn't all that and was super expensive for small portions! We had to wait about 20 mins, not bad. Drinks were really good! And we got to keep one mason jar! :)
author: Ria D.

description:
Ended up leaving before a waiter even came to the table.   I watched him take the drink order of two table who came in after me and then the food order I one of those tables.

When I complained I was told he had to change a keg so there would be a delay.   There wasn't a delay for the female customers he took care of and flirted with.

Why didn't I say something sooner?  It isn't my job to notify him he has a table.   I went to the crab house down the pier and had immediate service.   

Sorry you are off my dining list.
author: John G.

description:
Everyone was great. Our server (Edgar Allen Bro) was great. Dorky /funny guy. Lol ;) I wish I could remember his real name, but we told him he looks like John Cusack :D

I ordered a veggie burger and fries. I was happy they had it on the menu, and it didn't disappoint.

I also custom ordered a margarita, it was yummy and I was happy they made it for me! My boyfriend's Michelada was another story though lol. Althiugh we appreciated the effort. I'm surprised many places still don't know what that is!
author: Liliana R.

description:
Truly love this restaurant and all the memories here.

Pros:

(a) Bayside/Oceanside view when eating
(b) Friendly staff that will converse with you and get your order fast
(c) Forrest Gump trivia and games (with occasional photo ops)
(d) Good gift shop
(e) Awesome location at the end of Pier 39; go check out the sea lions afterwards

Cons:

None.  Just be sure to go during a good time of year (spring/summer) to get a good experience and bring a warm coat.
author: Justine C.

description: If I could put ZERO stars as an option I would! We were told a wait time of 1 1/2 hours so we patiently waited. Mind you I'm almost 9 months pregnant and a diabetic. After waiting nearly that length of time, we were told that the next large group calling would be ours ( we had 6); but a group of 8 were called instead. After almost 2 hours they told us that there's no guarantee to seat us. And if we were called, we'd have to wait in another line for over 30 minutes in order to be seated. I'm appalled by the service and the way this situation was handled. I've been to Bubba Gump in other places (that are busy) and I still wonder why this location is still in business. Such a big disappointment. I would not recommend this place AT ALL.
author: Ya Y.

description: Worst restaurant experience, I got there at 9:20pm and left at 10:22pm and never received my meal. The manager gave as an excuse that they had a large party of 13. Wow and the restaurant was not even full.  Many customers were having to get up to look for their waiters because they were busy talking. They need better customer service
author: Monica G.

description:
I came here today with my bby t-rex because it was a million degrees in San Jose and oh man!! it's good food! Albeit pricey, it's worth it.. Great service, accommodating, and they gave us a window seat I requested for:) 

We had the mahi and it's cream creole sauce was great, the fish itself was a tad bit dry but it was acceptable. The other plate was the stuffed trout, idk how they cook their rice but it has the texture of instant rice which wasn't very good. the stuffed trout was amazing! I was wishing she would spontaneously have allergic reactions and I'd be forced to eat her food!! Lol! Jk:) but you guys get the point!

Tip: late lunch or early dinner is yr best bet, so make a daycation out ov it.. Yr already in sf so slow it down and enjoy what this odd city has to offer (^_~)¡!

Happy Eating!
author: Marco O.

description: Good stuff. Everything was great here, the service, the location, the food. The waiter was friendly and fun and checked in periodically to make sure our table was having a good experience. I ordered shrimpers heaven and it was fantastic. I suggest that if you are in San Francisco you should definitely stop by and have lunch or dinner here.
author: Gabriella P.

description:
I came here with my wife. We got a great table by the window with a great view of Alcatraz. The waiter was good. He even gave us a bunch of trivia questions that I got about half right. 
I then gave him a trivia question. I said, "Don't look. What is the small sign directly behind you?" He didn't know. I said, "It says Exit." He smiled and ask if that was a hint. Hahahahaha. It wasn't suppose to be a hint, just worked out that way.
The food was good.
author: Patrick Z.

description: Great costumer service, good food, money well spent!!:) the young man who assisted us this evening is  amazingly charming and  has a great sense of humor.. I enjoyed him making my family and I laugh :)
author: Jess L.

description: Opened on Christmas day so that was great! Even though there was a 1 hour wait, the fact that it was opened when most places were closed, it was a life saver. The food was really good and the service was great! Staff was in a good mood to be working on Christmas day and with so many crowds. The view overseeing the pier was amazing at night.
author: Ana D.

description:
Been here three times, and each experience was worse than the next. My girl loves this place, but I see the dark forces behind the cheery exterior - *stops typing to look over my shoulder*. The second time I went here, the wait was 2 hours. I asked them why and they said "drama in the kitchen". Okey smokey. 

This third time (2/1/14) our server was absent and another one came by and mentioned she was arguing with him and she'd "let him know" we were waiting for help. Okey dokey-didel-smokey!

Here are the cold hard facts:

-Overpriced greasy food - $18-$24 per plate, not including tax and tip.

-Extremely loud atmosphere

-Tables CONSTANTLY claiming bdays, signaled by a server who screams the announcement so loud you think they got stung in the butt by a bat ray, followed by an unintelligible bday chorus - "FRAFRICKCHUGGY-CHUG-BUBBA-GUUUUUHHMPP...!"

-DO NOT GET A BURGER HERE. I know it's a seafood place, but folks, a place as famous as this shouldn't take a dump on a plate and call it a burger, no matter how specialized you are. BG's should have be versatile enough to produce seafood AND adequate non-seafood dishes. The burger was tasteless and no BBQ flavor to speak of (it was a "BBQ" Burger).

I give this place a dreaded 1 star because drama in the server and kitchen realms should be handled without impacting the customers. That's a huge knock against this place.
author: Jeremy H.

description:
The food was good - this place is always consistent, whether you're at the Monterey location or Fisherman's wharf (the 2 that I've been to) it's been good.

Our server Thomas was great!  He played a little Forrest Gump trivia with me and my boys while we waited for our food.  He was always checking up on us and refilled my water 3 times.  Very great service.  

We went here for my son's 15th Bday and they happily sung the birthday song while embarrassing him and Thomas even made the announcement that he was celebrating his 21st birthday which got laughs from all nearby tables.  Over all a great experience.
author: Aisha M.

description: Went here for lunch today a little bit warm in the restaurant but food was amazing! Pretty good service, I always recommend to anyone who hasn't been here!
author: Cori M.

description: Its all hype but its a fun place to eat. Food was mediocre and fattening. Service was a little slow and food is overpriced.  Probably would not come back.
author: Thuyvi M.

description: Great environment. Great place to eat. They have some great seafood. I ordered the steamed shellfish and it was amazing. I recommend it.
author: Paul M.

description: Bubba Gumps is great. Super atmosphere makes you feel at home. Anything there tastes like magic 5/5.
author: Alexander J.

description: overpriced, long wait, horrible service, and salty food!
author: Elaine C.

description:
My husband and I came on Christmas Eve (for my Birthday- it was not busy at all- which it usually it)- just us two. We are Landry club members so we were seated right away with a view of the San Francisco Bay (Gorgeous). We had soup (Gumbo and Clam Chowder) to start off. We ordered a drink that had a toasted Marshmallow in it. The drink was so good. I really wanted the Shrimp Shack Pasta, which they no longer have on the menu- so I was pretty bummed. So I ordered the Shrimp New Orleans, it was ok- I felt a little sick after eating it. Which I have had this dish before, it just didn't taste the same... 

The staff did come and sing happy birthday to me- which was nice. The overall experience was ok. It is the closest Bubba Gumps to me and has great views of the Bay.
author: Lemoura G.

description: Poor quality food.  Service was not good, waitress seemed rushed, too busy to spend more than a minute with us at a time. We had to ask 4 times for them to close a window, was cold next to open window during 45 degree weather. We waited 20 mins for a table and specified we wanted window seat with view. Then after 20 minutes we had to wait another 15 mins for a table with view. Was taking my parents visiting Northern California for the first time. Don't waste your time or money. Very expensive for quality and service.  Will never return!
author: Sonia Y.

description: Yesterday i found a plastic on my accidental fish and shrimp plate and the waiter and manager didnt even apologized to me. I am never coming back.
author: Felipe L.

description:
Pro:  Great location overlooking the SF Bay and the food is okay...

Cons:  Overbearing waitstaff!!  No, I don't want to join your dining club!  I don't want to play 20 questions as you attempt to sell me on your dining club, or listen to ALL the waitstaff play 20 questions with every patron!!  It's damned annoying!  Some people just want to eat in peace.

Then there's the Run Forest Run signs on the table.  Not once did I turn it over indicating that I wanted my waitress to magically appear, but she was at my table CONSTANTLY!!!  How about instead of needing signs to indicate that a table requires attention, they just train their staff to be aware of the patron's needs??

I found all the game playing annoying and unnecessary, and for these reasons I won't go back and definitely won't recommend this place to anyone.
author: Abby L.

description:
I'll probably never eat here again because the selections we received was either bad ordering on our part or everything really did come out of a 'fry' basket. Most of us never even finished the fries - all grease. Saddening considering it was my first trip to Frisco and Bubba Gump's. 

We should have went to the pier like we were told. :(
author: Kimetta C.

description:
I've lived in SF my entire life, and worked at Pier 39 every summer for about 5 years. Never eaten at Bubba Gumps.

It's always so busy, I would never want to wait in line. 

A coworker invited me to have lunch, and luckily we found a seat at the bar. I had a delicious bloody mary ($11). The service was really good.

We had the mahi mahi entree with mashed potatoes and shrimp. The aioli sauce they put on the fish was delicious. Everything was fresh and tasty, I was really pleasantly surprised.

We also shared a veggie burger with mushrooms and spinach, and it was really good.

I would definitely visit again.
author: Michelle W.

description: My favorite shrimps place in the entire Bay Area, my friend and I went there on Christmas Eve and had a huge amount of delicious shrimps. The service was great, Gabriel was awesome n very helpful. I don't get why some people gave this place less than 4-5 stars but well, you can have negative experience anywhere, mine was just great :)
author: Mariam H.

description:
This was the first time I've ever eaten at Bubba Gumps and it was just "meh" for me. 5 stars for the service and bay views, but only 3 stars for the food. My sister order the seafood bucket (market price that day was $25) and there was hardly anything in it. The crab legs hardly had any meat in them, the clams and mussels were teeny tiny. I ordered Bourbon Street Mahi-Mahi and the fish was over cooked and dry; that would be fine if I wanted fish jerky. My mom enjoyed her Pear & Berry salad and Dillon wolfed down the Texas Cajun Chicken sandwich (we just got off a 5 hr flight, he was hungry!). 

Next time I'm at the pier I'll go with a clam chowder bowl at Chowders.
author: Julia C.

description: We had horrible service here. The food was overcooked and came out really late. We waited over an hour for the food to come out and we managed to see 3 shift changes. So I posted a review on the Landry club website and the manager called me back. He said he would compensate us for the poor service. This was in March and we haven't heard back since. I called back and have been ignored since. Money is not the big thing here, but it's the principle. The double talk and lying is what will make me avoid Bubba Gump and Landry's restaurants.
author: Francis Y.

description:
Every time I have family come in from Alaska, they request to come here. 

I think its overpriced for the food, however you also pay for the location . 

Bubba Gumps is at Pier 39 ,surrounded with shopping, tourist attractions, seafood, a merry go round and sport shops. The restaurant  sits on top of the water overlooking the SF bay. But if  I wanted to look at the water, I would have rather purchased  a $3.75 hot dog from the hot dog stand  and a chocolate covered frozen banana with peanuts for $5.50 and ate it at the bench out side the pier.
author: Nyla J.

description: This was the only good restaurant experience we had on our visit to San Francisco. We had tried the Hard Rock down the pier and had a long wait and crappy food. Bubba Gumps was crowded and I thought our wait would be at least an hour but was surprised when they told us 15 minutes and it was spot on. Our waiter was very fun and friendly and the service was amazing our drinks were always full. Our food was amazing. I wish we had one here in Seattle! I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Maria H.

description:
came to this place on MLK day and it was really packed, but luckily the wait wasnt too long

we actually got seated right by a window with an awesome view of the bay and our waiter was michael

i love the forest gump theme of this restaurant, its really entertaining to see how they incoportate every part of the movie into your visit

we were only a party of two so we were seated at a smaller table, the only thing i would complain about where we were seated is that it was pretty crowded and tight, couldnt move much.

our waiter was really helpful and friendly, he had his recommendations and that helped out alot.

we ordered our drinks and the cajun shrimp as apetizers. they were delicious to say the least! they came with garlic bread and that was delicious as well, although they were a bit too buttery.

the reason we went to SF in the first place is because we were craving clam chowder so thats what we ordered. unfortunatley they dont have bread bowls, they just have regular glass bowls to eat out of it but the waiter was nice enough to give us some more garlic bread on the side.

the clam chowder was really good too! i had always just ordered from the sidewalk stands but this beat those even though they didnt have a bread bowl

the waiter was really entertaining, in the middle of our lunch he came in and started asking us trivia questions about the movie Forest Gump, unfortunately we hadnt seen the movie in years and got almost all the questions wrong, i wonder what we would have won if we got them all right, but he said for trying we would get "free" water all day lol

overall, the experience was great and i would definitely come back and recomend it to anyone!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
My family and I went here for the first time on a busy Saturday afternoon.  They were busy, but the wait was only 10-15 minutes. However there "waiting period" was a bit confusing. You give them your name and number of party and wait for them to call you (like any restaurant), but once they call your name you walk up to the ramp and wait again for your table. I guess I thought it was a bit confusing because we never been here, but we will know what to do the next time we come back.

Once we were seated our waiter (forgot his name) acknowledged us right away even if they were really busy. He was super friendly and very welcoming.
