Since it was our first time there we didn't know what to order, but he had great recommendations! He made this visit quite nice and the food was pretty decent. For 4 people it was about $90. Be prepared for a "Forrest Gump" quiz before you leave. We watched the movie more than 100 times so we did awesome! Lol!
author: Anna P.

description:
Came here about a week ago to celebrate a friends birthday who came in from out of town. Normally, I don't eat at chain restaurants but my cousins had worked here over summer and the birthday girl wanted to try it so we thought we'd give it a shot.

Upon coming in, (we arrived around 10:15 pm) we were told to wait for a table. There was hardly any people in the restaurant, but we still waited approximately 10 minutes. We found it interesting but were fine once we got seated.

Our waiter, a younger guy who was decently attractive helped us. At first, things were looking very positive for him as our waiter, friendly making personal connections with us.
As he took our orders, I asked about the soup, the Crab bisque. He told me that the clam chowder served wasn't good at all, but the bisque was alright. Having worked in restaurant before, I appreciated the honesty, but from a restaurant standpoint, aren't you always trying to up sell?

Furthermore, he addressed my friend at the table as 'buddy' which she was mildly offended at.

Honestly, the food was just sub par but it was a chain restaurant so we couldn't expect much.
It was the waiter who really killed the mood for us, and took on a condescending tone most of the time, while trashing his own restaurant.

When exiting the table, he told us 'I hope you take your friend to somewhere better than Fisherman's Wharf'

...like um sorry you hate your job but don't kill it for others.
author: Annie C.

description:
Coconut shrimp is the BOMB! 
Super friendly service always makes the food taste even better. Brent is the best waiter I've ever encountered. 
He loves Trisha's donuts. Will take instead of tips!
author: Kyle H.

description:
Famous for being mentioned in such a famous movie, but the food sucks. 

All the food was blah, blah, blah. Nothing refined, nothing special, everything bland.  

The best thing about this place is that they have immediate service. You flip over that license plate to red and you get service right away, no matter who your server is. 

We had the Pear & Berry salad. It was drenched in super sweet sauce that was way too fruity for my own taste. I usually love fruity dressings, but this was way too much. This salad was pretty dull too. Too much lettuce, less of everything else. 

We ordered the Shrimper's Net Catch. Basically a bucket of shrimp cooked with beer. Flavorless. I did not like. I have satisfied my curiosity with Bubba Gump. Next time I will just watch the movie at home and make my own seafood.
author: Hang T.

description: Server recommended us something new on their appetizer menu that wasn't on their menu yet, which I thought was awesome. It was basically 4 different things shrimp with fries, fish and fries, hush puppies, and last of all Mac n cheese bites fried! We ordered drinks as well which came out really fast. We waited maybe about 20 mins, until a manager came to let us know that they didn't have any Mac n cheese bites which was really disappointing... They could have told us earlier instead of making us wait for so long. He said we can sub it for Mac n cheese with shrimp. When we got it, it didn't even have shrimp in it, but I wasn't going to complain.. I was done waiting and wanted to leave. Service was lacking and took them a while to give us or check and to get my card ran. Our server disappeared for a while, I feel like they should be more attentive, they have so much staff on site.
author: Christina T.

description: I'm giving this restaurant 4 stars, but only because I have eaten here many times and have never had a bad meal. However, this time was quite different. We had the seafood hush puppies as our appetizer and these were very delicious! I had the I'm Stuffed Shrimp. The shrimp was very overcooked and rubbery. I could not even finish it. My husband had the Bucket of Boat Trash and the crab was overcooked as well. Our server seemed to be overwhelmed and we had to wait a while to get our check. This experience will not prevent me from going back. However, it probably won't be any time in the near future.
author: Cheryl A.

description: went to bubba gump for the first time, on my birthday nov 22. my boyfriend decided to surprise me with a trip to san fran, we are from stockton ca. they provided great service, very friendly environment. all though my plate (jennys catch) was terribly salty. i decided to stay quiet and just eat it . lol i didnt want to hurt my boyfriends feelings .. i kinda expecteed better:(
author: Lisette B.

description: Brought a friend from out of town here because she was craving seafood and wanted to play tourist. I don't eat seafood so I had the vegetarian burger. It's house made there so it was not a frozen Boca or Gardenburger which was a huge plus. It's made out of mushrooms mostly and it was pretty darn good. I don't recommend it if you don't like mushrooms though as that's pretty much all that is in it. Had good service, typical touristy chain type place. Very loud.
author: Dusty N.

description:
Food wasn't that tasty. I was expecting really yummy shrimp, but they serve skimpy, old, (probably) frozen shrimps. Food was also expensive, but what can you expect? It's the touristy area of SF.

Now my review is based on the service I got. I wouldn't say the hostesses in the front were the best, but my server and anyone else that worked as a server that had helped me during my experience all went above and beyond. 

Our server (unfortunately I don't remember his name) even took off a couple items on the menu because of slow service (they were packed!). He made us feel super comfortable and most importantly, welcomed. To me, that's what a dining experience is all about. If the food isn't great, at least the service will balance it out.

Overall I would say it's recommendable.
author: Maddie P.

description: The view from this restaurant is great.  It's at the end of Pier 39 right on the bay.  The food tasted ok, but it wasn't as hot as it should've been.  The wait service was good and it was fun to to be quizzed on the movie trivia by them.
author: Mike D.

description: Bubba Gump's is one of my favorite spots to eat at. The environment is so much fun. Even when the place is packed, service is still pretty decent and the food is delicious.
author: Julia W.

description: Yes it is a tourist location. But the overall experience: service team, food quality, location is ok.
author: Marc B.

description:
We are (or were) regular customers of this establishment, as we live in the area. However, the service was so horrendous, we will never be returning again.

Tuesday, July 14, 2015 12pm - 3pm: Our party was large, so we excused the hour long wait for seating. However, it took another half an hour for them to take our order, then another hour to even get us any food. We were starving. Two of our party ordered chicken strips and received two tiny strips and barely a palm full of fries, with jello and a paper tugboat carrier. That was not the only instance we were treated like children. All of our table were fully grown adults, yet "Gigi" (or rather, the WORST WAITRESS EVER) seemed to think us unimportant. Everyone else who arrived with us got their food before we got our drinks.

Gigi gave our drinks to children 12 and under, then when my friend tried to tell her the mistake, she stuck a finger in her face and shushed her! She walked away and had to come back before she realized she'd gotten it wrong. The kids were drinking them (it was disgusting), and she took them all and placed them in front of us without apologizing or even offering us new straws!! Then later we asked for refills, and she informed us they were a 99 cents and she'd have to ask the "grown-ups" (my parents) for their permission. I was absolutely in awe at her complete incompetence and disregard for the well treatment of her customers. My friends had to use the restroom (we were there for two hours by then!), and Gigi tried to take their food away before it even looked touched! She seemed irritated when I told her they'd be back. For hours, we endured her constant talking-down to us, and then she overflowed my fiance's drink (rootbeer!) on him and didn't offer a napkin to clean him up!

She must have been aware of her mistreatment of us because she became overly friendly in the fakest way possible when the bill arrived (go figure). Every member of our party decided it was the worst service they ever received, and I hope she gets reprimanded.

Bottom line, the food is overpriced and underwhelming (to put it nicely), they take too long to get it to you, and the staff are the rudest people I've ever had serve me food. BEWARE OF GIGI.
author: Keli L.

description:
Got here early before our tour to Alcatraz.  This place is located at the very end of Pier 39 on the second floor. Waitress was good and fast.  Only had an appetizer of shrimp made 2 ways, coconut and tempura.  Tasted ok, but they were not even warm.

One of the waiters came by our tables for some Forrest Gump Movie trivia.  Different.  What I thought was great was the fact that anyone in the area can help you with silly things like refills.  

Food is meh, just a tourist trap I'm afraid.
author: Maria S.

description: I took my mom here when she visited and it was exactly what we expected-nothing more nothing less. It's a chain. We had decent service (a tad slow) but no real complaints. It was a nice lunch.
author: Sloane R.

description: Worst burger in San francisco! This is the worst place to get dragged to if you don't or can't eat seafood. Order a burger, it will be undercooked, and taste like fish! Funny I didn't order anything with seafood in it.. However that's all I could taste. I would never reccoment this place or come back.
author: M K.

description: Surprising good.  You pay a bit for the view and touristy locale but the grilled shrimp and scampi were solid.
author: Jay V.

description:
RUN FORREST RUN!
Even though I was a local, I wanted to be a tourist for the day. 
Mmmm, Mmmm, Mmm. Yes, yes yes! It's a must! 
No box of chocolates here, but fresh fish they got!
"Christine! Party of 2, party of 2... IT'S SHRIMPn' TIME!!!" 
I LOVE how they call out your name with, ".....It's SHRIMPn' TIME!" 

Beautiful, sunny (kinda rare in the city during winter/spring) therefore it was CROWDED.
A table for 2 this evening would have been a 30 min wait, but hey! The bar area was open! Waited only 10 mins, table wasn't literally in the bar. Table was tall for my short mom to get up to, but anything to NOT wait for too long.

STOP FORREST STOP! Yes! Got waiter Jose to stop!
- Forget Me Not Blueberry drink was delicious. Yes, this would do since I wasn't allowed an alcoholic beverage.
- BUBBA'S FAR OUT DIP - An artichoke dip. On the greasy end, but it was free!! (If you check into Fisherman's Wharf or Pier 39 you get coupons for activities and restaurants).

RUN FORREST RUN!
STOP FORREST STOP!
- FISH AND CHIPS was huge in portion. Slices of fish were SO FRESH and so soft! Not even oily, it was perfect, once bite and it just slipped into your mouth with a rich fish flavor. Not sure what kind of fish it was. Fries were average. The fish was shining here over the chips. 

On to Jenny's Catch!
- SALMON & VEGGIE SKILLET was absolutely tasty! You could taste the garlic that the asparagus was sauteed in. If you're price conscious, as some have said it's pricey $20, but was rich in flavor. 

Will come back to try the rest of the menu.
author: Christine F.

description: Use cash!! My credit card info was stollen at this location  Pier 39. Food ok nothing special. Will never go back, heard multiple stories about customers getting info stollen here. Karma will take care of them. Be aware you've been warned.
author: Santiago W.

description: We ordered the Jambalaya and it was spicy and delicious. My wife ordered the fried chicken and it was great as well. Staff was pretty cool and attentive. There was a long wait. I suggest sitting in the bar. It's full service and no wait.
author: Ron P.

description:
We had a really long wait time and they took people in out of order, even though we'd listed our name in the register. Most of the stuff here is deep fried, so be ready to consume a couple of days' calories in one go! The quantities are also ridiculous for 2 people. 

On the plus side, the views are awesome if you're sitting in the right places, and there are some not-so-unhealthy options too.
author: Vivek R.

description:
Great place to go. The view from the resultant is awesome and the food is spectacular! I have been here a few times most recently yesterday. Even though it was the 4th of July and they were extremely busy we still got seated in a reasonable time. We asked to be seated at the window and they made it happen. The waiter was funny and on top of everything. Again the food was very good. it's some of the best sea food i have ever had. I will come here again and tell my friends as well. 

They do validate parking for the pier 39 parking garage don't forget to bring your ticket and mention it to them.
author: Sarmad N.

description:
This place is hands down one of the most touristy places at the pier. If you're coming to SF for food, please try one of the other restaurants because you'll have a much better experience.

Of course my sister's family came to visit and this place was one of the places they thought to eat at. I understood because it's more a kid-friendly place.

Overall, the kids enjoyed it, but I definitely wouldn't be back. I had the jambalaya and it wasn't impressive. I also tried the combo popcorn shrimp with fries and that was comparable (or maybe even worse than) store-bought frozen food.

The concept of those signs "Run Forest Run" signs are creative, but I just don't like it. Think about it, you're trying to eat, but then if you need something, you have to touch this sign that I'm sure thousands of people have touched. Gross.
author: Mimi V.

description: Incredibly slow and lazy service. When our table for 6 was finally called, we had to wait in line for another 10 minutes. Our appetizers took 25 minutes to come out and the garlic bread was absolutely loaded with butter, it was nauseating. My tilapia + lobster buttered potatoes were pretty good and saved the review from being 1 star. Everyone around me said the shrimp was as mediocre as mediocre can be. Don't eat here.
author: Tim D.

description:
I've been to the Bubba Gumps in Santa Monica and have had nothing but great experiences there. This one though was just the opposite. In fact, I have NEVER stiffed a server before until I ate here. 

Food was fine - not great . What wasn't fine is the waitress suggesting my 2 kids get their seasonal watermelon lemonade and charging $1.00 for each refill. I guess that may be expected in a touristy restaurant but the original lemonades cost $9.00 each. So, I basically paid over $20 for 2 kid drinks (prices are not on the menus so make sure you ask what everything costs). I did share my disappointment in a very nice manner. Had she taken just 1 of those drinks off I would have given her the typical 20% tip I normally give servers (even when the service isn't great but I reward great attitudes). Instead, she gave me a really pathetic whiny "I'm sorry" and charged me full price. I paid $107 for me and my 2 kids - total rip off. If I had tipped it would have been just around $120. With so many wonderful restaurants in San Francisco you can bet I will never be back to BG!
author: Jeannie S.

description:
The food was well flavored and the view was so relaxing.  As usual it rained that day so the fog was out over the water making the view just a bit more beautiful.  The free glass at the end of our meal was sweet.  We had the shrimpers Net Catch which were messy but enjoyable.  The shrimp New Orleans is yum and the Scampi was so so.  Overall: it was a flavorful dine.  

I found that the DT Long Beach Location is less flavorful.
author: Char J.

description:
It was you're standard Bubba Gump restaurant.  A bit touristy for my liking, which also lead to there being a wait, even on off peak hours.

Service was good, waitress was attentive.  I ordered the seafood feast, which offered a nice variety.  

When time came for the check, there was an error on it, so we politely asked the waitress for it to be fixed.  She had to bring the manager over who was quite rude to us.  I expected better from someone who manages a restaurant like that with such a high volume of customers.
author: Matt M.

description:
We got here when it had just opened up for lunch, so there wasn't many people. The wait staff were friendly, but I would say they were all more concerned with socializing with each other than paying attention to what was going on around them. 

I understand that this is a chain restaurant, but I wouldn't say I was, at all, impressed with the food. The clam chowder was very watery and, in my opinion, flavorless. The salad looked like it was out of a bag. The popcorn shrimp were pretty good. The main reason we went here was because it was pretty child friendly, had a waterfront view and one of the few places open before 11:30 on the pier.
author: Nicole M.

description: One and only time Ive been to Bubba Gumps was approx. 10 years ago at Pier 39. Had some spicy butter shrimp with garlic bread to soak up the shrimp juice. Was very tasty.
author: G G.

description:
This was my first time eating at Bubba Gump, and it was a fun experience! I'm a big seafood person so this was place was worth trying. I thought the food was really good. I had the shrimp po' boy sandwich, and I guess this was also my first time having a sandwich stuffed with popcorn shrimp. Soo good!

I also really enjoyed the entire atmosphere of the restaurant. You really do feel attached to the "Forrest Gump" environment, and this adds a lot of creativity to the restaurant itself. There was basically everything and anything related to the film "Forrest Gump," and boy.. have I watched this film so many times! My friends and I even got quizzed by our server about the film, and I liked that there was this fun interaction while we were waiting on the food.

Some little problems I had were the price of the food, the worth of what you paid for, and the crowded seating. Again, the food was good, but it's still a little overpriced, especially for the amount given. And this place is just packed with large parties of people. But overall, Bubba Gump was a fun and different experience as compared to your everyday restaurant because of its "Forrest Gump"-themed food and ambiance.
author: Neil B.

description: Definitely try and get a table close to the window so you're close to the water. Staff were very friendly and made sure everyone at the table was attended to. Food was good but not great. I recommend the coronarita, that was definitely a hit!
author: Thomas O.

description: The food was absolutely amazing. I had the Po Boy sandwich and it was to die for. If you want to have God's own personal chefs cook for you, then come to this Bubba Gump!
author: Lex A.

description: Big thanks to mike for coming to tell us our food would be a lil late but offered us complentry desert so happy we made a choice to come her great service n yummy food in the best city n the world happy day to us
author: Samantha S.

description: Interesting place to say the least, food wasn't bad at all, just kept forgetting to turn the license plates over since I was the designated communicator. All in all, it was a nice experience.
author: Charlene E.

description:
After experiencing Bubba Gumps for myself I can see why it is a well deserved 3 stars and here is why. 

I rate it a 3 for the food, because although it is satisfactory, it is by far nothing special. I had a shrimp po boy with fries. On the menu it had a Bubba Gump favorite icon, and it was good. The shrimp was fresh and fried perfectly; and rightfully so since it is right on the pier. Thumbs up for the fresh seafood!

The service and experience though was a 5 stars all the way! Unconventional way of ordering and getting server attention but so much fun. Our server was very personable and fun, and he went out of his way to hang out with us at the table and even "quiz" us on Forrest Gump the movie. Truly appreciated and just enhanced the experience. 

There is a great view of the pier and of the bay from the dining area, and even though I gave it a 3 stars I would still recommend coming to eat and experience; especially if you are a fan of the movie! Gift shop attached to the restaurant as well. Have fun!
author: K. G.

description:
We came here on an early Saturday evening around 5ish. There was no wait and we got seated within 5 minutes.  It took quite a while for any waiter to acknowledge our table. I even used to "Stop sign" at our table to get someone's attention. A waiter stopped, we asked for water and a waiter- he said ok and kept walking. No water, no waiter for another 10 minutes. Finally a waitress came up to us and asked if we'd been helped. We told her no and we were ready to order. She was nice. 

Food came out pretty quickly. I ordered a BBQ cheeseburger with stringy onions since I don't eat seafood. It was good, but could have used more BBQ sauce. 

Pricing is kinda high since it's in the middle of a tourist trap (Pier 39). But we were hungry and wanted food.
author: Jennifer F.

description:
Forrest Gump metaphors, fantastic view of the pier and beyond, courteous staff and a very good ambiance. 

We dine here whenever we visit the pier and it has always been a great experience. The Mac n Cheese was a surprise favorite while the Calamari was good too.

We usually start things off with the Shrimp combo. The beer's pretty good too and you get to keep the glass :D

All in all, a cool place to hangout in the 'Wharf.
author: Aneesh R.

description:
Bubba Gump Shrimp is a household name, and its service is great, the views are spectacular of Alcatraz and the bridge, but its so busy, and we were there at the peak of dinner hour after walking around SF, we were starved. We were seated in 15 minutes and service is efficient and professional. Our waiter was clever and attentive despite being busy. 

Run Forrest Run. There are lots of places to eat in Fishermans Wharf, and lots better seafood, but worse than Chinese Restaurants,  you'll be hungry after eating here.   I got the "Im Stuffed Shrimp"6 is not pictured in the menu, it was flavorful, but tiny..  6 shrimp, cooked in garlic butter stuffed as advertised with beautiful Monterey jack cheese melted over it.. In the center a "dollop" of parsley sprinkled Jasmine rice.  Now there are things that are well "dolloped' (ice cream, sour cream, butter), but Jasmine Rice in a dollop looks like "RICE?? We were just kidding!"    

Mango Sparkling Lemonade sounded awesome and the other drinks in the shiny glasses, probably didn't even need to taste good to be awesome, but the Mango Sparkling Lemonade was really not sparkling in flavor, nor with a present taste of Mango. 

By the time dessert came around, I did not want to be disappointed so we just asked for the check.  Life is like a box of chocolates.. you never know what you are gonna get..  With this place you will stand in a long line, to hope for a great view, and eat tiny food... at about $20/ per person.
author: Dawn S.

description:
Bubba Gump...   

We ordered the Shrimper's Net Catch or something like that...  it came with 1 1/3 lbs of peel and eat shrimp and was supposed to have both butter-garlic and Cajun style...   I love both Garlic and Cajun seasonings...   Both of varieties here were very muted and bland tasting: -4 stars.

However, we also ordered the popcorn shrimp, which had a surprisingly good flavor: +2 stars.

Since the seafood appetizers were a coin toss, I went with the turf: baby back ribs.  They were actually cooked just right and their BBQ sauce was decent (aka not flavored with fake smoke), it too was rather bland: + 2 stars

Seating and decor:  What can I say?  Very gimmicky decor celebrating a 20 year-old movie...  Although Forest Gump is an iconic American film, the restaurant is getting very dated!   Seating was very uncomfortable. Although there were a variety of chairs to choose from, none of them were free from discomfort: -3 stars 

Service was decent although we felt rushed to hurry up and leave due to the tremendous wait outside.    

My recommendation is if you just love the Forest Gump theme, then this is the place for you; otherwise to go to any other seafood place on Pier 39 for much better quality food.
author: Michael B.

description: Great experience!! I personally loved the food!!! Server was not very attentive, and it wasn't that busy around 11:45am, but by the time we left around 12:45pm, it was hoppin'.
author: Sue W.

description:
It's a typical Bubba Gump - touristy, loud, and a bit expensive. I'm sure there are better alternatives in San Francisco, for shrimp at least. 

I've been to Bubba Gumps all over the United States and this one is by far the one I dislike the most, mostly a combination of service and the view of the bay - boring compared to Maui or Cannery Row. Try elsewhere!
author: Kevin L.

description: For my boyfriend's birthday, we made our way to San Francisco after enduring a 7 hour commute. We were excited to visit the renown Pier 39 and were hungry to catch a bite at Bubba's. The service was horrible, there was no designated waiter at our table. We were greeted by 3 different people, who were all oblivious about the status of our order. It took over 30 minutes to be served a cup of soup, which we only received after asking multiple times. After waiting close to an hour, we were done. Even the manager's attempt to alleviate the situation by compensating our meals wasn't worth it. The experience already soured the trip. We didn't make a scene, and nor are we ever the type to just leave a restaurant but the negligence wasn't worth sticking around for. We even overheard another table complaining that they were waiting for a long period of time for their receipt as they were eager to check out. I'd recommend checking out Fog Harbor. More expensive, but hey, at least you get your food in a reasonable amount of time with great service and an awesome view.i
author: Caroline K.

description: I like their food. However on a Saturday night they charge $25 for the next available table. Just milking customers even when their restaurant is not that busy. Their wait time is an hour and half apparently. However I don't see it that busy. This is a poor policy fleecing customers. I've been to several of their locations including the one in Las Vegas and NYC. Neither of them had such pathetic policies.
author: D J.

description:
I love the Forest Gump theme and decor.  The service was great too.  Large and spacious, and the view of Alcatraz was pretty. But let's face it, I'm hungry from touring most of SF so my primary mission is not to be wow'd by my surroundings, but to be satisfied by some good grubbing!

When I went, got the Shrimper's Net Catch and basically supersized it to get more shrimp.  The shrimp tasted clean but for the price, I did not think that the portion and size of the shrimps did justice.  Further, the sauces on it (Cajun and Lemon) were just average.  In the end, I was still hungry and $24 out.  

Not worth the price.
author: Izz A.

description: We came here yesterday on our outing to San Francisco. It was a Saturday afternoon so I understand the wait being pretty long, but they just have a weird way of doing things. Our waiter, Padraig, was awesome though! He was very nice & attentive. Also, my boyfriend's food came & our waiter noticed 10 minutes later that mine didn't come out yet, so he went ahead & comped my meal! I got the Shrimpers Heaven which, I believe, is $22! I thought that was very generous of him. Would love to come back.
author: Kandes R.

description: I love the restaurant decor and the vibe! Forrest Gump is one of my favorite movies, so I thought the "run forrest run" signs, maps of his running routes, ping pong paddles, pictures, posters, and so much more were super cool. Outside, there's a souvenir shop and benches next to a bubba gump sign with Forrest's shoes that you can put your feet in for pics. We went on a Saturday night so it was somewhat of a long wait to get in.
author: Nick G.

description: If you don't plan on going to a upscale restaurant but still want a tasty sit down seafood meal. Staff is friendly & funny.
author: Noel C.

description: Sure the overall atmosphere of the restaurant is a lot of fun, with cool souvenir glasses that light up at the bottom and you get to bring home and keep for the rest of your life, and also the Forrest Gump movie trivia games, blah blah blah......But frankly, the food sucks!  Guess there's such norm that chain restaurants can easily charge $18-30 per person (before tips) with foods not even measured up to standards yet everyone just thinks it is acceptable and alright!  The Shrimp Lovers, including four different kinds of shrimp like coconut shrimp, tempura shrimp, regular fried shrimp, and popcorn shrimp maybe (or some other kind of shrimp that i just can't remember) is presented adorably but tastes just A-OK.  Snow crab legs are tiny weeny and not fresh.  The fish and chips come with skinny fish fried all dry and NOT in my favorite beer batter! boohoo *sad*  Definitely have I experienced better fried seafood somewhere else, and most likely not gonna come back.
author: Ada L.

description: We have been to other Buddha Gump and the food was way better than at this location. It was very noisy. We were not happy with our food as it was very greasy, just not what it was like the last time we went to other ones in this chain.
author: Karen B.

description:
I don't understand why they take your name when you walk in, make you wait 20-30 minutes to be seated, call your name and then make you wait in line for another 10-15 minutes for an open table. 

We were hoping to get seated by the windows but ended up in the booth right next to the line of people watching you eat your food. 

The food is just okay... you'd can tell the shrimp was frozen before being cooked... but the drinks were good.
author: Cat T.

description: Well since Forrest Gump is my favorite movie ever I love this place! Anything on the menu is a guaranteed satisfaction if you want seafood... also awesome drink menu, both for kids and alcoholic
author: Alan R.

description: Though the environment was delightful everything else was so so.  I took us 1 1/2 hour to have lunch and the food was just ok.
author: Anna S.

description:
WOW I have been to Buba Gumps many times and it is always great.

I went on the forth of July with my BF Chris, it took only 35 minutes for us to get a table and when we requested a window table we were told it would be abother 15 minute wait ( which I would have gladly done) however we were taken to a table with one of the best views after waiting maybe 3 minutes. 

The service is always excellent I have not once had a problem. We ordered the 2/3 pounds of garlic shimp for an appitizer, it was delicious. We had 2 of there rum drinks and I ordered the Dumb Luck Coconut shrimp, Chris had the Fishermans Catch. Both were amazing and we served hot and quick.

Granted this place is not cheap it was $ 75 for us but worth it!

It gets very loud and yes its a tourist filled place but it is a great place to eat and hang out.
author: Whitney R.

description: My awesome European friends who I love love this place, and we went. I felt like a tourist in my own town. It was fun. The food was chainy - sort of comforting in the ways that it reminded me of my suburban youth. The food was hecka salty and one-note. The fish was probably frozen. But, I had fun, and that's what counts. And our waitress had heart.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Average food, so-so service. But if you're just looking for a touristy place to eat at Fisherman's Wharf, the view from the large windows lining the restaurant cannot be beat. We sat right by the window and looked out over the bay and saw lots of boats passing by and had a great view of Alcatraz. 

Also a good place for kids. Quite noisy so the noise small children tend to make just blends right in. Both my little ones (ages 1 and 2) enjoyed the busy atmosphere, looking out the windows, and coloring in the kids menu. The kids meals come in little paper boats which is a fun touch.

Best part of the meal was the appetizer--we had the artichoke dip and devoured it quickly. Not sure if it was as good as I'm remembering or if I was just starving but I would still recommend it.
author: Sarah P.

description: We tried going to have dinner in Chinatown at an authentic Chinese restaurant, but there was noooo parking what so ever. So we went to the area where we knew We would definitely get parking. Pier 39. Bubba Gumps was definitely a surprise. The service was great. Our waitress was extra nice. She took the time to ask us where we were from and she gave us her favorite dishes. We had the onion rings and they were just right for me, not hard and crunchy. I ordered the New Orleans shrimp and it was pretty tasty. It was sweet and spicy. Our waitress played a little game with us and we won free refills. Lol. It was cute. The reasons I did not give it 5 stars is because the wait was too long, about 45 min and the cookie desert was hard and you could tell it had been premaid.
author: Terry M.

description: Great service.  Super fun staff.  My children are young and they made them feel included.  Great time if you are headed out to the pier.
author: Wendi E.

description: I've been going here with my father since I was a little girl and this awas always our spot. I always had rthe baby back ribs and he would always get some seafood thing. I love how the restaurant is based on the movie. Everything about it has to deal with the movie. Which is fun. The food, no matter what I get, is always good.
author: Angelica R.

description: Yes the wait time here could be a little long but it sure is worth it you can get a good view of the ocean and also the food is always good here and they have good customer service  and don't forget to validate your parking here they validate it for you if you parked in the pier 39 garage which is another great reason to eat here
author: Johnson Y.

description:
Love this place been to this one and the one at LA Gardenwalk. All is great, but are particularly like this location. Can't beat the view from SF Pier.

I've lucked out to have non-foggy days when I go to eat hear. I love the Forest Gump trivia.

Food is awesome! boyfriend and I have had :
Shrimpers Net Catch
The Shrimp Po' Boy
Shrimp New Orleans
Shrimpers Heaven
Baja Shrimp Tacos
author: Kathryn Y.

description: I had a shrimp scampi dish from this location on Monday night. It was really busy. Waited about 15mins before being called. Even after we were called up, we waited another 10mins to actually be seated. The waiter was very nice and informative. The dish was great! Not a fan of capers so had them make the dish without it. It was the best Shrimp scampi I have had so far. In the middle of eating our dinner, I asked for my bday cupcake. The waitress who was covering the first waiter took about 20mins to bring it. We were on a time crunch down to the minute for parking in the garage. Parking garage is $10/hr. We can have them validate one hour. We got there at 5pm. Spent the entire time in the restaurant and ran back to not go over 7pm or else it would of been an additional  $10 even if it was 1 min over.
author: Gina S.

description:
My friend and I came here on a super chilly friday evening and were seated right away. We ordered cajun shrimp, garlic bread, fish n chips, and shrimp new orleans. The cajun shrimp was pretty good. The fish and chips were kind of dry and a bit too oily. The fries were soggy and flavorless. The rice that came with the shrimp new olreans was all stuck together and cold. The shrimp with the sauce was good though. The garlic bread was the best part of the meal.

The service was good though and I liked that we sat next to the window. :)
author: Wanda M.

description: The location and views were amazing but the food was pretty disappointing and our table was pretty crowded / cramped, right next to a server station.  The broiled seafood sample bucket had no flavor and was tough.  The bread was even dried out.  Not cheap.  But the kids enjoyed the paper boats their food came in.
author: Alicia K.

description:
My niece's birthday dinner request was Bubba Gump.  She loves the movie and when the waiter did the trivia.... she knew almost every answer!  She's 9!  

We had a party of 8 people and seated by the window.  Service was really good!  Especially since hubby and I came later than the rest.  The kiddies got a their cute kid meals in a Jenny boat.  But neice didn't want her in a kiddie boat.  Eh, no problem. lol  We ordered so much food it was overwhelming.   All I remember was hubby ordered a seasfood salad and a cup of chowdah.  he liked it.  I ordered a bowl of bisque and a side salad.  YUMMY.  Better than expected.

I told the waiter it was neice's birthday.  So when time came they brought it to attention to the WHOLE restaurant by screaming out it was her birthday.  made her stand on a chair and then proceeded to sing her happy Birthday!  She LOVED the attention and ate it all up!   That was really great.  

So based on the service, the birthday girl being over the moon happy brought up the average eh, of their food to 4 stars!  I personally wouldn't go here unless it was a request of someone else under the age of me.  But hey, I'll play along. :)
author: Erika G.

description: I'm a big fan of Bubba Gump my fav is the bucket of shrimp half n half, the drinks are good, and they play Forrest Gump all day whats not to like.
author: Brian P.

description: I was really pleasantly surprised with this restaurant. The prices were much better than most of the other restaurants in the area and the theme was very cute. The waitress gave us a movie trivia test for fun. We had a table with a great view as the restaurant is at the end of the pier. The food was good and so were the drinks. Glad that we went!
author: Nancy C.

description: My friend and I were in the city and decided to try bubba gumps shrimp for the first time and let me tell you our expirence was aweful. It took about an hour for our food to come out and when it finally came out my friend realized they messed up our order. We told our server and she said "oops sorry if you want the right food it's going to take about half an hour for it to cook". Really half an hour! We decided to just eat the food we received but that was a mistake. The shrimp was dry and tasteless and it ruined our night. To top it off or bill was $100! It was a huge waste of money. The food here is overpriced and the service is horrible!
author: Lupe M.

description:
SOOOOOOOO MUCH HYPE!

My boyfriend and I decided to come here since we were doing some shopping in Pier 39 and BAD IDEA! First of all you put your name in and when you FINALLY get called....you just wait in another line! It was the stupidest thing ever. I don't know what idiot came up with that idea. Oh and apparently they seat bigger parties because so many parties of 5+ walked in after us and were eating by the time we waited in our second line. I was hoping that with it being this busy then they HAD to be good. I was wrong. Luckily we had the free far out dip with the pier 39 fun pack (which I highly recommend). My boyfriend ordered the bigger portion of fish and chips which were the size of large shrimp and I order New England Clam Chowder. MISTAKE! Just should have went to Boudin or something.
author: Shanel S.

description: Food was great...service was ok but I'm not impressed. I went to the one in LA and I must say that place was way better than this one here in SF. The one in LA gave us those trivial questions about Forest Gump but not this place I guess it's Cuz it's too crowded for them to do so but if that was the reason then that's super lame. Anyways the crab stuffed mushroom appetizer was great...a little bit on the salty side but it was yummy nonetheless...same goes with our side order of fries...salty but still ok I just wished they went easier on the seasoning. My pear & berry salad entrée was alright but I'll definitely won't be ordering that again next time. The accidental fish & shrimp entrée was probably the best one out of everything tonight because of the Jasmine rice. Very well-cooked & soft, the salmon and shrimp was flavorful as well...I'll be ordering that next time lol good experience but not as great as the one in LA that's for sure.
author: Rose C.

description:
I went to try this place just because it's pretty famous around. Nothing was exceptionally good, but the food wasn't bad either. We came in a little after they opened, so there was no wait. I recommend you do that; when we were finished around 1230 or so, there was a wait to be seated. I ordered the Shrimp Po Boy, and the popcorn shrimp was surprisingly done quite well! There was a nice crisp to it. I also got an order of clam chowder because I just love soup.

Overall it was a pleasant experience. The servers were all really friendly, and they periodically came around to make sure everyone had their fair share of refilled water. (Plus for me!) 

The food is pretty standard, but it's a nice place to take people if they're not normally in the area and want to try something quite famous. Don't expect it to impress connoisseurs, though.
author: Eric N.

description: This was my first time that I've eaten at a Bubba Gumps. The food was good but way over priced IMO. My daughter ordered the coconut shrimp which was about $22 which had 8 coconut shrimp, fries, and coleslaw.
author: Nacian S.

description:
It was good but way too pricey

4 stars: Clam Chowder, Shrimp Cocktail, Seafood Pasta
author: Crystal W.

description: Our waitress was great, but the wait was misleading. We had a 50 minutes wait, which ended up being 60 minutes. We were told our table was ready, we had to wait in another 25 minute line. We saw many empty tables and asked the staff what the issue was... He said the tables hadn't been bussed & they couldn't help bus them because that would be like rewarding their servers. We assumed the restaurant would be run like a team, not an us against them deal.
author: Stephanie S.

description: It's fun here. (You can tourist in your own city.) it works really well for office events. The food is pretty good. They have nice souvenir drinking glasses that are pretty durable. I still have two from 4 years ago.
author: E. R.

description:
$140 for "lunch" for 4???? (not including tip) We didn't even get the expensive dishes, just burgers and pasta dishes. Each of us had one cocktail each.

We all left scratching our heads wondering what just happened...lol. Nice view though, I'm sure thats what cost us the extra $60. Just glad we didn't bring the kids, we would have had to get a loan to be able to get out of there.

Food: OK
Service: Above Average
Cost: Ridiculous

Go Giants.
author: Jerry W.

description: I got the fish and chips, pretty sure I got a half-assed defrosted ball of batter. The fish was not fresh, the batter was not crunchy, it was a doughy mess. I was STARVING and even then I could taste the low quality. My friend got the shrimp and same thing; the fish were rubbery, bit crisp or fresh. It's no wonder they were the only place without a ridiculous long line. You're paying for the name, do not dine here. Warning!!
author: Marcela M.

description: It's okay. The food was decent. Our server wasn't great either. He was only working 3 tables (including our own) and he kept saying "I'll be back. I'll be right back" we had to ask another girl to take our order and bring us water. Then he was nowhere to be found and had to ask another girl for our check. Our server wasn't friendly but he wasn't rude either. He was just bland. Overall it wasn't worth the money or the experience. He didn't even ask us Forrest Gump questions. WOMP!
author: Bee F.

description: It's touristy, but you already know that. The menu isn't that varied, but you already know that, too. The waitstaff tries to make it a fun experience. The view is incredible. That's what really makes it worthwhile.
author: Michael W.

description:
My family and I went to Bubba Gump Shrimp Co in Hawaii so we were excited when we found out there was another one in Pier 39.

We were seated pretty quickly and received our food and drinks in timely manner. But no one came by to give us refills and the food was rather salty. I don't mind salt here and there but sometimes, it can be too much. 

Overall, the atmosphere is good and you can see yourself in and out by half an hour. But don't expect excellent service. It is just okay.
author: Lyla K.

description:
When I was younger, this place was great! It was appealing to everyone, especially if you saw the movie Forest Gump, always full of energy and wonderful people, even if half of them were tourists.

Now...well, too pricey. Service is meh. Food is okay but nothing to make me come back again unless I have visitors over and they REALLY want to come.

They have a great view of the bay though! But go somewhere else instead where you can find real authentic seafood around the piers...
author: Nika K.

description:
Long wait, over-priced and poor service.  We got our food before our appetizer came and the waiter couldn't seem to get our bill right.  Would not go back.

RUN FORREST RUN!
author: Nancy A.

description: One of my favorite Restaurants, a little difficult to find, its all the way at the end of the pier, but has great views and the food is fantastic.  Love the fries and the garlic bread.
author: Mark O.

description:
I was totally disappointed by not only our food but our service. We got to Bubba Gump's kind of early (11:30am) to avoid the crowd. We were seated quite quickly considering we had a party of 6. We asked for a table on the side of the restaurant that allowed us to see the water & it would have been perfect had it not been by far the worst spot in the restaurant. We sat three by three and unfortunately one of us (me) had to literally sit against a huge column. I couldn't move to the left or right to avoid it.
Our waiter came to check on us fairly quickly and took our drink order. It took awhile for him to come back with our drinks and to see if we were ready to order. The first time, we were not ready. We asked if he could come back in a few minutes. About 10-15 minutes went by before he came back. We ordered our food but it was a process. There was a clear language barrier between us and our waiter as he didn't understand what we were saying. For example, my son likes to eat his hamburger dry (no ketchup/mustard) with just pickles. When we asked for a hamburger, dry, cooked well, with pickles only; he asked us more than once if we just wanted a bun with pickles. He kept saying "you no want any meat?" It took several tries for us to get our point across but we finally did (well, until my son's order arrived and it was just a hamburger with a bun). We had to ask another server to please bring us a side of pickles. 
My husband and I always order the same thing; shrimp po'boy sandwich and fish and chips. My husband's sandwich looked great. My fish and chips looked great but did not taste that way. There was very little fish in my fish and chips. It was mainly overcooked batter. And, there were very few chips (and some of them were so burnt that I couldn't even eat them). I was really disappointed. I had also asked for a side of lemon and all of the slices were full of seeds. I kept having to pick the seeds out of my food. 
Thankfully my parents enjoyed their food. My Mom said the clam chowder was really good and my Dad liked his shrimp trio. 
I was very surprised that the kids meal did not come with a drink. My son had ordered milk and the second time he went to pick it up, he grabbed it by the lid and since it was a soda lid, it came right off and he spilled half of it on the floor. Our waiter was great with helping me wipe it up. We asked for a second milk (only filled half way) and I was very surprised to see that they charged us for the second milk. 
Our lunch was expensive, the staff were rushed and rude. We put out our, stop forrest stop sign, waited several minutes as 6 to 7 people walked by and didn't stop to have a young lady rudely ask us "do you need something?" Um, yes. That is why we put up the, stop forrest stop sign. 
This was by far the worst experience we have had at this location. I am disappointed to say that we will most likely not eat here again. That makes me kind of sad because it has been a tradition for the last few years to eat here every time we visited Pier 39.
author: Casey A.

description:
Bubba Gump's is basically a Forrest Gump-themed, overpriced version of Red Lobster.

I knew being a chain restaurant located at Pier 39 it would be touristy and while the service was fine and the view was nice, it was basically what I expected.

Unfortunately, for a chain that makes a big deal out of its shrimp plates, the food itself was not any better than you would get at ShrimpFest or whatever Red Lobster calls it this month. However, the pricing was probably twice as much.

Then again, its either Bubba Gump's at Pier 39 or you'll end up staring at another Eric Clapton autographed guitar at the Hard Rock Cafe.

On a positive note, they did have an actor playing Forrest Gump sitting on the bench in front of the restaurant. With the haircut and the accent, he definitely could have passed for Tom Hank's brother.
author: Brad H.

description:
I luurv the movie Forrest Gump, but Bubba Gumps.. meh. Their portions and prices just don't float my boat. $14 for a Texas Cajun Chicken burger w/ fries? Soo not worth the price..I mean it was good but not good for $14. I felt like the bread wasn't supporting the burnt grilled chicken, lettuce, tomato and the so-called guacamole. The fries are aight, with the small cup of ranch dressing o___O

On the other hand, I enjoyed the view of the bay bridge from our table and the decor of the restaurant is pretty decked out with Forrest Gump stuff. And I liked the "Run Forest Run" & "Stop Forest Stop" signs they have to flag down the waiter/waitress. I don't know if I'll come here again..
author: Vicky L.

description:
Our first server was un-knowledgable of the food. She was rude and after a LONG wait she was pushy to get our order. When asked what BBQ sauce was on the ribs she couldn't answer. Just "BBQ sauce". She didn't know if it was sweet or spicy or anything. She acted put out that I would dare ask what their BBQ sauce was like. Later when asked what sauces came with our shrimp not a single person could answer. Not a manager or even the cooks! Who doesn't know what sauces/dips they are serving?! 
It took over 45 minutes to even get our drinks! They were unable to even bring our small child her chocolate milk. When the drinks finally arrived the cups were covered in spilled drinks and we could tell they had been sitting around a while. The foam from the blended drinks was gone. The milk was super cold.
We said no appetizers but she later asked if we wanted garlic bread. Thinking it was part of the meal after such a long wait we accepted. On the bill we were charged almost $6 for two pieces of bread with garlic butter.
When our server went on "mandatory break" we got a very nice and knowledgeable server Stephen. We enjoyed him and made the extra star on our review.
We planned on leaving him a big tip even after the  initial experience but he said it goes to the first server. No thanks. She was awful.
When we were leaving we found that my wheel chair was covered in spilled sweet drink the server for another table spilled. They didn't even clean it up off my chair?!
$150.00 later we will never be back. What a disappointment. The movie was great and the decor in the restaurant was awesome but as MANY others have reviewed the restaurant experience was awful.
author: Erica R.

description: The view is spectacular.  You have a clear view of Alcatraz, the bridge, the bay, and Angel Island.  We did send back our hush puppies.  They had fish in them and boy did you know it, nasty fishy taste.  Other than that, it was alright.
author: Tina E.

description:
Not sure why reviews are so low for this place. Everything was good: food great, ambiance pretty cool, view awesome, staff friendly and personable, drink very good (but expensive!). The only turn-off about this place was the wait time. We arrived at a busy time, and waited for about 30min to be called and seated. This was alot to kill the mood at the beginning. But the rest of the experience made up for it.

Would go there again
author: Siamak K.

description: I have been called (some other yelper - a wait staff there?) a rude customer by another Yelper and next time to please make room for a better tipper for pointing out the surcharge. Well Kan***e K. can have my wait ticket, party of 6. The 2 stars review is not for the surcharge - sure it's my mistake surcharge is citywide. Still very long wait, decent not great food quality and only ok service. I expected the go Forest go charm but I experienced none of that.
author: Ray R.

description:
I know this restaurant is expensive and a tourist trap, but it's a great place the family and I enjoy. We especially like the view of Alcatraz, the boats, bridges and the bay.      

For the kids we ordered pizza and a burger. We chose smashed potatoes and vegetables for sides, nice option instead of your typical fries. My wife ordered the Lobster Butter Sauce with fish of the day. The fish was laid over mashed potatoes and sautéed spinach, nice presentation. 

I ordered my usual, the Baja Grilled Shrimp Tacos. I went with the grilled shrimp instead of the fried, watching my figure. The three tacos come with two salsas, sour creme, limes and tortia chips. This dish goes great with a Sam Adams, so much for watching my figure.   

Staff is energetic and friendly. Our waitress changed it up a bit by asking the kids Sponge Bob trivia and asking my wife and I the Forrest Gump trivia. Kids went 3 for 3, wife and I went 5 for 5 on trivia questions. Woo hoo!
author: Alberto E.

description: The atmosphere at this place is pretty cool. Very laid back and chill. I like how on your birthday they make you stand up on your seat and they sing to you! Super fun & embarrassing! And I'm not gonna lie, I like the cups they have where the bottoms light up! I've been to this location more than once and to the Times Square location and both were consistantly good.
author: Courtney K.

description: Worst service or no service, I'm not sure. Came here with my family . They set us down and threw 10 menus with several napkins and utensils on top . So after about 7 minutes the waitress came by , I asked her are we suppose to set or own table. Her reply was yes. I politely told her that I'm not use to those type of establishments, and we all got up and left. I've been to bubba Gumps in New York, Santa Monica, and universal studios. Never was I basically told that I had to set my own table and serve myself. I would never recommend this place and never bring your out of town guest to this place.
author: Felicia M.

description:
What a disappointment! Came with my family to celebrate a couple birthdays, i guess they cant handle big parties. Waited 2 hrs more than they said we would, our food came out 45 min later and it was cold!  The worst part that after dinner we had dinner we wanted desert & the kitchen was closed... They didn't even give us a warning for the last call, so much for celebrating our birthday.

Overall we were not taken care of like we should have been. We are on vacation we are definitely not coming back!
author: Gee M.

description: Went here to eat eat for my little cousins birthday dinner. Came in around 7 o'clock and we didn't have to wait too long maybe 10 min. My girlfriend and I ordered the baby back ribs with shrimp. These were really good, just wish they gave us a bigger portion for the meal. Also got a side of clam chowder, which was okay. Think I would've got better at the fishermans wharf though. But over all pretty decent had a good waiter.
author: Mike P.

description: Fun atmosphere! Great food! Great service!  The "Jenny's Catch" is delicious !  And everyone is super nice and fast. And everything is Forrest Gump themed!
author: Zoe B.

description: Food ..... not so hot but very expensive. Bathrooms were disgusting,  dont bother. What a shame , such a cute concept. Our waitress was nice but most staff were just walking into us or ignoring us. Boo.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Extremely busy with a wait but it is always worth it for us since we are a big fan of the movie.  This time we got a table with a view.  The service is always pretty slow because they are packed and the server can only do so much so don't go there when you are in a hurry.  Relax and enjoy your company.  The food was great but not fantastic.  I try something different each time I go and sometime it is a home run and sometimes just a hit.  You really want to go here as a tribute to the movie and in memory of Bubba (lol).  I would go again and again.  We have gone to the one on the Santa Monica Pier as well and that was also great.
author: Sabrina M.

description: Three stars for the view. Thinking that were close to the bay and ocean that the seafood would be well prepared and served. It wasn't though. Wait staff is friendly and it's good for a one visit. But if you want a better tasting meal go elsewhere.
author: Elmo S.

description: We got there before it got super crowded..Love the view of Alcatraz...atmosphere was great. The detail of the restaurant is outstanding, i love how the waiters play a trivia game with u while u wait for your food. Garlic bread is ok nothing special, try the gumbo tho its on point. We ordered the big net market bucket ...it was alright nothin like joes crab shack tho...a bit pricey for that amount. Four stars cuz the view saved it from three.
author: Jane M.

description: This is a loud touristy theme-restaurant in the same vein as The Hard Rock or Joe's Crab Shack, only this time it's based off the movie Forrest Gump. It's noisy, crazy, and loads of fun (all things the movie is not)(but I'd suggest giving the movie a viewing before dining here). But who cares about how the place looks, how's the food??? Well, it's a wee bit pricy, and for the price you get rather small portions, but the quality is in its own league. I am a shrimp lover, so this place is my wet dreams realised. The shrimp is usually very good, and the sauces for them are all made fresh in house (which shows in their thumping rich and spicy flavour). For seafood lovers, particularly shrimp fanatics, this is THE place for you.
author: David S.

description:
Pricey (about $20 per entree), crowded (always a wait before you are seated) and smack-dab in the middle of a tourist trap. Having said that, everything in Pier 39 fits that description. This is why no locals come here.
However, if you are doing the tourist thing, this is a nice restaurant to experience. Wonderful views, excellent service, lively and responsive wait-staff, fun themed decor and excellent shrimp dishes. The portions are medium-plus on generosity. Everything tastes freshly made. Our waiter was in training yet he did an excellent job. Kudos to his trainer who was on him like white on rice. My picky 6-yr old loved the fish sticks off of the kids menu and served on a paper shrimp boat. Fun!! 
I had the shrimp stuffed with crab meat. Hubby had the 3 kinds of shrimp and fries dish with 3 different dipping sauces. Our guest had the fish and shrimp combo. All yummy!! 
We are all big talkers in our family but a silence descended on our table once we started eating. That is a good sign, right? Absolutely.
author: Melanie M.

description: Just ok meal. Did not live up to the bubba gump model. Family of 4 $100+ for a fried fish meal? Service was just ok had to ask several times for items. Big table next to ours with loud people server definitely chasing the big tip.  Appetizer had 4 calamari rings for $10. Just poor service.  I won't visit Bubba Gump again.
author: J C.

description:
The mister & I were being a couple of tourists for a day then our stomachs started to growl. I knew I wanted clam chowder so being in Fisherman's Wharf, there were plenty of spots to eat chowder. We were already in Pier 39 so we decided to pick Bubba Gump's since we both have never eaten here before. The wait for a table wasn't so bad. Very crowded of course, since it was a Saturday. Beautiful views of the bay although we didn't get seated by the window but I'm not picky about where I sit. Ordered the Run Forrest Run smoothie which was very yummy. Had to order a cup of Clam Chowder but in my opinion, it could've been a little bit more thicker in consistency. It isn't the best but it was ok. Also had the Calamari with bell peppers & pepperoncini (both I dislike very much). Didn't know it was going to be breaded & deep fried along with the calamari so I had to pick my way through it. (I'm a pro picker btw) My other half ordered the Dixie Fishwich in which he said was very good & I had the Shrimp Stack Pasta. The portions were large so that's a plus. My entree was tasty and I like that they put enough numbers of shrimp in my dish. 

Playing the Forrest Gump triva quiz was fun to play. Oh, I almost forgot, while waiting for our table, there was a kid who asked his Mom who Forrest Gump was. My fiance & I looked at each other like, WHAT?!!!! REALLY?! We both made a promise to each other that day that we'll make sure our kids will watch all the old movies. School these kids with classic movies people!!!! By the way, service here was awesome!
author: Candice J.

description: Fourth time coming here because I love the fresh seafood that much!.  Dessert was okay though. Had the appetizer shrimp cajun bucket. Spicy and cooked to perfection. Also, had the big seafood main bucket which contained lobster, crab, clams and mussels. First time I have had this much of a variety of seafood and quite frankly, it was a lot of fun and delicious! Coronarita's are off the hook too! I definitely will come back again!
author: Alisha Y.

description: One of my friends birthdays was happening and his family and mine went to go celebrate it, but he didn't get a birthday song because the waiters were too busy. So the super kind manager offered to give him some free things from the gift shop as an extremely nice compromise. His birthday was made and this is officially the best restaurant I've ever been too. Sadly there isn't anything higher than 5 stars :).
author: Charlie R.

description:
Came here with my cousin last week, for a very late lunch and it was packed because of the holiday weekend. We were sat right away at the bar tables, which was perfect because we had a great view of the TVs and the 49ers game was on, and we won!

We ordered the following:
Clam Chowder in a bowl
Caesar salad
French fries
Shrimp Lovers (coconut shrimp, tempura shrimp, cajun shrimp cocktail)
Adult IBC root beer float w/ Chocolate ice cream
Georgia style alcoholic sweet tea

Food was mediocre, but the ambience was great. Clam chowder was OK, only half as good as Boudin's. Caesar salad was perfect! Crispy clean, green romaine with parm and a tangy sauce. Cajun shrimp was very cold, and somewhat translucent (not cooked all the way). Tempura shrimp had a very thick coating like fried chicken, but without the yummy fried chicken flavor. Coconut shrimp was hard, not mouth friendly. The sauces that accompanied the shrimp combo were less than stellar. Stick to the cocktail sauce.

Our server was Mitch, and he was friendly, quick, polite, and enthusiastic about Forrest Gump the movie, and had a great sense of humor.

Surprise! Georgia tea came with a a free souvenir masonjar/wineglass -- pretty cool, heavy glass, made in China, looks kind of hillbilly and mountainman chic. I think it would look great as a vase for flowers!

As a sports fan, I would recommend that they upgrade the TVs to HD.

Would still come here again, but would definitely order something different.

Free parking validation for 1 hour, if you park at the Pier 39 lot.
author: Nancy F.

description:
The Gorilla says:
"You don't have to like
The movie to like this place.
I am full of shrimps."
author: The G.

description: Food was good, service was excellent ... be sure to triple check your bill - if they over charge you by adding meals you did not eat, getting money back is impossible.  I've had over 12 contacts in the last 12 weeks and am still waiting for my money back.  They will promise the moon - don't be fooled.  Also watch out for the "surcharge 10%" they charge ..  other places on the wharf don't ... shop around and be money wise!
author: Gail C.

description:
Bleh!

Let me get this straight... we're in the famous pier 39 where the famous Fisherman Wharf is at. Of all the edible seafood restaurants we could have chosen, this is it??

Let me proclaim my innocence by saying I didn't chose this place and I wouldn't have either. Alas, somebody chose this because it's Forrest Gump and its movie props. The deception of a full crowd was also a major factor in why this place was picked for lunch.

Bleh!

I was smart enough not to order the burger or salad that appeared on their menu. The cheesy "run Forest run" sign was dumb because even we flip it to "stop", none of the wait staff was there anyways. It will take awhile in that tourist trap.

I ordered the coconut shrimps and that was serviceable. The other items our colleagues ordered was pure junk. Too bad, I hope they didn't need to go to the restroom. Oopps, I spoke too soon. There they go heading towards the restroom.

The view is great looking out the ocean. The place decorated it very well to reflect a seafood joint by the dock with memorabilia adorn the walls in the place. The ambiance is nice, but was noisy and chaotic at times.

Like Cher, If I can can turn back time.... I would... and chose a new place for lunch.
author: Mike L.

description: Food was great, just in case no one else knew about this here's a few tips.. Refills are 99 cents & its $3 for a side of rice lol, nice view of seals swimming while we ate :)
author: Tiffany G.

description:
I have always loved this bubba gumps. their clam chowder is amazing! Also have had their fish and chips which is delicious. I love the atmosphere. They always have friendly staff and make you feel as though you are a friend rather than just a customer. You can see Alcatraz from the windows which makes for a beautiful view. 

Only downside I found the last time I visited was that some of their tap beer seemed a little flat. It happens but it was disappointing to be served a flat beer.
author: Aimee T.

description: Very good food, festive, lively and fun atmosphere. The fried foods are not too heavy or greasy. But the prices are about 25% too high. That's really my only complaint. You pay a lot for the cuteness of the Forest Gump theme.
author: Darryl H.

description:
My bf and I were hanging out at Pier 39 today and we decided to go to Bubbas for lunch. We had a nice seat by the window with a gorgeous view and our server was friendly and attentive.
Unfortunately the food was just ok but not worth the $18! I had the fried chicken with mash potatoes and corn. I had the same dish at the Monterey location a few years ago but the portion size/taste seemed to be lower this time around.
This restaurant is also super touristy- they do the Forrest Gump trivia, etc. which can be fun and appealing to some but for locals probably not. If you are a die hard fan of this movie I think this is still a fun place to come to but I wouldn't return to eat probably.
author: Miss H K.

description: First I want to say Georgette our server was the best ever! Friendly, happy and with a mind that shines like diamonds. Everything was right on! BUBBA GUMP, YOU NEED TO CLONE GEORGETTE!!
author: Tarcisio G.

description:
I love the movie Forrest Gump, so this was definitely a must go.
Sat by the windows at the far end. Lucky for us there was minimal fog at 4:00 pm and an awesome view of the golden gate. The windows are very very clear considering that it is right by the water. 
The food was ok, a bit on the oily side and just too much french fries.
But then I didn't order the shrimps which was kind of a mistake.
Had fish and chips after a couple of years but wasn't impressed

The service was awesome though. the 'run Forrest run' and 'stop Forrest stop' signs were fun.
The trivia questions were also nice.
But the best part of the visit were the drinks.
Corona Rita -- seriously good
as was the Mango Mojito

 I will go back, but mostly to try their cocktails, which did have more than a decent bit of alcohol
author: Sandip C.

description:
This is why I don't let my parents choose non-Asian places for us to eat. They are fantastic when looking for Vietnamese or Chinese food, but when it comes to anything else, they are terrible. I came back to the bay area to visit and parents know that I love SF, so they decide to have a family lunch in the city. Sweet thought, but bad execution. My parents heard of this place while walking the pier and connected it with the movie, so it was automatically awesome. I thought place is tacky and the food ridiculously overpriced. 

Shrimp Po Boy - The bread was tough and tasted almost stale. The shrimp had a really think bread coating and was dry. The fries that it came with were boring and tasted like McDonald's fries.

Seafood Feast - Basically everything (the fish&chips, the shrimp and the hushpuppies) were oily on the outside and dried out on the inside.

Crab - Small pieces of crab with a mediocre sauce

Coconut Shrimp - Again, the shrimp was dried out. The coconut coating had a odd bitter aftertaste. Almost brunt maybe? And you only got like 5 shrimp. For almost $20? Rip off.

Calm Chowder - Decent chowder that isn't super expensive. Its basically the only thing here that I might get again, but being at the pier in SF, you can get way better chowder elsewhere.

To be fair to our server, he was really nice and attentive. They also played a trivia game about Forrest Gump. Its cute, but don't expect to win anything cause you aren't going to win anything.
author: Billy T.

description: It's hard to believe that I have not tried this place yet after living in SF for so long.  My first experience was just okay. I would only come back for the view. The catch entree that comes with shrimp, sausage, potatoes, and corn was okay. It was filling but the shrimp was cheap(frozen small shrimp).  The Cajun sauce was okay.  I only wished they provided more sausage and less shrimp. The only good item in the pot.. Need less to say, service was good but waitress asked us "how's everything?" When we only had water/just ordered a few mins ago. I guess the water was okay. Didn't taste like tap. Anyways, food wise.... I will pass. View wise, I might come back for drinks and appetizers, definitely not for dinner.
author: Ann L.

description:
Two words: Tourist trap.

I don't see what the hype is all about regarding this place. Sure, it's associated with one of Tom Hanks' greatest films, but the food here is mediocre.

Staff are hospitable, extremely upbeat, and the view of the San Francisco Bay area (including Alcatraz) is gorgeous, but I came for the food and it failed to meet my standards.

My group and I ordered an assortment of shrimp - each of which were cooked/fried in a different manner. If it wasn't for the sauces, all I'd taste in my mouth would be grease soaked batter. Having been charged a premium on these, I expected more.

The drinks, however, were thirst quenching. Just be sure to read the fine print because the ones we ordered came with an LED strobe-light base. No doubt that the price of the plastic cup was fixed into the cost of the drink.
author: Michael P.

description:
Love this place!  Kevin was my bartender and as always gives some of the best service in town.  The food is good, the service is great.  Remember this place is on Pier 39, so you just might have to wait.

I'm a local, but I enjoy lots of places in the tourist areas.  Not as pricey as you might think.  So be adventurous and wander out to the Pier and try some of Kevins drinks.
author: Kenneth G.

description:
Let's not get it twisted: 2 stars is for the drinks. 

We waited for 1 hour for a party of 10, called my name and then made us wait additional time for our table. They don't have the pager things, so it's just girls over the mic. We got our drinks, ordered, wanted re-fills and the girl had to remind us every time she picked up a cup that it was $0.99 re-fill. Then our drinks were MIA until almost when our check came. 

THE FOOD: we were not full after the meal. Disappointing. 

Summary: This is a tourist trap. Go with a small group. If you go with a large group, it's not worth the 1 hour free parking validation because that 1 hour will be spent waiting at Bubba Gumps just to get seated.
author: Cal Y.

description: Came to Fisherman's Wharf to find a good place to have a beer, an appetizer and hang out. We are not the touristy or chain restaurant type, so we were reluctant to come here. But we loved it! Our bartender Kelsey was so fun. Glad we chose this place.
author: Laura B.

description: Restaurant and vibe was great, very fun atmosphere. Service was exceptional. Loved the interior of the restaurant. Food was ok, nothing to rave about. We got a bucket of Cajun shrimp.
author: Hoboken R.

description: as all ways staff uber friendly.. all ways fun to bring the kids.. had great tabel over looking the bay.. great food love the hush puppy's yummm .... lifes like a box of chocolates
author: Kid R.

description: The atmosphere is awesome and I like that it's Forrest Gump themed. The wait is long so we decided to sit in the bar area after my sis tried to get our name down but sadly was ignored. Rude. The food is good but I don't think it is worth the price, it's like 22$ for coconut shrimp and some basic ass fries. Drinks are expensive too. I would go back as long as I'm being treated out to eat.
author: Kelly M.

description:
Both my husband and I hate chain restaurants, especially when traveling and pretty much came here because we just didn't feel like researching where to eat lunch for once. I've been to a Bubba Gumps in New Orleans and remember it as being just ok and my husband had never been to any of them and wanted to try for a laugh. 
Well allow me to turn in my food snob badge for a little while because this one was good!
The service was attentive and cheesy, especially with their little Forest Gump quiz that wins you nothing but a laugh. We played along. We also had a great table by the window on the bay. 
The food was shockingly good. My husband ordered the shrimp and crab bisque....and it was amazingly lovely. Seriously good stuff chock full of chunks of crab and shrimp! I got the shrimp tacos. Not amazing but they were very good. Surprisingly perfectly cooked shrimp (and they were small ones too). Good seasoning, lots of food, decent prices. We didn't want to spend $5 for garlic bread though we had to laugh at them charging us 50¢ for a side of plain bread.
We'll still prefer little local joints over chains, but this was definitely a good meal.
author: Laura P.

description: This place is always hopping so be prepared for a wait and for the inside to be loud. I was happy when I asked for gluten free menu they had one. They were great with my food allergies and the food was delicious!
author: Janel B.

description: Reservations not allowed but tables were held for a 25+tour group resulting in over an hour wait for our table of 6.  It was a cool, windy evening in San Francisco and the wait was outside.  After all that we were taken inside only to be held in a second queue line for another 10 minutes!  The food was mediocre at best.  The only redeeming quality was the waitress who was friendly and responsive to our needs.
author: James M.

description: Errrr, it's just an expensive fast food place. Everything is fricking fried and breaded, how genius is that? There's a rush during peak hours too. This is like a seafood mcdonalds i would say. Never mind with the food servers have character and the place has a nice view. Other than that i wouldn't come back here for the food.
author: Xyzagal A.

description:
I haven't been to Bubba Gump Shrimp Co in about 4 years. Yesterday, my bf and I finished out trip to Alcatraz Island and wanted to eat well. It was 2 PM on a Sunday so we were hoping that there wasn't too long a wait. We were warmly greeted and they took our names, infoming us that the wait would be anywhere between 5-15 minutes long. We used the restrooms and walked around for a bit and were called to our tables in about 5 minutes (pretty fast). We requested prior to seating that we get a window seat of the bay and they gladly sat us at a small table near the window.

Our waitress was super hyper and excited to give us the day's picks and her suggestions. We ordered the cajun shrimp appetizer which was pretty decent but I wished they gave us more garlic bread. SO GOOD. 

The menu had so many options and I honestly could have picked anything from their menu. Everything looked enticing! I finally decided on the Lt. Dan's Drunken Shrimp which consisted of "Large chargrilled Shrimp and Andouille Sausage with Mashed Potatoes and Bourbon Sauce! 18.29". My bf ordered the "Shrimp Chimichurri Skewers" which included "Tender Shrimp with fresh Red Bell Peppers, Red Onion, Yellow Squash and Zucchini, chargrilled, served over Jasmine Rice with a Chimichurri sauce of fresh herbs, olive oil, black pepper, and
crushed red chilies. 18.29". Both picks were great choices and I liked that their portions weren't too big and out of control.

My shrimp and sausage was absolutely perfect. The mashed potatoes were delicious and complimented the entire dish well. I liked that touch of bourbon sauce as well. My bf also enjoyed his skewers and I even got sample a bit of his! Well done. 

Overall, speedy service, good food. Price was a bit much but the location is catered to tourists. I would bring my family here if they visited SF.
author: Darina H.

description: I think if you like Forrest Gump, you have to check out Bubba Gump's at least once. They have so many fun touches - the place is decorated floor to ceiling with memorabilia and quotes from the movie. The tables have signs that say "Run, Forrest, Run!" and "Stop, Forrest, Stop!" for when you want to get your server's attention, which I think is a clever idea. And the view of Alcatraz is fantastic. Especially if you're a tourist, I see no reason to pass this place up. We just stopped for a quick lunch, and I had the stuffed mushrooms, which were actually surprisingly delicious, and my friend liked her burger and fries (I tried the fries to confirm they were tasty). I would've liked to stay here longer, but we had a reserved spot on the Alcatraz Cruise!
author: Bethany S.

description:
