Bubba's is always a creative treat when hitting up tourist areas near the ocean.  This particular location on Pier 39 is no different.  Have an early dinner or a late one to avoid the rush.  No reservations ahead of time so run in and grab that beeper thing as soon as you can.

Great views of the ocean if you get the window seats.  Only thing worth all the wait is the Shrimper's Net Catch (try the 1 1/2 pound if you a real shrimp lover)  I LOVE the cajun spice mix!  SUPER YUMSSSS

Everything else is your typical chain seafood restaurant fare.  

Cute and fun environment and concept.  If you've never been to a Bubba Gump's you should definitely check it out at least once.
author: Esther S.

description:
I know businesses have good days and bad days, but we might've visited them on an extremely busy day.

Pros: 
1) Wait time: when we first arrived to the restaurant, the hostess said it would take about 45 minutes to seat us. I really liked how they take your cell phone number and will text you when the table is ready. We were able to continue to walk around the pier and do some shopping while we waited. I was excited to see that after only 20 minutes I received a text message saying that a table is ready. We got a table shortly thereafter. 

2) Waitstaff: although they were extremely busy, the waitstaff was consistently courteous and very helpful. When we put up the sign that said "Stop Forest Stop", servers would stop to see if there was something they could do for us, even if it was not their table.

Cons:
After we ordered our food, it took 45 minutes for the meals to be delivered. Fortunately, we ordered an appetizer during that time, otherwise, we might have been extremely cranky by the time our food got there. Unfortunately, when we received our meals, one of the dishes was incorrect. The wait staff was extremely helpful and courteous when it came to fixing the meal, but it took another 45 minutes for the one dish to come out of the kitchen. In the meantime that person just had stuff off of everybody else's plate. When we finally received the correct meal for that person, we ask for it to be put into a to-go box so that we could head out to our next event. By the time we had received our check, it had been two hours from when we first walked into the door to be seated. I have to complement the staff and management because when we received our check they had charged us for the incorrect meal and for the corrected meal. I mentioned it to the server and the manager took the incorrect meal off of our ticket and then comped us our corrected meal, as well. 

Conclusion:
I've been to this franchise all over the US and Hawaii, but this experience will not necessarily sway me from avoiding it. I plan on going back to this restaurant in the future. Like I said, I hope it was just a bad day. If you have not yet been to this restaurant, the food taste good, the atmosphere is exciting, and I've never had a problem with the waitstaff at any of the restaurants. Also, they help you brush up on your Forest Gump movie trivia.
author: Bud A.

description:
We were hanging out by the pier doing some shopping and sealion-seeing when we all decided we were really hungry and needed to eat. Someone suggested Bubba Gump because it was right next to us and I vetoed no. However, after some research that lend no result, my veto was vetoed and we ended up there.

We got waterfront corner window seas, surrounded by the bay and a direct view to Alcatraz: plus one star.
We started with a guy server who was really funny and a female server who was super sweet and some fun trivia: plus one star
My drink was peach sweet-tea vodka and oh so good: plus one star
My main was shellfish bucket. After I received it, my boyfriend said I disappeared into the abyss for about an hour until I was done: plus one star.
All other food I tried off of other ppl's plates were great too: plus one star.

A solid five star.

I wonder if I try a bubba gump in another city, it would be just as good?
Perhaps the seafood may  not be as fresh but I loved my shellfish bucket!!
author: Lynn C.

description: Always a great experience.  Love the atmosphere, and being at the end of the pier doesn't hurt the view.  Love the city, and dig this place.
author: Nick W.

description: Love thier food it's awesome even the drinks on point and with nice view of the bay. Customer service is so great love it
author: L B.

description: Ate here today with some family of mine. I had the  tilapia with a lobster sauce and the calamari. It was delicious as expected.
author: Tay A.

description: I found my meal to be ordinary...bucket of trash, snow crab a wee bit salty the fried fish and shrimp coating wasn't to my taste couldn't identify the seasonning that was throwing me off.  It was nothing special.  The quantity - amount of food was sufficient.  My daughter went and brought back my food to go.  I would go back and try something different possibly..
author: Kathy W.

description: I wish I could give zero stars! Worst dining experience I may have ever had. We ordered a Po' Boy Sandwich and fish tacos. We sat and waited and hour.  Everyone around us came and went. We still waited. Our waiter stopped by a couple times. He said our food was put on rush, yet we still waited 30 minutes without seeing food. We asked the waiter if we were going to get a discount since we had waited so long. He went to ask the manager, but after 10 minutes of nothing and our waiter still being MIA, we took off. We went to the Chowder Hut at the end of the wharf and had speedy and excellent food. Bubba Gump's you have put a horrible taste in our mouths! I will tell everyone I know to avoid this place like the plague. There are too many good restaurants on the wharf, to waste your time at this place!!!!
author: Allison D.

description:
I ordered their specialty drinks that came with a souvenir cup, 
gumbo (large bowl, tasty)
bourbon street, mahi mahi (it was flavoured well)
the run across america sampler (large variety, definitely a lot shrimp) 

Our servicer was amazing with a massive a moment of energy. We had a great view of the water.
author: Cynthia V.

description: First time at Bubba Gump Shrimp Company and loved it. Some of the best shrimp I've ever had! Location is great if you sit by the window you can see the bay and the view is amazing. Food is reasonably priced but the drinks are a little more on the pricier side. Service was a kind of slow but nothing terrible. I recommend this restaurant if you are in the area.
author: Rachel J.

description:
The wait took foreverrr, so we walked around the pier, watched the show, shopped around, then came back to see if it was finally time. When we got there, there was a couple that was yelling at the hostess because they had been waiting a long time, but the hostess had a "I dont want to deal with this shit" kind of face. Or a "its not my fault so stop  yelling at me" face. 

FYI, we only came here because we recently watched Forest Gump again, and I just had to try it out!

When we finally sat down, we made the mistake of ordering only fried food...It was yummy though!

I was forced to tip an undeserved 25% because the waiter did not break my bill -___-"

 minus a star for the forced tip, minus another for the long wait.
author: Annabelle T.

description:
I loved the movie Forrest Gump...

I know the food isnt the best here but I'm sure you are going for the atmosphere or the experience.  I mean come on, were you really expecting like GRADE AAA food? This is just a place to have some fun, listen to music and watch the movie in the background.

I dont come here a whole lot but when I do I end up eating a lot of fried seafood in a bucket. Its not a place where I go if I am trying to lose weight. I go friends and we just eat and drink, very simple fattening meal.
author: phillip w.

description: It's just a touristy place to go once if you love shrimp and/or you're a fan of Forrest Gump. I'm not really either. I do love seafood, but there are easier, cheaper, and more pleasant ways to enjoy seafood than dining here. Don't even think about going without a reservation. You can even reserve a table an hour in advance. It's very loud and chaotic. The "peel and eat" dishes are weird and messy - not a normal kind of crab-cracking messy, but like a lot of effort spent peeling tiny shrimp. I like my shrimp already peeled before they're on a plate, please. It would be nice if the servers spent less time trying to sell you novelty beverages in light-up souvenir cups, and more time making sure you have the ice water you asked for and bringing the food you ordered. The seafood sold from street vendors on Fisherman's Wharf is much better, and there are also many other, quieter restaurants to go to on the wharf. For my son and I to eat there it was $75, and that was without salads. Just two plates of seafood and lemonade. Pretty ridiculous for a stressful experience.
author: Lori S.

description:
food is alright. my husband and I ordered the super sampler. it came with the artichoke dip, hush puppies, shrimp, chicken strips. 

for the entrée I ordered the seafood pasta. kinda bland, I must say. it came in a marinara sauce with shrimp, clams, and muscles. the meat was very little. I wish there were more. 

customer service was amazing. our server was more than delightful to help. he even did some trivia questions about the movie. it was fun. 

I'd come back again!
author: Dixie x.

description: Came in to have lunch with some friends while visiting town, & got great service. Wait was a little long but thats expected..being that its located in a tourist location. Drinks and food were accurate and everything was plentiful and tasteful. Restaurant was a little busy so didn't get the full experience that I have received before..but it's understandable. Small hiccup would just have to be when we got cashed out two tabs got ran under the wrong card.. I got the more expensive one..but luckily I realized it and got it fixed. Server was friendly. Overall I had a good experience.
author: Alex S.

description:
Great atmosphere & great service. I really want to rate it higher, but the food was just so-so at best. Very bland taste. The hot sauce helped a little, but not enough. 

Fog Harbor is better if you care more about the food quality. It's fun for once, but it will not make me a regular.
author: Kenny D.

description: I've always liked this place. The food is good, not great (though my crab was this time) and though it's typically super busy once you get a spot the service is pretty solid. My last time in I had an awesome server who went above and beyond for us
author: Chris M.

description: Someone frm the Corporate office did contact me regarding my review, which is nice to know that my reviews really do mean something. She said that she would have the manager contact me via email, I gave her my email... but.. i never heard from anyone lol. I guess my review doesnt matter THAT much. haha. it is a chain restuarant. I didn't expect them to contact me .. and they didnt. oh wells... I would have definitely give the manager a piece of my mind! :)
author: Judy W.

description:
Delicious, but a little pained at the prices. Got there around noonish, only had to wait about 10-15 mins, so that was definitely a plus. 

Came here with my mom and brother. Walking in, I felt like I was on a ship or something. The walls were decorated with all sorts of sayings and slogans from the movie "Forrest Gump." We were seated near the area where you could look out the windows into the pier and ocean. The service was superb. I really liked the "Run, Forrest, Run" and "Stop, Forrest, Stop" signs that they used to tell if their service is needed or not. 

We ordered:
- "Shrimper's Heaven";  consisted of 4 diff cones of Coconut Fried Shrimp, Cocktail Shrimp, Tempura Shrimp, and French Fries. Very tasty. Great sampler dish of shrimp. 
-"Shrimper's Net Catch";   reminded me of Boiling Crab's boiled shrimp. We got the garlic flavor since I wasn't sure if my mom could handle cajun spice. It was pretty good; though I wished it had more flavor, maybe will try the Cajun flavor next time. 
-"Lt. Dan's Drunken Shrimp";   this was by far the fanciest. I believe the shrimp was sauteed with diff seasonings, paired with sausage and mashed potatoes. Mmm the sauce was divine.. 
-"Mango Sparkler";   i think the orange juice overpowered the mango, there wasn't much mango taste to it. but it was still pretty good. 

Being along the pier, definitely came here in mind that the prices would be on the higher end. Despite that, it was an enjoyable meal with great company and atmosphere. Would definitely want to come back here.
author: Diana L.

description:
I've been to Bubba Gumps once before in Monterey and I have to say my experience there was better then here.

Inside there is memorabilia everywhere, which was cool. All the staff had smiles on their faces, and it was loud and lively.

I cant remember the name of our waiter, but he was a tall slim guy with facial hair. He gave us our menus and went on his way. He never came back to order our drinks so we flipped that sign on the table and another guy came. I noticed our waiter was a lil more interested in the table behind us(Three college girls) which was fine, but I felt like he could've showed us a lil more attention then what he gave us. The other two people that helped us were great.  

The food was good. My shrimp was amazing!! I think my order was "after the storm"? I cant remember the name but it had shrimp, fish, and fries. the fish and shrimp were fried and had a tasty seasoning. Me and my gf shared that. She got a fish dish which was good. (I'll post the pics).

I've only been to Bubbas once before this but in Monterey I remember them asking us questions from the forest gump move and that didn't happen this time. The college girls behind us got asked from our waiter so maybe it's only for groups bigger then 2??

I'd give the food 4.5 stars and our first waiter 2 stars. I would come back again.
author: Lou L.

description:
We arrived here about 11 am this morning for a early lunch and beat the RUSH...

We ordered the Cajun Shrimp appetizer & my friend ordered Fish and chips my normal order and I ordered a burger and fries. 

I must admit when they brought my friend fish and chips I was kicking myself because they looked so delicious as usual! But my burger was good! 

We had great service and our food was great and the place was clean and attentive!
author: Rubbie S.

description: Wonderful customer service.  The food was delicious.  Great drinks they were very yummy.  I will be returning in the future.
author: Angelique B.

description:
I have been to several Bubba Gumps and have visited this one specifically on many occasions as well.  This visit was different, as I was bringing my teen age kids in for their first time.  We were celebrating my sons birthday and chose here since Forrest Gump is his favorite movie.  

It was a Thursday night at 845 when we finally arrived after a long flight, checking in at hotel and taking the trolley to the pier.  I asked the hostess for the best "Forrest Trivia server" in the house and explained the favorite movie and we wanted to challenge my son.  Her response was "all of our servers are great, just give me a few minutes".  After 10 minutes, we were called to be seated and followed the hostess past 5 empty booths to a 10 top in the back of the place.  Considering we were only a party of 3, I assumed this server must be really good if they were putting us in such a huge table.  Boy, were we wrong.

We met our server after a few moments and gave our beverage order, received our drinks and then gave our food order.  That was pretty much it for seeing our server the rest of the night.  Our food was delivered by a runner, Room temperature at best and after almost nothing being eaten, our server finally returned, didnt seem to care how things were and delivered the check.  Furious and disappointed, I put cash down and went in search of a manager.

I was greeted at the front door by the same cheery hostess who asked how it was and I shook my head holding back tears, stepped outside to cool off, came back in and asked for a manager.  I was not surprised that the manager was less than shocked by what was said and how we were treated.  Basically, I got the "wow, I have never had a complaint and not sure why that happened, come back and see us next time you are in town" kind of answer.  

I understand "theme" restraunts, however, SF/pier 39 is a tourist attraction and they should really keep that in mind.
author: Jen M.

description: The clam chowder was watery and tasted like it came from a can. The fish and chips were delicious. My berry, pear and chicken was excellent ! There was plenty of it and the raspberry vinergarete was a perfect dressing!
author: Laura F.

description: Bubba Gump is a bit overrated for me. Nothing but the venue is memorable. I ordered the Grilled Baja Fish Tacos, and only 1 out of the three were cooked perfect. They're a bit inconsistent since the other two tacos were very dry.
author: Matt A.

description:
Today 5/17/14 we had a family Birthday Lunch 14 peopleat Bubba Gumps at Fishermen's Wharf San Francisco.

The first incident was that I ordered a GIN MARTINI.  When the bartender made it it was made with the wrong ingredients.  The bartender did replace it with the proper MARTINI mix.

During Lunch I ordered another GIN MARTINI.  I waiting approx. twenty minutes .  I had to wave the waiter back and asked him where my drink was.  He replied, "We're Out Of GLASSES".  I had to give him my Bar Glass to get my drink made.

The food was ok but we had to wait a lot of time getting our food.  

I think this is a tourist attraction and it appears that this place is not a place I will go back too including any other Bubba Gums places.
author: R S.

description: Really? You are going to pass off tiny little shrimp that you can get at Safeway for $5? Shrimper's Net Catch 2/3 lb garlic flavor sucked. And why don't you get the corn and potatoes in the pot with it? This shrimp was hard to eat since it wasn't flavored very good, but when you wait for a table you get hungry. We ordered and go our food an hour later. My daughter ordered the sirloin and it was cold, but they told us that was what had held up our order. I have been to the one in Monterey and had a great experience this turned me off. Drinks were so weak for the price what a waste. Will never eat here again....yuk for $167 for (5).
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Mediocre and overpriced food. Ordered the bucket of boat trash (steamed crab, fried shrimp, and fried fish) and could barely taste the seafood over the batter. Barely anything to the crab either. Went with two others and our bill came to over a hundred before tip for three standard meals. Will not be coming back.
author: Elizabeth F.

description:
OVER PRICED!!!!  Oh my GOD this place is rediculious I payed $18 bucks for a small plate of french fries and a handfull of deepfried shrimp....LOL really 18 bucks?? that dosent include a salad or soup or even bread just a small portion of fries and a handful of shrimp.....LOL really?? no really?  

But hey I can add a small side salad for only 6 dollars LOL LOL LOL really??  no really??   wow My friend tricked me into coming here we where suppose to go to joes crab shack where you actually get a large portion for 20 bucks not a basket of friess lol ........ 

Needless to say i will NEVER EVER EVER eat at this place again....... Food took so long to get out that our parking meter expired ( i remeber why the city sucks ass so much)  so after my 20 dollar  fries and my 55 dollar parking ticket i think ill pass on pier 39................. 

God Im so stupid for even thinking that we could have an enjoyable time at such a overpriced torriest shit hole........
author: Brian f.

description:
I'd been to Bubba Gump at the Fisherman's Wharf just once many moons ago. I had the Shrimp in a Basket as a starter which was a pound of beer steamed shrimps tossed in Cajun spices and served on a little net inside a small wooden bucket. The presentation was quite novel (for me) and I remember the shrimps were plenty and tasty. 

Good thing I held off on placing an order for the entree the same time I placed the order for this "appetizer" as I was so darn full by the time I was almost done with it. The shrimps were pretty tasty, just make sure you share it with a friend or two if you intend to save space for the entree.
author: Umesh T.

description:
I don't know what it is about this place that keeps me coming back every time I am visiting San Francisco.  It's almost like a mandatory stop while at Pier 39.

Maybe its the the smile I get every time I think about the movie, or just the memory I have of hanging out here, drinking at the bar with 20 of my friends 5 years ago - whatever it is, it isn't the food.

This is the ultimate tourist destination.  If there was a local or a regular that calls this place home, I would be shocked.  The food is terrible, greasy, and just not worth eating.  The bar is ok, but once again, if you are not a tourist, you shouldn't be here.

I know some of you will tell me the food is ok, and that you like it, but the 3 times I've tried anything, I swore I would never try again...

But hey, life is like a box of chocolates, you never know what you're going to get.
author: Daniel A.

description:
Bubba Gumps is a place I grew up going to as a child.  My family would always go to the one in Monterey and I have visited the one in Anaheim once.  This was my first time going to the one in San Francisco.

When we got to the restaurant, we were told by the hostess that we would be seated in no less than 15-20 minutes.  No joke, we waited for over a half hour!

Luckily, they made it up by giving us delicious food!  Our serving sizes were very generous.  For the appetizer, we ordered the cajan shrimp.  They were too spicy for my liking, but my boyfriend loved them!  I ordered the shrimp/crab bisque, it was so good, but I wish I ordered the cup size rather than the bowl.  The bowl was so big and the bisque is too rich to eat a whole bowl.  So get the cup :)
My boyfriend ordered the fish and chips.  He was given so much food and the fish was fresh.

Warning: get your parking ticket validated at the BUBBA GUMP GIFT SHOP!  Both our hostess and our waiter told us false places to get our ticket validated and it caused us to go over our hour parking validation (because we went to four different places try to find the right place).
author: Katrina L.

description:
Since my first visit to this restaurant I have felt that it was overrated and overpriced. Every entree is at least $15 and can go up to around $30 for very small entrees. Even then, we continued to go because we loved the Forrest Gump movie and we usually had good waiters. That was until our last visit.

We went to have dinner here a few days ago to celebrate a birthday. As soon as we sat down we told our waitress that we were celebrating a birthday. She sad happy birthday and went about taking our drink orders. We ordered our drinks and our food and waited. While we waited for our food, we saw the employees go to two other tables and sing happy birthday and deliver a dessert to the birthday person.

After waiting about 20 minutes, our food finally came out. It turned out that the kitchen ran out of certain types of pasta, so they replaced it with other types of pasta without informing us. 3 of our pastas were supposed to come with linguine, but they were made with penne. Another one was supposed to have penne, but was made with elbow pasta. We asked to have it made properly, so they told us it would take about 10 minutes to make again. So we waited once again. About 20 minutes later, after waiting a total of about 40 minutes for our food, it finally comes out properly. 

We ate, paid, and left. We were there for about 1.5 hours, and no one ever bothered to come sing a birthday song for our birthday person. Overall it was a disappointing birthday dinner. We will not be returning to this place.
author: R M.

description: The view is great and the servers are very friendly and helpful.  The food is so-so at best but its good enough. It a fun choice when your out with friends
author: Blake N.

description: It was my first time here and honestly I didn't expect much because of the reviews but this place was awesome. The appetizer was delicious and the server was very helpful with the menu. The entree was so good. I ordered the crab stuffed shrimp which came with an amazing sauce. The only reason it's not getting five stars is cause of the bar drinks they were way too sweet. Over all tho will definitely come back. Oh and the view is amazing too.
author: Sana S.

description:
Heads up: this review ONLY reflects the best thing to order on the menu, the Shrimp Po Boy sandwich!

This sandwich is definitely one of my favorite sandwiches of all time. So fried and so delicious. It's simple and maybe nothing special, but the crispy shrimp perfectly contrasts the tangy pickles, sweet roll, and spicey sauce. If you're in the mood for something fried, please look no farther than this Po Boy. 

I can't say much for the rest of the menu except it's a little overpriced and repetitive. I do enjoy the Gump trivia and the servers' enthusiasm. 

Fun place with a perfect view to match this perfect sandwich.
author: Kara L.

description: Food and drinks are pricey but the service is excellent and the food was perfect!!! Will definitely return!!!
author: Jamie C.

description:
Food is so-so. This place is not cheap, It's around $25/entree; and for the quality of food they give, I would prefer Boiling Crab in San Jose if i'm craving for seafood next time since parking is easier over there, and the wait is probably the same. 

*CONSUMER FRAUD -- BEWARE*
I'm not sure if the servers in here are commissioned or what not, but they are telling people to join the Landry's Select Club. I don't mind them selling membership to be honest, but I do mind when they mislead consumers!!! 

They have clearly told me that there will be an initial charge of $25 added to my bill, which will be REFUNDED back to my credit card once I register my membership card online. Guess what? It never did. I tried contacting the clubs' customer service via both email and voice mail, waited 2 weeks and still haven't gotten any response. 

I was with a party of 7 and ALL OF US heard what the server said. I'm putting this on the review so fellow Yelpers can be aware of the situation and read the membership rules online prior to actually trusting the servers there and got *scammed* into joining their club.

Update: Also, I just saw Andrey K.'s review and apparently, this Bubba Gump likes scamming people. I'm not telling you guys to not go there, but just be careful :(
author: Claudia P.

description:
The food here is OK, but it's nothing special and is honestly very overpriced. It's primarily fried southern style food, although there are a few items on the menu that are somewhat healthy. If you have Celiac disease, they do have a couple of appetizers and entrees that are gluten free. 
            Anyways, on to the service: the service here is horrible.You can't make a reservation, and you can't even call ahead to put your name on the list. I came in and was told there was a 40 to 50 minute wait for a party of 4, so I gave my name to the host and took a seat outside. As I waited, the line got bigger and bigger and I began to notice that groups, both large and small, that had come after me were being taken before me. I asked the host about it, and she told me that some of the groups had a Landry's reward card (which costs 25 dollars) so they were able to get priority seating. The other groups were taken simply because they were "large parties" and were to be seated at  larger tables. 
            Once we were finally called by the host, we discovered we were amongst 5 other groups so, once again, we were taken out of order. We were instructed to go up a ramp to be seated and ended up waiting nearly 10 more minutes while the host managing the ramp, who was also responsible for cleaning silverware, told us that our table was being "cleaned" and attempted to make light conversation with us. Another 5 minutes passed despite there being a few clean tables in plain sight. I asked the host atop the ramp why my group still had to wait and he responded that he could not leave the area in fear of getting in trouble by the manager. He told us we would have to wait for the proper host to seat us. Moreover, I noticed the manager walk by multiple times...why he could not have seated us himself baffles me.
            Once the host finally arrived, we were led to a table right next to the kitchen door and were told that a table closer to the window would be another 5-15 minute wait! Seeing as my family and I had come all the way from the United Arab Emirates, I accepted his offer to wait. 10 minutes later, we were finally taken to our table -- I must admit that it was a great table with a wonderful view of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge. Once we were sat down, our experience became somewhat better because our server was nice and the idea of a stop sign was very helpful. We ordered our drinks and some appetizers and shortly after ordered our entrees. Like I said in the beginning of this lengthy review, the food was sub-par and the "Shrimper's Heaven" that I ordered was pretty much just overpriced, fried shrimp with poorly cooked french fries. 
              On a better note, our server came back shortly to check on us and also asked if we would like to play "Forrest Gump Trivia." Her assistance was nice and that trivia turned out to be a fun experience. Upon finishing our food, we turned our license plate to "Stop, Forrest, Stop!" which is intended to signal to a server that you are in need of help. I tried to make eye contact with a server multiple times but was unable to reach success due to 3-4 servers standing in the corner having a swell time and 2 managers standing by the computer laughing away. 
              At last, we received our absurdly expensive ($100+) bill and with no more satisfaction left to sacrifice, simply got up and left.
author: Abdul-Hakim H.

description: My family and I had a great time here. The restaurant has great views and the server Craig was fast and responsive. We ordered the Cajun Chicken Sandwich, shrimp lover's heaven, and a popcorn shrimp for the kiddo. The chicken was perfect and the shrimp was good as well, but order the grilled shrimp instead of the peel n eat. I like the boat the kid's meal came in. I ate the blue jell-o. Fun atmosphere and a great location.
author: Maha W.

description: Had dinner and the food was good, the people who work their know its for out-of-town er so they play up the charm. But I loved it and I am very glad I took the time to eat here.
author: Amanda Y.

description:
Two stars for the food. Fish and chips were skinny dry pieces of fish, all batter. Friend had soup and salad. Salad was a mound of iceberg lettuce, not much else. She had been there before and commented that it had changed for the worse.
Giving the third star for great view and friendly service.
author: L. M.

description:
I can't even begin to describe my dining experience here at this god awful establishment. It amazes me that this place is still in business. 

So my family decided to take a trip down to the pier for a nice day out on the water. We chose Bubba Gump's because we all love shrimp and the movie Forest Gump. I go inside to ask about the wait, firstly the hostess completely ignored me and continued to communicate with whoever she was talking to on her walkie.  I politely waited and finally gained her attention. I put my name down and quoted a 50-60min wait. Ok, I understand it's Memorial Day weekend so of course I'm going to have to wait a while. Before I forget I told her I had a party of 8. So we waited outside and forty minutes later I went  back inside to check in to see how much longer my wait would be. She said gather your party and we can seat you in about 15 Minutes. We waited another 20 minutes and finally I heard a strange name on the intercom "jessy party of 8, Jessy party of 8" I looked at my mom and she said, "does she mean CHELSEA?" Then she repeats back, "I mean Chelsea, party of 8" followed by a chuckle. Seriously? 

Then we are directed to this table that has 7 chairs and a high chair all crammed together. There is no way 8 people can fit comfortably in this location. We notify a manager that we need a bigger table. She looks displeased and I swear to you, she sighs and tells us she will find something else. Another male manager comes up to us and says to sit at a nearby booth until something comes available. The table we are supposed to be moved to has other people just sitting there staring at each other. They are obviously done but just wasting precious time doing absolutely nothing. Finally they leave and we are seated, we wait another 15mins until we are greeted by a random server by him saying, "hold on I'll be with you in a second" wtf? Then this same server and another server stand over our table arguing no out who will take our table. They were seriously  conversing with each other for 10 minutes while we confusingly look at them with blank stares on our faces. At this point I can't even begin to fathom what is happening. The other server finally introduces himself, and serves us. 

All in all, the food is way too overpriced, mediocre at best, it's extremely loud, elbow to elbow, and all around a hot mess. The managers were confused, the servers were confused, even the busters were confused. I will never spend my money here ever again. I think the only reason this place is still in business is because of the tourists. They don't know any better. But please if your reading this review know that this restaurant is not worth your hard earned money.
author: Chelsea B.

description: I love this place! I've been here twice and both times, my boyfriend and I have gotten amazing servers. They always seat us by the window with an amazing view of the bridge. The food takes a while to come out, but it should give you time to talk and hang out with your table.
author: Jacky H.

description: Nothing really special food wise. Pretty much your basic overpriced commercial surf and turf. It's all about location here. The views of the bay from this restaurant are spectacular!
author: Max D.

description:
Wow, this is a must-go!
I didn't know the movie when i went there, so that's not why I was tempted.
I loved their Coconut Shrimps! I don't remember the name of the plate, but there is a picture on the menu. It's four buckets of shrimps and french fries.
That was delicious!
My friend had the Clam Chowder, and she said it was amazing.

I recommend the place! Came for  the view (which is excellent on Alcatraz and the East Bay), and I certainly will come back for the food!
author: Oleg K.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant at Pier 39, in fact, I think it's the only one I have enjoyed.   It gets very crowded on weekend nights, so be prepared to wait a while, fortunately there's a lot of stuff to do to kill time.  

The service has always been top notch, and I like that they have the run Forrest and stop Forrest signs for servers whenever you need something.  So instead of waiting for your server to come back to ask for a refill or anything else, just flip your stop Forrest sign, and any employee will stop and help you out.

The food itself is really good too.  I've had crab, shrimp, pasta, and lobster, and I haven't been disappointed one time.  Good portions for a fair price.

I also like that you are quizzed on the movie after dinner.  I'm not the biggest fan of the movie but I know quite a bit about it, like what kind of shoes Jenny was wearing at their wedding.
author: Marcus J.

description:
Not only had I never been to Bubba Gump's, I haven't even seen Forrest Gump, much to the loud shock of my companions.  However, as I do quite love seafood I was more than happy to go.

Since it's at Fisherman's Wharf, it's perpetually busy.  The wait for our table of 8 was about an hour, just slightly longer than suggested.

Deciding what to order will be difficult if you like shrimp and fish.  I went with the Mahi-Mahi and shrimp.  

First minor disappointment was that the portion size in the photo was decidedly larger than what I actually got.  It also wasn't quite as warm as I might have liked, but having said that, it was quite good.  There were about 5 normal sized shrimp accompanying the mahi mahi along with mashed potatoes.  The highlight was the bourbon sauce, which I could have just eaten on top of a gigantic heap of mashed potatoes and been happy.

The speckled strawberry lemonade was good and had real strawberries, but also had way too much ice.  Refills also costed a buck, which is a little greedy considering you're paying four bucks already for the first ice-filled one.

My friend got what I almost did: the jambalaya.  I made the mistake of having a bite... and immediately wished I'd gotten that.  Mine was perfectly fine, mind you, but the jambalaya was creamy and spicy, and anyone who likes it knows that it's tough to find a truly outstanding one.

Our waitress was friendly enough and the food came out in a reasonable amount of time.  They did a Forrest Gump trivia thing which our table did rather poorly at, I suppose to kill time, keep patrons busy and stay in theme.  And the view out the windows of the bay is pretty great, although we weren't sitting close to a window.

The coolest thing that BG's does in my opinion is having table signs that read "Run Forrest Run" or "Stop Forrest Stop".  This way your server can tell if you need them for something or not, preventing the common and annoying requirement of getting their attention.  More restaurants ought to copy this.  I'd love it if there was a third one, "Pay Forrest Pay" so they knew you're ready for the bill so you can go.  God knows trying to get the check after eating is probably one of the most common irritations at every restaurant I've been to.

The prices are probably what you'd expect.  You are unlikely to get out of here for under $20 a person, but considering that you're eating at a tourist trap and getting fresh seafood, it's a hit you can probably afford to take if you're already here and in the mood for shrimp/fish.  

Food: A- 
Service: A-
Value: C-

I'd come back if I was in the area.
author: Tony D.

description:
Nice service, very crowded, expect to wait a few mins to get seated.

The food was a let down, overly priced and just average.

I like the interior of the place though.
author: Linda H.

description: Worst burger I have ever had! I'm a big fan of burgers and I eat at the pier often. Kenzie at the bar offered me a mushroom Swiss burger with onions. I gladly accepted as this is one of my favorite types of burgers. The bun was greasy, you could taste that the grill needed to be cleaned, and it was super bland meat. No seasoning at all. Not even some simple salt and pepper. The burger was cooked medium rare like I asked but with no seasoning it wasn't all that great. The crazy amount of onions which were kinda greasy as well made it all worse.
author: John B.

description: This location will always be home to me. Yet this last visit was awesome. We were very lucky to get a small table that fit us just fine and had views of the water that seemed to go on forever. We got to watch boats pass by and just enjoy the atmosphere. Our food that day was amazing too - I ordered the Jambalaya which was so good but pretty spicy. I asked for a side of sour cream to tame the heat and it was perfect! Our server - Kendrick I believe his name was - was a very cute and very tall young man with curly hair and a pretty smile. He made sure that we were taken care of and I didn't have to ask for anything - he had it all under control. I know that this location can have some pretty heavy wait times but a lot of the time its worth it. Always keep in mind that a lot of places will have their hosts add time to the quoted wait times for every 5+ people that approach the stand wanting a table. (Example: wait list is at 5 people. The wait is 10 minutes. 5 more people come in and so they bump up the wait time to 15 minutes etc.) Since I know this I usually don't get tooo frustrated with quoted waits because usually its less than what I was told. In this case it was.  If you are willing to be patient and decide to wait it out for a table... its always worth the wait in most cases. I cannot recall one bad memory at this location. I hope this review helps!
author: Alicia M.

description: I really don't mind paying $50-$60 for a meal if the food is good, and in this case it was delicious! But the only complaint I have are the small portion sizes. I like to leave a restaurant with a full stomach, knowing that I definitely got my money's worth. 18 bucks for two kebobs, some mashed potatoes, and half a corn on the cob seems a little steep. But all that aside, I loved the vibe, my waiter, and the food. Would've got 5 stars if my tummy had been filled up!
author: Allie E.

description: My best friend and I came here Sunday night & had a great experience! Our food was good and our waiter really made the night awesome, Bruce played the trivia game with us and we had a blast with him! Overall, super awesome time and I can't wait to go back!
author: Zoe G.

description: I have visited this location on several occasions and their food is always good. My favorite is Lt. Dans drunken shrimp. I also love their strawberry lemonade, I will come back just for that,
author: Liz L.

description: Run Forrest, run!  Super pricey and simply put....a tourist attraction.  I will say....the mac and cheese and shrimp is quite awesome but everything else is just...meh.  chowder tasted like it was right out of a can and warm at best.  My salad was weak and super small for a main course.....not impressed.
author: Joseph M.

description: Typical fried shrimp with a Hollywood theme setting.
author: Justin R.

description: This is long overdue, but I'm writing it now. Our actual waitress was super friendly, but I guess if you're not waiting a table you don't have to do anything? I was eating with family friends when one of our drinks accidentally spilled all over the floor and splashed over me a bit. We scrambled to find napkins to clean up our mess, but there were literally 5 other employees around us just standing there, watching us clean up, not even offering to help. I was appalled. I felt like an animal at a zoo as they, the EMPLOYEES, watched us, the CUSTOMERS trying to clean up a wet floor with only napkins. I even went up to one of them, who barely acknowledged me, and asked if they could bring a mop or something. He didn't even move. He just stood there. It made me so angry! The manager came out a few minutes later and was of course super nice and offered us whatever we needed. I don't know if there's some kind of policy that doesn't allow employees to touch floors or something, but everyone except our waitress and the manager was so rude! Not even a little eye contact, or a "we'll get someone right away???" geeze. Only reason I'm giving this 3 stars is because the food was amazing.
author: Dianna M.

description: Horrible experience. And it was me and my family's first time too. Horrible service, orders were off, expensive and over priced for the quality of the food. The views were the best part overall. But never again.
author: Cassandra H.

description:
Fun, Cool, and Upbeat!

This awesome restaurant, (based on the movie Forrest Gump) is a great place for friends and family alike.  It's located at pier 39, in the beautiful city of San Francisco.
The prices are what you would expect for a place with a lot of tourists, but you getting more than good food. 
 
You're getting a great experience!

My group sat in a corner farthest from the front door, which had AN AWESOME VIEW!  There on one side was the Golden Gate Bridge in the distance, and on the other side was Alcatraz!  That with a beautiful sunset... great experience.

The staff gets busy, but it's such a fun environment, you don't mind the little wait.  
Our servers were super friendly and very accommodating when it came to splitting the bill.  And theres great shopping places there at the pier.

I highly Reccomend this place!
author: Shenandoah S.

description: Went out for a birthday. It was okay and the food all came out once ( including the appetizers) and the drinks were okay. Had bigger expectations and was so so
author: David B.

description:
Are you stupid or something?

How could you not enjoy a visit to Bubba Gump's? Shrimp is the fruit of the sea. You can BBQ it, boil it, broil it, bake it, and saute it.

Take a look at their menu, there's uh, shrimp kabobs, shrimp creole, shrimp gumbo. Pan fried, deep fried, stir fried. There's pineapple shrimp, lemon shrimp, coconut shrimp, pepper shrimp, shrimp soup, shrimp stew, shrimp and potatoes, shrimp burger, shrimp sandwich.

I stood near the entrance, staring at the long line and busy hostess, and I had to ask myself one question; Have you ever been on a real shrimping boat? No but I've been on a real big boat.

I sat down at a table and ordered a tall anchor steam. It was my most special beer. My only beer. Next came the food. Now my mom always told me that miracles happen everyday. Some people don't think so but they do. The shrimper's paradise and the crab-stuffed mushrooms were delicious, the service and teamwork were excellent, and my son scarfed down his entire cheese pizza. Awesome. Thats all I have to say about that.
author: Paul M.

description: Everytime i go to the city i always come and eat at Bubba Gump Shrimps, i love the food and the serivce is always on point. i always take my friends here to eat, and they always love it. I can't wait to eat at the one in Las Vegas,nv
author: Shallani C.

description: 2nd time here food is ok to good kids like it here. There shrimps are good and good for families.  Serves allways good at least for us.
author: Figghi I.

description: Ok so my kid and I enjoyed an awesome day at the pier and wanted to finish it off with a nice meal. I should have gone somewhere else for the nice meal. I ordered the stuffed shrimp with crab, tasted like something from a garbage can, so I sent it back. I then ordered the new Orleans shrimp. This dish had great potential, however with undercooked rice and shrimp it was a complete fail. I ate it, so I wouldn't collapse from hunger, however I recommend you spending your money elsewhere for authentic seafood, or having something fried. Service from the staff was attentive, not overly friendly.
author: Happy T.

description:
Atmosphere + Service = 5 stars
Soupish food = 4 stars
Fried food = 2 stars

A tourist trap? Sure, but a nice tourist trap. One can do much worse in this area. Shrimp in broth is particularly good.

For Fish and Chips, go to the Codmother.
author: George T.

description: Nice view of the bay. I feel like this is the Friday's of seafood. I had the seafood pasta and so far so good. It was a bit spicy and I was expecting a bit more shrimp. I found it disappointed that two clams were not open in my dish. I would have given it two stars if not for the view and friendly waiter.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
This place's 3 star overall rating fits it perfectly... I'll break this review down as follows... They get this many stars (per each dept)....

- SERVICE (From start to end) = 5 stars

- ATMOSPHERE (Cleanliness, decor) = 3 stars

- FOOD (Taste, quality, freshsness, presentation) =  4 stars

- OVERALL "LIKEABILITY" = 2.5 stars

- PRICES (Considering all above) = 2.5 stars

Definitely a crowded tourist spot that goes a little overboard on Forrest Gump trivia, but worth checking out once in your life, I'd say. Fun for the One visit....
author: Kai S.

description: We know that this place is very popular. Wanted to try it out for the first time waiting 1 hour and 15 mins in the cold was a little much but take into consideration on how busy they were we waited. Server mediocre atmosphere pretty cool. We all ordered our dishes. Tab came out to $95 for 2 adults and 1 kid which is fine but for the amount of clams, mussels and shrimp we were getting on our plate, I felt it was a little skimpy (picture on menu looked more pleasing).
author: James O.

description:
Where is Forest?!
I swear I thought there was a Forest Gump there.... Maybe I missed him? 
Soooo, my dining experience here... It was ok. 
Way too crowded. I had to wait like and hour to get seated,then forever for the waiter then even longer to get my food. 
It's not the dollar menu, that's for sure lol i ordered lt. Dan's drunken ship and when I finally got my food well it was really salty. It has way too many spices or something. The mashed potatoes were cold and I just don't know. Definitely not my liking.

I would go back and maybe order something else...
author: Karla Emm N.

description:
"Hi Tina,
My name is Lindsay and I'm the Social Media Manager for Landry's Inc., owner of 
Bubba Gump. If something happened to your daughter in which we did not honor her 
gift card I would like to know about it so we can rectify it. Please have her 
contact me at webfeedback@ldry.com.

Sorry again,
Lindsay"


This was what was sent to me regarding a $100 gift card to be sent to my daughter.  I e-mailed Lindsay numerous times and explained the situation but even at this point, the gift card was never sent.  I don't remember the managers name the night of the visit but I still believe that Bubba Gump Shrimp Co should follow thru on promises made by their managers.  Enough said.
author: Tina S.

description: Service is good but I would say price and quality isn't. If your looking for a place to take your family it's fun but pricey. If your looking for quality San Francisco seafood there are much  better choices.
author: James T.

description: For being my first time here they got really good service but the food... I was not impressed. I told the server to get my appetizer first of course but they bring out my main meal then the appetizer. The food took too long that I basically wasn't hungry anymore and when they brought out the food, it was like feeding a kid. I don't know if I'll go here again.. Maybe in a few months but I hope they improve on their food.
author: marie d.

description: Go for the atmosphere!  Go for the nostalgia of the movie.  Go for the view of SF Bay.  Go for the great service.  Go for the craziness of this chain restaurant.  (Just don't go, expecting to have amazing food.  It was just fine but one time is enough for me.)
author: Heidi D.

description: Came in on a Saturday for dinner around 6pm. And naturally it was going to be a two hour wait.. However I know that bar area seating is typically first come first serve and my husband and I were able to sit at the bar within 10 minutes. Great atmosphere at the bar. Interacting with other tourists and constantly having someone to give you what you need is a huge plus!! We ordered the shrimp feast and a shrimp po'boy. Both were amazing and completely filling. Shrimp feast had coconut, tempura, hand breaded and Cajun grilled shrimp with fries. All were seasoned well and cooked perfectly. The po'boy was exactly what I expected. Crispy popcorn shrimp on a toasted bread with great seasoning. Perfect amount of lettuce and mayo.  A little expensive but you definitely pay for and receive a bubba gump experience. Would definitely go back.
author: Mrs. A.

description: theme dining at it's mediocre-est.  wait was not bad for a sunday night, only 30 mins, which is ok for being at the pier.  mess up on the order, had to ask for things (drink, extra bowl, crayons for the kids, water) about three times.  the server bought my fish and chips over as a kids order, which is a little annoying, cause by the time they came back with the real order, everyone was half way done with their stuff. The last 1.5 stars were earn by our view, we got window seating looking at the beautiful bay.
author: Bobby W.

description:
Well I wrote a pretty scathing email to the Sales Person (only card I could find).  I then got a prompt email response and a call from the General Manager.  The GM offered me $25 GC, and told me to let him know when I'll be eating there again.  The GM said with enough notice, we should have no problem seating ASAP.

Kudos to corporate stepping up and taking care of their customers.

I will eat there again, when the time is right, and let y'all know how it turns out.
author: Billy M.

description: I don't like seafood much but i have never been upset when coming here! service can be slow but they are super busy so i understand.
author: Matt M.

description: Tourist trap.. expensive and mediocre .. to bad my husband loves it.  You're better off getting a bowl of calm chowder on the pier and a crab sandwich from boudins, a third of the price and worth every penny
author: Mimi W.

description: Long wait but it worth, seafood first choice, good on a relax day. Both me and my husband had a good time there, seats next to the window have great view. Food are good, seafood are very fresh, staff are nice, waiter and waitress serving very good service. Always busy. Price are reasonable.
author: Sammie Y.

description: Service sucks. My wife, her family, and I (4 people total) waited patiently for 40 minutes. I politely asked the girl working up at the front how much longer it will be. She said a couple of minutes. Nearly a half an hour later still not seated. Saw larger parties that came after us going in and was like WTF? When I went up there a third time, the girl up front looked annoyed and finally let us in. Food is ok, but because of the service, we are never going back there again.
author: Brian B.

description: My mom, my brother and I loved our food, and had a great first experience! But most of all we loved our waitress Olivia, she was amazing! Very rare now a days to get great food and great service! We will definitely be going back soon!
author: Breeann E.

description:
My 10 year old daughter has been wanting to visit your restaurant for some time because Forrest Gump is one of her favorite movies. She heard servers at some other tables asking trivia questions and she was so excited. We asked our server at the end of our meal if she could ask our daughter the trivia questions, she said certainly and asked her some simple questions that my daughter easily answered. At the end my daughter was elated that she had gotten all of the questions correct. The server then said "you know what your prize is? It's the paper towels" (then she pointed to the paper towels on the table). Needless to say we left immediately and my daughter was very disappointed...not that she didn't get a prize, but because the server was so rude about it. We didn't even ask for a prize. I will never go back there again.

Also, the food was very overpriced and not that good. The silverware was dirty and the service, while efficient, was not very pleasant. The view was amazing and probably worth the money we spent if it weren't for the unfortunate event at the end of our meal.
author: Laurie R.

description:
$110 for three people. This place hurts your wallet and the sea food is something I can make myself. I ordered the all shrimp basket with 4 different kind of cooked shrimp. My favorite was the shrimp tempura because I'm a huge tempura fan. But the portions were not as big as I would've liked for my $$ spent. 

Drinks were pretty delicious, but paying $12 for a regular margarita doesn't sound too worth it right now. The worst part about this place was the wait time. They make you wait outside and when they finally call your name, they make you wait in line again inside the place. To make this story short, company was definitely the highlight of this restaurant.
author: Michelle R.

description:
Three basic tips:

1. Bring your patience, especially on the weekend.  It's a touristy place, and if you're considering eating there, you're probably a tourist.  Try not to be in a hurry because the wait times can be long.

2. Don't eat in the bar.  Seriously.  You might want to because the wait will be slightly shorter - but probably only slightly.  You'll be giving up a better table to get service from the crappy bartender.  She was a rude little witch the day we went.  She literally threw a ballpoint pen at my husband.  Seriously.  Threw it.  (Then, I became my mother when my first thought was, "You could poke someone's eye out like that!")

3. The food is just OK.  Are you really surprised?
author: Shannan W.

description:
When we arrived, we were told the wait would be about 10-20 minutes which it was. What they didn't tell us was that was Part I of our wait. We were then escorted in and told we would have to wait a few more minutes. When we were finally seated, the music was so loud that we literally had to yell at one another. The wait staff was very friendly however.

I ordered the seafood feast which was far from a feast. The fish was limp and the fries were cold. My co-worker ordered the shrimpers heaven which was fairly pricey but appeared to have a lot of shrimp with it but that proved to wrong as one of the shrimp cups was full of dry cabbage and only had a few shrimp. 

We won't return.
author: Terrill W.

description:
REALLY not impressed with this restaurant!

We made the necessary tourist visit to this place when we were down in SF a few weeks ago.  To me, it was way more hype than is necessary.  

For 'the city by the bay' the menu was minimal.  I understand that it's a shrimp joint, but come up with some creative options will ya?

There were a few things that went wrong:

The waitress spilled a drink (mine....grrr) on my son and didn't even apologize.  She kinda chuckled as she sopped it up.  Um...okaaaay.

I ordered broiled fish and got fried.

A different waiter brought out the wrong drink and then argued that it wasn't.  It's not hard to tell when a vodka and tonic isn't a vodka and tonic.

Needless to say I was happy to leave this location and will not be returning.
author: PDXgirl C.

description:
I got the Net Catch Entree: lots of shrimp, some vegetables, Secret Cajun Spice, all served mixed together in a trough/plate. The spices are "hot", I was warned. Great!

Coated in spices, the food looked like it should be flavorful. But it was bland and certainly not "hot". There are plenty of other fine restaurants in San Francisco and along the wharf to spend time in this one.

Pros:
 Great service
 Great view, especially if you get a window seat like I did

Cons:
 Bland food
 Expensive
 Excessive movie trivia (consider this a "pro" if you are in love with the movie)
author: C L.

description:
Came here for dinner on a weekday. There was no wait.

We tried their shrimp basket and their crab legs. Everything was super fresh. I have to say though, the rice there was meh... it was so soft and all stuck together - definitely not a fan. But the seafood was really good and extremely good service too.
author: S L.

description:
I swear I already wrote a review for this place but maybe I'm thinking of the one in Monterey?  They're both quite good. I might prefer the one in Monterey over this location but that probably just has to do with the location and not the dining experience. This is the type of place that doesn't offer anything spectacular but most items are fairly good and there are cute trinkets to delight in like novelty cups. Last time I ate here I had the peel shrimp. Both seasonings are quite good. My least favorite item I've ever had is probably the watery Mac n cheese so do not eat any of that. 
I love their cocktail glasses and cups and think they are just cute items that one should add to their kitchen collection. They're also very durable. 
I'll always enjoy coming to this place even if it's only once every few years. It's great for family and kids.
author: Amber R.

description: It has a direct view to the ocean!georgia peach iced tea and shrimp net catch were great!pleasant experience.
author: Bali H.

description: Good food great views keep in mind its a chain would rather come here than fog harbor that place is $$$ the food is way over rated there.the blue hawiian is great here to.go during the day here less crowded.
author: Mike H.

description: This place is mediocre at best. I've been to the one in Minneapolis, and it was great. The waiters played Forrest Gump trivia games with the guests, and the food was fantastic, so I was excited when I saw that there was one in San Francisco. I would swear it was a different company entirely. The waiters were pretty unfriendly, but the service was decent. The food was okay, but I've had better shrimp at Applebee's. Definitely overpriced for the food and experience.
author: Ariel K.

description: I came here a few weeks ago because my cousins were in SF for the weekend. They live in New Jersey and we're thrilled when they found out there is a restaurant called "Bubba Gumps" based off the movie. Well, the wait to get in was short. We sat and talked. Our table was in a weird spot. There was some like diagonal pole that was positioned from the ground to the ceiling. I hit my head on hit, which burned. Anywho, our server was the best! Shoutout to Donny B! My cousins were wearing UCLA and Berkeley sweatshirts, and he talked all about colleges with them. It's was fun to listen too. I'm pretty sure all the servers do this, but he asked us trivia questions on the movie. His style of doing it was amazing. Definitely one of the best servers I've had at a restaurant. The food was also delicious. Especially the shrimp scampi. Get a few appetizers because it won't fill you up. Good job Donny for being my favorite server at Bubba Gumps!
author: Jared H.

description:
The Food is a bit expensive, but where they really get you is the drinks (a strawberry lemonade was 6 Dollars)  

I had Fish n Chips, and both the fish and the chips were a bit greasy (the paper stuff they came on was as clear as glass. One of my friends got the calamari appetizer, which was inexpensive, but very salty. 

Overall, I'd say that it wasn't worth the price and that the food was fairly lame, but then again, the same thing can be said about anything at Pier 39.
author: Alex G.

description:
It was my best friends birthday she absolutely loves forest gump the movie, came down to the bay to have a great seafood dinner, so we chose Bubba Gump Shirmp! Its only right, right?! Wrong!!! It was a bad ..baaaad mistake and unfortunately that was all because of our unfortunate untrained servers who don't know how to handle a bill/check for a party of 5adults!!?!?!! 

This place is MOST DEFINITELY over hyped! Poor seafood quality,  which is absolutely the kitchen's fault. This is the city by the Bay, the source is in your backyard!! Overall the experience there was decent. But the servers need better training!!!!!!!!!! They don't know how to manage a bill for a party of 6(5adults,1child)!? Our bill was $190, we gave 2cards to be charged $40 each & paid $110 cash. These IDIOTS charged EACH card for the full amount + $40 tip on BOTH cards and took the $110 cash!! Made that mistake failed to tell us anything even when we asked if there was something wrong because it was taking a little too long to bring back 2cards for their signatures. It was obvious they made a mistake and tried/did fix it while we were all waiting. We leave the restaurant that night but to find out there was $230 charge on 2cards which was readjusted and will be back in the accounts in 2-3days..OKAY WHYYYYY didn't they TELL US AT THE RESTAURANT! !!!! GUEST SHOULDN'T FIND OUT SUCH STUPID MISTAKE BY THESE DUMB SERVERS FROM OUR BANK..THE NEXT MORNING!!! TOTTALLY UNPROFESSIONAL!!! 

MAKES NO SENSE!!! How does their system even allow that? How does one bill even accept the charge of $430(cards)+ 110 (cash)... Overall they were very dishonest, unprofessional!! And very upsetting to just get a "We readjusted the charges, sorry". THAT'S IT!!!!! 

DONT GO HERE...THE PIER MARKET HAS THE SAME AMAZING VIEW WITH BETTER FOOD..GO THERE.  SAVE YOUR TIME MONEY LIFEEEEE!!!
author: Salwa R.

description: The service was decent but the food was disappointing.  The food came out cold the calamari was bland and cold. They highlight shrimp so dont expect alot of selections of shell fish like crabs or muscles. I came in hungry and it would have taken alot to disappoint me and I was dissapointed.
author: Kao S.

description: Made a reservation for a group of 40 with 7 different checks.  They were ready for us and served us efficiently.  The food was awesome and the drinks were fantastic, especially those margaritas they serve in the shaker.  We took a group of Girl Scouts over the bridging weekend on May 3, 2014.  We played trivia and had an excellent time.  I couldn't have been happier!
author: Freddie M.

description:
I'm surprised this place got 2/3 star reviews!
I thought this place was great! Me and my friend came here for dinner today and we ordered a large amount of food.
I ordered two appetizers: the bucket of shrimp which was boiling crab style, and the shrimp mac and cheese. Both were really good! The mac and cheese was very flavorful and creamy, I loved it! It had a perfect kick to it :] And not only that, the bucket of shrimp was delicious too! I like peeling the shrimp and sucking all the flavor off the shell :] so yummy!
This was a great place! Sure, it's pretty pricey (in total mine was about $25) but what do you expect from a tourist zone?
author: Johnny C.

description: 2 words. Forced. Waiting. Can not stand it. Sitting here waiting with others. At least 6-10 tables I can see that are clean, and haven't been used since we checked in.
author: Tim O.

description: I have always expected bubba gumpa to have the friendly atmosphere associated with the Forrest gump movie but this experience was nothing like what I expected. Our server Sean was clearly more interested in going home than serving us, he was sarcastic and pushy all night. Our party was partially arrived and as soon as they sat down he was pressuring them for their order. Our food arrived and it was good overall, the peel away shrimp wasnt cleaned but everything else was pretty good. The night took a turn when we asked for a water refill, Sean decides to just grab one glass and fills it with water. When he gets back I ask him to please bring a pitcher so we can all get a refill. He comes to the table and just slams the pitcher down for us to pour it ourselves. Um worst service I have ever had, he took idgaf to the next level and was clearly complaining about us on our way out. I'll never go back unless I decided to order to go.
author: Sarah W.

description:
The food tastes like fast food and is really expensive. We came to the restaurant and there was no wait. My bro-in-law hadn't arrived yet and the guy with the earpiece said we wouldn't be able to be seated until he gets there. My sister asked how long the wait would be. He whispered something into his headset and then said, "It's our policy not to seat people until their whole party has arrived. "  Umm, thank you for informing us of the policy, however that wasn't the question.  So my sister asks again, "How long is the wait if we wait for my husband?" So, Mr. Earpiece whispers into his headset again and then tells us again that it's restaurant policy to not seat parties until the whole group has arrived. Then he proceeds to tell us about large parties of 10 and more and how they have to wait for everyone to arrive. My sister asked him again how long the wait is and he whispers in his headset and then asks, "Will you be ordering food?" Well, there were 6 of us there, 3 kids and 3 adults.  I am pretty sure we wouldn't be sitting at the bar ordering drinks with 3 kids with us. So he finally gets the okay to let us in to our table. 

Our waitress was friendly. She was a little hard to hear because of the noise level in the restaurant. The Forrest Gump quiz was fun. The signs signaling when you need service are a great idea and whenever we flipped our sign for service, someone came over right away. However, towards the end of our meal, the manager rushed over with our bill to inform us they automatically included gratuity because we had more than 6 in our party. Well, considering 2 of our party were kids under age 3, I felt that was just a way of squeezing more money out of customers. I don't need a restaurant to calculate how much tip to leave for a server. What I choose to leave (or not leave) is my decision. For that reason, I took off 2 stars. 

So minus 2 stars for an automatic gratuity of 18%, minus 1 star for the generic fast food and minus 1 star for the overpriced food and/or all food prices not being listed on the menu. Be careful when ordering. The prices for some of the smaller portions are listed on the menu, the larger portion prices are not. The saving grace of this place was the waitress who would have been well compensated even without the restaurant including gratuity in our bill. This is obviously a tourist trap and I will stay far away from this place next time I am in the City.
author: KiKi W.

description: It was a good place to eat waitress was very nice and attentive. We came in here with a family of 14 people so yes we expected a wait = ) We just hung out at the bar until the table was ready. An hour later I fell in love with a drink I named the gummy bear.
author: Mary Jane P.

description:
Came back here again last weekend with a big group of friends for a b-day party. It was fun. This was the first time I ever got to participate in the Forrest Gump Trivia game (so they do still indeed do that). Won no prizes but some others did. I could see how that game would be annoying to neighboring tables the way my table screamed the answers. But it was all in fun.

This time I had the Mahi Mahi with shrimp and mashed potatoes in a burbon sauce. Flavor wise, yuuummm. The only problem I had was that the fish was a little overcooked. But the mashed potatoes were buttery and seasoned perfectly, the bourbon sauce was good, the shrimp were good and perfectly cooked and the flavor of the fish was good, just a little dry.

And yes indeedy the drinks are WEAK! I ordered a Long Island and it was sour/tart and very much weak as hell. How can you make a L.I. weak?? Crazy. 

Oh and the staff was friendly but off this night. They each kept coming to the table asking "Who ordered blah, blah" and no one had ordered it. A bunch of times. And the bill even had stuff on it that no one ordered. Get it together suge. Next time I'm getting a separate bill.
author: Chantay X.

description: I love it here! Great atmosphere and staff! The meal was great and was delivered quickly even though the place was packed. The Sam Adams in tap was great. I WILL come back!
author: Jason T.

description:
BuBba Gumps is always a very fun place to go to. The Ambience is always quite lovely with the cool things from the movie.

I always enjoy mama blues fried shrimp. SO GOOD. 

In Pier 39, it's got such a lovely view of the ocean, you'd think that Forrest was right there. 

Run Forrest Run!!! 
but Stop Forrest Stop!! for some awesome shrimp at good ol bubba gumps for some fun seafood cuisine
author: Julia L.

description: The food was good, as expected, but the service was even better! I am not a fan of seafood but this place got me sold! We played our chances and randomly picked two items and we were definitely pleasantly surprised!  Definitely recommend it!!
author: Asma B.

description:
Sergeant: Gump! What's your sole purpose in this army? 
Forrest: To do whatever you tell me, drill sergeant! 
Sergeant: God damn it, Gump, you're a goddamn genius. That's the most outstanding answer I've ever heard

I loved that movie, It's one of my favorite movie of all time!!!

The moment we walked in to the time we left we had an amazing time! There was a small wait to get seated. But that was fine, cause we checked out the menu they had posted outside.

We were seated next to the window, so we had a nice view.It's been a couple of weeks so I forgot what I ordered..it was some kind of fish dish and it was delicious! They also had brown rice, I order a side of that too! I got one of the frozen lemonade in a flashing cup that we get to keep. Yeah I 'm a tourist! I get to take a souvenir home! Yay !!

The servers really extremely friendly an nice! The place is loud, so beware! The table next to us were asked questions at the end of their meal. I was secretly listening for the answers. Although I said its one of my favorite movies, it's been too long! I would have failed miserably. Overall good experience!
author: Sophia H.

description: I like this place at every location I've been to.  Yummy food.  The service was not super speedy because the place was packed.  We shared garlic bread and I had the shrimp po boy sandwich.  The girls I was with enjoyed their kids meals - fish and chips and mac and cheese that came in cool paper boats the kids can keep!
author: Sherrie Rose M.

description: I can't believe they changed my favorite item on the menu! The only reason I come here is for the "Bucket of boat trash"! Which used to come with fries, fried shrimp, crab legs, yummy fish, hush puppies and a lobster claw! Well now it doesn't have the lobster claw or the hush puppies and the fish tasted run of the mill! Too fishy! I was very disappointed and probably wouldn't go back! Btw it was still $21.99 and now it fits the name bucket of trash!
author: Lisa K.

description:
This place to me is just like Rainforest Cafe. It's only popular because of it's name. I am sad that we chose this place to eat, but hey.. When the Cheesecake Factory had an almost 2 hour wait on a Friday night we had to make do. Especially since we had my toddler with us. 

Let's start off by saying that the server was awesome. His name was Luke and I couldn't have asked for a better person to help us. 

However the food was GARBAGE !! I mean it literally made my whole table sick. We ordered the popcorn shrimp appetizer.. Yes on the menu it tells you it comes with pepperoncini's & roasted red bell peppers, but if it's called "Best Ever Popcorn Shrimp" I would expect way more shrimp. Every one I picked out was a pepper of some sort, so I gave up on that. 

Next I ordered "...Of Course We Have Scampi!", which I figured would be a safe choice and plus I love shrimp Scampi. Holy cow, when it got to the table and I took a bite all I tasted was lemon. Okay once again they listed it had lemon-garlic butter in the dish, but I didn't know I was ordering LEMON DRENCHED NOODLES with a few small pieces of shrimp. My boyfriend took a bite too and said there were too many capers in it. Either way I ate the few pieces of shrimp and left the rest. 

My son got the kids pizza, (I chose for him obviously). Poor baby wanted nothing to do with the "pizza" they brought him. Let me tell you this kid can eat, but I can't blame him. That looked like cardboard with some cheese sprinkled on top. I could make a better pizza myself and I am no chef. Heck, he could probably make a better pizza and he isn't even 2 yet. 

My mom ordered Bubba's After the Storm "Bucket of Boat Trash". She dug right in and ate a piece of shrimp and then started working on her lobster claw. She had no real complaints with hers but she didn't touch a single french fry either. I had one of her shrimp which was, eh.. just okay. Then I tried a piece of her fish, and I swear someone had it out for me that night because whatever they used to coat her fish tasted like dirt. No I can't say exactly what dirt tastes like, but that was the first thing that came to mind when I tasted it. She is the one who usually says something to the waiter but we told her not to tonight.

Last my boyfriend orders the Fish & Chips. Just average. Nothing worth bragging about. His fries came out cold as well so they had to bring him new ones. The fish wasn't very crispy like I am used to when I order fish & chips, but at this point I ate three pieces of his because anything was better then the crap I got served. 

So sorry to say, we will NEVER come back to this place. $105 tab for three adults and a child, I think not. From now on I will stay at the front of Pier 39 and eat at my favorite place, Pier Market Seafood Restaurant.
author: Manda W.

description: I ordered the fish and chips platter.  It wasn't great.  Thank God my server was hot.  At least I had some eye candy.  Oh and the view (of the bay) is great.
author: Kaleb A.

description: This place is great. Not only does it incorporate one of the greatest movies ever created, but it also has pretty good food too.We had a large party and one of our orders got mixed up. The manager came to our table and personally apologized. They gave us the meal on the house. Mama would have been proud! Thanks for being such awesome lieutenant Dans.
author: Brenda L.

description: They had great food and we had a good server but being a mom and having a baby and having to changing your daughter diaper. You want it in a clean bathroom not a disgusting one( toilet paper all on the ground along with diapers)! When I told one of the host she ignored me and rolled her eyes. Then I proceed and asked for a manager she completely ignored me again. Definitely won't be going back to this location EVER AGAIN!
author: Kristin P.

description:
I like Bubba Gump coconut shrimp.... it's overpriced, tourist food but still good.

We went on a Sunday afternoon and the wait was about 25 minutes for the four of us. We then waited another 10 minutes to be seated after being called. They waited another 10 minutes for a server to come by, then another guy came by to take our drink order but we put in our food order with him too since we were already very hungry.

They have a lot of drink options but they are all $6-$7 just for something fun, blended, and non-alcoholic. 

Others at our table got the fish & chips, and cajun chicken sandwiches, they enjoyed them.

For whatever reason the fries this time around were stellar... I seriously never eat the fries that come with meals and I ate EVERY last little fry on my plate.

We spent a day at the zoo and were looking for something casual to eat besides burgers, so this was a good choice for us.
author: Karen S.

description:
YUM!

This place is always packed... No matter what you will probably have a long wait. HINT: Stalk the bar... wait for someone to leave... snag their table. Your wait won't be NEARLY as long and the service is the same.

Anyone who has been here knows what to expect with the service.  STOP FORREST STOP, RUN FORREST RUN... no need for further explanation... It saves the waiters from making needless stops to ask if I need a refill.

My fave? Bucket of Boat Trash... yum yum yum!

Although I have had other dishes and it is always good.

I have never been disappointed with the food... EVER.
I have always had nothing but pleasant service, if not OUTSTANDING. I have been coming here for years, whenever I am near the wharf.  In fact, when my daughter (who is now 16) was small, the waitress gave her a piggy back ride around the restaurant... lol. I left her a substantial tip...
author: Julie A.

description:
