Came out here on a Friday afternoon for lunch after walking around Pier 39 and working up an appetite. The wait was only about 5 minutes even though the place seemed packed.

We started with the Shrimper's Net Catch, 2/3 pound Cajun Spice. Then we shared the Shrimper's Special, which is a combination of Coconut Shrimp, Chilly Shrimp, Fried Shrimp, and Tempura Shrimp with fries. Gotta say my favorite was the Coconut Shrimp, paired with the Cajun Marmalade...delicious!

I understand this is a touristy spot and all but the view is pretty cool and the food wasn't too expensive since we wanted a light lunch and decided to share. I'd definitely come back.
author: Oscar H.

description:
Top notch service!  Our server was fast, efficient and very friendly.  Jambalaya was delicious!  Fried Calamari (nothing special with too many Red Bell Peppers and
Pepperoncinis.)  We enjoyed Bubba's Far Out Dip. Shrimp Scampi with lingunie was very tasty. For shrimp lovers..we'd recommend "Shrimper's Heaven", they give you lots of shrimp. Forrest Seafood Feast was good.  We had two orders of Boat Trash with lobster claws, breaded shrimp, and cajun fries, VERY YUMMY!  

NO ROOM FOR DESSERTS!  Looking forward to our next visit.
author: Yummy L.

description: Watch out, it's a tourist trap! The food we ordered seemed old, the shrimps literally felt as if they would've been reheated. Fries were cold, seafood was horrible quality compared to most of the restaurants on the pier. Avoid, there's so many better options around!!!
author: Alejandro Arnoldo F.

description: Better than I expected. It's a tourist trap with a large gift shop but once you look past that it's quite good. We went late evening which was good as it wasn't too busy. The service was average. It was nice that they had a sign you could put up to instantly get serviced. The food was good. I recommend the "I'm stuffed shrimp" which is really good. It was also not too expensive for such a touristy area. If you have never been to the chain before and want to experience it, this is the place.
author: Louise F.

description:
I came here on a business trip out to San Francisco.

We at first had seating in a cramped table towards the front but the waiter came back to our table and asked us if we would like a view of Alcatraz (um, heck yes we would! LOL). The seat was awesome! We had the best view of Alcatraz along with the bay and the Golden Gate Bridge which could be seen slightly in the distance.

To drink, I got the margarita with the corona sticking out of it (I think it's called a Coronarita). Usually, these are my favorite but the one from BGSC was waaaay too sweet and I wasn't able to really taste the alcohol at all. I had to keep adding salt to cut the sweetness.
For the appatizer, we got the calamari. It was so good...probably the best I've had in a long while.
Finally for my main entree, I got Bubba's bucket of boat trash (or something like that...I can't remember the exact name). It was pretty good. Had a lot of spice to it but I like that on my seafood. The only thing I really don't like about that place is it's quite expensive for what you get. I really thought that I'd be getting a bit more for my money...but I guess they try to make it more about the experience than anything else.

The service was really good. My favorite part was when the waiter comes to the table while you're waiting on your food to give you a quiz on the Forrest Gump movie. I got all but one answer right....LOL I couldn't remember Bubba's full name from the movie (Benjamin Buford Blue).

Anyway...besides the prices and the lack of liquor in the alcohol, it was a good time and I'd definately go back if I'm ever in San Francisco!
author: Stephanie H.

description: We love this place.  We order the 1 1/2 pound half cajun/half garlic shrimp and a couple pounds of crab legs every time we go.  Ambiance is wonderful.
author: Ali M.

description:
It's a quirky chain theme restaurant in a sea of tourist trap businesses... Really, what do you expect?

For what it is, it hits its mark. Expect to wait in line twice. Once to get your name called, then curiously wait again at the Stop Forrest Stop sign before you get seated. Views are great. Drinks are solid. The food is frankly overpriced and not special. The servers are friendly, even if the friendliness is forced because deep down they hate their lives and wish they could find any job that didn't involve singing the praises of Forrest Gump for seven hours straight.

Your server will come ask you trivia questions about the movie. Be sure you're ready with answers like "Jenny", "Greenbow, Alabama", "Bubba and Lt Dan", "Both legs", "Box of chocolates", "Football and Ping Pong", "Kennedy, Johnson, and Nixon", "In the buttocks", and if you are really on a roll, they may try and stump you, so be ready to answer "Number 9". You won't win any prizes. In fact, your server will probably think you're a gigantic loser for having seen the movie enough times to memorize that, and they will call Homeland Security and ask that you be added to the watch lists.

But hey, if you ordered one of the fancy drinks, you get a souvenir glass out of it. So there's that.
author: TJ P.

description: Ok. The wait time was estimated and told to me upfront when I put my name on the list.  The wait time was up and my name was called.  Now I have to wait in line while my table was being ready, was down right ridiculous.  Took another 15 minutes to get our order in.  The Steamed Shellfish was ok and the Cajun Shrimp was very bland and tasteless.  I've been to many seafood places all around the bay area, and have to say this one you should definitely pass on.
author: Jeff H.

description: I like this place. I know it's touristy and the food is predictable and just ok, but the views are great and the service is always friendly.  It's a great place to bring out of town guests at the end of a long day of walking.
author: Marie D.

description: Kevin, the Bartender is awesome. He was really hospitable to me and the kids. He is super friendly and warm. It was a pleasure.
author: Hazel H.

description: After our tour of Alcatraz we chose Bubba Gump Shrimp Co as our lunch destination. The restaurant was busy yet after a short wait, they gave us a booth near the window with a magnificent view of the Bay and Alcatraz Island.    The server was sweet and helpful. She made suggestions that we took and the food was outstanding. My picky 14 year old daughter loved her New Orleans Shrimp and polished off her plate. The Razzle Dazzle drink with complimentary souvenir glass was sweet and delicious.  Overall, very pleased with our experience. The prices were reasonable considering the location. The view was stunning. We had a great time!
author: E. R.

description:
Very fun place to go to! The food is very good (awesome shrimps) and I reccommend trying to get a seat by the window for a great view!

Run Forrest Run!!
author: Mario A.

description:
We brought cousins here last week.  The Jambalaya was so good, the best I've had almost anywhere.  My husband enjoyed his shrimp which was cooked 3 different ways.  The sauces were good too, and so were the appetizers.  We had a good time despite the fact that the place was SO LOUD you could not hear yourself think.  In a way it reminds me more of a sports bar, than a restaurant, with all kinds of parties going on that were so loud, it was unbelievable.  I had one glass of Sangria and it was the most watered down drink I've ever had.  I should have sent it back.  The drink and a cup of coffee with tip came to $14.50, way too much for a bad drink.

We'd go back, but not on the week-end, especially a Saturday.  Saturday is their busiest night.  The waiters kept changing too.  We must have had 3 waiters.  Waiter #1 kept coming back over and over again and interrupting conversation.  Pretty enthusiastic, but really kinda obnoxious.  And she pushed the Forrest Gump trivia crap on us too.  Then she came around again to ask us to buy their special credit card...  it was all in all too much.  Food was brought in a timely manner.  It was just that with the volume in the restaurant and the overly talkative waiter, it was not that pleasant.

But we did like the shrimp and the food... I guess I am getting too old for the noisy environment and all the bar scene going on with roudy people shouting at the top of their lungs.
author: Linda G.

description:
If you are in SF near Fisherman's Wharf, I would definitely recommend a visit. Some of the dishes on the menu are themed after the movie. I had the Dumb Luck Coconut Shrimp dish. The Cajun marmalade that it came with was a little too sweet for me, but overall the food was good.

This location gets a lot of business because its in a touristy area and has views of the bay...so be prepared to wait.
author: Kelvin M.

description:
Whenever we go to Pier 39, we always go to Bubba Gump. Not the best food in San Francisco, but a fun place to visit overall. There's a really nice view of the bay at this place and the service is always great. 

We always order the Coconut Shrimp which is delish, but a bit overpriced for something so simple. Be prepared to wait in line to be seated though since this is a tourist spot!
author: Frances B.

description: Foods is okay ,but we waited for one hour and thirty minutes for the food!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Chen M.

description: Bubba Gumps was really good! Personally, I am a shrimp lover so of course i'd love this place. There was a long wait but if you're in the area and have some time to spare check it out. We ordered the garlic bread appetizer (which was a good idea since the food took awhile) and we really liked it. Food tastes very fresh and well delicious. I recommend it :)
author: Teresa C.

description: What a joke. Let me start saying don't ever go there. First we checked in and we were told 15min wait. Okay we'll wait then our name called, great we got a table, then there is another line to wait to be seated, that was 30 more min wait, finally we were seated. Waiter walked by 3 times and said he'll be right with us and that was another 10 more min. He toook us orders. We order soup and some appetizers, we asked to have soups first, guess what we've got appetizers first, person who brought them had no clue about our soup orders. We sent them back. We turned red sign on, a waiter stoped, told him about soups he apologized turned around and start talking to someone else. He did not care or maybe didn't listen what we were saying to him. We flagged down our waiter, he apologized too and brought soups then we got our grease and cold appetizers, probably the ones they took it back. Over all careless service, bad food and worst attitude. We never ever go back and I'll suggest you shouldn't either. There are many other places around, I'm sure they have way better attitude and food and less waiting time.
author: A T.

description: The view alone would give this place a 5 stars but what made it go down was that it was freezing outside and they had the fans on. Other than that the food was good, servers were very attentive and the atmosphere was lively and fun. They stop by your table every couple min and try to brain test you with some forest gump trivia. All and all great place to come visit and have dinner.
author: Alberto L.

description:
Hi Yelpers,

My family and I finally had the opportunity to try this place out. Typically, we eat at the restaurants near the Fisherman's Grotto. I LOVE fish and chips and order it as often as I can. So naturally, that's what I ordered this evening. My husband ordered the fish tacos and my daughter ordered the traditional shimp cocktail. 

The fish and chips were overcooked and tasted very fried and were greasy. I'll let my husband yelp his own experience regarding the fish tacos. He wasn't raving about it afterwards, though. 

I think my biggest complaint was that we were constantly interrupted despite the "Run Forest Run" sign displayed at our table. One of the servers even stopped, brought a chair and sat by our table to asked us trivia questions about the movie Forrest Gump. We participated to be polite, but at the time we were trying to have a family discussion about something. If we weren't having that conversation, perhaps I wouldn't have been so miffed by it. 

We ended our dinner with the Alabama Mud Pie, which ended up to be a small ice cream cake. With mud pies, I'm used to tasting more peanut butter and caramel flavors. This one tasted more like vanilla ice cream with the idea of those elements. I would go back for the on a hot day, though, now that I know what to expect. 

I wouldn't eat a meal there unless someone else paid for it, and it wouldn't be my first recommendation choice for someone who wants to dine at Pier 39. If I do eat there again, I'll try the Shrimp Scampi. Who wants to take me? :)
author: Jenny S.

description: Wanted to get some claim chowder while I was in Fisherman's wharf since that's what all the talk is about. Ended getting it here and all I can say is I've had better out of a can. Don't even waste your money here its disgusting and over priced.
author: Lex C.

description: We came here on a recommendation from my mom. They were pretty expensive but the food was good. The staff is very friendly and I loved our waiter. He played trivia with us at our table which was really fun. Overall, a great experience!
author: Tara T.

description:
The atmosphere is a bit hectic for me (wasn't Forrest Gump a simple man??) but it can be appreciated, especially the creative way to get your server's attention through signage.

The food was satisfying, and although I wouldn't make this a constant go-to place for seafood, it is convenient when you're starving at Pier 39 and want to sit down to a decent meal.
author: Connie M.

description: I love the food and atmosphere. Just slow service but it was packed in there and I received stale fries with my Forrest favorite but I got a new batch as the kitchen was closing and almost every customer was gone. So.... The freshly fried fries were so good. I had ordered forest #1 favorite and it was OK. I'm not a fan of their beer battered almost anything but I personally liked the hush puppies my sister didn't like them. I liked the first taste of the shrimp and fish strips but the after taste I didn't like. So overall I would definitely go here again never go by yourself this place is only good with other people. But they also play the movie over and over again for what ever reason. I get it but They should play other stuff like music videos and sports from that era. or even other movies from that time or about that time. But they seriously have like 20 TVs with the same movie. Like its not like we can hear it. .........But also portion sizes are to small for the price. The pictures on the menu are mis leading
author: Chelsea C.

description: Just 3 stars. Not that anything was bad. But, with all the hype about this place I thought it would taste much better. It was a bit to noisy for me. Overall, food was ok.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
It was just OK, and the food not only took awhile to get to us, but it was certainly on the colder side. 
I was hoping to experience better.
author: Kim G.

description: Im an all around bay gal; & the 1st time i went w.my bf after a giants game ( it wasnt that crowded ) & we waited for our server & got our drinks & ordered our food which took more than 40 minutes to bring to the table; so good thing we got an appetizer but still left us hungry for more. Im sorry but even tho the server was trying to help stall us a table of 4 came after & got there food quicker than we did. Not ever come here ever again!!
author: Ivy S.

description:
Food wasn't  as good as the Bubba Gump's in Monterey. Great view of the Bay and Alcatraz from our table though. 
I ordered the Bucket of Boat trash. The lobster claws were OK, but everything else was too deep fried. I also ordered the Premium Margarita and it was mostly mixer.

If you're a tourist, it's OK .But the mediocre food quality, we won't be back.
author: Joel C.

description:
WOW ive had this place for my pf pic and i never reviewd it... yelper faaaaill..
ok so im not from sf and the drive here IS A @()$*()(@)#*%(*%_
but the place was great to walk around at. its a great place for a date or if you and a group of friends wanna go siteseeing. The people here are friendly as hell, but the food was a bit overrated. lots of seafood, but the flavor was bland, kinda lame. and its crazy overpriced. I can see why people say its a tourist trap... we even got the expensive seafood feast or banquet or whatever it was called. it was like every type of seafood in one, and we got bags of crawfish. everything was miniature and did NOT fill me up. but it did hurt my bank account. its a nice place to relax and have a beer at. but i would not come here hungry, or u will leave here broke
author: Albert W.

description: Gross deep fried tourist food. Awful. Take it from a Louisianan, this is chain of horrid restaurants does not represent real Cajun food.  Then again, I suppose people don't go to a gimmicky restaurant in the middle of tourist town for the food.
author: Chelsea D.

description:
I've been here several times, each time with tourists/foreigners. I don't think any local in their right mind would actually pay so much for mediocre food. 

Since I'm not really into fried seafood (other than my beloved fish & chips), I feel like everything is too greasy for my liking. I've tried the Calamari, Popcorn Shrimp, Bubba's Far Out Dip, Captain's Fish & Chips, and Scampi. Everything tasted good, but occasionally had too much salt or batter/breading. Again, I wouldn't come here just for the food.

Anyone who loves Forrest Gump has to go to Bubba Gump at least once in their lifetime (I predict that Bubba Gump will close down in 30 years because the movie will have become obsolete, and those who do know of it will be too old and die of blocked arteries the moment they breathe inside the restaurant.) They really play up the whole Forrest Gump theme with license plates, quotes, and other misc. memorabilia on tables and walls. They also loop the movie on their TV's, which I've always thought was a nice touch. Another thing they do really well is birthday celebrations - they make you stand on a chair and they scream/sing their little happy birthday song so everyone else can hear and join in.

Since this one is located right at the Wharf (which is a prime tourist spot), the wait is always astronomical - and they don't take reservations! It's really noisy inside, and service is pretty slow because of all the people. I'm actually trying to avoid coming here again because 2-3 times is enough.
author: Katie M.

description:
Tried here my first time, I saw Bubba Gump in Hollywood too and I thought, why not give it a shot~

And I soon regretted......I ordered a bucket of steamed clams and shrimps, to be honest, it tastes nothing special and look boring ......The only good thing suddenly is because the portion is in fact small ......

I think spending $60 for lunch should at least get me and my girlfriend some qualify food experience but I was wrong~

She was so disappointed and dragged me away....lol....
author: Jerry Z.

description:
5 star nod on a double date with our favorite couple. We wanted to go out to celebrate Brian's 21st birthday. When we asked what they wanted to eat, Brian and Ana both said simultaneously "a bucket of shrimp from Bubba Gump!" Whoa there now! Weird couple synchronization going on. Well, if two people can recommend it at the same time, then their bucket of shrimp must be good!

And it definitely was worth the trek out from the East Bay! Those shrimp soaking in Cajun saucy goodness made for a surprisingly tasty and fulfilling meal. We also ordered garlic cheese bread to dip in the Cajun sauce the shrimp were marinating in. So delish! We washed our meals down with pints of beers that also came with their complementary glasses, which made for a great souvenir.

Overall, Bubba Gumps made for a great double date spot. We'll be back again!
author: Grace L.

description:
I have loved this place since I lived in LBC - and would go there all the time - So being able to visit the bay and enjoying the awesomeness that is Bubba Gump - NOM NOM NOM my friends!

They need to build here in WA. or in Portland OR ASAP!!!!!  I need you!!!!
author: Alexander D.

description: This is a really fun place to eat, but the food isn't that tasty :)
author: Melanie B.

description: I was expecting something way better. This place its ok, the food can be much better, they also take a while to bring out your food, there is lots and lots of tourist and it can get very loud.
author: Erika M.

description: Ok...I know this is a chain restaurant but let me just say for the record...I have never had a bad meal here at this Bubba Gumps and the service has always been good. On this particular trip we went on our first night in San Francisco. I ordered the "I'm Stuffed Shrimp" with a Caesar salad. The dish was excellent (I liked it so much that we came back a week later and I had the same thing. Second time was still good but not quite as good as the first). My wife had the Bourbon Street Mahi-Mahi. She found it delicious. We topped it off with a Chocolate Chip Cookie Sunday. I felt kind of like the name of my entree...I was stuffed but happy!
author: Bill W.

description: Came here today with a group of 7. Received excellent service and was pretty impressed with our food. I had very low expectations thinkin this was just another over hyped tourist chain. My husband and I split the popcorn shrimp appetizer and it was very good. And I really liked the dipping sauces it came with. I got the soup n salad combo, the clam chowder and a house salad. The house salad was nothing special but the clam chowder was actually rather good. The rest of our group ordered various shrimp and fish dishes and all enjoyed their selections. I would Definately go back and this one has a great view of the bay!
author: Miss K.

description:
Lunch at Bubba's at Pier 39 was about what you would expect. The restaurant was pretty noisy and busy...but then again it was a gorgeous Saturday on the SF Bay.  

Hostess told us a table would be ready in 10-20 minutes, and it was more like 40 but we were okay with that. The food is typical of Bubbas- good quality but high priced (we both had the Dixie Fishwich).  The woman who sat us was a little presumptive and rude, but the waiter was friendly enough.  

Agree with what someone else said- it does have a great view of the bay!
author: Amy M.

description: Service was horrible. We came to celebrate 2 birthdays. It took over an hour to seat us which was expected as it was a Sunday around 5pm- I understand its busy on Sundays. After we are seated they take our orders. My mother and I both have fish allergies so we substituted it for more shrimp which we were told was fine. Of course they end up bringing out fish which my mom confused for chicken strips. Luckily we had some Benadryl to combat her reaction. We send it back and wait another probably 45 minutes to receive our meals. I never received mine (we ordered the same thing and they only ordered one over again)so I told the manager never mind. They forgot to place my daughters order so she waited an entire 2 hours to be fed. Everyone had eaten by the time she received her meal. The manager expressed his apologies but I will never come back as it was just way too disorganized and busy for me. The food is just ok anyways. I feel like for the amount you pay, you should receive much larger portions and appetizer portions. This is about my 3rd time coming here and each time the service is below par. But this time was by far the worst. NEVER AGAIN. They did take our meals off the bills but I still was thoroughly OUTDONE with how horrible the service was.
author: Kimberly L.

description: My husband & I always have the Cajun Shrimper's Heaven, the Bourbon Street MahiMahi, Angus top Sirloin & Mama's bread pudding. Wow the bread pudding is amazingly good. Try Lt.Dan w/extra shot very good cocktail. I've brought my family, my clients & my employees here & they all love it.
author: E G.

description: We went for an early lunch on Sunday in the summer. We were seated right away as the crowds hadn't come in yet and got a table with a nice view. Our server David was wonderful. Great combination of fun and professional. My husband and I ordered a drink in a souvenir glass for $12 each just because the glass was so darn cute. All our food came out as ordered and was surprisingly better than expected. I thought this touristy place would have great food but I was completely satisfied. My husband had fried chicken and I had the boat. I was about to leave my 5 star review when I got home and opened up my souvenir glasses and noticed they were not what we were promised what so ever. We should have checked it out before we left instead of taking their word on it. But I specifically said "the only reason I'm ordering this drink is for the stupid is as stupid does glass". And then I got some basic glass with nothing on it? And the drink wasn't worth $12 either!! And now I'm sad about that.
author: Stacie C.

description: So happy with Bubba Gump.  We had Leasley tonight and she is so amazing.  I was so happy she got a 30% tip.  Thank you for the best and kindest service I have had in years!!!!
author: Joel S.

description: Went here for the 1st time about two weeks ago. Went on the rocket boat, to the aquarium and got a piercing and to top it all off went to Bubba Gumps to settle my nerves. Was the best food I had in a long time. Cant remember the name of the dish but had my favorite; shrimp, sausage, potatoes and a tasty sauce. My server LisaMary was a super friendly Irish girl and was always smiling. She was good fun, interacted with us the perfect amount of time and always made sure we were 100% satisfied with everything. I recommend this place for great food, great view and a great atmosphere! Peace out yawl.
author: Ber M.

description:
Sunday night dinner with the family :)
We were told the wait was 75 minutes, but only waited about 20 minutes.
Excellent customer service, everyone here has a great personality +
Food was great, we had the Shrimper's Net Catch, half garlic and half cajun.. very tasty. We also decided to try the Shrimp & Crab Bisque.... it was just ok.. not enough flavor. Pasta was good.
Great view
author: Vero G.

description: One star because they show the movie Forrest Gump on a loop.. Another star cause the waiter was nice... That's it.. The food kinda sucked.. Way better options if ur in the City
author: Kevin C.

description:
A bit of an overrated tourist trap at Pier 39. My friend wanted to go here because she had been to a Bubba Gump in Cancun and remembered the food as being good. After eating here she commented that the food was much better at the Cancun location. 

Our food was way too pricey for both the amount of food we got and the low quality of our food. For some reason I thought Bubba Gump was a company that had been around before the movie Forrest Gump came out, but apparently it was inspired by the movie instead. If you ask me they take the theme a bit too far and the final end effect is a very cheesy themed restaurant that puts more emphasis on the theme than the food. 

At the end of the day, let's face it, a restaurant is about the food. While my service here was great, my server can't make up for the fact that I spent $20 on food I hated. Sorry Bubba but I won't be back. As Forrest would say, 'stupid is as stupid does' and I would be stupid to come back here and waste my money again.
author: Saliha B.

description:
My boyfriend had recommended we visit Bubba Gump's when we were planning out places to visit on our romantic holiday to San Francisco. We both love shrimp and I was more attracted to the girly drink menu than he was. 

When we first stepped in the restaurant, it reminded me of a bunch of other family friendly eateries. Staff is nice, memorabilia EVERYWHERE, solid food. 

We ordered were both starving and started off with the Shrimper's Net Catch and Mama Gump's Garlic Bread Basket. We weren't sure which was better: the Cajun Spices or the Garlic Butter sauce. The nice waitress split the sauces for us. It's pretty hard to screw up shrimp and Bubba Gump's did an awesome job. The sauces weren't too salty and the garlic bread was available to mop up all the leftover saucey goodness. 

Apparently our eyes were bigger than our stomachs because we both ordered entrees. I had the shrimp linguine and my guy ordered the Shrimper's Heaven. My pasta dish was delicious. Simple, not overdressed with sauce. My guy seemed to have enjoyed his mondo shrimp basket. 

The only con: the portions! The hotel we were staying at didn't have a mini-fridge and I felt bad for leaving the 3/4 of my pasta dish behind. Moral of the story: come hungry and ready to eat. 

I've read some of the other reviews and had a hard time understanding why people were so bummed out about Bubba Gump's. Yes, it's going to be expensive because you're by the water. I honestly thought the prices were reasonable. Besides, the hostess tells you to stand under the "Stop Forrest Stop" sign when you first get there. Hellerrr?! You know it's not going to be high class dining experience. Relax, order a huge drink and get messy!
author: Galang B.

description:
My friends were visiting from Georgia today. They invited me to go to the restaurant. I had a BBQ burger which was okay... The food is so so. It's a seafood place which is notch above Red Lobster. My friend talked about how she could make better clams and mussels. It's seafood for tourists more or less.

I gotta say, this was a fun place to hang out. All of the waiters there are clearly FABULOUS and I am not referring to the service. My waiter was a muscular guy, who I almost wanted to tip more for putting up with us. Yes, I was pretending to be a tourist today. Every guy in there looked like they were pulled straight out of the Castro. Nice looking guys, but not a chance in hell with them.
author: Lana P.

description: Went here for my bday when we were down in SF.  The service was good and they were really nice.  I asked to substitute veggies for rice and they had no problem with it.  My only complaint was that the portions were really small. I ordered the bucket of crab, shrimp and lobster and I got two crab legs, one lobster claw and 4 shrimp for $27.  The drinks were tasty but not that strong, it touristy and well established.
author: Rachel B.

description: Really impressed how my poor experience was addressed. A big company like Bubba Gumps wouldn't have to care about every bad experience, but they reached out to me on multiple platforms and apologized. Thanks Bubba Gumps! We will be back.
author: Alyssa L.

description:
My review haiku:

Dinner here's like a 
Box of choc'lates: You nevuh
Know what you're gonna get
author: Austin M.

description:
2nd time being here. Took them forever to seat us even though they said we cold get a table immediately. Our waiter was nice and friendly. 

Only downside of this place is the price. I like all the forrest gump designs inside, esp the quotes on the wall. The gift shop has cool stuff too. Overall, mainly for tourists. I've been to the location in Long Beach by the aquarium too. 

Think either they should lower the costs or give more food. I got the shrimp tacos which were meh. My friend enjoyed the free refills on her hot chocolate though.
author: Christine C.

description: Came with my wife to have a awesome lunch since it's the place to come when visiting San Francisco.. I been here many times, but it was going to be my wife's first time.. we order our food and yes it was good but as we sat there enjoying our food 20mnts into our great lunch the waitress asked, if we wanted to take care of the bill already.. I told her in a bit because we might order a drink.. so she left, 5 minutes later she asked again "would you like to take care of the bill"?.. I said no in a little bit she is still indecisive about getting a drink..  well she asked again 2 minutes later.. so as we planed what we were going to do next the waitress came again and asked now will you take care of the bill.. and we said yes give us a minute.. we'll then she left but then I notice she went to talk to a guy and he came to the table and said, "you guys are done"?.  Will you like to take care of the bill now??. Then I got upset and asked why have you guys asked about the bill like 5 times we have only been here no more than 30 minutes?  He said I am the manager and the reason we asked it's because people order and just leave!!! Well I told him it's sad you think that about us we have never left without paying and that is no way to approach or treat a customer.. I got up and payed and told him well that's our last time here.. it seem like he didn't care that we left upset.  The worst experience.. we will never come here again!!!
author: Jose G.

description: Worst service I've ever experienced . Asian lady was too concerned providing the tables on the outside of ours , good customer service to get that tip. Spent $70 here just for two people to get service like we were at freakin McDonald's . She didn't bring our sons drink out then later came back with a styrofoam Dixie cup with apple juice in it claiming they had no kids cups when I was looking straight at them. Never once said thank you not even when the bill was brought, didn't get any refills but she sure made sure to ask if I wanted a dollar refill on my drink that wasn't water. I'll never step foot in this place again. Made a complaint hoping to get my hard earned money back for the crappy service , to just be told they'll take care of "some " of the bill if I ever go back. I'll be calling corporate next or It looks like I'm out of 70 dollars and a bad taste in my mouth. Bravo bubba gumps :).
author: Vincent S.

description: A wonderfully fun experience! The view of the bridge is sparkling and gorgeous along the entire span of windows. I wouldn't recommend the garlic bread, as it was overpriced for what it was. But the gingerbread margarita was AMAZING ( best margarita I've EVER had) & it comes in a souvenir shaker :)
author: Alyssa L.

description:
Just as I expect any corporate restaurant would rate in taste..3 stars. I had the fish in lobster sauce that was a bit bland; fried calamari was typical..nothing special. 

I have to say the service while we waited was abominable! The host was soo rude especially to this Italian lady who was obviously a tourist & spoke minimal English. She merely asked her if she can walk around the pier or if she had to stay while she waited & the host was extremely rude. Told the host lady didn't speak English & her response was: 'I don't have time for this.' my thinking is: you chose to work in the city...that is very popular for it's tourism...so that is not an excuse.
author: Paige J.

description: If I could give no stars I would. This place has OK food, but when it is busy and you're sitting at the bar area DO NOT GO HERE! Their service blows! I came with my girlfriend for her birthday lunch. And not only did we have multiple servers! But it took them about 45 minutes to complete our service they suck!!!!
author: Marco F.

description:
Came with a field trip as a large banquet.  They were so organized, speedy, accomodating, and patient.  

Even with the large quantities being ordered, the food was delicious and we didn't have to wait long - which was nice since we had about 20 kids!
author: Theresa W.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants to visit in SF. I'm a really big fan. You must try the 'I'm Stuffed Shrimp' and the 'Shrimp Dippin' Broth' - both are my favorites! The clam chowders tastes good, but I've had better. 

The only con about this place is the prices. 2 people can easily rack up a $50 or more check so you got to be prepared or be sure to bring a sugar-mama with you.
author: Mosheem K.

description:
Our party came in to have lunch after our tour of San Francisco.  We were all hungry but rushed to catch our 2:00 ferry to Alcatraz.  We let the waiter know of the time constraint and he did a fantastic job by providing us a very fast, yet friendly service.

It was a crowded Thursday afternoon and we wanted to experience the authenticity of real San Fran Shrimp.  Bubba Gumps was a perfect spot to go!  

The drinks were good and the food was yummy.  We especially liked their coconut shrimp.  We didn't order much because we were snacking throughout the day, but what we did order was fantastic (except for the uncooked cocktail shrimp...not a big fan of that).  All of our orders were family style and everyone had a little of each dish. 

I will probably update my review when I can actually experience this place more properly and without time constraints.  Overall, we enjoyed our frood and the service was exceptional!
author: Aman G.

description: Well first let me start with the service was pretty good. Our server checked in on us often and was very friendly. That was probably the best part about this place. I came with my husband and kids. The kids meals are over priced. 5.99 and they don't even come with a drink. I ordered the cajun shrimp the flavor wasn't bad but the shrimp were pretty small and a tad over cooked. My husband ordered the mahi mahi with mash potatoes and shrimp. The fish was dry, shrimp small as we'll best part about the dish were the potatoes. Probably not worth the dishes 19.99 price tag. We also got the Lt. Dans pomegranate drink (alcoholic beverage) which was a total let down you could tell it had hardley any alcohol in it and the glass was so full of ice you didn't get much of the drink it's self. Overall not a great experience here. Next time were at the peer we will probably be eating somewhere else.
author: Kelly Q.

description: The Applebees of seafood, with a 100% markup because of the location.  A loud place, with a very large menu.  I don't really remember what was good/bad on the menu though.
author: Mike L.

description: The food is good. The service kinda fast and ok. The place is crowded all the time. The place is avg. size.
author: Nick S.

description:
My husband and I have never been to Bubba Gump's and so we stopped to eat dinner. We stopped at the front and there were 3 employees talking to each other and laughing and didn't even acknowledge us. We saw a line so we thought we were supposed to stand in line until we were seated. After 45 minutes we got to the front and one of the employees brought a bunch of menus up and just dropped them in a trough like holder. It was loud and he acted like he didn't want to even be there. My husband and I thought that was rude. Then the gal asked how many was in our party and I said, "Two."
She asked the name and I told her. I saw her looking for the name and I asked her if we were supposed to have a reservation. She said that we were supposed to tell them at the front. I told her about our experience up front. My husband and I left. When a company has a bunch of very young people working for them they need to tell them that the first impression starts with the employees at the front. The front staff needs to stop screwing off and pay attention to the customer. Maybe the other staff could at least pretend that they care about the customers and act like they want to work there because there are a lot of unemployed people that would gladly take their place.
author: Dameita S.

description: I came here with my family. Last time we had been here was 6 years ago. The food was awful. I do not recommend eating here. Everyone was disappointed with their meals. The fish tacos were cold. The shrimp net was not seasoned well. Gumbo had barely anything in it. Fish burger had no flavor. We will not be returning to eat here.
author: Mar L.

description:
I absolutely regret going here! This was probably the WORST dining experience i've ever had! My boyfriend and i have been to bubba gump before, in Kona HI. It was one of the best dinning experiences I've ever had, they were so friendly! And asked you forest gump trivia. 
THIS bubba gump on the other hand told us it would be a 5-10 minute wait, it was seated, then they sent us up a ramp and made us stand there for 20 more minutes! We were about to leave when they finally seated us when here were more than 1/2 the restraunt filled with empty tables! 
They either never put in my drink order or they forgot about it, we never saw our server until we were just about done eating and i told him i never got my drink but never mind on it because im done eating. He tried to offer it 1/2 priced. I was done eating! Why would i want to hang around and just drink my drink for 1/2 an hour? My boyfriends shrimp were not fully fried. and $17! for like 5 shrimp and a basket of fries?! jesus!
Then there was a huge mixup with the bill where the waiter took the money i put towards the bill as tip and brought me a new bill! I have no clue how that makes any sense! Its safe to say that will be our last stop here.
author: Caitlin L.

description:
Very good service. People are friendly attentive timely.  The view and decor also are also quite amazing. Where it all breaks down is the quality and healthiness of the food. Bottom line is that it is chain quality seafood. Most things are fried, oily or drowning in gallons of butter. Just put a cork in my arteries and avoid the cost of the meal. It's not even good unhealthy food.

San Francisco is blessed with many many good seafood restaurants. Don't waste a meal on this despite the view and service.
author: Eric W.

description: Watch out for the deceitful wait times. When you arrive you will be given an approximate wait time, when your name is called it does not mean your table is ready, it means you have to come in from waiting and wait in line standing on a ramp for the staff to find a table for you as it becomes available, clean it and finally seat you down. Several names at a time are called at once to come into ramp area so this allowed 2 other parties that signed in way after me but were waiting closer to ramp to get ahead of me in line extending our wait time even more.  My family of 5 we were given an aproximate time of 30 minutes and we sat down at our table 1 hour 30 minutes later. People complain to staff right and left and managers walk around oblivious to their staff's attempt at resolving issues. We have been to many Bubba Gumps always had to wait our fair share and had been ok with it. This restaurant is trying to reinvent the wheel with this 2 wait system. Good luck out there.
author: George E.

description: I really enjoyed my lunch here.   There was about a 15 minute wait which was OK with  me. The place is right over the bay and I could see the water even though our table was not near the window.  The service was excellent.  Our server quizzed us on our knowledge of the movie Forest Gump  which I knew a little about. My fish and frys were good and my brothers shrimp dinner looked good. I learned you flipped these  license plates for service which comes very fast.  This is a very busy place so be prepared  for a wait and noise.  I would definitely go back
author: marian c.

description:
Returned here exactly a year later during a trip to SF, and i was pleasantly surprised at how different the experience was,
Delicious food, average pricing, and a great atmosphere,  RUN FOREST RUN!
author: TJ B.

description:
I been coming here for years now & their costumer service varies...sometimes it's fantastic, great & blah!!!

The food is about average, my favorites are the Po' Boy sandwich & the Fried Chicken plate. Although I was disappointed they took the tower onion rings off the menu.

If you are lucky to get a table by the window during the day, the view of the bay is awesome! 

The down fall is pier 39 is such a tourist attraction, Bubba Gump's is always packed and loud. I now go after 8 for a late dinner
author: Benny S.

description: To be honest, I'm kinda surprised this place has 3 stars. It's my favorite place to eat on Pier 39. I'm a huge fan of seafood and was pretty impressed about what I ordered. I also like the ambiance, and the seating next to the window that gives a beautiful view. The down side is going on the weekends because chances are there might be a 1-2 hour wait, like any other restaurant though. I've usually gone on the week days so I've gotten lucky with immediate seating and service.
author: Jamie J.

description: I have good memories here because it's one of the first restaurants my fiance took me when we started dating. I remember it was really busy that time we went. When we were finally seated I ordered maha fish with mash potatoes and he ordered fish and chips. I also had a blue alcoholic drink - it was gi-normous! I had fun chatting it up. My food was pretty good, nothing memorable.  It's a very busy and touristy restaurant since it's in the middle of the pier where everyone is walking around.
author: Razel C.

description:
I will definitely come here again because of one reason... Nicole!

She was the best! I came early to reserve for a party of 12 and she was more than happy to seat us as soon as our party was all there. She still put us on the list as first in line even though they were still seating smaller parties that came before us. There was huge miscommunication with the rest of my party that we ended up almost missing our table. But Nicole was so patient with me even though I came up to her about billion times! She sat us and we were very much appreciative because we had a concert to go to. 

Thank you Nicole!
author: Gabrielle M.

description:
It's fun, friendly, and the scenery is great. I love that the waitress and waiters play trivia games with the guests! It makes you have just much more fun. Their pina colada drink is great. 

But the real reason why my boyfriend and I go is so we can have their chocolate cookie chip sundae. A warm, fresh baked Chocolate Chip Cookie topped with Vanilla Ice Cream, Caramel, Chocolate, Peanuts, and Whipped Cream. With chocolate syrup too. We can never have enough of it! They should box that stuff!
author: Flower P.

description: I love the movie and the restaurant is just as good. It's always a fun night when I go to bubba gumps. The mahi mahi with mango salsa or something was divine. The I'm stuffed shrimp with jasmin rice is one of my favorite dishes. I love the trivia questions the servers ask about the movie. Overall bubba gumps is a great time for food and fun
author: Roger P.

description: Shrimps are the must have over here. I had the "All stuffed Shrimp" which had crab meat stuffed inside the shrimp and it was really good. I would definitely love to go back to this place and try out their other dishes. !
author: Sriram S.

description: Outstanding food for both myself and my wife. Very impressed with how nice the wait staff is. Shrimp was perfectly cooked in every dish ordered. Excellent garlic and cajun hot peel and eat shrimp. Mommas garlic bread was to die for. Shrimp scampi was outstanding. My mixed ship meal was awsome. The mixed drinks were perfectly made.
author: Jeremiah S.

description: Was there with the family last night. We were told it would be an hour and 20 minutes to an hour and a half wait. The little sheet of paper said 1 1/2 hours. We had 5 adults and two kids, one that needed a high chair. It was pretty cold, but we figured we would wait (outside because there is nowhere to wait inside). I checked back about an hour into the wait and was told just ten more minutes. After two hours and repeating the just 10-15 more minutes thing twice more, they finally sent the text. If we would have known it was  going to be that long we would have gone somewhere else. On our way in we grabbed a booster and a high chair, yes we grabbed them because the staff didn't offer to do so.  When we got to our table it couldn't accommodate a high chair. The hostess said if we wanted to wait she could get us another table, but we had another place to be and didn't think we could wait another hour with a two-year-old. The only reasons I am not doing one star is our server (Tori) was great and rushed our order out and the food was really pretty good.
author: Craig H.

description: Do not go there and pay with your debit card, They will steal your identity and your card numbers. Someone who lives or went to Foster City, Ca. used mine. I am furious that this place hires thieves!!!
author: S W.

description: This visit to Bubba Gump could not have been better than this one. We were in San Francisco via BART for legal matters. Decided to taxi it down to Pier 39 and discovered that the America's Cup was just about to begin its race. We watched the first race outside but then decided to get lunch. We had not planned on watching the second race but the host at Bubba Gump Shrimp Co sat us at a window seat. We got to enjoy watching the second race and eating some off the hook shrimp!!!!!!!!!
author: Roger W.

description: love the food. their chowder is the best. fish and chips hits the spot. coconut shrimp was delicious. ive been here twice first time the wait was 40mins and second time it was only 15mins. very nice view of the bay. the place is packed with tourists. staff was very friendly AND i got a free desert for my bday!  will definitely come back again.
author: Vince N.

description: Just like EVERYTHING in San Francisco, this restaurant is pretty expensive.
author: David W.

description: Our server was Conner. Friendly and gives great sevice!  Checked up on us throughout our meal & made sure we were enjoying ourselves. I waitress too thanks for the awesome experience. I loved the calamari and the Accidental mahi
author: Yvonne M.

description: My family and I arrived 15 mins til closing.  The food was great, our waiter was awesome and the view was breathtaking. We will definitely be back next year.
author: Ebony D.

description: Loved the location and all shrimp menu. The staff came and sat at our table to play trivia games with us and the movie was playing throughout the restaurant. They had cute run forest run or stop forest stop signs so that you could get help whenever you needed. Altogether a fun and yummy experience.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Here I am, on Pier 39 during one of those rare moments when my whole family can get together to visit me in San Francisco, looking for somewhere to just get a beer. We're not picky people, all we want is a beer with a decent view, so somehow we ended up at Bubba Gump. The idea was great, the experience was terrible. Here's the main points:L

1). First impressions really do matter. When we got there, there was some serious mis-communication going on between our group and the wait staff to grab a table. At first it looked like we were going to be by the window - perfect! The waiter walked over, there was a perfect table to fit 8 right there being cleaned up, but no... no no... you have to go forward to the "stop forest, stop" sign first, something completely unclear to us. I recognize that perhaps there was a moment of confusion, but this first impression set the tone for the rest of our experience.

2). Hidden costs. We got 1 fancy cock-tail (which was actually ok), which comes with a free glass, and 6 large beers, served in the same glasses which you have a hidden fee- you're buying those glasses. Again, miscommunication by the wait staff; it isn't clear to us whether ordering these you're buying the glass or not. We did get this cleared up, and saved $28 bucks on glasses by not taking them home (through talking with the manager).

3). Shrimp was mediocre at best. I thought I'd be getting super fresh tasting, delicious shrimp, since it is Bubba Gump SHRIMP Co. It wasn't fresh, the flavors were far from bold or exciting, we didn't even finish the plate (and as 8 people sharing, thats a pretty big deal).

Conclusions: I have nothing against chains, there are some that I really enjoy, but this just isn't one of them. Forrest Gump, great movie, Bubba Gump, terrible restaurant. I'll be doing my best to never return.
author: Phil C.

description:
If you're in SF, you have to go here. 
The food is delicious.
You need to see the movie first and then you feel like you're in Disneyland. It's all so clever and humorous. It's hip. It's fun! I always come here when I'm in the city. Also the waiters act like they get paid 50 bucks an hour because they are so much fun.

I really don't like how long the wait is, but it's a popular place, so that happens. It's also REALLY loud. And it's a tad expensive

Otherwise the best.
author: Maria P.

description: This is my favorite restaurant on Pier 39. The food and the service are always amazing. They have a great view of Alcatraz. And most of the servers ask you Forrest Gump trivia questions while you wait. It's a really fun experience.
author: Courtney L P.

description: YUCK. It made Forrest Gump seem bad. The food was nasty and not worth the money. You were paying for the view.
author: Sarah B.

description: If you feel like being nickel and dimed for mediocre food at best come to Bubba Gump. I won't be back. Run Forrest Run! Far far away!
author: Jonathan A.

description: located in the back of pier 39.  a huge tourist attraction, pretty much the new hard rock cafe when it comes to chain sit downs.  a pretty big lively place.  gets super crowded by noon so come early.  all forest gump themed.  waiters are fun and full of forest gump trivia.  they are all nice and friendly.  sat right away and accommodated for a baby with ease.  prices are a bit pricey, about $20 per plate but hey its a tourist area.  rent is probably really high.  and theres a full bar with plenty of good speciality cocktails.  shrimp shrimp shrimp! all pretty tasty.  a fun place for groups.  tvs showing forest gump.  overall fun for the shrimp lovers.  just bring plenty of $$$.
author: Matthew G.

description:
Momma always said that life was like a box of chocolates, you never know what you're going to get. 

But you always know what you are going to get at this Forest Gump themed restaurant. The food is consistently good and for the touristy pier 39 area the prices are really good. There are some great widow seats with fantastic views and the waiters won't come bother you unless you flip the sign to tell them to do so. 

I nearly always try to find something a little more original and authentic but every once in a while I just crave this place!

Yum!
author: Jay K.

description:
Another lovely tourist trap located at Pier 39. The service was good, and the food wasn't horrible, but after peeking at my check at the end of the meal... Yes, it was that bad.

The prices are tourist-ly overpriced. It's a cute place to eat and hang out, but really, not worth the money. If you're a local, then save yourself a trip. Rent Forrest Gump, stick a tray of popcorn shrimp into the toaster oven and call it the night.
author: Sara K.

description:
Pier 39 is always a fun place to be.  Lots of people, lots of food, and lots of little cool souvenirs.  Bubba Gump is located at the deeper end of the pier.

I've been to the one in Monterey few times but this one was my first.  We went there at 3PM on a Sunday afternoon.  People were waiting for their table and we were told 20 minutes for our table.  We were pretty hungry and weren't in need of a view by the window so we went to the bar section and sat at one of the open table.  Tables at the bar area are first-come-first-served, like lots of other places, hehe... which was pretty cool  =)

Cocktail called "Mama's Favorite" for $9.95.  It comes with a take home 'Logo Hurricane' souvenir glass.  The souvenir glass itself is $7.99 online, hehe... so basically you're paying $2 for the drink.  Even lemonade costs $3.95.  WHAT A DEAL!!!  Here's how it work - When you're done with your drink, you leave the dirty glass on the table.  Take the receipt to the shop across from the restaurant entrance, show them the receipt and they will give you a brand new, wrapped 'Logo Hurricane' glass to take home.  Sweet deal or what?  =)

BOAT TRASH ($18.99) - I recommend this one.  It has deep-fried shrimps, slipper lobsters, and mahi mahi dusted with cajun spices and served with fries.  Very yummy  =)   I ordered that everytime.  

FISH & CHIPS ($11.99) - pretty good.  

FRIED CHICKEN ($14.29) - I didn't taste it but the plate was empty so I'm guessing it was good too, hehe...

CLAM CHOWDER ($4.50), for a cup - It was the ONLY type of soup they offered , hmmm, not too bad, but I prefer if they had more options.  I figure if they only offer one type of soup, it should really give you that 'WOW' about it, and it was just okay for me...
author: Adrienne K.

description: Overpriced small portions.  Not impressed at all.  We had better food at a take out place on pier 39.
author: Molly G.

description: The food is always great when I come here and the staff are very knowledgeable. My mother loved the trivia and the view of the bay! The hush puppies and Jenny's catch are my favorite!
author: Danielle V.

description: I've been here several times before, but I thought I'd just finally write a review for BG's, as well as a very helpful tip (so read on). First off, if you're a fan of the film Forest Gump, then you're certainly going to enjoy this place. Everything in the restaurant is themed toward the movie. Everything from memorabilia replicas, a 24/hr loop of the film, a gift shop, food names, and even a daily film quiz competition against you and the table next to you. Because of the popularity of the film and restaurant, expect the place to constantly be busy. It is definitely a tourist spot, which means only one thing... high prices. Yes, the food is pretty expensive, so here's the advice I have to offer: order the Shrimper's Net Catch (either the 2/3 for two people or the 1 1/3 for more people) and then order sides like fries. This saves you a lot of money and you get plenty of food. Other than that, the place is exactly what it seems to be. It's a fun place to go for a birthday, but be prepared to be the center of attention. I'll leave that part to your imagination. The food is pretty good. I do love the coconut shrimp. For kids, they can order a kids meal in which the food comes in a fun shaped box that resembles Forest Gump's shrimp boat, The Jenny. Unlike Forest Gump's experience, the food does not taste like cigarettes (A little bit of film reference never hurt). Enjoy!
author: Eric M.

description:
We had family visiting us, so of course you have to head to Pier 39.  We made the choice to go to Bubba Gumps..the food was good, so I would give the food 3-4 stars but the rest of our experience overshadowed everything else.
Our waitress kept checking on us when we did not need to be checked on, but was never anywhere when we needed her. Then they got busy and it was impossible to get her to deliver check, we had to ask someone else. Check was delivered and it took sooo long for her to come get credit cards that we, once again, had to stop another server to help us. We felt bad as we were not the other servers responsibility.

 After our cards were taken, we wait longer than ever. We all became so grumpy and annoyed at this point, until finally she comes over and says their systems crashed and they need to enter everything manually. I understand systems go down and things go wrong, but please let us know while we are painfully awaiting your return with our credit cards. We must have waited 15 min (more) and a manager came by to apologize (Victor) and we asked for some type of discount (somewhat jokingly yet somewhat serious) and he politely refused, which is bad customer service(he offered to refill our sodas)

Finally we sign off for the bill and head out rolling our eyes..The next day my sister in law discovers her card has been charged 3 times!!! The bill was $87 and with tip she approved $100 charge on her card. Lo and behold, they charged $274 after all three charges together. That was monday, she calls Bubba Gump's on tuesday. Today is friday and the matter has still not been resolved. She was supposed to get a call back yesterday and never did so she had to call them herself today. The person she spoke with said it will have to wait until monday when the banks open..Can you imagine, If someone had no money and could only afford the dinner, not the three charges they mistakenly made, then they would be out of luck (and money) for one week due to Bubba Gump's diligence? My sister in law said they did not even seem that apologetic..

I had never been to a Bubba Gumps, a little too cheesy for my tastes..but I assure you I will never return. After this, I may never even watch "Forrest Gump" again and I used to really really love that movie. bummer. What a shame. Now Bubba Gumps, show me the money!
author: celene m.

description:
The food is pretty good and priced a bit on the steep end; its expected for decent seafood. 

My last visit was a pretty awful. There was a basketball championship game and there were plenty of out of towners in the joint screaming and making noise, everywhere, even if the were no where near a TV. 

They were the wolves or mutts or something. 

At one point a server was walking by and the gentelman at the next table over starts to holler with the rest of the crowd and throws his arms back and spills the servers drink all over my fiance. Soaked head to toe he sat there shocked. The server was shocked and called for help and another person asked for a wet floor sign. While my fiance sat coldly and the table was still drenched. I had to grab napkins for my fiance and the servers worried about the floor- Yea I know for safety but com'on!

The man appologized and ordered him a drink, and the server also said sorry after about 15 minutes. Manager came over appologized for the mess and said the the drink would be on the other mans tab. 

I dont feel they were very worried about my fiance being drenched and had to hold zip my lips because my Fiance wanted us to have a good night. 

Hard to do when its 11pm and your soaked with liquor after a $70+ tab.
author: Christina P.

description:
Friendly, funny environment
Good service
Good selection
A little pricey for the type and size of the food
author: Neda M.

description: Not bad but not add good.  One of us returned the chicken because of weird flavor it could be his taste.  But it is ok to eat there.
author: Walter G.

description: I had a fabulous experience here. Yes it's expensive, but it's in one of the most touristy places in the world so that's to be expected. The service is on point and the seafood is to die for. If you like Forest Gump, the place is tailor made for you, with the movie playing all over and quotes from the movie in the decor. The clam chowder and steam pot were the highlights of our meal, but everything we tried was great. It's definitely not only a meal, but an experience as well, and one I won't mind having again.
author: Alie C.

description:
1 star for the decent view
1 star for mediocre food that didn't get me sick
1 star for a short wait

Came here with the family and was pleasantly disappointed with the food. It was only mediocre... And Bubba named off more types of shrimp than they served in the restaurant! HMPH!

Can I say a total Theme restaurant!? I would have thought our server was slow in the IQ department since he couldn't get our orders straight... keeping in total consistency with the movie... I think Forrest would have done a better job.
author: Vicky L.

description: Good food. Worst service in my entire life. If you like a place that caters to tourists and tourists only then this is the place for you. We came in with a party of 10, the wait was supposed to be 20mins, but not an hour.. that is what it turned in to. So many empty tables as we wait in the bar and we continue to watch large groups walk right in and be sat down. Finally after having to unfortunately complain about waiting way longer than we were supposed.. we got a table and when we did our whole group could not even sit together.  A server comes by and tells us he will help us.. after finally never getting served by him we snag another server named Nicholas.. who was not even supposed to be our server but he kindly helped us, which we were very thankful for because as a server myself I probably would pass a table like us off.. but for him to take initiative to take a table that wasn't his was AMAZING! 30 mins later our original server walks to us and tells us he is ready to take our order but thanks to a server taking us under his wing and not passing us off nor making excuses as to why he couldn't be with us our food was already in, thank the lord! We were already upset from it taking a few days to be seated. I appreciate the server who was willing to be a team player and just help our very hungry table. To the other sever would tried to make excuses as to why he took so long to help? That is why I will never come back. I know our table was big but I ate my food without a drink.. and that is just ridiculous.. guess it was our bad thinking we could come to such a popular place and get decent service.. my advice? Never come with a group over 4 people. Clearly the servers besides Nicholas can't handle it.
author: Astyn L.

description: Great sea foods. A must try. The restaurant with a view :)
author: D J.

description:
Our waitress was really cool and helpful, she suggested items for us but we actually didn't try them out. The girlfriend the shrimp scampi and I got Luitenant Dan's dish. We both really enjoyed our meals and the entrees and we're pretty full to get some desert. Next time though, we'll try that strawberry shortcake. 

By the way, I got almost all of my Forrest Gump trivia questions right! Love that movie!
author: Tom I.

description:
Me and my sister and nephew had just came in town and after a long flight we were very excited to start our trip off amazing because we love bubba gumps. We asked the front hostess for a waiter that asked all the trivia questions because we loved the movie And the hostess answered simply that all the waiters/waitresses were good. 

After waiting about 15. Minutes we were walked into the back corner after passing 5 booths and sat into a freezing corner. Our waiter simply asked us what do you want to drink and our food and that was it. I did not like my dish so I was planning on ordering a new one but the waiter never returned besides to drop the check off. We paid cash and got up and left. 

We were very dissapointed and decided we wanted to go back and talk to the manager and she simply told us sorry this has never happened before ...oh and not to forget the hostess sat us at a 10 top and there was only 3 of us. I have never had such a horrible experience at bubba gumps and will NOT be returning
author: Morgan K.

description: I am eating here right now. We got here at 8:30 PM and we didn't get our food until 10PM. This is a Tuesday. Basically the place was closed about time we got the food. Warning if you are a diabetic please don't come here. Your blood sugar will go really low leading you to a comma. Take heed to these words.
author: Rissa S.

description:
I had such a bad experience here (probably one of the worst of my life) that I have to give it one star. I'm not gonna write a long review because my experience was so horrible that no one will probably have one as bad as mine...

Anyway, for what it's worth, the wait was over an hour especially since it's in a super tourist-y place. It was almost two hours because I remember walking outside along the pier to play games and looking at all the other food I could have eaten, but nooo, my family wanted to eat here.

We finally got seated and no matter how badly we wanted to scream, "STOP, FORREST, STOP" to get the waiter to STOP, we didn't. He also never stopped. Anything that was wrong with my family's orders never got fixed. My water never got refilled. It took almost an HOUR to pay. No exaggeration, without the one hour wait time, our dining experience took almost 3.5 hours. Not even joking.

The food made us all sick. It wasn't that great and I really, really did not anticipate getting sick after. It didn't taste bad but something did not agree with our stomachs. I can only think of one time in my life where I threw up from eating bad food at that was something I made in my own home. I actually threw up after eating here, which NEVER happens to me. I felt shitty for most of the morning after. 

The weirdest part is that I didn't even have any fish or seafood. I had the burger. It had mushrooms, pepperjack cheese, onions, avocado and lettuce on it. With fries. It was $12.50. I felt ripped off for the burger I got. It sounded delicious on the menu but didn't hold up to how hungry I was after waiting like two hours.
It wasn't bland, but the flavor still wasn't really there. The meat itself wasn't that great, I got most of the taste from the cheese and tiny bit of avocado I got. It was pretty dry too. 

So, sorry Bubba Gump, can't give you a good review. You have enough other good reviews to keep you going, though.
author: Kellee N.

description: Nice location and beautiful view. The service is pretty good. The only thing I didn't like - I've got the appetizer after I finished my entree. Other than that, no complains ;)
author: Liliia R.

description:
Run Forrest run!

Stop Forrest stop!

Seriously that may be the most ingenious thing ever at a restaurant...two different signs, one if you dont need any help and one if you need something from your waiter.

Now if they actually paid more attention to the signs...

:0)
author: Eric N.

description: My medium burger was virtually raw and made me sick. The replacement they sent out wasn't much better but that doesn't really matter because the burger wasn't good anyways. The bun was stale and crumbled when eaten. It was overpriced and horrible but had a decent view.
author: Sean E.

description:
I took my son and his family there for a late lunch on a Saturday. BIG Mistake.   I was told my wait would be about 20 minutes.  After 30 minutes I asked about a table, stating I had been waiting for a long time, the hostess tells me I had waited for only 15 minutes (HUH? did she not think I noted what time I arrived?)   Meanwhile several other groups were seated, who had been waiting less time than we were.  After 45 minutes I became annoyed, and went back to the hostess station .  The Hostesses were trite and never smiled.  By now I was very irritated, my two year old granddaughter was with us.  We were finally seated, only I suspect because I really let them know I was very unhappy.
I had been here many years ago when it first opened and the food was very good.  This time, just average and overpriced.  The only reason I didn't give it one star is because I was given a discount for being a veteran.   
I am sorry I put my son, his wife, and my toddler granddaughter through this. 
Go to one of the other restaurants in the area, better service and food, without the attitude or wait.
author: Candice H.

description:
I was always crazy about going to Bubba Gump... main reasons, I love shrimp and I love the movie Forrest Gump.

I always loved that quote from the movie: "shrimp is the fruit of the sea. You can barbecue it, boil it, broil it, bake it, saute it. Dey's uh, shrimp-kabobs, shrimp creole, shrimp gumbo. Pan fried, deep fried, stir-fried. There's pineapple shrimp, lemon shrimp, coconut shrimp, pepper shrimp, shrimp soup, shrimp stew, shrimp salad, shrimp and potatoes, shrimp burger, shrimp sandwich..."

Let's say that the restaurant didn't take full advantage of all those ideas and offer not enough options. So I liked the place but was a bit disappointed because I thought they would have more options. I got the shrimp heaven and liked it, but was not in love with it.

The coconut shrimp is awesome... this one was worth the lunch. Beer and appetizers are also great.
author: Gisele M.

description: Pretty good food. Service was excellent... we got a little sundae and then acknowledged for having just gotten married that weekend. I liked how quickly people would stop when we had the sign flipped. I'd say it's a little pricey for what you get but you're also paying for the kitsch.
author: Chloe T.

description:
The name " Bubba Gump" just sounds cool right?!? Forrest Gump totally put this place on the map. 

To be perfectly honest- it's totally Overrated.

I guess to those who enjoy fried seafood in a bucket- this place would be amazing. But personally, it's just okay. 

The food isn't to die for. The service it average. The experience is interesting but forgettable.

Overall, the best thing about this place (which has nothing to do with the restaurant) is I got to hang out with Too Short. He's such a sweet guy! lol
author: Diana B.

description: Food was ok. We ordered a burger, mushroom burger and a shrimp appetizer. fries were blah. (My dad liked the fries.) Food took forever, but the servers walked around trying to distract us from our food not coming by asking Forrest Gump trivia questions. Overpriced touristy and loud.
author: Luna P.

description:
I should have written this review earlier because I don't really remember the name of the pasta dish I ordered. All I remember was that it was really good and filling. (I started to dose off shortly after plowing through it.)

The decor of this place is nuts. Really Forrest Gump-ish, complete with a list of the different types of shrimp dishes, a map of the USA where Forrest ran, and bunch of other cooky things from the movie.  If one of your friends is a big fan of the movie, they'd be in heaven here. All they need is a live topless hippy performer, and they'd be set. (After all, this is San Francisco.)

What I remember the most is the little sign on the table. One side says "Stop Forrest Stop" and the other side says "Run Forrest Run." If you want your waiter to come over, just flip it to "Stop Forrest Stop" and any one of the waiters will instantly be at your service. I wasn't used to this, so mine was always flipped to "Stop Forrest Stop" and the other waiter kept stopping at our table. Hehehe. 

Speaking of, our service was excellent. Our waiter took time to answer all my questions. The other table's waiter was also pretty lively and was giving a pop quiz on the movie.

We had a great view of the dock and boats outside and one appeared to be haunted, with lights reflecting off it that appeared to be ghosts. Either it was my lack of sleep (just got off the plane that day) or the drink I had mighta been too strong for me. Lol.
author: Julie A.

description:
Came here with a group of friends for a Saturday lunch. It was as you'd expect a Pier 39 restaurant to be on a sunny Saturday--very crowded and loud. We waited about 20-25 minutes to be seated (though we were told it would be 10). The waitress was very friendly and played a trivia game with us and another table to help pass the time we had to wait for the food (which wasn't atrociously long, but we were so hungry!). I had a drink which was delicious but I felt it was a little overpriced. Then again, it is SF and it did come with a souvenir cup.

I ordered the crab-stuffed shrimp, which was okay. The crab stuffing kept coming off of the shrimp which was irritating to me. But it tasted good, especially with the jasmine rice. A couple of my friends ordered the garlic bread, which I thought was delicious. Very buttery and flavorful.

I probably wouldn't come here again, but that's just because there are so many other places to eat in San Francisco.
author: Stacy R.

description: I enjoyed my meal, good shrimp, chips, fish and hush-puppies. Waiter was a lot of fun, went on a Tues. so no long wait or big crowd. The other 4 diners with me enjoyed their meal, also. No complaints (for once...lol)
author: Krissy A.

description:
Nice view. Friendly staff. Touristy. The wharf is a great location. 
However the food is overpriced and barely mediocre. Shrimp was mushy. Cajun sauce was greasy. Chowder was decent.
author: Berg T.

description: A nice place, the food was okay, it was not the best, but definitely far from being the worst. I had the strawberry freeze up, something along the lines, it came with a flashy cup, which really flashed. I also ordered the shrimp tacos, which was okay. It was kind of salty with a strong Cajun taste, more then I expected. I would had gave Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. 3 stars but the environment to this place was amazing, very unique and one of a kind, with a nice view of the wharf. And the waitress Jenni was just as amazing, and very friendly, so I decided to give them 4 awesome stars! I did feel a little rushed from the moment I got here, but I can't really blame them since we did arrived towards closing. Overall a nice place and would definitely come here again whenever I decide to visit San Francisco again. Woo!
author: Simon W.

description: Expensive for what it is.  The steak I had ordered was overly dry, no taste & cold.  Our bill came out to 70 bucks and was not worth the pay. Don't go here unless you want to pay a lot for cold, dry, flavorless tasting food.
author: Michelle O.

description:
*WARNING the drinks are highly watered down, but Awesome place none the less.... 

Although you may go broke trying to catch a buzz on the drinks...  and the bit with the waitress somewhat joining my date and I for dinner was a bit bizarre, I had an awesome time!!!
The food taste great and was plentiful, plus the atmosphere was very inviting. There were lots of smiles and every waiter/waitress helped out.

A gave it 4 stars and will definitely be a regular at the SF Pier 39 location.peace.
author: Saint S.

description: I'm not big on sea food but everything was really good. I'm glad the place didn't have a fishy smell because that just turns my stomach. Drinks here are really good and the staff is really friendly. Make sure you watch Forrest gump before coming in. They ask you trivia questions :)
author: Carina P.

description: We went to Bubba Gump's yesterday during the holiday season. The wait was about 25 minutes, but once you were called, you had to wait in another line to actually be seated. I felt like we were seated in the "neglected section" because I barely saw the waiters come by our table nearly as often as compared to other tables. Service was quite slow. I understand they were busy but you think they would've called on more staff during the busy holiday season to make up for it. The food was decent but nothing amazing. I got the baja fish tacos with grilled fish and my husband got the veggie burger.  The tacos comes with about 2T. Salsa and two cups of tortilla chips... Someone explain that math to me. I've been to Bubba Gump's before and it's always been ok but nothing amazing.
author: Sarah T.

description:
Dear Nice Waiter from the East Coast and USF:

Your service was a bit instrusive at first but you were actually very friendly and me and my friends really enjoyed your service today. Thank you for making us laugh, its something you don't get all the time at restaurants. The Forrest Gump trivia was entertaining. Anyways, I just wanted to apologize for leaving such a sucky tip. We were just low on cash today for some reason. We truly feel bad about it because you were really nice. What made it us feel even worse was when you dropped someone's drinks, everybody had to yell "flat tire" at you. We are seriously sorry for the bad tip, but keep providing the great service :)
