Sincerely sorry,
Three cheap college kids

We ordered the cajun shrimp as an appetizer. The dish was way smaller than what we expected, but it was delicious. The shrimp were small but fresh. And the garlic bread to dip in the sauce was delicious.
I ordered the stuffed shrimp. It came with about 8 shrimp, a scoop of rice, and a piece of bread. The dish was enough for lunch and I thought it was good.
author: Lesley T.

description:
If I could give a negative star I would! I've always passed by this place when I've visited the city but never ate here before until I had guests come from over seas. While showing them SF we decided to dine here. We had a party of 7 and was seated quickly which I thought was amazing especially on a Saturday. A few of my guests ordered hamburgers because they aren't seafood fans. We waited and received our food and I looked over to make sure everyone was okay and noticed the hamburgers were charcoal burnt- it was bad! The waiter took it away and the manager apologized. Next round they received the burgers and they were bloody- I mean when u squeeze into it blood was coming out so I sent it back again. I've never been so embarrassed in front of guests. A third round of hamburgers come out and this time they look burnt but not as bad as the first round and one of my guests said they weren't eating it. I noticed that the waiter and manager were obviously talking about us- not sure why when they messed up three times. They took the burgers off the bill but that doesn't change the experience we had. They should just stick to serving 
seafood!
author: S J.

description:
I ate here yesterday for dinner. The ambiance is all in the name, and you pretty much experience what you expect. Forest Gump everything.  For dinner I ordered the peel n eat shrimp. It was tasty however it was also really shrimpy in size. This place isn't, nor is it expensive but i'd say the portion doesn't match the price. I also ordered fries and a mango sprite. The drink was good but also $5. Fries were worth it only because it help fill you up at $5. For dessert I had the key lime pie which was probably the best part of my $30 with tip. Not really worth it, but for all the first timers, I guess the experience is also what you pay for.

Aside that, the service was excellent, our waitor was down to earth, and even talked to us about Coachella, rad.

If I ever come back here, I'd never get shrimp, just the fish sandwiches and samplers. If you want shrimp go to Crawdaddy!
author: James D.

description: The Jambalaya was great and the dessert sampler was amazing.  The reason why I'm giving this 2 stars is because it's the typical tourist trap and the prices are outrageous!
author: Alma L.

description:
-1 for TERRIBLE HORRIBLE service
-1 for tiny portions for huge price
-1 poor flavor/taste
-1 WORST EXPERIENCE EVER

This place is all hype -- it's located where a lot of tourist go so I'm sure it gets plenty of business. I feel bad that this would be a place for tourist to go to in order to get a "taste of SF" ...

Even if you look old, young, middle aged -- service should always be fair. 

The waitress who was helping us dropped our menus off, left for a really long time, We had to flag someone down to place our order, never checked back in with us to refill our drinks or to ask us how we were doing, and before we even finished our meal she dropped our bill off.

I wanted to chuck one of the corns at her head. 

I would understand that maybe if the place was packed and hectic -- but we were one of the few customers there on a week night. 

So what am i paying for here? Definitely not the service or the taste...
Is it the decor?

+1 star for decor then.
author: Ashley C.

description:
We waited for over 40 minutes for a sticky table.  The service was lagged out and sloppy. Food was mediocre (super greasy and tasteless).

Waaay overpriced, too.

In a word:  Overrated.

Won't darken their doorstep again.
author: Millie B.

description: we thought that being a chain the food would just be average, we were surprised......  the seafood was excellent!!!!!!  the place was packed of course with all the tourist on pier 39 but the staff gave awesome service, the food was hot and delicious....  will definitely go back when in the bay area again
author: Kelly s.

description:
I went here with some friends and the overall experience was not great. The food was nothing amazing but then again it is a chain...

I ordered one of the cocktails on the menu and it was HORRIBLE! It tasted like acidic mold, I couldn't even finish it. You couldn't taste the alcohol either.

I most likely won't go back unless someone has an event there. There are better places for food and drinks.

I give two stars because our waiter was hilarious and helped us find a good club to go after dinner, the view at the restaurant was nice and the restaurant was clean.
author: Kristyn W.

description:
Good place to eat ate once, do not think it is good enough to eat at very often. The city has many great places to eat. Everyone should eat there once though. The food is ok, the service is ok and the views are great. Their location is great, prices are a little high for what it is. 

My brother's nickname has been Bubba since my younger sister has been able to talk. So we had to eat there as a family. Forest Dump made this place even more well known, Bubba Gump shrimp and the hundred different shrimp dishes. 

I liked my meal and enjoyed the setting. Nothing to right home about.
author: Marie W.

description:
Thanks fellow yelpers for getting me prepared for this interesting commercial Odyssey on Pier 39!

My oldest niece wanted to have her birthday dinner here so the old uncle gets roped into another experience/ordeal. My sister in law thinks they will allow me to get and hold a table. No way Jose! We had a small basketball team of nine, fat chance we will even be seated at the same table. The wait staff is very helpful and enthusiastic but short being retreads from Joe's Crab Shack (at least only the patrons have to stand on the table) like many reviewers have stated, if you are going for the food or ambiance go somewhere else. On the upside the location does have a thrilling view of the bay and the tour boats zooming by the windows! I had the Mahi Mahi with the Bourbon sauce, and it was dry and tough with the sauce to more or less try to throw it a lifesaver. It also comes with a huge serving of mashed potatoes with shoe string fries stuck in it? Did not work for me. One of the other guests ordered what I was and some hotties at another table wanted to know if it was good and where it was on the menu. My nice was serenaded by the servers and that was it.

Make sure you get your parking ticket validated on the way out in the gift shop!

Nuff said.
author: Richard G.

description:
I went here recently with a friend and I the food was okay. I remember going to Bubba Gumps when it first opened and the food was great, but the food wasn't like I remembered, but the service was good. 

If you want a better "seafood" place, go elsewhere.
author: Joann L.

description: Amazing food and service! Definitely satisfied. what a view!
author: Ashleigh M.

description: Good service and friendly atmosphere. Don't forget, life's like a box of......
author: Tyler B.

description: Bubba Gumps is always fun! If you enjoyed the movie, you'll enjoy the restaurant. I've been to the one in Chicago and this one. The view of the bay here is gorgeous! Be prepared for crowds and a little waiting. This time round, I had a corona-rita; a margarita and Corona beer combination. Mmm! It's just a fun place to be and eat.
author: Gina B.

description: I used to love this place growing up. I still love everything about the inside! And the service is still awesome! BUT, the food was just ok. I mean, we had a great spicy canjun shrimp appetizer...but that was the BEST part of the meal...that shouldnt be the best part....the main plates were eh, ok. I'd spend my money somewhere else, like Q restaraunt (if you're in san fran)!!!
author: Adrianna E.

description: Came here on a Saturday afternoon. It was pretty busy, but the service was still okay. I have no clue why I came here, like most residents of the city, they like to bring friends and family from out of town to this tourist attraction/trap. I loved Forrest Gump, and I missed out on my chance to eat at the chain when I was in New Orleans. Anyways, I had the seafood bucket, I forgot what it's called, but it has all types of shrimp, crab legs, and fries. It was okay, definitely has the fast food feel to it. The price was okay as well, nice view though.
author: Phan H.

description:
BUBBA GUMP!

Yes, their food is overpriced, but it IS located in the heart of tourism in San Francisco, so this is expected. 

Boyfriend and I were seated quite promptly, explained to about the RUN FORREST RUN & STOP FORREST STOP signs and offered a selection of drinks by our server, Courtney (who, might I add, was awesome). She gave us suggestions on alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. Specialty drinks allowed us to take home the glasses! I brought home a 16 oz. light up glass.. the epitome of awesome.

We started with some steamed clams and mussels. While shared between the two of us, wasn't exactly enough, it still hit the spot. Our entree, the Shrimper's Heaven consisted of cocktail shrimp, coconut shrimp, tempura shrimp, and fried shrimp with a side of fries and dipping sauces. MMM. This was a great meal.

The parking validation was nice, too. ;)
author: M C.

description: This restaurant is loud and fun. The servers are energetic and check on your table frequently. During my meal, they also did a Forrest Gump Trivia game where she asked questions related to the movie. Since I got all the questions correct, she said I won a Bubba Gump drinkware. For my meal, I ordered Jenny's Catch which was tasty. I would like to come back here to try their other seafood dishes. They all looked so good!
author: Frances V.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! I come out here sometimes with my family when we go out to eat and it's one of my favorites on Pier 39. 

It does get really crowded during the week (due to all of the tourists and all) but it's worth the wait.

The food is very good there and I reccommend trying to get a seat by the window because the view is spectacular! I love looking out the window at the ocean and the Golden Gate Bridge while dining and Bubba Gumps is a very fun place to be. I recommend trying out this resturant.
author: Jackie R.

description: I was here yesterday, around 2:30pm.  I was dissapointed with the rude ass waitress.  This is how it started.  I ask for a drink before she introduce her name.  She intruppt me.  Can I tell you my name first before you order.  First of all ii am the one paying here not you.  Really shitty service,  THE FOOD WAS LAME FOR THE PRICE.  Ughhhh what a dissapointment.........
author: Francis B.

description:
While playing tourist for the day with family from out of state, we decided to try BG's for dinner. What a disappointment!

We had a group of seven (3 kids) and were seated fairly quickly even though we didn't have reservations (7PM).

Our waiter was a cocky guy who seemed to be in a great rush... maybe it's that Run Forrest Run thing... I don't know. We got our drinks quickly, and then our server rattled off the specials like an auctioneer. When we told him him we needed a little more time to go through the menu, he was put out. I noticed we were missing two setups and asked for them... they came 15 minutes later.

The food was mediocre...my wife had the Tilapia and wasn't happy. When she mentioned it to our server, instead of being caring and wanting to please her, he argued with her how he loved it and it was very popular. While that may be so, this Tilapia was not good.

Then, to add insult to injury, when we got the check, an 18% gratuity was added without our knowledge for a group of just seven people.

In fairness to the rest of the staff, the Stop Forrest sign worked and it was nice to have a server other than ours stop to see what we needed.

All in all, I would Run Forrest Run from this location!
author: Bill S.

description: Decent food, decent price. Zero locals but makes for a good stop to eat if your in the area every couple years or so.
author: Mafia M.

description:
I ate here once when I came to SF, but my oh my look at all the Gump memorabilia. I love the movie Forrest Gump. and they didn't disappoint. 

This one is less crowded than the one in NYC or the one at Universal Walk.
author: Wilson G.

description: Really fun environment.  Very good servers who know the menu.  BEAUTIFUL view of the bay.  Great food
author: David R.

description: First time here and i ordered the kentucky shrimp skewer and its really good :) i also like the ambiance! :)
author: Cyress C.

description:
Damn I love Bubba Gumps!  I visit this place literally every... single... time I go to San Francisco.  Two favorite things on the menu: Bucket of Boat Trash (if you aren't trying to be healthy), or the Accidental Fish (if you ARE being healthy).  Either way, I start it out with 3/4 pound of the cajun peel and eat shrimp!

Oh, and BTW, I kick ASS at the Bubba Gump trivia.  Just sayin'...
author: John P.

description: It's a tourist place for sure. I loved the movie Forrest Gump so the idea of this place makes me really want to like it more, but the food is honestly just alright, nothing really stood out as incredibly fresh or well prepared. The service team is decent. Quick and efficient even when the place is really busy. But I don't like that they try to sell you a bunch of crap like 10 seconds after sitting down. Literally had just sat down and a guy came by trying to get us to order an appetizer and a blended cocktail in one of their cups that lights up and stuff. It's fine if you have a sales protocol to follow but let me get situated before you come to do your sales spiel. Of course there's tons of shrimp prepared a lot of different ways. I guess overall what doesn't do it for me is the so so food and the touristy feel of the place, it's not bad, just wasn't anything special.
author: Anthony R.

description:
Total tourist trap. Overpriced, noisy, long wait, mediocre food.

But the view is nice..
author: Melissa T.

description:
LOL. Okay, really?

My friends and I came here for New Years Eve dinner and we were having a pretty good a*s time! The waiter was great and the environment put us all in a positive mood.

And then.............

One of the waiters RANDOMLY came up to us and told us that they had security cameras around. (....okay?) Like, why? Why are you telling us this? So randomly? While we're eating? Just.. sitting there.. eating..

Killed our mood.

The end.

Oh, and killer tip -___-'
20% GRATUITY. REALLY!?!?!?!
author: Mimi N.

description:
I love this place I bring my family and my girl friend here often. I only live a few miles way so we all way stroll down the embarcadero to come eat at this amazing place on the bay. A few time we have come we got to
See some bay dolphins. It was amazing!!!! Only down fall is there's all ways a major weight. But the weight is definitely worth it.
author: Jacob K.

description:
Great to go once, touristy, expensive, on Fisherman's Wharf but really cool!
Watch Forrest Gump before you go whether it is the first or the 100th time you have seen it. The entire place is filled with movie paraphernalia. The waiters will give you a quiz towards the end of your meal about the film (I sucked at it but it was super fun, hint: look at the signs and photographs around you and you will do fine). 
Food was good but nothing special, I don't eat sea food though so I am probably not the best judge. They have huge drinks you can get that come in special glasses that you can take home! I forget what they are called though.
author: Sierra B.

description:
When you know that this place is located among tourist area, don't order things that are too much for your wallet. Choose smart, like gf and I did.

We order Cajun shrimp, Old Fashioned New England Clam Chowder, and Captain's Fish&Chip. We both know that we can get other food on the menu with a cheaper price than this place.

Food came out all at the same time. The service was friendly. Our server was energetic and humorous. He gave us quick trivia about Forest Gump at one point. It was quite entertaining.

Gf loved the cajun shrimp very much. She said she could eat that every single day.

Again, just remember, when you are in tourist place, ofcourse you have to expect overpriced stuff. But this place is one of the few decent restaurant around there. It is certainly better than some unknown fish and chips joint that always empty.. and also certainly better than some crab house which can cost you $30 and up per plate over there.

It's definitely better than 'Crab Pot' in Seattle.
author: Yohann S.

description:
To be honest, the only reason I like Bubba Gump's is the ambiance and the environment. I LOVE how realistic they've tried to make it and to tie it back in with the movie. There's always a couple TVs playing Forrest Gump on loop too. AND there is an amazing view of the Bay out of their huge windows!

Service is alright and decent, but food is kind of lacking. I always get the shrimp alfredo, which is kind of bland and not that great tasting. They have good garlic bread though!
author: Melody L.

description: Overpriced tourist trap!  We were lured in after a 45-minute wait and spent $94 on frozen shrimp, like you could buy at your grocery and heat up in the oven.  Everything is served in disposable place settings except for the forks and $5 soft drinks, which makes this chain one of the most over-priced nationwide, with little food quality.  It's all about the ambience and Forrest Gump trivia, and that's it.  Live and learn.
author: Clay A.

description:
We go to Bubba Gump more often than we probably should. 

The fish and chips are ok, but we usually come here for the cajun shrimp net catch. No less than 3 pounds, please. So, so good! 

I LOVE playing the trivia game. (: Every time I come here, I want to come home and watch the movie for the millionth time and come up with a question to stump the waiters/waitresses. 

Drawbacks: It is PACKED during tourist season. But then again, when isn't it tourist seaon in SF?
author: Jeanette P.

description: OMG!!!! I haven't been to a "Bubba Gumps" in years and after yesterday's experience I WILL NEVER GO BACK!!! It wasn't so much that the place was crowded & crazy-hey it was a Saturday afternoon at Pier 39-totally expected that! But what I didn't expect was for the food to be as bad as it was!!! Lobster/shrimp bisque...watery & chalky! French fries...hard! Fish strips...tiny & tasteless! They clearly do not care about the quality & taste of their food!! If you must go because its the "tourist" thing to do...I say visit the gift shop, take a photo wearing the big Forrest Gump shoes, but eat someplace else or you'll be sorry!!!
author: Deborah V.

description: Great view, Great Service, Food was pretty good too, I got the Dish with all the shrimp, they let me sub out the coconut shrimp for more fried shrimp, the Tempura and chilled shrimp were good as well.  The Fries where Meh.  My wife's Stuffed Shrimp was delicious.  The drinks were a bit expensive but that's San Fran prices at a tourist trap.  I enjoyed it even though the food was run of the mill.
author: Scott J.

description: I hadn't been to Bubba Gumps in San Francisco for five years.  It has changed.  I had the fish and chips.  The fish sticks were narrow and heavily battered.  The ones before were chunks of battered bass that were tasty. The shrimp tacos were not very good.  The salmon filet was small and didn't taste very fresh.  The food was warm.  Service was good.  There are better places to eat.
author: Jacko B.

description:
Soo crowded, not worth the time and trouble of parking in the area.

 it's just touristy...but if you want quality, you wont' find it here.
author: Carol Y.

description: I love Bubba Gump! The food is never overcooked, the servers are fast, and the portions are large.
author: Nneka O.

description:
Went here on a Saturday night and the wait was almost 2 hours.
But after the long wait the hubby and I were amazed at how quick we got our food served. Our waiter was really nice and helpful. Thumbs up for how fast the food was served Thumbs down on the wait....wayyy tooo loong
author: Val T.

description:
I must revisit Bubba Gumps.

I'm not a big seafood eater, so if you don't eat seafood.. I say you go to another restaurant. Maybe Rainforest Cafe? But anyway.. the shrimp isn't amazing. I can't even say much since I don't eat seafood and the majority of the menu is seafood. I suggest you sit by the windows the overlook the wharf though, good view.
author: Jessica R.

description: Way overpriced for the quantity and the quality of food served. My 4 shrimp were okay. The few 2" pieces of fried fish was nasty...frozen quality. A few limp French fries. All for only $20.95! You are def paying for the novelty of Forrest Gump. The atmosphere is good. The view is spectacular. The staff look very sloppy and unkempt...like they came straight from Alabama. Lol maybe that's on purpose?
author: Stacey M.

description:
OK I know this place is a "tourist trap" but sometimes I just want to eat some seafood and stare at the pretty ocean, so bubba gumps it is! 

Maybe I always go on a good day or I'm easy to please (makes you wonder about my one star reviews...) but I'm usually happy with my experience. On New Years Eve our waitress was friendly and helpful, which is very hard to get now and days. 

Appetizer-Cajun shrimp we both LOVED it. Only thing is I wish there was more. 

Entrees-I had the crab legs. It's hard to mess up crab legs unless you suck. *cough*Hooters*cough* So I gobbled it all of. Boyfriend ordered the Mahi Mahi and oh my gosh it was fresh, delicious oh and did I mention DELICIOUS? 

Drinks-We ordered the sweet tea with booze. Him regular and mine with peach. Regular old chain booze. Yummy, but not enough booze.
author: Sunie K.

description:
I enjoyed my first time here. I came here with a group of 6 and the wait looked super long, but we only ended up waiting for 15 minutes! Our server was incredibly friendly. They were having a very busy day and you can tell he was exhausted, but I appreciate that he didn't gyp us out of good service.

We all shared the garlic-flavored 1.5 lbs of shrimp steamed in beer for appetizer. Deeeelicious. We killed that thing in 5 minutes.

My friend and I shared the fresh red snapper with lobster butter sauce on top of mashed red potatoes. Upside - SOOOOO FREAKIN' TASTY!!!!! Those mashed potatoes were extremely flavorful, I wish I just had a big fat bowl of it! It complemented the snapper well.

For the most part, good food, good service. Pricey, and I wish the portions were a little bigger.
author: Lisa D.

description:
I like going here because of the service and it's a place I can count on to eat something yummy, because I always wonder if I try the other places, if I will like my meal, and if I don't it would be a shame.

Customer service is really good, the waiters are interactive with their tables asking forest gump trivia. They also have a good system to get their attention with plates to stop or pass. no need to have them constantly ask if you're okay, interrupting conversation.

Their cups that light up are a nice souvenir to take home. I enjoyed dining there, and would go again. :)
author: Kathleen C.

description: Really great atmosphere, but a little pricey for the food's quality. Service is great and I love all the Forrest Gump themed decorations, but $20 seems a little expensive for a medium sized plate of shrimp
author: Nick R.

description:
This was the first time I was here and I didn't come in expecting too much.  It was in the middle of lunch hour and the place was kinda dead.  Maybe it's the economy?  My friend and I ordered and it took a while for the food to come out even though I asked if they can rush it a little since we were in a hurry.  The decor was fun to look at.  It make me replay the movie over in my head.

The food was tasty but a bit on the salty side.  (Maybe they wanted us to order more drinks.)  I sat there and gulp down many sodas; something I don't normally do.  The wait staff wasn't as attentive as I expected for it being so slow. (I would try to give extra attention to get a little more tip when it is slow.)
author: Thuy H.

description:
Whether or not you're visiting San Fran or a resident,  you should try Bubba Gumps and emerse yourself into the great tourist trap that this is..

The place was packed, busy and buzzing with people from all over the world (with many Americans as well).

Service levels were high, they cared about all of their customers and the food was actually very very nice.

A very fun night out for each and everyone and just because it is the centre of all things tourist should not put you off..

Great seafood, great range of drinks, a fun area to walk around in that you feel very safe in as well and you must take a walk outside to look at the sea lions..

I'll always make time when over in San Fran for some Bubba Gump.
author: Paul L.

description: One of the best things this bubba gump restaurant has going for it is the ocean view and alcatraz in the distance.Every time My family and I go here we get great,friendly customer service as well as awesome food.So if you want kicked back family oriented environment or just want come in with some friends to have some drinks,I recommend pier 39 in general!
author: Isaiah H.

description: I've been to both the one on Pier 39 and the one on Cannery Row a few times and it was a pleasant experience each time. The waiters were very nice, efficient accommodating and just fun. They keep you from getting bored while waiting or your food, although I remember it didn't take that long and usually they are pretty busy. It's a very popular place, but you never wait very long to get seated or to get your food which is always generous, delicious and has a great presentation. They have some great unique and fun libations too. The waiters ask you Forest Gump trivia while you are waiting for your food. They also show the movie on TV. I remember the last time we went, we sat outside and although it was a cold day, we were comfortable because we had heat lamps. It was really nice. I remember I had the walnut apple salad and it was really fresh and delicious. They have a lot of healthy choices on their menu. They are a bit expensive, but perfect for a really nice treat after you've been to the Monterey Bay Aquarium.
author: Liz C.

description: The best thing about this place is the Forrest Gump memorabilia, other than that its pretty basic. Quality of seafood is poor especially for being right on the WARF, I've had better shrimp off of a corner vendor down the pier. Wait time wasn't too bad for a party of 8 on a Saturday early evening. Single shots of Jack run you $10 each and they were putting them in warm glasses which from a sanitization outlook is good but from a shot of whiskey outlook is all bad. Our waiter was from Ireland with such a thick accent it was hard to understand anything he was saying especially during what could have been a fun trivia game. I got the Forrest feast, or something like that which has fish, shrimp, hush puppies and fries. Fish batter was light and crispy but tasted of nothing, shrimp was sizzler quality at best, fries were soggy and cold and hush puppies had huge pieces of corn in them and we just off tasting. No one else's food in our group looked any better than anyone else's. $300 tab for the name of the restaurant, I wouldn't go back and for the price and quality there are many other places that would be a better pick.
author: Heather N.

description:
I really like this place. 

The wait can be unbearable at times. 

We always get the Shrimper's net catch.

The food is pretty good.

The ribs are one of my favorites! It's very messy but oh so good! 

I'm so glad they give you wet naps and a roll of paper towel on each table. Trust me....you will need it.

I was a secret shopper here once and I think they knew. I had to buy a drink from the bar. So when our waitress asked if  I wanted any drinks from the menu, I told her no.

But when she returned with our food, she saw my drink next to me. I didn't get a chance to even drink it so I asked if I could take it to go. She said she's not allowed to let anyone leave with alcohol but for me, she'd let me. She got me a large coffee cup. That was so sweet of her!

It's pretty embarrassing when someone is celebrating their birthday here. The staff stands on a table and shouts out to the whole room. Then they all have to sing a birthday song and all the patrons join in.

Every time I have eaten here, we got wonderful customer service from all the staff. 

I will definitely come back whenever I'm in the area.

I think Yelp needs to change the price range tiers to reflect what $$ .. shouldn't it be $11-20?? 
Anyway BGS was ok. We shared a shrimp platter: Lt. Dan's Drunken Shrimp Platter. 10 large shrimp in all, mash potatoes, in a buttery sauce. A bit salty but and definitely greasy. I'd go again but I love the noisy and bustling atmosphere. The waiters/tress are a bit difficult to wave down, as it is always so crowded and noisy it's hard to get their attention.
author: D M.

description: Yep, it's touristy.  Yep, it's kind of cheesy.  But you know what?  The food is actually pretty good and the servers seem to not hate their jobs. Solid 3 stars, no more, no less.
author: Gina K.

description:
Like any of the other restaurants along side the pier, this place is seriously EXPENSIVE. I guess it is always so busy because tourists do not know any better when they are in a big city like San Francisco. 

I came here once with a group of my friends and then another time with my friend's family. I had the "Pear & Berry Salad". It was pretty good but now worth $12.99. Way to overpriced for a salad that is not prepared by a known chef. The amount they gave was alright. There was enough for me to finish it. My friend had the "Dumb Luck Coconut Shrimp". There was only like 6 pieces of shrimp and a bunch of fries for $18.99. I think I would rather drive more into the city and eat somewhere nicer and pay this kind of money for dinner. 

The cool thing about this place is that everyone is so energetic. There are these signs that have different signals on it to get your waiter's attention. Although, I feel like since it is always so busy you might as well scream for your waiter's attention as opposed to hoping for him/her to read the sign.
author: Katrina T.

description:
1 1/2 lb bucket of cajun shrimp.  why else would anyone go here?  ok maybe for the movie memorabilia, or the cutesy gift shop stuff, or because you're at pier 39 and that's just what you do.  i'm not happy or ready to leave until i have orangey/red fingers and slipping into a satisfied food coma .

a note about the service...  those license plate things on the table are how you get someone's attention.  *run forrest run* tells them you're good.  *stop forrest stop* er something like that tells them you need something.  did i mention how much i love the bucket of cajun shrimp?  until i figure out the recipe i guess i'll just have to keep coming back...
author: Rene L.

description: I don't know why the reviews are so negative here! It's an attractive and popular tourist spot so of course there will be long wait times but enjoy being the city and walk around the pier why you wait! I love bubba! Such a fun environment and the popcorn shrimp is amazing! The location is hard to beat too
author: Kelly J.

description: I was at this location 2 weeks ago. One of the worst dinning experiences of any place I've ever been. After over an hour and a half, 3 visits from our waiter (telling us our food was on rush), 40 minutes later it never came, nor did the manager that I requested to speak with regarding our order. We ended up leaving. This was after watching people around us come and go. We were a party of 2 that ordered fish tacos and a shrimp po boy. Not a difficult or large order. I am aware of others on this site that have left reviews regarding a horrible experience at your restaurant, you have replied to their post, saying upper management would be contacting to resolve . No one has received a call, or a letter as you have promised over and over. This doesn't surprise me as this appears to be why your service is so bad, as poor customer service trickles down from the top.  Just like we were promised our food your words and actions are all posture, with no follow through. Get your ducks in a row, or your customers will figure it out sooner or later, and just stop coming to your restaurant. I for one will never return and will encourage everyone I know to do the same.
author: Darin D.

description: Very good service. Our waiter was attentive and funny. The food was cooked and seasoned perfectly! It was served surprisingly quick too :) they always have some deals on drinks and you can take a glass with you - this time we got a light up glass and a shaker. Restaurant has some pretty amazing views.
author: Joanna V.

description:
It's Applebee's, but based on a film, ~75% more expensive, without a nutrition facts menu, and 50% greasier.  Not to mention the majority of the menu is shrimp.

Since I came with my family and their friends not hungry, I just ate ice cream and strawberries.  It was a bit annoying because our server took my order, asked me a couple of questions about it, and then left, and then came back, and asked me /more/ questions about it, and then when I got it I had to ask for more strawberries.  It's just a scoop of ice cream and strawberries!  How complicated can it get?

Now... for the rest of the adults in the party, they were really, really disappointed.  They expected Bubba Gump to be classy and nice, but instead they got frozen fish and shrimp, flickering lights, and an atmosphere so loud you have to yell.

A positive would be it's really lively and the servers are upbeat and accommodating.  But, meh, not coming here again.
author: Katherine B.

description: Been here once, it's actually a good place to go too. When I came here there was no line like my previous attempts coming to Bubba Gump. Anyways, it's quite pricey. The Run Across America Sampler was good. The net catch with the cajun sauce in the other hand was not good. I had Mama's Southern Fried Chicken, it was ok, not much seasoning in it. The atmosphere is great, the service is great. The price and the quality of flavor is questionable.
author: Daniel C.

description: When visiting San Fran the second time round, we decided to take a day out and walk around Fisherman's Wharf and the surrounding Piers. Having not been able to try Bubba Gump the last time, we decided to satisfy our appetite! And it definitely was fulfilling! While waiting, we were asked questions about the Bubba Gump movie. Ironically, Bubba Gump Shrimp doesn't sell Dr Pepper! The atmosphere was lively and the staff were nice. Between the 2, we ordered a Shrimpers Net Catch and an I'm Stuffed Shrimp. which we devoured whole heartedly! The gravy and bread were just as delicious with all the southern spices mixed in. We loved this combination so much that we couldn't resist ordering the same while we were in New York! Definitely a must try!
author: Sam P.

description: The view they have is gorgeous. Prices are not crazy. My friend and I had the bourbon halibut dish with shrimp appetizers, 1 coke and i had some dranks all for about 70 something dollars.
author: Romuald D.

description:
I first tried this establishment years ago when I was still in high school, but I just went yesterday (I'd been there a few times in between) and I usually have a good experience.

The food is good, a little pricier than I remember but the fact that it's fresh kind of makes up for it. 

My favorite dish happens to be the Shrimper's Heaven, and my second fave is the Dumb Luck Coconut Shrimp. I love coconut, the texture, the flavor but i don't like it when it's overpowering. Here, at Bubba Gump they have just the right amount of flavor in their food.

Another upside is the view, you get a gorgeous view of the bay, and depending on where you sit you can also see Alcatraz. I personally am not a fan of the view..but that's because I have a fear of water and ships, but i digress. Everyone else I know enjoys the view.

My only gripe with this place is when they waiters come by and give you a little bit of trivia..I go to eating establishments to eat, not to be hassled in the middle of bites of food with questions about a movie that i haven't seen in over 6 years!!! And in case they didn't notice, all of the answers are written on the table. The other thing that kind of irked was their birthday tradition. I'm all for singing happy birthday to people, but there was a 13 year-old girl celebrating a birthday there and they sang the Birthday Booty Dance song to her...ummm, inappropriate. This poor child looked uncomfortable and mortified as they urged her to do the dance. I'm sure after that kind of trauma that poor girl is on the right path to a secret life of dancing at her local strip joint! 

Thanks a lot Bubba Gump.
author: Cristal H.

description:
This place used to be much better... or maybe I'm becoming a food snob? 

I came to Pier 39 with "Seafood Salad" on the brain. Most of the nearby wharf restaurants had salads that were priced up to $30 for crab and shrimp toppings. Since Bubba's is a bit of a family tradition when we come to the Pier, we headed on down there and got right in with no wait on a Sunday early afternoon. 

Hoping to find some type of awesome salad, I found the new Pear and Berry salad on the menu (I think it was $14?) and I asked them to replace the chicken for the grilled shrimp. That was no problem at all, but I do think that it cost a little extra for the shrimp replacement. The salad itself was pretty big, but I expected more shrimp. There were probably 7 or 8 medium-sized shrimp on my salad that tasted as if they were sitting out for a while, about room temperature, and I wasn't "wowed" by the texture or taste of them. I suppose I expected larger, more succulent shrimp. The lettuce, berries, pears and dressing were DIVINE, but I really was let down by the shrimp. I wished I had stayed with the chicken. 

Our view of the sea was fantastic and we did have a blast watching the boats go by. 

I was hungry a few hours later and got an $8 crab and shrimp combo cup at one of those outdoor places off to the side of the Pier (past Ripley's) and that totally satisfied my seafood craving.
author: Neon D.

description: I went here with my mom,dad, and my two brothers it was great. We had a waiter named Emerson and he helped us out with everything we went to San Francisco by a ferry so we had to be back to the Getty at 6:45 and he helped us get everything we needed. He was so polite and we also played trivia which was very fun. The food there was also amazing but the waiter I have to give you creds for helping us out he was the best waiter I have ever had
author: Angelica W.

description:
We had a new server who came paired with an "experienced" server. Now granted, when you're a waiter, it takes a couple of weeks to work out a shpiel. But his shpiel consisted of "That blah blah drink is my personal favorite." Furthermore, these were the kinds of waiters that wouldn't leave you alone. Now, I worked at the Rainforest Cafe. I know what it's like to have annoying the crap out of your customers as part of your job. But I am not dumb as a rock. I can read people. It's part of working in a services industry. This guy would not leave us alone with the quizzes about Forrest Gump and offering us more food and drinks. 

Everyone at the table got drinks and the drinks were WEAK. My friend got one of the frilly drinks in the fancy cup you get to take home. It was so weak she complained and the "experienced" server said that those drinks were the weakest. She didn't get charged for it. 

Deviled eggs were horrible. Had overwhelming bacon. Basket of shrimp had about 8 shrimp in it. It was a sad-looking basket. Cocktail sauce was horrible. 

I will never set foot in one of these ever again if I can help it.
author: Anya F.

description:
I can honestly say this is the first time I've had a screw in my food. Though, I wish I didn't  have to! Maybe they thought it would be a good garnish. 

My friend and I decided to share the "Run Across America Sampler". We had just finished eating the average tasting meal when, lo and behold, I spot a screw. It wasn't just sitting there on top, it was EMBEDDED in the remaining spicy chicken strip. How this actually happened, I have no idea. But my guess is that it came from a pan OR the chef picked his nose and *plop* a screw fell out. When we showed the waitress, she and manager stared at it in oblivion for a good minute or two. They said their apologies and ended up excluding the meal from the bill. Besides the screw fiasco, the food tasted like it came fresh out of the freezer section of Safeway... And the alcoholic drinks were far from alcoholic... but I did get a free cup with purchase and the service was good. However, I definitely don't plan on going back.

I was really hoping that my first time at Bubba Gump's would be a 4/5 star experience but I just ended up getting screwed! (Sorry, I just HAD to add that last part bwahaha)
author: Lynn T.

description:
Finally made it....glad I didn't rush! LOL!

It's a little over rated. Too many workers...they were kinda annoying too! Seems like EVERYONE wanted to help....so much to the point that we got our food before our drinks and appetizer! How backwards is that?? The appetizer came after we'd finished our meal...which also meant that it was on the house...that was the least they could've done.

The food was ok.....agreed expensive, but yah look where were were.

I don't have to come back.....I can think of a few other places to get better and cheaper shrimp dishes! :)
author: Sharee g.

description: I truly love this place... I've driven from Portland or non stop just to make sure i get there for a cup of the clam chowder before they close! Don't miss out!
author: Paul L.

description:
Well for our first time at the San Francisco Bubba Gumps at Pier 39 the experience was wonderful.  The waitress we had explaine dhow everything works there and to use the Run Forest Run or the Stop Forest Stop plates to get the attention of the closest server.  That is a brilliant idea and should be used by every restaurant!  Similar to the Brazillian Carver places with the red and green coins!

I don't remember the waitresses name but she was really good at servicing all her tables and made it a good time to remember.

Definitely going back for more of the good food we had the shrimp sampler and ordered the clams as well.  I enjoyed the Iced tea and Margerita cocktails both were very good and came in a shaker glass 18 or 22oz. I believe.

If you had bad service you had a bad server so go back and try it again you never know what you will get inside!
author: David F.

description: This was visit number 4 for me. Food and service excellent as always (see earlier review Sept 22 2014), my one beef was that, when ordering the beer, the staff didn't ask if we wanted souvenir glass. They are nice and all, but I already have. The glasses add about $6-$7 to bill for 2 people, not much, BUT , is nice to be asked
author: Michael L.

description: LOVE Bubba Gump's!!! If you are looking for a fun place to eat with the fam...this is your place. We went after touring the aquarium of the bay. It was on a weekday and hardly any tourists around. We didn't wait...and got a table by the window. My 3 year old got to see boats cruise around the bay! During our wait for the food, we had a switch in servers..our new server came by twice and even did forrest gump trivia with us. Food was great and I was literally "stuffed" after eating the stuffed shrimp. My son's kids meal came in a cool lil shrimp boat that he played with while eating. :) the run and stop forrest license plate signs on the table came in handy several times and IT WORKS! I was happy to see that any server walking by help us. Parking validation was a plus!!!  Will visit again!
author: Viclaire S.

description: had clam chowder as an appetizer, satisfied the taste buds. The shrimp po-boy was perfect!! Service was awesome, loved the Run Forest Run & Stop Forest Stop sign concept. We had to have 5 different servers stop at our table asking if everything was good. I would definitely visit Forest and the team.
author: Kim M.

description:
I absolutely love Bubba Gump and this goes against every fabric of my being. I typically don't like chain restaurants but on a trip to SF a few years ago we were so disappointed with our restaurant selection so far we said "screw it, we'll at least get a decent meal at a chain." Much to our surprise it was one of the best meals we had all week. I know that's not really a ringing endorsement since I said everything else sucked, but it was really good.

Every time I come to SF, I make sure to stop at the tried and true Bubba Gump. This last time I came into town I ponied up to the bar with a buddy and several hours later we were full of good food and good drink. The bartenders were working their asses off but managed to keep a good conversation going. 

I'm a big service fan. Great food can be killed by bad service and mediocre food can be made good by great service. Bubba has great food and great service. I'd recommend the cajun shrimp!
author: Chris S.

description:
I like Bubba Gump, No, I LOVE BUBBA GUMP.

Great people work here, great people eat here, great food, make me feel so great after eating a whole bucket of shrimp with cajun~ yuuum yumm!
We were not that hungry just now, so we only had a bucket, but next time Bubba.. Next time I promise you I will eat 3 pounds of shrimps... Just watch out! 

They also have a bar with great selections of drinks, a nice place place to hang out with buddies.
author: Marlis T.

description: The atmosphere is a bit loud but very fun. Our waitress kept things lively by hosting a Forrest Gump trivia game with some of the customers. And if you're a fan of the movie Forrest Gump then you're in for a treat! And by the food by the way is great! Try the snapper with lemon sauce! Will definitely be going back!
author: Aaron A.

description: This is the third one I've been to. (Long Beach, Santa Monica) It was my wifes first experience, She really enjoyed it. It is on the pricey side, the food is good , I think you pay more for the experience than the food.
author: John R.

description:
I cannot stand shrimp, but I made myself eat some here.....and if I like shrimp it would have tasted amazing.  Very nice flavors on the shrimp- I just can't get over the texture.
I had their ribs and they were awesome....the staff was very nice too.....explaining how the license plates work.  I was confused at first!  
You have to go their at least once...and many times more if you are a shrimp fan!
author: Bobbi J.

description: Sorry. I live out in Daly City and travel a lot so sometimes am in a rush. Sometimes I'd like to PHONE IN an order for PICKUP but you guys don't do that. I don't understand why. Some people don't have the time to wait 10-15 minutes for an order. Please revise your rules and ALLOW phone orders.
author: Nicole H.

description: Okay so let me just say that my family has always loved Bubba Gumps, but we've always gone to the Monterey Bay location (which is great so don't let bad reviews about this one steer you away from Bubba Gumps for good). We had only been to this location one other time and had no complaints. However, yesterday we spent the morning at the exploratorium and walked over to Bubba Gumps for some good seafood. Obviously there was a wait, it is a tourist attraction, but it wasnt too long. After we were seated we asked if we could have a window seat and one of the waitresses was kind enough to reseat us. Our server was very friendly to us and came up to check on us often and to ask us Forrest Gump trivia which is always fun. Overall good service, however my FOOD was absolutely terrible. I ordered the Captain's Fish and Chips (Mahi Mahi) and after I started eating the fish I noticed a weird texture. I had eaten some of it before I actually inspected it and that's when I saw the batter. The outside looked fresh, fried, and delicious, but once I peeled back the batter, I saw that the inside of it was raw. Completely raw, I was eating fish coated in wet, thick, orange, raw beer batter inside. We notified the waitress and the manager and they took my meal off the bill. They asked if I wanted to order anything else but my appetite was gone so I declined. The rest of my families' food was alright. It wasnt hot and my sister had a raw fry but my dish was the only real problem. Safe to say we wont be coming to the SF Bubba Gumps again.
author: Adri T.

description: I have to say, this one is a must visit restaurant in SF. Jenny's Favorite Catch (fish filet) totally blows my mind. And the view is gorgeous.
author: Lei W.

description:
I must say, if you buy one of their alcoholic drinks you get a damn nice glass to go with it. That being said, the drinks are around $10 and probably have enough alcohol to be called virgins. 

Now you know that if you go to the Bubba Gump Shrimp Corporation on Fisherman's Wharf you're acknowledging to pay a pretty penny for food that may or may not be up to your standards. For example, you get a bowl of clam chowder for $5.50. Yet I think you could get clam chowder of equal or greater quality out of a can. For $13.95 you could get a jumbo shrimp cocktail with surprisingly generous pieces of shrimp with some horseradish and cocktail sauce and be pleased. But yikes. If you go for a bigger entree like Shrimper's Heaven you're going to be paying $20.50 for a bunch of fried things nifty little cones. If that's your thing then go for it. After all you're there for the experience of living in Forrest Gump's "box of chocolates" world!

Considering we were stashed waaay in the back corner with our party of five, we had great service and attentive waiters and bussers that made sure we were taken care of. One of the servers sat down with us and did a little Forrest Gump trivia. (And no there's nothing you win if you get all the questions right). We also had a fabulous view of Alcatraz and the tourists taking pictures below on the wharf. 

Here's the final breakdown:

Food: 3.5 stars.
Service: 5 solid stars. Even the manager said thank you to us as we left the table.
author: Emiko T.

description:
I gave it 3 stars because it was a bit pricey for what you get, but other than that I had a good experience. When we first got to Pier 39 we went straight to Bubb Gump so we could put our name down, they told us that the wait would be an hour and a half. So this gave us time to look around Pier 39 while we waited. After about an hour we went to check back and they took us in. Even though it was super busy, our server was great. He would constantly check up on us. He also had us play a little Forest Gump Trivia game with the table next to us, which was interesting. I didn't mind this, but I know some people probably don't like to be bothered while they eat.

We started out with the Garlic Bread as an appetizer, which was enough for two very hungry people to share. If more than 3 people are in your group, then one order of garlic bread may not be enough. I ordered the Shrimp Shack Mac and Cheese as my main dish, even though it was under the Appetizers. It was so good and so much flavor. For most people, the size of this dish probably wouldn't fill you up, but for me it did it's job. The hubby got the All American Burger and Fries with BBQ Sauce and crispy onions. I assume that he liked it because he took his left overs home.

Side Note- ,if you parked at the garage across the street, make sure you get your parking ticket validated. You just need to bring your restaurant receipt to the Bubba Gump shop and they will validate for you. Before 6pm, you can get 1 hour free validation, after 6pm it is 2 hours free validation. And the garage charges $8 per hour.
author: Dee P.

description:
What I liked most about this place as the location.  I wasn't really impressed by the average food....the service was really friendly though. 

This was a great place to hang out at the bar with a few cold ones and relax.  Great views from the restauarant.  Convenient located in the heart of the Wharf district.  

If you're only in town for a little while I would recommend skipping over this one to find something else....
author: Lisa G.

description: Let's start with the view. It is amazing to sit with a view of the Bay and Alcatraz just a little over a mile away. The restaurant is a machine and the employees are finely tuned parts of that machine. Everything here went perfectly and the food cooked exactly as requested. Nothing to complain about other then perhaps the steep price and long line but you are after-all in one of the most popular tourist locations in the world at Pier 39 in San Francisco. You want that view and the location then you must pay and be willing to wait for it.
author: Drew N.

description: Yes it is overpriced, but what sit down place in Pier 39 isn't???  Good food, good service (in the bar area).  We found a seat at the bar within a minute over waiting 45 minutes for a table so that was a plus.
author: Jeremy W.

description: Long lines today !!!! Great service, great attitude and let's not forget excellent food. Be prepared to wait but also to be well taken care off once inside!!! Great job guys !!
author: Nelson M.

description:
Ah, hell. We as San Franciscans are so so spoiled by the quantity of quality restaurants, that we tend to forget there are many many towns far far away that have neither quantity or quality of restaurants. 

That said, this place satisfies The People's Expectations for a wharf eatery experience. The wait staff is energetic, friendly and witty. The  innovation for the license  plates to get immediate attention for each table is pure genius. The food is the food, and I have no complaints because the tourists just keep-a coming. I am actually pleased that the food and service are as good as they are. Call it a benevolent tourist trap. 

Views are exquisite.
author: Betsy W.

description: Friendly staff and great views.  Predictable food from this popular chain.
author: J J.

description: My boyfriend and I came here on a Monday evening for my late birthday dinner. Although it's only on a Monday but this place is still packed with full of people! My bf and I had waited about 45 min for a table but it was the worth of wait because we end up getting a table with the San Francisco Bay area view, which it was nice! We ordered the Captain's Fish & Chips and Bubba's After the Storm "Bucket of Boat Trash".The meals were O-K but it was ridiculously overpriced for a small portion of food! Besides that, our waitress was very nice and attentive. This place has a great atmosphere, reminded me of Joe's Crabshack.
author: Cam H.

description: We decided to go to Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. Which is on Pier 39. The food was excellent! They had the best hush puppies I've ever tasted and the shrimp were delicious. Great service. Our server came multiple times to refill drinks & make sure everything was ok. The downsides to this place were the wait time, which was 50 minutes for 5 of us, and it was very crowded. The tables are very close together and everybody is trying to talk over each other. So the noise level is very high.
author: Benjamin G.

description: First time at bubba gumps, November 11th 2012 right after the 49ers played the rams game that I had gone to. We were put on a waiting list for about 20 minutes then got seated. They had really good onion strings, my husband really loved the crab pot and calamari. Service was great and when you turn the license plate over to stop forrest stop they help you right away and get you what you need. The only reason I gave it 4 stars was cause we went on veterans day and they gave no discount for military/veterans. I was very disappointed they could have done something special for my husband.
author: Lindsey B.

description:
I like this place a lot, there is many good things that can be said about Gumps. I do really enjoy the atmosphere and the servers. The shrimp is on the smaller side, but still very tasty. 

My favorite dish is the Im stuffed shrimp but the last couple of times I went, it was too lemony. 

The parking is the reason for the 3 stars. I would give it a higher rating but the last couple of times the quality is going down, too Lemony, and too small of shrimp.
author: Travis L.

description:
I just wanted to check this place out during my trip.  I was quite below expectations.  Maybe it's because of the location, and the name that I expected so much, but it didn't do it's job.

The server did their job well, so I tipped her well.  It is NEVER the server's fault when the food is not that good, and some people just make the server a scapegoat.  

I ordered 3/4lbs garlic peel & eat shrimp bucket with garlic bread.  The  garlic bread was nice, but the shrimp was cold when I got it.   The amount was decent, and I wish I had ordered 1 1/2lbs.They must have made my food and let it stand for a while.  

Nothing much to say.  Pier 39 is overrated, and spend time no more than and hour of your whole time in San Francisco.
author: Bum Soo K.

description:
The cold breeze rushed through my sweater as the distracting slippery floor left me tipped in an awkward stance.

It's actually not that hard to write an entire essay about this place; maybe even a speech. The service was nice, but the wait and the conditions of the place are just too much to bare. 

You could feel the ocean breeze from all directions because in the afternoon they leave doors and windows open. Ugh, what I can't stand is a cold breeze making my food cold. 

They also are stingy on their shrimp leaving half the container with lettuce and only a couple pieces of shrimp. For 20+ dollars I am expecting damn more. 

The only think keeping this place from being a one star joint is the friendly tolerable service and the cool things to look at while waiting. Other than that, I'd rather go spend my 40 dollars else where.
author: Christine T.

description:
2 stars chain food, high price and stingy servings

service is good they got a flip sign on the table where you flip it if you need service or flip it again for no service kinda like eating at a fresh choice but for seafood

for about 20 dollars will get you a less then a stellar meal with more veggies to cover up the seafood you ordered, and this is not the salad I ordered, if it is a chain you expect more food and maybe cheaper prices but i guess because it is at the pier so they have to make rent somehow.

good for groups or for out of towners that cant decide where they want to eat, they just know they want to eat in or by the pier haha

food ** food is ok.. portion is small
service ***** helpful staff
price $$$
ambiance ** alot of junk thrown on the walls, licenses, old posters, fishing, crabbing, lobster traps and much more
author: Clarence A.

description: I have been here a few times. Always very busy but has great customer service and the food is always good. The desert sampler is amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Alex M.

description:
Fun place to go with the family or friends... it's loud, so not a romantic date sorta place. It's definitely something you gotta try out at least once if you are a fan of the movie, solely to be quizzed on the movie trivia through out your meal. 

The food's all right, and they definitely have a lot of seafood options so that's nice. On the price-ier side like you'd expect from a Pier 39 diner.

Love the Speckled Lemonade (strawberry chunks at the bottom), enjoy it virgin or with a little something to thin the blood. ;)

Love Jenny's Strawberry Surprise (a HUGE Strawberry Shortcake dessert) -- however I haven't had it in YEARS, so I don't know if it's still on the menu. I think it might be seasonal. SO FRIGGIN' FINGER LICKIN DELICIOUS. 

Also, this past weekend (Apr 2010), the bartenders were awesome.
author: Shannel G.

description: Amazing!!!! The service was great and the food was really good. I had the Dixie Style Ribs which were the best ribs I've had in the states. My dad had the Shrimp New Orleans which he loved too, it had lots of garlic for the garlic lover. My mom tried the Fish and Chips and she thought they were okay. 5 out of 5!
author: Pernilla A.

description: My Fiance' and I went to Bubba Gumps @ Pier 39 for a quick lunch recently.  The hostesses seemed confused as to who should seat us and where we should be seated. The view of the bay was beautiful on an unusually clear day.    We both ordered a cup of clam chowder and a shrimp trio basket to share.  Our shrimp trio came before our soup.  The shrimp trio would have been a good meal for one person but we decided to share because it was pricey.  We didn't order any cocktails and our bill was still $48!  I was expecting to pay closer to $30 for lunch.  Had the prices been a bit more reasonable we both would have had full lunches but we weren't prepared to pay close to $100 for lunch.  I would like to go to Bubba Gumps more often but their menu prices will prohibit it.    I don't remember Babba Gumps being so pricey, but it has been quite a while since I've been there.
author: Shery M.

description: YUMMY!!! The food is always delicious here and the service is always fun! The lady below who complained about their server giving them a roll of paper towels as their prize is being a little too sensitive. They always do that, it's their "gimmick". Anyways, there is such a variety of food and it's always fresh and yummy!
author: Eliana A.

description:
So sad to see so-so reviews about this location!
I've been here multiple times and have always had a pretty good experience. I've been going for the past few years and love it. Of course everything is Forrest Gump related. The movie is playing constantly on the televisions, the tables, the walls, all the decorations are awesome. And what I love most is that it's directly on top of the water. If you get a window seat, you see all the waves beneath you and it's really nice.

When I was in high school, my boyfriend at the time had taken me here to eat, and it was our first time at this location. We had an awesome server who made us laugh the entire time and gave us friendly service. The atmosphere was great and inviting. At the end of our meal, our server brought me out the large cookie dessert (which, by the way, was the most amazing cookie dessert I've EVER HAD!) with a candle in it, and on the plate it read "Homecoming?" in hot fudge...... My boyfriend asked the server if they would help ask me to the Homecoming dance on a dessert, and they more than happily helped out. I thought it was fabulous they took the extra time to help him like that. Now THAT is what I call customer service.

Yes, the food is a little pricey, but we know the servers or managers can't control that. But we've always had great experiences here. Best Bubba Gump's I've ever been to!
author: A. L.

description: Food was pretty good but it's the fun of the restaurant and the view (worth the wait for a window table) that makes the experience ;) if you loved the movie you will love this place!
author: Andrea B.

description: Love seafood? Then you've come to the right place! I ordered the 1/4 lb shrimp catcher's net and it was absolutely delicous! Our server Jason was very friendly and attentive.  The ambiance was nice and fitting to the movie Forrest Gump.  There's plenty of dishes to choose from you just have to bring your appetite!
author: Marissa T.

description:
First time here and I will make an effort to make it the last time. I ended up paying $150 for the meals. I cannot grasp the concept why seafood cost more in San Francisco than Arizona. We order the clams and crabs and they are expensive!!! a simple soup and cesar salad (very bland) cost $16???? For $150 i would expect a feast but instead I walked away extremely disappointed. The place is popular but I feel sorry for those who walked in (myself included). Also I do not appreciate the mandatory tips. I have no critics on their service but it is not worth the $23 tips. 

I would strongly suggest people not going to this restaurant. All in all I have better food going to my local Chinese seafood restaurants where I can have unlimited snow crabs and tasty clams for 1/3 the price.
author: Tommy L.

description:
Good food, great service. 
Got the stuffed shrimp and it was yummy (though I have to admit our cute waiter was pretty yummy lookin' too)
author: Sheri K.

description:
I'm not a chain restaurant hater. (Themed restaurants I am a little less tolerant of.) I enjoy a greasy Bloomin' Onion or Chili's margarita with the best of them. But if you found Forrest Gump, the movie, to be cheesy, prepare yourself for this lame-ass place.

My Mom and her husband were in San Francisco for one day, and this is where they chose to eat. In fact, Mom's husband had been anticipating his trip and Bubba Gump's was a huge, huge part of that. Don't ask, people: I don't know what ails him.

I felt ashamed at this place. In a city with affordable, delicious, plentiful seafood, was I really sitting in this joint that could just as easily be in Wichita, Dayton or Detroit? The food was on par with Red Lobster, but the servers much, much more annoying. 

It's huge, and crowded and full of clueless tourists. I know, I brought two of them there. It was expensive, loud and you had to flip a card on the table to get a server's attention. I wanted out of there ASAP.

If you like gimmicks, super sweet cocktails in shrimp-shaped glasses and immense guilt about not opting for a locally owned, mom and pop restaurant, then run to this place with a quickness.
author: Brittney G.

description: This place has great energy with every staff member having an extra pep in their step. Our waitress Ezra was quick with everything and really nice as well! I would definitely recommend coming in for a few drinks and appetizers at the least
author: Brett Z.

description: We came here for dinner one evening. The wait for a table was long and they don't do reservations so you just have to sick it out. When we finally got seated the atmosphere inside was cute.. very touristy though. The view of the ocean and Alcatraz from our table was amazing. We ordered several different kinds of shrimp as appetizers and they were ALL delicious. I deeply appreciated that they didn't put to much horseradish in their cocktail sauce. For my entree I got the grilled mahi over rice with lemon butter sauce and tomatoes. It was not nearly as good as the shrimp. The mahi was dry and overcooked, the sauce lacked flavor and the whole dish felt kind of cheap. So my word if advice would be stick to the shrimp! My only other gripe was that the service was very slow.. granted, the place was packed, but a tourist trap like this is predictably packed all the time so the management should know to staff properly to handle the business. They are failing a bit there.
author: Tracy H.

description: Went on forth of July with my family for my sons birthday. They said it would be a 3 hr wait. Ended up waiting 30 mins. Service was great and food was good. We will come back.
author: Monica R.

description:
You gots to be kidding me...  overcrowded, overpriced, crappy shrimp dishes.
Red Lobster ain't classy, but their AYCE shrimp blows this place out of the water, so you can imagine what you're not missing.
BTW- hats off to Barry, who pounded the fried shrimp platter in, what, 5 min?  dude, the ocean's calling...
oh yeah, run Forrest, run, far away from here.
author: Roni L.

description: This is a plain old regular chain food place.  Nothing special and all just heated up frozen food.  They even have Glueten free menu listed on line BUT once asked they have stopped this.  Manager came over and just started making up stuff and of course we figured out the basics.  Then the waiter struggled with delivering a beer.  he was more into his talking to co workers then returning with a beverage. I just not happy and would have rather gone to Jack in the Box.
author: Dave P.

description: This place has become a tradition for my friends and I, you are right on the water and three experience is light hearted and family oriented. Food is a little bit expensive,.but well worth it. The staff are wonderful and always seat us where we request to be seated
author: Nicole C.

description:
Likey the cajun shrimp that me and my friend savored until the last bits of sauce in the plate. Others were okay only

A bit pricey but in Pier 39, which one isn't?

Fun little place with friendly servers.
Good for tourists
author: Cliff T.

description: First time eating here, although I've always wanted too. Was alittle dissapointed that they didn't have many choices for lobster or crab. We ordered a bucket of crab legs and a shrimp sandwich. Drinks were good, staff was very friendly. Place is always packed!
author: Candy P.

description: This was my sons first time to eat at Bubba Gumps. We had a good meal.I ordered the crab it was very good. They charged market value which means you don't know how much it cost unless you ask. It came with a bowl of rice and a piece of bread. This place is friendly and we enjoyed our time here.
author: Jessica S.

description: I've had better experiences at Bubba. I went with my mother and my gf this past Sunday thinking it would be nice. First off the wait is crazy (my mistake Pier 39 never again). My mother food was under seasoned. My plate was good. My girls plate was made as requested so was sent back. Then the replacement order took nearly 20mins to be served and it was overcooked, so of coursed we sent that back. Luckily the manager was willing to not charge us and even offered to make another complimentary.
author: Joe R.

description:
I been going there for years and it's always been on the expensive side but I like the views of the bay. I decided to go with my wife, son, daughter in law and my two grand kids
Ages 1 and 5. I had a good time and they sang happy birthday to my one year old granddaughter.
When the bill came  they charged me 18% tip for having a large group counting my
1 yr old daughter and 5yr old grandson as patrons. I lost it because I been coming there for years and never have been charged this mandatory tip for kids.

So be aware about this when taking your kids, on the back of the menu in tiny 
Letters in red it declares kids count as patrons.

I spoke to the manager suggested telling patrons up front about tip charge so it won't spoil your good time at end of your meal when you get the bill.

Beware you don't have to pay the 18% but  they don't tell you that.

Greed and deception ruin a good thing espeally for family's  who are on a budget.
author: Rafael I.

description: 5 stars for serving Jasmine rice!!!!! Gotta have my (authentic) rice!
author: Debbie Downer D.

description:
I'm noticing alot of bad reviews on this place. I came here once a few years ago, it must have still been good then. I loved every minute of it. For one thing, one of my all time favorite movies is FOREST GUMP, and this restaurant has done a great job decorating accordingly. The wall that has the list of shrimp dishes Bubba describes in the movie... "shrimp stew, shrimp salad, shrimp sandwich, shrimp and potata's, shrimp creole, shrimp burboun" well you get the idea. The waiters were coming around to our tables and asking us trivia questions from the movie, and if we answered all of them right, we got free dessert. 

Who were the two musicians  Forest Gump meets? Well that would be Elvis Presley and John Lennon. 

I remember the food being really good, I had mahi mahi and it was delicious. I've always wanted to go back, I hope it is as good as I remember it.
author: Susie C.

description:
Although the wait was pretty long, it was worth it I'd say.  The atmosphere is the best part.  They have great drinks and food and it's on the pier so that's pretty cool.  
A great place to take visiting guest or for tourists.
author: Ashley W.

description: Second Bubba Gump Shrimp I've been to and pleased with my time there again.  The food is always pretty yummy and drinks are too.  The popcorn shrimp is really good.  Best thing about the SF Bubba Gump Shrimp Co. in San Fran?...the bartender, Ian.  He was so engaging and gave us all kinds of pointers for our 4-night stay in the city.  When we were about to leave, he even went over to the Bubba store and grabbed the souvenir glasses for us that we had accumulated from our drink purchases.  Above and beyond...thanks again, Ian!
author: Beth R.

description:
Look, I know it's touristy.

I know that everytime I'm near the wharf I want to poke my eyeballs out.

But damn, I do like eating pound after pound of shrimp!  Yum!
author: Matthew R.

description:
I was a tourist and dammit I wanted to eat some touristy seafood at Pier 39!  We wandered around for a bit, checking out menus and settled on this place - I wanted crab, he wanted shrimp, and we didn't want to spend all of our booze money on lunch.

Touristy it was! The crab legs were exactly what I was looking for though, and my bf was happy with the shrimp combo he got.  The prices were completely fair for the amount of food and the service was about as good as could be expected for someplace so busy.

3 stars because every server we interacted with was ANNOYING.  I get it - your gimmick is Forrest Gump and if your manager catches you not asking us trivia questions about the movie you'll get into trouble but for the love of all that's holy, you barely speak English! I can't understand a lot of what you are saying to me anyway and I'm trying really politely to not engage in the trivia game so take the hint and go away! 

The next time I am being a tourist in SF I will eat touristy food somewhere else, just for a new experience, but I'd recommend this to anyone looking for a tasty lunch at Pier 39.
author: Kat F.

description: I had just gone for the trivia- I've seen the movie over 20 times (who hasn't?) and know the entire dialogue. We had to wait for the manager to come by to ask us if we had been quizzed, and that wasn't until the end of our meal. I was bummed. I've had better mojitos- the one they make at the Westin Inn at the Union Square is so fresh that I could sustain myself alone on it for the entire day. I must say, the Bubba Gump's view was great. I mean, you do pay up the butt for ambiance, so expect it the food to be mediocre, but enjoy the experience- if the get to your table in time.
author: Jasmine G.

description: It's not that bad, especially at Lunch Time!  Great Views, OK food.  It's Fishermans Wharf Damnit!!
author: Ty A.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE. OMG Everyone is so friendly here. We came on Valentine's day and me and my husband noticed how friendly everyone was. As we were leaving and passed employees on our way out of Bubba Gump they all told us to have a great day and Happy Valentines and we were just wowed. LOL. We will totally come back. The view was amazing, the service and the food were superb. I totally recommend this place if you come to Fisherman's Wharf in SF.
author: Lucia N.

description: Get a seat by the window. Order Coconut Shrimp and extra marmalade sauce. Smother the fries with Bubba Gump's hot sauce and enjoy!
author: A R.

description:
I will always remember this place as the restaurant that boo'd me. Really.

Don't make the mistake of telling your waiter that you never saw the movie Forrest Gump. He will chide you, announce it to the entire room, and then have everyone boo you on the count of three.

According to my friends, my face turned pale white before it became red from the embarrassment. Ha ha.
author: Lubs Y.

description: On sunday 11/23/14 me and my girlfriend went to San Francisco for the day while there th he one place she wanted to go was here to eat so we. Right when we walked in we knew we would have to wait and we were okay with that. But the two girls that were at the front were very rude on how they were talking to us and how they asked for my name it felt like they could care less. I get it was busy but still that is the first thing that people see when coming in if we really didn't want to eat there we would have lefted. Not only were they rude they called people before us and I went up and asked weren't we before them and they said my bad I skipped you. Really?? Once we got in the food was great and the workers were really great. I wish I got the two girls name thay were at the front so I could write their names down. We will still come back there cause of the great food but hopefully those two girls won't be there.
author: Adam L.

description:
Shrimp oh Shrimp, how I love thee...

Yup, I'm a shrimp lover. That's why I really do like this place.

Don't get me wrong though, in a city like SF where you can be surrounded by authentic ethnic food and mom and pop shops, this is definitely a tourist trap...but one bite of the "I'm Stuffed!" shrimp stuffed with crab, and nothing else in the world matters.

So satisfy your touristy side and drop by Bubba Gump. The atmosphere is hectic in a fun rowdy way, and the service is quick (especially due to the signs on the table). Order the "I'm Stuffed" Shrimp. You won't be sorry.
author: Shafaq C.

description:
Came to the Bubba Gump Shrimp Company right after the Monterey Aquarium with the Husband and son. The atmosphere and service was pretty nice which brought our target at 3.5 stars. 

We followed our appetizers with the Cajun Shrimp and 2 Jenny Favorite smoothies and Cesar salad including some kind of dish that serves with a tower of shrimp and dips. 

Although, we didn't order as much, we racked up to about $75 dollars. Which kind of killed our pockets right out. Though the food was good, I think i can get a better price at a different restaurant, which brought the rating down to a 2.5. 

It took awhile for us to get the waiter's attention to get our check, which took about 15 to 20 minutes, which was sort of annoying because our son was somewhat disturbing the peace for other customers, and we wanted to leave early since that it be best, would of expected better, but i'll just leave it at 2 stars.

Service: 4 stars.
Food: 3 stars, yet overpriced.
Worth coming: Not really.
In the end: 2 stars.
author: Carol T.

description: a great place to be part of the collective! An epic movie transformed this joint to bubbas dream..shrimp recipes galore..seems to work out ok for the dishes do come out edible..a little sarcasm is in order..for the asian themed dishes are not very good at all..the rice is not well cooked and the fish dishes are al beit salty....but redemption came to the peel and each shrimp which are delicious and finger lickin..  3/4 pound is not enough for two people get at least 2-3 orders of this you wont get disappointed.   3/5 judofingerlickin
author: Dustin G.
