description: I did get an email from the general manager who apologized profusely and offered to refund the money spent here. I thought that was nice of him...but I'd rather my server just learn some manners instead.
author: Jessica K.

description: Food was overpriced and over cooked. Not worth a stop with so many other options nearby. Cutsey does not replace edible.
author: Jack C.

description:
I was craving some fish & chips and since we were at Pier 39, we decided to do the touristy thing and went to Bubba Gump's. 

We were greeted right away. We requested a window seat and were told it would be a 15 minute wait. We sat at the bar and didn't get a chance to order our drinks as a few minutes later our table was ready. 

I had a Tropical Breeze which you can never go wrong with Malibu Rum in my book. My friend ordered some Mango concoction and took a sip and didn't like it. Our server offered to replace it with another drink and didn't charge us which I thought was nice. 

The fish & chips were very good. Fresh Mahi-Mahi. Coleslaw was pretty good also. 

Although I thought the food and drinks were a bit pricey, it's not unexpected as this is in Pier 39. 

Good service and good food.
author: Monica M.

description:
First of all my boyfriend had a serious decision over why it's called a bucket of trash" but most importantly wny I order it and love it?

Of course "Shots, Shots, Shots...repeat" like the lil Jon song says.

A couple of drinks and minutes of watching the birds pick up their food to go,... our food comes...

Fried Shrimp, crab claw, breaded fish and fries... hmmm... a heart attack in a bucket and I loved it!
author: Nicole R.

description: I love this Bubba Gump's restaurant. The energy is fabulous. The hosts and waitstaff know their menu and are willing to make recommendations.  They will substitute chicken for seafood in certain dishes, a nice option for the non-seafood lovers. The decor is fun with all the Forrest Gump displays, and the staff enjoys challenging customers with movie trivia questions. Water and drinks were refilled regularly. I have had their salads, spinach and artichoke dip, and pasta, and enjoyed every bite. After a number of visits, I can honestly say that I have received and enjoyed the best service consistently. Great for visitors and fun for kids who have seen the movie. Not a romantic or quiet location.
author: Shauna H.

description:
Worth the try... 

So my friends and I were so hungry we ended up being near this restaurant.  We requested to be seated by the view which was nice even on a typical foggy day.  My friends and I ordered 2 steamed shellfish for $24.95 each per 2 people for a party of 4.  When it arrived it our impressions were fooled! The pictures do lie cause when we received it in pots, it wasn't even full it was just half way full.  The mussels were so small also! Good thing we ordered two pots for 4 people or else it would of been gone all at once.  We also ordered calamari for $9.99 on the side because we weren't even full from what we ordered.  While we were eating they have this trivia about the movie Forest Gump and we weren't totally prepared for it but we gave it a shot.  I felt like the trivia was a joke because it was such a teaser.  Oh well. At least it was worth trying the place since we all heard about it before.

It could be better in terms of serving portions.
author: Sharjah M.

description:
There are some restaurants where I'm a one dish kinda guy, and this is one of those places! Here it's the I'm Stuffed Shrimp - large shrimp stuffed with crab, baked in garlic butter and topped with Monterey Jack Cheese, served on with jasmine rice. Scrumptious!

Please don't ask me any Forrest Gump trivia though.
author: Steve S.

description: I came here and had a really good experience. I came with a group of 8 and we had thee nicest server. He kept us entertained and checked up on us consistrntlly. The food was good, but not to die for or anything. The wait was for about an hour, but the great service was well worth it. Good job Bubba Gumps.
author: Linda V.

description:
Price + Location = higher expectations.

This place satisfies hunger, but isn't the place to go for a meal you can walk away truly happy from.  The waitstaff is friendly, but there is always a wait, as the place is packed and pretty noisy at all times of day.  Restrooms on three separate occasions were not well-maintained. However, view is very nice and can be seen from many points in the dining area.

The standard seafood selections are o.k. with the safe choices of fish and chips, and the more interesting ones like seared halibut with rice and some kind of creamy sauce (not worth $18.95).  The desserts are HUGE, sweet, and very average --strawberry shortcake and chocolate cake were just okay.  The drinks are typical, but follow the food portions, and are quite large (blueberry and strawberry lemonades are the better of the lot).  Cocktails are exciting to order and you get to keep the cup/shaker combo, but have probably more sugar and color(?) than anything else.

Overall a bit under average place that could be good for large groups and birthdays.  Most likely won't be back anytime soon as this is more of a 'touristy' spot and I've had much better.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Not terrible, not very good either. Too expensive and not very original. Cute restaurant theme, though. :)
Why is it so damn hard to find good seafood at FISHERMANS wharf??
author: Bibby L.

description: We stopped here while walking around pier 39 as it had more options for my husband vs the other restaurants at the pier.  We ordered the popcorn shrimp and calamari.  Having both, made for a very greasy start to dinner.  I just had the chowder and salad which was fine, my husband had the shrimp new Orleans which he really enjoyed.  It is more of a touristy resturant  that tends to be loud and crowded during peak time. I would give it 3 star and my husband would give it 4 so I went with a 4star rating.
author: Stacie A.

description:
I'm Conflicted about this place. 

Every time I take my friends here, it's disastrous!  

The servers are rude / distracted or my friends' orders get screwed up.

On one occasion, our server had such a crummy attitude we made an inside joke about it.  
Now, whenever we call each other out on a crappy mood we say " Don't be such a Russel!" ( our sourpuss waiter's name.)

On the other hand, 

Whenever my sweetheart and I go, we always have the nicest servers, the freshest food and the best time!

The view is absolutely breathtaking at sunset and the the servers make a big deal if they find out you are a birthday girl ( or boy)

So..

I'd say I'm split on this place.

I'd recommend going if you are a couple but not if you are a group. 

The place is always packed and the servers can get overwhelmed.
author: Sarah S.

description: This was my first stop after I arrived in San Francisco as I was very hungry. My friend received the wrong dish, the beer is very expensive, and service was terrible and our server didn't check on us once.
author: Ashlee K.

description: if you plan on ordering any of the fried food (calamari, popcorn shrimp) be prepared for a bunch of breaded pepper fillers.. never again!
author: Bernard K.

description: Came here with the family and had a great time! The food is really good, and growing up next to the bay --- we know good seafood from bad! But I was stuffed and very happy as I slipped into the food coma. The service was also nice! Our wait or was super funny and gave us yummy recommendations. Next time I'm in the area I definitely have to hit this place again. And again.
author: Jordan W.

description: This is my 3rd Bubba in 3 different cities. Same quality when it comes to food and the service is always great. I like the fact that the wait time was only 5 minutes, but this makes me wonder if there are better shrimp places at the Fisherman's Wharf that I probably missed. My very minor complaints are that the shrimps are undernourished and the blue lemon-up was actually green.
author: Rey Q.

description:
Oh, Where to begin it all? So much changed in the restaurant in 6 months, that It's almost unbelievable. 

First off, They must read Yelp, because they finally stopped giving everyone movie trivia. It was fun if you love the movie, but the Fifth time around with those questions, you just want to ram a wooden stake through your heart (or theirs, but let's be less violent, shall we?).

I will never be a fan of sea food, which makes me question why I like this place so much. However, Everything else, such as Their burgers, sandwiches, And Caesar Salad is really good. I love the Caesar salad quite a bit, actually. Great atmosphere. I think the number one problem with people who had to yell at Waiters for service, is that they forgot the sign quirk. I like it, It's much better than having managers coming Awkwardly for no reason to ask if you need anything. 

Just a minor quirk that sets me off, however:

They make the whole thing themed like the movie, which I LOVE. Another thing: In the movie, Forrest Gump's favorite drink is Dr. Pepper. At Bubba gumps, It seemed as if it was the best made Dr, Pepper ever. It was SUPER good. The soda machine NEVER broke for that. 

However, When I came recently, the whole table was going to have a round of Dr. Peppers. The only problem: They replaced it with Raspberry Iced tea. Wait, Wah? 

(meanwhile, in the back room, some guy is editing every Dr Pepper bottle in the Movie to look like Raspberry tea...)

Yeah. Minor disappointment. Seriously, I was going to down like, 25 of those things.

Other than that and the prices (what do you expect? It's a tourist trap),
Its a really good place to eat.
author: Jake L.

description: bubba as bubba is supposed to be! good food... love the vibe, energy, enthusiam, service and good
author: Angel D.

description: waterfront seating to enjoy our delicious lunch of clam chowder, berry/prawn salad followed by a crab/prawn/jasmine rice dish that I had while my husband was enjoying his gumbo and all the prawns, crab legs, lobster, and shell fish that came out of a bucket accompanied by jasmine rice....we will definitely go back again.....Rebecca who took our luncheon order at the Pier 39 location on 10/22/2015 was a gem....always smiling and at our table to meet every whim we may have had, but never hovering....besides it being a beautiful day in San Francisco, lunch at Bubba's topped it off.
author: Jan P.

description: Absolutely love Bubba Gumps I always get the bucket of boat trash
author: Justin S.

description:
Considering the prices and location, I would had thought the food would had been better or at least the place cleaner. We came here right after spending the morning at Alcatraz. We got a table very quickly and was seated next to a window so we could see the sailboats. 

We wanted a couple cocktail virgins but was the same price with and without alcohol so skipped it. We ended up ordering a few ice teas, soda, the pound and a half of shrimp, a sampler, coconut shrimp, a shrimp brisket and a bowl of clam chowder. 

The utensils was not the only thing dirty. A couple of the ice teas had green stuff stuck to the side of the glass. The tables were kind of sticky. And the plates also had some whitish stuff stuck to them. 

The food itself tasted like Denny's quality. The shrimp brisket had so much oil, when I ate the bread the oil lined my stomach so bad. None of the shrimp was fresh in anyway, most likely using frozen shrimp.
author: M C.

description: Got here at 11 am to avoid a packed house.  Food is what I expected from bubba gumps but what i did not expect was the bad service we got...party of 10, checks split in 3 and a gratuity of 18% was added to each bill.  We had to set our own table, drinks were messed up more than once and we were never checked on when this place was pretty dead compared to its lunch rush.  Will probably go to boudins next time I go to pier 39.
author: Nick F.

description:
Imagine the Dow Jones Industrial Average starting at 10,000 and then just dropping... That's what eating and returning to Bubba Gump's Shrimp Company is like... the fun level just keeps dropping. 

Your First Visit goes like this: 
Ahh look how much fun we're having! We're eating at that place just like in Forrest Gump! lol Fried Shrimp, Popcorn Shrimp, Shrimp Gumbo... lol remember? Ahh Crackers! Ahh window seat! Oh man look at these cool "Run Forrest, Stop Forrest" signs! How clever! The employees are so cool! Oh man is this guy gonna ask us Forrest Gump trivia? Oh Snap it's Forrest Gump sitting outside! Holy Crap i'm pulling my hair out i'm having so much fun here! 

And then on your second visit, it's like:
Damn i don't remember the prices being so high last time we came here... Well at least we're sitting by the window. Yes, we know how the stop signs work, thanks. Damn the crackers they keep here at the table are pretty good... but is our food almost here yet? Hmm, i don't remember the portions being that small, either. Oh sure, we'll play Forrest Gump trivia... Yeah, i know, you guys asked me that question last time, too. Oh look, it's that Forrest Gump guy sitting outside again. 

And on your third visit:
Wait, why did we come back here again? Forget it, let's just go get some of those Trish's Mini-Donuts downstairs... Hey look, it's that Forrest Gump guy sitting outside again.

Your first trip will be a 5, your second trip will be a 3, and if you ever decide to go back, you'll probably rate it a 1. Don't get me wrong, it was fun the first time i went, but that's why it's at a tourist destination- it's kinda a one time only deal.
author: Greg G.

description: Best crab stuffed mushrooms ever and service was exceptional for being so busy . Not along wait for the food to arrive big fat thumbs up
author: Tobey W.

description: Please prepare your tilapia dish in a manner that does not get people horribly sick like it did with my most recent visit. That's not the quickest way to get more fans. It IS the quickest way to get SHUT DOWN!
author: Rob H.

description: This was my first time eating at Bubba Gumps and I was told that it would be great. Little did I know the service and food would be atrocious. First off the Gentleman at the gift shop insulted my friends and me. Then our server made it his job to insult me, not only did I feel belittled by our server but another server came up and hit the back of my seat as hard as he could as if to get my attention. None the less that is not how you treat a customer. After waiting for our food we were served what I believe was garlic bread, although it tasted like pure oil and everything fell off. Our main corse was taken to a completely different table. So at a table of four half of our food was there and we waited another 15 mins for the other half. I was over joyed to finally try the famous Bubba Gumps! Yet as soon as I went to eat my sandwich I pulled out a piece of white hair. When shown to the server he denied that it was a hair but still offered me another sandwitch. The entire experience left me so upset I refused to eat anything. Honestly I would never go back.
author: Brittney S.

description: Just had dinner there with large HCCA group - most of us from out of town.  Food and service were terrible.  Steak dinner not edible - way overdone and hard to cut, potatos stone cold - wait staff would not change.  Would not come here again.
author: Dave M.

description:
I guess you wouldn't go here for the food or service.  Good to go just to try it out, especially if you are a tourist. The service was sort of slow.  The wait was terrible, took 25-30 minutes- then again its a tourist attraction, well the pier is.   

While waiting for your food, the waiter will give you a quiz on the movie Forest Gump.  Pretty fun, they try.  

Margaritas could be better. lol.
author: charles a.

description:
Its good decent. I would go back for more if in the mood. Service is always great here, they are all friendly I like the movie questions they randomly ask.

I think is is a great place for out of town people.
author: Conchita B.

description: This place is served me salty calamari.  Serving something like that either means you dont give a crap about the customers who pay a high price for food.  They couldn't offer a fresh plate because they make a 'batch' for the night. So they offered us something else.  The cost of the meal was 177 which was high for what i've paid at many other restaurants with my same group.   They no longer offer refills on strawberry lemonade which seems to be a bit sticking point for some restaurants. Some do, some don't.  this is the only drink i normally order and didn't because of the .99 cent refill policy which didn't exist the last time i came. This place is not packed like it use to be for a sat night and prob will be this way for years
author: Bjj P.

description:
The food was not bad at all, but the food poisoning from the fish I had was terrible... I had nothing but that so I am certain it was the food and my doctor confirmed that it was in fact food poisoning...  

The staff was really nice, the services was good, prices a bit too high for what you get and they didn't follow up after their research regarding this issue... I just didn't want other people to order the same dish and get sick... I had Jenny's Catch (this time they had Ttilapia fish :(  like I said the taste was good, but unfortunately it led to a really bad food poisoning that I'm still recovering from... 

My family that are from San Fran (we were just visiting for the weekend) told me they go to Bubba Gump for drinks only.   Hope no one else got this that day, but all it takes it one bad fish!
author: LBN L.

description: This place is yummmm! Their dishes and appetizers are delicious. I am not a seafood person, but this place makes their food taste not fishy at all. so much flavor. The view they have is gorgeous. I cant wait to come back. Prices are not crazy. My friend and I had the bourbon halibut dish with shrimp appetizers, 1 coke and i had some dranks all for about 70 something dollars. right??? not bad!!!
author: Brenda S.

description: This place is great! It's on the wharf so it can be pricey - but if you are on the wharf you should expect to pay more. And seriously, it's all about Forest Gump (great movie). We went for a birthday and even though it was crowded the wait wasn't too long. We waited for a table overlooking the water and it was well worth the wait. The food was good: the Popcorn Shrimp app was really good and the Cordon Bleu Chicken Sandwich ROCKED) and the service was GREAT!!!!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
=========  =========  =========  =========
 Food      l  l   Decor         l  l  Service    l  l    Cost    
=========  =========  =========  =========
l      3        l  l        5         l  l       2           l  l         $20       
=========  =========  =========  =========

Many diners enjoy the aptly named "Boat Trash" entree because they would eat "fresh dolphin shit" if it were "breaded and deep fried."   Some tourists like to come here for "the sophisticated feel"  because they "ain't had nothin' this delicious since the Johnson twins burnt down the Sizzler last 4th of Joo-lie."  

Other tourists noted that Bubba Gump is "conveniently located near the wax museum and Pier 39" and far away from "where the queers are."
author: Jay Z.

description:
I sat next to a waitress from here the other day during lunch at herbivore.  When I overheard her telling someone that she is a waitress at Bubba Gump's, I leaned over to offer my sincere apologies.  (Just FYI: If you are sitting next to me in a restaurant and talking loudly, I will make it a point to know your business.)  She gave me a seemingly genuine thank you and informed me that she is looking for a new job.  I told her the hustler club is hiring and i mean, sure she would have to strip herself of both her clothes and dignity (I mean the dignity thing was obviously not big with her...she's working at BUBBA GUMP SHRIMP COMPANY) but I hear the money is GREAT!  

God, looking back, I actually said that straight faced to the poor girl...what she must thought of me!  Why am i such a rotten bitch?  Note to self: must re-evaluate entire personality and possibly get a lobotomy.

p.s. working here must be the 10th layer of hell.  one so scary that Dante himself couldn't even begin to describe it.  All I know if that if one drunk frat boy told me to, "run, forest, run!" to get his basket o' fried shrimp, it would be fucking over.  OVER.
author: Laura B.

description: The place is loud. The food is less then average. Service is slow. Prices are outrageous. I will never go back.
author: Chef PrettyKelly P.

description: Busy place for Saturday lunch. Great view of the bay. Food was good and service was friendly. Definitely not a quiet place.
author: Colin P.

description:
To the tune of, "Jessie's Girl" by Rick Springfield. 

Bubba is a friend. 
Yeah, I know he's been a friend of Forrest
But lately got a craving that ain't hard to define. 
Bubba's got himself a friend and told him about 
'em shrimps. 
And he told him about them shrimps. 
And Forrest listened to Bubba's shrimp cookin'
I just know it. 
Yeah he's listening to him.
Listening 'til late late at night. 

You know, I wish I had Bubba's shrimp. 
I wish that I had Bubba's shrimp. 
Where can I find some shrimp like that. 

You know, I wish I had Bubba's shrimp. 
I wish that I had Bubba's shrimp. 
Where can I find some shrimp like that. 
Like Bubba's shrimp. 
I wish that I had Bubba's shrimp.
I want Bubba's shrimp. 
****************************************************************************
This place is a bit touristy area as it is situated in a touristy spot.  But, it's got a great view of the Bay, and great shrimps.  One of the few places I go to and eat seafood.  We enjoyed the appetizer popcorn shrimp.  Minus one star for the very long wait at times. But, the food is great, the drinks are tasty, and the desserts are big enough to share.
author: Marzan W.

description: Good food but a bit pricey.  Plus they need to turn up the AC a bit as it was really hot inside.
author: Nate P.

description: They aren't very nice and the waiter and waitress they okay but they ignored u a lot made me wait for my food a lot. Loss money here when I came with my wife I accidentally left my wife purse in the booth I was at and stuff. No customer took the money but some employee did cause there no camera there. Insecure and unsafe it supposed to be a good place but they ruin it for me and ilike they said what go around come around.
author: Douglas L.

description: This place was great.  I loved the food & drinks. Artichoke dip was yummy!  Also, depending on what kind of drink you get, you get to keep the glass!  They don't give you the dirty one you had of course, but you show your receipt to the Bubba Gumps store next store & they give you a brand new one in a box.
author: Jocelyn C.

description:
Pricey chain tourist trap w/beer and large portions.

Shrimp, shrimp, and mo' shrimp.

Unless you are feeling glutenous or wanting a super shrimp induced food coma, share the entree! They are very huge. Yes it is a chain, but my out-of-town friends wanted to try it. I had the Dumb Luck Coconut Shrimp which was good, but the fries that came with it were bland.

They have a full bar, beers on tap (including Anchor Steam), and very fruity and sweet looking concoctions.

+ food comes out quick after ordering
+ huge portions
- touristy
- pushy service
~ obstructed views of bay with wooden planks across windows
author: Christina C.

description: Last time I came was horrible service but my cousin wanted to come here today so I decided to come and try it one more time . I'm glad I came I had the best waiter the best service she kept coming to our table and check up on us her name is Kandice  she did a good job want a good waiter I recommend Kandice. Your really patient and good people skills. Keep the good job !
author: Erika H.

description:
WARNING: exaggerated review due to diet and lack of sugar intake.  

Pear and Berry Salad, alone brings this trip up from a 4 to a 5  Sure I've been feasting on meat for the last week and haven't had something sweet for over a month, but my God, this salad shouldn't even be considered a salad.  It should be a desert.  A desert served with greens.  

The bucket of trash was like crispy bits of heaven served in the sweetest tomato dipping sauce.... oh wait that's just ketchup.  

Heh... this place should still get a 4.  We has a wonderful view of Alcatraz and the kids loved watching the boats come around on the water.  The food was very child friendly and the trivia on the kids menu along with the waiters were very entertaining.  

What was Forest's girlfriend's name? What was the name of Forest's first boat? What was Forest's dogs name? Yes we kicked ass, and the 13 year old boy next to us just looked at us like we were weird.  Come on it's Forest Gump.... you haven't seen Forest Gump? How old am I?
author: Sheryl L.

description: My new office is across the street from Pier 39. Every time the folks from the Dallas office come to visit, they get lunch from here. That pretty much says it all. Battered and fried flavorless seafood with a side of fries and a large diet coke. If that's what you're craving, that's what they've got. If you want a real San Francisco restaurant experience, you probably shouldn't be at Pier 39 anyway.
author: Aaron M.

description:
I came here with my sister and my niece and nephew and decided to play tourist on Pier 39. We were getting hungry and came to Bubba Gump 
It was like a 30min wait, which was fine for a Sunday afternoon.
We then got seated and the place was poppin. Our server was very nice and she was assertive. 
The decor was very entertaining. The food was very good, I thought that it came out on time and we did not feel rushed. And we left feeling satisfy and full. I would go back but not as tourist but as a native San Franciscan.
author: Der Maibaum L.

description: Good food and a great view of the bay.  At pier 39.  I have never had a bad meal there and have been there 10 times or more.
author: Tony K.

description:
This is such a great place to bring out-of-town friends, since there are large windows along one side of the restaurant overlooking the San Francisco bay, a super friendly vibe, and a happening crowd at all times of the day since it's on Pier 39.  I've been to the Bubba Gump in Monterey before, but this was my first visit to the one in SF.  

I don't remember much of the Monterey one, but this place was pretty awesome about keeping everything themed around the movie Forrest Gump.  See Wayne K.'s review for details on some of the well-done theming.  

Although most items on the menu were overpriced (but what wouldn't be on the super-touristy Pier 39??), I thought that my appetizer sampler order was worth its money.  For $14.99, I got some perfectly boiled, fresh shrimp; delicious hush puppies that had shrimp and whole corn niblets; fried shrimp, their special cheddar/spinach/artichoke dip with chips; and some buffalo chicken tenders.  Totally worth the price in my book.  

I'll definitely keep this place in mind for future outings in the city!
author: Diana C.

description:
I don't know why alot of locals want to slam this place....it's SUPPOSED to be kitschy and touristy!  And shock, shock, horror, horror...it's located in the high rent tourist district known as Pier 39 so expect to pay a bit more.  The views are great if you get a seat by the huge bay windows.  And it's not THAT expensive.  The portions for the entrees are pretty huge.

For starters, we always ordered the popcorn shrimp:  small golden crispy shrimp served--typically--in a popcorn style carton and sometimes atop a bed of actual popcorn, which was kinda cool and actually worked....bonus for creativity.  It's accompanied with two sauces (a tartar and a cocktail, if I remember correctly).

Two of my favorite entrees (that I no longer see on the online menus) are the boneless Fried Chicken (served with mashed potatoes and corn on the cob--NOTE:  obviously, not date-friendly!) and there was a steak plate (some type of skirt/flat steak I think...a bit on the spicy side) that was consistently decent.  I love seafood, but those two items always jumped out at me and were done well.  

Their mixed drinks are good as well.  One of my favorites is called "Mama's Favorite" which is kinda like a mudslide, with Kahlua and low/nonfat frozen yogurt...hits the spot.  A bit thick and on the filling side, but, I mean, if you're gonna eat heavy, might as well go all the way, right?  And there are two prices for the drinks:  the advertised price typically includes a keepsake souvenir glass...you can always request w/o the souvenir and they'll charge you less.  

Service is always pleasant and attentive...just be sure to use their system to flag them down (yeah, they're kinda programmed to follow that, a bit weird, I know).  Besides the birthday madness they'll often squeeze right in to your table to quiz you on Forrest Gump movie trivia while you wait for your food.  

Certain times of year, if you're lucky, you can get front row seats for the sailboat races where the boats literally skim by just outside the windows.  Pretty cool.  

I recommend Bubba Gump's for both locals and tourists.  
Just make sure to work off all that food somehow afterwards or you'll be in for a food coma for sure.
author: Jeff H.

description: One of my favorite places to eat in SF.  Came with my friend and his fiance and I had a bowl of cajun shrimp which was awesome but quite small portion for the price.  Then I ordered some tempura shrimp which was more expensive/bigger portion but had AWESOME flavor.  also has a WONDERFUL view of the bay.  Will come to again
author: Tyler M.

description: One star for view and one star for service. Food was way overpriced (no kids menu) and not great. We could have gone to Outback cheaper. I realize we were paying for the Bubba Gump name and the view, but we could have jumped on a tour bus for that price.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
Good View, Good Food, Good Cocktails. Is Sheila happy??? YESS!!!

So I have eaten here several times and I have never been upset. decent food I like to get a range from one of their healthier baked or pan cooked fish plates to their good ol' bucket o trash this place can easily satisfy an arrange of peoples palates.

Plus come on its Bubba Gumps you gotta eat here at least one just for the love of your momma!!!
author: Sheila C.

description:
The food was pretty good, and for the pier, not too too pricey.

I really liked the signal system they have for waitstaff. If you want service, you flip to the green sign, and if you don't want to be bothered, you flip to the red sign. An innovative restaurant concept that seems to work well.
author: Michelle V.

description: Loved their shrimp heaven meal, a bit too pricey but to be expected when eating anywhere out on the pier 39.
author: Rae K.

description: This is pretty much a restaurant for tourists.  It's right on the pier, so it has a nice view (probably it's biggest upside) but the food is slightly overpriced.  The portions are a good size and the service is good, but considering other places in San Francisco, I can only imagine how much better seafood you can get for a better price.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
What?  WHAT?  Seriously, stop looking at me like that.  I can feel you judging me through my computer screen.  
YES.  I HAVE BEEN TO BUBBA GUMP.   IN FISHERMAN"S WARF.  Screw you.  I had to go because my friend from San Diego was up here with a bunch of his students and--you know what, I'm not going to explain myself.  I have good taste.  This wasn't my choice.  I didn't eat here--I just had a coke and stared in wonder as people from all over the world sat in this terrible restaurant and listened to a guy on a megaphone scream Forrest Gump trivia at them.  Forrest F*(&(*ING Gump!  Who cares about Forrest Gump anymore?  My God.  
The point is that this place is what you think it will be.  The view is nice, the food looks greasy.  I hate myself for having been inside.  OK?  Now leave me alone.
author: Blake W.

description: bubba gumps is great I had the jambalaya and coconut shrip it was very good customer service is great gave us a window seat and the bartenders got skills they know what they are doing for sure!
author: Rudy D.

description:
I get forced to go to this place a lot from out of towners.  I guess its the name and the fact that you can take a goofy pic on a bench pretending to be Forrest Gump.  The food....seems like good ole frozen crap with just a fancy funny name.  I must say the location and view is great. 

Come here for shyts and giggles...that's it.

I have to be fair...I have had one thing here that was pretty good...the crab stuffed shrimp in a tasty sauce but very rich
author: Virgo M.

description:
i barely remember this movie let alone the shrimp scenes. this is a red lobster with a movie theme. and it's a tourist trap. and it's over priced. the food's not terrible.

why did i go 2 stars? oh yeah. the food's not terrible.
author: Brian B.

description: My favorite place! I love the Cajun Shrimp and they make the best Blue Hawaiian. I like the atmosphere and they play my music. What more could I ask for.
author: G S.

description: Good... never great seafood. Get a view table it makes it worth it. My wife loves the Fried Chicken
author: Bodie T.

description: I hate to say it but there was something super endearing about this tourist trap.  A friend had been to a few of the other locations and her a thriving obsession with Forest Gump brought us here.  They DO have a gluten free menu although the selection is only a couple of salads and about 4 entrees (2 just shrimp, 1 shrimp with mahi mahi and 1 salmon). The waiter was very attentive despite a busy section and good about double checking our orders to avoid mishearing anything in the loud restaurant. There was no confusion about keeping my dish gluten free which was a reassuring sight- the manager actually personally brings out any "Allergy" dishes. The shrimp and fish was doused in sauce but quite tasty.  The bed of rice it sat on was overcooked but there was a big enough portion of fish that I didn't really miss the carbs.  The hostess was apologetic at their lack of GF desserts so she let me know that if I would like, they would prepare me a platter of sliced fruit the bar uses for garnish-- sweet, but I definitely passed on that one.  The best part of this meal was by far the gorgeous view of the bay and Alcatraz!
author: Sarah B.

description:
There is not one vegetarian option.

I ended up in this crappy restaurant on a company event. I asked the waitress what they could serve a vegetarian.  She looked at me like she had never thought of this.

"Maybe pasta" she said.  

She never got back to me with an answer - which was alright since I decided to leave the dinner early and eat a meal at a better restaurant.

This restaurant is for clueless tourists.
author: Soma L.

description: Only plus was view of the bay. Got an extra star for that. nice waitress for our group
author: Scott G.

description:
I can understand why this place is so busy and it's because of the awesome vibe it gives out. However, the food selection wasn't as big as I hoped it to be (maybe because the movie hyped it up a bit when Bubba listed out all the great recipes you can make with shrimp), but the service they had was superb when me and my friend went. I thought the signs you flip over when you needed attention (RUN FOREST/STOP) was rather clever and should be something that more restaurants should implement because I've had experience in the past at other restaurants where they don't check up on you at all.

Over all, I enjoyed this little place although the wait time is ehhh considering how popular it is.
author: Jaye C.

description:
If you don't like seafood, and your diet is tailored to creating type II diabetes, then this is the place for you. Imagine ordering coconut shrimp, and biting into can I can only describe a shrimp stuffed into an almond roca.

Oh, lest I forget - a 'dipping sauce' of ORANGE MARMALADE!

Oh yeah, the $50 tab. Lunch for two, and no booze. Damn skippy I went to a bar after that.
author: Rene D.

description:
First, I have to thank all the yelpers for giving me a good idea of what I was getting into.  I was invited to Bubba Gumps by a friend of a friend who really LOVES this place.  (they're from Australia, so go figure!)

Anyway, went in not expecting too much which was good!  The crowds were insane! Fortunately, those friends had already procured a table - hence no waiting (BIG PLUS!).  

I tried the bucket of boat trash (sounds appetizing already doesn't it?), and I have to admit, for generic fried foods... it's not bad.  It covers the requisite criteria: fried seafood, fries, and most fat in the form of coleslaw.  Before you get the wrong idea, I was actually quite surprised when it came.  The fried mahi mahi was still tender and not dried out.  The little tiny lobsters (similar to crawfish) were tasty and because they are so extremely fried, the shell is pretty much edible. (hey... gimme a break, I'm asian, we eat shells some of the times...AND!!! you get your dose of calcium for the day too!)

My final verdict, not bad.  If you are dragged there by tourist, it's not too horrible.  You'll get a large meal of decently fried foods.  My other friend had the fried chicken breast with mashed potatoes and it was HUGE!  2 large fried chicken breasts with a mound of mashed potatoes, coleslaw and whole ear of corn.
author: H. Q.

description:
OMG I wish I had a place like this close to my home I would be there everyday!
Service was great, food was delicious.   I loved how everyone works together and you are never waiting for "your" waiter.  My mom recomended this place to me and she was right.
author: Stephany M.

description:
This rating is just for the quality of their food.

First off, I don't want to start this review with a lot of negativity, so I'm going to go in with their service, which was surprisingly EXCELLENT again despite the horrible service other reviewers received. Our waiter came by very often and was super friendly and helpful. Even gave us a little Forrest Gump pop quiz to help us pass some time by as we waited for our food. He chatted up with my friend who, to everyone's surprise, knew more about the movie than the waiter! Spectacular service from him. *applauds

Onto their food now. I had the mushroom veggie burger and it was soooo delicious except for the fact that it was unevenly prepared. Some bites out of my burger were extremely salty! The edges were also burnt to the point that it was solid black and added a pretty bad taste. I ate through half of my burger before throwing in the towel and just peeling the burnt parts out and eating the middle of the burger where it wasn't salty. Oh yeah, they throw in two huge slices of avocado in the burger which made it extremely tasty(I LOVE avocado!), except they kept falling out. They really should stick with sliced avocados instead of GIANT CHUNKS. The fries that came with my burger, on the other hand, was really satisfying for some reason. It wasn't soggy or soft or too crispy. It was....I can almost say PERFECT if they would've just added a bit of salt. Their fisherman's catch dish was very bland. Once you peel away the shells, the shrimp is tasteless. You know how shrimp has that mild sweet flavor by itself? Well, this didn't taste anything like it. Might as well just eat it with the shell just for the taste. Overpriced food, but can't really complain because it IS a place for tourists and seafood lovers, but for their quality, I'd look elsewhere for seafood.
author: Annie S.

description:
Its a marketing gimmick.  Just another financial ploy to further collect on people's fascination over a good movie.  Making people believe that Bubba Gump was an actual establishment is a way of giving Forrest Gump some sort of credibility that he really was an all-american athlete that told the president, "i need to use the bathroom."  

Far be it for me to complain, i thought the food was okay.  The idea of telling your waiters you need help simply by changing the sign from stop and go on your table is funny.  Looking at memorabilia from the movie is fun.  

"i bet however its not the actual movie memorabilia simply because you probably would find the EXACT same thing in another Bubba Gump restaurant."

But look at me talk about the place over the food.  Thinking about it, I guess this has helped me realize that  the food was actually just Plain Jane and it was the restaurant itself that made me believe the food was fun and good.  DAMN THOSE MARKETING GIMMICKS!!!!
author: Bernardo C.

description:
Had an early dinner at Bubba Gumps in Pier 39, so luckily no waiting in line.  I would rank the food 3 stars but the service brought the overall rating down.  

So first the food and why 3 stars.  We ordered the New Orleans Shrimp and it was good.  A spicy sauce under a bed of white rice and about a dozen grilled shrimp.  The flavor was good.  Wish the portion would be bigger than the price of the dish - $18.  

The second dish was a fish with shrimp combo and it was good. The right size and good taste.  The third item was a Mac and Cheese and whoever made it did not follow the directions on the blue box.  The dish lacked liquid so was very dry.  And yes, it is what you get in the blue box that you get at the grocery store for a dollar. The last dish was the popcorn shrimp.  Cannot go wrong with fried shrimp.  

Bad thing, we never got our salad.  When told, no apologies no nothing.  He should have wrote down our order, but did not.  

Wished we went to the Crab House instead for their very good crab chowder.  Kids would have preferred Rainforest Cafe.  Either would have been better for both food and service.
author: J Z.

description:
I love seafood, and am from the East Coast, so I had never heard of Bubba Gumps. We went on a Monday afternoon, it was mildly crowded, but got seated quickly. Nice atmosphere, the whole Forrest Gump theme going on. 
We were seated near the windows over looking the bay. Very tranquil. I ordered the steamed shrimp. must say- BEST I HAVE EVER HAD! The cajun seasoning was delicious. Our waiter was friendly and quick. Unfortunitly it was a bit pricey and wasnt able to be full off the shrimp. Didnt want to spend another $10 on dessert. 
So good shrimp, but high prices. If you have the pockets, I do suggest. At least the steamed shrimp.
author: Jen S.

description: Been here 4 times and don't really like the food. Pasta is too sour, stuffed shrimp is too dry.
author: Jehnsen D.

description: always get the cajun shrimp appetizer went last week it wasn't that great this time it tasted chewy and fishy not like the previous times ive had it over all i like bubba gumps of course ill come back. this time just wasn't great.
author: Kimi P.

description:
You'll enjoy it if you like Forrest Gump or, like me, you're a fan of well-done theming:
- There's a bench outside with a suitcase and a box of chocolates.  Great photo spot.
- The interior is adorned with famous Forrest Gump quotes.
- Our waitress entertained us with 5 trivia questions about the movie (e.g. Which leg did Lieutenant Dan lose?)
- The table has a fun "Run Forrest Run" sign that you flip to "Stop Forrest Stop" when you need wait service.
- There a gift shop where you can buy Gump-themed merchandise like a "My Momma Says I'm Special" shirt (you can find these online too: http://www.bubbagump.com/store/index.htm).
- Large TV screens run the movie.
- Quick friendly service, fast seating, and fun menus too.

The seafood?  Ok though pricey.  The drinks?  Decent but expensive.  Come for the theming though and you'll have a blast.
author: Wayne K.

description:
SF offers so much in the way of excellent California and international cuisine, whether it's fine dining at Gary Danko or burritos in the Mission or Vietnamese in the Tenderloin, that we often overlook those fine establishments prevalent throughout the 'burbs: chain restaurants. 

At the risk of losing all my yelp cred, I wholeheartedly recommend a visit to Bubba Gump's. Why? Well because as Bubba put it: "shrimp is the fruit of the sea. You can barbecue it, boil it, broil it, bake it, sautee it. Dey's uh, shrimp-kabobs, shrimp creole, shrimp gumbo. Pan fried, deep fried, stir-fried. There's pineapple shrimp, lemon shrimp, coconut shrimp, pepper shrimp, shrimp soup, shrimp stew, shrimp salad, shrimp and potatoes, shrimp burger, shrimp sandwich. That- that's about it." 

And Bubba Gump's pretty much offers all of the above. And it's actually pretty good. 

It's a mini-excursion out of SF to Hicksville - you could be in Kansas, North Carolina, Minnesota...anywhere but SF, except that you ARE in SF, surrounded by tourists from everywhere but.
author: Deb I.

description:
IF I COULD GIVE IT NO STARS I WOULD!!!


Let me tell you my experience:

   a) Over priced shrimp with a fast food taste.

   b) I know that there were probably 10 million birthday celebrants that 
        night and the staff had to sing their esophagus out, but please 
        don't forget my sister's birthday song. PLEASE DON'T FORGET, 
        FUCKERS! We told one of the staff to please let our waiter know 
       that it's her birthday and we wanted to publically humiliate her with
       your song and cheer, but the word wasn't passed and we had our 
       table at "STOP FORREST!" We the people at our table our 
      pissed. 

      c) The End
author: Christine C.

description:
Overally salted food, rude and slow service, and it was dead the day we stopped by...so I don't understand why.
I've actually been here before and had a great time, with the food being like a "3", but upon our last visit, I am going with a "1" because of how disappointing it was.
author: Danielle D.

description: The best part of our lunch was the view!  Our service was very disappointing, despite the "Stop, Forrest, Stop" sign on our table.  Not sure if the server was new, busy or just not attentive, but I would be hard pressed to go back to this location.  One thing to beware of (server did not mention this) the children's mac 'n cheese came in a bowl that was burning hot.  Unfortunately, causing discomfort to a 5 yr old and myself when I transferred the noodles to a plate.
author: Mary W.

description: I made up for the non-alcoholic experience the night before by having a Sunburst (complete with keepsake cup with flashing lights). I tried my best not to down it all at once because I knew it would be a creeper. It went nicely with my Run Across America Sampler of fried and cold shrimp, hush pups, chicken strips, and artichoke dip. If I had to choose between cocktail and fried shrimp, I'd pick cocktail hands down. It's healthier, and I can eat more without slumping over in a food coma afterward. The restaurant's ambiance was a little crazy in the beginning. People were sitting waiting, lining up on the walkway ramp waiting, standing around the bar waiting, ya get my point. It was worth it though. Our group of 16 was seated in under 30 min, and our table had a nice view of the bay with Alcatraz in the distance.
author: Rhia R.

description:
All the other reviews about this restaurant pretty sums up my experience... overpriced and not much to brag about.

The best part about the visit was the trivia.... that's pretty much it. I ordered the shrimp and bass (i think). Shrimp wasn't bland but far from being flavorful. Service was mediocre. 

For being known for shrimp, they really need to step their game up.
author: Terrance M.

description: Waiter was great. View was outstanding of bay. Food ok....not worth the touristy price you're gonna pay. Restroom not as clean as you might expect to be.  If bathroom not kept clean, what does that mean for the kitchen?
author: N M.

description: OK, it was a nice atmosphere. The server was great and efficient. We got seated quickly even though it was peak lunch hour. I take off two stars because, of all places, this place has clam chowder but not in a bread bowl! My bf went to the one in Monterey and recalled they had great clam chowder in a bread bowl. I was all excited because Fisherman's Wharf is synonymous with clam chowder in bread bowls. We walk and walk and walk past all these restaurants. I thought, okay the bf knows what he's talking about. I'm sure it's worth all the walking. We get there and order the clam chowder. We ask if it's in a bread bowl. They said no. We ended up eating the clam chowder but had lunch again two hours later. :( We later recommended other colleagues NOT to go there for clam chowder in a bread bowl.
author: Anna S.

description:
I loved the movie Forrest Gump, so it was inevitable that I would end up trying Bubba Gumps.  I love the name, can't help myself.

I ordered the Boat Trash.  Crazy name, but it's a metal bucket filled with fried shrimp, mahi mahi, and slipper lobster.  I really enjoyed it.  

It's a tacky fun atmosphere with the movie playing in the background.  The service was friendly and quick for us.  

It's very touristy, but I was pleasantly surprised.  It's not on the top of my list of places to go, but I wouldn't "not" recommend it.
author: Denise M.

description:
Being a tourist in san francisco, I try not to goto the places where other tourists will be. But I couldn't resist coming here with my sister, her husband and their friend from Daly City. 

We enjoyed all the Forrest Gump stuff, right down to the "run forrest run" signs on the table. I just had to buy a margarita shaker from here.

as for food itself, i had shrimp and lots of it. delicious, truly delicious. Of all the theme restaurants i've gone to, this is probably the one with the best food. Or should I say the only one with good food.
author: roderick A.

description:
Very friendly staff...we came here on Sunday, July 5.  We were seated and I asked them if they had a table by the window, they said no but they could accommodate us across from it.  Beautiful view, we could see Alcatraz from where we were seated. 

Sean our waiter come by to take our order, very patient, my daughter who couldn't decide what to drink was never rushed by him.  

Appetizer: Bubba's Far out dip (Spinach, Mozzarella and Artichoke dip) was so good
Mussels - was excellent
clam chowder - daughter loved it
New Orleans Shrimp - hubby enjoyed it
Cheese burger - my son said "thumbs up" so when he says thumbs up, it's excellent!

Sean was not our real waiter but he was nice enough to explain to us that Jenny was our real waiter and that he was just helping her out while she was on break.  That is excellent service right there!  They just don't drop off and you wonder what happened to him?  Jenny was a real sweetheart as well...very attentive.  She actually gave my husband a free lemonade refill (without the fruits) so she didn't have to charge us for it. 

We're definitely coming back again...
author: Maria K.

description:
The food here was excellent. since i love shrimp haha. 

I love how they set of everything, the license plate flipping stop signs. Its very unique, well as far as i know.  So i came here with my friends. and i do have to admit, this place is overpriced. No joke! But i don't really mind about the waiting, it took us about 15 minutes to get in. To some people appearently is way too long... The service was good. I give that a B.  They had a great view from where i was sitting so it was awesome. The bad thing was, It wasn't very clean. Thats why i gave it a 4. being overpriced and kind of dirty. But other than that, Everything else was pretty awesome.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Apart from the popcorn shrimp, I was very underwhelmed with by Bubba Gumps. It was very crowded, which I don't understand. Gimmicky, sure, but I guess with the right group of people it could be fun? 

The servers play a trivia game with you, and even though I hadn't seen the movie since I was a kid, I did pretty well! I really think they should throw in some popcorn shrimp as a prize though.

Maybe if I was a bigger Forrest Gump fan I would find Bubba Gump's fun...but alas, I did not.
author: Sophie D.

description:
For fuck's sake I'll make myself clear. 

I have absolutely no problem with eating shitty food. In a city, it's hit or miss and eventually one has to learn to enjoy the misses as well. So it is not from elitism or holier-than-though-foodiness that I deal this judgement: Tourists, there is more to san francisco. 

North Beach, a great hub of italian, chinese and loads of other culinary delights, is but a walk, cable car, or short bus trip away from the wharf. By all means, spend lunch there! There are BRILLIANT places with great views in the same vein as this place, but better and maybe even cheaper!

Bubba Gump is average food. Nothing special. They do, however, serve massive alcoholic drinks, so that's a plus. The view is admittedly nice too. But get out there and have some fun you kids and avoid this shit like the plague.
author: Jay C.

description:
I came here for my birthday - and even a few times before that and each time I came, I had a great time. Yes, their food is a little unhealthy, but apparently I like living the dangerous life because I really don't care. Their food is delish, their desserts are amazing, and their Delta Sunset margarita? 

Oh God. YES PLEASE.

The service is always excellent; at least when I go there. The servers are attentive, friendly, and their quick to get you what you need when you need it. Yes, their prices are a little worrisome, but dammit - that's ok because it's a great place to be in when you're in the mood to have some fun out with friends. The atmosphere is lively and carefree.

I love you, Bubba Gump!
author: Thea G.

description:
A theme restaurant  is interesting.

Only 1 out of the 4 of us actually watched Forest Gump. So the waitress asked us very very simple questions about the movie. It was interesting.

I ordered the fish and chips and clam chowder. The fish and chips was okay quality  overall. The fish was a bit dry, so the lemon juice made up for that. It was a bit greasy. The fries were well seasoned though.

The clam chowder was yummy. 

My friend ordered a drink and there was a bug in her drink. The waiter replaced her drink for her. & I thought we'd get our meal for freee. Ohwell. The drink doesn't taste fresh which meant that it's powder/syrup based.

Overall, the place is a bit overpriced, but is fun to go for like once in awhile.
author: Jay Z.

description:
I had never been to a Bubba Gump Shrimp Company before and I'm really not sure I will be back.  My hope is that the other restaurants are better than the one on Fisherman's Wharf.

Let me first state that the staff was excellent. They were helpful and willing to accomodate any special needs that we had. Kudos to the staff.

The food is what was really disappointing. I had the variety bucket. I can't remember the name of it, but it had Fried Fish, French Fries, Fried Shrip and crab legs.  This was a lot of food.  The problem was none of the ingredients were fresh.  You're on the San Francisco wharf, you have to serve fresh food. Everything was dry and tasted bland.  I paid a lot of money I really expenct fresh food.

I am definitely not anxious to try Bubba Gump's again.
author: Alan N.

description:
Late night dinner with the boyfriend.
There was a wait but we were seated in about 30 minutes. My boyfriend and i browsed the menu and saw the dessert menu and decided to skip out on appetizers to save space for the strawberry shortcake dessert. The strawberry shortcake was delish! 
When we arrived at the table and it took a while before the waiter checked on us but we realized we had the "run forest run" sign showing so as soon as we put up the "stop forest stop" sign, a waiter came within less then a minute.
I ordered the "Bucket of Boat Trash". The lobster claws were huge. Everything else in the bucket was fried; fried shrimp, fried fish and french fries. The cajun spices around the fish and shrimp gave them lots of flavor. I really enjoyed the texture of the fish.
The boyfriend ordered the Lt. Dan's drunken shrimp and he really enjoyed that because he barely said a word while until he was done eating. I tried a bite from his dish and the sauce and mashed potatoes were really good. I think next time i come back i will try the bucket of shell fish.
author: Karen N.

description:
Bubba Gump Shrip company aka Tourist Trap.

You have to dine here at least once just to get the feel of it. I got it out of my system and hope to never set foot in there again. It's crowded, noisy, cramped, the food is mediocre and the service is SO BAD.

I love the movie Forrest Gump, so I had to dine here, I was so very dissapointed, so do not expect much from this place and you will have an okay time.
author: Katrina F.

description:
Went here with two friends last Wednesday.. the overall experience was good.

The VIEW was awesome :) We happened to see a sea lion floating and sun-bathing in the bay. How cute. The ambiance was relaxing, good for a family or friends setting. The wait time was not that long, we ordered Onion Rings, which I thought were HUGE. Then a couple of entrees.

It was my first Bubba Gump experience at the Embarcadero and I was pretty impressed with the service that we got. Loved the memorabilias hanging on the wall, gave me something to look at aside from the awesome view on the side part of the restaurant. I did not get any movie questions though, maybe they assumed I was too young to know? But I've seen Forrest Gump for maybe 5 times now. I know stuff. haha.

Would definitely come back again here!
author: Andrea M.

description:
Yes so many better options to dine at by Pier 39...but we went here and honestly I did not mind the meal at all.

I had a delicious bacon cheeseburger with fries and some crab cakes. I washed it all down with a few big beers and my friends had some cocktails as well. We all enjoyed our time here and the view by the water adds to the atmosphere for sure. I would return here when I visit SF. But more than likely will try more local places before checking out this chain restaurant.
author: Andy K.

description: I absolutely love the food and the service,,,but so does everyone else, hence the HUGE wait time and crowded dining area!!! If you are in a hurry, starving, and/or just want a cozy little nook to hang out in to enjoy your food, then by all means this place is not for you. But, other than that, the food is delicious, and the wait staff is very friendly :)
author: Sonya M.

description:
I admit this place is such a corny tourist trap, but they have the most delicious pulled pork sandwich in the world.

If you like pulled pork... this is the place to go.  I know, I know Pier 39 is the closest thing you know to hell but I'm telling you... it's so worth it.

TDF!  To die for!
author: Derek B.

description:
OVERPRICED!!! 

The fact that it delivers a nice view and entire feel of Forrest Gump is the only reason why they receive 2 Stars.

Servers here are unpleasant!

I've had to return several times to finally admit that they do not have much to offer, I'll admit that there are a few items on the menu I do somewhat enjoy but I can eat better seafood, cheaper without the attitude. 

Movie still rocks!
author: Lisa C.

description: I feel that this place is hit or miss. I came here with some friends on a Saturday night. Super busy! But thats normal in a tourist area. But I got a plate where it had breaded shrimp, fish, and hushpuppies. It was OK.
author: Desiree T.

description:
I LOVE BUBBA GUMP'S TO DEATH. Seriously. I don't care for all the fun & games aspect of it, but seriously the food is GREAT. The service in San Francisco is fast & friendly. I'd eat there every weekend if I could afford it ! I totally ignore all the tourists and the fact that its always packed.. Just give me the good food !! =) My boyfriend & I have eaten here plenty of times and we just adore it.

The one in Monterrey is pretty cool too !
author: Selina M.

description: I loved eating on the bay and the whole atmosphere of the wharf was awesome. Took my mother and father here and it was good but not blow me away awesome. As a chain this is probably the best of the Bubba Gumps I would think.  Fresh seafood and atmospere has to supercede the others.   Neverthless is was good and a good time. I didnt rate it quite as high only because I couldnt tell if it was actually the food or the enjoyment of the area that I was so excited about.  Food is good, service is ok and the location is.............well that is what they say.  Location, Location, Location!
author: Aaron T.

description: Five stars or their veggie burger!! I am so addicted to it! I highly recommend it, even if you're not a vegetarian!
author: Sarah M.

description:
This place is pretty cool for an establishment based on a movie.

The food is quite pricey, I honestly wasn't expecting to pay that much, but the service was cool.

I love how they had those ping pong paddles that says "Run Forrest Run" and "Stop Forrest".  It makes the service that much better and easier.

I also love the trivia they do about the movie from time to time.

Pretty cool tourist attraction.
author: Mike V.

description: Food is absolutely mediocre. Children's menu is a little less than, but the views are absolutely spectacular if you like San Francisco Bay.  The ambiance is sort of frenetic and joyous so it catches on with my grandchildren who absolutely love this place...Curious thing to say about as restaurant but we love everything but the food.
author: Vrede B.

description:
I like the Fish n' Chips here. If you get a seat where you can look out at the water it's worth it...There is always a wait and no reservations are taken. I did have a B-day here and I didn't want the Employees to sing to me, Because i wouldn't stand on my chair as they sang, they took the Ice-cream away from me after the end of the song!!!!!!!
Therefor they only get 3 stars :-)
I'm lactose intolerant anyway Suckas! 
Jokes on them.
author: Shelley S.

description:
We got the last table at the very end of the restaurant, we had a slightly clear evening with a great view of Alcatraz, but wait, let's start from the beginning.

We all put in the party count, and walked around Pier 39 before we were seated.  As we headed back to Gumps, I thought we were being seated.  As I walked through the front door, the whole party was standing in the front still.  D'oh!  

We saw small party leave in the bar area, so we all sat and waited.  At that time, I watched Forrest Gump on the screen which they play over and over and over...and over all day everyday.  I wonder if the employees are tired of the movie?  

Anyway, they have this Sunkist drink that everyone ordered, excluding me, which comes in a tall, light blinking plastic cup.  I was relieved when they all turned it off.  I ordered a simple dish...which I'm sorry that I forgot what it was, but it was fish with mashed taters and some juicyness to it all.  I liked it.  I thought it better then getting something fried and crunchy and greasy.  What else?  I didn't have dessert...I didn't have room for any.  Unless you plan on saving room, be prepared to sit back and un-buckle your belt or un-tie or do what you do.  Ok that is all.  Go have some Gump...I did.
author: Joey H.

description:
We sat at the bar to eat because this place was packed..our bartender was awesome. The food was not cheap but it was good, we ( my bf and I ) had a total shrimp extravaganza & we were oh so satisfied. The drinks were ok - normal mixed drinks nothing too special - I enjoyed my Peach, Love, Rock'n'Roll, the best part about them was getting to keep the glass afterwards!

Our friends weren't disappointed either. We were all pretty drunk after the giants game & this was the perfect place to go!
author: Samantha R.

description: My sister loves to go here for her B day every year its ok. chicken ceasar salad was delish. but the service could have been alot better.
author: LoveMeTender t.

description:
The food was fine. Nothing spectacular but it was decent, but my experience wasnt.

I ordered and my food came in 2 minutes. It makes you wonder where your food comes from- if it was somebody's rejects or something. I asked my waiter for water. It never came. I asked my waiter for ranch. It never came. In fact, he basically stood somewhere chatting and laughing with his fellow waiters. Although the others managed to get their work done since some other waiter brought me the things I needed (and he wasnt even getting the tip!). My waiter brought my check really quick though. Needless to say, I was MAJORLY cheesed off. Still am! Grrr.
author: Gobbledygook C.

description: I came here on 4th of July which was earlier this week and I knew it was gonna be busy but who knew it was gonna be a 4 hour wait for 2 people. As me and my boyfriend were sitting in front of Bubba's, all the big parties that came way after us were being called in to be seated. I was so mad because parties of 2-4 weren't getting seated. Since it was too cold to be sitting outside, we waited inside and luckily they were giving out samples of their garlic bread. Me and my boyfriend were seriously taking most of it cause we were that hungry. After waiting in the cold for less than 4 hours, we were finally seated. I was pretty sad that I thought we weren't gonna see the fireworks since It was gonna start in 30 minutes. Tell me why we saw the fireworks from Bubba Gumps because we were sitting by the window. I guess you can say the wait was worth it cause then we didn't have to stand out in the cold to watch the fireworks. Other than that, the food was alright. Our waitress was friendly and kept asking us if we needed anything. She even asked us questions about the Forrest Gump movie which last time our waitress didn't do.
author: Janice V.

description:
Run Forrest Run!  
...away!

If I remember correctly, the service was actually decent.  I think the thing about this place was the view, really.  You get a nice view of Treasure Island and Berkley. The food wasn't that great and definitely not worth the price, but it isn't inedible.  The TVs playing Forrest Gump gets a little redundant, but it's the theme of the restaurant.  You're really paying for the view, a TV dinner and royalties to the movie.
author: Kevin K.

description: Bubba Gump is part of the tourist trap at Pier 39 but they do shrimp right.  The cajun shrimp were spicy but they were very good.
author: Brent T.

description:
Decent food. Hit this spot after fireworks on the 4th. It wasn't too crowded but the host didn't pay us much mind as we waited and waited and there was seating available.

I love seafood and relish any opportunity to get my hands on shellfish... so this place was a good fit. I liked the overall Bubba Gump mentality... a fresh look at eating. Had a upbeat staff which i did appreciate. 

The prices was what killed it for me... I felt satisfied up until the check arrived... but hey it is on the waterfront.
author: Nelson C.

description: I've only been here once with my family and I've always wanted to go back since. Although the wait was pretty long, the food and servers were great. The theme of the restaurant is very cool and the view (from my table) was amazing.
author: Michael M.

description: The place has a great view of the bay while dining. This is one of my favorites in Pier 39. Yes, this place does get very crowded and wait times can be ridiculous up to an 1hr or more. The service is average and very prompt when it comes to seating arrangements and the food is great. My favorite entree is the Shrimper Heaven and The Bucket of Boat Trash. And let's not forget they do have great cocktail drinks.
author: Jr P.

description:
Went to Bubba Gump yesterday again; it was probably my thritieth time as I always bring my friends and family there who come from France or anywhere in the world; it is a great place, right on the water; service is fast; line is quiet often long but dont wait in line, go to the bar and enjoy a first cocktail !!
Portions are HUGE, for four of us we usually get two big basket of their fried food and one dip...that will feed you enough and you might even have some space for a crepe on teh Firsher\man wharf !!
author: Christophe K.

description: When I visit SF I usually end up here. Nice view, good food, good drinks... The Stuff shrimps with Crab is really good!!!.
author: Diana M.

description:
Forgive lord for I have sinned too.

I have been in Bubba Gump's.  And lord...I have been to the one in Chicago and San Francisco.

I took my inlaws to Bubba Gump San Francisco...as we were on the pier...they wanted to see the pier (and the prison in the Bay) and it was the ONLY eatery they felt they would like.

...and they did.  Lord, they did.

Me on the other hand?  I could have easily done without the continual loop of Forrest Gump on the television.  Dear god.  I LIKE TOM HANKS...BUT I DON'T LIKE HIM OVER DRY SHRIMP COCKTAIL OVER AND OVER AGAIN.

God, please send my prayers to the waitstaff that has to watch that movie over, and over again.

Also lord, please send my prayers to the poor man who approached our table to give us Trivia Questions....of which (going to a lot of Trivia nights around the city) I'm more Rainman than Forrest Gump at (please lord, this is not a plea for a Rainman themed Restaurant.)

I answer all of the questions...and he dubbs me something Forrest Gump Special.

It was then...My Hitler Youth Mother (refer to Schintzelhaus) started attacking this poor man in her heavy German accent:  DOESN'T SHE EVEN GET A FREE DRINK!

Yes lord.  I know you are a big old prankster.  You created a lot of things I don't get.  You do things like create BARTMAN who takes away the ball from my beloved Cubbies.  But that moment was just cruel.

Having my loud mother in law attack some poor guy for not giving me some door prize.  She badgered him so much...he finally gave in and gave me a drink.

Please lord, forgive me and my choice of in laws.

The last time I was in Chicago I went to Bubba Gump's as I knew half of the waitstaff (actors) and my dear friend gave me his discounted rate, because he knew I was so broke.

It's amazing how the food all taste the same, lord.

Is that one of your other funny jokes too?
author: Shaun L.

description:
Run Forrest Run!
Sure Bubba's is a tourist trap but they serve up some good shrimp!! And the garlic sauce is pretty good too!  The crab legs aren't bad either but for the price the portion size is too small...
So..Run Forrest Run and go get you some Bubba Gump Shrimp down at the wharf!  Ask for seating near the window and overlook the water and it's a great view of Alcatraz too!
author: Mel S.

description:
Seriously, what's up with the waxed floor or I was the only one retarded-ly slipped dozen times during the whole trip of walking from the door to our table??!  I didn't even dare to go to the washroom because I was afraid that I might slip and crack my head open against some sharp table corners.  I am sorry but I had to take off one star for that because next time (if i plan to come back) i will have to bring my slip-proof black sneakers.

If you dig Southern comfort food, this is definitely THE place to be...seriously just look around you.
We had:
The Cross America Sampler - 4/5, they are all deep fried except the cocktail shrimps, anything deep fried is good, common sense.
Pear and Berry Salad - 3.5/5 not bad, the vinaigrette dress was a bit rich, if you looking for something light..i guess this is best you can get from this kind of place.
"I'm Stuffed" shrimp - 4/5 HUGE potion, worth of every penny

Took off another star because the greeting girl at the door giving us attitude when I asked her if we could get a table beside the window, she replied: i dunno...

Okay, very helpful
author: Ting R.

description:
So what smart family FROM SF would choose to go to tourist-laden Pier 39 on a holiday weekend to enjoy some Bubba Gump's?  Yeah, that would be mine!  My dad got hooked on it during a recent trip to Anaheim's Gardenwalk, so...off we went.

I loved the shrimper's net catch (half garlic, half Cajun) - would consider getting it as my entree the next time, with a side of rice.  The grilled mahi mahi (one of the few, non-fried items on the menu) was good, but a little bland and too lemon-y/caper-y (prolly wouldn't order it again).  Fish and chips were pretty yummy, scampi looked good (my mom loved it, and she's super picky with scampi!), and my dad loves the fishwich.  Now, my absolute favorite part of the meal?  Dessert!  The strawberry shortcake was deliciously sinful and worth every thousand calories it contained.  Think of a big, warm biscuit, filled with strawberries and ice cream, covered with whipped cream...oh dear!  The only drawback to the dessert was that they didn't use fresh strawberries...but whatever...it still made me happy!

Sidenote: our waitress threw some Forrest Gump trivia at us...I've never actually seen the movie in its entirety (just bits-n-pieces, my bad!).  I got some of the answers, but I think I provided some amusement when she said something like...Forrest said the best thing about being shot in the butt was being able to eat_____ (fill in the blank).  I proudly shouted "shrimp!"  Guess I was a little off...hmm...I'd rather eat ice cream, too :-)  Fun times!
author: Joyce L.

description:
Mileu:
Loud, but a very country atmosphere.  A tourist's delight.  So, if you wanna avoid the touristy thing, please don't come here.  

Service:
Fun and very animated people.  They sing, they dance, they are quite wild.  At least they serve you very well.  

Food:
I always ONLY get their fried chicken to be honest.  It is one of the better fried chicken places I have ever been to.  It is tender, no bones and fried to perfection.  So, in terms of food, I don't know too much besides I swear, get the fried chicken.  I know its a seafood place, but yummy fried chicken.
author: M L.

description:
I was here sometime ago, the fried food was great.  Loved the bucket of fried goodness!!!  Even though it tastes so much better in Maui!
I found the service a bit slow, it was a week night and not a whole lot of people.  But I would go back!
author: Yamil A.

description:
UPSCALE LONG JOHN SILVERS.   If your into mediocre food that's expensive, you will LOVE this place.  Standard chain crap.  It's a shame that they get such a great location on the wharf.  If you want good seafood, go to Sams chowder house in HMB.
Seriously, don't waste your money.
author: Keith N.

description:
Went here on 4th of July for a few drinks.  Kudos to the bartenders, they had a lot of orders and were making drinks fast (edited: damn im dyslectic).

I'm giving a bad review because the bathroom was wretched.  The floor was so slick, I almost slipped and cracked my head open.  

It would help if they put one of those rubber mats with holes in front of the stalls.  

Apparently after you have a bucket full of Bubba Gump you can't piss into a stall.  I felt the need to wash the bottom of my pumas after a visit to this fine establishment.
author: David C.

description:
wow! they served the appetizers and salads before they could get our drink order out despite several queries.
food was cold, yesterday's fries and when the manager was informed, he sent out another round of food and it was likewise cold
i wouldn't eat at this place again even if the food was free......
just extremely disapointing, overpriced and the worst of the typical tourist trap operations.
the tour guide warned us and we should have known better.  and listened to a local
author: Greg P.

description:
While I like seafood and including fish but I do not like being smashed into a table like sardines. The service there was horrible. Asked the waiter to grab me some water and it took forever to give it to me. 

Ordered a few appetizers that arrived just before our entrees. umm the whole damn point of appetizers is to eat it before your meal... then the meal came I ordered the Shrimper dipper dinner eh it use to be better. I asked the server for butter for my bread, he was like sure by the time we left the butter still had not appeared.

Onto the horrible service our server was...how shall i say it lacking in service. It seemed like he never had to time to chat with our table but had plenty of time to chat with the other tables. dont understand.

I dont think i'll ever return to this Bubba Gump, like the one in Monterey better.
author: Christina T.

description: Came here late one night with my friends on a road trip. Service was awesome. Our waitress was really friendly. She quizzed us on Forrest Gump, 100% A+. Great sense of humor. The food was pretty good. Nothing spectacular for seafood lovers, but worth the trip to go. Great atmosphere.
author: Steven M.

description: The food was okay, nothing special.  The net catch of the day was especially disappointing.  I think I was expecting prawns, so when the tiny shrimps came out, it was like bleh.. The waiter was probably the best part of the visit.  The wait staff in general came off as pretty rude in my opinion, but our waiter was very earnest and giving us a good experience at the restaurant.  Despite his great service, it was not enough to glaze over the overpriced food.
author: Jackie C.

description: The food is alright here, but what makes it 4 stars is for the service and the servers. The server we had Lee was pretty funny and had a lot of knowledge of the movie Forest Gump.  While waiting he sat down and we did trivia for about 10 minutes. After a while other tables go involved and it was pretty fun. Now I have watch it again since my interest was aroused.  The shrimper's heaven gives lots of shrimp, but next time I'll order less fried shrimp.  The shrimper's net catch was both garlic and cajun and when mixed together comes out pretty yummy.  The clam chowder was nice and chunky, but nothing extraordinary.  The thai style shrimp was pretty tasty too.
author: Chris G.

description: I ate here for the first time a little while back.  It was a neat atmosphere, but pretty crowded being the middle of the afternoon-2ish.  We got our drinks which were great, the server seemed pretty cool.  My main beef was it was a little pricey for what you got and I got up to go to the bathroom.  My food was half finished and I had been sitting talking.  The bathroom line was super long and when I got back my food was gone.  My friends were still eating and said the person who took my food didn't even ask if I was done or gone or anything.  Next time I saw them was when they brought the bill.  So beware if you have to pee you better be done eating.
author: Whitney B.

description:
My roommate and I came here for dinner and it was only a 45 minute wait on a Saturday night, not too bad.  That wait time gives you time to walk around the Wharf and enjoy the views and everything else it has to offer.  Even if you are a local like I am, it's just nice to enjoy this kind of scenery every once in a while. 
When we got seated we met our waiter , his name is Benjamin and he was super nice and friendly.  He gave us some great drink recommendations and as we were leaving we told him we were going out drinking and he gave us some great bar recommendations! 

Was not a disappointment at all!
author: Samantha G.
