description: I always order the Shrimper's Heaven which comes with cooked chilled shrimp you peel, coconut shrimp, friend breaded shrimp, and tempura shrimp (4 tempura shrimp to be exact- hey Bubba, can you add more? They're the best!) It also comes with fries and 3 dipping sauces (one sweet one whose name I don't know but that is so so delicious.) This place is always packed since it is on Pier 39 aka tourist central but the food, experience, and view are totally worth the usual 15 minute wait. Overall though, I love Bubba Gump's! If you've seen Forrest Gump and haven't been to BG then what are you waiting for?
author: Luisa G.

description:
My first time here was great, so was my last.  I even had my birthday dinner here.  The wait can be kind of a pain, but it's located in tourist central, so it's expected.  They have cool cups that light up for some of their drinks.  You also get a great view from their windows.  

The service is also really good here.  They sometimes come around to ask you Forrest Gump trivia questions.  They're fun, but I suck at it.  hahah.  I personally like this place quite a lot though.  Maybe because I've always had good company when I came here.=)
author: Lisa Z.

description: The food was good but the proportions were a little small. I enjoyed the food but the service was slow. While the dishes were small, it was a little pricey, but then again it is seafood. i recommend this to anyone who hasn't tried the place yet. Oh yeah, the place was well decorated and it really set the mood.
author: Calvin Y.

description: I'm ashamed to say, I've been here, but it was a couple years ago for a workplace celebration. It was a long wait, the place was cheesy sort of like that place Jennifer Aniston worked at in "Office Space".  The food wasn't bad but for the price and embarrassment, I'd expect more.
author: Marc S.

description: This place is fun as far as atmosphere, but every time I have eaten here I have gotten sick (about 4 times).  There is always a line, and lots of tourist, but its fun for a group.  My husband loves this place, because he loves Forest Gump.  If you like Forest Gump then check it out, and enjoy.  Their menu has a little bit of variety, but everything is pretty much fried, buttered, or pretty fattening, so if you are a health nut maybe not the place for you.  Anyway like I said I have been there four times so its not that bad, it just always makes me feel sick afterwards.
author: Kimmy G.

description:
Worst Bubba Gump we have eaten at yet!

We have made a point to eat at Bubba Gumps as we travel and have been to the one in Maui; Times Square, NYC; and Breckenridge...  I thought San Fran would be the best yet... UH NO!

Their kitchen has gotten sloppy.  The shrimp was noticeably overcooked and we got the Netcatch peel and eat shrimp but they were horribly deveined... I prefer my shrimp poo free but they seem to like to showcase it.   I asked to have it redone only to get the same problem with the second go round.

If you are in San Francisco I think it best to skip Bubba and go get some Crab somewhere local.
author: melissa t.

description:
I avoided this place for years primarily because it was a real life restaurant "spin off" of a book/movie.  COME ON!  Can we escape Hollywood for a MINUTE?!!  

One night, a friend I were driving back from the Redwoods and took a detour in San Francisco that brought us to Pier 39.  On a whim (and also because it was one of the few restaurants on the pier open at 930pm) we decided to eat here.  Neither of us had been here before, but both of us were pleasantly surprised by the food.  

The portions were quite healthy for the price, the steak was tender and juicy, and the shrimp flavorful and cooked just right.  The mashed potatoes were homemade, and the dessert quite chocolaty.  

Its probably not worth driving ALL the way to San Francisco for, but if you're in the area, its a great novelty restaurant with surprisingly scrumptious food.

They also have a bench with some oversized Forrest Gump style shoes and books glued down.  If you want to be a touristy nerd, feel free to sit in the appropriate spot and pose for the camera.  I did!
author: Chanel F.

description:
GOOD FOOD.

The drink was a bit watered down. Nice server, BUT the hostesses did nothing but gossip and talk shit. guess thats what minimum wage does to ya?
author: RoseMichelle M.

description:
I had dinner here on a Sunday night. Sure, I'm quite aware that its a tourist trap. I'm born and raised in the Bay Area, but I just want good food, tourist trap or not. 

We shared: Popcorn shrimp, "garden" side salad, and Shrimp Scampi.

The popcorn shrimp was delicious in that the shrimp was the freshest and softest that we've ever tasted. However, I believe there were only ~10 pieces of popcorn shrimp.

The "garden" salad that was part of the Shrimp Scampi was a total joke. I think I could buy a better salad at Costco.

The Shrimp Scampi was exceptionally delicious. The pasta noodles tasted great and of course the shrimp was yummy.

The service was decent. When we flipped the license plate, servers came to us within a couple minutes.

Besides the crappy garden salad that was ~$5, the end total came out to be $45!!!!! My goodness. that was expensive even after sharing 1 appetizer, 1 salad, and 1 entree. I'm confused. This place should be cheaply or at least make it up in amazing service or extraordinary food. With these prices, I'm more likely not to return.
author: A C.

description:
I absolutely love the movie Forest Gump...I know every word to it (pathetic i know) so naturally I would like to a go to a restaurant that is themed based on that movie.

I get there and i love the atmosphere and all of the interesting memorabilia that they have.

The wait was suppose to be an hr...so we decided to wait since that's where my boyfriend wanted to eat for my birthday.

After sitting for about 10min...a waiter comes by and asks us if we have been seated yes...we said no and we were seated right away! yay! for us we beat the system!!

We got in and the food was OK...overpriced i say but good nonetheless.

I told our waiter that it was my boyfriends birthday so they made him stand on his chair while they sang happy birthday to him.

It was the most hilarious thing i have ever seen someone do...they danced around him and it was just something that you had to see to believe.

Overall great server, great service. OK food.
author: Jessica B.

description:
As a general rule, I hate any restaurant with a gift shop, but Sister and Brother-in-Law really wanted to hit this place before the game, and I wasn't up to lecturing them on the utter WRONG-ness of patronizing a chain, themed, tourist-trap joint in a city filled with superb food options.

That said, it wasn't so bad.

The main saving grace of this restaurant is the AMAZING view!  You can practically see the whole bay from their windows!  That view alone was worth my money.

The food wasn't what I'd call "good," but it wasn't vomit-inducing, either.

The design is very creative, and if you're a fan of Forrest Gump, I'm sure you'll really dig it.

Overall, not anywhere I'd choose to go on my own, but great for people who want easy and fun.
author: Tracy S.

description: Horrible experience with this place, I wont even give it a half of a star. My husband & I have eaten here many times before and this most recent time we both had food poisioning. About an hour or 2 after we left the restaraunt, I was up all night throwing up and he had the ruins all night from the shrimp we ordered. To make matters worse the manager/risk department there didnt want to take any ownership of this matter. I will never eat here again, bad service and obviously bad food.
author: Janelle G.

description:
The food is actually not bad, although in a larger side in terms of portion.  Fans of, or someone who's familiar with Forrest Gump the movie will enjoy memorabias and pictures.  It's a nice place to take someone who's from out of the State.

It's in the deep part of Pier 39, so you will have walk a little to get here.  Good luck finding a parking spot though, especially on weekends :P
author: Tak K.

description:
I am giving them a 5-star rating for what has to be one of the absolute best overall experiences I have had at a place like this in years. We came with a large group (9) after a long day at Alcratraz and we were hungry.

We were seated within minutes, had appetizers on the table within minutes, drinks within minutes, and our food within minutes. Even with a server change, this visit was great.

The food was also excellent. I set my standards low considering it's a chain, but I was extremely impressed with everything. Shrimp of all kinds were done perfectly, drinks were well done, soft drinks were well carbonated...so on. Garlic breads were very good, and we even ordered one more and had it on our table within 2 minutes. I don't even know how they pulled that off considering how packed the place was.

I'm not going to detail everything out, but suffice it to say that for the entire party, this was one of the best meals we have had in a long time.
author: Scot B.

description:
$ - Over priced

Staff - Host:  Seemed as though he was new.

     Waiter:  She was great and made us feel welcomed.  Provided us some Forest Gump trivia.

     Waiter-In-Training:  Exactly what it was.  Waiter in training.  She seemed slow to pick things up.

Food:  Not worth the price they are offering.  Not impressed with the food.  Get more bang for your buck going to a Joe's Crab Shack.

Location:  Awesome location.  Great view of the bay and Alcatraz.
author: Wenzel A.

description: I've never eaten here and didn't get a chance to this weekend.  My review is on their hostess and table wait list service.  We had a large party and they must' have happen to have a table available because they said the wait would only be about 10 minutes.  They said the whole party needed to be there.  When they called my name I told them that our family was still parking in the lot and by the time I told them they were walking over they told me they gave the table up.  I understand they cannot hold the table for a long time, but usually in the city all the restaurants I have been to have been extremely understanding knowing the parking is difficult there.  Also, the walk to the restaurant is farther since they are at the end of the wharf.  I was mostly dissatisfied that I was sitting right next to the hostess table and she didn't have the courtesy to give me a heads up that they were giving up the table so I could just tell my family to go to our other restaurant option.  I can definitely see they are a typical tourist restaurant that doesn't care as much for returning customers and just wants to fill their table with whoever shows up.
author: L C.

description:
Yes, its tourist hell, but the view is great, there are fruity drinks my fiancee loves, and the service here is second to none.  The Bubba Gump's experience is great.  The Run/Stop signs are a cute touch and any staff that passes your table will help you.  None of this "I'll get your server" stuff that is everywhere else.  5 star service for a 2 star price!

The food is a solid 3 stars, nothing great, but a decent meal for a very fair price.  So I think its a well earned 4 stars.
author: Zakk D.

description:
Eh, I settled on this place after my stomach told me to pick a damn place already and stop referring to Yelp on my phone for restaurant advice. I knew the reviews this place had on Yelp, and despite my better judgement, I went in anyway. I hadn't eaten lunch, it was already 2:30pm and I didn't feel like wandering around Pier 39 anymore.

It was my first time to eat at Bubba Gump and probably the last time at that. If anything I went in just to say that I've eaten there. I wasn't expecting a grand experience, but the view of the bay was great. 

I didn't like how I put my name down for a table, got called over the PA system to announce that a table was ready, only to wait in line AGAIN for a table to be actually ready. I was starved at this time of the day so needless to say I wasn't very happy to wait twice for a table.

The artichoke dip was actually pretty good. There were huge chunks of artichoke. It was cheesy and oily (which made it good). Adding the extra pieces of shrimp like what we had didn't really make a difference in the flavor of the dip, only that it was a little bit more on the price.

The clam chowder was okay...still not as good as others I've tried, but at least it didn't taste like it came straight out of a Progresso Clam Chowder can. It had a lot of clam pieces, which was a nice surprise.

I ordered the shrimp po' boy since I didn't feel like having anything huge. It was great for the most part. The shrimp was nicely breaded and stayed crunchy even with the dressing in the sandwich. It was a little dry.

Our server was enthusiastic and helpful, so I can't complain there.

The only time that I'd probably go back here is when I have relatives over and they wanted to go to a Bubba Gumps, but I'd most definitely try to steer them in another direction if I could.
author: Chris F.

description:
I haven't been here in quite a while but have been here several times with friends.  The food here is okay.  It's nothing special in my opinion but people would go for the ambience and the whole Forrest Gump theme.  If you didn't know, Bubba Gumps is based on something in the movie Forrest Gump so the restaurant is designed in that fashion.  Your waiter talks to you about Forrest trivia and things like that.  

I give it four stars because I've generally had a good experience here and think it's worth trying.
author: Wilson C.

description:
I love this location.  We are usually fortunate enough to get a window seat, and the wait is not unbearable with all of the stores wrapped around you on the pier. I've been on dates here, brought my sister here for a full on embarrassing birthday song, and some damn good drinks.

..and one more time, coconut shrimp ftw!
author: Pucca C.

description:
I live in SF but I've been here three times hahah
This is definitely the better of the theme "touristy" restaurants.
The popcorn shrimp is to die for, it's a shame that they give you so little, this is one thing I'll order every time. Anything that's fried here is good, my dad enjoyed his fish n' chips.
The service is always fast and friendly.

I would give it 4*s but I do have my issues with BG.
Don't get the blueberry smoothie, maybe I'm used to the huge, sweet, flavorful shakes that I can get at Bashful Bull... but it was BLAND.
We sent it back once, and the second one was exactly the same, I had to add sugar so I could drink it.
Also, I've had better scampi, and the stuffed shrimp can be iffy, both were overly oily on the recent visit.
author: Stephanie F.

description: This is my 2nd time eating here. I don't remember what I ordered my first time but this time I ordered something my tastebuds will remember forever. Grilled cajun style Ahi tuna and shrimp over mashed potatoes, topped with a buttery cajun sauce. It was definitely worth the  walk from Embarcadero! Great service, awesome food, and breathtaking views. What more can you ask for?
author: Angelo R.

description: If you dislike waiting, then don't come here. I came here with some friends one night... We waited for a table. We waited to order. We waited to get our food. We waited for the check. Okay you get it; we waited an excessive amount of time. The food was whatever, not great. They added 18% gratuity onto each check. They have these little signs that say "Run Forest Run" if you don't need the waiter and "Stop Forest Stop" if you need the waiter. Unfortunately the waiter never responded to anything. Not a fan.
author: Lisa R.

description: Our bartender could not make a good margarita to save his life!! The food was greasy and way overpriced for the portion size!
author: Jeanie C.

description: Been here a couple of times. Always liked the food. Service is great but the view is really nice. The birthday party traditions and the trivia make it a unique fun experience. And the signs in the restaurant are really funny! Run Forest Run! Stop Forest Stop! haha
author: Ridhima S.

description: this  restaurant  is  not  that  good,  I've  been  to  other  bubba  restaurant  and  they  have  great  food.  this  one  here  in Pier 39  has  the  worst  fish  and  chips,  too  greasy  and  soggy  fries.  the  mojito  drinks... it's  terrible,  the  bar  tender  needs  to  learn  how  to  do  it  because  this  was  my  favorite  drink ... not  anymore,
author: Herminia H.

description:
Call me weird, but I had a salad (Pear & Berry Salad) when I came here. Pretty darn tasty. :) There was quite a bit of fruit in mine, but it was kind of weird when coupled with the chicken. As for the rest of the menu, seems like regular seafood, I guess..

The decor is neat, though. :D Are those really props from the movie, or replicas? Kind of a tourist spot, but it's okay because service is great! Everyone is friendly. :) Towards the end of our meal, the waiter began a trivia session with questions about the movie. I *know* my boyfriend and I got all the right answers! The waiter just couldn't hear us.. ^^
author: Annabel H.

description:
A very decent place to go to for seafood - seemed if anything you order from the menu is fresh and very tasty.  I had the fried shrimp, trite and simple it may be, but it was good and the shrimp clean and deveined.  My parents had the Mahi Mahi, and they loved it.  Forgot what I brother had at the time (sorry bro), but he didn't complain about anything and kinda liked the place too.
Staff did their job, just unremarkable; and the environment was a bit noisy, but that's to be expected to a place like this (which sorta compares to the Chicago-area Bob Chinn's) and the fact that this area is a tourist trap.
I'd give it a 3.75, but I hate to round up...
author: Y.D. K.

description:
Good food but not great. The atmosphere is better than the food actually. If you love the movie Forrest Gump then you'll love their little signs and things they put on the wall. If you hated the movie, you'll hate the fact that they play the movie 24/7 on tvs everywhere.

Ordered the stuffed shrimp and found it pretty good but its way too oily and heavy. Even their spinach dip was kinda oily too. I also didnt like how we had to distribute our own utensils and menus. I mean, come on, the food is way overpriced and you make us do your work? I might as well order shrimp at Chili's.
author: Mike B.

description: This is the one thing worth going to on Pier 39! Beautiful ocean views, decent pricing, and excellent food makes this a favorite for me in San Francisco. The one thing I hate is that it gets SUPER noisy in there, like twice as bad as normal restaurants, even touristy ones. Of course you may have to wait awhile, it is Pier 39 after all. But it's worth it. I tried the Run Across America samplee. I was a bit bummed there was way more of the spicey chicken than fried fish. I think the chicken should be replaced with more fish. Who goes to Bubba Gump's by the bay for chicken? But I did love that I got to try hush puppies with it. The dips for the chips were really yummy! The clam chowder was great too. This is a good plate for one or two but maybe not enough for a big party. Oh, and of course the peel and eat shrimp was amazing. I stopped there by myself during a walk around town, and even though I was just a party of one I received fantastic service, just like I was at a bigger table.
author: R R.

description: This place is a tourist must! Pier 39 has some cool places to eat, and this is one of them. Great view of the H20 as dine on your food. (take a look at the sea lions after you eat)
author: Brandon L.

description:
Never ever heard of this place before but my friends said it was really good so I joined them for dinner.  This place is based off of the movie "forest gump" with Tom Hanks.  So you can imagine what types of food they would serve here.  When we got here, we got seated very fast and service was very attentive.  

So for the food.   I went with the Shellfish bucket w/ a crab and shrimp bisque soup for an appetizer.   The soup came out cold which bugged me but it was no big deal.  I asked the waiter to heat it up and he made me a new bowl and it was a little hotter but not as hot as I like my soups.   As for the Shellfish bucket, It was a decent size serving of mussel, clams, crab legs and a lobster claw in some garlic sauce.  Too be honest it was kind of bland, there was really no special taste to it that caught my attention.  I found myself dipping almost everything in butter which is totally good for my health.  My friends got the shrimp basket, that was good but it was a bit on the salty side.   All in all, this is a nice place to try out if you're in the area.  The prices are decent for a "Seafood" joint and its a very upbeat and fun atmosphere.  Everyone is super into their job and happy.   Try it out!
author: David T.

description:
If you liked the movie then you'll love this joint. This place is a complete tourist trap but it's always fun to get away for a bit and do the touristy(?) thing. The wait staff is always very friendly and high energy. The decor is straight out of Louisiana but I always find the floor to feel real slippery when walking through. 

The food is right about middle of the road and the pricing is a bit higher (it is Pier 39). A bowl of clam chowder is $7.50 and I think they put too much celery in it, otherwise it was good. The fries weren't too tasty but the chicken caesar salad was served in a big bowl and was pretty good ($13.49). The bucket of steamed shellfish (mussels, clams, shrimp and crab for $22.99) was also pretty good, just watch out for flying juices when you're cracking the crab!

All-in-all, a good time. Just remember that this is located in the heart of our tourist area so there is always a wait for a table and the prices are much more than usual. 

RUN Forrest RUN!!!
author: Jason R.

description:
Come here for the shrimp buckets.  Anything else, look elsewhere.

The waitress or waiter will come to your table to ask questions about the movie, they used to give out little treats when you got it right, but not any more.

The last several times I went to Fisherman's Warf I ended up here, although I swore I'd just get a clam chowder bread bowl from a street vendor.  My friends and family love it, though.
author: Gene J.

description:
This restaurant is based on the movie Forest Gump, as you no doubt have read...and it's very gimmicky. I remember when I ate there with 3 or 4 friends, and we accidentally left up the "stop, Forest, stop" sign which is supposed to signal the waitress that you need something.  The waitress actually got angry at us for not having it on "run, Forest, run." 

The Food is a bit expensive, but where they really get you is the drinks (a strawberry lemonade was 6.00 Dollars O_o...ridiculous)  

I had Fish n' Chips, and both the fish and the chips were a bit greasy (the paper stuff they came on was as clear as glass =P). One of my friends got the calamari appetizer, which was inexpensive, but very salty. 

Overall, I'd say that it wasn't worth the price and that the food was fairly lame, but then again, the same thing can be said about anything at Pier 39.
author: Eric W.

description:
I came here because SOMEONE, i will not say who thought it was awesome...

I would give it 2.5* if i could but i cant.

This place has a REALLY REALLY nice view of the San Francisco Bay, and the atmosphere is pretty lively in here.  

They show the Forest Gump movie 24/7 and once in a while the waiter/waitresses will come over to quiz everyone on the movie.  You win something at the end, but thats for you to go there and find out what.

The food was eh, more disappointing than good.  I ordered the Crab stuffed shrimp, it just tasted like oily cheese, my bf got the sweet bbq pork sandwich which was way better even though they are supposed to be known for shrimp!!
author: kim w.

description:
+ Lava Flow
+ Boat Trash
+ "I'm Stuffed" Shrimp
+ Salmon & Veggie Skillet

So my gf and I were at Pier 39 one night and of all the restaurants still open at the time we chose to go to Bubba Gump. We were seated right away ... maybe because no one else was inside (well, a couple of old men in their 70s reminiscing about their days in the Vietnam War and a couple of busboys staring at the floor).

Anyways, service was mediocre at best ... though I didn't really care ... I was just hungry and I wanted my salmon.

note: this place is better during the day.
author: Vincent B.

description:
Visit #1: 3 adults 2 children Aug 2010

Service was good, but the kitchen was horrible! It took forever for our appetizers to come out. It came out and about a couple minutes later, our meals came. That was unacceptable, so the manager comped us the appetizer. Worked out well for us because it was 1.5 lbs of shrimp. Overall, the food was awesome...very yummy and the service was great! The prices were consistent of an average seafood restaurant. The fact they are on Pier 39 didn't really make a difference. Prices were much better than the other seafood places on the pier.

Visit #2: 4 adults and 2 children Nov 2010

Service and food were awesome! Didn't order appetizers this time. This is a great place to eat if you're visiting Frisco with family or friends. Very yummy food and again...average seafood restaurant prices. Portions were appropriate for the price.
author: Carol N.

description:
- Excellent smoothies/shakes. The fruity beverages mixes were awesome. Try the lava something. It was great. 5 star drink.
- Of course, shrimps. their shrimps were good.
- A bit of a long wait, but it's a tourist spot, so that's expected.
- Busy place, but they will take care of you. friendly staff
author: Andrew Q.

description:
I thought the service was pretty good, but I guess when we went it wasn't terribly busy either, as it was before the lunch rush.

The Fish n' Chips is probably the best fish n' chips I've ever had... Not authentic or anything, but it was very tasty. I've never had fish n' chips made with Mahi Mahi before... It was excellent. Nice and tender, flavorfull, etc. The breading was seasoned, and not too crispy, and not soggy. Reminds me of fried chicken in a way. But the breading was not oily at all, unlike other fish n' chips I've had.

However, the fries were bland, but the fish was so good, I didn't care.
The clam chowder on the other hand was nasty. Tasted like it came out of  a can.  The garlic bread was dissapointing as well. Wasn't garlicy enough, and too soggy.

After all was said and done, I still enjoyed my experience, even tho only 1 of the 3 things I ordered was memorable, but I liked the fish n' chips that much, that I would probably come back.. I just wouldn't order any of that other stuff.
author: Crayon S.

description:
This is a good place to eat if you LOVE shrimp. They have shrimp prepared in all different ways (steamed, fried, chilled, in pasta). I came here on a weeknight with a friend. The first thing I noticed while walking in was the dcor - the theme of course is based on the movie 'Forest Gump'. It's like eating in a fishing boat - with buckets and nets to catch shrimp. One of the shrimp appetizers we ordered came in a bucket (Shrimper's Net Catch) - the garlic spice sauce was tasty. For entre I ordered a shrimp pasta. The portion size of the appetizer and entre was hefty. After eating the appetizer I wasn't able to finish my entre. Or maybe I was just shrimped-out. I recommend having a margarita or 2 to wash down all that shrimp.

During the meal the waitress/waiter will ask various trivia questions from the movie. (ex. How many presidents were shown the movie? Can you name them?) Our waitress was friendly and made some recommendations. The wait for our food was long and I was hungry. Try to get your order in ASAP. I wouldn't recommend coming here on the weekend - the wait is long due to the abundance of tourists.
author: Candace F.

description: I use to come here with my best friend a couple of years ago and we would always get the Bbq salad. They don't have it anymore =[ sad face... But the place is still good but quite pricey. They have fresh seafood, which is why I keep on coming back. If you want to treat yourself come here :]
author: Melissa G.

description: blah good well ok waitress i asked do you have clam chowder? yes we do ... i got it well it was like chicken soup nothing like calm cowder were in S.F what the hek , i told her it doesnt even look like clam chower all she said was ok but it does have clams wow never again will i go or tell anyone to go .
author: Andrea s.

description:
I LOVE THIS SPOT : )



The food is good, the drinks are great, decorations are fantastic, the servers are very attentive.

this place is always poppin, great for families, group of friends or a pre- birthday get together.
author: alexandria f.

description: Your typical touristy cheesy overpriced restaurant on the water. Fried foods taste really fried, Like going to Hard Rock Cafe and drinks are measured and not very strong. Sorry. A good place for a family looking for that Disney experience on the Wharf
author: Annie A.

description:
I went here with a group for a friend's 21st birthday and if it wasn't for our server, I don't think I would've enjoyed the meal at all. Like many people know, this place is a tourist trap. You can tell from the first thing you see upon entering is merchandise you can purchase as a souvenir that you've visited Pier 39. Cool. I just wanted to get in and get my food.

So our server seats all of us and he was a total sweetheart and really paid attention to our needs. He was even nice enough to explain everything on the menu to one of our friends. Totally patient. And he came back with the drinks that we ordered, even if we didn't think it was that strong he would offer suggestions as to what was better and tried to make it as much of an enjoyable meal as possible. Too bad his niceness couldn't help the average seafood that they prepared. I had the hush puppies because I wasn't that hungry and it was one of the cheapest things on the menu (tourist spots hike up the prices like CRAZY). But all it tasted like was corn and breading. I could not taste the shrimp or crab inside. What a waste of $9 on 6 tiny pieces of cornbread. Everyone else seemed to enjoy their buckets of seafood, but of course since it was expensive, booze doesn't come cheap, and we're on the college budget, we had to share.

Overall, the enthusiastic server whose name I forgot (DAMN IT) was the best part of the meal. Even with our stupid asses leaving the "Run Forrest Run" sign up.
author: Leslie K.

description: we went for the first time as a family and the kids loved it.  we got a seat pretty fast b/c we are part of the laury's club.  the usual wait is 1 hour.  Food came pretty fast as well.  The kids got fish and chips - it comes with jello and the build your own sunday was a lot of fun for them as well.  our favorite is still the shrimp and dipping sauce.  The rice and sauce is the best.  The bucket of trash was okay - the clams and lobster are over cooked - dried out.  I don't think they cook it when you order it fresh, but that it is precooked and chilled and then re-cooked so I don't recommend ordering this.  The salad is good and the shrimp pasta and trio is good.  So just stick to shrimp orders and you would be good.  The thing I like most is that it is kid freindly
author: Kay T.

description:
We took the kids and had fun. I didn't know my daughter was such a big shrimp eater..lol!! 
 But she has good taste because Bubba Gump makes great shrimp! The cajun shrimp appetizer is so good and the waitress offered to do half cajun and half garlic butter for the kids since the cajun is spicy. What a yummy mix too. We also got the shrimp combo entree which was great too. It has coconut shrimp, deep fried shrimp, tempura shrimp etc with three different delicious dipping sauces.The rest of the food on the menu is not worth the high price. The Mahi Mahi wasn't as good as expected.... too salty. 
 I say it's great for family Shrimp fun or for anyone that enjoys a yummy beer and shrimp feast because they have a great beer selection too.
I will go again for that cajun shrimp : )
Enjoy!!!
author: Claudia M.

description: Went here with my boyfriend for dinner a few days ago. We ordered the Pear and Berry Salad, Steamed Shellfish, and fish and chips.  The salad and shellfish were to die for. The fish and chips were nothing special. Over all a great place to go on a date. Wonderful view of the bay and friendly service. We will be back for sure!
author: Sarah L.

description: This place is wonderful. The food is really tasty. But the best thing about this place is the view. You're right on the waterfront, and you get to San Francisco Bay, its islands and the Marin headlands. Imagine dining with such magnificent view! It's well worth any visit to Pier 39.
author: Holt D.

description: love love this place! any time in the city i stop here! its a must! delicious. i usually get a shrimp dish depending on how im feeling. service is fast once your actually seated. the wait is usually the worst part haha! but def well worth the wait! i recommend a thousand times!
author: Nicole C.

description: I have been to Bubba Gumps two times, both times I had the same impression. The service is okay the staff is friendly but the food is awful. What a shame to to be seated next to the ocean and have to suffer through tough stringy shrimp an tastless vegetables
author: Jeff D.

description: 4 of us went on a Saturday around 6pm. The wait was surprisingly short and exactly within the wait time the hostess gave us - - 20 min. The waiter was a very nice, accommodating kid. He Immediately swapped out my husbands warm tap beer for a colder one. He explained they were out of chilled glasses. But my food order was a huge disappointment. I ordered an $18 dollar  shrimp Louisiana bourbon skewers with mashed potatoes and corn on the cob & coleslaw. This food was completely cold. There was absolutely no heat at all. We were trying to catch a cruise to Alcatraz so there wasn't time to send it back. But I'm really surprised they would think such cold food would be acceptable. I tipped the waiter $12.00 out of $14.00, and wrote a note on the bill about the super cold food. Maybe he'll let the cooks know they are messin' with his money and step up their game when it comes to serving hot food.  Next trip to SF, I'll skip the trip to Bubba Gumps and get some chowder and fresh bread bowl instead.
author: Marcy R.

description:
This particular Bubba Gump Shrimp location is located on Pier 39. The views from this restaurant are great.

For the appetizer, I recommend the Cajun Shrimp.

For the entrée, I recommend the "Boat Trash," which is essentially shrimp. I also like the Mahi Mahi and baby back ribs.

Prices are about $7 to $11 for appetizers.

Entrées range from about $8 to $20.
author: A B.

description: The Bubba Gump restaurant is located in the far back corner of Pier 39 on the 2nd floor.  We were lucky and did not have much of a wait for a table on a busy Saturday evening.  I ordered the clam chowder and fish & chips.  The clam chowder was ok.  A bit too peppery and watered down.  I prefer my clam chowder to be creamy.  The fish & chips came with 5 pieces of fish; which weren't particularly big.  The flavor though was good.  Would I go back to this restaurant?  Meh....there are other restaurants at the pier that I would prefer to go try before returning to Bubba Gump.  On the plus side, since we dined at a restaurant, we were able to get 2 hours of free parking in the lot across the street from the pier.
author: D B.

description: First timers!  Good food, great service, awesome experience!
author: Miranda n.

description: I thought this would be a cheesy tourist trap kind of place but it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. There is a great view and the food is good but not great.
author: B T.

description: The food isn't bad for a chain restaurant. I found the proportions good and tasty. The large order fo the fish & chips was almost too much to eat. The batter tasted something like KFC classic recipe. One caveat: do not be in a hurry. These guys are slow to get your food to you. I encountered the same problem at the Bubba Gumps in Monterey. Still, the food works.
author: Robert A.

description: Very dissapointing, shrimp taste like they were the precooked frozen from the grocery store with seasoning on it... Bubba would be very dissapointed...
author: Ian R.

description: HORRIBLE SERVICE! I had reservations for my birthday and ONE they skipped our name soo many times we waited over an hour and service was just bad! Food was alright, I got the bucket and it was flavorless! I don't plan to go back again!
author: gee b.

description: If you want to eat shrimps, shrimps and more shrimps in all varieties this is the place.  good cencept and decent portions..
author: Stawan K.

description:
I am one of the unfortunate ones who has been to this establishment. I must say, I LOVE SEAFOOD~ I DON'T LOVE BUBBA GUMP'S. The service sucks. My family insisted we go here and me being a newbie to the place I was very excited especially eating at Forrest Gump's restaurant (LOL) 

We had to wait an hour and a half to get seated. And another 30 minutes to take our order. That's 2 hours down the drain. By, the time were done eating it was dark and we hardly got to the rest of SF because we spent  much time there. The only reason I gave it 2 stars because my kids enjoyed the food.
author: Tessi M.

description: Food here is okay but there are other seafood restaurants in San Francisco. I like that they have those signs that indicate if a table needs a server because sometimes it gets really hard to flag someone down. I get that this is supposed to be modeled after the movie Forest Gump but I was expecting the menu to have a more variety of fish not shrimp. Everything on the menu is basically shrimp. The garlic bread is also not good, it's like a slab of bread covered in a pound of butter, not real garlic bread. Instead of eating here, just eat at the sidewalk stands at fisherman's wharf, its worth it.
author: Pearce C.

description:
for overpriced tourist food, i still always have a good time here..
....great location! but that's a given...
author: jessica s.

description: We went there last week but we been going here every now and than, since it is a tourist spot. Some time is fun to play a tourist in your own city, you'll learn something new every time. Every time we went here, we had a great service and the food was always great. I love the garlic shrimp as the starter as well as my kids. Plus you get a great view of the bay.I love the idea you can put up the sign for them to stop when we need something.
author: mimi S.

description: The Atmosphere was good awesome view service was quick and on time but the shrimp had better if they call that spicy. The fish sandwich was good though I still have to give them three star because of the shrimp
author: Jay M.

description: I LOOOOOVVVVEEEE shrimp. So I love going to Bubba Gumps. Shrimper's Net Catch is what I love. Their ribs and the salmon isn't too bad. I got a free lighted up cup for ordering a smoothie. LoL. But I don't think their overpriced. The staff are SUPER cool. I love Bubba Gumps.
author: Vika H.

description: Oh how I wish I could this place 5 stars. The food is excellent, the waiters and waitresses are always super friendly too. The thing that prevents me from giving it 5 stars is the fact that because it's such a popular place the staff rush you to make sure they can seat new customers. It doesn't seem to make a difference whether you come by on a weekday or during the weekend, it's always packed. Other than that, love this place!
author: Linda S.

description: Very expensive for 13 people we had chip about 20 or 30 forgot it was like 3 years ago. Had our middle school reunion so I didn't care like to try new places.
author: John F.

description:
ill tell ya why I enjoyed myself here, the staff at the bar are great!  
old man and i came in to see if one of his tattoo customers was working.  he wasn't there, but were getting thirsty so we decided to sit at the bar and hang and drink some margaritas.  one dude ron i think introduced himself, took our orders, (we also got fries and shrimp salsa, which was fine) and we proceeded to watch the controlled chaos that is working in a fun loving chain restaurant.  they are a bunch of good hard working people.  i respect that.  i think the saying is, mad props to them for bustin their asses and still being nice.
author: yayoi s.

description:
I came in expecting a tourist trap, but at the very least one that could deliver decent shrimp. Unfortunately it fell short.

I was greeted by friendly hostess, and was called in for seating after approximately 10 minutes. However, there was a secondary wait after that, of another 10 minutes. It was jammed packed in there though, even in the late afternoon. And noisy. Three people had a birthday apparently, and the loud, obnoxious birthday song was certainly not helping the atmosphere. 

I ordered the Shrimper's Heaven, which was 4 kinds of Shrimp. Tempura, fried, coconut, and chili. Tempura shrimp was flavorless and barely warm, same with fried shrimp. The chili shrimp were slightly below room temperature, and barely tasted of anything other than plain shrimp. The coconut shrimp were hot and juicy, and delightful. Unfortunately 1 out of 4 is not acceptable for a shrimp restaurant literally a stone's throw away from the ocean. The fries were good. Dipping sauces were passable, and I relied on the classic seafood sauce for my flavor. 

Among the other tourist traps on the wharf I visited, this was the most unfortunate. Dropping $20+ on mediocre shrimp left me feeling disappointed.

I do not begrudge myself the experience, and if you have a large group of tourists to entertain it's worth going, but I won't be returning any time soon.
author: Paul H.

description: So this place is really...intense. Lots of pieces of flair, lots of server entertainment/interaction with the tables. I went with my co-workers during lunch and it felt like we were transported into a faraway land of tourists and excitement. It was a little overwhelming at first and our server was almost too much, but he committed so much that I think he won us over at the end. The food was enjoyable, as any dish with shrimp and cheese will be delish but...it's Bubba Gump! Pretty cookie cutter and definitely overpriced. If you're feeling the excitment and festivity vibe, this might be cool to check out. If you want a good meal without the pomp and circumstance, then why are you at the wharf to being with?!
author: Hanan H.

description: Bad right from the start. First the hostess calls our name along with several other parties. We get to the front desk and they tell us we didn't check in before they sat another group. If they can't guarantee a table don't call our name. Called us again five minutes later and we were seated. Ordered our food and took about fifteen minutes for a salad from one of the soup/salad combos we ordered. Then they brought our food out only they didn't bring my order of the soup and salad combo. Wait staff apologized and took ten minutes just to bring me the salad. Husband asked where my soup was and I just told them to forget it. My teenager ordered the clam chowder and didn't like it. Husband tasted and said the same. Usually when the wait staff makes a mistake they may offer a discount or free item, but nothing. The waiter serving us did not even apologize, only the food runner did. Very loud, lots of customers, but I am willing to bet if it wasn't on the wharf they wouldn't be as popular. Food was wayyyyyy overpriced as well. Long John Silvers has better food than this place. Should have went to one of the many chowder places around the area instead.
author: Sarah C.

description: if you like seafood and margaritas this is a great place i was delighted with the grilled shrimp, my wife with the some fish and my one yr old daughter loves the garlic mash potatos.
author: Sam H.

description:
B.G.'s is alright if you're looking for a touristy lunch spot.  My wife and I took a couples getaway and it rained the entire time we were at the Bay.  I opted for Bubba's because it looked like the kind of place that doesn't mind if you walk in dripping wet, fresh off the plane.

I've seen the movie and like it, but not to the point of creating a religion out of it.  I imagine for those who ARE members of the Church of Gump, this is their Shangri La.  

I recommend bellying up to the bar and getting to know the brewslinger there, as it proves to be more entertaining ripping apart the Cult of Gump with someone who is haplessly shackled to it.

We managed to eat and drink (drink mainly) a hundred dollars worth of grub that was pub-fare enjoyable.   Obviously, it's not recommended for those with dainty, sensitive stomachs.

Overall, I would recommend this place if you revel in the schmaltz of pop culture as interpreted by over-zealous fans with too much money and have experience eating Midwestern cuisine (i.e. deep-fried mayonnaise balls*). 

*Thank you Daniel Tosh.
author: B.J. M.

description:
WAY overpriced for what you get.  The service was ok at best.  We were told 10 minutes for a table and 40 minutes later, after complaining, we were seated.  Seated RIGHT AT the kitchen door.  I would have been more comfortable by the bathroom.

There were tons of people waiting for tables and when we were brought into the dining room there were at least 10 tables that needed to be bussed.  They remained dirty and unused almost the entire time we were there.  I was annoyed that people were waiting for no reason.  I saw 3 different waiters or buss people drop plates of food or trays of plates and it seemed that there was absolute chaos with the staff.

Our waitress, an Irish girl whose name I don't recall, was fine.  She was attentive and offered some good food suggestions (nothing fried).  The food was OK, but the prices were out of line for a chain restaurant.

We can say we've been there, but we won't go back.
author: Walt G.

description:
Pricey food and small portions.

1 star for the excellent service, and another one because the shrimp is sooo good. Other than that, don't be suprised if you walk outta here still hungry =\
author: Mike A.

description:
overpriced! better than joe's crabshack though.
food was decent, but way overpriced...
author: emily p.

description:
The movie is so old... the theme of this restaurant just isn't that novel anymore.  The servers were attentive and kind of obnoxious; and the fried food had obviously been sitting out for awhile (they were warm and stale, instead of hot and crispy).  I got the Dixie Fishwich, and it wasn't TERRIBLE... but it just seemed a giant Filet-O-Fish from McDonald's... at 6x the price.

If I weren't with a large group who was already planning on coming here, I would not have gone.  There are so many good, unique places to eat in SAN FRANCISCO!  Why go to this chain restaurant?
author: Samantha L.

description: I used to love coming to this place - but things have changed. The food is not that great - it's overcooked and covered with too much breading. Service is a bit slow for being a place in the pier. I'd recommend going to Pier Market if you want to eat something in the Pier 39.
author: Michelle F.

description: Yes, ohhhhh yes, this is for sure the best shrimp around, and my credit card can prove it! We the service too, very nice.
author: John W.

description: Talk about a tourist trap from hell! The best thing about this place is the Bar and the view. Other than that it's a deep fried heart attack in the making that is waaay over priced and set up to swoop on unsuspecting tourist that literally get right off the boat and land at Pier 39. I love the service but can only stand watching Forrest Gump so many times in one sitting before I am heading back to the bar or another bar far far away.
author: Muhammad R.

description: I had friends from CO visiting and they wanted to eat here...I was reluctant having eaten at the one in Monterey years ago...buuuuuut...I was very pleased with my spinach artichoke dip and chips and the pear berry salad (which normally comes with chicken but they were kind enough to sub avocado) was a delicous surprise.   The Margarita was a disappointment...could barely taste the tequila let alone the triple sec...should have known better.   The waitstaff is amazing and plentiful and very accomodating.
author: joni L.

description: Fun atmosphere on Pier 39, service was outstanding even with the crowd. Food was good and price not bad for what you get. Loved it! Service can really make or break a place,it most assuredly makes this place. I would like to point out  those that say it is a tourist trap are completely right but if you are a tourist to San Francisco and you are on Pier 39 it is exactly what you are looking for.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Nobody other than tourists hang out at Fisherman's Wharf.
Unless you're dragged there by friends who still find Pier 39 quaint and fun because they have not lived in SF long enough to be tired of touristy attractions.
My friend dragged me here my last birthday.  It seemed very little kiddish because of all the Forrest Gump souveneirs hanging from the walls, the whole idea of the "Stop Forrest Stop" signs for your waiter, and the ambiance in general.  So what.  I'm still a kid at heart so I didn't really care since she was paying for it anyways.  We didn't have to wait too long since it was a Wednesday in the early afternoon.  The food was average, nothing great.  I've had shrimp just as good elsewhere and haven't been charged as much.  But probably the worst thing was the birthday song.  I was made to stand up on my chair, and I was quickly turning as red as a lobster, they sang the bday song to me and presented me with free dessert as everyone, and I am not exaggerating, EVERYONE in the friggin restaurant turned around and clapped along.  As I slunk back down in my chair, I poked at the not so tempting birthday dessert I was given and begged my friend to pay the bill so we could scram.  
It's an ok place to have a fun but expensive time with friends.
I won't be going back.
Thanks to being overrun by tourists.  ugh.
author: Marley E.

description: Food was terrible and the restaurant looks like a cafeteria. The service was good but it doesn't make up for the garbage food, avoid at all costs.
author: C S.

description:
it's kinda like hooters, but without the hooters. family friendly and LOUD. 
this's not where you should go for great seafood, but the food was not bad... I mainly came here because i love forest gump saw the movie many times but  bombed the quiz!
waiter: who did forest marry?
us: eh.... her....she...
waiter: here's a hint starts with a j ends in a y
us: JENNY!
waiter: what did he name his boat:
us: bubba?
waiter: here's a hint starts with a j ends in a y
us: jenny?
waiter: what did he name his second boat?
us: BUBBA!
waiter: here's a hint starts with a j ends in a y
us: oh jenny

we had the:
* bubba's far out dip (love chips and dip, bit on the oily side)
* bucket o boat trash (definitely for sharing, lobster tail was weird... didn't know if i was suppose to eat it with the shell...so i did)
* shrimp scampi

if you get anything at all get the shrimp scampi, and try to hold back from ordering all fried food. all the spice and oil made my throat hurt)
lastly... it's located at the end of pier 39 in the way back second floor... gets pretty chilly there so bring a jacket.
author: Lynn T.

description: Life isn't always like a box of chocolates - sometimes you know exactly what you're going to get. Here it's mediocre food and indifferent service in a theme-park atmosphere. I warned my out-of-town visitors, but there was no talking their kids out of the Bubba  experience, which they loved, proving that this spot is ideal for those who are too naive to know the difference between gourmet and Gump.
author: Gourmet G.

description: A few years ago I worked here.  Yes, it was a low point, I'm better now.  Actually, I never got past the training.  They made me memorize stupid  Forrest Gump trivia to ask the tourists.  What was Lieutenant Dan's real name? I would just ask that one over and over in my most monotone voice. And I was supposed to instantly give service to any table who flips this stop-go sign to stop.  Like I am really going to go to that table because little Timmy keeps flipping that damn sign.  I lasted 3 months and when I quit I was still in "training".  This place almost made me hate the movie.  Almost.
author: Starla D.

description:
Come on people.  The fact that this place is even being reviewed is an insult to common decency.  This is a restaurant named after a fake company from a movie, and it's located in the biggest tourist trap in SF.  Honestly, how good could this be?  Do we really need to answer this question?  

Do we?

Okay fine, here we go.

I thought nothing could get worse than Red Lobster (pls see my review).  I forgot about Bubba Gump Shrimp.  I came here on my first visit to SF many rotations around the sun ago, and ended up doing the tourist tour of Pier 39.  It started raining, and we were tired and hungry, and we saw the first recognizable name (ie. Bubba Gump) so we thought, okay let's try it out.  WE FELL FOR EXACTLY WHAT THE CREATORS OF BUBBA GUMP EXPECTED US TO DO.  

They bank on the fact that tourists are tired, hungry and will go to the first recognizable place, and are less resistant to dropping bills.  I take it back, these people are geniuses, because even I was young and naive once, and fell for it.  

What does Bubba Gump have to do with Pier 39, or even SF?  Absolutely nothing.  Bubba Gump is located at other tourist traps across the US, and the food quality is exactly what you would expect from a tourist trap area, ie. the food was terrible and terribly expensive.  They don't care about repeat customers, all they care about is casting as wide net as possible to ensnare as many people as possible *once*.  

If I had Bill Gates money, I would open a competing restaurant with a similarly recognizable name, such as  "Stars Wars Canteena" or "Shrek's Castle Restaurant", right across from every single one of these restaurants, to drive them out of business.
author: Stan L.

description:
would you like to eat some disgusting shrimp?
that cost a ridiculous amount?
i mean, if you can even order,
because the waitstaff are terrible.
they don't even pay attention to you, 
even when they run into you.
(which they did, three times, while we were here. RAN INTO OUR CHAIRS, & then neglected to even give us an "oops! sorry")

this place is awful, & i can't believe i was so hungry i let my guard down and got suckered into going.

NEVER AGAIN.
author: Irene S.

description:
Wanted some fried comfort food so the other half and I made our way to the Pier 39 area. I love the friendliness and cheerfulness of the servers here. Yes it is a little touristy and commercial but hey sometimes you need a little of that tin your life. The whole bubba gump trivia is entertaining. Our server decided to integrate the tables around us for bubba gump trivia (I won a stuffed shrimp). Usually there's a wait time of 30+ minutes but luckily put wait was half that time and our tables had a bay view. We shared the shrimper's net catch (beer steamed shrimp), you know when you eat a popcorn you tell yourself only a few but you end up eating more? Yeah that beer method and spices got me hooked on the shrimp that i popped one right after another and almost finished the whole thing. For the entree I had the fish and chips and he had the ribs. The mahi mahi was coated and fried to perception. For some reason I remember eating this a while back and complained bout the coating being too thick but this time around it was lightly coated. I got a piece of the ribs and the meat tore off the bones with breeze and the bbq sauce was spicy. For got was drink he ordered but we got to keep the glass.

Our server checked in on us and brought us whatever we requested promptly. It is a little pricey but I guess you have to pay a little for the view.
author: Lola L.

description: Fish and chips were good, but not $18.80 good.  More like $10 good. I tried some of other peoples food, and I was not impressed at all. I was a big fan of their tartar sauce though. Definitely not good enough to visit again.
author: Anthony M.

description: Terrible food, badly mixed drinks, ditzy service.  If you're a tourist looking for the "Forrest Gump" experience you'll enjoy it but if you're just stuck in that neighborhood looking for a meal the Gump Trivia quizzes will get very old (e.g., when you just want your check so you can get the hell out of there).
author: Angela W.

description:
if you like seafood...if you liked fried seafood...i think there's some sauteed butter seafood and grilled as well.   veg heads can get sides from what i remember...

this place is fun for the bubba gump movie factor of it all.  i love the license plates that say run forrest [or was it go], and stop.  or something like that.. anyway, u use it for the waiter to alert them if u need them or not.  i like that idea.. u don't have flag them down.  it's subtle and they have to look out for it.  u know sometimes u have to call them a million times and they don't even acknowledge u...sometimes avoid eye contact, or acknowledge but come later...

there's paraphernalia from the movie... it plays on the tv's.  it's funny and cheesey..  i guess that's why i give it 4 stars.  i like quirky novelty stuff...what can i say.  and i like that movie too.  it's not really for the food...  and i did eat their when i ate seafood.. it's okay.

back in the day some of my gf celebrated their bdays there...they make u stand on the chairs and chug...   i guess the high rating for nostalgia too.  we had a great time that night...roaming the pier drunk.
author: Sheri N.

description: My bf and I ate here and the bill was $90. And all we ordered was two entrees a soda and an appetizer. way overpriced and the food wasn't even that great. Definitely would NOT come back. Don't waste your money, folks. Oh and the waitress dropped her tray and food/sauce went flying on me. The manager had to bring me a wet cloth with baking soda to try and remove the stain. I wouldn't say I had the best experience here.
author: Jen Y.

description: We went here on Fleet Week (Saturday) in 09/2010, my girlfriend made a reservation's in person for 3:30pm for a party of 3. We got to the hostess at 3:30 and she said that it will be a few minutes for our table, we sat down and 40 minutes later they finally call our name. We walked up the ramp and waited another 30 minutes for them and still no table ready. After the 30 minutes we are told they are having a shift change and its going to be another 15-20 minutes for us to get a table. We were all starving by then and left. We went down to Houston's and got seated right away. We will never be going back to Bubba Gumps again.
author: Itchy F.

description: My wife and I went here on our honeymoon a year and a half ago and loved it! So much that I can't wait to go back. We walked all around Pier 39 trying to decide where to eat and decided on Bubba Gump and had no regrets. The wait was short, our server was great, we had a window-side view of the bay, and the food was amazing! I had this shrimp crab cake thing which has to be the best food I have ever tasted. Bubba Gump may be a franchise, but it is still a perfect way to experience the yuminess of Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Dustin C.

description: This place would get 4 stars from me, but more is expected from this place because of it's name and the price they charge for their food.  They got a good listing of mixed drinks and beers on tap here.  Hurray!  Their food on the other hand is a little above average, but I'd expect more coming to a place like this.  But at least they validate your Pier 39 parking for you for eating here.  I'd recommend either getting a fish & chips plate or getting down with a fish fillet or some sort of fish plate that looks and sounds good on the menu. Decent date spot for a day out on the pier.
author: Chris T.

description:
i give them no stars!!!!

it was my first time to try their food,but i found the place un-friendly . 

i was supposed to have a take-out order,but changed my mind the last minute. the guy who took my order didn't seem interested  talking to me(the customer).. "i told them , I'll take my business somewhere else"
author: m e.

description: If I was to compare Bubba Gump to other Pier 39 restaurants, I would put two stars because I have "experienced better." This place gets an extra star for their great service, and that's it. But do come here if you're in the mood for shrimp, that's pretty much what you'll see on the menu. I love shrimp, but I was looking for a little variety I guess, hence the average rating.
author: Narina A.

description: DID YOU KNOW SHIT WAS EVERY WHERE?...Okay nice place to have shrimp...my Dad really does live in the bayou off the Gulf Coast and considering I had some real authentic style shrimp back over in Gulf  this is good enough to pass for Cajun style platters...Service is always wonderful cus my good friend works there as a bartender...so I always get prompt service and attention. However about the shit! My friend called me to tell me he was not going to work because there drain system and sewage line backed up into the dishwashers, sinks, cooking areas, bar, everywhere...They did close for a full day to clean up and have health inspectors check it out before opening but I have not gone back cus even the dishwasher's had backed up sewage and there kitchen was full of piss & shit...So I would never go back and eat there again....
author: Michael H.

description: There was a bit of long wait, even though the tables weren't filled. Although we asked for a booth, we were seated at a regular table, but they switched us after we requested it again. Our waiter was cool, but my sister and bro-in-law were pretty angry of the fact that the salads were brought out after our main dishes were served.  I had the shrimp lovers combo and ordered the side of rice. The cold shrimp weren't peeled, but the coconut, battered, and tempura shrimps were pretty good. the sweet mango sauce was my favorite.  did you know that jumbo shrimp is an oxymoron?
author: Jay M.

description: So my review is not going to be very helpful because I am vegetarian.  We went there with visiting family as they wanted to try it since it is Bubba Gumps and all and so that's why I went.  I didn't enjoy it all.  There is no veggie selection, obviously.  The service was good.  However, it was way too crowded, too noisy.  I think San Francisco has much better restaurants to offer.
author: Joyce P.

description: Most people don't come to SF to visit Gary Danko or Aqua.  They come here for vacation and want to visit the touristy spots and that's ok.  Bubba Gumps is one of those places where they can take the kids and have fun and a good meal albeit at an inflated price.  Do ya think the kids are going to remember MOFA?  No,  they're going to remember having their picture taken on the bench outside Bubba's with Forest.  Way to go Bubba Gumps!
author: Kevin G.

description: BLEH Been to this location and the one in Miami Beach. Both were MEDIOCRE at best. Over priced tourist trap.
author: Pamela M.

description: So my gf and I ordered the hush puppies which were pretty good, she ordered the shellfish bucket or whatever but most of the seafood in there was overcooked & chewy, and the only thing that was decent was the lobster claw, but it was TINY! nice service when the girl actually paid attention but other than that was totally ignored. my fish was way to salty and only came with rice so it was pretty boring. and I guess the alcohol they put in my drink wasn't enough. Came here as a kid and thought it was good. Mabye growing older your tastesbuds mature because this time it was mediocre. Spent about 80 for the both of us when I would much rather go to Long John Silver's.
author: K N.

description: THIS PLACE IS A JOKE ESPECIALLY ON WEEKENDS.  After waiting hours to be seated we were asked if our party of 8 (plus a high chair) would like to split our party up inorder to be served at two different tables.  Are you kidding me!!  What's the point of being put on the wait list with a large party when you will be asked while your being seated (might I add) if your party would like to be split up.  Of course we DECLINE!!  Then they proceeded to seat us at a table that had enough room for 8 chairs only!  Where was my 2 year old suppose to sit on top of the table? REALLY!!!  By this time I'm getting annoyed.  I asked  the female embecles who made the silly request to split up my party that I wanted to speak to the manager.  She replied with a nasty attitude "I am the manager', as if I had asked her to have several seats in those hard, ugly chairs they make their customers sit in.  Then we were told that we had to wait until customers at another table vacated so they could push their table together to make room for my party and THEN proceeded to ask my party of 8 (plus a high chair) remind you to sit at a booth which seats 4 at the most.  You want us to sit where?  WHAT IS GOING ON UP IN HERE!!!!   After waiting for the other party to vacate which I must add was a party that was split up as well.  They were waiting for the rest of their party who was seated close by at another table to finish their meals so they could all leave together.  Unbelieveable!!!  Once seated I wish we had left.  They only reason I stayed was because my children waited so long and really wanted to eat there.  The food was terrible, cold and bland.  The waiter at another table spilled someone drink all over the table and the floor.   I can't believe I paid money to this establishment after experiencing what my family and I had to deal with.  I will NEVER come back here I don't care what time or day of the week it is.
author: Franketta G.

description: I only saw like half of the movie but was able to answer most of the questions since on the table there were clues! They should have like a prize when you get the questions correct. Anyways it is always crowded! Here and the table wait is about 10-15 minutes but it give you time to check out the gift shop! I got the boat load of trash which had a lot of different kind of seafood in it! There were mini lobster tails! which I loved. My boyfriend got he pulled pork sandwich which was loaded with meat and even filled him up! The view is pretty when you sit near the window because you see can see the ocean and the wharf with the boats.
author: Janet Z.

description:
went here for the first time in years since i had gone with my family...

first impression crowded as always, but not too bad of a wait time for a sunday afternoon. 15 min max we waited.

as we are seated to our table takes about 15 minutes for a waiter/waitress to come over..then once we've ordered our drinks as she serves em mixes mine up with my boyfriend's order.

After we received our food, which i specifically requested it not to be spicy its served none other than S-P-I-C-Y!! wth. so much for her being a waitress and listening to a customers' order, isnt that what those note pads they carry around are for?!!?!?

anyway finally get her attention after watching her fcuk up the order at another table of which one of my girls and her friends were at, she then comes back to ours we send it back and i order another dish with substituted chicken instead of shrimp (bad seafood allergy) and yep we get it its good,tangy but delicious as of yet....OH BUT WAIT....DID I MENTION THEIR WAS A SHORT PIECE OF BLACK HAIR IN IT, YUCK!!!! the next time i go back to BG will probably be when my grandkids have their kids....so gross. cannot stand places with that type of service. i know it happens ever since i watched the movie "Waiting" but still.... gross!

luckliy the dumb waitress removed both my dishes, and the tab was under $40-

NOTE: to Rachel Ray do not eat here its definitely not worth your $40 in a day meals.
author: Tiffani L.

description:
uber-sugary "alcoholic" beverages were overpriced and disgusting!!

overall corporate scum... over-rehearsed waiters, cookie-cutter menu

food was decent (if your in the mood for greasy shrimp) but not for the price

tourist trap. everyone (including servers) had accents

1 star for the coconut shrimp
author: c e.

description: I went here to do the touristy thing and honestly it's not that great.  I went here twice and I was not impressed both times.  The food was okay and pricey.  I rather get a bowl of clam chowder by the wharf and it enjoy the hot soup while I sit in the cold.  I would not recommend it  if you're looking for good food.  Instead I would recommend walking up that steep hill to Little Italy or China Town for some good authentic food!  It's worth every step!
author: Nicole E.

description: It's a nice place and I had a good time here, the food was good and the service was good. The wait is sometimes rediculous, but hey it gives you some time to walk around the pier. =).
author: meL Z.

description: Went there for my birthday couple of years ago, haven't been back not because of the restaurant but because of the tourists!!!! Ahhhhhh, located dead smack in the middle of it. It's a chain restaurant, it's fun, drinks are good & they do some embarrasing shit for ur friends birthday! Cool, relaxed place to go! Each table has a sign @ the end of it that says something to the effect of stopping & going. This is for your server...GENIUS!
author: Karen H.

description:
i am seriously repulsed by this place.

i understand that it is a total tourist trap, and it's a "famous" restaurant.. but that doesn't mean that you can't serve good, decent food! i was on the verge of a heart attack after eating the popcorn shrimp and calamari. 

seafood with your salt, anyone?

pass this up.. go down to the wharf and get some REAL seafood.
author: Nancy P.

description:
Life is like a box of chocolates, youll never know what youre gonna get...Such as going to this place to eat lunch. Had to wait about an hour to get seated. Then had to fight the crowd to even walk through the front door after being called to get seated. The we were greeted sent up to person who seats us, the guy got 3 menus and then walked about 100 mph to the table. While here I was practically pulling the arm off of my 7 yr old trying to keep up. Crazy. The same goes when trying to exit the restaurant. I was thinking wow, what if a fire broke out and you were trying to get out of this place and all you have is this small opening jam packed with people. I over heard another pissed of lady cussing to her friend about the people blocking the entrance way.

So...then...our waitress came and we ordered our drinks. I ordered a lemonade (the one for $7.95 for my son, came with a glass you can keep, well it wasnt glass but plastic but the bottom lit up which he liked) So she brought us 3 waters and 5 min later the lemonade came. My son took a slurp and his mouth puckered. I drank it and did the same. The waitress came by and asked how it was. He said the truth, it was sour. She just gave a questioned looked and just smiled.  I thought ok.

My husband ordered the bucket of junk (which consisted of fried fish, shrimp and 2 lobster claws) I tasted the lobster and it was good. Son got the usual chicken tenders & fries. It came in a paper Jenny boat, it was cute.
I ordered the fish sandwich (I got it charbroiled instead of fried) when it came out it wasnt charbroiled and it didnt have much flavor. Very bland. I tried dumping some of that hot sauce that was on the table and it worked. The pickle it came with was warm and real salty. Fries were nothing special. 
Yes the view is nice we sat in the lower level, not right next to the window but the tables next to them. So we have the table in the upper level, group of people sitting there facing outwards. Feels like you are being watched while you eat, drink & talk. Like you have your own audience. lol
We never used that Run Forest Run / Stop Forest Stop license place signs on the table but the people next to us was using it when trying to pay the bill. Funny. Our waitress told us about using it too. Guess its good so you dont have to depend on 1 person to help out on tables. 

I just thought it was funny that they were playing the Forest Gump movie and its been about what, 15 yrs since that movie came out?? wow! Funny how they can open up a joint based on a movie. Guess its working real well, sucks in all the tourists.
author: Sandy N.

description: I enjoyed the view of the bay and the Alcatraz. However, the food was basically to chain-y and too salty fo rme. Nevertheless, it was a nice snack and a nice experience. An extra half star for making me a bloody mary on an easter sunday afternoon!
author: Oanh N.

description: I should have thought to order a salad.  It is a pricy tourist trap with coconut shrimp and mahi mahi.  They sell cute shrimp plushes.  We didn't get a view.  When a local took us here, I should have known it was some kind of insult.
author: Ai M.

description:
The best part about this restaurant is the fact that they can design an entire restaurant chain based on one movie.  Why aren't there more themed restaurants like this, where families can go for a nice meal and some Friday night fun?
The food was great, the drinks were great, but the service needs improvement. The calamari was nothing more than fried batter. The server seemed unconcerned with our table, not to mention everything (appetizers, drinks, and entrees) came out all at once, so we had to down it all together rather than taking our time to enjoy the food. 
Again, I must stress the service was rather unpleasant... as if their goal is to get you in, take your money, then get you out as quick as possible. Not that we had room for it, but they didn't even ask us if we wanted dessert. I guess they just wanted us to leave. FYI Bubba-if you want a good tip, treat your customers as if they were your guests, not your paycheck.
author: Crystal R.

description:
Night we went: SUNDAY NIGHT

Food, quality & portion was good. Service was great. Love the atmosphere, especially the view at night. The run/stop bubba sign does help. No need to flag down a waiter. Would come back again & again! Gotta know your forrest gump movie for random trivia that the waiters ask. Its an open good time at this place and many birthday celebrations. Be ready to stand on the chair and have all eyes on you.
author: Duane D.

description:
smell that?  it's called a tourist trap and it's a big one!  

If you like this place, I'd recommend you take your planet hollywood jacket and walk over to the local hard rock cafe and get your hurricane glass/shot glass...
author: Rob Y.

description: This is where I'd probably eat if I had a day at the pier. The food is great! The shrimp is sooo delicious and I love the coconut shrimp. Somewhat expensive, but I'd only visit this place once or twice a year so I don't mind too much :)
author: Vivian R.

description: We always enjoyed our time at Bubba Gump Shrimp Co at any locations.  Good food, good service and we always get the good seating next to the window.  Even during busy days where we have to wait 5-10 minutes, we always ended up next to a window seating over looking the water.  My four year old loves their shrimps too.  You can never go wrong with a bucket of salted shrimp, very juicy.  Overall, this is a good place to enjoy good food, drink and good company on a nice location.
author: Chris R.

description:
Overpriced and awful.

I should just leave it like that but I feel like ranting.  Okay there are a few things I expect when entering a restaurant or a store in general when it comes to customer service...
1. Greetings ( I want to be greeted, a simple Hello would be sufficient)
2. No Drama! (understandable not everyday is perfect, but we need you to fake a smile and pretend it is!)

I know I know, Pier 39 is a tourist trap and on a lovely Saturday afternoon I shouldn't even dare to to that side of San Francisco right? Well I'm stupid...so I did. After walking more than 1 block from my extremely far parking spot to the pier I was hungry....the boyfriend has never been to Bubba Gumps(lucky ass) and really wanted to try it. At first I kept telling him it wasn't that great but hey, he wanted the to take a risk and get the runs so who was I to stop him. We get to Bubba Gumps this place was packed! I get to the host counter and this guy working the counter was frantic, yeah it's busy, but he is the FIRST employee we see so the person who handles the front should be able to handle the pressure of all the people. As I was standing infront of him for a good 5 minutes all he kept talking trash about customers to the other employee while I was right there! 
After finally being notice by the host I asked how long the wait was going to be and he told me 2hours and 20 minutes (FIRST of all how the hell do they know how long people eat...cause I take a good ol' long ass time!) and also asked if I can pick a seat by the window to view the ocean...and well here comes the conversation.

Host: Okay the wait is 2hours and 20 minutes long
Me: Oh...okay well can I request to either have a booth or a seat by the window.
Host: well why don't you wait for 2 hours and then when you get up the ramp ask your server but it'll probably be another 1 hour wait.
Me: Why can't I just tell you seeing it'll be a 3 hour wait regardless 
Host: Well I can't tell the servers that it' s not our policy
Me: Ok...leaves

WHY CAN'T THEY TELL THE  SERVERS WHERE PEOPLE WANT TO SIT...is communication really that bad here...
The way I feel is that I was willing to wait 3 HOURS for a good view just to eat your food because my boyfriend was soo excited to eat it...and he didn't have the decency to do something soo small....really?! This is the second and last time I'll ever attempt to eat at bubba gumps because if anything they have been consistently bad.
author: Cristelle J.

description:
We waited a LONG time to get a seat, but we were underwhelmed with the food.
We waited about an hour and 15 minutes on a busy tourist-filled Sunday night. When we finally were seated we asked about the Cajun Shrimp since it was labeled as "spicy." Our server didn't think it was going to be too spicy, but you will DEFINITELY need something to drink with it. It's a 6 or 7 on the spicy scale. One weird thing is that it was on our table not more than about 45 seconds after we ordered. Was it a return from another table? Eew. It wasn't very hot, just warm, so you never know.
We ordered some beers (luke-warm too, because they just swapped out the keg, or whatever they said) and they were pretty good. If you don't mind warm beer.
We also had the Scampi and the Coconut Shrimp.
It doesn't look like you get a lot of shrimp in the Coconut Shrimp dish, but it was definitely enough. I was pretty stuffed.
My wife said that the scampi was good.
The bill was a little surprising: 3 beers, one appetizer, two entrees, plus tip: over $80!! Be forewarned!
author: Christiaan V.
