description:
I would not have gone to this place if it was not my friend's birthday - he really wanted to go to this place and well, I hesitated since it looks ALL COMMERCIAL.  As you can guess, it's very pricey for what they serve, and the food is just average.  Shrimps are fresh but come on, how far are you from the ocean?  

You can easily spend 30 to 40 bucks here.  My advice?  Don't go.  Even if you like Forrest, their ideas seem stupid to me.  But obviously it attracts many people.  So I guess I'm just not average.
author: T T.

description:
The wait is long, the service is always good and the food is good. 

How I crave the hush puppies from Bubba's, sometimes I dream about them ;) And to think my boyfriend just doesn't appreciate them the way I do! 

Like always the boyfriend and I, if we are going to a restaurant that we have been to a few times, we always get the same things. It's just standard. Here we split the 1/2 LB of garlic spice Shrimper's net catch and the Bourbon Street Mahi Mahi. It's enough for us to get full because we have probably already been snacking on something else we got on the pier :) The Shrimper's Net Catch is really good and it's all in the garlic spice. I've tried the other flavor, the cajun one, and I didn't enjoy it. I think the garlic spice is the better choice to go with. Now, a piece of the Mahi Mahi with some potatoes and the bourbon sauce mixed in with them and a few crispy, I believe, tortilla chips on top in one bite is like paradise. They just mix perfectly and there also a few shrimp on the plate too that taste great in the sauce. For dessert we have had the Mama's Cinnamon Bread Pudding and I almost didn't want to share it with him!

Oh and I love the cool glasses you get to bring home if you order one of their pricey drinks, well worth it.  I got a few of them at home and I know there will be more added to the collection =D
author: Katie J.

description: Wonderful service... Not so good food...small portions...high prices.....
author: Nancy S.

description:
nasty. expensive. not worth your time. i rather starve than eat here.

first meal in SF..very disappointed.

so when we got there..they wouldnt let us sit near the ocean view..cuz they didnt have enough waiters..but everyone that was eating then were sitting in the ocean view area. and then they put us near this table with freaking red lard on dirty plates and flies were eating it. it was flithy

we had the appetizer with all the different types of shrimp. the cold shrimp was gross, mushy and old. it was prob frozen and left out for awhile. corn hush pups gets sickening after awhile. dip and chips was gross. and the only good thing was their battered beer shrimp...but how can you mess that up??!!! i cant even rmr if we ordered anything else.
writing this review makes me wanna vomit. 

2 stars for ambiance and decorations & forrest gump!
author: Jen T.

description: The experience here was okay. It wasn't blown away or shunned away. If your looking to be as loud as you want to be with your company, then this is the place. It seemed like every 5 minutes there was bday song being yelled (yes, yelled), including my own. Bubba Gumps is good if you need accommodations for a large party. I wasn't really impressed with the menu or prices, but satisfied with the taste of the food.  Just know you won't have a dull moment here!
author: Mike F.

description: I came here on Sunday with my friend, never been here before.  There was a 20-30 minutes wait.  So I said maybe next time, but the hostess said if we don't mind, there's a table at the bar.  I said OK.  We sat there for more than 10 minutes, no service at all.  The hostess saw us sitting there the whole time and she did not call someone to wait on us.  So we got up and left, she said you guys don't want to eat here today?  I said no thank you, there's no service.  She said NO SERVICE? she's waited until we get up and then she's going to try and find service for us. I hate when people act dumb!  She knew we were sitting there, it's like 5 steps to where she's standing.  Don't try to get people in when you have no service.
author: Mike C.

description: Love, Love shrimp!  This place is based on the movie Forrest Gump and his friend Bubba.  They open this restaurant at the end of the movie together.  Me and my BF had a blast!  Highly recommend it.  Its at Pier 39, you can take the F line to it from Market St.
author: Rob P.

description: Love this place. Cant go wrong with any food choice here. Great place to go when your walking around the city and get hungry.
author: John B.

description: This place is horrible i suggest NEVER to eat here!!!!  My bad experience started off halfway through finishing my srimp scampi.. I had found a 3 in screw in my pasta!!!!!!!!! Which could of contained bacterias that of gotten me sick... The worst part of it was they wouldnt give me the meal for free which i wouldve done if i was a manager.. Yet they gave me a dollar of the meal!!!!!!! I was pissed!!!!! I couldve died if i chocked on that for christ sake!!!! And they had the nerve to say they didnt have any screws that compared to the one in my scamPi????!!!! Theres posters and crap all over the walls!!!! No refund no nothing not a good place please protest because people deserve alot more than bad service that allows this to happen!!!!! I also have a picture of the scampi if anyone is interested !!!
author: Anna N.

description: Came here with some out-of-towners who insist on trying the food...a lot of fried items and more suited for tourists. Wasn't very memorable...
author: Yan M.

description: Coconut shrimp and Mahi Mahi were good.  Atmosphere was excellent.  Service was fair.  Overall a good meal but the atmosphere takes up for the food and the service.  It was a good night.
author: JAMES A.

description: This experience was the lowlight of our touristy san fran day.  We were hungry and had time to bite before our Alcatraz tour just down the next pier.  So we head to Pier 39 (vomit) and at the end of the overpriced boardwalk...sits Bubba Gump Shrimp.  My partner ate at the one in Santa Monica, so he said it wasn't bad.  It was about 1115am on a Sunday when we arrived...and it was just starting to get busy.  Two people greeted us at the entrance -- and it was very creepy and odd.  Basically, they were like entrance guards before you entered a museum or something.  So we ask to sit in a table.  And they try and sit us in a booth.  So then we get taken (btw, excellent view of the bay and alcatraz from our table) to a table near the rear of the place.  After 5-10 minutes of no service -- someone stops and asks us if we'd been helped.  Nope.  So then she starts helping us and someone else comes up to our table (goofy looking preppy guy) and reclaims us.  He never made eye contact once with us the entire meal.  He seemed like a robot from Mars.  His jokes were not funny and his attention to us was overly fake and dramatic.  If Bubba Gump's thing is service and that "Red Robin" happy atmosphere -- we did not come away with any of that.  The food was SOOOO overpriced and stupid.  The quality of the food was HORRIBLE.  So high prices and bad food equals DO NOT GO HERE EVER.  None in my party liked it...bad Bad BAD.  Gross just thinking of this place.  Corny.  Stupid.  Horrible.
author: Kyle R.

description: I went here once. Because we got free food. And drinks. Not a big deal to me, but it was to my companions. If you catch my drift. And they were huge, the funny bubba gumpy specialty drinks. But other than that, there is a reason it's on Fishermans Wharf. To keep away any self-respecting San Fransican or qualified palate.
author: Matt L.

description:
shrimp, shrimp, shrimp, shrimp, shrimp, shrimp shrimp!!!!!

I love this place, what can I say?  Incredible shrimp!!  I haven't tried anything else here but the shrimp.  The 3/4 pound shrimp appetizer is big enough for a meal for 2 if you buy sides with it.  The garlic butter flavor is delicious, do no pass it up!!

IF you're not ordering shrimp... why are you going here??

Oh also, the view is incredible - ask for a table towards the back where you can see the beautiful SF bay and Alcatraz more clearly.
author: Toni S.

description: What goes better together than San Francisco, Fisherman's Wharf & Bubba Gumps?  Any place but Bubba Gumps.  I expected crowded & over priced, but I did not expect to receive low grade sea food.  I ordered the Dumb Luck Coconut Shrimp and was appalled to find that my shrimp had not been deveined in the least and were tough and cheap.  I kept getting an intermittent strange tastes.  I guess they got lucky and a few of them weren't as full of waste as others, because it took me 5 shrimp to take the breading off and find the black vein.  I should have said something, but I was so disgusted that I knew I could not possibly be courteous about my complaint.  The  service was good, but my boyfriend got bitter tea and then when he complained and asked for Coke refills, was advised that the tea glass would have to be used as to avoid a charge for Coke????  Really?  Asked for more sauce and it never appeared.  The calamari was tasteless and chewy.  Very disappointing all the way around.  All in all, the view was not worth the aggravation and we would have been better off with a sourdough bowl & chowder from one of the smaller vendors.  I will not be returning to Bubba Gumps in San Francisco and may very well avoid all the restaurants.  You can surely find someplace more worthwhile to give your $$$$ to at Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Dorine J.

description: Stay away from this Bubba Gumps!   Three of us ordered mixed drinks and none of the three had any alcohol in them. If they cut corners at the bar, imagine what they are doing in the kitchen with your food to save a buck!   Ive never been so upset with a restaurant to write a bad review before.  Ive been to other Bubba Gumps and never had a problem.  This is one to definitely AVOID!!
author: RIchard R.

description: If your ever at the Embarcadero then you've probably seen Bubba Gump.  Your in San Francisco and eating at Bubba Gumps.....come on there's better restaurants to choose from.  The people that work there are friendly and funny.  If you think your getting a real seafood dinner guess again.  It's usually frozen not fresh....hmm isn't this restaurant in the bay?  I've been dragged in this restaurants numerous times when showing visitors around and every time I went It gave me a tummy ache.  The worst part of all...the bathrooms are always filthy!!!!!  There's better restaurants around the area, avoid this one please!
author: Danny B.

description: Food was good but the portions were very small. I ordered a $13 salad that was as big as a side salad. My husband ordered the mahi mahi for $18 and his plate was as small as mine.  We were hungry like an hour later. The atmosphere is fun with all the Forest Gump memorabilia but the food was not a good value for the price.
author: Stephanie G.

description: As a Seattle native, I have only been to San Francisco two times, but I have been to this restaurant and loved it. I am an avid fan of "Forrest Gump", so this place holds a nostalgic value for me. I was last here in 2010, and our family always has to get a photo with the giant shoes outside the front door. The fish and chips are divine, and I love the view from the tables of Alcatraz, San Francisco Bay and the Golden Gate Bridge. I was much better at Forrest Gump trivia than I thought I would be. ONe question was, which 3 sports was Forrest involved in? The answer, obviously is football, running, and Ping-Pong. Duh! The setting in Fishermans Wharf is a lot of fun, though from what I hear, its an area Bay area natives try to avoid, because of all the tourists. BUt right outside the Wharf, you can see big red open-topped buses that give a great tour of the city. This is a town with a lot of history. Before you tour the City by the Bay, get it started with some great seafood, with great views of the bay, and do it all while quoting the best movie to come out of the 1990's. Well worth a visit. I've been to different Bubba Gump restaurants, like the one in Anaheim and the one in Universal Studios, but this is my favorite one.
author: Shane M.

description: Food is descent. Atmosphere is actually pretty fun and what not. The service could use some work. absolutely loveee the popcorn shrimp and non alcoholic beverages!
author: Nathalie N.

description:
I keep wanting to like this place, but everytime I go I'm disappointed.

The food is alot less flavorful than expected,  and never tastes as it is described.  It almost feels like they use something other than the main ingredient to bulk it up.  

The drinks are very big, but very weak, so what's the point?    They are extremely stingy with the alcohol and you can tell they just want to justify charging 8-10 bucks for it.    

They have this sign system that they don't even follow.  You can use a sign at your table to get them to come over or to tell them to stay away.  But they ALWAYS come over when my signs says not to and when I want them to come, I inevitably have to call someone to.  

Once a waitress interrupted our meal to ask us a long series of Forrest Gump trivia questions, that we got ALL correct, only to win the prize of the napkins at our table.  Gee, thanks.
author: kristen v.

description:
i went there a few times years ago when i had just moved to the bay area...
as i remember it, the food seemed pretty good...  
the service wasn't anything to complain about... i thought the forrest gump trivia was pretty funny cus i really like the movie and have watched it a zillion times...
but it is a very touristy place - i don't think people who call themselves locals to this place go to dine there...
i know people now who have actually worked there and they say it's pretty terrible management - real fast turnovers of staff... but i'm beginning to think that's how most corporate/chain restaurants operate...
author: charlotte s.

description: i love this place! the best peel and eat shrimp ever. when i go back to frisco im stoppn here first!
author: Shayla P.

description: My friend came to Bubba Gumps for her bday one year and she said I HAD to go try it! And of coarse I am always in the city I love it there! Plus, my boyfriend goes to sfsu. So the man and I took a full day to go to the city. We took the ferry it was cool cause I've always want to go on it! We walked around the pier joining some side street activities, we also went to the sea aquarium! That was also super exciting. And I was just so anxious to go to Bubba Gumps so I told my bf he needed to get hungry so we can go lol! Well our server was off the hook! She grabbed a chair and sat across from us just telling us about the place.... And the sign that says run forest and stop forest! They need those in every restaurant... SWEAR! GREAT INVENTION! I loved my food the man was ok with his. He normally doesn't get shrimp raw lol and his platter had raw shrimp. Heckka funny because he ate off my plate! I also love how they play triva while waiting for the food and so energetic! Its so wonderful how the employees are happy or show that there happy with there job. It helps them get reviews like mine! I  will go back when I'm on the pier again!
author: Debra W.

description:
this isnt my type of restaurant but since it was my friends birthday and he wanted bubba gumps, everyone went along with it... i got the salmon and veggie skillet.. the salmon was really salty!! and they totally drenched the rice with buttery sauce... i didnt finish but my friend totally gobbled up the rest.. haha

and it was expensive too!!
author: JUDY L.

description: I liked this place a lot. The food there is simple, but very good. It is also a very creative place with the way they decorat, dress, and even serve your food. Like the chicken they put it into this thing that looks like a bucket, but when you open it you see that it's all food. I thought the place was creative and fun.
author: Nikita K.

description:
3.5 stars

i always like the layout of this place.  all the tvs that is constantly playing the movie.  the waiter/waitress used to ask all the trivia questions from the movie but they don't do it anymore.  

the food is ok.  my favorite is the dippin shrimp.  i come here when i want to head to the pier and for some shrimp.  the atmosphere here is ok.  they sing you a birthday song if it's your bday.  parking can be a pain but they validate 2 hours of free parking.
author: Kapo T.

description: Fortunately they no longer force you to indulge in Forrest Gump trivia in order to eat here.  It is very weird when the waiter sits down at your table with you.  However, the staff is pretty friendly.  The food has gone very down hill recently though.  I used to like to indulge by coming by for the bucket o boat trash, but they took out the slipper tail lobsters and replaced them with old cold main lobster claws (that tasted like they were way past their prime).  The only reason to go here now is to impress out of town folk and look at the views of the bay out the window.  So long slipper tail lobsters, I miss you already.
author: Michael D.

description: Excellent food!  I've only been here once and the dish that stood out to me was the shrimp appetizer with the garlic bread...so good!  I had the Coconut Shrimp meal as my main course and it was excellent.  If you have never seen Forrest Gump, you won't get 99.99% of the restaurant but they do show the movie.  The only issue is that you could potentially wait up to 2 hours to sit.  My boyfriend and I went the same night one of my roomates tried to come here.  She had a 2.5 hour wait.  We decided to try it anyway so we came an hour and a half after that, and our wait was 5 minutes.  Hit or Miss.
author: Sonya T.

description: I went for Mother's Day with my mom , aunt and wife. We got an inside table for four because there were four of us,  but I would suggest a table for 6 or a booth if you have 4 people because it tends to get cramped for space, what with the appetizer and the condiment bucket that comes on the table.   The service was good, not the typical BG bubbly behavior, but good. The food was right on target.  I got my usual dippin' shrimp and they were soft and spicy.  The dipping bread was lightly toasted outside and soft inside.  The mahi, salmon and other shrimp dish were also worth ordering.  I also like the lemonade with multiple refills so one does't go thirsty.
author: Jerome W.

description: Fun, kitchy place to eat. Too bad the menu is so limited and never seems to change. I guess it's a place solely geared toward tourists. ?Good hush pups!
author: Carly M.

description: I really enjoyed my visit to Bubba Gumps! I have always heard about it and wanted to try for myself, I was pleased! The service was good, even though we had to wait awhile. The waiter was knowledgeable and friendly. I really enjoyed the killer view of the bay! I had the mahi mahi sandwich which was really good, like a fish burger. A good drink to have is the hurricane, good times! Overall, I would go back here. I liked the food and service. B!
author: Jason F.

description: I'm not a big fan of shrimp but I LOVE their Shrimper's Net Catch in garlic spice and Cajun Shrimp. Sometimes if I'm not that hungry, I'll just order those two appetizers as my dinner and I'm good. The strawberry lemonade is pretty awesome with free refills. Although, if you end up getting entrees, it will really fill you up and you might have left overs. Try the baby back ribs. It's yummy. The view is fantastic in the daytime. They always have Forest Gump playing on the TVs so if you eat there a lot, you'll start to remember the movie.
author: Rhonda H.

description:
+5, son! I thoroughly enjoyed the food at bubba gumps. Here is a description of the en tree I ate. :)

"Bourbon Mahi Mahi Charbroiled cajun mahi mahi with bourbon sauce and shrimp served over mashed potatoes." (from the bubba gumps menu)

MmmMmmMm.. It was SOOO good, actually I just finished eating my leftovers. The mashed potatoes were oh so buttery, the fish was perfect, and the little shrimps just made it that much better! The atmosphere is also fun. The theme of the restaurant is clever complete with their Forrest Gump memorabilia all around the restaurant. Next time I already know what I'm going to order... LOL

Oh and don't forget to get your ticket validated if you parked in the Pier 39 garage. :) happy eating!

OHHH! and I forgot to mention if you go there on your birthday they make you stand up on the chair and if you don't dance while they sing you end up looking ridiculous (I'd be embarrassed). There were literally like 7 birthdays tonight! ok thanks all! Ciao!
author: Je M.

description: I like this place. So it's a little touristy..what do you expect from Pier 39? It has a breathtaking view of the bay. Air conditioning, and great shrimp. Shrimp cocktail, Cajun shrimp, fried shrimp, cold shrimp, shrimp BBQ..etc. The service is too good. Vast selection on the menu. I swear the waiter wants you to stay longer..Hard not to leave this place.  They show the movie "Forrest Gump" on the screen when you come in. Funny stuff.
author: Smooth R.

description: The service is decent. It's better in the day than night. At night, all the server's are rushing to finish waiting on tables just to stand around for the end of the night rest and ignore nightly customers. The food is also okay. Everytime I order something here it ends of being too salty, but love the "I'm Stuffed!" shrimp with a blueberry lemonade.
author: Charisse G.

description: The waiting sucked, but the food and service were pretty good. Complained about the hour and half wait, and got a free appetizer. They even gave us a quiz about the restaurant's theme. Cool place to chill.
author: Magi Y.

description: I actually thought this place was spot on for where it is located. If you look at their menu you'll see that you're getting exactly what you pay for. The food is just fine for this mega touristy spot, yet you gotta be out of your mind to expect an ultimate dining experience at the price of $20.00 an entree. Perfect for family with kids, very entertaining and friendly staff. My picky son has "polished off" his plate (i believe it was ping pong pizza). My husband had some deep fried shrimp dish and my Bourbon Style Mahi Mahi was actually, quite decent. The portions are not overwhelming, yet generous enough. Overall, i enjoyed eating there, the view was great and the atmosphere was very fun. Excellent for families large or small.
author: Zaya S.

description: The coconut shrimp here is awesome, so are the fries. Waiters are all fun. Quick service
author: Mary B.

description: I did not expect to like this place.  Went with a visiting relative, and what can I say?  Like other reviewers, I was surprised to enjoy myself.  The staff was quite attentive, though it was lunchtime on a busy weekend, and the shrimp sampler was excellent.  I'm a foody, and I gotta say, the sauces / flavorings make me think the place has a genius for an executive chef.  Sure it was pricey, but it' the Wharf; I can't think of a better restaurant in the area.
author: Matthew E.

description: I love Bubba Gumps! My favorite dish is the Southern Fried Chicken! The keepsake glasses are a plus as well.
author: La Toya B.

description: Let me make this clear.  The food sucks here.  The 2 star rating is based simply on the fact that the restaurant has a gorgeous view of the bay.  If you eat here right around sunset then you are in for a million dollar view.  Now that that's out of the way, I've had the coconut shrimp here and seriously?!  You're charging me $15+ for shrimp that is dipped in coconut batter and then a measly order of fries.  The hush puppies here are sooo greasy that it's bad.  I love fried foods and if I knock you for your fried foods then it's bad.  Hell, you can fry up a tube of chapstick and chances are I'll still eat it.  The food here is overpriced also but hey I guess they gotta pay for that view somehow.
author: Anna H.

description:
I'd much rather go to Red Lobster than waste my time and money here.

So the themed restaurant is a fun place to grab a bite to eat with friends and family to relive the movie but if you ask me.. the food doesn't quite live up to the hype. The service has been great each time I've visited but the food was very much mediocre and a bit tasteless. It truly is over priced shrimp with a fresh from the freezer taste.

Depending on what day you go the wait can be torturous. I don't know about you but I HATE waiting in long lines on an empty stomach. Seating is limited when it comes to waiting for your name to be called and the restaurant itself seems cramped.

 Thanks but no thanks.
author: Rachel L.

description:
There was one glaring issue that I had while eating at this tourist hole:

16 oz. Anchor Steam: $5.75
22 oz. Anchor Steam: $11.25

uh, what?

The food was pretty meh, nothing special at all. The portions were pretty small, too. Never again.
author: Jared R.

description: I came back here recently after a 4 year hiatus.  It's not the same.  The food's ok, the service was ok, but the view makes up fo ra little of it.  If you plan on going on a Friday or Saturday evening, be sure to get there early because they do not take reservations
author: rob m.

description: This is not as good as the other Bubba Gump restaurants I have been to but I really enjoyed the view.  It is all the way towards the end of the wharf.
author: Sarah B.

description: A novel place for forest gump fans. The waiters were friendly enough but the food was so so. The shrimp could have used more flavor and was really too expensive. I do recommend the clam chowder though, very fresh and tasty.
author: Jia Hui W.

description: Its fun Place. Its bit Pricey for the food but it is down at Pier 39 so you are paying for that. Forest Gump is a movie my friends and I grew up quoting so it was blast to go there The Staff does walk around and they ask You Trivia Questions and being the Geeks we are we answer all the question's we need help) the food is good is pretty good just a step up from Red Lobster, but if your out to act Like Forrest of His Friend Bubba for the night then its all worth it
author: Martin G.

description: We went here on a Tuesday night for a "white trash" adventure and the restaurant had just a handful of tourists in (mostly from the midwest from the sizeof them). Our server was amazing, really friendly, super professional - he's wasted on Bubba Gumps! The food "boat trash" and boiled shrimps were just what we expected - unhealthy but tasty. I'd go back on a weekday if I had a craving for deepfried fish and tourist spotting.
author: jane t.

description:
Food was okay -view was great - service was horrible. The restaurant was relatively empty - and they still had trouble getting my order right. Two different servers and 30 minutes of attempting to bring me a new bun - and I never got it. Lots of apologies - but no actual correction. Didn't  take it off my bill either. 

And then to top it all off - after I paid with cash, and told the server to bring me the change - she did - and then took it back off the table when I wasn't looking (as if all of it was her tip). Crazy. Don't waste your time. There is better at Pier 39.
author: Chris C.

description: A fun touristy place to eat.  Nice views, good food and drinks, a bit pricey but what else do you expect from a tourist trap?  Service was fast and friendly during our visit.  Not a place I would go regularly if I lived near by, but a fun stop on vacation.
author: Dan H.

description: Awesome food, everyone loved it. Quick, polite, and friendly service. My only complaint is the overall cleanliness of the of the restaurant felt slightly lacking, the small plates set on our table had rice grains and a few of them were greasy. Otherwise everything else was spectacular.
author: Sean A.

description: Bubba Gump's is a fun place to eat and has a great view. Food and Service are both great.The wait may be long but there is a lot to do around the restaurant since its on pier 39. And its worth the wait and they validate parking if you park in the pier 39 parking lot.
author: Bambino N.

description: I was in San Fran last month on a combo personal/business trip since my sister lives there.  We went to BG Fisherman's Wharf - again.  Long wait time, so-so food, service was just ok... and the fact that the portions were small for what you pay -- all made me think, 'man, this place has changed a lot in the last few years!'  Next time I'm there I'll definitely skip this place.
author: Dorothy T.

description:
I LOVE Bubba Gump's with a passion!! My fiancé and I love to plan random date nites here, because the food is amazing, the drinks are the best, and the atmosphere is fun, casual and beautiful (on the pier, great view of water).  
Try the Cajun shrimp appetizer if you like sometime spicy (comes with yummy garlic bread too). Any of the entrees are great, and honestly we never have room for dessert, but that looks super tasty too. 
The drinks are the best.!!!! If you like fruity drinks that don't taste like alcohol, and have a pretty presentation this is for you. But don't be fooled, these drinks have plennnttyyyy of alcohol in them, even if you can't taste it!! 
There is always a line, and probably at least a 30 min minimum wait, but it is WELL worth it, trust me. Great place for couples, groups and kids. You don't have to be a Forest Gump fan to enjoy this resturant.
author: Meg C.

description: Just went here last week.it was pretty full but our waiter was friendly and we got our meal pretty fast. The food was good and the cocconut shrimp was delicious.The portion of our dessert was huge for me and my boyfrienf.The price was reasonable.what do you expect your in sf and in pier 39 everything is going to cost more in a tourist place!it was a good experience and it has a nice view.
author: Jocy l.

description: The staff are always friendly, and I really enjoy the views. The food is average to above average, but the price is a little over the top.  I went here 2 nights ago, and did enjoy the visit, but was shocked at how the prices that were high, just keep going higher.  I will return on a very limited basis, only when someone visiting wants a fun place to eat, with a great view of the bay.
author: mark h.

description: If you like shrimp and like to have fun this is the place to go. Everytime I've been there it was super busy but the place is huge and the wait list goes pretty fast. Try it at least once.
author: Lori R.

description: When I went here my waiter was very drunk. It seemed like he was about to pass out when he was taking my order. He also never refilled my drink. The food is ok but overpriced. Place is way too cheesy. I do not recommend eating here.
author: Tom A.

description: amazing view of the sea and wonderful sunsets. stunning food. glorious cocktails i recommend the margharita woth corona bottle in the top.
author: pinkbutterfly

description: it's worth the wait. the people that work here are really nice and friendly. they even made me smile and laugh a bit after a hard day of hiking up the Alcatraz Island. The food was delicious. I had the BBQ pulled pork sandwhich. and it's the best i have ever had so far. the setting is really nice you can see the ocean from most of the tables. there was this one guy testing out the party next to ours about the movie "Forest Gump" this guy knew the movie like the back of his hand. i wonder if he could name all the Shrimp dishes Bubba named in the movie??
author: Zito R.

description: Excellent view of the warf, waitresses are friendly, cute table settings and atmosphere (its Forrest Gump themed), bomb ass calamari... what more can you ask for.
author: lil b.

description:
My husband and I usually end up here when we visit the Pier. The food is always pretty good. We end up getting the bucket of boat trash which is seasoned and fried to perfection. And the fried shrimp is consistently good each time we order it.

the only complaint that I have is that the portions are not as big as before AND the prices went up! DARN TOURISTS! =) just joking.

BUT what makes up for that is the CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIE SUNDAE! *makes my mouth WATER!*
author: M J.

description: I went here for my friend's birthday party, and we came as a group of 10 or 11. I enjoyed the time in there. The service is very good. And when you need an assistance in you table, you can just flip over the sign, and one of the people working there will come over. Unique way xD I ordered a steak which comes with mash potatoes. It was good, and one of my friends ordered clam chowder, and boy it looks good also. I should try that next time I go there. Even tho this is like a place to eat shrimp, but sadly I didn't try it, but comments about their shrimps were good also. For a birthday party, the staff told the man with the loudest voice to cheer up the party. And he was sure loud! Everyone in the whole place can hear it =D They had my friend stand on a chair and told her to hold a cup of ice cream and that man just started his cheer. His cheer was quite comical also. Also, during your meal, a waiter will come and asks you questions about the movie. I had a wonderful time there, and hope to visit there again. Looking forward to it!
author: Elaine W.

description:
Strolled in a little before 3, put our name down for 3 and was told the wait was 5-10 minutes (up to 15-20). 20 minutes later we were called up then waited another 10-15 minutes to be seated. .. Really?! I mean, where's the common sense in that? Waiting to be seated then having to wait again to actually be seated? Awkward..

Anywho, the majority of the menu is overpriced seafood. (What do you expect - it's tourist food!) Don't get me wrong, I love seafood - I just wasn't much in a mood for it today. I ordered the Shrimp Po' Boy which surprisingly filled me up (alone, without the fries) for a 6" inch sandwich. Typically, a foot long sandwich from Subway would fill me up, so you know why I was like :O!? It was good though. But before our food was served - waiting - our waitress quizzed us about the movie. If you look around the place - you can actually find some answers to the questions :) If you win, there's a prize!! The prizes are hilarious and have been on your table from the moment you seated.. Whatever is in your bucket, you can take ONE thing from it (a roll of paper towels, hot sauce, ketchup, towelettes, etc)!! I thought she was joking but it's true - you can take one, only if you win though. All in all, the service was great. I really liked our waitress (Jamie); she definitely made the experience enjoyable. 

I'm coming back for Jenny's Mini's since I really liked Jenny's Strawberry Surprise.. Mmm!!
author: Rachel A.

description: Fun place on Pier 39.  It's always packed with tourists everywhere, but that's what you get in the Wharf area.  If you're a Forrest Gump fan, this is the place for you - cool trivia games, famous Gump quotes posted on the walls, a gift shop, and the obligatory photo opportunity of sitting on the bus station bench and posing with your feet in Forrest's giant shoes.  Food is excellent and the view of the San Francisco Bay is something to write home about.
author: Jill W.

description:
YUM ~ SHRIMP!

Too bad I'm allergic. 

STILL - I love this place.  Besides being a huge tourist spot, they have these delicious drinks for the 21+, complete with the cool cup that lights up.  The service is excellent (Stop Forrest Stop!), and even if you can't eat shrimp without turning into a balloon like me and have friends who drag you to the place, there's something to fill you up.

Some suggestions: Fish & Chips (super filling), the Mahi Mahi, Mashed Potatoes, the sauce on your friend's Shrimp New Orleans...

NOTE:  *GREAT PLACE* to drag the birthday girl/boy to, especially if they're super shy.. =D

5 stars (for great service, drinks, food) - 1 star (dirty silverware, wait time even though there were several tables empty)
author: E K.

description: This place is my favorite. I go to them all over. This one more often because I love San Fran. You have to know about seafood to eat at a seafood place. Get the bucket of shrimp thing and my all time favorite is the market value crab. Great! My absolute favorite. Me and my tear up that crab. Keep in mind it's a theme restaurant it's not a fancy French menu, wine selling type of place. It's seafood so don't go out to eat if you don't have money. I read some of these comments about "not worth the money" broke a$$ don't go out to eat seafood. Duh!! I love this place for It's shrimp and crab. I try not to comment on service because the waiter are people. Not your personal slave. Take my order, keep my drink full, bring my bill, keep the change. Thats all I need. This is a 5Five5 *star* restaurant I rate it a 1 just because I only read the bad comments myself and I want this to be read. Never been busy at lunch time. Love it!
author: Travelers H.

description: I went here on a Saturday night on Labor Day weekend. The wait was about an hour at 7pm. The didn't have buzzers. There were shoes, a bench and a box of chocolates outside the entrance to take pictures like Forrest Gump. That was cool if you are into taking pictures as if you are famous. When you finally get called up you have to wait in line again for a few minutes until they finally have a table cleaned up for you. Seems like you shouldn't have to wait in two lines to get seated....The view is great..on a clear day. You can see the Bay Bridge pretty well and even Alcatraz if you are seated toward the rear of the restaurant. The waiter we had was awesome, he made us feel like we were friends right off the bat. He was attentive to our needs. There are lots of specialty drinks to choose from, not too many beer options though. I know that San Francisco has the highest cost of living but I thought the price for what you get was a bit high. For three of us who shared 3 plates our bill was about 80 plus tip. There were no leftovers and I was still hungry. We ordered clam chowder, halibut with mashed potatoes, and 1/2 garlic and 1/2 cajun shrimp. The cajun shrimp was good. The clam chowder was a bit on the thin side. The halibut was pretty plan but it was pretty moist and went well with the mashed potatoes. All in all I would say that the service was great and that you are definitely paying for the location and not so much the food.
author: Rudy P.

description: I don't ever go to Fisherman's Wharf. I'm allergic to fish, and shrimp, so it's only natural that I would go eat at Bubba Gump's. No, well actually it was my friend's birthday and her restaurant choice, so I went along with it. The wait was a little long, since they don't take reservations, but i did appreciate the view. Wait, that's a lie, because all i saw was pitch blackness, some lights in the distance, and maybe a boat or two floating by the whole time I was eating. Thanks to my allergy, I ordered the sirloin. It wasn't bad. The staff's also really friendly. I might just mention that unless you want to embarrass the hell out of yourself or your friend, do not go there for either of your birthdays because you are going to have to stand up on that chair and be coerced into shaking your ass while they dangle a tiny cup of ice cream in front of your face and scream to the entire restaurant that it's your birthday. If public humiliation is your thing, then go for it! If not, eat your meal in silence, and leave. Also, brush up on your Forrest Gump knowledge, because you will be tested.
author: Melissa L.

description: yayay! surrounded by tourists who reached the end of their pier 39 adventure!
author: Jamie C.

description: when i first moved out here, i had not idea what pier 39 was all about and thought that forrest gump was somehow based on the bubba gump shrimp company (i'm retarded, i know).  thus, i somehow ended up sucked into this cliched excuse for a fast food restaurant.  at least the view was nice...
author: Roshni R.

description: Was really looking forward to eating here after a trip to Alcatraz - what a disappointment...! The service was very poor. Our mains were brought to the table before we were even halfway through our starters, and the staff were rude when we asked that they be taken back to the kitchen. Then we were watched over until we had finished our starters and the mains - which had obviously been kept warm - were brought immediately and were unpleasant. It wasn't cheap either. Needless to say we would NOT recommend this place.
author: JJII

description: The food was pretty good.  A little bit pricey, but a nice experience by the open windows.  The scream a happy birthday song pretty often on sundays, which is a little distracting.  The employees seem to enjoy their jobs which is nice, but some of them have the same routine memorized that you can hear repeated word for word as others are seated in your section.  The plain shrimp needs to be peeled, but is very very tasty and fresh.
author: Amber M.

description: This is a great place to eat.  Good food and service.  I've been there twice and the servers have been patient, nice, funny, and helpful.  The place has a fun atmosphere.  There are signs hanging everywhere that are so interesting and funny.  Great seafood!
author: N N.

description: bubba gump is the reason i wish we could give 0 stars. this place was absolutely terrible. the artichoke dip was less artichoke and more grease. the shrimps were under cooked and tasted like they had been in brine for the past 5 days. i ordered some mixed drink from their not so extensive menu and was extremely disappointed when they came out with a glass filled with ice and a touch of "liquor". just an all around bad experience with even worse food.
author: Aly L.

description: I really don't understand how a restaurant that bills itself as a shrimp place can ruin shrimp.  I had a pasta and shrimp dish that would have been awesome (really good sauce on the pasta), except the shrimp was horrendously overcooked.  I mean, I hardly ever cook shrimp myself and I can do a better job.  That's sad.  Anyway this was far and away the most rubbery shrimp I have ever had.  However, I was STARVING so I ate it anyway and told the waitress how bad it was after the fact.  And then, to my surprise, the manager came over and gave me a full refund!  Even though I'd eaten it all!  So great customer service on their part.  It also had a great view (the reason we picked the place to begin with) and my mango spritzer drink was nice.  I thought about giving it 3 stars considering that everything but the shrimp was good, but seriously, it's Bubba Gump SHRIMP Co.  At least be good at what you claim to be good at!
author: Kate M.

description: The view is very nice and I enjoyed my expensive drink. The waiter was very good-friendly and enthusiastic. The reason I am giving this 3 stars is because the food was really expensive and salty. I had the stuffed shrimp and the it was too salty. Would recommend this as a once in a blue moon trip
author: alexandria s.

description: Last year, I came here on a trip up to SF for a grad school interview. I didn't know much else, and have always loved Bubba Gump in the past because of the fun atmosphere. This particular night, I shared an appetizer of spinach/artichoke dip, got some peach alcoholic drink that had ice cream in it, and had some kind of shrimp-scampi-esque entree with pasta and capers. I can safely say that the spinach/artichoke dip was not the problem, as I shared it and no one else in my party got sick. However, my drink, the shrimp, or the butter/capers in my entree, were a problem. I was up sick all night in a hotel, which was a great experience seeing as I had a 6 hour drive back to socal the next day. It was my first experience with food poisoning, and let me just tell you that I still can't eat shrimp, spinach/artichoke dip, scampi sauce, or capers. I would stay away from Bubba Gump unless you don't mind risking food poisoning, because in skimming the first few Yelp reviews, I see I am not the only one who suffered that fate.
author: Bridgette A.

description: I've been aware of Bubba Gump's for a while but never ventured into one because of the bad memories of Red Lobster's TV dinner tasting seafood.   At the decision of someone else in the group, I finally got my first visit to a Bubba Gump at Pier 39.  It was decent and decently priced.  I expected the price to be more.  I thought my Bourbon sauced Mahi Mahi and shrimp was a bit thin.  The garlic mash was decent.  I ordered a pomegranite flavored drink but was told at the gift shop that it was not one that included the glass.  Only the people in the group that had glasses with an a LED light inside got to keep theirs.  Their cocktail drinks were like a box of chocolates, never knew what I was gonna get.   We had dinner, and it was hard to see how the view outside looked at night but it looked like it would be a nice view in the day time looking out at the Bay.
author: Foodie B.

description: Yeah, I know this place is a tourist trap, but Hey my friends had there kids doing the pumpkin patch and trick or treating in pier 39 and well, I didn't want to participate and  besides  they had the football game on the tube and I wanted to play tourist for the day, so aside from the overpriced appetizers and food and the fact that they don't give you much of either or. The alcoholic drinks were pretty good especially when they place it in some cool plastic containers that light up!! Yeah so I'm easily amused, especially when your team is losing and you had way too many to drink and all you've ordered were oily appetizers. I would say this place is not worth going to. But if your looking for a place to go to, to avoid playing being a parent go here. they got great views of the bay, football on the tube and alchohol too boot... oh and by the way there waitress are pretty cute too...either that or I had too much alcohol to drink...
author: Arthur C.

description: It's really nice place to eat shrimp and hang out. it's really fun to go with your friends here. their cajun shrimp is so Yummy.... the staff is also energetic and very friendly, the trick their use for calling the staff also really nice.
author: Aditia H.

description: Fun atmosphere and gorgeous view at sunset. Friendly and accomodating service but it's very crowded with many tables in a tight space. Food is okay. Pretty good but not amazing.
author: Anne B.

description: man do i love bubba gump....great food, great drinks and great service. i had so much fun there even though i had to wait and hour to get seated.  great atmosphere...all worth the wait.
author: Romeo J.

description: If you love shrimp, then this is the place for you.  They have shrimps cooked in many different ways.  I love shrimps and that's the reason I've been here a couple times.  This is a nice place to just hang out with friends and snack on shrimps!  It's a short wait during dinner times, but on weekends, the wait is 30 mins to an hour long.
author: Linda H.

description: i guess you would go here for the forest gump memoribila.... though 11.99 for peel and eat shrimp that is way over cooked and doused with oil and salt - not too yummy. everything here is deep fried and served with a measly portion of seafood with a ton of fries or rice - and some oily salty sauce ... and your only options here are shrimp and mahi mahi... still you got to feel sorry for the working students here that are forced to push this tourist crap - i used to be one of 'em back in the day. pier 39 you gotta love this place :-)
author: Edwyn A.

description: So I've been to the one in Miami and the one at Fisherman's Wharf.  Maybe it's because I was on a diet when I ate at the Fisherman's Wharf location that everything tasted so good!  I ordered the Cesar salad (I know, I know, but I was on a diet!) and my mom ordered an appetizer of fried calamari (drool) and some type of seafood pasta (double drool).  Of course I had no choice but to sample what she ordered, right?  Calamari?  Yes!  That pasta? Oh, yeah!  Even my plain ol' salad was really good!  We had a great view of the ocean.  Although the service was a bit sketchy we were still happy.  But the BEST THING AT THIS PLACE IS THEIR APPLE COBBLER!!!!  OH MY GOD!!!  THE REASON WHY I'M SHOUTING IS BECAUSE THEY PROVIDE THEIR OWN SAUCE FOR YOU TO POUR ON THERE!!  Okay I'm calming down now.  But I swear this sauce is some type of melted butter.  Butter?!!  Are you kidding me!?!  That's like a heart attack wrapped in a bow.  IT...WAS...SO...GOOD.  Yeah, so much for my diet that day.
author: Andrea B.

description:
Worst $40 spent.
I ordered the "1 1/2 lb shrimp net catch" and the "Amazon Nectar". I should've read the menu more carefully before choosing the drink. I chose Amazon nectar because it had the "all time best" icon next to it. It was just bad. The taste was very unique. It did not taste very strong initially, but the bitness came along with a hint of tea taste. Yes, this cup of liquid has some green tea mixed with some other stuff that I have never heard of which explained the tea flavor. I am not saying green tea is bad, but Amazon nectar was not enjoyable.
The shrimps in the shrimp net catch was not good shrimp. I didn't mix it up well enough, so some of them were quite salty. Regarding the shrimps themselves, they were low quality shrimps. They were too soft for my taste. They did not have that "bounciness" offered by tail muscle fiber. Perhaps shrimps of that size are like that.
I've had better and cheaper shrimps at San Jose.

Bottom line, not a place I'd visit again. The quantity was pretty good, but the quality was not.
author: Ivan L.

description: i'm sorry but i love thier coconut shrimp.  it's the reason to go, even if you hate it.
author: shilpa p.

description: I have to say that after all these years I still do love me some Bubba Gump's.  I don't come too often anymore maybe once or twice a year now that the novelty has worn off a bit.  The food is good and the quality is consistent, and consistent seems to be harder to come by with restaurants these days.
author: Bri L.

description: I ordered an $11 adult beverage and got fruit juice with some mardi gras beads hanging around a glass.  My entree was a very tasty shrimp dish that came with shrimp, rice, and there may have been a vegi in the mix.  The rice was literally the size of a golf ball.  Do you know how small a golf ball is?  Picture a golf ball.  Now pretend it is made completely out of rice.  And it wasn't like solidly packed rice either.  It was like loose golf ball rice.  Isn't rice cheap?  Couldn't they afford to give me a few cents more worth of rice?  The dish was like $17!  Not only that, There were songs of Happy Birthday being busted out about every 2 minutes on the dot.  Only come here if it is someone's birthday and they beg you to take them there because their parents don't want to.
author: Pie S.

description: I loved the Shrimp that we ordered. The food was good, the service was great!!! I'd love to go back there for that shrimp we had. Too bad the portion was small, I guess I'll have to order more than one. LOL.
author: Rachel P.

description: Not the BEST place for real seafood, but LOVE their sampler appetizer platter. Portions are huge and great when sharing with a group of three or four.
author: Sharon H.

description: I have come here a few times before but this is the first time since becoming a Yelper & we had a visitor from out of town.  How I long for the good ol' days.  We had a GORGEOUS server who was just a filler until our real server take care of us but that was just about the extent of our good experience.  First, let me point out that the previously rated #1 Cesar salad has become just a shadow of itself.  The plate is near 1/2 of the original size & it lacks much of the ingredients or love it used to. The hush pups were DELICIOUS.  All 5 of them that we were served were great.   We had to ask for utensils 3x & we weren't offered refills on any of our drinks until JUST being handed the check.  The entrees all have also become minuscule in size though the taste is pretty much the same.  I just finish much quicker & look for another place to eat afterwards to satisfy my hunger even though the sticker shock of the check still remains.  Sorry, BG's.  You're done with me.
author: ConstantlyEating A.

description: This place is better than you would think but not as good as you would wish! The staff here is kind of lame and annoying and doesn't seem to be very helpful. I had ordered something last time that I had ordered before and it came out different this time and I called them on it. I was irritated that they weren't knowledgeable enough about the entree to know that it was missing a key item. They were nice and tried to solve the problem to make me happy but hello, know your items and serve it to me correctly the first time. Oh and PS the wait here is SOOOO NOT worth it. You will have to wait about 45 mins to a hour on a Friday or Saturday night. Oh and the crowd here is so sketchy. Not my favorite spot at all. I mean, come on....its San Francisco. Let's find somewhere good where the ambiance is nice and the servers aren't wearing tee-shirts that say "Shrimpin' ain't easy" Ghettooooooo!!!!!!!!!
author: Elizabeth H.

description: This place is coo to me. The food is okay, a little overpriced... I like the idea of the plates to signal a waiter... (the concept is coo, but the waiters normally don't like this... if u don't get ur waiter, chances are u'll get an eye roll). But for the most part service is coo, and as long as ur not looking for high quality seafood, u'll be okay.
author: Philly P.

description: sure, i'll admit it. i've been here.... i was wandering through fishermans wharf one night with an out of town friend who happened to be pregnant at the time. she insisted we eat here! of course you never argue about food with a pregnant woman so we practically sprinted to our table. i noticed everyone has given this place tremendously BAD reviews but i'm going to take the road less traveled this time and say... i actually like this place. the waiter was hilarious. he kept popping up out of no where and asking us random trivia questions about the forrest gump movie... everywhere you looked the movie was playing on TV monitors. it was like forrest gump on steriods and i wasn't even drinking that night. both of us had shrimp for dinner and i thought it was pretty decent. fresh tasting and seasoned well. the whole experience might have been a little surreal, yes, but isnt that the point of this place? i say try it out once. really, you should.
author: Michelle I.

description: popcorn shrimp is bomb! texas cajun chicken sandwich is yummy too. it has guacamole, bacon and spicy sauce. the bbq pork sandwich is okay but kinda boring. clam chowder is meh. arnold palmer was weird tasting. the view of the bay is really beautiful. the waiters here are always really peppy and fast. i feel lame and touristy when i go here but sometimes i just need that shrimp!
author: N. M.

description: always enjoy going to bubba gumps, when we went we got a ocean view table, it was great.
author: Anna U.

description: wow, 205 reviews?  i'm sure my review won't be relevant but i am at work and bored goddamnit!  after going to the sf body art expo, my friends&i ended up here because it was still open.  the wait was 50 minutes for 3 people but we found an empty table at the bar, woot!  i ordered the shrimp new orleans which was really good but spicy.  definitely not enough shrimp as i am a shrimp eater!  my friends both got the bucket of trash which they definitely felt was trash.  everything was FRIED TO THE MAX but so fried it was no longer crispy but soggy so they opted to be filled with drinks.  they got some beers and this mixed drink that's served in a pretty light up cup (perfect for when you're on an acid trip).  my other friend got a drink in a glass but after we finished our meals, our server told us that we could go to the gift shop, show them our receipt and get new cups.  of course that didn't stop my drunk boys from stealing their old cups as well.  my food was good but i felt it was a little overpriced and hyped up.
author: Kristie S.

description:
initially, i was not excited to eat here  - it being a chain restaurant i figured we could do better with a local seafood eatery since it is san francisco. but my opinion completely changed when the waitress was super friendly, very honest about the menu choices (and their health value), made recommendations for how to make the dish healthier (the restaurant is all about flavor so everything is butter cream sauce, glazes, etc). she also showed us the little sign sitting on the table, to get a server's attention  you just had to flip it and any server who noticed it would promptly come over to the table. the best part of my lunch there was that we let a different waiter know we were supposed to take the bay adventure cruise in about 45 minutes but since it was the lunch rush and the restaurant was PACKED we needed to honestly know whether or not it would be possible to make that cruise. he assured us it would, let our own waitress know of our time constraint, and expedited our orders. they also printed the check and brought it with the entrees so we could speedily pay for our food as we ate. we got out of there (full of delicious food) with time to spare.
it was an amazing experience and i would definitely go back.
author: Amanda g.
